title: Deployment Product Manager
job_description:
Eager to market analytics technologies to improve decision making?

Enjoy working with customers to define next generation products?

If so, MathWorks is looking for a strong, inventive, product manager to promote the use of MATLAB analytics with enterprise systems!

This dynamic role will focus on owning the Deployment business that enables researchers and engineers to turn their insights into applications for the enterprise. You will work closely with customers, sales, application engineers, development, and other marketing teams to craft and execute on marketing and selling plans, drive technology roadmaps, and grow this exciting area of our business.

This position will be based at MathWorks headquarters in Natick, MA with travel expected to be about 10% of the time.


Define, propose, and drive the business strategy for a large and growing product suite.
Work with key partners to develop product plans, assess new features, products, licensing and pricing models, and develop multi-year product roadmaps as well as short-term release plans.
Plan and launch products with complex selling models. Develop messaging and collateral in support of the Deployment products role in incorporating data analytics and IoT functionality into enterprise systems.
Support the global sales force and application engineering channel with trainings, customer presentation content, reference stories, and other selling tools.
Track and analyze revenue. Collect and synthesize customer requirements and technology trends to better understand the market for the Deployment tools.

Relevant engineering or computer science degree (e.g., EE, ME), MBA is a plus.
Previous experience in product management, product marketing, consulting, or system/IT architecture.
Experience with some of the following enterprise applications: Web architectures, Cloud and virtualization (Azure, AWS; Docker, Kubernetes), Messaging and IoT (Kafka, IoT Hub, Kinesis), or Big data (Hadoop, Spark, MongoDB, Cassandra)
8+ years industry experience involving software products for enterprise production systems.
Experience with data analytics tools such as MATLAB, Python, or R.
Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills.
Project management skills.
Experience working with a team and building consensus within your company.

A bachelor's degree and 12 years of professional work experience (or equivalent experience) is required.

title: Senior Product Manager
company_name: Aunt Bertha, a Public Benefit Corp.
job_description:
Our Mission: To connect all people in need and the programs that serve them (with dignity and ease).

Aunt Bertha picks up where Uncle Sam leaves off, making it easy to find and apply for government and charitable social service programs by organizing the world's human service program information on auntbertha.com.

We are a venture-backed startup looking for people who are driven to make the world a drastically better place. Join our growing team of thoughtful, committed citizens because we believe, as Margaret Mead said, you should "never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has."

Please note: If our mission doesn't strike a chord with you that is OK. But please consider not applying. We are seeking people who come on fire after learning about what we do.

*

The Team:

We are a rapidly growing Product Development organization building software that connects people in need, helpers, and services. Every day, real people in communities across the country are searching for assistance and connecting to services using the software we build.

The team here is passionate about building products that help our users quickly find and identify programs they are eligible for and connect with those services. Our small cross functional product and engineering teams own experiences across the business and are responsible for improving the lives of our users.

The Job:

As a leader on the Product team, you will be responsible for partnering with engineering and the senior leadership team to deliver on our mission. You will define a product strategy for your team, working with your cross functional counterpart, to deliver on our goals. You will be responsible for the delivery of your team and your Product Managers’ teams.

You will train and provide guidance to your team of Product Managers, helping grow their product expertise and ability to deliver against business goals. You will lead your team to build new features and functionality as well as scaling our existing systems. You will voice and balance tradeoffs that help solve this week and next week’s problems. You will grow members of your team to be leaders.

Your responsibilities include:

Directly manage and grow product managers;

Partner with engineering to own and deliver against business goals;

Ensure your teams have direction and leadership;

Advocate for what’s next to help us achieve our goals;

Balance between short term and long term goals;

Attract great talent to join the team; and

Establish a great relationship with Customer Success, Community Engagement, Product, and the Senior Leadership Team.

You:

You are someone who is passionate about having an impact on your community and the world. You are someone who is ready to help define a product organization — contributing to organizational design and business decisions. You’re ready to scale. You enjoy working on challenging problems and aren’t afraid to come up with an iterative plan to get things done. You love simple solutions. You’re not afraid of ownership. You have a history of building great things. You enjoy working with teams and you’re always looking to improve their capabilities and processes. You love upleveling your team through demonstrated success.

Requirements:

5+ years experience of product management experience in consumer web or SaaS products;

A history of advocating for and supporting your team;

Experience building beautiful things;

Experience partnering with other functions in an organization, like engineering, customer success, and UX;

A strong desire to solve the next problem impact the lives of our users;

A history of getting things done.

What You Get:

Beyond the compensation and benefits package, you will be doing meaningful work and helping us build a company. We believe life is too short to work on things you don’t believe in passionately. Your work will directly contribute to our mission to help people in need find help and lead better lives. That’s no small thing.

We are a certified B Corp (https://bcorporation.net), meaning rigorous standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency are written into our corporate charter.

Apply:

We are selecting from a broad field of candidates. If you are interested in joining our team please respond to this job posting with the following required items:

Your résumé

A cover letter in which you tell us who you are, and why Aunt Bertha's mission strikes a chord with you. We are most interested in people who are interested in working with us to make the world a better place. If you skip this step, you most likely won’t be considered!

Please include your GitHub username, StackOverflow profile and/or links to any projects or other resources that provide the full picture of your experience and skill set.

Thank you. We truly hope to hear from you soon.



Job Type: Full-time

Experience:


Product Management: 5 years (Required)

Work Location:

One location

Benefits:

Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insurancePaid time off

Visa Sponsorship Potentially Available:

No: Not providing sponsorship for this job

title: Director of Product Management, Consumer Data & Insights
job_description: ABOUT A PLACE FOR MOM A Place for Mom is an online platform connecting families searching for senior care services with a team of experienced advisors providing insight-driven and personalized solutions. Our mission, as the leader in senior care advisory, is to be a trusted destination for families and our community customers. We are a quickly growing organization with over 500 advisors connecting more than 300K families every year to one of our community customers.  Living by our values and working to achieve excellence on behalf of our customers is integral to success at A Place for Mom. Employees who thrive at A Place for Mom live our values every day and are an important part of our hiring practices:Focus on ExcellenceAct with Integrity & Assume Positive IntentDrive Outcomes Every Day with Passion and A Sense of MissionMake the Lives of our Families and Customers Better, Easier and More SuccessfulRealize the Full Potential in Each Team Member. Work as a Single Supportive Team COMPANY LEADER Larry Kutscher - Chief Executive Officer Larry Kutscher is Chief Executive Officer of A Place for Mom. Larry is a veteran CEO with over 30 years of experience leading digital, technology and service businesses through significant periods of growth and value creation. Prior to this role, he served as Chief Executive Officer of TravelClick, where he drove the company’s overall strategic vision and helped increased the company’s value from approximately $300 million to more than $1.5 billion over eight years. THE POSITIONWe are looking for an experienced product manager to implement a customer data platform across our web sites and marketing platform to enable us to understand customers, behavior and allow us to cater the experience to their needs with a goal of driving product engagement and conversion. You will identify tagging needs, data categorization, consolidating requirements (product, design, marketing and technology) to implement across the CDP platform. As a product owner, you will work with other product managers to enable CDP informed customer journey, including design. You will also spend time understanding product analytics to guide product development. You will turn business questions from stakeholders into detailed and documented tracking/tagging specifications across all platforms.  This product manager will be instrumental in defining and delivering on the new product vision for A Place For Mom by instrumenting the source of truth of consumer/user data and insight. This position reports to the VP Of Product – Content Data & Search and will be based in New York City. Who you are: You possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. You will participate in the data layer development process as an integrated member of the engineering team(s) you support. You possess product management understanding and love data, analytics. You will work with all parts of the organization as new features and enhancement are released to ensure that key success metrics are identified and tracked as well as to draw out key insights based on the data.What you will do:Technical owner of tagging and data mapping workflows, and data layer customer data platform (CDP like Segment, Lytics, etc.); oversees implementation of data tagging and flow of consumer data across key consumer facing products and internal platformsOversight of data layer quality, ensuring consistent and reliable data capture and federation to downstream destinationsWork with internal stakeholders on Product, Technology, Marketing, and other teams to identify, select, and integrate business critical, data-driven platforms (analytics tools, re-marketing, CRM, A/B testing, etc.) to ensure strategic goals are metCollaborate with internal engineers, analysts and data scientists to ensure various product owners and internal teams are receiving quality data, enabling actionable insight and product success determination Work directly with Product Owners and UX researchers to measure new and ongoing products / initiatives, defining success metrics and product goals; ensures Product Development team becomes more data-driven and measurement oriented Responsible for creation and delivery of product dashboards and analytics reports to Product Owners and other relevant stakeholders, ensuring that actionable and insightful data is widely accessible Provides ad hoc reporting to senior and executive business leadershipWill help inform A/B Testing and Personalization Opportunities, KPIs and PrioritizationRequired Skills and Competencies:Direct experience managing Consumer Data Platforms / Consumer Data Infrastructure 6+ years experience with enterprise analytic / data analysis, CRM and omnichannel marketing platforms (including Google Marketing Platform, Marketo, Amplitude, Mixpanel)6+ years experience in enterprise B2C digital marketing and commerceExcellent written and verbal communication skills, including an ability to communicate complex analytical concepts to various audiences.BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or StatisticsOpen to travel#LI-KT1

title: North Bergen Program Manager
job_description:
North Bergen Program Manager

North Bergen, NJ

If you thrive when leading a team and have incredible customer service and problem-solving skills, we are looking for you! You will be responsible for managing a team of Representatives and in some cases Team Leaders. The Program Manager is responsible for the success of the team and for the client relationship and reports to the Director of Operations.

Responsibilities

Oversee Team Leaders, Lead Representatives and Customer Service Representatives to ensure program goals are met
Interface at regularly scheduled intervals with client providing program updates and ensuring a clear information flow between the client and the operation
Hold calibration sessions with client and leadership team to evaluate program quality and overall service delivery
Train newly hired CSRs on client specific competencies
Review daily productivity reports and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) adjust schedules and provide coaching to CSRs as necessary
Review recorded customer service calls to evaluate them on soft skills, product/procedural knowledge and KPIs
Partner with the client to maintain high quality of service and current product/procedural information
Interview prospective CSRs and evaluate candidates on predicted job fit, soft skills and program specific requirements
Manage program budget and billables on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis
Create monthly, quarterly, or yearly reports on program’s activities
Identify and react to trends in activity, with a strategic mindset
Provide creative solutions to obstacles
Oversee employee schedules in order to ensure that program goals and KPIs are being met

Requirements

College degree required
5+ years of experience in the customer service field with a minimum of 3 years call center leadership experience in managing operational teams and client relationships
Excellent oral and written communication skills

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.



Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Continually maintain working knowledge of all company products, services, and promotions
Knowledge of program specific material to train and answer questions from CSRs regarding products or procedures
Knowledge of interviewing techniques and the ability to identify quality candidates
Responsible for evaluating team performance, setting goals and overseeing the completion of these goals
Ability to effectively communicate goals and objectives as well as motivate a team to achieve them
Responsible for coaching CSRs and documenting both quantitative and qualitative performance
Represent and interact with clients in a professional and positive manner
Demonstrated ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment
Ability to motivate a team to do their best in order to reduce turnover and promote workplace satisfaction

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Care.com is a consumer tech company with heart. We're on a mission to solve a human challenge we all face: finding great care for the ones we love. We're moms and dads and pet parents. We have parents and grandparents so we understand that everyone, at some point in their lives, could use a helping hand. Our culture and our products reflect that.

Here, entrepreneurs, self-starters, team players, and big thinkers unite behind a common cause. Here, we're applying data analytics, AI and the latest technologies to solve universal problems and connect people in new ways. If you like having autonomy, if you thrive on collaboration and building new things, and if you're all about using your talent for good, Care.com is the place for you.

What Your Days Will be Like:

The ideal Product Manager should be data driven and act with a sense of curiosity and urgency. He or she can successfully motivate teams to solve customer problems. He or she should be flexible and able to jump from creating a product vision to immersing themselves with implementation details. Lastly, the Product Manager should be collaborative, facilitating cross-functional alignment and decision making.

What You'll be Working on:

Ownership of metrics. This means developing and executing on a roadmap.
Leading an agile, cross-functional team during the entire lifecycle of product development.
Working with stakeholders throughout the company to ensure a successful product launch.
Experienced solving business problems while keeping the broader business perspective in mind.

What You'll Need to Succeed:

5+ years of work experience with at least 3 of those years in product management.
Experience working for a tech company, preferably a consumer-oriented or marketplace service.
Experience with developing product requirements and user interfaces.
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams, solve complex problems, and produce high-quality results.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, start-up environment.
A minimum of 2 years of experience collaborating closely with engineering.
Excellent oral and written communication.

**Care.com supports diverse families and communities and seeks employees who are just as diverse. As an equal opportunity employer, Care.com recognizes the power of a diverse workforce and encourages applications from individuals with varied experiences, perspectives, and backgrounds.**

Care.com

Since launching in 2007, Care.com, an IAC (NASDAQ: IAC) company, has been committed to solving the complex care challenges that impact families, caregivers, employers, and care service companies. Today, Care.com is the world's largest online destination for finding and managing family care, with 19.8 million families and 14.3 million caregivers* across more than 20 countries, including the U.S., UK, Canada and parts of Western Europe, and approximately 1.7 million employees of corporate clients having access to our services. Spanning child care to senior care, pet care, housekeeping and more, Care.com provides a sweeping array of services for families and caregivers to find, manage and pay for care or find employment. These include: a comprehensive suite of safety tools and resources members may use to help make more informed hiring decisions - such as third-party background check services, monitored messaging, and tips on hiring best practices; easy ways for caregivers to be paid online or via mobile app; and Care.com Benefits, including the household payroll and tax services provided by Care.com HomePay and the Care Benefit Bucks program, a peer-to-peer pooled, portable benefits platform funded by household employer contributions which provides caregivers access to professional benefits. For enterprise clients, Care.com builds customized benefits packages covering child care, back up care and senior care consulting services through its Care@Work business, and serves care businesses with marketing and recruiting support. Headquartered in Waltham, Massachusetts, Care.com has offices in Berlin, Austin and the San Francisco Bay area.

*As of June 2019

title: Dental Office Manager
job_description:
Are you an energetic, motivated “people person”? If you are, you may be the right person we are looking for to become part of the management of our dedicated dental team. We are a fast-paced, dental practice that prides itself on teamwork and a warm caring approach toward our patients. The Office Manager will work with the Doctors and staff to create an environment where patients feel competently serviced and cared for and where staff can work together as a team. The successful candidate should have some prior experience in dental office management and have computer skills that allow for use of Word, Excel and Quickbooks. Personnel management and some bookkeeping skills and experience are also essential. The position will offer a base salary commensurate with experience and education. There will also be an incentive bonus based on meeting the goals set for the position. If you have some experience in supervision, management and team building and enjoy working with people. Send your resume in. Purpose of the Office Manager Position • To manage staff and office by: • instituting and maintaining compliance with policy • instituting and maintaining compliance with job descriptions • utilizing statistical management • To ensure smooth and efficient patient flow • To create an environment where patients feel completely serviced and where staff can work together as a team Product of the Office Manager Properly Doing that Job • An organization that is expanding and prospering • A doctor who only has to wear his/her Doctor hat and Owner hat • Staff members who know their jobs, are thereby productive and are operating together as a team • Satisfied patients who continue to come in for dental care and who refer others to the practice Statistics • Production • Collections • New Patients Job Duties of Office Manager • Acts as a liaison between owner and staff for routine matters such as time off, schedule changes, questions about policies and procedures, special projects, etc. • Acts as a liaison between Doctor and patients and between colleagues and the public as requested • Handles problems prior to consulting with the Owner • Initiates policy (with owners approval) and distributes to staff • Evaluates the quality of office systems already in place and plans strategies for those that do not work • Meets annually with the owner to summarize the past year and anticipate the next • Meets regularly with the Owner to set production goals, plan budgets and adjust office systems appropriately • Monitors statistics to ensure that the office is viable, prosperous and expanding • Sees that stats are recorded onto graphs and that each staff member has graphs that are current and posted • Ensures and encourages good communication between staff and Doctor/Owner • Hires or dismisses staff (with Owner’s approval) • Maintains all personnel files • Sets forth the staff schedule • Conducts staff meetings in conjunction with Owner • Conducts job reviews in conjunction with Owner • Develops training programs to continually upgrade the knowledge of the staff • Establishes staff bonus systems in conjunction with the owner • Seen that each staff member understands and follows job descriptions and policies and that they receive appropriate correction when necessary • Educates the staff in the mechanics of new systems, arranges for training and gains staff allegiance to practice goals • Sees to it that a position is temporarily covered appropriately in the case of an absent staff member • Records daily statistics and compiles weekly and monthly statistics • Educates patients whenever possible and appropriate and ensures that all staff members are educating patients • Oversees that now patient intake is done fully and that former patients are reactivated

title: Senior Product Manager
job_description:
Who We AreWillowTree is an award-winning digital product agency driven by innovation and grounded in strategy and user-centered design. We create long-term partnerships with the world's leading brands to design and build digital flagship products crucial to their core business. We are one of the largest independent digital firms in the US. Some of our clients include HBO, National Geographic, Anheuser-Busch, and PepsiCo.The OpportunityThe Senior Product Manager is a highly-autonomous role with endless opportunities. You'll partner with Fortune 500 clients to create a product vision while advising and managing scope, risk, and new product opportunities. You'll have the unique opportunity to build and grow a team as the Virtual CEO of your project!

*This is not a remote position and requires up to ~25% travel.Responsibilities

You'll drive product development, leading the creation of products that are critical to our clients' businesses
You'll lean on your deep client services experience to drive effective decision-making on complex issues of scope, design, architecture, and process
You'll deliver timely, tailored communication for various audiences: engineering teams, product managers, marketing partners, and C-level executives
You'll create, guide, and communicate the holistic (WillowTree, client, 3rd party) project plan and goals to create alignment and drive convergent implementation
You'll encourage sustainable flow for your team while focusing on key client objectives
You'll be flexible and adaptive to changing scenarios and environments by applying appropriate project management frameworks to suit the customer and product
You'll regularly visit your client, usually 1-3 days per month, up to 20% of the time during kickoff or launch periods
You'll engage directly with clients managing the account details, project scope, and relationship

Qualifications

You have 7+ years of experience in the software development industry as a Project Manager, Product Manager, Product Owner, Team Lead, or Scrum Master in a client services business
You have experience leading Fortune 500 custom software development projects, from discovery through UX design, implementation, and deployment
You've demonstrated empathy, experience and confidence managing software projects with complex scope and with multiple executive stakeholders
You're an experienced technical problem solver that can adeptly figure out how to address and communicate technical or process issues between systems (e.g. API issues vs client-side, bug management issues, etc)
You're an expert communicator who regularly runs workshops and structured meetings to align client stakeholder groups on enterprise business goals
You have a blend of business, user experience, and software project management acumen and mindset of motivating clients and 3rd party counterparts to be collaborative partners
You've managed projects in which you mentor other product, development, design, and testing team members

Bonus Points

You have professional experience as a Project or Product Manager and Scrum Master from a major technology consultancy or agency
You've led projects that require the build and delivery of successful native iOS and/or Android applications that have been successfully delivered to a high volume of users
You've taken part in Agile transformation or application of Agile methodology (Scrum, Kanban, etc.) on software development projects
Certifications such as CSM, CSPO, PMP, SA, SPC, etc.

Why WillowTree?We offer a place to be yourself.

Our differences, both visible and invisible, benefit our teams, our communities, and the products we craft. That's why WillowTree strives to build a team with diverse backgrounds, skills, and perspectives. You'll work hard here; however, we'll balance that with a culture that supports your growth and cares about your well-being. We're committed to creating an environment of inclusion a place where every Tree can thrive.

We want you to reach your fullest potential and part of your professional development at WillowTree will include dedicated time to innovate on passion projects and an annual stipend to fund your professional pursuits.

WillowTree celebrates our differences and provides equal employment opportunities to all team members and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Technical Project Manager - Future Opportunity
job_description: ABOUT USAre you ready to transform an industry? At Centro we are building a comprehensive tech platform that radically increases efficiencies and impact across businesses, teams, and campaigns. Our clients can run all their digital business through Basis, with robust business intelligence, workflow automation, search and social integrations, and the number one rated DSP. We’re taking the digital advertising world by storm and are proud to be headquartered in the rapidly growing tech hub of Chicago, with offices that span across the United States, Canada, Mexico, and London. Join us in our mission to improve the lives of everyone working in the industry! WHY WORK WITH US? At Centro, we believe that lasting success is achieved through continual dedication to the growth and well-being of the individual. Our people are the core of what makes Centro unique. Driven by the Centro Manifesto and our guiding principles, we look to hire the best and brightest minds—curious, passionate learners who are driven to create impact. We are committed to building a culture of highly motivated individuals who create a positive and supportive environment together. When we work hard, stay focused, and act in service to others, we believe that anything is possible. Come grow with us!ABOUT USAt Centro, we’ve always been about making people’s lives better—from our employees to our clients. Today, we’re building a unified platform to execute every digital media advertising transaction, thus providing a new level of automation and intelligence in ad tech. This is an enormous task that will disrupt an industry and improve the lives of those who work within it.We are imaginative, passionate, determined and relentless in our efforts. Of course, we are fascinated by the complexity of engineering problems at this scale—it’s what brings bright minds together. But what keeps us coming back (and why we love coming to work every day) is the chance to improve how work gets done: freeing up people’s time so that they can dream bigger and make life better.Come build something amazing with us. ABOUT THE TEAMCentro's technology team is building applications for streamlining digital media planning. Come design and develop great software with us and make life better for all our friends in the advertising industry. Our customers live in our apps eight hours a day, planning and executing complex advertising campaigns. We’re looking for someone with experience supporting the development of complex web application to be the newest member of our growing band of talented professionals.CORE RESPONSIBILITIESWorks with the development teams to build and iteratively improve processes and best practices.Operates and makes decisions in an uncertain environment with limited information.Leads rituals associated with the team’s development methodology.Streamlines processes in a program that spans 2 cities, 2 countries, and 5 functional areas.Develops a high-level understanding of our platform infrastructure and operations, building credibility to become a team coach and a bridge between the Basis Platform program and key stakeholders outside of technology.Builds consensus among stakeholders.Breaks down large and challenging goals into actionable tasks, gets buy-in, and ensures follow-through.Challenges assumptions, especially when something is identified as “can’t be done” and suggests a better approach.Protects development teams to ensure that team members can remain focused on Product Discovery and Delivery, e.g. maintains priority of tasks, and applies just enough management controls to deliver value.Keeps Program, Product and Technology management apprised of progress and risk. Radiates information to keep the team and the Centro organization aware of how the project is progressing.QUALIFICATIONS A minimum of 2 years of full-time experience as a Project Manager in Software Development. Bachelor's degree in a STEM field. Administrative experience with JIRA. Must be able to create complex workflows with conditional post functions. Must be experienced creating complex JQL queries. Excel: Expertise with pivot tables and VLOOKUPs. Intermediate knowledge of SQL i.e. no trouble with JOINs.Experience project managing complex web applications. Strong ability to understand complex technologies and how they interact at an architectural level. Strong critical thinking and analytical skills Strong interpersonal skills. Impeccable communication skills: Concise and clear. Able to pick up new technologies quickly. Values outcomes over processes and optics. Highly independent, goals-focused, pragmatic. Interest in technology either in professional or personal lifeLIFE WITH CENTRO We take care of our people. Our team has put together a thoughtful benefits package and provides a wide range of perks, including competitive 401k matching, a tax-free health savings account, tuition reimbursement, generous maternity/paternity leave, and more.Aside from benefits, we’re always finding new ways to invest in the personal and professional growth our employees. We’re proud to support a variety of employee-led communities that enrich our culture of uniqueness, inclusivity, and empowerment. Centro is more than a workplace. Centro is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and support an inclusive workplace diverse in thought, perspective and culture. We celebrate all team members regardless of gender/identity, sexual orientation, race or cultural background, religion, physical disability and age. We are better together.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Sapphire Digital is seeking a Product Manager who will be involved in the research, delivery and analysis related to building and enhancing features for our CareSelect and Smartshopper products.

In this position, you'll be responsible for:


Working with the UX team to ideate on user flows or experiences for a feature and conduct and compile insights from user testing and iterate to meet goals
Writing thorough specification/user stories and work with the development team to build out features, phasing the approach, and testing along the way
Applying product development methodology to projects; these projects begin by gathering input from our stakeholders, including clients/buyers (health plans), sales team and our consumers
Analyzing and evaluating site analytics data as it pertains to new ideas to prioritize actionable items
Collaborating with QA team to test created features
Working with configuration team to define configuration settings
Interacting with and presenting product concepts to groups of internal stakeholders and current or prospective customers
Partnering with implementation & services team to roll out features to customers
Managing processes and workflows within the product team (e.g., client request process, client ideas portal); identifing the gaps in order to devise plans effectively
Gathering requirements and creating competitive analysis matrices
Anticipating and resolving implementation challenges of particular features or feature sets
Compiling and analyzing data on user engagement and adoption

You might be a good fit if you have:


Bachelor's degree (B.A./B.S.) in a related field from four-year college or university
6 – 9 years in software product management with a demonstrated set of experiences along the product management continuum in increasingly complex capacities
Product management and/or UX training, a plus Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to research, quickly understand, and synthesize complex, often technical problems and then articulate them into simple and clearly understood requirements and documentation
Adept at engaging with high-level business problems and understanding the strategic market position of a new product enhancement, looking at competitors in the space, and applying knowledge of best practices and solutions from other industries
Confident and polished presenter who can deftly handle a group of people (peers, leaders, clients, customers) asking tough questions on the spot
Strategic mindset to offer creative and thoughtful solutions, incorporating influx of feedback from various sources
Expert communication skills, effectively achieving goals within a cross-functional setting
Proven track record of building relationships and influencing important clients and internal stakeholders, setting and managing expectations and creating consensus across diverse groups on increasingly complex projects
Excellent in multi-tasking in a high-volume, goal-oriented environment
Proficiency with standard office tools including but not limited to: Microsoft Office, Google Docs, Jira/Confluence, Balsamiq/wireframing apps, Google Analytics or other analytics tools to understand user experience data
Experience with Agile-Scrum development methodologies
Experience with health care industry a plus

title: Product Manager - Digital Health
job_description:
About iRhythm:

iRhythm is a leading digital healthcare company focused on the way cardiac arrhythmias are clinically diagnosed by combining our wearable biosensing technology with powerful cloud-based data analytics and machine- learning capabilities. Our goal is to be the leading provider of first-line ambulatory ECG monitoring for patients at risk for arrhythmias. iRhythm's continuous ambulatory monitoring has already put over 2 million patients and their doctors on a shorter path to what they both need – answers.

About the position:

iRhythm is looking for a Product Manager with a technical background, to join the growing product management team to drive the Zio digital platform. You will be working with design, engineering, and various business functions to shape the evolution of our clinician and patient-facing portals and mobile apps. You will play a key role in delivering solutions that induce user delight and address customer and patient needs.

 Responsibilities:

Defining and communicating product requirements for software releases.
Coordinate with the cross-functional team to scope and define features.
Collaborate with engineering and project management to groom the product backlog and prioritize development work.
Collaborate with UX and Design to ensure products and features are intuitive and easy to use.
Create and manage stories in Jira.
Participate in the scrum team as product lead.
Define, analyze, and communicate product and feature level KPIs.
Willing to travel up to 10%.

About you:

You are highly motivated by the cause to improve patient experience and clinician workflows within the cardiac arrhythmia diagnosis/treatment space. You always have the end user in mind, and serve as their voice in business discussions and decisions. Your technical background, merged with your quest to solve complex problems, allows you to dig deep into the details to make sure what is delivered is of top-notch quality. When ambiguity presents itself, you are ready to work with a team to proactively clear up the fog. You work well with diverse teams and inject FUN into the equation!

Required Experience:

3+ year's product owner/scrum master/product manager experience in a SCRUM environment for commercial web and mobile apps.
Experience translating complex workflow initiatives into product requirements.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Effective presentation and interpersonal skills.
Demonstrates initiative; results oriented; strong sense of urgency.
Up-to-date on industry standards and best practices for digital products.
Experience with Atlassian toolset (Jira, Confluence, etc.)
BA/BS in science or technical field. Advanced technical degree or MBA is a plus.
Experience with requirement management applications (Jama, DOORS,…), product portfolio applications (Aha!), as well as analytics tools (Google Analytics, Pendo, Splunk), is a big plus!
Software development experience using scripting/OO language would be ideal but is not required
2+ years Medical Device or Digital Health experience desired

What's in it for you:

This is a full-time position with competitive salary package and excellent benefits including medical, dental and vision insurance, paid holidays and paid time off.

IRhythm also provides additional benefits including 401K (w/ company match), an Employee Stock Purchase Plan, annual organizational/cultural committee events and more!

FLSA Status: Exempt / Non-Exempt

As a part of our core values, we ensure a diverse and inclusive workforce. We welcome and celebrate people of all backgrounds, experiences, skills and perspectives. iRhythm Technologies, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer (M/F/V/D). Pursuant to San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment all qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Make iRhythm your path forward.

title: Product Manager, Software Buying Programs
job_description:
The Business

The Security Business Group is a critical contributor to Cisco’s overall growth, and comprises a breadth of offerings covering many of our customer’s evolving protection needs.

The Role:

You will lead the Product Management team driving the execution and development of the Software Buying Programs for the Security Business Group, reporting to the Director for Software Buying programs. This means both managing the team and owning projects yourself, extending the programs to include new technologies as they are added to the portfolio and improving the execution of, and capabilities required to support the evolving needs of the program.

The Responsibilities:

You will work closely with SBG Product Management, engaging with the business leaders responsible for each of the products sold through the programs. This means understanding how each of the products are licensed and metered, defining appropriate program rules to meet the various business requirements and maintaining the programs as each of those offers evolves.

You will work closely with Finance, Sales and Operations to drive active deals and manage deal exceptions and discounting escalations.

You will work closely with OMO, CPS, OLE, and IT to enhance the platforms, policies and workflows that support the programs.

You will engage with CX to develop service offerings that can be sold alongside the programs and that provide the necessary support for customers to adopt and fully utilize these strategic investments.

You will engage with Sales and Marketing to develop and maintain the necessary collateral to support the field and channel in positioning, selling and growing program investment by customers.

Required Skills and Experience

- Demonstrated capability to deliver results in a cross-functional environment

- Have worked on software pricing and packaging for both SaaS and subscription software models

- Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to express complex topics to a range of audiences, tailoring content and messaging to suit the audience’s need

- Familiarity with Security applications, in general, is strongly preferred

- 8-10 years of work experience with 2+ years in a manager role

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Open Position: Product Manager

Headquartered in Arlington, Virginia, Promontory Interfinancial Network – the nation’s largest deposit allocation service provider and the inventor of reciprocal deposits – provides dynamic, all-weather balance sheet and liquidity management solutions to help financial institutions grow franchise value. The company, chosen by thousands of banks since its founding nearly two decades ago, has assembled the largest bank network of its kind. Its solutions help institutions to acquire high-value, local relationships; purchase funding; and reduce collateralization costs.

At Promontory Interfinancial Network, we prosper by working hard in an open and creative environment. Our efforts to create and maintain a culture that values our people have led us to be designated among the top fintech companies to work for by American Banker. Promontory Network has also been recognized as one of the best places to work by the Washington Post’s Top Workplaces and the Washington Business Journal’s Best Places to Work. Our company is also recognized among Fortune’s lists of Best Workplaces—Small & Medium Businesses and Best Workplaces in Financial Services and Insurance.

What is the role?

You will work at the intersection between business, technology, and the customer to deliver profitable and usable products that customers love. Key responsibilities include:


Collaborating with a core team of product stakeholders to evaluate opportunities for existing and new products.
Collecting ideas from customers, market research, and internal sources to drive product development and growth.
Serving as the product owner during product updates and releases, conveying vision, prioritizing functionality and release plans, and reviewing functionality prior to release.
Facilitating meetings, workshops, and discussions to create balance between user wants, client needs, technical level of effort, and timelines.
Serving as the customer advocate on projects.
Meeting with customers to conduct research and usability testing aimed at aligning product design with customer needs.
Creating both external and internal communications about upcoming releases.
Providing product support and subject matter expertise in resolving daily inquiries from internal staff.

What qualifications are required?

Proven track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle
Minimum of 1 year of experience with Agile development
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Technical background with experience in web-based application development
Excellent teamwork skills
Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience

How do I apply?

Don’t just settle for a job, explore this career opportunity.

Apply

Promontory Interfinancial Network, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, religion, age, veteran status, disability, or sexual orientation in employment of the provision of services.

title: Project Manager, Software Implementation
job_description:
Here @Strata…We are committed to our mission to help heal healthcare. Our unique culture is driven by a social, hardworking environment full of talented people solving problems together. We embrace learning, cross-team collaboration, and continuous career growth. Lifting each other to lift our clients, our product, our company. Prepared. Positive. Core to who we are and how we treat one another.

While managing timelines, resources and budgets, you will oversee project communication strategies using Salesforce, email and printed materials. Develop, maintain, and monitor detailed project schedulesTrack project changes and make necessary updates as neededCollect and compile meeting documents to distribute both internally and to clientsParticipate in client planning, training, and support discussionsLead weekly status meetings and monthly executive meetingsEnsure coordination between different consulting teamsManage expectations and escalations of both internal team members and clients

Your accomplishments include:



Bachelor’s degree or foreign academic equivalent3-4 years of project management experience in a healthcare or software environmentA drive to learn quickly and constantly adapt to new challengesStrong self-motivation, and the ability to work effectively with limited guidance when necessary

title: Regional Renovations Manager
job_description:
Are you the kind of person who thrives in a highly functional team environment? Do you see yourself at a company that invests in you as much as you invest in the company? The core values at Earthtone: Mindful of our Actions, Invested in our People, Passion in our Craft and Sustainable in our Vision are the foundation of who we are. Come and join our team and be part of an amazing opportunity to grow as a person and support others as they do the same.
Along with competitive pay, Earthtone provides a generous benefits package that includes premium medical coverage, dental, vision and SIMPLE IRA along with Paid Time Off (PTO).
As Renovations Manager you'll be responsible and accountable for regional multifamily renovations related to Earthtone Construction Inc.’s (ECI) construction activities. The Renovations Manager will plan, direct, coordinate, and budget activities related to multifamily renovations, construction and maintenance of structures, facilities, and systems. He/ she participates in the planning and development of a construction project and oversees the organization, scheduling, implementation, and risk management, production and quality control.
Duties and Responsibilities: (include but are not limited to the following):
 

Work in harmony with the Earthtone Construction Project Management and Renovation Management Team.
Provide leadership to establish and maintain the effective and harmonious working relationship between owner/client, subcontractors, vendors, designers, engineers, and Earthtone Construction employees including carpenters, laborers, etc. Promote and maintain ECI core values, positive project morale, and provide support as necessary.
Proactively provide context, oversight, and direction to project coordinators, supervisors and PM’s for all regional multifamily projects. Ensure relevant information is communicated to all levels of the project team (onsite and offsite), and continually check for understanding and commitment.
Identify problems throughout all stages of construction/ pre-construction. Utilize your experience and knowledge as well as engage project team members and outside consultants as appropriate to weigh professional input and provide a clear and concise possible solutions.
Hold the “big picture” and problem solve with perspective. Utilize planning and leadership skills to manage projects proactively rather than reactively in order to avoid unnecessary conflict, reduce ECI exposure to risk, and cultivate positive team culture.
Independently and collaboratively examine the contract drawings, specifications, and addenda for design deficiencies, impractical details, and possible code violations. Collaborate with the design team to solve any deficiencies by providing practical solutions and alternatives.
Independently or in collaboration with the estimator, complete project estimates and/or establish a project budget using ECI standard processes and procedures. Incorporate all tasks required to successfully complete the construction project including but not limited to general conditions, equipment costs, subcontractor costs, material costs, and labor costs. The project budget must include clear and concise detailed notes for presentation to the client, and additional detailed notes as necessary showing the work up of numbers, assumptions, allowances, etc.
Collaborate with Estimator to maintain subcontractor bid list databases.
Set up estimating take offs and manage the job buyout/ bid analysis process.
Coordinate and chair the pre-construction project walks and handoff walks.
Manage, track and ensure accuracy of all project information including budgets, plans and changes (SK’s), change orders, RFI’s, RFP’s, submittals, and samples per ECI standard processes and procedures.
Maintain project binders and electronic files per ECI standard processes and procedures.
Independently establish a detailed project schedule using Microsoft Project software. Schedule must establish all necessary tasks, links, predecessors, and milestones to successfully complete the construction project. The project schedule must evaluate resource allocation, product lead times, specialty shop drawings, the complete submittal process, subcontractor and self-performed work schedules, etc.
Continually maintain the project schedule to define ongoing risk, delays, slippage, and opportunity; clearly communicate project schedule to project team. Ensure entire project team is meeting scheduled milestone and deliverable dates.
Negotiate and execute profitable vendor contracts in accordance with ECI standard processes and procedures. Contracts must be in compliance with the project documents and include all insurance and legal requirements.
Collaborate directly with the Project leads to develop and maintain the construction program including quality control procedures, safety and security practices, field facilities, temporary utilities, staging areas, equipment and manpower, etc.
Ensure compliance with all Cal-OSHA/OSHA regulations and implementation of all Earthtone Construction safety programs including weekly safety meetings, ongoing periodic employee and vendor training, accident reporting, safety infraction documentation, and record keeping.
Oversee the procurement of all permits and/or licenses necessary to complete the renovation/repair projects. Independently collaborate with state and local agencies to define requirements and communicate with the project team to ensure those requirements are met. Manage permit implementation inspections and documentation.
Review and code all applicable employee timecards, project invoices, receipts, and tags in a timely manner. Ensure coding and costs correspond to the project budget, contracts, and subcontracts.
Prepare monthly project billing in accordance with ECI’s standard processes and procedures.
Independently manage, track, and report current and projected project financial health and profitability. 
Collaborate with Project leads to thoroughly review shop drawings and submittals to ensure compliance with the project documents. Ensure that fit, field measurements, and site conditions have been taken into account.
Report weekly to Senior Management to clearly provide a project status update, resource needs, etc.
Chair and minute construction meetings with owners, owner’s representative and/or architect, and other members of the design and construction team as you establish. Issue detailed minutes and action items within 48 hours of the meeting’s end.
Issue weekly written construction progress updates to the project team including a clear and concise written narrative of construction progress, deliverables, short interval schedule, and link to project photographs.
Maintain an organized record of project photographs for the life of the project.
Manage the assembly of the project Operations and Maintenance manual and as-built drawings.
Manage and drive completion of the project punch list and coordination of maintenance and warranty work.
Work in harmony and collaboratively with the Project leads to support their role and responsibilities as required for the success of the construction project. Such support includes but is not limited to establishing and maintaining short interval project schedules, establishing resource requirements, review of vendor shop drawings, etc.
Work in harmony and collaboratively with office administration staff such as accounts payable, Controller, etc. to get all information required in a clear and expedient manner.
Maintain good relations and communications with all involved in the project including neighbors and the public.
Other duties as assigned.

 
Supervisory Responsibilities:

Directly supervise, task, and support all crew members and project coordinator or assistants on each
Responsible for the overall direction, supervision, coordination, and evaluation of construction labor and subcontractors.
Carry out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with Earthtone Construction policies and applicable laws and regulations.


Other Desired Skills and Abilities:

Strong project management and organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects at one time.
Strong leadership and interpersonal skills to work effectively with all levels within the organization.


Ability to plan, supervise, and exercise effective leadership of the project team.
Strong verbal and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to communicate professionally at all levels.
Proficiency reading Architectural plans.
Proficiency in quantity take offs from plans.
An energetic, forward-thinking, and creative individual with high standards and an appropriate professional image.
Ability to identify problems and issues in order to develop and evaluate options to implement solutions.
Ability to apply common sense and to deal with problems involving several fixed variables.
Effectively execute plans and programs that achieve established organizational goals and objectives.
Computer literacy and proficiency in industry software including but not limited to: Sage 100 Contractor, Adobe Acrobat Pro, BlueBeam Revu, Dropbox, Microsoft Office Word, Excel, Project, and Outlook.
Other training and/or certifications desired: OSHA 30, First Aid/CPR.


Must have a valid Driver’s License

title: Market Development Manager – West Coast
job_description:
About BrainScope
BrainScope Company, Inc. is a medical neuro-technology company that is pioneering the future of traumatic brain injury (TBI) assessment. The BrainScope® One device, utilizing Electroencephalogram (EEG) technology cleared by the FDA, is the first objective, adjunctive device capable of assessing the full spectrum of mild traumatic brain injury (mTBI/concussion). Its ability to rapidly identify the likelihood of both structural brain injury and functional brain impairment at the point of care offers an opportunity for dramatic improvement to the current treatment path for evaluating mTBI/concussion patients. The benefits could include diversion from the emergency department (ED), a major reduction in unnecessary CT scans, and early intervention for patients with functional injuries, including concussion—contributing to the best possible outcomes in the shortest possible time. 
The company’s paradigm shifting BrainScope One technology will change the way head-injured patients are assessed and managed, providing clinicians – for the first time – a comprehensive, multi-modal, objective assessment a person’s head trauma. If you are an experienced and self-driven individual seeking a challenging career and the satisfaction of making an impact on the lives of patients and service members with head injury, BrainScope is the right place for you.
About the Opportunity
We are currently seeking a dynamic individual to join our team of Market Development Managers who will be responsible for increasing education, awareness, distribution, and ultimately growing the utilization of the BrainScope head injury assessment device. The Market Development Manager works closely with the Marketing and Customer Care teams (and, in the future, distributors) to increase the awareness, education, purchase, clinician adoption and increased utilization of the BrainScope system.
The selected candidate will possess successful medical/healthcare experience, strong leadership and communication skills, an ability to work independently, and is highly organized, collaborative and energetic. This individual must have experience and demonstrated comfort working with a wide variety of physician, healthcare professional specialties, healthcare administrators, and healthcare providers at every level (including nurses, techs, PAs, MAs, etc). Experience in promoting and educating the market on new medical technology, strong understanding and competence in process improvement and promoting and integrating best practices is preferred.
The Market Development Manager (MDM) is also responsible for identifying and proposing cost-effective opportunities to engage and educate clinicians, with and without the support of Key Opinion Leaders. In addition, the MDM is responsible for the education and training of new and current customers, and personally executing a successful incorporation of the BrainScope system into the “flow” or protocol of the new or existing customer’s mTBI assessment process. Equally important, is ensuring that our customers are satisfied with their use of BrainScope in order to drive ongoing utilization and to add additional positive references for future sales and market efforts.
In the latter half of 2019, BrainScope will establish market-specific (e.g., sports, urgent care, etc.) distributor relationships. When this occurs, the MDM’s above responsibilities will expand to then include educating, supporting, driving, managing and acting as the BrainScope expert to ensure these distributors remain focused and meet their and your respective Revenue targets.
This position:

Reports to Vice President, Sales & Marketing


Requires travel, 75% of the time across the assigned market (West Coast Region)
We offer a competitive salary and commission pay, strong benefits and stock options to complete the package.

Key Responsibilities
Manage New Business Development Process

Develop detailed business and call-plans that identify and target high potential accounts and execute face to face market development calls with physicians, nurses, athletic trainers, hospital administrators, practice managers and other key users and purchase influencers within the market to demonstrate and promote BrainScope’s cost-effective, clinical benefits.
Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing customer needs, communicating the cost-effective clinical benefits of the BrainScope system with the clear intent to meet your Revenue target.

Manage Customer Onboarding 

Establish and oversee new customer “onboarding,” including leading all implementation planning related efforts, workflow planning and updates, developing and communicating best practices, determining and ensuring implementation of IT requirements, provider and operator training and education, and go-live support (as necessary)
Engage Reimbursement Team to ensure that customer in informed of reimbursement guidance and updates systems and process to enable reimbursement for BrainScope cases
Leverage Marketing Team to work with customers to co-develop and execute site-specific marketing plans to drive and increase patient volume

Manage Product Adoption, Utilization Growth, and Customer Expansion

Track and leverage customer product utilization metrics to target specific customers/sites/operators with appropriate training and collateral including follow-up training, help/FAQ documentation, educational and instructional videos, etc.
Develop and execute plans to resolve potential areas of customer dissatisfaction with BrainScope
Forecast and track key account metrics, monitor and manage account status, and provide regular reporting to both customers and BrainScope senior management and other internal stakeholders
Continually nurture the customer relationship and drive revenue growth by account; identifying and pursuing opportunities for customers to broaden and deepen their use of BrainScope through resell/re-orders and expansion into additional sites/locations
Influence future lifetime value through higher product adoption, customer satisfaction, and overall customer health scores

Manage Strategic Customer Relationships 

Develop a deep understanding of the customer’s business, customer needs, and opportunities within existing account base, serving as an advocate for the customer within BrainScope and with any 3rd party distributors.
Develop a trusted advisor relationship with both customers and distributors, ensuring all activities are closely aligned with the customer’s and BrainScope’s business strategy
Establish and maintain customer satisfaction through the creation of an account-specific relationship framework inclusive of account plans, proactive and consistent customer and distributor communications, quarterly business reviews, account documentation and reporting, active issue remediation, etc.

Desired Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree (minimum)
3-10 years of experience in healthcare and/or business to business sales with a strong preference for experience in the field of healthcare consulting, technology or process consulting, or account management selling B2B or B2C within the medical device space
Strong technical acumen and ability to quickly understand BrainScope technology and communicate it effectively to key stakeholders


Experience in developing new innovative markets with paradigm shifting technologies
Solid job skills in business planning/consulting with multiple cross-functional contacts


Ability to understand a financial Proforma and communicate the value proposition


Understanding of the operational levers in each market and what is important to the customer


Keen understanding of the capital buying cycle and process within the healthcare space
Collaborative, goal-driven, confident self-starter with a willingness to continually embrace professional development and a passion to excel
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and able to work successfully in both team and autonomous environments.
A demonstrated mindset for putting the customer first and track record of exceeding customer expectations
Demonstrated ability to develop meaningful relationships and effectively communicate with, present to, and influence key stakeholders at all levels of an organization, including executive and C-level
Proven ability in managing a book of business or multiple customer relationships and customer projects, while maintaining sharp attention to detail

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this position, but they are not an exhaustive list of all the required responsibilities and skills of this position.
Qualified applicants are encouraged to send their resume and a cover letter including availability to recruiting@brainscope.com.
BrainScope Company, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer

title: CEI PROGRAM MANAGER
job_description:
Position:CEI Program Manager

Requisition Number: 2020-2610-02

S&ME is an employee-owned engineering firm that provides civil, geotechnical, environmental, planning, landscape architecture, survey and construction services. Consistently ranked in the top 100 of ENR's Top 500 Design Firms, our markets are diverse and include transportation, energy, water/wastewater, commercial development, industry, healthcare, education and government. We recruit top talent and are currently seeking a CEIProgram Manager to join our team. This position will play a key role in establishing and growing our CEI services across North Carolina, South Carolina, Georgia, Virginia and Tennessee.

This position will play a key role in building a nationally recognized construction engineering and inspection (CE&I) program and provide CE&I services to transportation clients, including Highway/Bridge, Rail, Aviation, Port and Pedestrian modes. The successful candidate will be a team-oriented leader with expertise in construction management as the project lead on major construction projects, have a desire to participate in regionally and nationally significant projects, provide exemplary client relations and demonstrate extraordinary responsiveness to transportation clients within a personally and professionally fulfilling work environment. This individual will be skilled in CEI program strategy, project development, seeking project opportunities, recruiting of project personnel and managing transportation projects.

title: Senior Website Manager
job_description:
We are one of the main reasons it's possible to text with a business today. Zipwhip was the first company to enable texting on existing business phone numbers, and we are now the world's leading business-texting software and API provider. More than 35,000 companies use us to increase customer engagement and drive growth through texting on their existing landline, VoIP or toll-free phone number. Intuitive cloud-based software, an enterprise-grade API and direct network connectivity mean businesses can use any computer or mobile device to securely and reliably reach their customers, every time.

Our strong venture backing allows us to aggressively invest in our product, technology and team; we've received nearly $100 million in funding from the likes of Goldman Sachs, M12 (Microsoft Ventures) and OpenView. We are consistently ranked one of Washington's fastest-growing workplaces, and were voted the 6th best place to work in the state by Seattle Business magazine and The Puget Sound Business Journal in 2019.

Every day we work to uphold our core DIRECT values: Determination, Innovation, Respect, Enthusiasm, Collaboration and Trust. We know that we'll build better products if we have a diverse and inspired team that's encouraged to make mistakes and experiment.

If you want to be part of a team where you're supported and empowered to change the way the world communicates, then we'd love to hear from you.

How this role makes an impact:

The website senior manager oversees the functionality and sustainability of Zipwhip.com; evaluates and manages website performance; facilitates hosting management; develops, maintains and updates website content and processes; and the integration of Zipwhip.com into the self-serve checkout flow. This role oversees our WordPress instances, hosting management, code deployment, website analytics, A/B testing and SEO optimization efforts integrated into the website. The website senior manager serves as the marketing team's subject matter expert on WordPress, web best practices, and front-end technologies.

What you'll be working on:

Own and manage our WordPress codebase and relationship with hosting vendor, including selection of themes and plug ins, codebase improvements and updates, and managing deployment processes.
Act as project manager for all asks related to Zipwhip.com including process development, project planning and execution, project prioritization, QA and launch. Includes managing weekly meeting, workback, and follow up with stakeholders.
Manage the integration of Zipwhip's marketing automation stack into Zipwhip.com, including Marketo, Drift, Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, and future analytics, tracking and automation tools.
Write and update HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP to support and improve zipwhip.com.
Collaborate with product and engineering on coordinated rollouts. Includes managing multiple dev environments and snapping to engineering processes.
Collaborate with content marketing team to drive search engine optimization best practices and tactics.
Own website performance optimization including ideation, testing, coding and execution of projects.
Create and present regular reports on website project status, roadmaps and performance.

The skills you'll need:

A degree in computer science, web development or a related qualification.
5+ years of work experience as a website manager, ideally working within WordPress.
Proficiency in HTML, CSS, SASS/SCSS, JavaScript (including webpack, babel, jQuery, and other frameworks), and PHP/WordPress.
Great understanding of Search Engine Optimization (SEO).
Competency in traditional software development workflow including local development and git.
Ability to troubleshoot website issues in a fast-paced environment.
Attention to detail with an analytical mind and outstanding problem-solving skills.
Strong project management capabilities and interpersonal skills to enable cross-function collaboration.
Willingness to roll up sleeves and get things done.

Why Zipwhip?

Ranked the #6 best workplace in Washington in 2019 from Seattle Business magazine and The Puget Sound Business Journal 
Consistently ranked one of Washington's fastest-growing companies by Deloitte
Competitive salary and stock options
Full benefits package including parental leave, 401k, flexible remote work, generous PTO
Health benefits including paid maternity and paternity leave, medical, vision, disability and life insurance
Free on-site weekly yoga and meditation classes hosted by ZUM fitness, and discounted memberships to Soul Fitness and CorePower Yoga
A brand new office on Elliott Bay with easy beachfront park access
Stipend for transportation and cell phone usage
A culture of transparency and open communication, including a catered weekly lunch meeting hosted by our CEO
Values-based leadership and a commitment to building diversity and inclusion

We are an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity of all kinds. We prohibit discrimination against any applicant or employee based on any legally recognized basis. This includes, but isn't limited to, race, color, national origin or ancestry, citizenship status, creed, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, age, veteran status, disability or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

We are an E-verify participating employer.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Title

Product Manager

Location

San Mateo, CA

Reporting to

Director of Product

About the role

Reporting to the Director of Product, the Product Manager will be responsible for assisting the product lead in driving the full product lifecycle of the product, including market research, competitive analysis, gathering requirements, developing specifications, creating feature lists, working with developers, tracking timeline, as well as all required documentation and assisting implementation team with delivery of the product to customers. The ideal candidate will also provide some customer support functions related to the product and enhancements.

What You'll Do

Own product feature development from market research, execution, to go-to-market and impact evaluation.
Conduct product discovery to identify and prioritize opportunities for product development that are in-line with desired business outcomes.
Write product specs, define product UI with the UX team, review test plans.
Collaborate with Engineering in product development, validating builds and driving releases to meet target dates.
Be the product champion. Document product functionality and train the organization on new features. Define the value proposition of your products and guide marketing / sales in selling your products.
Facilitate in data-driven decision making and create the telemetry and metrics required to evaluate the success of the products you launch.

What You'll Need

4+ years of Product Management experience in an enterprise B2B/B2B2C SaaS company.
Domain knowledge in building one or more marketing cloud products, such as Campaign Management, Segmentation, Email Marketing, SMS Marketing, and Marketing Automation.
Experience with wire-framing (Balsamiq preferred).
Experience with leading Scrum/Agile methodology development cycles, JIRA/Confluence proficiency.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication skills.
Self-starter, detail-oriented.
Technical background required. MBA is a strong plus.
20% travel involved.

Benefits

Healthcare coverage, FSA, HSA
Life and AD&D insurance
401K
Competitive salaries, bonus and stock options
Professional development
EAP
Maternity and Paternity (Bonding) Leave
Unlimited PTO
Paid holidays
