title: Senior Product Manager - Commercial
job_description:
nCino offers exciting career opportunities for individuals who want to join the worldwide leader in cloud banking.

As a Senior Product Manager, you will be responsible for owning the product strategy, detailed feature roadmap and ultimate success of your product suite. Being part of the product team means working collaboratively with developers and other key stakeholders to take the right ideas from concept to final delivery and adoption in the market. Product Management at nCino is a unique opportunity to continue to develop industry leading solutions that help transform the way financial institutions operate and service their customers.

Responsibilities

Be a front runner to push product vision, strategy, development, and execution to establish world-class, industry-leading, well-adopted productsManage the entire product lifecycle, from strategic planning to tactical activitiesSpecify market requirements for current and future products by conducting market research supported by on-going conversations with customers and non-customersKeep one eye on our fast moving environment to ensure we remain well positionedDrive the product road map to meet business objectives & goalsCollaborate closely with development teams to evaluate and iterate on ideas and designs

Qualifications

Required:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field4+ years of software marketing/product management experience or combination experience, education, & superior performanceExperience in presenting to multiple layers of a company, including executivesExperience being involved in the sales cycle and conducting customer interviewsOutstanding written and oral communication skillsProven ability to plan and deliver products in an agile environmentDemonstrable ability to gather and transform product feedback into actionable requirementsTravel Requirements -

Desired:

Advanced knowledge of Scrum principlesAdvanced knowledge of the commercial, small business banking, treasury, consumer space in relation to both processes and regulationsWorking knowledge of Salesforce

If you thrive in a high-energy, entrepreneurial environment, we invite you to share your passion, ideas and excitement at nCino.

nCino provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, disability, genetics or other protected groups. In addition to federal law requirements, nCino complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: Territory Sales Manager
job_description:
Territory Sales Manager Job description  Job brief  We are looking for a Territory Manager to help us increase our sales revenues and maintain customer relationships within an assigned geographical area. You will need to enjoy traveling and need to be able to adapt to whatever situation may occur. In this role, we seek outstanding organizational and sales skills. We expect you to be an excellent communicator who understands customer needs.  If you are also goal-driven and analytical, we’d like to meet you. Ultimately, you will ensure our clients are happy and search for ways to grow our sales.  Territory Sales Manager Responsibilities include: 

Maintaining customer relationships


Setting and meeting sales targets to increase revenue
Finding ways to ensure efficiency of sales operations in the territory
Devise effective territory sales and marketing strategies
Analyze data to find the most efficient sales methods
Meet with customers to address concerns and provide solutions
Discover sales opportunities through consumer research
Present products and services to prospective customers
Participate in industry or promotional events (e.g. trade shows) to cultivate customer relationships
Conduct training in sales techniques and company product attributes
Monitor competition within assigned region
Prepare and submit reports to the Sales Manager

 Requirements 

Proven experience as a Territory Manager
Proven track record of increasing sales and revenue; field sales experience is a must
Ability to develop sales strategies
Proficient in MS Office
Excellent communication skills
Organizational and leadership ability
Problem-solving aptitude
BSc/BA in Business, Marketing or a related field

 Benefits 

PTO- 1 week to start
Competitive salary
401K matching
Paid Holidays
Annual Performance Review
2% Commission

title: Senior Manager, Product Development
job_description:
Responsibilities: 

Manage multiple projects across a broad range of categories in the beauty industry ensuring timelines are on track and launches are successfulCollaborate with Product Marketing in developing early stage new product concepts, identifying opportunities and establishing differentiationCreate product profiles (product dossiers) to include dermatological positioning, product concepts, product claims, technology and key product attributes, ensure R&D cross-functional team alignmentPerform market research and competitive analysis/review, understand trends, and new technologiesAct as a liaison between the product development team, vendors and the cross functional team to ensure that all critical milestones are metResearch, select and align on product benchmarks that represent desired formula attributes: aesthetics, performance, usage experience, etc.Manage product submissions and redirects providing feedback, direction and approval, selecting standards for cross-functional teamsWork with cross functional team to ensure final formulas are within COGS targets and that they achieve target margins for finished goods.Assist in communication with new vendor screening and potential new innovation opportunitiesWork cross-functionally with R&D team members to ensure all lab testing is complete including MICRO, RIPT, Lab Stability, Lab Compatibility, Ophthalmology, In-vitro and SPF testing as neededCollaborate with Clinical Development to validate technical feasibility and final product efficacy and safety through technology POPs and clinical studies.Create and conduct internal user testing to validate formulas and packaging fill weightsWork with Packaging on primary packaging and line trials associated with the pilot runs and scale-ups to maintain on time deliveriesWork with Quality on developing testing protocols per product, reviewing new batches (including reviewing specifications, aesthetics, MSDS, quality, QA/QC and all product associated documentation)Work with Regulatory on formula reviews, global registration, regulatory restrictions and strategies per marketsWork closely with NMD on global market launches to ensure market readiness with compliant, tolerable and desirable new global product launches and reformulationsManage at least 1 direct report

Qualifications:

8+ years beauty related product development experience in a corporate environment.Prefer to have beauty brand management experience.Prior experience in the skincare or beauty industry.4+ years prior experience managing direct reports.The ability to fulfill several project requests simultaneously while managing and meeting tight deadlines.A proven track record of working collaboratively, displaying flexibility and being accountable.A demonstrated passion for the industry, business, company, and/or brand.The ability to effectively partner and motivate across functions and with outside vendors.Bachelor’s degree required.Working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications: Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.Outstanding oral and written communication skills.Exceptional organizational skills and a great attention to detail.A fast-mover who is flexible, able to adapt quickly to changing priorities in a fast-pasted environment, be willing to take risks and wear many hats and be hands-on.Responsible and extremely resourceful in finding answers and solutions when information and data is not readily available.On-task, expedient, rigorous, tenacious, results-oriented and a proven problem solver.Creative thinker who thinks outside of the box and always looks for ways to improve.Highly self-motivated and directed with the confidence to be able to discern how and when to champion their ideas.A conscientious team-player with unquestionable personal and professional character and integrity.

The Company

Rodan + Fields was founded in 2000 by Stanford-trained Dermatologists Dr. Katie Rodan and Dr. Kathy Fields with a passion for giving people the best skin of their lives — and the confidence that comes with it. Today, Rodan + Fields is the #1 Skincare Brand in North America[1] in 2018 and the #1 Skincare Brand in the US in 2016, 2017 and 2018[2]! The company has grown its innovative line of products and expanded into Canada and Australia. Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, R+F now employs approximately 700 people, has more than 300,000 enrolled Independent Consultants and over two million Preferred Customers.

At Rodan + Fields, you will be challenged to make an impact, inspired to do more, and rewarded for your contributions. We are transforming skincare, and we welcome your big ideas to fuel our ambitious growth plans! If you are looking for a life-changing career opportunity, we've got your prescription. You’ll become part of a positive, passionate movement that celebrates greatness and encourages employees to be catalysts for change. We provide a creative, vibrant workplace outfitted with all of the technology, tools and training you'll need to learn, grow and thrive! We create life-changing impact in our communities through our non-profit, Prescription for Change®, the heart of Rodan + Fields. By funding empowerment programs for students, we teach them how to use their skills to make life-changing differences in their lives and the lives of others. Join us and share your talents as we develop innovative solutions for your skin and empower entrepreneurs. In addition to working arm-in-arm with industry leaders, employees at Rodan + Fields enjoy rich benefits plans and perks.

[1] Source Euromonitor International Limited; Beauty and Personal Care 2019 Edition, retail value RSP terms; all channels, Skin Care includes Sets and Kits; North America defined as Canada and the United States

[2] Source Euromonitor International Limited; Beauty and Personal Care 2019 Edition, retail value RSP terms; all channels, Skincare includes Sets & Kits.

*At R+F, we do not engage with Google Hangouts or other social media platforms to schedule interviews or communicate with candidates. Please disregard any messages or notifications from Google Hangouts or other social media messenger platforms regarding interviews or job

title: Product Manager
job_description:
By applying to this position, your application is automatically considered for the range of PM roles we have at Wayfair. If we think you might be a fit, a recruiter will reach out to learn more about your background and discuss relevant positions in more detail.

Who We Are:

Wayfair believes everyone should live in a home they love. Through technology and innovation, we make it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 14 million items across home furnishings, décor, home improvement, housewares and more. Partnering with Engineering, Experience Design, Analytics and business leaders across Wayfair, our Product teams ensure that were building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways.

Our Product organization includes a variety of teams solving interesting problems:


Storefront, our consumer-facing Product team, is tackling a wide array of fascinating, incredibly difficult problems - like helping a massive, rapidly growing global customer base efficiently find the perfect products from our catalog of >10M items (with the majority of traffic on mobile), building 2-sided marketplaces to connect consumers with interior designers and contractors, and leveraging A/R and Computer Vision to help customers visualize products in their space.
Ad Tech & Customer Intelligence (ATCI) builds products that let Wayfair communicate with new and existing customers effectively across advertising, email, and onsite touchpoints. This team is at the intersection of product, marketing, data science, and technology which allows us to be a leader in the Ad Technology space.
Our Supply Chain product team ensures the right products are in stock, in the right places, at the right time, with the right cost profile to enable valuable delivery experiences for our customers, and differentiated value for our suppliers and carriers. We power availability, speed, and cost reduction across the value chain, from forecast to home delivery and post-delivery services.
Our Operations Product teams drive the development of the world-class software products that power Wayfairs transformation of retail for home. These teams create new and innovative services for customers and build the backbone of Wayfairs pricing, merchandising, and enterprise operations. Whether on desktop, mobile web, app, or any of our proprietary internal platforms, we leverage data, user-centric design, machine learning, and Agile to achieve operational excellence, fueling company growth.

Across all product teams we have a modern tech stack including sophisticated capabilities around AI, data science, multivariate testing and personalization. Were a highly collaborative, supportive team that values learning, psychological safety and intentional career development.

What Youll Do:

As the owner of your product(s), youll be responsible for wearing any and all hats. You will own your roadmap, measure performance, keep your pulse on the customer, anticipate bottlenecks, make tradeoffs, and take acceptable risks to maximize the benefit for our customer and business. If youre doing it right, youre also having a ton of fun and learning every day
Lead a cross-functional team of engineers, designers, analysts, data scientists, and other internal partners to envision, build, and deliver experiences that impact tens of millions of consumers
Measure the impact of your initiatives and report performance metrics to key stakeholders throughout the organization

What Youll Need:

You have a track-record of shipping software products in an agile development environment, ideally with exposure to a relevant product area (eCommerce or B2C; SaaS platforms; API experience) or relevant practical experience in an analytical role
An entrepreneurial mindset, with a bias for customer focused innovation
Bachelors degree or equivalent practical experience
Passion for building functional and engaging user experiences with a strong customer-centric focus
Excellent analytical skills with demonstrated experience turning data into actionable insights.
Ample experience collaborating across multiple stakeholder groups, communicating with diverse audiences, and balancing/negotiating priorities
Familiarity with Excel, SQL, and multivariate testing practices a plus

Wayfair is one of the worlds largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, were reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If youre looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then youll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. Were a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair and world for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. Thats why were proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.Apply Now

title: Senior Product Manager
job_description:
WHAT WE DO MATTERS:

Here at The Knot Worldwide, we believe in doing work that matters. In 15 countries around the world, our leading family of brands (The Knot, WeddingWire, Bodas, GigMasters, The Bump, How They Asked, Lasting, and more) inspire, inform, and celebrate our communities as they move through life's milestones. From the proposal to creating a home, and starting a family together, we're there for every step of the journey. Our couples and business partners depend on us. They're all in. So are we.

ABOUT THE ROLE AND OUR TEAM:

We are seeking an experienced and impassioned Sr. Product Manager to help us transform wedding planning into a delightful journey while helping couples get the hard work done with confidence. We're looking for that special someone to ensure that The Knot stays #1 in Weddings by bringing your entrepreneurial spirit, creative problem solving, and user-centric design thinking to our team. You'll work closely with exceptional design and tech leads. Your Marketing and PR partners are knowledgeable and collaborative, having built up key relationships in the industry over many years.

We have built a world-class product development team and are passionate about growing product managers into masters of the craft. We have a rich product development program including monthly Product Schools, development budgets, guest speakers, meetups … as well as a strong general focus on personal development.

This role is a great mix of forward-thinking strategy and highly creative, design-centered feature development, with a strategic product focus on The Knot's wedding planning journey. We craft planning tools that help the couple stay organized, confident, and have some fun while planning their wedding.

You should be excited about building new products from Minimally Viable Experiments to iterating and scaling the existing planning products. You love helping users solve big problems and making life's biggest moments joyful instead of stressful.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Always put our users first
Work closely with our outstanding analytic and research team to gain feedback and insights directly from users
Set the strategic direction in collaboration with product marketing, engineering, and design partners
Drive outcome-focus execution - what matters most is how the product impacts our customers and our business
Collaborate with product leaders to ensure cohesion between your products and the overall product experience on The Knot

SUCCESSFUL SR. PRODUCT MANAGERS HAVE:

5+ years in product development, in an agile environment
You can set strategic direction and help ideate and launch new products and experiences
You always refer to quantitative and qualitative data in making product decisions and have experience with analytics and research tools + methods and comfort with analytical tools
You have a track record of creating quality consumer experiences that solve real user needs and drive business growth
You communicate clearly and collaborate effectively with your partners and executives
You have keen aesthetics and empathy, and a user-centered mentality
You're a strong partner for engineers, empathetic to their unique needs, and you believe there's such a thing as tech debt
You're a natural prioritizer, have great instincts when it comes to what matters, and have made tough but smart trade-offs. You care about Outcomes over Outputs - goals matter more than the roadmap

WHAT WE LOVE ABOUT YOU:

You deeply understand our users and put them at the center of everything you do. You aim to serve and delight them every day.
You are respectful and act with the highest integrity.
You ask questions to understand a perspective and are comfortable respectfully challenging assumptions.
You set clear ambitious goals.
You anticipate obstacles, persevere, and are accountable for your commitments.You aren't afraid to challenge the status quo and know that there's no such thing as failure if you learn from it.
You seek out feedback and never settle in your quest to grow and develop. By being here, you make our company stronger.

WHAT YOU LOVE ABOUT US:

The Knot Worldwide offers a unique employee experience and we are deeply proud of our award-winning culture. From flexible vacation and generous parental leave benefits to promoting wellness and giving back to our community, we believe in happiness above all else—in and out of the office.

The Knot Worldwide provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability. In addition to federal law requirements, The Knot Worldwide complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. The Knot Worldwide expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.

If you are a resident of California, by submitting your application, you acknowledge that you've read the California Privacy Notice.

title: Kitchen Manager
job_description:
DESCRIPTION:  Trollhaugen Outdoor Recreation Area has an exciting and rare opportunity for a new human to join the full-time year-round team in trolly Dresser, WI, just 50 minutes North of the Twin Cities. At Trollhaugen, we sell fun in every department, from the perfectly groomed ski slopes, right down to our famously stacked Bloody Mary’s and mouth watering dishes. We are seeking a Kitchen Manager with a positive, can-do attitude, that is genuinely interested in taking ownership of this role and crafting their dream culinary job in the quickly expanding St.Croix River Valley. Our culture is not of of “me” and “mine” - rather, it’s one of “How can I help!?” We put the customer experience before all else, and we are searching for someone that shares that same passion. Are you shaking your head yes and saying “Pick me!" Well, you might just be a Troll at heart!  This position supervises and coordinates the daily back-of-the house operations of our casual dining services, including managing the kitchen staff, and overseeing workflow to ensure the department is operating to plan. Additional responsibilities include hiring, training, and scheduling of kitchen staff, preparation and cooking of food products, training and coaching staff on the production and preparation of menu items.  The ideal candidate will have 2 or more years management experience in the restaurant field. The kitchen manager will work on all stations in the kitchen along with having responsibility for menu development, ordering, controlling food costs and kitchen labor costs.  OPERATION SCHEDULE:  Trollhaugen operates casual dining services during the ski season, 7 days a week, typically early November through the end of March, including limited hours on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day, excluding Thanksgiving. Throughout the off season and occasionally in season we have catered banquets/events onsite, which this position is also responsible for. This includes Saturday and Sunday morning of Memorial Weekend.  This position is expected to work 6 days a week during the ski season, weekends required – and 4 to 5 days a week in the off season.  In season our kitchen area is open from 11am-9pm Mon-Thurs, 11am-10pm Fri, 9:30am-10pm Sat, and 9:30am-8pm Sun (with breakfast served Sat and Sun morning). Off season we are open only for private Banquets/Events.  QUALIFICATIONS:

At least 2 years of related supervisory or management experience in a moderate to high volume, high energy, food and beverage environment.
Exceptional knowledge in food safety and preparation.
Working knowledge of food cost, purchasing and kitchen equipment operation.
Proficient computer skills necessary to communicate with others, use our scheduling app, prepare and provide food costs and recipes.
Working knowledge of state and federal laws and regulations related to food, safety, sanitation, and employment.
Embrace our positive, caring customer experience attitude
Culinary school background a plus
Able to work ten hour-plus shifts, plus ability to stand, sit, squat or walk for extended periods of time.
Must be able to work closing shifts and evenings as needed.
Able to grasp, reach overhead, push, lift and carry up to 50 pounds.
Finger/hand dexterity to operate kitchen machinery, knives, etc
Must possess hearing, visual and sensory abilities to observe and detect emergency situations; also to distinguish product, taste, texture, temperature and presentation and preparation
Will need to either have or be able to attain ServSafe manager certification within 6 months of starting this position

POSITION ACTIVITIES AND TASKS

Assists the kitchen staff to achieve expected profitability while ensuring maximum guest satisfaction and the development and training of all employees.
Ensures that all menu items are prepared, portioned, and presented properly in a clean, safe, and sanitary manner, according to all established procedures, performance standards, and local health department regulations.
Monitors and oversees food temperatures during hot and cold handling to reduce the incidence of risk factors known to cause food borne illness.
Must be able to perform/assist all functions for all positions in the kitcehn if needed.
Ensures that inventory levels for both food and non-food items are properly maintained.
Ensures the kitchen efficiency by having a sufficient number of well-trained and productive employees.
Ensures proper management of facility and equipment through preventive maintenance, energy conservation, repairs, security measures, and adherence to safety and sanitation requirements.
Conducts employment activities to include interviewing, scheduling, training, and conducting performance reviews with all kitchen personnel, as well as recommending pay increases and preparing employee documentation.
Achieving and maintaining ServSafe certification.
Ensures accurate financial data to include: restaurant supplies, inventories, food cost, payroll/productivity, and operating expenses.
Attends management meetings.
Works with all departments to prepare for increased traffic due to special ski area events & competitions, school holidays, and weather events.
Anticipates, identifies and corrects system breakdowns to achieve guest satisfaction.
Responsible for all communication with regard to system breakdowns and deficiencies to General Manager.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/ENVIRONMENT/WORKING CONDITIONS

Extensive standing, without breaks
Exposure to heat, steam, smoke, cold
Reaching heights of approximately 6 feet and depths of 2 1/2 - 3 ft.
Must have high level of mobility/flexibility in space provided
Must be able to work irregular hours under heavy pressure/stress during busy times
Bending, reaching, walking
Communicating clearly with guests and employees
Operating cash register
Carrying trays of food products weighing about 20 pounds for distances up to 30 feet
Using telephone
Lifting up to 50 pounds for a distance up to 30 feet

EXPERIENCE REQUIRED  Two years previous experience; preferably in the food production management.  COMPENSATION PACKAGE  Annual Starting Salary $42,000-$51,000.  Matching 401k after 1 year of employment  Complimentary Meals during in-season operations  Starting 2 weeks PTO  Ski and Snowboard Privileges, equipment use, lessons for self/immediate family  ABOUT TROLLHAUGEN  Trollhaugen is located in Dresser, WI – 50 miles outside of Mpls/St.Paul. Trollhaugen is a family owned business, currently in its 3rd generation. We pride ourselves on dedicating our effort towards the customer experience. There is nothing more rewarding than seeing the smiling faces of people on the snow, in a lesson, or lounging on our balcony with a beverage and meal. We aren’t just looking for ability, but an attitude that reflects our core values.  We will be accepting Applications through March 29th.  Job Type: Full-time

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Spok is looking for an experienced Product Manager to guide the delivery of our next generation clinical collaboration and communication application. Collaborating with the Product team, business stakeholders, and the Delivery teams, you will tackle complex and challenging problems to optimize user experience by developing innovative product offerings.

As a Product Manager, you will use your healthcare IT background to drive the product strategy for Spok’s Spok Go Platform. You will collaborate with healthcare users to understand their challenges. You will collect and interpret data to make recommendations on strategic product development and marketing of offerings to our healthcare customers. You’ll forecast trends within the healthcare marketplace to align marketing strategy based on your predictions.

This role is inherently cross-functional -- you will work closely with the Product Management Team, Marketing, Professional Services, Clinical SME’s, and the other Spok team members to assess and communicate your product strategy. A successful candidate puts the customer first in everything, is highly organized, able to work effectively in a fast-paced environment, and adept at synthesizing information and clearly communicating a product vision.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include:

Understand customer needs and validate solutions. You will oversee and interpret market research and competitive intelligence to determine ways to competitively enhance product capabilities.Understand and support the portfolio. You have strategic thinking and prioritization skills with the ability to develop the roadmap to achieve business goals while making difficult trade off decisions.Analytical problem solver; able to understand interdependencies of business functions and impacts of decisions.Develop and maintain understanding of customer workflows and processes used in healthcare and enterprise communications.Gather inputs, establish direction and formulate the product features for the next version(s) of products. Constant product backlog refinement.Define and develop a data-driven (workflow analysis, market segmentation, competitive analysis, customer persona identification) service line strategy.Advocate for user / customer to ensure customer satisfaction.Work with management to recommend pricing to meet revenue and profitability goals.Define business case including sales projections.Assess internal workflows and improve processes to drive efficiency, improve quality and facilitate cohesive development for Spok Go solutions.Synthesizes insight from analyses and identify high priority solutions and work cross functionally to drive new product innovation.Drive positive and meaningful business growth, including ROI analysis for customers.Work collaboratively with product and engineering teams to document, and communicate product requirements following Spok’s Jobs to be Done framework.Work with Channel team to establish new partnership opportunities.Partner with Marketing to develop go to market strategy.Host webinars and speak at conference and industry events.Other duties may be assigned.

Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education and/or Experience:

Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university and five years’ related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. MBA preferred.

Skills and Qualifications Required:

5+ years of product management /product development experience, preferably in the digital space5+ years selling, supporting, or developing enterprise solutions

Preferred Qualifications

10 + years’ experience in enterprise softwareExperience in healthcare ITDemonstrated portfolio of user-centric digital experiences with proven, positive impacts to engagement and product valueExperience working with clients (managing expectation, managing delivery dates)Experience working with multi-disciplinary teams comprised of product directors, technical product managers, other product managers, and engineeringAbility to absorb and make sense of large amounts of data, information, and perspectives to direct decision makingAbility to turn complicated inputs into clear, communicable visionOutstanding communication skills for all audience types including clients and executivesAn understanding of SAFe with related experienceKnowledge of current digital web and application standardsPassion for designing and building an exceptional user experienceStrong analytical, communication, and influencing skillsAbility to work in team settingSound business judgmentAbility to drive for results with minimal guidance

title: Sales Manager (Foodservice)
Product Manager, Platform (Smart & Connected)
job_description:
Sensata Technologies is looking for an entrepreneurial product manager to develop the product strategy and drive the product roadmap from concept development to market leadership for a smart and connected technology platform for commercial trucks and trailers. The platform will support applications for load and environmental monitoring (e.g. climate control, cargo capacity, etc.) as well as mechanical condition and safety (e.g. wheel ends, tires, brakes, etc.).

Commercial fleets are seeking to deploy smart and connected devices across trucks and trailers in order to generate actionable insight to reduce operating costs, improve uptime and enhance safety. As the Product Manager, Platform you will be responsible for understanding and translating the business needs of commercial fleets into a compelling technology solution that generates actionable insights for both OEM truck, trailer manufacturers and the fleets that operate the vehicles and equipment.

This is a unique opportunity at Sensata to play a highly visible role to develop and execute on a product strategy that is both compelling and achievable as a result of combining a deep understanding of customer and partner needs with our smart and connected technology capabilities. The Product Manager will work closely with market development, engineering, other product managers and operations to define and manage product releases.

This role reports to the Director of Product Management for Smart & Connected and the selected candidate will join a highly motivated and growing team within a new ventures organization at Sensata charged with incubating and commercializing new technologies.-

Responsibilities include:

Understand market outlook and ecosystem evolution of smart and connected trucks and trailers for different customer segments and go-to-market retrofit channels in each global region.Build deep customer empathy in partnership with the market development team for typical use cases experienced by each stakeholder (e.g. driver, production technician, fleet back office, etc.)Synthesize product requirements and develop a differentiated product strategy for an integrated solution consisting of high value wireless sensors and an interoperable vehicle area network platform connecting trucks and trailers.Define the multi-generation product roadmap, determining which devices and features should be prioritized across each customer segment and go-to-market channel.Facilitate product/solution development in collaboration with engineering.Lead product positioning and value proposition development for each customer segment and go-to-market channel; use data to illustrate conclusions that address commercial fleet business needs.Develop monetization strategies and pricing models for solution offerings, including creating innovative new revenue/business models.

Experience/Qualifications:

The ideal candidate will possess the following characteristics:

4+ years post-MBA or 6+ years work experience performing relevant product management or related job function.B.S. degree in engineering, or related quantitative field. title: Project Manager
job_description:
Becoming the leader in the fire and security industry takes talent—yours. We are looking for an experiencedProject Manager in theColumbus, OH area to join our best of the best team as we drive the industry forward and pursue excellence in everything we do. If you’re up to the challenge, we want to talk to you.

At Koorsen, we don’t provide jobs, we provide careers. A career at Koorsen includes competitive pay, a great health package, an annual bonus program, life insurance, continuous learning offerings, matching 401k, paid holidays, generous PTO, tuition reimbursement, career growth opportunities, and much more.

Job Summary

Primarily responsible for oversight of all phases of assigned fire protection/security systems projects Including coordinating employees, subcontractors, materials, and equipment, ensuring that specifications are being followed, and work is proceeding with quality, on schedule and within budget.

Duties and Responsibilities

Administrate and responsible for the Company’s performance on the project including:

oContract Management; Profit and Cash Flow Management

Project Startup and Project Closeout

oPerformance Management

Labor Management

oPurchase Ability

Develop scope of work

Research and purchase of material

Equipment and services at best value for specified product

•Serves as the branch representative when dealing with various general contractors, trade contractors, subcontract tors, vendors and internal customers

•Clearly articulate data, concepts and directions, both orally and in writing to all customers in a timely and organized fashion

•Incorporate the contracted scope of work into a final product, meeting all quality criteria as established by the contract documents and management, at the lowest reasonable cost

•Manage and serve as the Team Leader for all project assigned by management.

•Coordinate the efforts of all team members in respect to the requirements of the project and management to achieve all goals established for the project

•Provide coaching and guidance to team members about every aspect of the project so all team members understand their tasks fully and can adhere to their responsibilities and meet project milestones efficiently

•Evaluate the performance of all team members

•Be a role model for integrity to project team members

•Demonstrate Leadership

•Other duties as assigned by manager

•Be on time, ready to work when scheduled and work efficiently and utilize resources to complete all duties as assigned by management in a timely manner

•Ensure timely and professional communication with coworkers, customers and vendors

•Represent Koorsen in a professional manner

•Follow Koorsen policies and procedures

•Maintain up-to-date knowledge of NFPA code as applicable to the position and attend company training sessions as assigned

Education and Experience Requirements

Required:

•High School diploma or equivalent plus 5 years’Security Systems/Fire Protection industry working experience OR

•Associate degree in related field from an accredited college with 2 years'Security Systems/Fire Protection working experience OR

•Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college and no experience

•Valid driver’s license with acceptable driving record and meet the safe driving policy criteria to be an active company vehicle driver

•The ability to pass a background check

•Ability to attain required licensing

Preferred:

•Degree in engineering, building construction OR the equivalent field engineering experience with at least two years’ hands on experience in the Security Systems/Fire Protection service industry

•NICET Certification

title: Oncology Area Business Manager - San Francisco/East Bay, CA
job_description:
The Oncology Area Business Manager (ABM) is accountable for achieving annual sales objectives for a defined territory through the development, maintenance and enhancement of key customer relationships. Responsibilities include development and implementation of effective territory planning and leveraging Sanofi Genzyme resources effectively. Utilization of effective selling techniques and marketing strategies to create and expand product understanding and appropriate patient identification are also a must.

Develop and utilize a business plan aligned with marketing strategies through territory analysis, cross-functional collaboration and customer insights (updated quarterly).

Implement business plans through leveraging all appropriate resources, both human and physical, with Hematologists and Oncologists and other appropriate key customers.

Develop as product, disease state and marketplace expert. Effectively communicate and position product information to customers in order to successfully promote the appropriate use of the Sanofi Genzyme oncology portfolio within territory.

Work closely with all field partners, including, but not limited to Oncology Transplant Network Manager (ONM) as necessary to ensure strategy pull through from Key IDNs/System, Reimbursement, Account, other Sanofi-Genzyme ABMs and Medical (as appropriate).

Complete call reporting, business plan updates and expense reports, and operate within all Pharma compliance guidelines.

Effective account targeting and time management.

Attend training sessions as required and conventions and symposia, as necessary.

Complete all fleet safety training and maintain an acceptable driving record regarding accidents and incidents.

Basic Qualifications:

BA/BS degree from an accredited school required. Focus in business or life science preferred.Minimum two years of Oncology/Hematology sales experience OR one year previous Sanofi Oncology/Transplant sales experience.

Additional Requirements:

Ability to think, plan, and act strategicallyEffective oral and written communication skillsUp to 2 years successful experience in the sale of chemotherapeutic agents or bio-tech products preferredWorking knowledge of and familiarity with the hospital and cancer center environment preferred.Driving a company car in a safe manner to daily meetings and appointments is required

Territory ID: N12FE08S

We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.

title: Senior Project Manager
job_description:
Who We AreWillowTree is an award-winning digital product agency driven by innovation and grounded in strategy and user-centered design. We create long-term partnerships with the world's leading brands to design and build digital flagship products crucial to their core business. We are one of the largest independent digital firms in the US. Some of our clients include HBO, National Geographic, Anheuser-Busch, and PepsiCo.The OpportunityThe Senior Project Manager is a highly-autonomous role with endless opportunities. You'll partner with Fortune 500 clients to create a product vision while advising and managing scope, risk, and new product opportunities. You'll have the unique opportunity to build and grow a team as the Virtual CEO of your project!

*This is not a remote position and requires up to ~25% travel.Responsibilities

You'll drive product development, leading the creation of products that are critical to our clients' businesses
You'll lean on your deep client services experience to drive effective decision-making on complex issues of scope, design, architecture, and process
You'll deliver timely, tailored communication for various audiences: engineering teams, product managers, marketing partners, and C-level executives
You'll create, guide, and communicate the holistic (WillowTree, client, 3rd party) project plan and goals to create alignment and drive convergent implementation
You'll encourage sustainable flow for your team while focusing on key client objectives
You'll be flexible and adaptive to changing scenarios and environments by applying appropriate project management frameworks to suit the customer and product
You'll regularly visit your client, usually 1-3 days per month, up to 20% of the time during kickoff or launch periods
You'll engage directly with clients managing the account details, project scope, and relationship

Qualifications

You have 7+ years of experience in the software development industry as a Project Manager, Product Manager, Product Owner, Team Lead, or Scrum Master in a client services business
You have experience leading Fortune 500 custom software development projects, from discovery through UX design, implementation, and deployment
You've demonstrated empathy, experience and confidence managing software projects with complex scope and with multiple executive stakeholders
You're an experienced technical problem solver that can adeptly figure out how to address and communicate technical or process issues between systems (e.g. API issues vs client-side, bug management issues, etc)
You're an expert communicator who regularly runs workshops and structured meetings to align client stakeholder groups on enterprise business goals
You have a blend of business, user experience, and software project management acumen and mindset of motivating clients and 3rd party counterparts to be collaborative partners
You've managed projects in which you mentor other product, development, design, and testing team members

Bonus Points

You have professional experience as a Project or Product Manager and Scrum Master from a major technology consultancy or agency
You've led projects that require the build and delivery of successful native iOS and/or Android applications that have been successfully delivered to a high volume of users
You've taken part in Agile transformation or application of Agile methodology (Scrum, Kanban, etc.) on software development projects
Certifications such as CSM, CSPO, PMP, SA, SPC, etc.

Why WillowTree?We offer a place to be yourself.

Our differences, both visible and invisible, benefit our teams, our communities, and the products we craft. That's why WillowTree strives to build a team with diverse backgrounds, skills, and perspectives. You'll work hard here; however, we'll balance that with a culture that supports your growth and cares about your well-being. We're committed to creating an environment of inclusion a place where every Tree can thrive.

We want you to reach your fullest potential and part of your professional development at WillowTree will include dedicated time to innovate on passion projects and an annual stipend to fund your professional pursuits.

WillowTree celebrates our differences and provides equal employment opportunities to all team members and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager- EMEA
job_description:
About Us:

SentinelOne was formed by an elite team of cyber security and defense experts from IBM, Intel, Check Point, Cylance, McAfee, and Palo Alto Networks. SentinelOne is shaping the future of endpoint security through its unified, converged platform that automatically prevents, detects, and responds to threats in real-time. Our unique approach is based on deep inspection of all system processes combined with innovative machine learning to quickly isolate malicious behaviors, protecting devices against advanced, targeted threats in real time.What are we looking for?

As a Senior Product Marketing Manager, you will be a key player in the transformation of the endpoint security market. You will articulate a clear, consistent and creative value proposition for our target markets while acting as the linchpin between our sales, product teams and go-to-market message. You will have the opportunity to develop compelling go-to-market initiatives and sales enablement programs while being a part of our product positioning and messaging. You will work closely with the leaders of this organization - across product management, product marketing, sales, demand generation, corporate communications and customer success, to define and execute the strategy.Key Responsibilities:

Be the expert on the key capabilities, differentiators, benefits and use cases for target customer segments.Develop compelling messaging, product literature, website, competitive positioning, customer presentations and event presentations.Develop, gather and disseminate technical information internally and externally.Deliver content, assets and tools including blog posts, whitepapers, presentations, demos, videos, social assets, webinars, ROI tools and other market-facing materials.Identify thought leaders and topics - including research, information gathering, technical investigation, testing and publishing.Work closely across marketing teams to develop demand gen and awareness campaigns.Enable the sales, SE and channel organizations on SentinelOne capabilities and positioning.Understand sales/channel requirements and communicate the value proposition of the products to the sales team and develop the sales tools that support the selling process of the products.Regularly evaluate competitive capabilities and technologies to understand features, pricing, positioning,and packaging.Serve as a thought leader as needed with a variety of audiences including customers, analysts, field and partner teams driving a deeper understanding of the SentinelOne value proposition and our differentiation.Work closely with product management, sales and executives to develop & influence product strategy, GTM strategy.



What skills and knowledge should you bring?

Big passion for cyber-security and for creating high-impact marketing materials and campaigns. Well-versed in persona-based B2B marketing strategies.Knowledgeable about next-generation endpoint protection, cyber-security technologies (traditional antivirus, network security, firewalls, vulnerability assessment, incident response and forensics), endpoint computing platforms (especially macOS), virtualization (VmWare, Citrix), and cloud (AWS, Azure). Deep understanding of the enterprise data center, along with cloud and virtualization technologies. Of all areas listed, endpoint experience is a big plus!Business or Technical postgraduate degree. Strong written, verbal, editing and presentation skills. Highly collaborative with a deep sense of ownership and accountability. Easily builds business partnerships and inspires team member.Team player that can operate without close supervision, including working in remote locations. Conduct detailed reporting of timelines and tasks progress and completion.

title: Digital Platform Product Manager
job_description:
IntroductionWe are seeking a Digital Platform Product Manager to help advance iRobot’s capabilities and provide our customers with a world-class digital experience. As a Digital Platform Product Manager, you will drive the execution of our digital experience roadmaps and have a direct impact on our digital transformation. You will contribute to the company’s broader vision in digital customer experience by challenging and extending our thinking to ensure that we’re doing right both by our customers and our business.

Digital Platform Product Management is at the intersection of the “what” in our experience roadmap and the “how” in our technology roadmap. The Platform Product Manager must be able to translate the visions of our Experience Product Managers, and partner with strong technology leads in the software organization to make them a reality for their assigned platform component. To do this, you will need to bring a unique blend of technical savviness, business savviness, and user experience savviness, along with a distinct bias towards action. You’ll assess tradeoffs for how to best architect and implement solutions, and will make the challenging prioritization decisions across customer, business, and technology infrastructure needs. In the end, your partnership with Engineering, Design, and other PM leaders will enable iRobot to build the capabilities that will power the next generation iRobot’s platforms. A successful candidate has a proven track record in taking on end-to-end ownership and successfully delivering results in a fast-paced and dynamic business environment. You must be capable of driving multiple initiatives - focusing on details while not losing sight of the big picture.

If you have high digital acumen, are a change driver, customer-focused, analytical, resourceful and team-oriented – we want to talk to you!What you will do:

Identify capabilities and technology infrastructure that are necessary to create the backbone for iRobot's full suite of products.
Lead agile, empowered and dedicated development teams on a day-to-day basis, answering questions, making decisions, and closely managing scope and quality of deliverables.
Translate the digital value proposition and customer experience into a logically sequenced and optimized product roadmap for key product areas.
Prioritize activities to balance the needs of the business and the supporting architecture efforts.
Write user stories aligned with product vision, creating clear requirements for the development team.
Define success criteria for product development and build the insight required to measure it effectively. Obsess over the data and always be working to gain more insight to drive better outcomes.
Develop and maintain the product and feature roadmap for your assigned platform area, performing ongoing backlog maintenance, prioritization, and resolution of defects/bugs.
Proactively identify and resolve strategic issues that may impair the team's ability to meet strategic, financial and technical goals.
Opportunity to work on robot behaviors, mobile and cloud, machine learning, and other aspects of robotic system design.

To be successful, you will have:

Bachelors degree in a technical field (Computer Science, Software Engineering or equivalent preferred); MBA preferred.
7+ years of professional experience in similar role, with 3+ years of digital product management, or 5+ years of software engineering management/leadership with a passion for consumer centricity and strategic thinking.
Technical aptitude to understand digital concepts, engage in detailed technical discussions, manage trade-offs, and evaluate new ideas.
Experience working in a dual-track agile environment.
Exceptional critical thinking and analytical skills, with the ability to make expeditious, informed decisions related to product and platforming that align to the digital roadmap and strategy.
Strong problem solving, negotiating, influencing, and conflict resolution skills
Passion for creating innovative solutions for consumers
Bias towards action; Results oriented, high energy, and self-motivated.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences.
Excellent teamwork skills and collaboration skills.

In return, you can expect:

The support and collaboration of other peers
State of the art technology and tools to implement
The visibility and support of Leadership to drive your ideas and plan

title: Presales Bus Dev Manager - Mobility
job_description:
About SHI

Innovative Solutions. World Class Support.

Constantly growing in response to the needs of our customers in all sectors and verticals, SHI has transformed itself from a $1 million "software-only" regional reseller into a $11 billion global provider of information technology products and services.

From software and hardware procurement to deployment planning, configuration, data center optimization, IT asset management and cloud computing, SHI offers custom IT solutions for every aspect of your environment.

Privately-held and under the guidance of our current ownership since 1989, SHI has experienced tremendous growth in size and scope through neither merger nor acquisition. Our organic growth and two decades of stability are a direct result of backing a highly-skilled and tenured sales force with software volume licensing experts, hardware procurement specialists and certified IT services professionals.

Headquartered in Somerset, NJ, SHI supports their clients from over 30 offices throughout the U.S., Canada, the U.K., Germany, France and Hong Kong. SHI’s goal is to foster long-term, mutually-beneficial relationships with its customers and partners, every day.

What SHI Can Offer:

World Class Facility includes on site gyms, restaurants and community events
Ongoing opportunities for personal and professional growth and development due to our strong promote from within philosophy
Work in an up-beat, creative, and fun environment
Benefits, include medical, vision, dental, 401K, and flexible spending

Job SummaryThe role of Mobility Business Development Manager will be primarily focused on developing overall growth of all mobility product lines and business units within SHI International Corp. It will be the responsibility of this individual to create programs, spiff incentives, campaigns, training and account mapping sessions between sales teams to facilitate the growth of all mobility lines of business. The Mobility BDM will also be working in tandem with SHI’s marketing teams to develop successful mobility focused customer-facing events to help drive brand awareness and increase overall sales. This BDM will work across all divisions of sales at SHI and will be based out of the NJ HQ office.Responsibilities• Developing quarterly marketing plans and work with SHI’s Mobility Team to execute and manage Marketing Funds in order to increase overall sales• Proactively work to foster relationships between SHI and Mobility focused sales opportunities • Work with sales management to build awareness of campaigns and programs• Develop and deliver training material (in-person, web, and working with SHI’s training team)• Reviewing report data to determine weak territories and build strategic plans to achieve quarterly sales goals• Assist SHI Mobility team on customer calls and presentations• Manage lead programs, demo programs, and internal demo pool• Work with marketing and communications team to build SHI Mobility collateral and sales tools for SHI’s sales force that will allow the sales teams to properly position mobility products to their customer base and target accounts• Keep sales reps and customers aware of relevant product releases, constraints, etc.• Building relationships with third-party partners and other SHI product specialists that compliment mobility solutions• Manage regular pipeline/forecast of all large mobility opportunities across product lines and business units• Travel to customer appointments and roadshows will be required

Qualifications• Minimum of 2 years Sales (Inside/Outside) or partner/vendor sales support or 1 year within a Presales Specialist position • Minimum of 1 year experience with modern devices (Apple, Microsoft, Samsung, Google)• Bachelor's degree• Experience selling or supporting mobility via the channel or direct

Required Skills• Exemplary knowledge of mobility programs and product portfolios• Proactive, positive attitude; self-motivated sales-mentality• Exceptional communication, presentation and influence sills – both written and verbal• Excellent time management and organizational skills• Proficiency in MS office tools – Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint• Ability to work well both independently and in a team environmentPreferred Skills

Competency in core components of endpoint management systems in mixed platform environments consisting of iOS, MacOS, Android and Windows 10.

Equal Employment Opportunity – M/F/Disability/Protected Veteran Status

title: Product Manager, US Patient Marketing Hematology
job_description:
Apellis is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company focused on the development of novel therapeutic compounds to treat disease through the inhibition of the complement system, which is an integral component of the immune system, at the level of C3, the central protein in the complement cascade.

We believe that our lead product candidate, APL-2, has the potential to be a first-in-class treatment targeting C3 that may address the limitations of existing treatment options or provide a treatment option where there currently is none. APL-2 has already shown activity that we believe is clinically meaningful in clinical trials for two distinct medical conditions—geographic atrophy in age-related macular degeneration (GA) and paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH). We plan to conduct additional clinical trials in GA, PNH, autoimmune hemolytic anemia (AIHA) and complement-dependent nephropathies.
Position: Product Manager, US Patient Marketing – Hematology

Reports to: Director, US Brand Lead PNH

Location: Waltham, MA

Position Summary:

Apellis is seeking a passionate and talented marketer for the role of Product Manager, US Patient Marketing - Hematology. It is an outstanding opportunity to make a significant impact for Patients and the company, executing the US Patient marketing initiatives for the first commercial launch for Apellis.

The US Patient Marketing Product Manager will be responsible for executing the Patient strategy in the US, pulling through the Global campaign and regionalizing the creative and messaging for Patients. This role requires cross functional leadership across multiple internal functional areas to develop and execute the operational plan and tactics. This role will report to the Director, US Brand Lead - PNH.

Key Responsibilities Include:

Advocating for US patient and caregiver needs to be integrated into global product strategiesExecuting the vision and plan for Patient marketing in the US for both market shaping and the launch of APL-2 in PNH. Manage agencies in the execution of that planLeading aspects of multi-channel marketing execution in both market shaping and branded launchDeveloping execution strategy for Patient-facing initiatives in partnership with sales training and sales leadershipDeveloping a multi-channel/digital strategy and measurement planEfficiently and thoughtfully administering the Patient marketing budgetWorking closely with regulatory, legal, and compliance to build policies and procedures related to Patient marketing

Education, Registration & Certification:

Bachelor's degree requiredMBA or other advanced degree is a plus

Experience:

3+ years of biotech/pharma experience, predominantly in marketing roles of increasing scope and responsibilityExperience in US launches and rare diseases is preferredExperience in sales or customer-facing roles is a plus

Skills, Knowledge & Abilities:

Passion for understanding and championing the needs of people treating rare diseases, translating them into market-moving insightsExperience translating global brand strategy into affiliate marketing execution, with depth in both personal and multi-channel marketingAbility to navigate and be successful in a fast-paced, results-driven environment, managing through ambiguityCommitment to collaboration and engagement, with a history of success leading in a matrix environment and with agency partnersAn entrepreneurial spirit coupled with the drive to embrace innovation and develop creative but well-reasoned solutions to business challengesMotivation to be a part of envisioning and building the infrastructure, systems, and tactics to ensure launch successDemonstrated integrity on the job, including an understanding of relevant rules and regulationsStrong communication skills with the ability to influence across functions and varying levels of the organization Willing to travel domestically up to 30% of the time and attend events outside of business hours (e.g., occasional weekends and evenings)

Benefits And Perks

Apellis offers a great benefit package which includes: health insurance with full premium coverage, 401K with company match, paid time off (PTO), long- term disability insurance, life insurance and more! Visit http://apellis.com/careerbenefits.html to learn more.

title: Technical Product Manager
job_description:
Join a fast growing company that is transforming its industry! Financial Recovery Technologies has become a trusted partner to hedge funds, mutual funds, custodians, sovereign wealth funds, and other institutional investment firms, and our best-in-class people and technology have made FRT a market leader. As a Technical Product Manager, you will own our proprietary securities litigation monitoring and processing platform.

The Role: As a Technical Product Manager at FRT, you will:

Own our proprietary securities litigation monitoring and processing platform

Feel a sense of personal accountability for the availability, accessibility, and functionality of the platformServe as a thought leader and subject matter expert for the platform – think big, set direction and priorities, drive definitions, deliver results, grow customer adoption, and ensure we exceed clients’ expectationsSet the direction for the future of the platform and determine how best to evolve it to automate processes that support FRT's Operations and Client Service teams;


Evangelize projects to end users and to our internal engineering team

Market the platform to internal users and ensure stakeholders understand its features and its value propositionMaintain product vision and roadmap, keeping stakeholders up to date on high level goals and timelinesDrive business process reengineering by working with users to drive how they do their job – identifying pain points, developing solutions, pushing adoption of new features and use cases, and continually expanding our offeringWith end users, identify process improvements that could be made through automation or process redesign


Bridge the gap between Operations, Client Service, and Engineering

Work with stakeholders and partners to understand client pain points, internal business drivers, and technical gaps to develop a platform that enhances our ability to exceed clients’ expectationsBased on market requirements and consistent with business objectives, prioritize features, weighing business value and impact against risks and development costsShape high level concepts in order to understand size and scope of projects, ensuring scope aligns with long-term product plans and solutions are purpose-built and properly designed

Our ideal candidate is:

An experienced business analyst or product owner who is comfortable owning responsibility for products or product modules in a SaaS company (a background in financial services would be a plus!);Experienced in UI design, having worked with designers to build applications that drive delivery workflows and allow users to prioritize tasksComfortable engaging with clients to understand their current business processes, innovate solutions, and create efficiencies;Able to interact cross-functionally and across organizational levels – you are as comfortable with executives as you are with end users (and their internal representatives);Familiar with our tools: We are data-heavy (Oracle, SQL) and work in an agile environment, using Atlassian tools, so comfort with SQL and JIRA would shorten the learning curve, and familiarity with MongoDB and Postgres would be a plus;Self-directed and detail oriented, a “deep digger” with strong analytical, problem solving, and creative thinking skills;Highly collaborative, prioritizing collaboration over credit, and interested in building strong relationships with peers across corporate functions;A planner, identifying and analyzing problems, proposing solutions, and anticipating future problem areas before initiating action;Intellectually curious, with a demonstrated commitment to continuous growth; andOf course, looking to join a growing company with a vibrant, entrepreneurial culture, dedicated to being the top provider in the class action recovery space.

What does FRT offer:

Fun and diverse colleaguesFree drinks and snacks and free access to onsite gymHealth, dental, vision401k (with company match)Income protection plans (life, AD&D, short- and long-term disability) and access to a suite of voluntary benefit programsClose to public transit (walking distance to Wellington T on Orange Line)Free parking onsite
