title: Product Marketing Manager
job_description:
What We’re Looking For:

Product marketing is one of the most important positions in any software company, and we’re on the lookout for someone to step up to the task. NetMotion is a mobile technology company that builds products that its 3500+ genuinely love (no, really … our NPS is 91 and our renewal rate is 97%!)

We’re doing some special stuff, releasing features that no one else in the market comes close to competing with. While it’s great to be so differentiated, the challenge is that we don’t neatly fit into any category and so explaining the value of our solution in a simple way is critical. We want to hear from people that love working with innovative technologies and can eloquently articulate detailed or complex ideas.

If you end up joining the team, you’ll be working alongside a well-resourced team of marketers and reporting directly to the CMO. NetMotion is a rare breed of company in that its well established with a legacy of almost two decades, but is also experiencing rapid growth and operates just like a startup might – meaning lots of autonomy and a real opportunity to thrive.

If this sounds like the kind of workplace environment you’d excel in, then we’d love to hear from you.

Key responsibilities

Captain the efforts behind our product launches. Carefully craft messaging and plan activities that gets the world excited about the features that the engineering team has worked hard to build.Leading our sales enablement programs. This means you’ll develop messaging and copy to support defined product value propositions in target markets, use cases, features, advantages and benefits in a form that can be repurposed for all marketing collateral and web contentBuild relationships with our technology partners, and devise, produce and deliver marketing initiatives that help to drive business.Gain a deep understanding of customers’ requirements, use cases and key purchase drivers by way of customer and partner visits and other relevant research initiatives.Actively research, experience and solicit feedback about similar products in our market, competitor’s business models, pricing and go-to-market strategies.Articulate product value propositions and key differentiators internally.Assemble research data in a format that is relevant to and can be consumed by product management, marketing and sales teams.Based on market and competitive intelligence provide input into product strategy, road map and product feature set.Promote and evangelize products externally with press, analysts, customers and partners and at conference and other events.

Your Skills:

We’re not looking for advanced security or IT-centric knowledge, but you should be able to hold your own in a technical conversation and have the ability to pick up complicated concepts quickly. Experience in relevant sectors is an advantage.There’s a lot more to this role than writing, but if you’re able to put together a smart, succinct bit of copy and tell stories that keep people captivated then you’ll enjoy a great deal of success in this role.We love people that can carefully manage several internal stakeholders – it can sometimes be tricky for product marketers to avoid being trampled over or, conversely, coming across as overly controlling. You’ll be operating at the intersection of marketing, product and sales, meaning interaction with senior leaders in all three departments. Being able to balance assertiveness and responsiveness is therefore a highly desirable skill for any candidate to have.Experience in a startup or technology environment is important, especially in the B2B market.There are no minimum requirements around qualifications (we’re more open minded than that) but naturally we’re also impressed by people that have excelled academically.

Who We Are:

For almost 20 years, we’ve worked with a simple philosophy: help the connected world move more smoothly, seamlessly and productively. NetMotion is a Mobile Performance and Operational Intelligence software company that gives organizations with mobile workforces the connectivity, visibility and control needed to solve the common challenges of the mobile workforce.

If you join our team you will be working with talented colleagues who have a passion for industry leading technology. At NetMotion, we want people to enjoy the work that they do so we provide our team members with the tools and support they need to be successful. In addition, we have a collaborative and unpretentious environment where creativity is valued.

Why You’ll Love It Here:

Health and life benefits, along with a competitive 401k plan and a company match9 company paid holidays, 15 paid vacation days, 10 paid sick days, and 2 floating holidaysCommuting and fitness benefitsMonthly morale events and random treat days!

NetMotion is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race; color; national origin; ancestry; religion; creed; gender; gender identity or expression; sexual orientation; marital status; economic status; the presence of any sensory, mental, or physical disability; age; veteran status; or the use of a service animal.

title: Program Manager - Test, Training & Evaluation
job_description:
Are you a problem solver?

Do you strive to make a positive difference?

Do you enjoy being a contributor to a world class team?

Summit Technical Solutions (STS) is seeking an experienced Program Manager be responsible for the performance of engineering, administrative and technical services supporting a Major Range and Test Facility Base. This includes explosive and non-explosive open air and indoor test, evaluation and experimentation. This may include tasks in records management, human resources, or other administrative focus in accordance with contract requirements and company policies, procedures and guidelines. Ensures work procedures and standards improve efficiency and effectiveness of operation. Monitor daily operations and has budgetary responsibilities, and responsible for acquiring follow-on business associated with assigned programs and for supporting new business development by managing or leading proposals. Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Supervises exempt personnel, and may supervisor non-exempt personnel. Provides direction, coaching and disciplinary actions when required. The work location for this position is Dahlgren, VA.

Job duties include, but are not limited to:


Hands-on leadership and management of a TT&E program including program planning, execution, risk management, risk mitigation, issues identification and resolution, task breakdown, scheduling and resource allocation .
Coordinates reports and financial data with the Program Management Office (PMO) and creates Business Unit strategies for risk mitigation and contingency planning.
Ensures contract compliance on all business and operational levels.
Collaborates with other managers and professionals throughout the organization to effectively identify and resolve technical issues and take ownership for driving these issues to closure.
Communicates within all organization levels in order to define project requirements and proactively manage a complete project life cycle.
Assesses variances from the plan then develop and implement changes as necessary to ensure project meets time, cost, and quality objectives. Responsible for the cost, schedule, and technical performance of program.
Participates in the negotiation of contract and contract changes as needed.
Participate in both formal and informal In Progress Reviews (IPRs) of work being performed
Participate in periodic Task Prioritization Meetings with the COR and project/work area/TI leads/points-of-contact
Coordinates the preparation of operating budgets and financial terms/conditions of contracts.

**This opportunity is contingent on contract award to STS.**Required Skills



Understanding and Experience related to weapon system components, systems and subsystems
Written/Oral Communications Skills
Interpersonal Communication
Budget/Business/Risk Analysis Skills
Concept Design and Engineering
Organization and Planning Skills
Reading Skills
Time Management Skills
Customer Relations/Service Skills
Planning/Organization/Development Skills.

Qualified candidates will have the following experience and qualifications:


Current Secret clearance is required
Bachelor's degree is required; Master’s degree is preferred
PMP or DAU Level III certification is required
10+ years professional technical experience that reflects:



8+ years experience in the development and evaluation/testing of major weapon systems
6+ years demonstrated Program Management experience in managing complex requirements, including subcontractors
Quality Assurance Experience (i.e ISO 9000 programs; life cycle planning and costing experience)
5+ years of progressive management experience


Direct experience with US Navy/Marine Corps is preferred
Specialized Certifications derived from NAVSEA, NOSSA Instruction 8020.15, NSWCDD Instruction, NAVFAC P-307 or P-80, or similar documents is preferred


Required ExperienceWhat makes STS great?

STS is a services-based organization that relies on the exceptional results our workforce delivers to customers every day. We realize that our customers’ high regard for our consistently high performance is only possible because of the talents, exceptional work ethic, and commitment of our people. We promote and live by a strong and inclusive company culture that places the focus on customer and employee satisfaction, communication, and respect.

What to expect from STS:

Competitive total compensation plan, with immediate eligibility for most benefits and a 401(k) plan with matching contributions!
A work environment that emphasizes the safety of our workforce
An organization that is committed to upholding the highest level of business ethics and workplace conduct
A company that supports "paying it forward" with involvement in several deserving organizations and encourages volunteerism in the employee's community
Generous paid time-off program that starts on the first day of employment!
Tuition and certification cost reimbursement programs for qualifying employees

STS is actively committed to employment of Veterans, whom we regard as one of our Nation’s greatest resources. Today, you will find Veterans at every level of our organization, continuing their service to our country by supporting our government contracts and customers. STS is proud of their dedication, work ethic, loyalty, and commitment to duty, and we will continue to promote career opportunities for Veterans who are sincerely deserving of our appreciation.

We are an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law.Job Location

Dahlgren, US-VA

title: Product Manager
job_description:
What You’ll Do
Are you passionate about building life changing products? Do you think like a CEO? Do you always put the customer first and work with teams to deliver delightful experiences? Do you have excellent organizational skills and a high attention to detail? Then come join our Rock Star Product Management team at ConsumerAffairs.

We're looking for a Product Manager who will participate in opportunity assessment, requirements gathering, UX architecture planning, system process documentation, UAT and management of the ConsumerAffairs platform. Someone who's excited about the Agile development philosophy and is no stranger to the accountability and responsibility that comes with it. You will work closely with the ConsumerAffairs team (including business analysts, UI/UX designers and engineers) to build clarity on product vision and to implement that vision with a high velocity and quality. Additionally, you will interact directly with clients and our internal teams to understand and develop strategies to implement solutions for client needs.

The Product Manager has responsibility for driving continuous product improvement. This individual is charged with guiding product enhancements from conception to release.

Own and drive the product roadmap in conjunction with the team
Contribute to establish and manage the Product Management process
Communicate and prioritize potential product enhancements
Act as central arbiter for requests from internal and external clients
Direct cross-functional efforts to constantly increase revenue, efficiency and client satisfaction
Build strong partnership with engineering and client-facing teams
BE AWESOME in your work ethic and to work with

Who Are You
You are the type of person that leads people into battle. You are unfamiliar with the word impossible. You lose gracefully and winning is second nature. When you see a problem, you don’t run away from it. You embrace the challenge. You are entrepreneurial and refuse to quit. Fairly technical and a business savvy problem solver. Someone who doesn’t just like identifying problems, but likes fixing them. The idea of identifying a problem and handing it off to someone else to fix makes your head hurt. You own it and see things to a logical end. You are someone everyone around you loves to work with.

Qualifications include:
Successful track record of developing and delivering a product roadmap for early stage and mid-life growth companies
Deep technical understanding and knowledge of product development best practices but not shy to go above and beyond to achieve goals
Strong ability to communicate product features, including writing detailed User Stories, PRDs, & MRDs
Strong understanding of market trends and opportunities
Experience in delivering game-changing product enhancements
Demonstrated success managing teams and implementing Product Management process in a fast-paced environment.

If all above sounds good to you then come AMAZE us and let us show you why we are the BEST team to work with. Let us come together to enable smarter buying decisions.
You have no problem living out our core values:
Amazing Judgment
Clear Communications
Impactful
Curiously Innovative
Passionately Courageous
Selfless Honesty 

About Us
ConsumerAffairs is a rapidly growing SaaS business. Companies (Brands) utilize our SaaS product to proactively connect with their customers, collect reviews, solve customer issues, generate sales and shape their online reputation.

Over 8 million consumers visit ConsumerAffairs.com each month to research products and services, connect with brands, write reviews and read news.

ConsumerAffairs is a fun, creative and fast-paced entrepreneurial environment. Our team is energetic, passionate and, dare we say, brilliant. We are looking for like-minded individuals that are highly self-motivated, imaginative and excited about building something together.

title: Product Manager (Contract)
job_description:
We are an ambitious, well-funded startup with plans to change a $1 trillion-dollar global industry. This is no ordinary startup. We have a proven management team that has done it before, done it before together, and done it before in the travel industry. The company is overflowing with fiercely intelligent people who have tons of energy and an upbeat view of the future. We all act like owners and we get a huge kick out doing great work and doing it fast. We like it even more when we come up with a fresh way to solve a problem. Above all, we are devoted to solving customer problems, because that’s at the center of everything we do.ABOUT YOU


You have 3-5 years of experience managing projects for product and technology teams You have a Bachelor’s degree or related work experience.You have experience managing consumer facing products and the platforms behind themYou propose solutions to concerns you raise and can easily envision the path forward.You are customer-focused with sound judgment based on metrics-driven decisions.You enjoy being the go-to resource for answering questions about your product and processes from other teams within the company.You consider yourself a utility player and are eager to learnYou voraciously consume feedback from stakeholders and distill into action items.You have used JIRA or similar project management tool.You’re looking to get in on the ground floor of a well-funded startup with a proven leadership team.


ABOUT THE GIG


Lead agile product management for one or more agile scrum teams. Define objectives and requirements for engineering team delivery.Collaborate with scrum team and provide support for development initiatives.Continuously monitor customer behavior and create strategies for optimizing the customer experience.Plan sprints that drive features that make our products better every day.Plan for our rapid growth and work with product team peers to define epic backlogs to support that growthThis is a contract role


ABOUT OUR TECH STACKWe’re beyond passionate about using cutting-edge technologies. We've implemented a microservices cloud (AWS) based tech stack that allows for rapid iteration and scaling. We use React and Material UI on the frontend, mostly Node.js with Typescript on the backend, Go for anything performance heavy, MySQL as our main datastore and NoSQL products for certain domain-specific datastores.
While we have preferences as an organization for certain technologies, our microservices-based architecture allows us to experiment with new tech and always pick the right tools for the job if it is called for. Our devops setup allows us to quickly stand up / burn down services, frontends and datastores as business needs change. In short the theme of our tech stack is flexibility. We can quickly stand up things, change them, and scale them up or down as our requirements change.
ABOUT USWe are positive, passionate, playful and always pushing to be better. Our team is a hodgepodge of challenge seekers, travel gurus, startup junkies and data-miners who see the big picture.
YOU WANT TO TALK TO US IF…You are motivated by disrupting the norm.You have a great sense of humor and take your profession seriously, but not yourself.Your entrepreneurial spirit drives your bias for action.You are all about constructive feedback- you can dish it out and you can take it.You thrive in the frenetic energy of a startup.
Upside Travel is an equal opportunity employer and encourages people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply. We are committed to being an inclusive place to work, while maintaining a workforce that represents the communities we serve.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
About Netskope

Today, there's more data and users outside the enterprise than inside, causing the network perimeter as we know it to dissolve. We realized a new perimeter was needed, one that is built in the cloud and follows and protects data wherever it goes, so we started Netskope to redefine Cloud, Network and Data Security.

Since 2012, we have built the market-leading cloud security company and an award-winning culture powered by hundreds of employees spread across offices in Santa Clara, San Francisco, Seattle, Bangalore, London, Melbourne, and Tokyo. Our core values are openness, honesty, and transparency, and we purposely developed our open desk layouts and large meeting spaces to support and promote partnerships, collaboration, and teamwork. From catered lunches and office celebrations to employee recognition events and social professional groups such as the Awesome Women of Netskope (AWON), we strive to keep work fun, supportive and interactive.Visit us at Netskope Careers and follow us on Twitter @Netskope and Facebook.

Netskope Core Platform Product Manager

To be successful as a Platform Product Manager you must possess a combination of strong business acumen and technical skills as well as have a passion for data, and for cloud architectures, and deep understanding of the enterprise security and compliance market. You must be able to understand and articulate how to meet customer business requirements and/or to align to relevant market trends. You must be comfortable with frequent interactions with customers and prospects presenting and explaining our solutions while fully understanding their business needs, and how to map these into well defined product enhancements/behaviors. You must be comfortable in defining and communicating key success metrics for your product(s) and focusing your product planning towards achieving these. You need to be able to analyze large amounts of data, from a multitude of data sources, to ensure you are progressing towards meeting set targets, and if not, adjust accordingly. You have a successful track-record, in a large-scale Cloud/Saas company, working closely with Engineering, Sales and Marketing and clearly communicatinge business goals in technical terms. Previous experience as Platform Product Manager is highly desirable.

Responsibilities:

Develop and own a product vision, strategy and roadmap for Netskope Core Platform Services.
Mature deep understanding for the needs of internal and external consumers for these services. Articulate, in details, how these map to product requirements, for proper prioritization and analyze and communicate the value and trade-offs of the product decisions made.
Set quantitative business/technical metrics and success criteria for your product, and track how executing against set roadmap progress towards achieving these.
Develop deep and trusted relationships with key internal consumers and external customers, partners, and other key stakeholders,
Champion the strategy - Work with Go-to-Market teams, Product Marketing, Sales, Services, and Enablement teams to build a program that establishes thought leadership in the market.
Drive product lifecycle - Collaborate with Engineering, User Experience, Documentation, Infrastructure, and Go-to-Market teams to drive the product lifecycle from concept to customer success; Define the backlog for engineering teams, write the user stories, and do whatever it takes to fuel the productivity and effectiveness of the engineering teams.
Think Strategically - Knows what it takes to give Platform and Product the competitive advantage; Operate both strategically and tactically in a dynamic environment; Develops relevant, sustainable solutions; Align the right resources to the task at hand and foresees and plans around obstacles.
Own the product vision for your area; Ensure that it aligns with the overall product and company vision, as well as be an expert on the domain, market, and trends; Ability to evangelize that vision constantly so that all stakeholders are aligned, have context and understand where we are going.
Make Smart Decisions - Analyze and synthesize broad, cross-business or cross-discipline information that leads to breakthroughs or significant insight.
Drive Results - Attack everything with drive and energy with an eye on both the bottom line and customer success.
Growing Team - Coach and grow the product management teams for the next phase of growth for the business.

Required Skills/Experience:

5+ years of product management experience in a Cloud/Saas company.
Relevant experience as a Platform PM, and in the security markets are highly desirable.
Proven ability to excite and lead a successful cross-functional team, and a data-driven and outcome orientation.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including experience in high-level business discussions and low-level technical discussions.
Be comfortable delivering a compelling product demonstration, including the ability to tell a story and communicate business value in addition to product features and benefits.
Solid visual communication skills including the ability to create and deliver a great slide presentation.
Experience representing the customer; Experience being the champion and voice of customers by building impactful, personal relationships with customers, engineering teams, and the field, in addition to bringing the customer's voice into the creation process.
Expertise in leading and collaborating across teams. We win or lose as a team as product managers play a critical role in creating alignment between engineering teams and stakeholders.

Education: 

Bachelor's degree (technical disciplines preferred)

title: General Manager
job_description:
POSITION SUMMARY
This position directs overall store management. Responsible for inventory and money control systems. Directs staff to ensure that food safety, product preparation, and cleanliness standards are maintained. Maintains standards of restaurant safety and security at all times. Recruits staff and oversees the training of Sandwich Artists. Exceptional customer service is a major component of this position.
The Manager-In-Training process must be successfully completed prior to a permanent Manager title. In order to successfully complete this training, the MIT must complete 5 weeks of training, successfully pass each MIT weekly test including the certification test, and successfully pass the ServSafe course and exam.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Performs all tasks and responsibilities of a Sandwich Artist and Assistant Manager as outlined in their respective job descriptions.
Provides leadership to staff of assigned stores to ensure compliance with standards as set in the Operations Manual, Policy and Procedure book, and applicable government regulations.
Maintains in store paperwork as outlined in the Operations Manual and Policy and Procedure book.
Communicates all necessary information to staff to include but not limited to changes of food preparations, formulas, standards, etc.
Ensures that all local and national health and food safety codes are maintained and company safety and security policies are followed.

Ensures that store health and safety inspections are passed on a consistent basis.

Recruits, rewards, demote, promote, and terminate staff when necessary.
Identifies and contacts prospective customers to promote sales.
Performs all Manager duties and responsibilities as outlined in the Policy and Procedure book.
Performs bank deposits Monday thru Friday or as otherwise directed.
Contacts the store one-half hour before the store is due to open during the weekend days that management personnel are not scheduled.

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES

High school graduate or equivalent (GED) required.
Ability to understand and implement written and verbal instructions.
Must be able to operate a computerize Point of Sales system/cash register.
Minimum of two (2) years in a QSR operation, preferably with supervisory and training experience.
Must have excellent communication skills.
Ability to deal with all levels of employees and all situations with customers.
Computer knowledge.
Maintain a valid driver’s license and vehicle with insurance.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
A Product Manager at Klaviyo is passionate about identifying, spec'ing and shipping solutions to solve customer problems.

Our customers are businesses that want to grow. They know there is power in using their data to communicate with their customers in more relevant and targeted ways, but the existing platforms in the market have always been too hard to use or too expensive to take advantage of. Klaviyo customers are passionate, hard-working, ambitious and have incredibly high standards. They expect to deliver the best experiences for their customers and expect us to deliver the best experiences for them, too. We are looking to add people to our team who can help build a world-class product that will continue to delight our customers and exceed their expectations of what's possible.

Your First 90 Days
In your first 30 days, you will get acclimated to Klaviyo and our product: • Take a course on our product and ace the test at the end

 • Spend 80% of your time working with support

 • Answer >20 support tickets

 • Talk to >10 customers on the phone and/or in person

 • Connect with every internal team and learn what will help them succeed

 • Learn the basic architectural overview of the product
In your first 60 days, you will become a valuable member of the product and engineering organization: • Spend 60% of your time with support

 • Become a go-to expert on how the product should behave

 • Take ownership of 1 key area that you will improve

 • Complete a product enhancement from spec to successful completion during a sprint
In your first 90 days, you will push the ball forward: • Spend 30% of your time with support

 • Become the owner of a functional area of the product

 • Plan out a key product improvement (identify problem, define key metrics, brainstorm ideas, test hypotheses, write spec)

Team Openings
We're always looking for all types of dynamic and analytical Product Managers, but here are the specific teams we're looking to hire for now: • Marketing Automation

 • Email Templates

 • Profiles / CRM

 • Data Science (x3)


How you will make a difference:




Spec - PMs at Klaviyo go deep. They love to define every use case a customer would consider, document potential ways to solve, identify outstanding concerns, flag edge cases, and leave no stone unturned. They sweat the details and are passionate about making sure that every experience that could come from a feature is understood, anticipated, and handled elegantly.
Work with Customers - PMs at Klaviyo spend at least 15% of their time working closely with customers. We do deep dives with customers to work on actual marketing strategy and implementation; this helps us intimately understand what our customers are trying to accomplish and what stands in their way. You should feel excited about the chance to not only meet customers, but to spend time doing their job for them to truly experience their world.
Set and Manage Roadmap - PMs at Klaviyo understand the business and prioritize the most valuable efforts. Each PM takes ownership of a product area with their cross-functional team, and is responsible for helping set the priority order of what the team delivers on to advance our mission and maintain product quality. They communicate their roadmaps proactively, including when things change and why.
Write and Share - PMs at Klaviyo write and share early and often. We write ideas. We write use cases. We write requirements. We write release plans. Someone who joins Klaviyo must love to write and must be exceptional at articulating their thinking through written word. You should enjoy expressing your thinking on paper and reviewing your ideas with people around the company each week.
Wireframe - PMs at Klaviyo love to draw. If a picture is worth a thousand words, a wireframe is worth a million. PMs are quick to get on a whiteboard and explain their thinking, and even faster to document that thinking into expected use cases, behaviors and edge cases (see "Spec" above). You should love drawing pictures, getting feedback, and iterating on them.
Learn - PMs at Klaviyo are voracious learners. We are constantly passing book or article recommendations to each other, sharing interesting insights, and digging into unknown problems. A lack of experience/knowledge around a challenge is exciting because it means once we solve it, we are guaranteed to learn something new. You should love learning and tackling new challenges.
Think Critically - PMs at Klaviyo are sharp. We think deeply, quickly, and analytically. The rigor of thought is extreme here so we can ensure we're making the best decision possible at all times. You should love to tease out problems, break them down to small, digestible pieces, and put them back together elegantly.
Ship - PMs at Klaviyo get value into customer hands. At the end of the day, we are only as good as how our customers see us; we must deliver improved solutions and experiences every single day. PMs build close relationships with their cross-functional teams to efficiently spec, build, and release high quality product at a fast cadence. You should be energized by solving tough problems, but nothing should compare to the feeling of releasing value to customers and watching your success metrics move.





Who You Are:




2+ years of PM experience.
Want to learn and master new things.
Passionate about Product Management as a career.
Love wire-framing and sharing your ideas.
Hands on and not just "part of determining strategy".
Have opinions about products and features you love or really don't love.
Get excited about having big ideas, and even more excited about executing on them.




Get to know Klaviyo

Klaviyo is the world's leading owned marketing platform known for accelerating revenue for online businesses using the channels they own like email, web, and mobile. Enabling companies to leverage these owned marketing channels, Klaviyo makes it easy to store, access, analyze and use transactional and behavioral data to power highly-targeted customer and prospect communications. And unlike other marketing platforms, Klaviyo doesn't force companies to compromise between advanced functionality or ease of use - so companies of all sizes are able to maximize their sales quickly. That's why over 28,000+ innovative companies like Unilever, Custom Ink and Eventbrite sell more with Klaviyo.

title: Sr. Technical Program Manager
job_description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the leading cloud provider, providing virtualized infrastructure, storage, networking, messaging, and many other services to customers all over the world. Our services scale to staggering levels, are highly distributed, and are really fun to work with. The AWS Restricted Access Regions (RAR) team works to deliver the security, speed, and value of the cloud to global customers who have unique access control, security, and compliance requirements.AWSs rapid worldwide expansion creates new challenges in data protection, availability, and growth. As a TPM on the RAR team you will lead projects and programs to build a consistently excellent AWS experience for customers around the world.You will be as needed both broad and deep. You will work with business and product teams to define the right customer experience and engage engineering teams across AWS to deliver it.You will drive process and technology improvements that reduce friction for engineers and proactively address issues that help to scale AWS solutions to meet a range of customer needs around the world.To succeed you need to be motivated by putting your customers first; you understand what the customers need and you dont rest until we deliver it. You are detail-driven, with a strong technical background and excellent problem-solving skills. You learn from your mistakes, and you love working with really smart people. You have a solid understanding of project management fundamentals (e.g. business case, RTG, risk management, schedule management, and negotiation). You are comfortable briefing senior leadership, even when you have bad news; you can communicate effectively with business and technical teams both verbally and in writing.This position requires that the candidate selected be a U.S. citizen.Have Questions, Wish to apply, have someone to refer?contact Kevin Healy directly healkevi@amazon.comBasic Qualifications· 5+ years of experience in technical program management, or similar technical leadership role· 5+ years of experience with software development lifecycle from conception to delivery· 5+ years of experience with data management and data analytics tools and systems, such as limited to SQL, Quicksight, Redshift, Python or other scripting languagesPreferred Qualifications· Proven experience in managing large scale enterprise projects, gathering and communicating technical requirements· Experience solving challenging engineering problems with multiple constraints· Experience with identity management, billing and payments processes and automation· Demonstrated deep knowledge of technical program management and engineering best practices· Experience driving overall strategy and teams across organizations· Experience in service-oriented and web-service technologies· Experience with cross-organizational communication to both technical- and non-technical audiences from engineers to VPs· Experience working independently to design, plan, and execute technical projects; able to distill data and articulate rationale for making difficult trade-offs and prioritizationsAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

title: Supply Chain Program Manager
job_description:
Position:Supply Chain Program ManagerJob Description:Job Description:

At Arrow, we pride ourselves in helping our customers simplify the complex. The global economy is constantly evolving and so are we. To lead that evolution, we seek to hire, maintain and promote highly skilled people who relish facing the challenges that tomorrow brings. One skill we currently seek is an exceptionally talented Supply Chain Program Manager for our Global Transportation and Trade Compliance Operations department. Our ideal candidate has experience managing global logistics and trade compliance operations projects, with a focus on using data analysis to drive continuous process improvement.

What Youll Be Doing

Leads project teams by influence, planning and driving projects that will improve the efficiency and quality of transportation and trade compliance processes. Manage projects from requirements definition through deployment, including developing, defining, prioritizing, and executing project plans, schedules, tasks, issues, budgets and deliverables.Review and analyze complex, integrated project data and information to provide status updates, insights, conclusions, and actionable recommendations. Help identify project risks and clearly communicate them with internal and external project stakeholders. Work with project team to determine which deliverables are critical to the success of the project and prioritize accordingly.Schedule and lead team meetings, draft agendas, and capture and distribute meeting minutes. Write reports and give presentations to advise management of project status, critical constraints, assumptions, risk tradeoffs and progress. Assist the project team in the completion of deliverables.

What We Are Looking For

8+ years of project management experience in global transportation and trade compliance.Experience coordinating and influencing cross-functional teams to ensure timely completion of tasks and deliverables that adhere to strict budgets and schedules.Expertise with planning and managing resource requirements, budgets, and employee utilization.Experience leveraging enterprise software tools such as Windchill, Planview PPM Pro, and/or MS Project, to develop and maintain detailed objectives surrounding cost, schedule, and specifications.An affinity for data and the role it plays in improving efficiencies and delivering results.

Desired Skills & Experience

Bachelors Degree and applicable experience. MBA preferred.Project management experience in global logistics.Compelling written and verbal skills, with an innate ability to clearly communicate to team members, clients, vendors, and senior management regarding technical details and projects status with charisma and accuracy. Masterful organizational, multi-tasking, and team building skills.

What's in It for You?

At Arrow, we recognize that financial rewards and great benefits are important aspects of an ideal job. Thats why we offer competitive financial compensation, including various compensation plans, and a solid benefits package.

Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance401k, With Matching ContributionsPaid Time OffHealth Savings Account (HSA)/Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) OptionsGrowth OpportunitiesShort-Term/Long-Term Disability InsuranceOnsite GymOnsite Cafeteria/LoungeAnd more!

Arrow is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status. (Arrow EEO/AAP policy)

title: QC Lab Manager
job_description:
KC Pharmaceuticals is a Prime Manufacturer of Private Label and Contract Manufacturing Over-The-Counter (OTC) Eye Drops. We also offer Multi-Purpose Solution products to meet your Contact Lens care needs. KC Pharmaceuticals believes in providing a conducive working environment for our employees to realize their full potential, striving for excellence and innovation as the foundation for growth. We are currently hiring an experienced QC Lab Manager to conduct the following.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Coordinate operations within the lab to ensure materials and products are tested, reviewed and approved within the accepted time frames.
Interprets data, identifies adverse trends, and provides strategic resolution to technical issues with the group. Ensures scientific and compliance-based suitability of analytical methods used for testing materials and products through method transfers and method validations.
Review, author, and edit documents, including deviations, change control requests, SOPs, test methods, analytical investigations, and laboratory test plans and related technical reports.
Lead microbiology and chemistry validations including but not limited to media fill, cleaning validations, and review of test results for final release of the product.
Provide effective planning for QC Labs to include required resources, and the maintenance & communication of cycle times.
Lead and manage projects which include microbiology and chemistry department support.
Ensures investigations related to OOS, unexpected results, or invalids are performed appropriately and within expected timeframes. Ensure investigations are appropriately thorough to identify root causes or potential root causes and prevent a recurrence.
Supporting QA/QC during FDA audits, and enhancing current laboratory methods and techniques.
Experience in leading analytical investigations for Out of Specification or Out of Trend Results in accordance with regulatory guidelines
Other duties as assigned.

MANAGERIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

Directly oversees the Microbiology and Chemistry team.
Carries out managerial responsibilities in accordance with the organization’s policies and applicable state and federal laws.
Coach, mentor, lead and manage departmental employees. Ensure that training and other personal development programs are in place for succession planning and the development of subordinates. Ensure that performance opportunities are proactively managed through the Performance Management system.
Responsibilities may also include interviewing, hiring, training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.

REQUIRED SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge and experience of FDA regulations related to the manufacture of drugs and devices.
Strong verbal communication, proficiency in technical writing, and excellent interpersonal skills are required.
Ability to lead multiple testing sub-groups (Microbiology/Chemistry) to provide testing efficiencies while in full compliance with regulatory requirements.
Ability to lead analytical investigations for Out of Specification or Out of Trend Results in accordance with regulatory guidelines
Demonstrate knowledge and experience in sterile (aseptic process) and non-sterile pharmaceutical cGMP manufacturing.
Demonstrate knowledge and experience in analytical method development and validations involving HPLCs, UV Spectrophotometry, etc.
Demonstrate knowledge and experience working with various equipment HPLC equipment, UV
Knowledge and experience of including but not limited to USP, NF, and EP standards and monographs
Exhibit flexibility, open-mindedness, and adaptability to changing environments.
Complies and adheres to existing and new regulations and complies with all company policies and procedures.
Comply with all company safety policies and procedures to ensure a safe and healthy environment.

QUALIFICATIONS:

B.S. majoring in Microbiology/Biochemistry/Biology or related science.
Aseptic (class 100, ISO 5) environmental monitoring and sterility testing experience.
Experience in analytical method development and validations involving HPLCs, UV Spectrophotometry, etc.
6+ years of experience in a microbiology/chemistry laboratory of a pharmaceutical manufacturing environment.

COMPETENCIES:

Leadership - Exhibits confidence in self and others; Inspires and motivates others to perform well; Effectively influences actions and opinions of others; Accepts feedback from others; Gives appropriate recognition to others.
Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem-solving situations; Uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.
Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests; Able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed.
Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data; Designs workflows and procedures.
Technical Skills - Assesses own strengths and weaknesses; Pursues training and development opportunities; Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; Shares expertise with others.

PHYSICAL DEMAND & WORK ENVIRONMENT:

May occasionally lift and /or move more than 20 lbs.
While performing the duties of this job, the noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

WHAT WE OFFER:

Paid Holidays
Health, vision, dental, FSA and life insurance benefit plans
401k
Profit-Sharing
Paid Vacation and Sick time

Job Type: Full-time

title: Senior Product Manager
job_description:
About us:

Limeade is an employee experience software company that helps build great places to work. The Limeade platform unifies employee well-being, engagement and inclusion solutions with industry-leading communications capabilities. Recognized for its own award-winning culture, Limeade helps every employee know their company cares.

We're committed to creating a mission-driven, positive culture of improvement made up of the best and brightest people in the business. And we've got the awards to back it up: Puget Sound Business Journal ranked us #1 Best Workplace in Washington, and Seattle Business ranked us one of the top three Best Companies to Work for in Washington State. We're one of the fastest-growing companies in North America (Deloitte's Technology Fast 500), and Fortune magazine recognized us as a Best Workplace for Women. Learn more at www.limeade.com.

About the Job:

Product Managers at Limeade define, design and deliver products and services that delight customers and users and add strategic value to Limeade. Product Managers ensure that Limeade is delivering on its vision of measurably improving employee well-being and driving real employee engagement through smart technology and great teamwork.

Responsibilities span the life of the product/service and include deep collaboration with business stakeholders, customers/users, designers and engineers. Key product management deliverables include product/service vision, leading and communicating a successful solution process, writing and prioritizing detailed user stories, partnering with engineering leadership to manage the release of value, and establishing Limeade as a market-leading brand. The preferred location for this role is within the United States or Canada.

Responsibilities:

Leads innovation value chain from a product strategy perspective for our Engagement solution.
Product opportunity definition and vision of our Engagement solution. Drives product vision in our solution by incorporating market data to create value propositions with initiative teams, including management of resources and alignment to business plans and goals.
Partners with internal stakeholders, brand managers to build a competitive solution. Manages solution product backlog. Translates strategy and vision into a solution that ensure the product is amazing and users and customers love it.
Product leadership and ownership. Partners with engineers, designers and customers to build the right product. Shipping a product with pride. Has a sense of personal accountability for the quality and completeness of the entire product/service and resulting user experience. Maintains a sense of pride and craftsmanship that yields output with aesthetic as well as technical value
Release Readiness. Go-to-market execution, efficacy, product advocacy to drive release readiness
Ships value. Builds the right process and ships product. Uses, defines, and improves metrics, processes, and standards to meet the expected product/service outcomes
Effective teaming. Building the right team. Acts constructively to increase the efficiency, impact, and morale of the team, as a whole. Works proactively across team, product/service, or platform boundaries to share information and technology and ensure that peer team goals are aligned

Desired Skills & Experience:

Ability to demonstrate our values in an ongoing and consistent way
3+ years in product management or product development - preferably in SaaS or consumer websites/apps
On-the-job and/or academic experience with user-center design and design thinking
Proven success in shipping high-quality, simple customer-experiences
Self-starter with superior time management and prioritization skills
Enjoys researching and strategic thinking as well as planning and execution
A naturally curious person who seeks out understanding by diving deep into data, research and others' thoughts and ideas
A well-rounded communicator, collaborator and presenter who loves to share findings and insights
Always a team player and a leader - When it comes to the team, developers and other stakeholders they want to believe in our product and that starts with you
Quantitative background to support data-driven decision-making
Computer Science, and/or economics degrees OK with increased software experience

Limeade provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Limeade will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

title: Product Manager
job_description: WHO WE ARE:Tealium is the trusted leader in the customer data industry. We believe unified customer data is an organization’s most valuable asset and greatest competitive advantage. We help brands seamlessly unify their siloed customer data and applications in real time, and drive more profitable interactions across all touchpoints. Tealium’s Customer Data Hub (CDH) enables you to connect your data so you can connect with your customers. Founded in 2008, Tealium’s patented and award-winning solutions are used by over 1,000 of the world's most innovative brands, including Sony, Providence St. Joseph Health, Cambria Health, T-Mobile, Hulu, Uber, Facebook, Expedia, Hyatt, Barcelo Hotel Group, Sportsbet, Utah Jazz, American Airlines, The Gap, Orange, and many others.We are looking for an experienced Product Manager with a passion for technology to join our rapidly growing Product team. The ideal candidate has experience with Martech, Data, or Analytics software products and experience working closely with engineering teams to launch new features and functionality. This role will be dedicated to driving new innovation and adoption of Tealium’s Data Access, our newly launched ML platform Tealium Predict, and supporting development of a reporting and analytics center of excellence.YOUR DAY TO DAY Become a visible Subject Matter Expert on Tealium products in your focus areaConduct market research and user acceptance testing to challenge assumptions and ensure sound decision-makingHelp drive vision, roadmap, strategy and requirements that meet the needs of Tealium’s customersAct as an evangelist with internal stakeholders to develop and execute on strategy using bleeding edge technologies across a broad range of use casesWork with design teams to create solutions that are compelling, clean, intuitive, and practical Strategize with Engineering to resolve tech debt, prioritize feature development, and create innovative solutions to complex technical problemsWrite functional and technical requirements docsPartner with Leads and Scrum Masters to give guidance throughout development sprintsCreate and perform webinars and product demos in front of small, medium, and large audiences internally and externallyCollaborate with Product Marketing, Sales, Education, and Customer Success to produce go-to-market materials, training documents, and high customer adoption Ensure launch of new product and feature documentation in Tealium’s ShowroomWHY YOU ARE THE PERFECT FIT You bring product management experience within the Martech, Data or Analytics spaceYou have proven success with launching new software products, speaking the voice of the customer and evangelizing product adoption You are comfortable delivering product presentations and webinars to large audiencesYou have exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills You have excellent abilities to execute to plan and get things doneYou have strong relationship building skills and experience developing cross functional relationships with, but not limited to Engineering, Marketing, and Sales You have a passion for technology, innovation, and continuous learning You bring software development, statistics/math or other technical experienceYou have experience with Confluence, Jira, and other collaboration toolsYou are well-versed in Agile Scrum best practicesYou are familiar with global data privacy regulations including GDPR and CCPAWHY YOU WANT TO WORK HERE: The highly relevant and differentiated positioning of Tealium and our Customer Data Hub (CDH) makes this a unique and rewarding career opportunity. Organizations from start-ups to large global enterprises are utilizing Tealium to unify their customer data in real time and drive improvements in their overall data strategy. Over 1,000 global brands trust Tealium, and in an increasingly noisy market we are proud to maintain best-in-class renewal rates of >90%. When our customers are happy, we’re happy.Our corporate HQ is located in sunny San Diego, just minutes from the beach and surrounded by beautiful hiking trails and the renowned Torrey Pines golf course. Our location is just one of the many perks we enjoy; At Tealium we dress casually (but professional), enjoy a flexible paid time off policy, rich benefit plans, company holidays, 401(K) match, and employee Stock Options - just to name a few. Not to mention we get to surround ourselves with some of the brightest minds in San Diego. If you are interested in being a part of Team Teal, we’d love to hear from you!TEAL celebrates diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. It is our continuing policy to recruit and employ the best qualified individuals without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, and/or any other protected characteristic. TEAL does not tolerate unlawful discrimination of any kind and strives to be an inclusive and respectful workplace.

title: Warehouse Production Manager
job_description:
Job Location

Olive Branch, MS US

Address

10800 Marinna Dr (Olive Branch), MS 38654

Job Category

Transportation & Warehousing

ABOUT US (AND OUR EXCITING FUTURE)

Menasha Corporation is all about possibilities. Our two businesses, Menasha Packaging and ORBIS Corporation, are leaders in their industries, providing corrugated and plastic packaging products and related services to major global companies.

Our employees make the difference, proving that great ideas, collaboration and quality turn possibilities into success. Working at Menasha Corporation means that your insights provide cutting-edge solutions for our customers. If you like to make things happen and are passionate about what you do, you’re going to want to be here.

Join us and become part of the power behind possible.

ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY

Position Summary

Manages all warehouse activities. Manages the warehouse ensuring the receipt, coordination, and safety of goods coming through a warehouse. Also ensures that orders arrive and are dispatched on time to the appropriate destinations and in the expected quantities.

Essential to this Position

Oversight and enforcement of ORBIS Safety Programs.

Daily review of production metrics and KPI’s (Labor expense, Forklift/Machine Repairs, Cost/Sort, Sorts/Hour).

Provide leadership to employees by demonstrating ORBIS standards and expectations on an everyday basis.

Direct continuous improvement to maximize efficiency and eliminate waste throughout facility.

Establish and maintain professional relationship with local customer.

Achieve budgeted financial goals for service center.

Accurate inventory management.

Resolve any quality problems/complaints

Perform self-inspection on service centers relative to production and safety.

Procure and maintain all needed operation and facility supplies (Forklifts, Washing Machines, etc).

Interview and hire all service center employees.

Ensure all employees are meeting job level expectations and requirements.

Motivate and train employees to maintain succession plan for future growth/opportunities.

Consistently enforce ORBIS polices through discipline action process.

Facilitate payment of site invoices with Finance, including inputs, approvals, new vendor information.

Other duties as assigned.

Essential for Success:

Knowledge of and ability to use and influence organization's policies, standards and procedures guiding manufacturing processes

Knowledge of strategies and tools for controlling and optimizing the factors that lie between the purchase of raw materials and delivery of finished products

Ability to effectively manage the business relationship and transactions with the suppliers of raw materials or product components

Knowledge of issues and considerations for effectively managing local or distributed inventories of raw materials, work in progress and finished goods

Knowledge of the processes, tools and operational considerations for effective and efficient movement of goods and materials throughout the manufacturing cycle

Knowledge of the day-to-day operations of a manufacturing plant or facility

Must be able to read/comprehend written and oral instructions in English; read and comprehend safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, procedure manuals and product recipes/material identifications.

Superior leadership skills with demonstrated ability to effectively manage and develop a diverse team ofpeople.

Beginning financial knowledge sufficient to understand/manage financial budgets and statements.

Understands LEAN Manufacturing practices and at least 1 year of experience of LEAN utilization.

OSHA Regulation Training.

Experience with Gas/Electric Forklifts.

Microsoft Word and Excel proficiency.

Must be willing to work extended hours and weekends as necessary.

Bi-Lingual skills preferred (required for positions outside the US)

Pro-active attitude about the job and company

Desire to advance within the company, including relocation if needed

Ability to travel to other sites as needed

Conduct self professionally to customers and visitors

Ability to manage expenses

Ability to adapt to changing environments

Ability to make difficult decisions

Ability to assess employee performance and coach and develop others

Ability to lead by example

Willingness and acceptance to change

Ability to handle stress of working with others

Availability outside of normal business hours

Ability to multi-task

EDUCATION / CERTIFICATIONS

Education Required

Associate’s Degree

Education Desired

Bachelor’s Degree

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

Work Experience Required

At least 5 years relevant experience required.

ABOUT ORBIS CORPORATION

ORBIS Corporation is the market leader in the returnable packaging industry. Our reusable plastic pallets, totes, interior protective packaging and bulk container systems are used by major, global consumer, industrial and automotive companies. We also provide tracking, retrieving, cleaning and inventory management services that help world-class companies increase the speed and effectiveness of their reusable packaging program. Recognized for driving supply chain sustainability, our focus is to help customers move their product faster, safer and more cost-effectively using our proven solutions. ORBIS Corporation employs approximately 1900 employees and is comprised of a portfolio of businesses that includes 10 North American manufacturing facilities and multiple industrial services centers across North America and Europe, each with multiple sites.

As an operating company of Menasha Corporation, we celebrate over 167 years of unwavering dedication to a sustainable business strategy that focuses on keeping pace with change and market trends. Menasha Corporation is a privately held company comprised of two subsidiaries: ORBIS Corporation and Menasha Packaging Company. As one of America’s oldest family-owned manufacturing companies, Menasha Corporation employs over 5,000 in over 100 facilities in North America and Europe.

View our two-minute video that shares a quick glimpse about Menasha Corporation and our exciting future at http://www.brainshark.com/menasha/vu?pi=zH2zyKNEkz7PLVz0.

Visit our careers site at http://careers.menasha.socialsourcingnetwork.com/ to learn more about working at Menasha and to stay connected to future job opportunities.

For more information about ORBIS Corporation, please visit www.orbiscorporation.com.

ORBIS Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. ORBIS Corporation shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-300.5(a). This regulation prohibits discrimination against qualified protected veterans, and requires affirmative action by covered prime contractors and subcontractors to employ and advance in employment qualified protected veterans. As an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action/Pro Disabled & Veteran Employer, we request priority referrals of qualified protected veterans, qualified individuals with disabilities, qualified minority candidates, and qualified female candidates for job openings at ORBIS Corporation.

title: Customer Service Manager
job_description:
A&D Automatic Gate & Access Control Company has been around for 40 years. A&D prides itself by our 7 Core Values: Integrity,Respect, Compassion, Punctuality,Teamwork,Enthusiasm, and Accountability. Our corporate office in Redwood City, CA has an immediate need for an experienced, enthusiastic,energetic, Senior Service Manager .  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Perform Technical & Supervisor work in the operation and maintenance of residential and commercial properties.
Manage and guide service technicians, as well as, maintain involvement with Dispatchers daily to ensure technicians are scheduled to the appropriate number of calls.
Continuously evaluate current technician’s skill sets and their training needs to invoice repairs. Ensure that technical training and product knowledge is ongoing, as well as, tracking the development and improvement of each technician.
Invest time on personal development to increase personal leadership within departments.
Lead, direct, and motivate all my service techs to reach their highest level of potential. Achieve maximum motivation and attitude within service department.
Decrease the amount of call backs and cost for warranties in the department, with better training.
Achieve an overall attitude of being "On Time" with all service technicians.
Establish all service technicians to sell Preventive Maintenance agreements
Conduct service meetings in an efficient and productive manner.
Communicate with Dispatchers daily on reports, punctuality, skills and ability of Service Technicians.
Communicate with Sales/ Technical Trainer daily, on technical objectives and training programs.
Complete Ride-A-Longs with all Maintenance & Service Technicians.
Provide an environment that promotes Service Champions high standards of performance by all team members.
Bring forth a positive energy and enthusiasm for the success of the department.
Ensure the success rate of all maintenance service technicians to guarantee work for the service department.
Ensure the dress code has been followed to project a positive and professional image to clients.
Maintain our service vehicles as they are mobile billboards of the company.
Monitor social media Yelp, Google, and Facebook ensuring A&D has an excellent customer service and community presence
Communicate and maintain good relations with manufacturing reps and dealers

title: Team Manager, Product Management - Channel Health
job_description:
Your OpportunityCharles Schwab's Digital Investor Services team is responsible for defining, delivering, and leading the lifecycle of our platforms and services which enable digital interactions with clients at scale. Our digital experience is the way that most clients interact with us daily, and we’re passionate about creating the best experience possible for our users.

We work, think and approach problems differently than your traditional financial services firm, and we aim to change both how Schwab operates and how the industry serves investors. In this role, you will help drive the digital messaging channel and platform health strategy, including how we make data driven decisions. You will also build and lead a product roadmap with the digital messaging leadership team including our technical partners. You will work alongside the team of product managers who will implement tools, processes and reporting to ensure a performant, scalable, and reliable system. The digital messaging platform delivers hundreds of millions of cross channel communications to our clients across the enterprise.The team is responsible for:

Strategy - Envision the future and build the near-term and long-term outcome oriented roadmaps for the health of the digital messaging platform and channels
Execution – Own and drive the definition, creation, development and implementation of solutions that gauge the health of our platform and channel
Client service – Ensure reliability of systems to deliver digital messaging to our clients and provide scalable production support processes to resolve client issues
Partnership – Collaborate with technology, design, marketing and others in delivering value to our clients

What you’re good at

You will lead a hardworking team of digital product managers, who oversee the implementation and ongoing health of the channel.
You will inspire your team and lead by example using OKRs to get results for our clients, firm and team
You will help formulate the creation of capabilities which enhance Schwab’s digital messaging platform and channels.
You will lead the generation of new ideas based on data, analytics, insights, market trends, and interactions with partners, clients and prospects.
You will think “horizontally” to deliver an exceptional experience for our clients across our channel
You will champion Agile methodologies, leading and participating in the product owner activities including daily stand-up meetings, sprint planning sessions, backlog prioritization, user story preparation and demos.
You will execute brilliantly in a fast paced environment
You will work cross-functionally with technical, design, business, and compliance counterparts to define product release requirements and investigate production issues as they arise.
You will spend time examining and researching a client base to deeply understand the needs and wants of Schwab customers, often based on direct client feedback.
You will balance functionality against complexity on a highly visible platform which will serve millions of clients.
You will work to create the awareness and engagement plan for channel health and provide relevant and concise updates to partners and leadership teams.
You will serve as a channel subject matter authority and evangelist to partners.

What you have

Enjoy being a leader with vision who naturally challenges the status quo
People leader and management experience a plus
Strategic problem solver with the ability to formulate compelling vision and strategy and translate that to substantial roadmaps and results.
Strong knowledge base and experience developing or leading digital platforms, coupled with knowledge of the underlying technology, both current and emerging.
Experienced in creating clarity in the performance, security and availability of our platform and channel as well as how to optimize the client experience in relation to performance, security and availability
Ability to influence and build strong relationships across multiple levels of the organization
Highly developed communication and presentations skills with a superior ability to effectively communicate and present complex concepts and issues to leadership teams.
Skilled at working cross-functionally with technology, service, marketing and product teams to lead the entire lifecyle of a digital platform.

Self-starter with outstanding organizational skills and ability to track multiple project deliverables with minimal direction

Good understanding and/or experience with financial services regulations is a plus
Bachelor’s degree required (MBA preferred)
4+ years digital product owner experience

title: Program Manager
job_description:
JOB TITLE:  Program Manager

PROJECT OVERVIEW:

"This position is contingent upon contract award"

Provides a wide range of analytical and program management support to the Veterans Administration (VA) for COVID-19 Pandemic response. Support areas could involve access to health care, public health, health care administration, delivery of health care and management of health care business enabling functions.

Provide programmatic and analytic support for COVID-19 operational response to include planning, initiating, managing, executing and closing out programs in support of an integrated health care system.
Use program management tools to track and report projects in terms of cost, schedule, performance.

Understand and use project management discipline employing PMBOK principles.

Masters degree with 10 years of experience
Minimum of 6 years of experience supporting a large corporation of government agency
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification
Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook
Experience with analysis or program management
Experience with teams managing analysis
Operational, business or technical background relevant to systems development, operations and management
Excellent presentation skills and comfort communicating with clients

Secret Clearance or higher

Government agency experience or expertise

title: On The Go Manager
job_description:

Full-Time
Madison, WI - West Towne location

Summary: The On The Go (OTG) Manager directs and coordinates activities involved in providing the careful delivery of grocery products to customers at business or residential locations.
