title: Practice Manager, DevOps
job_description:
About 2nd Watch

2nd Watch is an AWS Partner Network (APN) Premier Consulting Partner and Microsoft Azure Gold Partner providing professional and managed cloud services to enterprises who need to transform their business to become more agile and innovative. The companys subject matter experts and software-enabled services provide companies with tested, proven, and trusted solutions with a focus on five solution areas: Enterprise Cloud Migration, Security and Compliance, Cloud Native and DevOps, Optimization, and Managed Services. The venture-backed company is headquartered in Seattle, Washington. To learn more about 2nd Watch, visit www.2ndwatch.com or call 888-317-7920.

Why 2nd Watch

2nd Watch is in growth mode, and we are looking to build out our existing teams. We are looking for like-minded, focused team members to join us! We offer roles ranging from all levels in our Sales, Managed Cloud Services, Cloud Enablement, DevOps, Product Development teams and beyond. We are looking for superstars and are raising the bar setting industry-level standards around AWS and Azure services, product management and delivery.

Where you fit:

2nd Watch has a unique company culture and working environment that live and breathe success and promote pushing the envelope every day in your respective role at the company. This is what drives our teams. Getting our attention takes creativity, ingenuity, a desire to improve each day, and a track record of caring about who you are affecting, both positively and negatively, while you are getting the right stuff done.

We are looking for a the most technically forward-thinking, cloud-passionate employees in the world and work daily to align our core values with those that we hire - Fearlessness, Tenacity, Humility, Customer Focus, Empowering One Another, Working Together, Winning as a Team, Honesty, Transparency, Having FUN these are all key elements to who we hire.

Position Title : 

Practice Manager, DevOps 

The DevOps Practice Manager primary function is to drive the DevOps cloud-based IT professional services delivery model ensuring success in building and migrating applications, software and services into the public cloud. This role will require creative problem solving via technical and business solutions with public and private cloud expertise to drive product and service adoption. The manager must have experience in leading efforts around transformative and DevOps Cloud Solutions while delivering the vision to build a business development strategy and plan to work with Sales and Service Delivery.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Set a compelling vision for the team, measure and adapt to results through quantitative and qualitative measures of value, outcome, velocity, engagement, and satisfaction.Take ownership of building the DevOps solutions business for 2W and help to enable sales


Create the DevOps practice vision and strategy Effectively create and communicate DevOps strategy and sales objectives to the sales organizationWork with the solutions sales team to message, engage, and sell DevOps solutions to enterprise grade clients
Clarify objectives and remove obstacles and barriers that prevent the team and organization from achieving resultsDevelop, implement, and promote agile / lean best practice standards including the use of tools and automationSupport and advocate an agile / lean culture where self-organizing teams develop solutionsDevelop and grow the team through training, mentoring, and coaching in your team and across the technology organizationStrong understanding of the public cloud providers and their products and applicable use cases, best practices and implementation, and support considerations. Partner with the sales team to formulate and execute a sales strategy to exceed revenue objectives through the adoption of DevOps Solutions. Collaborate with customers on migrating existing systems and building new systems using the DevOps technologies. Present technical concepts in clear manner to customers through product demos, proposals and presentations. Strong problem-solving abilities coupled with a desire to take on responsibility. Develop and maintain relationships with key external stakeholders at various business levels. Resolve complex technical problems at a pre- or post-sales level, working with either sales or support personnel. Attention to detail in documenting information and ability to show ownership of follow through in customer resolutions. Hire, on-board, train and develop new Engineers from internal and external sources. Act as a Technical liaison between customers, service engineering and support teams. Directly collaborate with the sales team to formulate and execute a sales strategy to exceed revenue objectives. Educate customers of all sizes on the value proposition public cloud technologies. Establish credibility and build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within customers to enable them to be cloud advocates. Participate in deep architectural discussions to build confidence and ensure customer success. Conduct deep-dive hands-on education/training sessions to transfer knowledge to customers considering, or already using, a cloud provider. Author or contribute to customer-facing publications such as whitepapers, tutorials, etc., and present sessions customer and industry conferences. Hands-on experience building, delivering and managing cloud IaaS and PaaS environments using platforms such VMware, OpenStack, Azure, AWS, and GCE.

Education and/or Work Experience Requirements: 

Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. 8- 10 years in progressively more responsible roles in either solutions architecture, support or IT professional services. 2-5 years experience working explicitly in or with cloud technologies. One or more relevant industry recognized certifications. General knowledge of areas of business operations beyond IT. Excellent written and verbal communications skills. Public profile or proven record of public speaking at relevant tech events. Solid problem-solving abilities coupled with a desire to take on responsibility. Partnering approach and mentality. Proven ability to stay abreast and continually expand knowledge in the areas of new technological developments and trends. Attention to detail in documenting information and ability to show ownership of follow through in customer resolutions. Experience managing exceptional engineersExperience with modern infrastructure as code technologies like Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible, Terraform, PackerExperience with modern CI/CD pipeline technologies involving git repositories, static code analysis, test driven development etc. Some examples are SonarQube, Jenkins, GitLab CI, Maven, Gradle, JSLintHands on experience in at least one development language (JavaScript, Java, .Net, Python, Go,. etc)A passion for keeping up on new technologies that could benefits like serverless, machine learning, blockchain, othersStaying up to speed on technology changes within our organization.Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze a business process/workflow, identify bottlenecks, improve the flow Strong sense of ownership and the ability to work with a limited set of requirementsFlexibility, ability to manage multiple priorities and ability to handle ambiguity

Benefits and Perks:

Beyond an amazing, collaborative work environment, great people and inspiring, innovative work, we have some great benefits and perks:Competitive salaries and all employees are bonus eligible 401(k) with company stock plans to all employees100% paid medical, dental and vision coverage for all employees and 90% paid for family, along with other wellness and disability plansNo limit / regulation on Paid Time Off We let you manage yourself. Catered lunches, fully stocked kitchens, focus on Philanthropy and giving back to the communities we support

title: Product Owner
job_description:
Are you a people person with a love for technology? Do you like to collaborate with your colleagues to create and enhance products that clients use every day? If yes, we want to talk to you! ImageSoft is currently recruiting for a Product owner, for our Southfield, MI office. This position works closely with the Director of Product Development and customers to understand the market needs and convey those needs to the SCRUM team, then serve as the point person for the developers and QA members on the SCRUM team.
 
What an ImageSoft Product Owner will do – Job Description: 

Develop epic and user stories for all new functionality to include presenting user stories to the product teams in grooming and design sessions, ensuring that new functionality meets the acceptance criteria, so the work can be designated as complete.
Assists the development team with release planning, functional research, and testing of releases.
Assigns prioritized items (User Stories) from the Product Backlog to the Scrum Teams, participates in Team Planning meetings and is available to provide advice, clarification and guidance during the execution of each Sprint.
Champions sufficient customer engagement during the development through, for example, product demonstration and customer feedback.
Inspects, accepts or rejects completed work from the development Sprint.
Works in relevant structures (e.g. Scrum of Scrums) to manage dependencies and set priorities across multiple teams and Backlog items and to maintain alignment to the Release Product vision and roadmap.
Has final sign-off of the Product Release at the different levels.
Responsible for Stakeholder Management, engaging with key customer contacts and with Sales and marketing as required to ensure that all relevant inputs to the Product Backlog have been collected and prioritized.
Ensures that the Product Backlog is constantly prioritized to secure delivery of maximum business value.
Becomes a subject matter expert in the relevant product domains and is expected to be an expert in the product from a feature / functionality perspective.
Maintains an understanding of target market and user base and uses this to guide product decisions.

 
What an ImageSoft Product Owner will have – Skills & Requirements:

Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university and/or a combination of education and experience.


Prior experience with Courts, a major plus
Minimum 5 years of relevant experience as a product manager, product owner, software development or business analysis in an agile environment.
Software Development Experience a plus.
Excellent and proven oral and written communication skills.
Excellent meeting facilitation and presentation skills
Ability to act and communicate professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers and subject matter experts.
Strong time and project management skills.
Strong negotiation and persuasion skills.

 What an ImageSoft Product Owner will receive – Perks & Culture:

title: Product Manager
job_description:
The Opportunity: Today’s winning retailers are using digital technology to transform virtually every aspect of their businesses. At One Door, we’re creating a platform that enables retailers to better collaborate and communicate to create outstanding in-store experiences for their customers. We are looking for a Product Manager to join our team and make their mark on our unique cloud-based visual merchandising software, Merchandising Cloud.

When you join our team, you’ll have a direct impact on the direction of Merchandising Cloud. You’ll see your ideas materialize from conception to reality and participate in strategy, product roadmap, and feature definition. You’ll be part of a growing company that shares your passion for thinking out of the box, learning, and collaboration. We’re looking for someone who is energetic and enthusiastic, who can apply a strong work ethic and strategic thinking to drive both personal growth and development and that of our cloud-based merchandising application.

In This Role, You Will:

Work with leading retailers and their partners to understand their needs, industry trends, and technical details necessary to document product requirements, to write use cases and user stories, and to help define MVPs. Strategize with UX, Engineering, and Product Management to build the best possible product roadmap.

Collaborate across functions daily to bring your ideas to life. You’ll work with:

 Software Engineering to guide and evangelize your features’ development from concept to delivery UX& Design to conceptualize a unique User Experience that solves pressing retail problems Client Services& Operations to drive customer adoption and continuous improvement Sales& Marketing to communicate your features’ value proposition and market impact

Participate in product workshops, company-wide strategy presentations, product boot camps and other ad-hoc sessions as needed to gather input and promote product efforts.

Grow. Reporting to the Sr. Product Manager, you will hone your product management skills and learn how to drive change across enterprise software organizations.

You’ll Have:

1 -3 years of software management or related experience, ideally in Product Management (we’d also love to hear from you if you’ve worked in Business Analysis, QA, Project Management or Product Marketing and would like to grow into a Product Management role) Hands-on experience writing requirements and driving their delivery (with the examples to prove it)The ability to work across functions and influence stakeholders both internal and external to One Door Strong presentation and communication skills An interest in“how the sausage is made” - being a part of the product lifecycle from ideation through delivery and support is exciting to you A resourceful and decisive nature and a willingness to advocate for your decisions based on your own data researchComfort with ambiguity and the ability to prioritize competing demandsEmpathy with individual users’ pain points and the ability to synthesize them into scalable solutions that work for a broader audienceA Bachelor's degree Retail, Supply Chain, or Merchandising experience (preferred but not necessary)

Perks& Benefits: Competitive benefits and compensation, professional& personal development, paid parental leave, 401K, a company contribution for commuter expenses, free Blue Bikes membership, and a great office a few minutes from South Station smack-dab in Boston’s Fort Point Channel, a tremendous amount of responsibility and collaboration, wicked awesome co-workers, Thirsty Thursdays, a fully stocked kitchen, fun company outings, and more.

One Door is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment, as One Door does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other classification protected by Federal, state, or local law.

title: Senior Product Manager
job_description:
Pager delivers a "doctor in your family" healthcare experience by making it simple for consumers to connect with the trusted experts they need to make the right healthcare decisions. Through AI-enabled technology, Pager brings consumers, nurses, doctors and other members of the care team together through secure chat, voice and video chat, all in one place. We partner with healthcare organizations to deliver seamless, tech-enabled services and solutions for a consumer experience that leads to better decisions, outcomes and healthier lives. Started in 2014 and based in New York City, Pager is led by seasoned technology and healthcare entrepreneurs to redefine the way that consumers interact with their healthcare.

Pager is looking to hire a Senior Product Manager to innovate and execute product initiatives. From ideation to development, to launch, to optimization, you'll be leading, inspiring and mentoring a team of designers and engineers while working closely with stakeholders from other departments.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Work directly with the Director of Product to ensure the product ecosystem is being designed to scale
Help establish design and development processes for the entire organization to get behind
Play a pivotal role in shaping the overall design culture
Drive innovation and inspire your team to think outside the box, knowing that it's easier to tone down a wild idea than it is to pump one up
Leverage data to make product decisions and quantify performance improvements
Manage teams remotely
Track and communicate progress along the way to various stakeholders
Form and adjust product hypotheses based on qualitative and quantitative feedback
Simultaneously manage different projects, deadlines, and requests without breaking a sweat
Synthesize insights and can prioritize bugs, features, and enhancements that really move the needle. Data is your friend, and you use it to make informed product decisions
Coordinate directly with clients on various related projects

IDEAL CANDIDATE

5+ years of hands-on, professional experience as a product manager working on live web and mobile products
Experience working on b2bc & SaaS products while managing multiple client expectations & asks in parallel
Experience shipping a product thousands of people have tried and loved
Strong communication skills which gives you the ability to align everyone on the team
Experience working directly with engineers to ship the best products
Ability to find that sweet spot between the user, business requests, and technical limitations
A proven track record of building consensus and making difficult decisions
Experience working with remote teams
Demonstrable understanding on how to use data to make informed decisions

At Pager, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status

job_description:

title: Sr Product Owner - Master Data Mgmt
job_description:
As a Senior Product Owner, you will shape the future of Products & Services capabilities at T-Mobile. This position is a member of the extended Product Management team and crucial member of the Agile Team. The Sr Product Owner is responsible for the Team / Sprint backlog, representing the single source of truth and is the single point of contact to the Dev team and Customer team for user story details. This position is responsible for defining and refining user stories as well as prioritizing a backlog to streamline execution of product priorities while maintaining conceptual and technical integrity of features for the team.

Responsibilities

Business and Technical Execution

Develops deep understanding of customer experience, especially at a tactical and transaction level.Builds and maintains Agile (Scrum / Sprint) team backlog, with input from customer, Product Manager, System Architect/Engineering and other stakeholders.Collaborates with Agile team and stakeholders to writes user stories and requirements that include acceptance criteria and acceptance tests, typically for 1 or 2 (max) Agile / Scrum teams.Reviews and prioritizes Agile Team backlog for Sprint Planning, including coordination of dependencies with other Product Owners.Reviews and accepts completed user stories for each sprint; participates/drives Agile ceremonies as neededAccountable and responsible for user story quality and performance in production environment.Identifies execution or operational issues that impede product success. Work to change or resolve issues (within sphere of influence).Recognizes technical challenges and makes educated trade-offs with the team.Mentor more junior Product Owners and members of the Agile team.Supports and helps Product Manager create and manage product vision and technical roadmap, primarily related to working scope.

Collaborate with business and IT partner teams to Deliver on roadmap with the support of the Product management Organization Assist in creation of KPI's and benchmarks to ensure anticipated project benefits are clarified early and achieved. Translate business requirements into process / system impacts and functional requirements and identify/assess potential data sources. Create solution options based on research of (current and future) system capabilities, standard processes, and high-performing companies Research, identify and drive improvements to project efficiency, speed and quality via new cross-team synergies, methods, and tools Operate in a 24/7 system support role focused on maintaining high system availability. Support software-related escalations and drive resolution as required. Investigate and debug production and non-production issues at a functional level. Partner with software vendor to debug and resolve issues when necessary. Work closely with Development team to proactively respond to investigate, analyze, validate and resolve issues for a dynamic and complex toolset and environment.

Qualifications

7+ years of relevant Product Management, Product Owner, Business Analyst, and System Analyst or Architecture/Software Engineer experience in an agile software product development environment. Strong requirements elicitation, and proven writing skills including the ability to write concisely and clearly for different audiences.Proven ability to effectively and efficiently communicate with Leadership, technical and non-technical audiences while employing a high degree of collaboration and influence.Strong analytical skills with demonstrated ability to identify/analyze/synthesize product use data and use the data to drive decisions.Ability to effectively manage time, prioritize work, multi-task across many assignments and create deliverables

Desired

Scrum Product Owner certification (CSPO) preferred.Experience with IBM Infosphere MDM Collaborative Edition, or other COTS MDM productsExperience with API's/Microservices/SOA Familiarity with Jira, Artifactory, Gitlab, Docker, Maven, Puppet, and Splunk.Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service.

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelors Degree. Computer Science, Business Analysis, Project Management, or related fieldEquivalent experience

Company Profile

As America's Un-carrier, T-Mobile USA, Inc. (NASDAQ: "TMUS") is redefining the way consumers and businesses buy wireless services through leading product and service innovation. The company's advanced nationwide 4G and 4G LTE network delivers outstanding wireless experiences for customers who are unwilling to compromise on quality and value. title: IT Operations and Maintenance Program Manager
job_description:
IT Operations and Maintenance Program Manager

Marine Force Reserve

Founded in 2005 and headquartered in Falls, Church, VA, Kingfisher Systems, Inc., specializes in providing a full range of Information Technology, Intelligence, Security, and other support services to the U.S. Government and Commercial Customers. Kingfisher Systems, Inc.s core competency consists of technology-enabled services, with a specific focus on Foreign Intelligence; Counterintelligence; Security; Irregular Warfare, including cyber, counter, and anti-terrorism; Homeland Security; and Law Enforcement.

Responsibilities:

Kingfisher Systems, Inc. is seeking an IT Operations and Maintenance Program Manager in the New Orleans, LA area to support Marine Force Reserve IT contract and to provide database operations & maintenance, infrastructure support, and application development and maintenance support to the Marine Forces Reserve (MARFORRES). The successful candidate will ensure the full mission capability by providing support to MARFORRES enterprise databases in its Headquarters at Marine Corps Support Facility New Orleans and 160 remote sites.

The Marine Forces Reserve is a three-star General level command responsible for training and equipping approximately 160 geographically dispersed Marine Reserve units across the United States to augment and reinforce active Marine forces in time of war, national emergency or contingency operations, provide personnel and operational tempo relief for the active forces in peacetime, and provide service to the community. The geographical disbursement of Marine Forces Reserve units requires significant investment in Command and Control IT solutions. The IT services identified in this PWS are critical to maintaining, sustaining, and evolving the Command and Control platforms for the Commander, Marine Forces Reserve.

The IT Operations and Maintenance Program Manager will be responsible for:

Plans, directs, and coordinates a cross functional teams activities to manage and implement project and/or interrelated projects from requirements submission to the final operational stage.
Plans, schedules, monitors and reports on activities related to the projects/programs. Facilitates status review meetings among project team members and/or with senior leadership.
Controls project/program requirements, scope and change management execution.
Facilitates all communication among cross-functional teams ensuring that all appropriate information is exchanged among key stakeholders.
Manage the execution of all assigned projects to accomplish all project/program goals, meet established schedules, and resolve all technical and operational issues.
Supports close to 100,000 users and encompasses upwards of 1.5TB of SharePoint Data.
Deliverable in accordance with contract requirements
Daily management and engagement of contractor staff in supporting customer

Minimum Requirements:

Clearance: Active final DoD Secret preferred

Location Onsite New Orleans, Louisiana (Marine Corps Support Facility)

Project Management Certification (minimum of one):

Project Management Professional PMP

Master Project Manager MPM

Professional in Project Management

Senior Level experience in IT Project Management lifecycle activities, to include:


Project management methodologies
IT infrastructure
IT deployment and operational methodologies

Years of Experience: 10 years of experience in respective fields or comparable fields

Education: Bachelor of Science or Art or Masters of Art or Science

Experience supporting working on classified networks

The IT Operations and Maintenance Program Manager will (not an all-inclusive list):

Develop and document project plans.
Estimate effort and duration for all tasks required of a project.
Establish an overall project timeline with intermediate milestones with associated dates.
Develop metrics and measures designed to monitor the progress and success of a project.
Identify responsible parties for the execution of all project tasks.
Document assigned responsibilities for a project.
Identify and document all risks associated with a project
Communicate all risks and associated impacts of a project to all key stakeholders.
Coordinate all interrelated activities required of disparate teams and team members.
Develop mechanism to communicate ongoing progress of a project.
Monitor ongoing progress of the execution of a project.
Identify potential obstacles or delays that could adversely affect the progress of a project.
Identify mitigation tactics to avoid or overcome potential obstacles or delays to project execution.
Communicate potential obstacles or delays to project execution to Government Lead with recommended mitigation strategies.
Create and present briefs to senior leadership communicating project status.
Create and present briefs to Government Lead gaining the necessary decisions to maintain execution momentum.

Exclusive list of Performance Tasks, Position overview and deliverables will be provided to minimal qualified candidates during the interview phase.

Kingfisher Systems, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with a disability.

title: Digital Advertising Sales and Account Manager
job_description:
Cx3 Ads is a digital marketing agency that is challenging the way businesses and consumers connect. We have been ranked the 77th fastest growing company in the state of Florida, along with being included in Inc. magazine’s top 5000 companies, and we are looking to continue to add rock stars to support our growth.

title: Research and Product Development Manager
job_description:
About Kion 
Our purpose is to empower people to live a joyful, adventurous, and fulfilling life. We are an eCommerce dietary supplement and functional food company. We believe in doing our best and courageously communicating with one another. We are fun loving and have a desire for self-awareness. We have a passion for growth and enjoy new challenges.
Job Overview
We are looking for a professional to oversee the entire process of product development at our eCommerce dietary supplement company. Duties will include tracking product/ingredient ideas, verifying research for ingredients, finding and tracking new ‘hot’ ingredients, maintaining all research and ensuring validity of proposals, ideas and suggestions from all parties. You will work to support our entire team in educating them about our product formulations and ingredients. This will be the person in the entire company who is most excited about answering any and all new questions that come pre-post launch via our Customer Service Team, Marketing Team and our Customers in understanding the products we bring to launch. This person will be excited and motivated to dig through to find answers to questions we may not have answered.
The Right Fit
At Kion, we hire for culture first. Then ability. And then skills. Please consider the following when deciding if this opportunity is the right fit for you.
Culturally, we seek team members who are interested in:

Exercise
Nutrition
Meditation
Self-Reflection
Personal Growth
Humor
Fun
Adventure

We seek these core abilities and qualities for this specific role:

Organizational
Exceptionally detail oriented
Balance between detail and big picture thinking
Synthesizes complex information
Presents and prioritizes options using data and research
Keeps detailed records
Packages ideas together that fit
Develops long-term plans and roadmaps
Seeks to conform to accredited and verified concepts
Committed to what consistent science and research says
No nonsense attitude
Ability to hold a meta perspective of the business and other departments
Flexible and adaptable
Strong sense of follow-through and completing tasks
Ability to present research in an organized and efficient manner to a variety of different people and departments
Ability to consider consumer marketing insights/data to meet customer demands and business goals via product development
The ability to look at multiple ingredients that serve a similar purpose, and make a strong assessment on which is the better ingredient and why.
“Can do it, can figure it out” attitude
Deep researcher and learner. Conducts intellectual searches for technical information through a variety of resources, including the Internet
Communicates in a timely fashion, all information regarding formulation, project status, component research, and results to all appropriate individuals in Purchasing, Sales, Customer Service, and Quality departments

As for skills, we are looking for someone who has experience working in a fast-paced environment and responding well to change and new ideas. You must already possess the following skills and experience:

Chemistry or biochemistry lab experience
Critical reading and fact-checking of research studies
Read and interpret technical specifications
Excellent professional communication skills
Excellent record keeping and file management skills
Experience in creating project briefs and procedure outlines
Experience in organizing gantt charts and checklists for multiple projects running at the same time
Experience in working in Asana, Google sheets, and or other project management tools

Additionally, we are looking for someone with the following background:

Bachelor’s degree required; Masters degree and/or PHD preferred or equivalent experience in Chemistry, Nutrition Science, or related field is required.
Two years prior experience in R&D; dietary, food or pharmaceutical industry experience preferred.

People with Whom You Will Interface 

Kion’s Founders
You will be supervised by our Director of Operations
You will work closely with our Supply Chain Manager
You will interface with all departments, especially Customer Service and Marketing

Job Details

Full-time, competitive salary position


Schedule will be Monday-Friday
Based in North-Central Boulder headquarters
Mix of office and remote work (three days per week in office, two days remote)
Opportunity to do extended personal travel while working (e.g. work remotely from Europe for a month)
Fully covered health insurance
Four weeks PTO + seven national holidays
After working for Kion for one year, five weeks PTO + seven national holidays
Team adventures and parties
Annual multi-day team retreat
Phone stipend
24/7 Membership and 8 Personal Training sessions at Bella Strength Gym
Discounted and free supplements
Exceptional opportunities to grow professionally

Application Instructions
If you want this to be your future, please follow these steps:Please only apply if you fit the culture, abilities, and skills/experience listed above. Check out GetKion.com and learn about what we offer. Send an email to: office@getkion.com with your resume and salary requirements.
*Please note - we have an extensive interview process consisting of an online video interview, Zoom video conference interviews, assessments, and in-person interviews, as well as education verification.
Thank you - we look forward to working with you!

title: Cloud Product Manager
job_description:
At Northwestern Mutual, we are strong, innovative and growing. We invest in our people. We care and make a positive difference.
The focus on this position is to support Cloud Platform teams enhance their Product Management capabilities & organization. The focus of this role is to provide the following discipline within the Cloud Platform space:

1) Responsible for serving the end user /customer or stakeholders of the product. Develops and maintains a vision for the product and is responsible for communicating that vision to the team.

2) Represents the customer, interfaces with and engages the customer.

3) Defines users, creates and maintains epics / features of work. Develops and prioritizes functional requirements for new or revised features or enhancements.

4) Responsible for the product and product features from start to finish. Key decision maker on priorities and design decisions, and works to ensure that all stakeholders are aligned. Inspects product progress and has complete authority to accept or reject work done. Elaboration of Epics, Themes and Features can be presented into user stories that are granular enough to be achieved in a single sprint. Prioritization of product engineering work to consider resiliency, security, & customer feature requests to drive the right engineering for the health & usage of the product.

5) Develops and maintains an appropriately prioritized backlog for implementation according to business value or ROI. Understands both the engineering and business side of the product released and is ultimately responsible for representing the end-users' needs.

6) Participates in the daily Scrums, Sprint Planning Meetings and Sprint Reviews and Retrospectives. Also leads leadership meetings & direction setting for the product domain area.

7) Can change the course of the project at the end of every Sprint including terminating a Sprint if it determined that a drastic change in direction is required.

Works with minimal supervision on large, complex products. Contributes to innovation and product strategy development.Develops reputation as consistently meeting expectations of key stakeholders.Recognized as having expert knowledge – in this case technical domain knowledge of the productProvides day-to-day leadership and coaching to less experienced professionals.May serve as a scrum master for team & mentor for agile / release practices.Gauges the best technology for the project.Develops strategy and understands full life cycle of product.Demonstrates working knowledge of the technology in Infrastructure.Exhibits customer/client orientation.Ability to work as part of a team and build collaborative relationships.Possesses strong decision making ability.Excellent communicator both oral and written.Good at dealing with ambiguity with strong analytical skills.Experience in agile methodologies (experience in product management).4-8 years of experience.Certification or experience with scrum master role (or equivalent).

This job is not covered by the existing Collective Bargaining Agreement.Grow your career with a best-in-class company that puts our client’s interests at the center of all we do. Get started now! job_description:

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Overview

MacStadium is the leading cloud provider of Apple hardware in the world and is headquartered in Atlanta, GA. We offer the only enterprise-class hosting solution for Apple Mac computers worldwide, providing critical infrastructure for iOS and macOS developers at leading tech companies, big enterprises, and more. MacStadium is part of an ecosystem where apps and programs are built that are changing the way people live. Its likely that numerous apps on your iPhone were built or tested in MacStadiums data centers.

What we need:

We are looking for a Product Manager to help drive new technology and product initiatives for our unique business. In this role you will gain a deep understanding of our current solutions and services and identify the next products MacStadium should focus on. To ensure we are creating products that our clients love, you will engage with our customers, analyze internal and external data, create/perform benchmark test, and perform market analysis.

This position will report to a Senior Product Manager with an opportunity for rapid growth. Additionally, you will work closely with the members of engineering, marketing, sales, and operations to ensure continuity in our product offerings and company objectives.

Someone with a strong understanding or experience in cloud solutions and infrastructure will excel; however, anyone with a customer focused mindset who can empathize with our clients (software developers) and paint compelling stories on the user experience will be successful.

What you will be doing:

Create and manage ongoing studies on the market, pricing, customer use cases, and competitorsAnalyze data to define and prioritize product roadmap and product backlogCreate journey maps on the customer experience and identify process improvements through direct client engagementLead benchmark testing initiativesCreate epics, features, and user stories to define scope for product requirementsCoordinate with engineering, marketing, and sales on product release plansRecommend strategies to improve market position, improve quality or reduce costsPrepare financial models and develop return-on-investment analysisIdentify and track metrics linked to product successHelp to define clear vision and direction for the new products and initiativesManage and communicate sales information and product changes both internally and externally

What Skills and Experience you need to have:

Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent experience4+ years of relevant work experience in Information technology or engineering2+ years of product management / business analyst experience Experience with one or more of the following: DevOps, cloud infrastructure, data & analyticsAgile certification (PMI-ACP, SCM, CSPO, etc.) preferredExperience collecting user research and organizing studiesStrong analytics background with experience organizing and analyzing dataExperience with SQL and reporting tools like TableauExperience creating roadmaps, business cases, competitive analysis frameworks, and managing the execution on product initiatives through the entire SDLC

What you will get:

The opportunity to work with an early stage company that has proven to be the leader in Mac hosting solutions with people that are excited to come to work every day.To work as part of a team in our brand new office space located in beautiful amenity filled Piedmont Center in the heart of Buckhead.Competitive pay, benefits and free shuttle to MARTA.

MacStadium has a defined Information Security Policy and all employees are required to adhere to this policy and sign an acknowledgment and receipt of this policy upon hire.

All offers of employment are conditioned upon successful completion of a background screening process and all employees must comply with the immigration rules and laws in the jurisdiction in which he/she will provide MacStadium services.

MacStadium is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All applicants are considered without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, gender/gender identity, sexual orientation, marital and family status, religion and religious belief, age, disability, results of genetic information, and service in the military.

No agencies please.

title: Sr. Product Manager
job_description:
Sharecare is the digital health company that helps people manage all their health in one place. The Sharecare platform provides each person -- no matter where they are in their health journey -- with a comprehensive and personalized health profile, where they can dynamically and easily connect to the information, evidence-based programs and health professionals they need to live their healthiest, happiest and most productive life. With award-winning and innovative frictionless technologies, scientifically validated clinical protocols and best-in-class coaching tools, Sharecare helps providers, employers and health plans effectively scale outcomes-based health and wellness solutions across their entire populations. We are always looking for people that value the opportunity to work hard, have fun on the job, and make a difference in the lives of others through their work every day!

Job Summary:

The Senior Product Manager is the key resource in defining features of the Sharecare platform. This position works with stakeholders across the company to distill requests into common and useful product features. The successful candidate will have a proven track record in launching a new consumer facing product and owning the go to market strategy.

The ideal candidate will have all the requisite experience to manage these responsibilities, including eight plus years of experience as a Product Manager

Essential Functions:

Work with clients to define, describe, and implement solutions
Coordinate with multiple stakeholders to present standard Sharecare features and functionality
Manage third-party deliverables related to all feature integrations
Retain product ownership and effectively communicate requirements to the development team
Recommend the most effective, highest quality, most appropriate solution; utilize conflict management skills in negotiating agreement among all parties.
Demonstrate superb decision-making skills by engaging experts while determining alternatives.
Work with internal stakeholders and the client to review configuration items.
Determine flexibility and configurable items for features
Lead the effort with stakeholders to design new or re-engineer existing features for more effective solutions where identified
Oversee documentation, user training and implementation of new features
Identify future process improvement initiatives where applicable and assist in the prioritization of those initiatives by quantifying needs and benefits.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree with an emphasis in information systems or related field required
Demonstrated leadership in product definition and implementation
Understanding of the conceptual, strategic and technical aspects of an issue. Capable of grasping these concepts quickly and translating the impacts to the client.
8+ years of product management experience or similar experience as detailed above in the responsibilities section of this job description
5+ years of agile work experience
2+ years of experience working with healthcare required
Understanding and experience with application development methodologies
Experience with Jira and Confluence a plus

Specific Skills/Attributes:

Ability to develop and articulate written requirement documents
Ability to distill complex requirements requests into easy-to-understand features and phases for delivery
Ability to understand information quickly, derive insight, synthesize information clearly and concisely, and devise solutions
Ability to work in an entrepreneurial and flexible environment
Inclination to take initiative, set priorities, take ownership of assigned projects and initiatives and independently drive for results
Excellent communication skills and the ability to interface at all levels of the organization within and outside of the company
Excellent organizational skills.
Strong orientation to detail.
Superb relationship building and interpersonal skills.
Strong meeting facilitation skills.
Demonstrated self-confidence, honesty and integrity.
Ability to travel 10 -- 15%.


Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Do you have what it takes to stand out from your peers? At MBI, it takes an individual with a competitive drive. It takes a strategic and innovative thinker. It takes the right combination of intelligence, creativity, and ambition. It takes a leader.

In return, MBI offers the opportunity to make an impact. Our managers, tasked with running a segment of our business, are afforded substantial responsibility early on in their careers. They enjoy a strong sense of ownership of their work and excellent opportunities for advancement.

You begin your management career with MBI as a Product Manager. Immediately, you are given the responsibility for developing and implementing the business plans for your products. You will take products from concept to market and will be actively involved in all stages of the process, including:



Advertising
Marketing – Strategy, Implementation, Analysis
Product Development
Product Sourcing


The role is not a rotational one, but rather a cross-functional one. We challenge our managers to be involved in every aspect of our business and to innovate in ways, both large and small, that improve the business. This approach has sustained our business for over 45 years.

A product marketing career with MBI offers tremendous responsibility, a stimulating atmosphere, the potential for substantial professional and financial growth, and an excellent balance between work and life.

REQUIREMENTS:

MBI seeks highly intelligent, ambitious individuals with strong commercial instincts. Although you may not have directly related experience in product marketing / management, you must be confident that you have an outstanding business sense and the drive that it takes to be a real leader.

We are currently seeking both entry-level and experienced candidates. If you are interested and qualified, please submit your resume and cover letter to:

MBI, Inc.

47 Richards Avenue

Norwalk, CT 06857

hr@mbi-inc.com

www.mbi-inc.com

title: Senior Product Manager
job_description: Sr. Product ManagerThe Sr. Product Manager leads the development of the company’s product features, pricing and competitive position. A key responsibility of this role is to independently create and develop projects through the analysis of complex business issues and provides recommendations for the implementation of new rating plans, underwriting rules, process improvements, and other initiatives. This role serves as a liaison between the Product department and all of the other departments that interface with the group. He/she ensures that projects are defined and implemented as intended. Essential Functions and ResponsibilitiesAccountable for state P&L results. Responsible for driving the business to achieve budgeted growth and profitability business results.Directly manages and develops talent to maintain a team of 3 analysts with Quantitative and Operations specializations.Understands predictive modeling and other quantitative concepts and serves as a resource to other Product Analysts in interpreting these concepts for business application.Seeks out new ideas and approaches to business issues and develops his/her hypotheses independently.Effectively manages projects of high complexity using available tools and data systems to identify, test and solve strategic business issues within the company data/reports, troubleshoots when there are inconsistencies and presents findings to upper management.Constructively challenges current processes and proposed solutions to obtain the best outcome.Interfaces with other departments to strategically address their needs as they relate to the product. Reviews documentation, interprets rules, and coordinates activities with marketing, customer service, underwriting, finance, and information technology.Serves as a regulatory, providing a thorough understanding of our rules and endorsements. Monitor the competitive, legislative, and regulatory environments in assigned states to identify emerging threats to our objectives and recommend plans for responding.Serve as a mentor to other team members on aspects of project work, insurance and general business knowledge.Serve as a Product representative in meetings with other departments as needed.Performs other job-related duties as assigned.Qualifications and EducationAbility to utilize quantitative approaches to generate sound business analyses with detail orientation. Identify results out of the norm, draw conclusions and articulate findings.Skilled in linking multiple data sources to organize data into a logical format for analysis.Confidence in taking ownership of challenging business issues, making decisions with limited or incomplete data and seeing issues through to resolution.Experience developing and implementing new, creative and effective solutions to highly complex business issues.Understanding of and experience within the property insurance industry is required.Experience managing relationships with upper management and with technical developers.Excellent project management and problem-solving skills.Ability to communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.Demonstrated regulatory expertise.SAS (or related software) and regression analysis experience.4 or more years in product management, actuarial, or other analytical role.4 or more years of experience with relational database tools and concepts.Masters or higher level degree required.About the CompanyThe Plymouth Rock Company and its affiliated group of companies write and manage over $1.4 billion in personal and commercial auto and homeowner’s insurance throughout the Northeast and mid-Atlantic, where we have built an unparalleled reputation for service. We continuously invest in technology, our employees thrive in our empowering environment, and our customers are among the most loyal in the industry. The Plymouth Rock group of companies employs more than 1,800 people and is headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts. Plymouth Rock Assurance Corporation holds an A.M. Best rating of “A-/Excellent”.

title: Product Manager, Energy and Utilities
job_description:
Job Description


Vlocity, Inc. is recruiting a Manager/ Director of Product Management within our fast-growing Vlocity Energy and Utility business. This product leader will be a key member of the Vlocity Energy product team and will have responsibility for defining and delivering cloud-based solutions that help utilities and retail energy providers increase customer satisfaction, operate with increased agility, and reduce operating costs.

This role will have an emphasis on both global competitive energy retail markets and regulated utilities and will shape the product strategy. This product manager will have primary responsibility for steering and delivering energy and utilities applications but will also be 30%+ outbound (client and market) facing, so will need strengths in these areas as well.

You will report to the VP & General Manager for Energy and Utilities and will collaborate with an extended team of product management, development, engineering, sales, and marketing professionals. Additionally, you will work with strategic Vlocity partners such as Salesforce, our Global Systems Integration partners, and our product/ technology partners for Energy.

Responsibilities



Define product strategy for industry applications. Use Vlocity's utility industry data model, Vlocity applications (e.g. Sales and Service Console, CPQ, Contract & Order Management), and platform capabilities to define new and compelling industry solutions for utilities and retail energy providers.
Collaborate with Vlocity's business analysts and design teams to expand our library of productized business processes and guide development of future Vlocity Utilities application modules and features.
Develop and engage ecosystem partners around industry solutions (e.g. Salesforce, systems integrators, and other product ISV partners).
Work closely with our customers, partners, industry experts, product managers, engineers, and services teams to understand and document energy providers' sales, service, and marketing processes, documentation, and training at a detailed level.
Define product positioning and messaging, and develop portfolio of sales enablement and training tools for use by Vlocity, Salesforce, and partner sales teams
Help Vlocity industry sales teams close business, serve as product sponsor for certain strategic customer relationships, and represent Vlocity Energy to the market and at industry events

Qualifications

10 years of experience in software development, software consulting, and/or product development/ management
5+ years as a software product manager, solution architect or lead business analyst in, delivering customer experience, customer service, and/ or energy management software products for utilities or retail energy providers.
Demonstrated ability to understand customer business strategies and operational objectives and to translate those requirements into effective industry solutions
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Self-directed, with the ability to break down a complex process, assign actions, and manage progress toward a deadline.
Highly motivated to learn and proactively engage, with the desire to work in a fast-paced environment.
Highly valued: Background in global utility markets for electric, gas, and/or water companies across retail and distribution
Highly valued: Prior experience working with Salesforce, SAP ISU, SAP CRM, Bit2Win, Opower (or competitor), First Fuel, or Oracle Utilities products and technologies is highly valued
Desired locations are Austin, San Francisco but we will consider other locations in or near major global centers for highly qualified candidates
Travel will be required up to 35% to meet with Vlocity product leadership (San Francisco) and Vlocity customers around the globe
Cultural fit is also important to us. We want to work with others who are comfortable working as team players and mentors, and who are committed to contributing to our positive, can-do, high-performance culture

Seeking talent near or accessible to: Austin, TX | New York, NY | Boston, MA | Atlanta, GA

Vlocity welcomes all. In our journey as a company -- and as individual Vlociters -- we recognize that our diversity is our strength. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including our decisions to recruit, hire, promote, transfer, discipline, or separate are based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees to bring their authentic selves to work every day. We provide accommodation for our Vlociters with disabilities both seen and unseen in the spirit and letter of the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA).

title: Product Manager - HVAC Equipment
job_description:
Product Manager - HVAC Equipment - Portland

 Job DetailsLevel ExperiencedJob Location 16 - Portland - Portland, ORPosition Type Full TimeEducation Level 4 Year DegreeTravel Percentage Up to 25%Job Shift DayJob Category ManagementDescription The Product Manager (PM) is responsible for all things related to the sales, marketing, stocking, handling, and training for the product(s) you represent for the company. Your job in a nutshell is to make sure that all of the branches are consistently meeting all of the goals and objectives set for your product group.

Your performance will be objectively measured on the combined performance of the branches and subjectively measured on how you conduct yourself and how you work with your associates.

The company considers the Product Manager to be the Expert on all things associated with the products you represent. You’re like the Factory Representative but you have just one distributor to support.

The Product Manager position carries with it a huge amount of responsibility. You have a responsibility to the Shareholders of Geary Pacific to protect the company’s assets and generate the planned return on their investment. Without them we wouldn’t have the money necessary to stay in business. You have a responsibility to the company’s customers to ensure their service expectations are consistently met and exceeded. You have a responsibility to the company’s suppliers to consistently outperform their expectations of performance. Finally, you have a responsibility to all of the company’s associates to provide the leadership and coaching necessary to ensure that all associates have the opportunity to succeed in their career here at Geary Pacific.

Product Managers report directly to the C.E.O.

Product Managers have no direct reports.

Product Managers must work in concert with and support:


Credit Management
Inventory Management
Marketing
Training & Technical Service
Region Managers
Region Sales Coordinators
Branch Managers
TSM’s
CSR’s

Responsibilities:

Provide leadership for all branch activities involving your assigned Product Group.


Sales Promotions
Customer Service Training
Pricing & Margin Management
Product Merchandising
Inventory Performance
Warranty Handling
Critical Service Events
Product Quality Issues

All branch visits are to be scheduled with the Region Manager and posted on the Region Calendar on the Team Site.

This is a Global position with responsibility for all branch locations considerable travel will be required along with overnight lodging at the various branch locations on a regular and ongoing basis.

Decisions must be made with a “company” focus in order to avoid potential conflicts of interest in the performance of outstanding customer service and realization of maximum profitability for the company. Said another way – what seems right for a branch may not be right for the company

overall but what is right for the company overall will always ultimately be right for the branch.Qualifications Expectations:

Develop a sales plan and goal for your Product Group with each of region managers and branch managers annually. This is to assist senior management in budgeting and goal setting for the company.
Schedule and participate in open houses, counter days, sales blitzes, and ride along with TSM’s.
Conduct product training as necessary at all locations.
Assist in closing/capturing sales with new key accounts.
Participate in and contribute to all scheduled branch manager meetings and conferences.
Develop and maintain a good relationship with key customer accounts for all branches and poll their satisfaction level on a regular basis.
Monitor inventory levels and turns, rotation of stock in the warehouse and on the shelves, ensure the sale of obsolete, damaged, or aged inventory.
Review / decide on all requests for new products within your Product Group. Do not allow the branches to stray from our core focus which is HVAC.
Interact directly with CSR’s, TSM’s, and warehouse & delivery personnel to be sure that everyone understands how to properly handle all aspects of your products.

Training

Provide training opportunities for branch CSR’s and TSM’s on your products through regularly held sales training sessions.
Work with Branch Managers to require that all personnel complete a minimum number of Blue Hawk and HARDI on]line training courses.
Develop product training curriculum not offered by HARDI or Blue Hawk for use in training all personnel on your Product Group.

Customer Service:

Ensure the following for your products:

All CSR’s, are able to provide basic product applications, process orders, credits, returns, and bids in Mincron independently and unsupervised.
All CSR’s can produce quotations for basic products that are clear and concise, and are consistent with company’s published terms and conditions.
All Branch Managers have communicated branch Product Group sales objectives to all associates, and are sharing with them this information on a weekly and monthly basis.
Work with Branch Managers to maintain a three month marketing calendar for your Product Group with scheduled promotions.
Keep Region Managers, Branch Managers, RSC’s, and TSM’s are informed on all price changes.

Inventory:

Make sure all Branch Managers are reviewing and reporting to the Inventory Department on a daily basis their inventory shortages, lost sales, back orders, large sales, new accounts, lost accounts, new product and seasonal minimums, etc.
Make sure all Branch Managers are consistently working to sell aged and obsolete inventory.
Make sure all branches are quickly repairing and selling scratch and dent items so they don’t collect in the warehouse.
Make sure all Branch Managers are constantly looking for slow moving inventory and selling it.
Make sure all branches are rotating the inventory with every receipt and selling the oldest product first.
Make sure Branch Manager is protecting the inventory from theft and damage.

Self Development:

All Product Managers are to attend at least one trade show annually to view new products and services being marketed in the industry.
All Product Managers should attend at least one self]improvement course, and/or read at least one book related to his/her coaching role in the company annually.
All Product Managers should review all trade journals each week to improve awareness of new trends and relevant products in the industry.

title: Technical Account Manager
job_description:
Apply
Description

If you have 5+ years of experience as a TAM, we are looking for you!

As a Technical Account Manager (TAM) your responsibility is to support our current client base in a post-sales relationship. This includes all aspects of the Information Technology sale including; post-sales calls, directing the client with on-boarding, conducting network discoveries, and providing technical direction and support. Complete quarterly business reviews, maintain a good working technology relationship with current clients and sales engineers.

Reporting to the Director of IT solutions, you will be tasked with:

• A comprehensive consultation with IT clients at the highest technical levels on a quarterly basis.

• Provide Technical recommendations during the initial sales process, presenting the components of the Maturity Model and assist with a Technology Road-map.

• Work in a team environment with other TAM’s that support our clients.

• Design, write and develop a scope of work for IT applications and hardware installations.

• Facilitate meetings and strategic planning sessions with current clients in order to satisfy, retain and expand our account base.

• Providing training, development, and direction of IT Engineers that support over 200 Outside Sales Representatives.

• Developing and maintaining a 'trusted advisor' relationship with current IT service desk, sales teams, and clients.

• Ongoing development and understanding of key vertical market trends, regulations and compliance requirements. Ongoing development of IT and industry knowledge.

Desired Skills and Experience:

• 5+ years experience as a Technical Account Manager

• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, or Management Information Systems

• Net+ Certified, MCP, MCA, MCSE, Cloud, Firewall

• Knowledge of IT managed services, IT Project engineer, sales experience, coupled with management in a technical field

• A good understanding of general IT operations and service management

• Great customer service

• Risk mitigation, security, web technologies, routing, exchange, active directory and servers

• Cloud technologies AWS, Email, and Server migration, VPN technologies, data migration, systems integration, VMware, Hyper V, etc.

As a Technical Account Manager at POA, you'll enjoy:

• Trips, clubs, awards, group events, team building.

• Team-player environment.

• DOE, base salary of $60,000-$100,000 + commission opportunity

• Aggressive 401k program 100% match since 1987

• Full Medical/Dental/Vision

• FSA programs

Our Teams of dedicated individuals are at the core of our growth and success. Our culture is confirmed to produce high earning, successful, career-driven professionals. We have the processes, training, products, and support that will enable you to succeed.

About Pacific Office: Pacific Office Automation is one of the largest independently-owned document imaging and technology dealers in the nation. We have twenty-five branches located in eight western states. Our extraordinary growth and reputation in the industry, has created an opportunity for a Technical Account Manager to join our team.

We promote a culture of growth and believe that each employee can make a difference—no matter your role or level of experience. Just as we aim to help our customers grow their businesses through technology, we offer our own employees growth opportunities to reach their career goals. Among our company goals, we aim to be a long-term employer. That means providing employees with the training and certification they need to keep up with the fast-changing technology our office machines, devices, and software employ.

title: Assistant Manager (SD06)
job_description:
