title: Product Manager
job_description:
Purpose:To develop and implement strategies to profitably grow assigned product categories.

Position summary:The Product Manager is responsible for product planning and execution throughout the product life cycle.S/he will be responsible for creating competitive advantage by optimizing the portfolio based on a thorough understanding of end user and channel partner needs, competition, market and technology trends, and the regulatory environment.S/he will work with a Project Manager and/or R&D Engineer to define a vision, strategy, roadmap and specific requirements for products in assigned product categories.This role will drive the introduction of new products, product improvements and marketing programs from ideation and definition to commercialization and metrics.This includes managing all areas of the marketing mix, building brand equity, being the expert for assigned categories, and communicating effectively to end users, customers and company associates.

Essential functions - The essential functions of the individual would include those assumed for a product management position and include, but not limited to the following:

Capture and leverage customer insights to identify, evaluate and prioritize new product, service and program opportunities in line with the strategic goals, technical and financial resources of the business. Define and manage the new offering pipeline, optimize the existing portfolio, and create buy-in for the product vision from internal associates and external partners. Partner with the project manager, R&D engineer and other functional owners to develop and commercialize products using the stage gate process.Drive product launches. Develop positioning and messaging that differentiates products in the market including launch materials, brochures, web site, merchandising, technical bulletins, sales training and end user support. Plan and execute a full range of marketing activities including demand generation, public relations, social media, events, advertising, and white papers. Develop marketing programs and evaluate effectiveness in coordination with other product managers. Establish and optimize product pricing strategies and promotion activities. Define product testing and certification requirements together with the R&D engineer. Define requirements for marketing campaigns including copy, video, graphic design and website with the graphic design department. Develop and manage product and program budget. Support brand development and management. Foster communication and collaboration across departments. Present progress reports to leadership. Expand and enhance functional and business skills through professional development.

Skills and experience:

Strong business acumen. Proven track record of successfully managing all aspects of a product portfolio and the product life cycle. Proven ability to develop and execute effective product and marketing strategies and tactics. Demonstrated knowledge and application of marketing principals, an understanding of sales processes, and experience in customer insights. Effective written, verbal, visual and experiential communication skills. Skilled at working effectively with cross functional teams. Solid technical knowledge of cutting tools preferred. Strong problem-solving skills, and drive to get the job done. Proficient with Microsoft Office suite. Must be able to travel 20% of the time.Bachelor’s degree required.

title: Quality Manager
job_description:
Position Description and Purpose:

Roskam Baking Company produces and packages food products with the goal of consistently meeting and exceeding customer expectations for quality, safety and wholesomeness. The role of the Quality Manager is to lead a team of quality resources and provide a systematic and planned approach to managing food safety and quality through a preventative mindset and strong partnership with production departments as well as customers.

Key Responsibilities:

The Quality Manager leads a team of Quality Supervisors and Technicians and is responsible for managing food safety and quality within a business unit. Activities include implementing, leading and managing food safety and food quality programs, developing and strengthening customer relations, providing a strong floor leadership presence and delivering continuous improvement. The individual will be required to provide direction, lead and manage projects, coordinate actions and deliver tangible results/improvements. Core responsibilities will include the following:


Lead and manage a quality team and ensure resources are actively engaged
Proactively plan, identify, develop and implement process and quality system improvements to meet Roskam policy, customer requirements, and/or SQF requirements
Conduct process and/or product risk assessments
Develop and implement preventive controls aligned with regulatory requirements
Develop corrective/preventative action plans, leveraging internal resources to deliver results
Promote GMP compliance
Manage internal and external audit schedules
Deliver and manage training programs
Professionally represent quality to external customers and governmental agencies.
Deliver continuous improvement (reduce/prevent internal failures, deliver right first time)
Manage and mitigate food safety and quality risk

Required and Preferred Qualifications

Required:

Demonstrated people and team leadership skills (5+ years of supervisory experience)
Strong working knowledge of quality systems (5+ years of food safety/quality system management)
Demonstrated experience with GFSI quality system implementation and management
Experience with FDA and GMPs
Strong interpersonal skills to include team building and oral communication
Strong customer facing and presentation skills
Strong project management and planning skills
Demonstrated data analysis and statistical process control skills
Demonstrated accomplishment in the area of continuous improvement
Strong documentation skills

Preferred:

BS degree in Biology, Chemistry, Engineering, Food Science or a related scientific field
Demonstrated SQF implementation skills
Strong regulatory awareness in the food sector


Our Organization

With 5 facilities in the Grand Rapids/Kentwood area, Roskam Baking Company employs over 2000 local professionals and has been committed to the production of high quality foods since 1923. We are seeing continual and rapid growth at our family owned and operated company and work hard to invest in the employees that serve the legacy our company has created!

Compensation and Benefits

We make significant investments into each of our employees by providing:

Highly competitive wages
Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, and 401k
Company Cell Phone
Paid vacation and holidays

title: Software Product Owner
job_description:
Why Packsize?

Ever wonder why the products you order arrive in an oversized box filled with air pillows? Packsize ensures that every product can ship in the smallest box possible. Our custom packaging solutions save time, money, and the environment.

We face interesting challenges every day. We believe our customers have better things to worry about than finding a box for their products. We believe every company can use technology to cut costs, increase productivity, eliminate wasteful practices, and develop a more sustainable packaging supply chain.

What Engineering Does

We work in a Lean-Kanban environment (without ceremonies) as cross-functional teams who develop new products, services, and features of the Packsize platform for our on-demand box making machines, integration with other systems, optimizing complex workflows, and more. We are highly collaborative with Product Managers, UX, senior management, stakeholders, and our customers. We are continuously looking at the health of our engineering culture and how we can learn and improve. We also investigate new technologies and how we will leverage them to solve problems in new and better ways including IoT, cloud, and stream analytics.

 Skills we appreciate

You are strong, proactive, and driven to deliver valuable solutions to your customers.
You are passionate about building a world-class experience for your customers.

You understand collaboration across teams is essential to success. We win or lose as a team.

You play a critical role in creating alignment across the organization.

You are a facilitator and are adept at guiding a group of people towards a decision instead of making it for them. You ask the right questions.

You focus on outcome-driven development. What impact do we want to achieve?

You ask specific questions, understand subtle differences, and challenge what has previously been done.

You create data-driven decisions. You define success metrics.

You focus on results over process.

You are comfortable debating with architects, engineers, company peers, and even customers.

You are curious and creative. You are execution oriented from concept to completion, doing everything possible to ensure success.

You recognize and communicate opportunities, not just technical solutions.

You are an excellent communicator. You communicate the vision and priorities of Packsize.

You welcome honest and candid feedback.

You represent Packsize as a product expert at customer events, industry and technology events.

Salary and Benefits

Packsize offers a competitive benefits package including paid time off, Medical, Dental, Vision, Short Term/Long Term Disability, Life, 401(k) matching, and a bonus program. Salary will be commensurate with experience.

About Packsize

Founded in 2002 and headquartered in Salt Lake City, Packsize is the worlds leading provider of lean packaging systems for businesses with corrugated packaging needs. Consistently recognized by Inc. 5000, ranked by Deloittes Technology Fast 500, and named one of America's Most Promising Companies by Forbes, Packsize delivers Smarter Packaging for a Healthy Planet® through On Demand Packaging®.

Packsize is an Equal Opportunity employer and is committed to diversity in its workforce. In compliance with applicable federal and state laws, Packsize policy of equal employment opportunity prohibits discrimination on the basis of race or ethnicity, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, veterans status, status as a qualified person with a disability, or genetic information. Individuals from historically underrepresented groups, such as minorities, women, qualified persons with disabilities, and protected veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Reasonable accommodations in the application process will be provided to qualified individuals with disabilities.

title: Senior Product Manager, XPOVIO Consumer Marketing
job_description: We are seeking a talented individual to join our team as the Senior Product Manager, XPOVIO Consumer Marketing responsible for Consumer (Patient) Marketing. The selected individual will be responsible for contributing to the development of the consumer strategy, and execution / management of several key marketing programs critical to the success of the XPOVIO brand. This individual will serve as an integral member of the marketing team, and will work closely with Field Sales, Sales Training, Medical Affairs, Legal, and Regulatory to develop and deploy consumer tactics. This position requires a highly motivated individual who can work effectively in a dynamic environment with a high degree of flexibility and creative problem solving. This position will report to the Brand Lead of XPOVIO U.S. Marketing and will be based in Newton, MA. Initiate, lead, and drive marketing work projects/tactics/resources, including direction and day-to-day management of agencies of record and additional vendors as needed  Maintain and refine existing, and lead the development of new Consumer educational tactics, programs and initiatives Work closely with Brand Lead to align on strategy and execution Ensure project timelines are met Attend review committee meetings to represent new and existing resources, and effectively manage annual renewals / expirations Manage SOWs, POs and marketing budget / monthly accruals to a high degree of accuracy  Work closely with the U.S. sales force to adapt strategies, tools, training and messages to drive success for U.S. business  Participate in several brand critical initiatives such as but not limited to, brand planning, market research, and message & creative evolution Ensure that all marketing processes, documents and tactics are developed and implemented in accordance with Karyopharm corporate compliance guidelinesBachelor's degree and minimum of 3+ years of marketing experience in the biotech/pharmaceutical industry, preferably in specialty or oncology spaceProven track record managing the overall operations of a large Marketing initiative directly supporting the field sales teamAbility to effectively communicate and collaborate across functionsTrack record of applying strong analytical skills – including commercial, financial acumen and budget management – to enhance decision-makingWillingness to proactively identify issues and opportunities in the business and make the appropriate recommendations, and/or take the appropriate action to get things doneDemonstrated ability to work independently in a fast paced, innovative and performance driven environmentFlexible and able to adapt to changing prioritiesKnowledge of the Legal and Regulatory environment in pharmaceutical marketing; including Medical/Legal/Regulatory Review Committee process Experience managing vendors and holding them accountable to timelines and project cost estimatesHigh level of proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)Karyopharm Therapeutics is a global commercial-stage pharmaceutical company focused on the discovery and development of novel first-in-class drugs directed against nuclear transport targets for the treatment of cancer and other major diseases.

title: Academy Program Manager (Men's)
job_description:
Want to make a difference? Join an organization that has been transforming lives for over 40 years!
Prison Fellowship® trains and inspires churches and communities—inside and outside of prison—to support the restoration of those affected by incarceration. We equip correctional leaders, volunteers, and incarcerated men and women to make prisons more rehabilitative places; we advocate for a more restorative criminal justice system; and we collaborate with churches and local service providers to support former prisoners, their families, and their communities.
What we are looking for:

A driven and mission focused Academy Program Manager to lead the day-to-day operations within the Montana State Prison in Deer Lodge, MT. The successful candidate will have a solid understanding of basic principles of the Christian faith, 7+ years of program management experience, including budgeting and managing staff; 3+ years’ experience building effective teams; a Bachelor’s degree in social science, business, or related field or equivalent relevant experience including:


+Proven ability to deliver a classroom curriculum using transformational teaching techniques and to provide case planning and management for program participants within the prison.
+Experience recruiting, interviewing, and selecting program participants and volunteers to ensure a positive, pro-social environment.
+Strong communication skills to ensure adequate communication, coordination and compliance with the Department of Correction’s policies and procedures. Relational ability to work with wardens and other corrections staff to approve and arrange special program needs.
+Outstanding interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with volunteers, wardens, corrections staff, and other stakeholders.



What we offer:
A team oriented, mission driven, supportive environment with cutting edge technology solutions and tremendous opportunity for growth and development. Our outstanding benefits package includes paid leave starting at 39 days (14 holidays, 15 vacation days, 10 sick days), retirement account funding and much more!
Visit us at https://www.prisonfellowship.org/resources/careers/employment/ to apply and to learn more about Prison Fellowship.
Check out our YouTube channel to see how Prison Fellowship is transforming lives!

title: Senior Data Product Manager
job_description:
DescriptionThe Senior Data Product Manager will help create and deliver best-in-class data products and drive the creation and execution of product roadmaps for innovative solutions based on data capabilities such as machine learning, geospatial analysis, natural language processing and advanced data visualization. This individual will collaborate with key business leaders to gather requirements and use cases and organize the features and capabilities to build world class insight driven data products that change the business and drive business value. The Senior Data Product Manager will apply user experience and design thinking concepts to create products that are adopted beyond technical users and into the broader organization. Finally, the Senior Data Product Manager will design, strategize and drive delivery of data products that will lead to better health outcomes for our members.


Define & communicate the overall vision, objectives and goals of the Advanced Analytics practice including data products and data science. Articulate the minimum viable product needs. Create, refine, socialize and prioritize the Product backlog.Enable delivery of Product Backlog by presenting backlog to team; creating, owning and refining well-formed user stories and artifacts that describe and detail new products, features and services based on feedback from team, creating acceptance criteria with the team, and accepting stories as they are completeUnderstand the challenges and tools available to Data Engineers and Data Scientists including enough architecture, machine learning and statistics to collaborate effectively with technical staffContribute to the maturity, performance and growth of the Advanced Analytics practicePresent progress on product roadmaps to senior leadership in sprint demos. Communicate the stages of advanced analytics engineering such as data blending, feature engineering, statistical modelling, etc.Represents the team, when needed, to external stakeholders, leaders and other teams to ensure alignment and understanding progress of the teamCollaborate closely with Engagement Managers to understand the vision and objectives of their data roadmaps and align capabilities and products with their needsAbility to align and motivate a team to achieve objectivesIdentify opportunities for process optimization and redesign that will allow us to accomplish objectives more quickly and at a higher level of probabilityWork one on one with each team member to ensure their growth and accountability to the team is achieved.Cultivate a diversity of thought in design sessions to ensure the delivery of the right features for the right outcomes.Additional duties as assigned.

Minimum Requirements:

title: Connectivity Product Manager
job_description:
JOB TITLE:
Connectivity Product Manager
JOB DESCRIPTION SUMMARY:
Connectivity Product Manager is responsible for the product management of the global connectivity product portfolio of IPLC, IEPL, Virtual Lease Line, Cable, DIA, IP Transit as well as MPLS VPN, IPsec VPN and etc. The product manager is assuming the whole responsibility on the product whole life management including the market analysis & strategy, product requirements, product planning, product development management, launching, new product sales support as well as the innovation management.
The Product Manager will serve as the internal interface to CUG counterpart in the market department on the specific product(s) and the external interface for the partnership management.
This position reports to the General Manager of Marketing Department.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO:

Understand the existing global connectivity product portfolio, strategy, cost and revenue structures, as well as the existing interconnection with the global providers.
Study the industry trends, capabilities, competitive environment to output the market analysis ,strategy and long term product plan
Collet the market requirements for the competitive products planning with business case study and drive the development aligning the CUG product roadmap
Prepare the product white paper, customer documents and the product promotion document
In charge of the new product introduction program including the acceptance test organizing , new product promotion
Take lead of the new product internal training program.
In charge of the product cost and pricing management, support the pricing team for the new product pricing system set up.
Manage the partnership for the product/solution optimization including the cost reduction
In charge of the product life cycle management.

REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor’s Degree or above on the telecommunication, electronic engineering, computing science or related majors
3 years product management or equivalent experience on cable, telecommunications, ISP or etc.
Self-starter who can quickly contribute across a variety of products and handle increasing scope of responsibility.
Ability to work with cross functional teams and comfortable to work with teams in different time zones
Bilingual in English and Mandarin for speaking and writing
Excellent interpersonal and communications skills; verbally, written, face-to-face and over the phone with partners and co-workers
Strong drives to achieve results and be enthusiastic and energetic
Travel availability within region to customers and vendors

Herndon, VA
Edison, NJ

We negotiate based on experience and relevancy.

title: Engineering Manager Quality - St. Louis, MO
job_description:
Tuesday, May 5, 2020
The world’s leading companies start with Watlow. Watlow®, a privately-owned company, is the industry leader in the design, manufacture and integration of complete thermal systems including electric heaters, temperature sensors, temperature controllers, power controllers and supporting software. At Watlow, we are constantly driven to do more to help our customers. We take on big technical challenges. We are committed to projects that help our fellow human beings and we strive to learn more. From single components to high performance systems, we bring our thermal expertise to numerous applications, including semiconductor processing, energy processes, diesel, foodservice equipment, life sciences and others.
Overview of Role: The Quality Manager role in Saint Louis, Mo is a challenging opportunity for an individual interested in expanding their Leadership and Quality Systems knowledge. This role will require daily engagement with Quality Engineering and Operational teams to meet daily business needs of the site. The ideal candidate will be able to work individually as well as in teams and be a coach and mentor. This role will require leadership in support of all phases of Operations using autonomy, mastery and purpose while serving as a member of the site leadership team.

This is an exciting opportunity to provide leadership in the implementation of quality systems, training systems, and manufacturing processes at our Saint Louis, MO Advance Development Technology and Manufacturing Center of Excellence site. This position will enable us to meet the needs of the Watlow Semiconductor and Thermal Systems business units serving customer in the medical, nuclear, semiconductor, food and transportation industries. As our Quality Manager, you will develop, apply, and maintain quality standards for our processes, materials, services and our end products. You will report directly to our Director of Global Quality and be a member of the Saint Louis Leadership team, representing the voice of the customer in this role. You will design and implement methods and procedures for inspecting, testing and evaluating products and/or production equipment. You will be engaged with both internal and external customers. You will also lead root cause analysis efforts and improvement efforts to ensure customer/Watlow quality and customer standards are met. You will coach and develop those in your department in alignment with Watlow Way and Coaching Forward principles. You will be a member of the Quality Leadership Team leading the organization toward our Watlow 2023 Vision and the Watlow Quality Vision 2023.

Your Key Responsibilities will include:


 Leadership and coaching of quality team members

 Subject matter expert for quality skills such as APQP, PPAP, Copy Exact, POR and complex quality tools

 Formulates or assists in formulating quality control policies and procedures

 Focuses on improving products or processes that impact one or more technical areas or across multiple manufacturing locations by researching new and existing business and quality systems within and outside of the organization

 Implementing and training of the best solution for business and/or quality systems to address the needs of the semi-conductor business unit

 Performs and assist with internal process audits, host or assist with customer process audits

 Coaches teams on application of cause chains, 5-Why, Ishikawa diagrams, 8D, RCCA, A3 systems thinking, creative problem solving and the development of trade-off curves

 Expertly performs, leads, and approves analyses of failed or returned materials and create effective corrective and preventive action (CAPA) plans

 Member of the Quality Leadership Team, leading and supporting action/projects in support of enterprise needs.


Qualifications:

Must have:



 Advanced degree in field of specialization or bachelor’s degree and related experience, or High School/GED certificate with 10 years directly equivalent experience

 Expertise in Advanced Product Quality Planning (APQP), PPAP PQP, CRAM’s, POR, and Copy Exact and methodologies

Additional success factors:



 Strong team player who advocates for team-based solutions that are safe, quality based, honest and sensible

 Semi-conductor/Medical/Nuclear/Automotive experience

 Six Sigma Black Belt certification highly desired

 Demonstrated high level of mastery of advanced systematic, creative and lean problem-solving tools

 Demonstrated ability to create and foster a leadership environment that is conducive to teamwork and demonstrates a genuine concern for the personal development of the team’s members


Watlow thanks all those who apply

Only those who are best qualified may be contacted for an interview

Watlow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer including Protected Veterans and Individuals with disabilities

title: Senior Project Manager (HCP) - McCann Health
job_description:
As a Senior Project Manager, you will manage a variety of projects that span online and offline tactics. You will also be expected to be an expert facilitator and manager of multiple personalities and will be responsible for managing/working with an internal team of Project Managers and Account Executives as well as oversee Production teams. Your overall mission is to provide the highest-quality client experience and products while maintaining process and profitability for the agency.

About the Role

Establish and enforce agency processes and procedures
Identify best practices and develop new systems/processes/tools as required
Work with Finance and Creative Resource teams to establish an agency capacity plan for the assessment of agency staffing needs in relation to client work in progress as well as approved SOW
Coordinate and manage agency internal production teams, client/outside vendors, third-party providers, etc.
Monitor adherence to agency process, project approvals, scheduling, time, and financial management policies
Facilitate quality assurance reviews for online and offline projects to ensure highest quality deliverables
Help to recruit, hire, and develop staff and support ongoing departmental training initiatives and resources
Be the hub of information for Account, Creative, and Internal support staff
Be available to provide support when needed “get your hand dirty”
Manage expectation and update timelines using Microsoft Project/Smartsheet
Support Account team and monitor health of brand finances
Supervise and provide support for all deliverables from inception to completion
Lead internal meetings with personnel of all levels.

About You

You have 5-7 years of Project Management experience.
You have excellent communication skills.
You have Pharmaceutical advertising experience, DTC a plus.
You have experience with integrated deliverables.
You have strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills.
You’re highly organized and willing to go the extra mile.

About McCann Health NY

McCann Health New York is born from the union of McCann HumanCare and McCann Healthcare, experts respectively in consumer and HCP communications. We have come together to form a singularity of comprehensive health and wellness wisdom. This integration means we can raise the bar on the notion of a “full-service agency.” We take integration, client experience, product, brand, communications planning and service expertise to unheard-of levels. We’re always on the lookout for inspired and inspiring talent. Whether you’re a creative genius, a next-level business thinker, a client-whisperer, or a tech-focused science geek, connect with us, we'd love to talk. Change is always good. Now make a change for the better. Join the momentum at McCann Health New York. No ego. No fear. No settling.Required Skills

title: Branch Manager II
job_description:
Branch Manager II


Department



Branch Sales


Location



Gresham, OR



Apply Now
Why Advantis? We’re more than branches.

If you want to work for a values-driven organization that believes that a great member experience starts with a great employee experience, you’ll love working at Advantis.

Our vision - to be the best financial institution our members can choose and the best place our employees have ever worked. That means you get a different kind of career experience. The Advantis experience includes opportunities for personal growth, meaningful work, and proud recognition of accomplishments. Come join our team!

The Branch Manager II is responsible for directing the daily branch activities, generally in a high volume branch. Performs all management functions at assigned branch including supervision of all staff. Provides operational and systems support to the branch. Handles a variety of complex customer and operational transactions requiring a high degree of expertise in specialized operational areas. Responsible for scheduling work, training and providing cross-training as necessary. Develops personnel in branches and participates in a sales and service culture consistent with the credit union’s goal to deliver exceptional quality, expand member relationships, increase revenues, and build member base. Ensures attainment of growth and profitability goals of the branch. Partners closely with other departments throughout Advantis to ensure consistent application and execution of policies and procedures. Fosters a positive working environment for employee empowerment through coaching and support.

Responsibilities of this role include:

Ensures that employees support the organizations member service and satisfaction objectives, and that members are served in an extraordinary manner to deliver on the Advantis brand promise.
Responsible for the effective and efficient performance of branch operations. Manages and oversees expenses. Pursues cost-saving measures.
Continually seeks ways to improve branch operations, productivity and to meet established goals.
Develops and manages elements of a sales culture, including product knowledge, sales philosophy, sales strategy, sales planning, data infrastructure, sales techniques, cross-sell/referral, sales training/coaching, sales tracking (performance) and recognition/reward systems.
Effectively provides leadership through being a positive role model, setting goals, coaching, and ongoing communication. Encourages teamwork and cooperation among all personnel.
Responsible for hiring, coaching, training, and performance management of branch staff including monthly one-on-one coaching meetings and writing annual performance reviews.
Establishes goals, forecasts staffing needs, and determines infrastructure requirements.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent combination of education and relevant experience required.
7+ years previous financial institution operations experience, and 5+ years lending experience required.
4+ years experience in a management or supervisory capacity; well developed leadership, management and coaching skills required.
Demonstrated ability to integrate branch operation plans with organizational strategy.
Must have excellent organizational abilities in order to manage multiple priorities and conflicting deadlines.
Proficient in use of personal computer and credit union’s computer system(s) for member account management.
Must be technology savvy, with the ability to learn new software applications quickly.
Professional and friendly communication style.

A Great Place to Work!

At Advantis, we help our members succeed financially. We serve our members with a purpose and a passion, and our talented team delivers uncommon value with every interaction.

We inspire fresh ideas, bold creativity, and outside-the-box ingenuity by asking, “How can we do banking differently?” We celebrate individual achievement and excellence with proud recognition and upward opportunity. We work together in a spirit of “together we can” teamwork, mutual respect, and a unified effort to reach common goals. We work hard but we get to do it in an atmosphere that’s upbeat and fun. We live our passionate community commitment to strengthen, educate, and elevate the prosperity of the communities we’re proud to call home.

If you like to work with passion and purpose, collaborate, elevate, and celebrate, Advantis Credit Union is the place for you. Advantis is one of Oregon’s largest member-owned financial cooperatives, serving the Portland areas for over 90 years.

What is it like to work at Advantis? Watch our videoclick here.

Advantis Credit Union is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

OverviewAyco is an industry pioneer and preeminent leader of company-sponsored financial counseling services.

We believe companies best serve their stakeholders and the greater economy when their employees’ financial lives are clear, understood and in their own control. For nearly 50 years, we’ve aspired to deliver a more productive and engaged workforce to our clients by providing their employees a path to financial well-being through holistic and personalized services tailored for each stage of the career cycle—from entry-level to C-suite.

Training: Ayco has a best-in-class new hire training program, covering the technical and practical elements of the job. Initial new hire training includes a combination of classroom learning, practical exercises, and shadowing of existing associates. Through Ayco and Goldman Sachs University, new hires have access to classes that focus on building foundational professional and technical skills, to culture and learning focused training. We take a personal approach to talent development and foster an environment that values different perspectives, challenges thinking and maximizes the potential of our people. Our annual and ongoing feedback ensures our people and their managers have the information they need to excel in their careers.

Diversity & Inclusion: Ayco values the different perspectives and experiences our associates bring. The firm supports the Ayco Diversity Network, an employee-led initiative open to all associates that provides education and awareness on topics of interest to diverse communities. In addition, our firm wide diversity and inclusion efforts expand professional and career development opportunities through programs such as the Women’s Advisor Initiative to support our commitment to having the best talent at all levels.

Benefits & Wellness: From benefits to wellness, we aim to support your commitment to your job as well as your priorities and interests outside of work.

Career Advancement: Ayco offers coaching, mentoring and on-the-job learning that supports your growth and development.

title: Lead Product Manager - Tutors Marketplace
job_description:
Course Hero is scaling! We are looking for a driven Lead Product Manager to own the product roadmap for our tutoring platform on our Content team. You will primarily be in charge of optimizing the end-to-end tutoring platform and experience. You'll help lead our efforts in crafting exciting new products and features that grow and scale our tutoring community.

You'll use part strategy, part magic, with lots of experimentation and analysis. This is a role that requires business acumen, a focus on customer needs/ wants/ desires, and an obsession with data to build habit-forming loops, combined with myriad tactical wins to increase tutor retention, efficiency and quality. You will partner closely with a dedicated team of engineers, designers, data scientists and operations personnel to build and execute against your roadmap. You'll also collaborate cross-functionally with other product teams to ensure your work is aligned with the rest of the company's strategy and communicate updates with internal stakeholders.

Here are some ways you'll make an impact!

Own the product strategy to revolutionize the experience for our tutoring community
Define and regularly monitor KPIs, success metrics, and other analytics to gauge your product's performance. You'll collaborate with our analytics team and use data-driven approaches to help guide your decisions and continuously improve your product
Run experiments to understand how to improve your product and user flows, and drive growth for your key metrics
Partner with UX Research, Design, Marketing, Data Science, Engineering, Operations, and AI to achieve our goals.

Are you our next Lead Product Manager for our Tutoring Platform?

4+ years working in B2C companies - ideally on Q&A, marketplace, aggregators or consumer web products.
Demonstrated success delivering products in a fast-growing environment.
Highly analytical and have experience running A/B tests. You use your strong SQL skills to dig through data to find key insights that will drive our business forward.
You have successfully managed a team of engineers, designers and data scientists. Bonus if you've managed other PMs.
Passionate about product and could talk endlessly about startup strategies and frameworks for decision-making.
Confidence to lead with experience & intuition but validate through data-driven experimentation and user research.
Excellent communicator. Your can drive product vision, execute a roadmap, and make decisions that win for your team.

Bonus Points!

Supply side of marketplaces.
Quantitative degree.
Experience working with editorial workflows.
Passion for evolving education to help students graduate.

About Us:

At Course Hero, we have an awesome team and a truly engaging culture. We are customer-focused, collaborative, responsible, gritty and we love to learn. Our bold mission is to help students graduate confident and prepared!

We are not the only ones that think we're onto something big. Course Hero has been recognized as the 278th Fastest Growing Company in North America on Deloitte's 2019 Technology Fast 500 and also 2019's One of the Best Places to Work in the Bay Area by the Bay Area News Group. Read up on some of our recent news coverage, blog, and learn more about usto see what it is like to work with our team.

Benefits & Perks!

Competitive salary and stock options
Full medical coverage (medical, dental, vision)
401(k) program with match
Education Reimbursement
Quarterly team events and outings (Sporting Events, Escape Rooms, Go-Kart Racing, Karaoke, Bowling and much more!)
Free lunches twice a week, on-site cafe discount, plus an endless snack and drink supply
Onsite gym – Pacific Shores Center – Classes – Pool – Spa – Rock Wall - Massages!
Commuter benefits, shuttle service from Redwood City, and cell-phone allowance
Local move benefit to move within 10 miles of our office!
8 hours per quarter paid time for volunteering for a cause of your choice

title: Consultant - Project Manager, Clinical Supply Operations (3109) (3186)
job_description:
Consultant - Project Manager, Clinical Supply Operations (3109) (3186)

   Consultant - Project Manager, Clinical Supply Operations

CONTEXT & INITIATIVE DESCRIPTION

Our Pharmaceutical Client is seeking an experienced Project Manager in the area of Clinical Supply Operations to strategize, implement and fully execute several ongoing projects and critical initiatives spanning their current portfolio.

This Client is ramping up several projects, mostly within Oncology, with product launches starting in 2020 and need Project Management expertise in order to prioritize and maintain strict deliverables and timelines. This position will report to the Director of Project Management.

DUTIES/EXPECTATIONS OF THIS ROLE

Responsible for on time delivery of clinical supplies for studies across the entire portfolio of productsResponsible for ensuring supplies for assigned projects are manufactured, packaged, labeled and distributed on time to support all Phases (1-4) of required studiesAssure availability of drug product, interpret clinical protocols, develop Supply Plan Agreements Develop and Maintain study-level budgetsWork closely with Supply Planning and Logistics Team to ensure all tasks and supply plans are executed in a timely manner and within budgetEvaluate, select, and implement contract manufacturing, packaging, and labeling Negotiate work orders/proposals, in collaboration with Supply Chain and Logistics and oversee operationsAct as primary liaison with clinical personnel on assigned projectsParticipate in the design of overall clinical plans and study protocols. Recommend type and method of packaging, labeling, and distribution. Translate protocol requirements and study milestones into an actionable Supply Plan AgreementCollaborate with clinical teams on forecasting and delivering supply assessments to the appropriate planning functions Recommend matching placebo drug sources Develop appropriate strategies for regulatory CMC filing (domestic and international)Identify emerging trends, technologies, and best practices and implement as appropriateAssist in the establishment of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and guidelines related to production planning and scheduling, inventory management, distribution, transportation, disposition of returned/unused materials, etc.Responsible for overseeing an annual budget of 10M+

MUST HAVES – QUALIFICATION SUMMARY

7+ years of related experience, including Project Management, Clinical Supply Management, and/or Pharmaceutical DevelopmentExperience on the sponsor sideB.S./B.A. degree

NICE-TO-HAVES

Oncology ExperienceExperience with creation of Supply Planning Tools

TRAVEL & LOCATION

New Jersey. Onsite 3 days/week and ability to work offsite 2 days/week

START & TERM

Immediately, 24 months

CONSULTING RATE

Competitive
 

 

Job Details


State

New Jersey=NJ

title: Cloud Product Manager
job_description:
JOB TITLE:
Cloud Product Manager
JOB DESCRIPTION SUMMARY:
Cloud Product Manager is responsible for the product management of the Cloud product portfolio of Cloud, Cloud Computing, Cloud Security, Cloud Interconnection, CDN, Cloud bond, Customized Data Center and etc. The product manager is assuming the whole responsibility on the product whole life management including the market analysis & strategy, product requirements, product planning, product development management, launching, new product sales support as well as the innovation management.
The Product Manager will serve as the internal interface to China Unicom Global (CUG) counterparts in the marketing department on specific product(s) and the external interface of the partnership management.
This position reports to the General Manager of Marketing Department.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO:

Understand the existing Cloud Service product portfolio, strategy, cost and revenue structures, as well as the existing partnership.
Study the industry trends, capabilities, competitive environment to output the market analysis ,strategy and long term product plan
Collet the market requirements for the competitive products planning with business case study and drive the development aligning the CUG product roadmap
Prepare the product white paper, customer documents and the product promotion document
In charge of the new product introduction program including the acceptance test organizing , new product promotion
Take lead of the new product internal training program.
In charge of the product cost and pricing management, support the pricing team for the new product pricing system set up.
Manage the partnership for the product/solution optimization including the cost reduction
In charge of the product life cycle management.

REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor’s Degree or above on the telecommunication, electronic engineering, computing science or related majors, Cloud knowledge and work experience are preferred.
3 years product management or equivalent experience on cloud and related industry.
Self-starter who can quickly contribute across a variety of products and handle increasing scope of responsibility.
Ability to work with cross functional teams and comfortable to work with teams in different time zones
Bilingual in English and Mandarin for speaking and writing
Excellent interpersonal and communications skills; verbally, written, face-to-face and over the phone with partners and co-workers
Strong drives to achieve results and be enthusiastic and energetic
Travel availability within region to customers and vendors

LOCATION:
Herndon, VA
Edison, NJ
SALARY REQUIREMENT:
We negotiate based on experience and relevancy.
BENEFITS:
We offer a competitive benefit plan.
DISCRIMINATION DISCLOSURE:
CUA is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, protected veteran status, or disability.

title: Consumer/Private Bank Product Manager
job_description:
Purpose of the Position:

The VP, Consumer/Private Bank Product Manager serves as a consumer/private banking product line manager for specialty and ancillary products and services. He/she will directly contribute to and drive the design and deployment of new or enhanced retail/private bank products, product deployment and third-party programs that increase customer adoption and retention, thus improving the Bank’s profitability. The VP has a deep understanding and will manage each product/program and how it affects key metrics (such as revenue) as well as the customer experience. The VP, Consumer/Private Bank Product Manager maintains an understanding of the retail/private banking market and local competitors to ensure Broadway’s consumer/private banking and digital products remain attractive, competitive and profitable. The VP, Consumer/Private Bank Product Manager must also be able to toggle line of business initiatives against competing features and priorities.

Key Accountabilities:

Provide strategic leadership and direction for retail and private banking products and along with the line of business leaders, has responsibility for the achievement of profit/loss, growth, utilization, and retention goals and all compliance requirements.

Leads and coaches a team of product/digital specialists who are dedicated to the growth and enhanced customer experience of the consumer, private and mortgage lines of business.

Manages outside third-party relationships to improve share of wallet, competitiveness and adoption of retail and private bank products including debit card and rewards program(s).

Aligns with other lines of business to deliver communications bank-wide regarding customer-facing projects and initiatives.

Along with Business Banking team, manages consumer and private banking credit card vendor relationship including data analysis, promotions, ERM and introduction of new products or current product enhancements. Works with Marcom and Sales and Service to execute promotions and employee engagement across the Enterprise.

Provides strategic product direction to digital lending and account origination vendor(s). Works with multiple stakeholders to gain approvals, feedback and deployment roadmap from consumer banking prospective. Collaborates with Reporting Specialist and AVP, Digital Product Manager on change control procedures for vendor.

Manages check printing vendor relationship and add-on programs that enhance and communicate bank value. Will manage the full life-cycle of the vendor relationship.

Develops retail/private bank deposit and loan products and strategies that support the bank’s strategic plans and objectives that align across all lines of business.

Attends and contributes to several internal committees including: Pricing Review, Consumer Credit, Sales and Service Communications, Responsible Innovation, Product Council and other ad hoc committees.

Directs the development and enhancements and revisions of retail and private bank deposit and loan products.

Works with the Sales and Service network and the eBanking team throughout new product development, testing, and implementation/deployment phases to ensure feature integrity and customer acceptance.

Coordinates budget, planning, and sales reporting/tracking of retail and private bank initiatives.

Partners with Marketing Communication, eBanking and other product teams to plan for product release communications & adoption campaigns.

Leads and manages special projects as requested.

Position: Consumer/Private Bank Product Manager |  Division: Consumer Banking Management

Work Days: Mon - Fri | Work Hours: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM

Purpose of the Position:

The VP, Consumer/Private Bank Product Manager serves as a consumer/private banking product line manager for specialty and ancillary products and services. He/she will directly contribute to and drive the design and deployment of new or enhanced retail/private bank products, product deployment and third-party programs that increase customer adoption and retention, thus improving the Bank’s profitability. Along with Business Banking team, manages consumer and private banking credit card vendor relationship including data analysis, promotions, ERM and introduction of new products or current product enhancements. Partners with Marketing Communication, eBanking and other product teams to plan for product release communications & adoption campaigns.
Leads and manages special projects as requested.

Competencies and Skills:

Understanding the consumer retail and private banking environment.
Knowledge of direct-to-consumer financial services.
Demonstrated leadership and negotiation skills.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.

Work Experience Requirements:

Retail banking and private bank experience preferred.
Demonstrated business acumen, strategic thinking and execution skills.
Demonstrated success in helping grow a consumer retail and private bank business.
Knowledge of financial services and products.
Knowledge of platform delivery systems.
Knowledge of relationship management software.
Knowledge of applicable deposit related regulations and compliance requirements.

Education Requirements:

Four-year college degree in Finance, Accounting, Marketing, Business administration or related field required.

Other Qualifications:

Experience interfacing with outside vendors and cross-functional teams.
Promotes a culture of collaboration and teamwork across organizational boundaries; willing to optimize business results and encourage the overall growth of Broadway Bank.
Ability to work enthusiastically with people outside of their immediate team to drive consensus and results.
Energetic and self-driven personality with a persistent desire to learn and grow professionally.

Experience with EnAct and CRM preferred.
Experience with Bank Analyst preferred.

title: Environmental, Health, and Safety Manager
job_description:
Supervisor’s Title: Director of Environmental, Health and Safety

Department: EHS

Exempt Status: Exempt

Location: St. Johns, Michigan

Job Summary

Provide daily guidance and direction to the facility managers concerning safety program implementation, safety training, recordkeeping, and reporting. Manages, plans, and implements programs to reduce or eliminate occupational injuries, illnesses, deaths, and financial losses. Directs and coordinates activities of environmental programs and the operation and treatment of water and wastewater by performing the following duties personally or through subordinate personnel.

Essential Functions

Manage site safety, security, environmental and sustainability programsDevelops accident-prevention and loss-control systems and programs for incorporation into operational policies of organization.Manages and coordinates safety activities through subordinate supervisory personnel to ensure implementation of safety activities throughout the organization.Identifies and appraises conditions that could produce accidents and financial losses and evaluates the potential extent of injuries resulting from accidents.Conducts or directs research studies to identify hazards and evaluate loss producing potential of a given system, operation, or process.Directs and coordinates, through subordinate supervisory personnel, activities of operations department to obtain optimum use of equipment, facilities, and personnel.Compiles, analyzes and interprets statistical data related to exposure factors concerning occupational illnesses and accidents and prepares reports for the information of personnel concerned.Maintains liaison with outside organizations, such as fire departments, mutual aid societies, and rescue teams to assure information exchange and mutual assistance.Devises methods to evaluate safety program and conducts or directs evaluations.Evaluates technical and scientific publications concerned with EHS management and participates in activities of related professional organizations to update knowledge of safety program developments.May store and retrieve statistical data.Each employee shall comply with occupational safety and health standards and all rules, regulations, and orders issued pursuant to the Occupational Safety and Health Act which are applicable to his/her own actions and conduct.Complies with all applicable food safety regulations and mandates (Safe Quality Foods, Food and Drug Admin, Pasteurized Milk Ordinance)Conducts audits, analyzing and collating environmental performance data and reporting information to internal staff, clients and regulatory bodies.Manages environmental strategy budgets and capital expenditure projectsDevelops or revises standard operational and working practices and observes workers to ensure compliance with standards.Monitors changes to environmental legislation and initiatives at Federal, State and Local levels to ensure compliance.Compiles, stores, and retrieves production and regulatory data.Utilizes GPS processes, driving zero losses and upholds the culture of MWC non-negotiables.Each employee shall comply with occupational safety and health standards and all rules, regulations, and orders issued pursuant to the Occupational Safety and Health Act which are applicable to his/her own actions and conduct.Complies with all applicable food safety regulations and mandates (Safe Quality Foods, Food and Drug Admin, Pasteurized Milk Ordinance)

Delivering on Glanbia’s Values:

“Showing Respect” - Research issues & incidents with internal teams, business partners, and customers in a collaborative manner that includes professional, honest and transparent communication.

“Find a Better Way” - Work with internal and external teams to implement process improvements and/or procedural changes that eliminate non-value added activities and drive more business value.

“Winning Together” - Assist with the training of new team members. Facilitate or oversee training and standard operating procedure reviews to ensure new hires develop proficiency of role.

“The Customer’s Champion” – Proactively engage in supporting our customer needs on an end to end basis and strive to meet or exceed SLA timelines. Take ownership of customer requests and engage with internal teams as needed and within a timely manner.

“Performance Matters” – Meet or exceed all key metrics in line with expectations for role. Continually update knowledge of products, product changes, processes, and services offered to deliver a dynamic customer experience.

Additional Functions

Perform other duties as assigned.Ensure after hours response in the event of plant outage and emergencies

Qualifications

Requires a Bachelor’s degree in related field and a minimum of 6-8 years related experience and/or training or equivalent combination of education and experience.Ability to prioritize tasks and handle multiple projects simultaneously.Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations.Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Understanding of TPM and similar continuous improvement methodologiesAbility to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.Ability to define problems, collects data, establishes facts, and draw valid conclusions and deal with a variety of concrete variables.Provide leadership to others through example and sharing of knowledge/skill Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form.Necessary personal computer skills including electronic mail, word processing, spreadsheet, graphics, HMIComply with all EHS policies, practices, and procedures. Report all unsafe activities to supervisor and/or the Facility Safety Manager.Participate in proactive team efforts to achieve departmental and company goals.

Physical Demands

Regularly involves talking or listening and the use of hands and fingers.Frequently involves sitting, standing and walking, and reaching with hands and arms.Occasionally involves stooping, crawling or kneeling and climbing, or balancing.

Physical Requirements

Must be able to lift and carry items weighing up to 50 pounds.Manual dexterity sufficient to reach/handle items works with the fingers, and perceive attributes of objects and materials.Involves light physical activity performing non-strenuous daily operations of a productive/technical nature.Should possess close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to bring objects into sharp focus.

Typical Environmental Conditions

May be exposed to loud noise levels (i.e., manufacturing equipment).May work in areas with mechanical moving parts, poor lighting, and/or above ground with a danger of fall.May be exposed to air-contamination, toxic chemicals, wet/humid environment, extreme heat (non-weather), and outdoor weather conditions.

Travel Requirements

Minimal overnight travel (up to 10%) by land and/or air.

Disclaimer

Must perform the essential duties and responsibilities with or without reasonable accommodation efficiently and accurately without causing significant safety threat to self or others. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and/or skills required of all personnel so classified.

Are you someone who likes to make it happen, make it better, and make it fun? If so, our company offers you an excellent opportunity to do exciting work and develop a career in a dynamic and innovative environment that is all about making you and our business successful.

title: Program Manager - Gas
job_description:
LaBella Associates was established in 1978 and is a certified Great Place To Work. We are headquartered in Rochester, NY with offices across New York, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Connecticut, Maine, Virginia, North and South Carolina, and Madrid, Spain. LaBella is a multi-disciplined architectural and engineering firm dedicated to client satisfaction through teamwork, respect, and trust. We provide services that take a project from start to finish—from an initial study to determine a project’s feasibility to construction administration and start up, and everything in between.

Job Overview

We are currently seeking qualified candidates for consideration to fill an open Program Manager position in our Program Management Services Division. This position will be located at our Client’s Pittsfield, MA office.

The Program Management Services Division at LaBella provides comprehensive management services for complex projects and multi-year capital programs. Project teams are established to provide a customized mix of business consulting, project management, financial control and monitoring, administrative, and technical support services.

The Program Manager is required to coordinate a multi-disciplined team and will be assigned to a program managing multiple gas utility infrastructure projects. As a leader of the assigned program, required competencies include leadership, quality assurance, budgeting, scheduling, tracking and cost control methods based on proven best management practices and relevant experience.

Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Civil or Mechanical Engineering
At least four (4) years of Project Management experience preferably managing natural gas or underground utility infrastructure projects.
Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification from PMI or the ability to obtain within 12 months of hire; this is a non-negotiable condition of employment.
Two years of experience with Quality Management System standards (i.e. ISO-9001)
The ability to work as part of a team and independently
Strong soft skills, ability to keep multiple lines of communication open
SAP experience preferred
Ability to travel

The offer of employment for this position will be conditioned upon a satisfactory criminal background check.

Company Perks

Health/Dental Insurance
401k Plan
Short & Long Term Disability
Profit Sharing
Paid Time Off
Verizon Wireless Discount
Gym Reimbursement
Tuition Reimbursement
Referral Bonus Program
Wellness Program
Team Building Events
Community Service Events


LaBella Associates does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiting professionals or agencies, nor do we accept resumes from any source that does not reference a specific, open position. LaBella Associates will not be responsible for any fees arising from the use of resume submitted by recruiting professionals or agencies that do not have a current placement fee agreement with LaBella Associates. All initial communication with recruiting professionals or agencies must go through human resources.

title: Automotive Customer Program Manager
job_description:
Swift Navigation, Inc. was founded in 2012 to make GPS positioning technology more accurate and affordable. Its GPS and GNSS positioning products are available at a fraction of the price of the competition and deliver 100 times better accuracy than the GPS in a cell phone. Swift Navigation's technology benefits a multitude of industries and applicationsincluding autonomous vehicles, drones, precision agriculture, robotics, surveying and space. With its innovation and technology honored by Inc.'s 2016 and Forbes 2017 30 Under 30 lists, Swift Navigation is enabling a world where fields farm themselves, drones fly safely and autonomous transportation can take you home. Swift Navigation provides an end-to-end GNSS solution with a line of Piksi® Multi and Duro® receivers and Skylark Cloud Corrections Service. Learn more online at swiftnav.com.

Swift is seeking an outstanding Customer Program Manager to help manage our automotive industry engagements. You will be responsible for working with internal business and engineering teams as well as external customers to turn our automotive product vision into tangible tasks that result in real products. Together, we'll create products that make high accuracy positioning ubiquitous and easy to use across a wide variety of industries and applications in unmanned aerial vehicles, robotics, and autonomous transportation.Candidates should have skills and experience with


Program Business Development - Supported proposal campaigns to or for automotive OEMs or Tier-1s.
Program Execution - Familiar with philosophies, concepts and models navigating technical engineering programs. Has experience creating process from scratch as well as running / adapting existing hardware (H/W) and software (S/W) programs. Excellent track record in creating program schedules and managing large scale programs.
Automotive Industry - Have managed programs for automotive OEMs or Tier-1s or managed programs supplying H/W or S/W to automotive OEMs or Tier-1s.
Technical Engineering Experience - Have worked directly with engineering teams on roadmaps, estimation and planning in a consistent, organized and disciplined manner. Understands stages of development, where to develop and understanding of integration points for HW / SW. Able to lead across-functions and anticipate impacts to other areas such as marketing, sales, operations, etc
Issue resolution - Keen knack for problem solving cross functional dependencies, resourcing, person conflicts, technical barriers, time restraints, and risk assessments.
Communication - Excellent communication in all forms
Leadership - Inspires teams, diagnose and help teams work through issues to optimize full potential 

Strong candidates will also possess skills in one or more of:

GPS and/or GNSS work experience or familiarity with Swift's core competencies

Perks:



Flexible vacation, competitive salary, employer covered health insurance, 401(k).
Fully stocked kitchen, weekly catered lunches and tech-talks, free gym membership.
Dynamic engineering role -- technological innovation is at the core of our business.

Growth and learning opportunities from a startup environment include working closely with an international team of scientists, engineers, platform architects, programmers and professionals.

Swift Navigation is a diverse and inclusive team. We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds to apply regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or other defining characteristics.

Swift Navigation will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of SFPC Art.49

title: Program Manager - Home Match - San Francisco, CA
job_description:
Home Match for San Francisco County helps communities meet three important goals: empowering aging community members to stay in their chosen homes; creating affordable places to live; and combating social isolation. The Program Manager plays a central role in increasing the visibility of the program in the community in order to attract a robust set of program applicants and sustainable funding. Daily travel throughout San Francisco and possibly other locations in the Bay Area. Evening and weekend work required. Fluent in Spanish highly desirable.Responsibilities

Develop and implement an outreach plan to promote the program in the community and to recruit the targeted number of appropriate program participantsIdentify and cultivate strategic relationships with entities that provide access to the target populationTrack results of outreach plan and refine as requiredSchedule and conduct presentations at a variety of forumsContribute to the core activities of the home sharing programUtilize technology tools to track participant and partner informationGeneral office duties that correspond to this position

Work independently, be self-directed and demonstrate initiative, as well as work effectively and collaboratively within a team and with community partners.Excellent verbal, written, and public speaking skills (ability to speak and write fluently in Spanish highly desirable).Demonstrated initiative in program development and providing outreach to various community stakeholders, including businesses, partners, potential clients, limited English speakers.Ability to negotiate and problem-solve with clients from diverse backgrounds.Interviewing skills and ability to assess client needsOrganizational and time management skills and an ability to be flexible and set prioritiesKnowledge of Microsoft Office products essential, CRM and online tools and digital mediaAble to work in the evening and weekends frequently

title: Senior Project Manager
job_description:
About NECI

NECI, an Emerson Impact Partner, is the leading Digital Automation solutions provider transforming manufacturing, lab operations, process development and process control across a range of process industries in New England. NECI relentlessly seeks to drive the outcomes that change the game for our clients and is seeking team members to join in our mission.

The Role

We are currently looking for a resourceful, driven, team player with a competitive spirit, and strong business acumen to help our customers reach new levels of automated and digital working.

How Youll Be Successful

Curiosity for solving business problems
Passion for making your customers successful
Ability to solve tough problems across multiple stakeholders
Ability to manage a rolling portfolio of projects across several customer accounts and industries
Provide credible leadership to all aspects of automation and automation related projects/operational activities
Preparing and evaluating budgets
Monitoring and controlling resources
Clarifying roles and objectives
Delegating
Work Collaboratively
Ease with executive management
Managing crucial conversations
Motivating and inspiring

What Youll Do

Pre-execution responsibilities such as sales support, proposal generation, planning, and estimating activities. These activities lead to well-defined deliverables with associated work plans that provide a solid starting point for all work.
Delivery responsibilities such as customer management, team management, high level technical direction, commercial management, and schedule/resourcing management.
Effective planning, budgeting, coordination, communication, and reporting to the customer and NECI management team.
Post project activities such as continuous improvement, customer satisfaction, project to site transition, training, adoption services, outcome delivery.
Continuously builds and improves upon the existing PMO and Operations standard operating procedures.
Management of traditional waterfall-based contracts via established PMI norms, management of software/product development via agile/scrum methodologies, management of outcome-based contracts, and management of mixed methodologies.
Strong participation in NECIs strategic planning efforts.
Responsible for providing uncompromising quality to all work processes in designated area of responsibility. Has the authority to stop those work processes at any time it is believed that quality is being compromised
Performs other duties as assigned; responsibilities and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.
Physical demands: Lifting to 30 lbs.
Travel: 50%-day travel within the Greater Boston area. Occasional project assignments requiring full time on-site presence.

What Youll Bring

BS in STEM
5+ years of experience including 2-3 years as Project Manager.
Experience in managing matrix teams on enterprise level projects.
Consulting or professional services experience preferred.
Project budget management knowledge.
5 years experience in a project management or program management role.
Proven ability to demonstrate leadership and have meetings with customers at the executive level
Strong verbal communication skills to speak to customers and delivery team members daily as well as good written communication skills
Experience participating in the sales process to scope and help sell the value of delivery services

Heres What Youll Get

Highly competitive Medical and Dental Insurance
Flexible Spending Accounts for medical expenses and dependent care expenses
4-6 weeks Paid Time Off
401(k)
Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP)
Employee Referral Bonus
Professional Development Reimbursement
NECI paid Basic Life & Short-Term, Long-Term Disability Insurance
Voluntary Benefits - Accident, Term Life, Whole Life Insurance
Flu Shot Clinic & First Aid/AED/CPR Classes

Must be currently authorized to work in the United States.

Policy on Third-Party Unsolicited Resume Submissions: Please note that any third-party unsolicited resume submissions will immediately become the property of NECI. NECI will not pay any fee to a submitting employment agency, person, or entity unless a signed agreement is established.

NECI is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.
