title: Professional Relations Manager - New England
job_description:
Professional Relations Manager – New England Region

Job Summary:

Are you an outgoing, self-starter with a passion for working with others? Do you thrive on building new relationships that result in people being connected to services that can transform their lives? Are you seeking a purpose-driven organization that you can believe in? If this sounds like you, we should talk.

Walden Behavioral Care, a rapidly-growing, leading eating disorder treatment organization, is seeking a Professional and Community Relations Manager for the New England region who will be responsible for creating awareness, educating the market, building new relationships and fostering growth with existing relationships including professionals, hospitals, schools and community leaders.

To be most successful in this position, you will have a good understanding of the behavioral healthcare market across New England. You will be a go-getter, who is a relationship builder at heart, have great communication skills and marketing expertise. We prefer someone who has a passion for behavioral health and understands the importance of connecting people and organizations to excellent care providers.

This is a full-time 40h/week position with occasional night and weekend responsibilities and regular travel within the New England region.

Specifics about this role:

Act as primary liaison, responsible for building relationships with potential referrers to maximize admissions to Walden Behavioral Care locations. Identify outreach priorities and pro-actively plan for relationship development and maintenance and growth opportunities in New England.
Maintain a full and active outreach calendar. Responsible for planning and scheduling professional meetings, networking events, conferences, and other events to maximize Walden’s exposure to regional stakeholders.
Possess a keen understanding, appreciation and ability to clearly communicate Walden Behavioral Care’s programs and services and what differentiates our organization to different stakeholders.

On the road outreach and relationship developer to key professional and community referrers, including hospital leaders, physician practices, community leaders, school administrators and others associated with patient referrals.

Responsible for seeking out key regional events, maximizing opportunities to drive awareness, educate and build relationships with prospective referrers as the primary Walden marketing representative in New England. 

Work seamlessly with Walden’s engagement and clinical teams to assure timely response and pro-active approach to partner requests for information, questions, insight and new product and service developments.
Work with Director of Relationship Management and team members to develop quarterly and annual marketing plans, product development, competitive insights and changing market dynamics.
Track, analyze and report referral data and maintain excellent records of meetings, relationship nuances and upcoming landscape changes and opportunities. 

Travel throughout the New England states, and open to travel in other regions periodically.

Value the mission of relieving the suffering and stigma associated with the diseases we treat and providing our patients with the best chance of recovering a full and meaningful life.


 Education

Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in marketing, communications, and/or healthcare / behavioral health.


Experience

Minimum of five years’ experience in outreach and relationship development with community stakeholders preferred
Experience working with EHR and CRM systems to support admissions team. (Salesforce experience preferred)
Analytical
Exceptional organizational skills required
Excellent computer skills with Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook

Reporting

Reports to the Director of Relationship Management

Walden Behavioral Care is a rapidly-growing, national mental healthcare system specializing in the treatment of eating disorders and mental health conditions. We are one of the only organizations in the country to welcome individuals of all ages and all genders at all levels of care. Since 2003, we have helped more than 20,000 individuals progress in their path to healing. With 15 locations and more than 450 dedicated care professionals across Connecticut, Massachusetts and in Georgia, we are committed to changing lives, one person at a time. Using evidence-based treatment, proven to support long-term recovery, we are passionate about providing all individuals with the specialized care they need and deserve.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Interested applicants may submit their resume to Ana Marques at amarques@waldenbehavioralcare.com .

title: Product Development Manager
job_description:
IntroductionASML US brings together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, the Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler Arizona, San Jose and San Diego California, Wilton Connecticut, and Hillsboro Oregon.Job MissionHMIMBI program teamis looking for a high value contributor to drive Multi-beam product development.HMI is developing a series of multi-beam technology based inspection products. This position will be responsible for the development and roll-out of a specific multi-beam product.

The Product Development Manager reports organizationally to the Program Manager and will interface with external and internal suppliers, Development & Engineering organization, customer support and other sectors within HMI and ASML.

Key interfaces

• Product management

• System Engineering

• Development and Engineering

• Manufacturing

• Customer Service

This position requires access to controlled technology, as defined in the Export Administration Regulations (15 C.F.R. § 730, et seq.). Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such controlled technology prior to beginning work. Business demands may require ASML to proceed with applicants who are immediately eligible to access controlled technology.Job DescriptionThe key responsibility is the development and deployment of HMI Multi-beam inspection systems, starting with the first technology demonstrator eScan1000.

Translate the Product Roadmap into a Product Development Plan

-Use the Product Roadmap as input for the master plan

-Set up the project organization

-Create detailed timeline and budget

-Define key milestones and deliverables

-Ensure proper staffing to ensure delivery.

Actively manage the realization of the Product Development Plan

-Allocate work among the team in logical and efficientmanner; ensures proper communication

-Pro-actively and intuitively identify potentialbottlenecks, develop alternative scenarios, focus on meeting the overalltimeline

-Actively measure progress against planning and budgeton a weekly, or, if needed, daily basis; quickly adapt as needed

-Drive operational excellence through chairing the“Product Meeting” with participants from system engineering, architecture,project management

-Manage system inter-dependencies

-Manage priorities between projects

-Escalate issues timely when requiredEducationBachelor’s degree required with strong preference forMaster’s degree.Experience-Relevant technical background as well as 7+ years’experience in program/project management in the capital equipment orrelated industries

-Proficiency in MS Office applications, specificallyWord, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.

-Strong English communication skills, both written andoral.Personal skills-Strong leadership and influencing skills

-Excellent communication skills, can build a bridgebetween different stakeholders within ASML

-Strong experience within technical, content driven

-Preferred experience with software development

-Strong entrepreneurial, can-do attitude and a P&Loriented program management style.

-Process-oriented with strong planning skills, setsclear goals, and is consistent in his/her approach

-Ability to think strategically and to drive change andtransformation, yet remaining hands-on and focused

-Mature and independent, with the right type of gravitasto gain immediate acceptance within ASML organization

-Bias for speed and execution, confrontsissues/roadblocks robustly, flexible to work in a fast growing andchanging organizationContext of the positionThis position primarily works in an office environment. It requires frequent sitting, standing and walking. Daily use of a computer is required. May stand for extended periods when facilitating meetings. The physical demands of the position described herein are essential functions of the job and employees must be able to successfully perform these tasks for extended periods. Reasonable accommodations may be made for those individuals with real or perceived disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job described.Other informationEOE AA M/F/Veteran/Disability

title: Case Manager
job_description:
Royal Neighbors is not an ordinary insurance firm. Since 1895, we have held true to our mission to support women and those they care about by offering opportunities that other companies don’t. Our members receive competitive coverage, member benefits such as scholarships, disaster aid, health discounts, and the opportunity to volunteer and give back to their communities.

Employment with a Difference is what you will have as a Royal Neighbors of America employee. At Royal Neighbors of America, our culture and values define who we are. With over a century of proud history working to empower the lives of women and their families, we share basic beliefs and attitudes that enable our employees to thrive in a high-quality and rewarding work environment.

Summary of Role: Royal Neighbors of America is searching for a Case Manager to provide professional and quality customer service to agents and administrative support to underwriting team. Assists agents with status, product and application processing questions. Basic knowledge of medical and financial topics.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Maintains knowledge of company and department procedures, products, policy provisions and compliance regulations.Maintains strong knowledge of policy administrative system, imaging system and underwriting systemPrescreens applications for Underwriting TeamReviews SIWL applications against underwriting guidelines and makes underwriting risk selection determinations based on all information receivedApproves non-medical applications with face amounts of 0 - $25,000Takes calls from ARRT lineCompletes follow-up processing based on receipt of underwriting requirementsMeets goals set by department– quality 98%, time service 1-2 daysMaintains ownership responsibilities to account•Back-up data entry and eDoc processingOther duties as assigned

Supervisory Responsibilities: This job has no supervisory responsibilities.

Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education and/or Experience Associate's degree (A. A.) or equivalent from two-year college or technical school. Minimum three years related experience and/or training, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Academy of Life Underwriting coursework preferred. Entry and Basic Life Office Management Association (LOMA) course levels will be required upon acceptance of position.

Certificates, Licenses, Designations, Registrations: LOMA Level 1 certificate required. Associate, Customer Service (ACS) required. Associate, Life Management Institute (ALMI) or Associate, Life Underwriting (ALU) designations preferred.

Core Competencies: Communicates Clearly and Effectively, Knows the Job, Achieves Results, Builds Partnerships, Adapts to and Promotes Change, Makes Decisions.

Technical Competencies: Jet underwriting, medical terminology knowledge, risk assessment, data analysis

Mathematical Skills: Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, proportions, percentages. Ability to apply concepts of basic Algebra. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions and percentages to practical situations.

Computer Skills: To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of LifePRO, Imaging System, Illustration Software, Microsoft Word, Outlook, Excel and the Internet, and underwriting engine systems (LifeSuites).

Industry Competencies: Life Insurance product knowledge and experience, terminology. Language Skills: Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating instructions and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization. Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Reasoning Ability: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; climb or balance and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly lift and /or move up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

title: Associate Product Manager: Billing
job_description:
Our Company:

EIS Group is a global innovator, committed to providing the insurance industry with transformational platforms to enable their success. We deliver a digital insurance platform built to move insurance carriers closer to their customers.

At EIS Group our mission is unwavering: continue to grow as global leader- delivering innovative solutions that combine best-in-class technology with deep domain expertise and proven business practices, establish key business relationships, and to employ a talent pool of the best and brightest, well-trained, highly-motivated individuals.

Our culture is highly innovative, collaborative and focused on building and maintaining relationships that allow us to surpass our customers’ expectations. We embrace the qualities that make each of our team members unique and develop each other’s skillsets so that together we can be stronger than the sum of our parts.

We are looking for smart, dynamic and intuitive people to join our growing team of insurance technology professionals and industry experts.

Job Purpose:

The Associate Product Manager: Billing is a role that requires creativity, innovative thinking and genuine curiosity to conduct, identify and conceptualize Life & Annuity (L&A) product requirements and features.

In this role, the Associate Product Manager: Billing will have a strong understanding of new business objectives and challenges, able to collaborate drive agreement on strategic experiences across a decentralized team as a key to success in this role.

This is a hands-on, detail-driven, analytical position which contributes to the strategy and design of solutions for the Life and Annuities markets.

The ideal candidate will work as part of the Life & Annuities Product management team and will bring a strong understanding of financial services products, technology, operations and agile methodologies.

Responsibilities:

· Identifying core business needs for the Life and Annuities markets, with a specific focus on the Cash Value Management, Billing, Commissions, and Ledger needs for "permanent life" and annuities products.

· Managing the creation and completion of product specifications for new Life and Annuities products and product-related changes.

· Analysis of the EIS system's capabilities to support Life and Annuities business needs.

· Identifying and prioritizing gaps in EIS capabilities relative to the Life and Annuities market.

· Creating requirements documentation for Life and Annuities capabilities.

· Collaborating across teams (RND, UX/UI) to better understand their approaches and specifications needed to design Life and Annuities solutions to meet market needs.

· Engage with R&D teams during the development process for specific capabilities.

· Implementing user testing of capabilities after delivery.

· Providing explanations of key capabilities to clients and internal EIS resources.

· Give occasional support of requirements sessions with clients during implementation.

· Assist in the development of complex technical solution requirements for billing related functionality.

· Think strategically in a strong leadership role, be proactive and take initiative as necessary.

· Be a self-starter capable of assessing what tasks need to be completed and maintains a strong understanding of meeting deadlines.

· Sustain excellent influencing, organizational, facilitation, communication and presentation skills.

· Maintain strength of convictions through an ability to influence positive change and champion product development.

· Possess superior verbal and written communication skills.

Requirements/Desired Experience:

EIS group welcomes different mixes of skills and different professional backgrounds, and therefore is flexible on the exact combination of capabilities for this role. We are seeking candidates with a strong combination of the following skills and experiences who are able and willing to rapidly learn additional skills needed in areas where he/she has gaps.

PREVIOUS PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

· Life and Annuities market, on either the business or IT side.

· Previous role as a Business Analyst or Software Product Manager.

· Product Management, Design, or Analysis within the insurance industry.

· Strong understanding of business requirements for gathering and documenting enterprise software applications.

· Software Backlog creation and maintenance.

· User Acceptance Testing for enterprise software applications.

EDUCATION:

· College degree

PROFESSIONAL CERTIFICATION(S) REQUIRED:

· SAFe certification or tangible experience in Agile development.

SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE:

· Strong computer skills, with expert knowledge in Microsoft Product (Word/Excel/PPT)

· 3+ years of professional experience.

This position may also require some travel (national and internationally).

EIS Group also provides you with empowering mentorships and digital learning opportunities, to help further develop your career. If you are ready to execute innovative solutions, apply new ideas, further hone your unique skillset, and join an exceptional professional services organization.

EIS Group has a fast-paced, distributed work environment that is an excellent fit for motivated individuals who have the ability to quickly and effectively engage on new challenges and opportunities. EIS Group also provides its employees with empowering mentorships, digital learning opportunities, and continuous professional opportunities to gain experience and develop employees’ careers. If you are ready to execute innovative solutions, apply new ideas, further hone your unique skillset, and join an exceptional professional services organization, apply now at careers@eisgroup.com.

EIS Group is an equal opportunity employer (EOE), M/F/Disability/Veterans, and strongly supports diversity in the workforce.

title: Construction Site Superintendent/Quality Control Manager/Site Safety Officer
job_description:
Onsite Construction Superintendent/Quality Control Manger (CQCM)/ Site Safety Health Officer (SSHO), will be responsible for managing and performing the daily responsibilities related to the physical construction of new and repair/renovation projects ranging from $1,000,000 to $50,000,000, and to ensure the project is constructed in accordance with the project Quality Control Plan and Safety Plan. Depending on what project is assigned, you must be able to perform as a Safety Officer, or Quality Control Manager, or both. The CQCM reports directly to Valiant Head of Construction for the sake of assuring that a conflict of interest does not occur among the productivity, schedule, and the quality objectives of the project. The CSSHO reports directly to the Valiant Site Project Manager.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities will include, but not limited to:

 The CQCM role includes direct oversight and review of the entire documentation and physical inspection phase of the workflow process and working with other in-house personnel (e.g.: Project Managers, Superintendents, etc.), and external personnel to produce and document a quality product.
 Performing all of the major QC activities required to construct the project at hand and to provide in a timely manner the written documentation described in each project's specific contract documents as follows.
 Create, update and maintain the project submittal log and all other project specific quality control reports.
 Review shop drawings and submittals for conformance with proj4ect specifications by direct review and by leveraging the knowledge and experience of others in the project team when necessary.
 Chair and document weekly QC meetings with the Project Manager or Superintendent and provide written minutes as described in project specific contract documents.
 Provide written daily QC reports that reinforce activities that are being constructed in conformance with each specific project's established standard and constructively confronts non-conformances to produce the desired outcome in a timely manner.
 Conduct preparatory, initial and follow-up meetings to establish an understanding of the standards of care desired for each definable feature of work. Verify that checklists are being used and signed off prior to the placement of concrete, steel and other similar items of work.
 Verify and document that all materials received for the project are in conformance with the approved submittal, are handled and stored appropriately and are acceptable for use in the project.
 Conduct preconstruction meetings with new and existing subcontractors and the superintendent at least two days prior to the start of each new phase of work to discuss issues that affect quality. Document these meetings in the daily QC report and Preparatory Phase reports.
 Schedule, document the results of, and maintain a log of all code and independent inspections that are required. Clearly document, correct and re-inspect all nonconformances prior to covering up work.
 Conduct periodic follow-up inspections to verify that work is proceeding with the contract documents and the approved submittals. (Desired results come from what is inspected, not what is expected.)
 Coordinate and document the testing and commissioning of building systems.
 Document and distribute pre-punch lists, punch lists, and the completion of these lists.
 Document final inspections, certificate of occupancy and acceptance of the works and various phases thereof.
 Maintain the project "as-built" drawings on a daily basis.
 Assemble and forward project closeout documents that include O&M Manuals, as-builts and warranties.
 Stop work if necessary to resolve matters that affect safety, quality and/or inhibit the logical progress of work.

SSHO Responsibilities:

Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:


 The CSSHO role includes direct oversight and review of all project site construction activity, to include physical inspection phases of the workflow process and coordinating with other in -house personnel (e.g.: Project Managers, Superintendents, etc.), and external personnel to produce and document a safe product.
 Performing all of the major Safety and Health activities required to construct the project at hand, and to provide in a timely manner the written documentation described in each project's specific contract documents as follows:
 Responsible for monitoring and assessing hazardous and unsafe situations and developing measures to assure personnel safety.
 Correct unsafe acts or conditions through the regular line of authority, although the Safety Officer may exercise emergency authority to prevent or stop unsafe acts when immediate action is required.
 Maintain constant awareness of active and developing hazardous situations.
 Ensure that all project personnel are compliant and wearing all required Personal Protection Equipment (PPE) for the specific work activity being performed.
 Ensure the Site Safety and Health Plan is prepared and implemented.
 Ensure there are safety messages in each Incident Action Plan.
 The Safety Officer will chair and document Weekly Safety Toolbox Meetings with the Project Manager, QC Manager, and supporting subcontractor personnel, and to provide written minutes as described in project specific contract documents.
 Provide written daily Safety reports that reinforce activities that are being constructed in conformance with each specific project's established standard and constructively confronts non-conformances to produce the desired outcome in a timely manner.

Additionally, the following General Superintendent duties may be required, but are not limited to supplement the site management throughout the duration of the project:


 Conduct preparatory, initial and follow-up meetings to establish an understanding of the standards of care desired for each definable feature of work. Verify that checklists are being used and signed off prior to the placement of concrete, steel and other similar items of work.
 Verify and document that all materials received for the project are in conformance with the approved submittal, are handled and stored appropriately and are acceptable for use in the project.
 Conduct preconstruction meetings with new and existing subcontractors and the superintendent at least two days prior to the start of each new phase of the work to discuss issues that affect quality. Document these meetings in the daily Safety report and Preparatory Phase reports.
 Schedule, document the results of, maintain a log of all code and independent inspections that are required. Clearly document, correct and re-inspect all nonconformances prior to covering up work.
 Conduct periodic follow-up inspections to verify that work is proceeding with the contract documents and the approved submittals. (Desired results come from what is inspected, not is expected.)
 Coordinate and document the testing and commissioning of building systems.
 Document and distribute pre-punch lists, punch lists, and the completion of these lists.
 Document final inspections, certificates of occupancy and acceptance of the works and various phases thereof.
 Maintain the project "as-built" drawings on a daily basis.
 Assemble and forward project closeout documents that include O&M manuals, as-builts and warranties.
 Stop work if necessary to resolve matters that affect safety, quality and/or inhibit the logical progress of work.

CORE VALUES: 

INTEGRITY - Honesty, Trust and Respect in every situation

EXCELLENCE - Performance, Effectiveness, Quality, and Safety in everything we do

INNOVATION - Embracing new ideas and best practice in every service that we provide

Valiant Integrated Services is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

NOTICE: Valiant Integrated Services NEVER asks job applicants to issue any payment or service fees to Valiant or its recruiters as part of our application process. Before providing any personal information to outside parties, verify that the job you are applying for appears on our Careers site.

title: Senior Product Manager - Data Analysis
job_description:
Do you love MATLAB and want to be directly involved in establishing its strategic direction? If you answered yes, this position could be a great opportunity for you!

We are looking for a new member of the MATLAB Product Management Team with a primary focus on data analysis workflows. The responsibilities of this position cover key MATLAB functionality including data import, data cleaning, data exploration, and managing big data. Our team works closely with MATLAB development to understand key requirements and define product features for MATLAB, MathWorks flagship product. We outline the short- and long-term roadmaps for the MATLAB product as a whole and for each of its key feature areas. Successful MATLAB Product Managers thrive on the challenge of synthesizing diverse (and often conflicting) requirements coming from 4,000,000 of the world's leading technical people. These technical people work at the most innovative technology companies, government research labs, financial institutions, and at more than 5,000 universities.

Fulfilling this role encompasses multiple tasks, including:


Collaborating with development on product planning, including developing short-term release plans as well as multi-year product roadmaps
Collecting, synthesizing and prioritizing customer feedback, using a combination of live customer feedback sessions and additional feedback mechanisms
Assessing market trends to generate product requirements
Tracking and reporting on the data analytics market and alternative offerings
Providing support to internal marketing and sales groups to educate them and enable them to incorporate the relevant MATLAB messages into their materials
Handling the complete "go to market" plan for features, including naming, positioning, demonstrations, and field-engineer training.
Presenting to management review teams to establish support and get approval on product plans

Extensive experience using MATLAB in an academic or commercial setting. Experience with other programming tools and data analysis packages is a plus
Extensive experience with practical data analysis.
Team-leading and project management skills

Expertise with MATLAB
A bachelor's degree and 7 years of professional work experience (or a master's degree and 5 years of professional work experience, or a PhD degree, or equivalent experience) is required.

title: Project Manager, Web Applications
job_description:
SUMMARY:
If you're passionate about technology and fascinated by the never-ending growth of the internet and its development tools; if you are tired of being one of many other members of just "a" team, then DP Technology is the place for you.
We are looking for a bright Web Product Engineer that will help us improve and maintain our company's business web platform. You will manage a portfolio of projects, from the specifications to the implementation and support, including QA testing. The Web Product Engineer will work in close collaboration with our team of full stack web developers and business stakeholders to successfully drive and manage web initiatives.
RESPONSIBILITIES:

Work with a team of Full stack web developers
Understand, refine and write functional specifications
Perform unit tests and other test routines to verify the developed functionality
Interact with stakeholders and key users during product design, feature integration and release
Use judgement to suggest modifications where appropriate
Manage multiple projects in parallel
Adjust to new priorities according to Business needs
Work directly with the Business Systems Manager and worldwide team

REQUIREMENTS:

Computer Science or equivalent degree
1-3 years of experience of Product Engineering, preferably for web-based applications
1-3 years of experience of Project Management
Good understanding of Programming and Architecture of Web applications using Windows technologies (ASP.NET Core, MVC, IIS, SQL, …)
Ability to provide some UI & UX specifications (design)
Strong analytical skills, to solve problems and come up with creative answers and solutions
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Demonstrated success working in a small, multi-national, innovative and creative team
Willing to work in a fast-paced environment. Needs can and will change frequently and you’ll need to continually adapt to changing priorities

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Some experience with Source Control (Git, BitBucket) and Continuous Integration tools (Teamcity)
Familiarity with agile development methods
Experience refactoring legacy software systems

THE TRAVEL:
Limited corporate travel may be required; up to 5%
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Regularly required to sit for long periods and talk or hear, both in person and by telephone. Use of standard office equipment.
WHAT WE OFFER:
Our robust benefits include a competitive salary, flexible hours, 401(k) matching, and gym reimbursements. But that’s not all. You’ll also enjoy more intangible benefits, such as autonomy at work (we trust you to do your best, however that looks for you), ongoing skills development across industries, and ample opportunities for experimentation.

title: Technical Project Manager - Scrum Master
job_description:
Technical Project Manager/Scrum Master

Recently named Best Place to Work by MM&M, The Holmes Report, PR News, PRWeek, and AdAge, W2O is an integrated marketing and communications firm powered by analytics and specializing in healthcare. We are currently seeking a talented Technical Project Manager to join our growing team of pharmaceutical advertising, technology and data professionals. This is a great opportunity to join a dynamic, fast-growing global agency.

Role Summary:

The Technical Project Manager is ultimately responsible for excellent delivery on their assigned piece of business. They will be comfortable acting as the point-person for large initiatives or owing a single program.

Strong leadership skills help them oversee the project team's activities, as they are accountable for the overall quality of work in conjunction with department leads, ensuring goals are met and projects are delivered on time and on/or under budget.

Project Managers are great communicators and motivators with an innate ability to "get things done." As a result, they wear many hats. The Technical Project Manager manages all aspects of the project life cycle from concept to delivery/launch and must be intimately familiar with the roles played by Design, Engineering and Development, User Experience, Account Management, and Quality Assurance.

They have experience moving projects through all internal agency technical departments and roles, ensuring the proper reviews and approvals at appropriate stages.

Whether it's advising on the feasibility of creative concepts, involving the correct resources from each department at the optimal time, ensuring resources are available and priorities are managed in alignment with account, identifying bottlenecks and proposing solutions ahead of time, the only thing that is certain is that no one day is ever the same.

Skill and Responsibilities

The Technical Project Manager / Scrum Master will:


Drive project timelines and road mapping while ensuring projects align to department launch goals
Identify issues, risks, and recommendations for improving team efficiency
Manage and conduct meetings
Engage and include all team members and encourage a collaborative approach to completing tasks
Assist the team with building skills of planning, goal setting, organizing and delivering through collaborative effort
Lead creative problem solving via collaborative problem-solving processes

Experience and Education:

7+ years of relevant technical project management experience
Bachelor's Degree in a related field
Advanced degrees helpful
Strong Technology Chops

Able to talk Tech at a granular level


Background in multiple Project Management methodologies and tools
Experience of working with distributed teams and vendors
Expertise in Project Management & Tracking with various types of teams
Solid problem solving and time management skills
Great interpersonal skills
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
Strong attention to detail
Highly organized
Experience working on AOR healthcare projects/accounts for pharma brands helpful.
Scrum experience required
Previous experience with Atlassian / Jira especially helpful
Advanced knowledge of software/systems used by Project Management, including FLOW, Box, Smartsheets and JIRA.

W2O Group offers a comprehensive benefit program and perks, including unlimited and flexible PTO, expanded paid leave for new parents including a 4th Trimester program that helps new parents transition back to work, and a five-week sabbatical program. Other perks include Income Protection, Retirement plans/401(k) match, and cell phone savings plans. Learn more about our great benefits and perks at: http://www.w2ogroup.com/

W2O Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We foster an environment that embraces diversity. We are stronger with a wider range of opinions, strengths, and backgrounds to achieve our goals.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
ABOUT US

Our Product

"Point provides the opportunity to stabilize your financial situation without adding costly monthly payments." - Homeowner in Burlingame, CA

Here at Point, we're helping homeowners unlock the equity in their homes without taking on further debt. With an investment from Point, homeowners can de-leverage and diversify their wealth, freeing them up to invest in their business, renovate and maintain their home, eliminate debt, and tackle all of life's expenses from college tuition to medical bills. Our equity investment product is an advantageous alternative for homeowners and investors alike. When partnering with Point, investors now have access to a brand new asset class - homeowner-occupied residential real estate. Point is the first fintech product that is truly aligned with consumers' interests - when the homeowner does well, Point and its investors do well.

Our Team

People first

As a consumer fintech company, we embed integrity, transparency, and trust into everything we do at Point, including how we work. Whether you're a homeowner, investor, employee, or candidate, it's people who power our business. We keep the human experience top of mind.

Experts at work

We're on a mission to help the 23 million equity-rich, but cash-constrained Americans tap into their home's wealth. To do so, we have experience and expertise in all areas of the business, especially at the helm. Point's leadership have previously founded TrialPay (acquired by Visa), Yub (acquired by Coupons.com), Metails (acquired by Buy.com), SiteAdvisor (acquired by McAfee), Affirm, SendGrid (acquired by Twilio), and TXN (acquired by Envestnet).

Championed by the best

In 2019, Point closed a $22M Series B led by Prudential Financial, DAG Ventures, and Andreessen Horowitz. We've received funding from Ribbit Capital, Greylock, SV Angel and Bloomberg Beta as well.

ROLE OVERVIEW

We are seeking an experienced Product Manager to join our growing team. You will help define the product vision, while gathering and prioritizing product requirements, and working closely with engineering, design, marketing, operations and leadership.

Your projects will range from small optimization experiments to building out brand new user experiences. Your work will have a huge impact on Point's trajectory as we revolutionize home financing.

The ideal candidate will have a high analytical drive and the ability to deal with ambiguity - in many cases you'll be starting with a blank slate. You will be the third product manager on our team and will help establish the product management function at Point. You will also have tremendous autonomy and responsibility over your domain.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Help develop and execute on product strategy.
Write clear and concise product requirements and develop basic but elegant prototypes that make engineers clamor to work with you.
Gather insights from internal and external user feedback, web analytics, research, experiments, competitors and data analysis to understand user needs and synthesize into learnings for the team, and into product plans to deliver on those user needs.
Identify and prioritize features to improve conversion and efficiency.
Breakdown complex problems into simpler component pieces to facilitate execution.
Collaborate with designers, engineers, and other internal team members to drive flawless implementation of your vision.
Drive the creation, execution, and analysis of A/B tests to increase conversion and reduce operational overhead.
(Over)Communicate with leadership, internal and external stakeholders.
Orchestrate product launches, including training for internal users.

WHO YOU ARE

You are passionate about the big problems in society and about the big decisions that people make in their lives.
You have thought deeply about homeownership or experienced the trials and tribulations of becoming a homeowner first-hand. You believe that technology will have a significant impact on financial institutions and you want to be in on the ground floor.
You collaborate effectively with your peers across all departments of the organization. You're a clear and articulate communicator naturally, who develops and nurtures relationships with ease.
You are self-motivated and organized. You thrive in a fast-paced, startup environment. You're ready to take ownership of some of the core processes of the company.
You are passionate about the human experience

YOU SHOULD HAVE

3+ years of experience in product management, preferably in financial services and/or real estate
A strong track record bringing product features to market and inspiring the people who work with you to execute flawlessly against both the long-term product vision and current priorities
A remarkable ability to use data to form a hypothesis and define metrics to determine the success of product initiatives. You use numbers to tell a story.
Highly effective judgment and interpersonal skills
Ability to conceptualize, manage, and prioritize multiple projects
Highly effective communication skills and ability to liaise seamlessly between functional teams
Previous experience with SQL
Previous experience at a startup preferred. You must thrive on being scrappy.
Intense desire to deliver amazing user experiences for both external and internal users
Superb attention to detail and a need to rally others in the pursuit of excellence
Excitement for our mission to help homeowners

PERKS AT POINT

Health Insurance

Point provides platinum-rated plans for medical (Anthem Blue Cross or Kaiser Permanente), dental (The Standard), and vision (The Standard). We cover 99% of employee premiums and 75% of dependent premiums.

Transportation

Point participates in the Caltrain GoPass program which provides an unlimited train pass for work and personal travel. Alternatively, team members commuting by car will receive a free parking permit.

Generous vacation

Take time for yourself and your family when you want - Point has an unlimited vacation policy.

Work from home & Flexibility

Many team members work from home once a week. We care about productivity and accountability, not facetime.

Continued Learning

We encourage all team members to attend events hosted by our investors, external workshops and conferences. We believe in continuous improvement and want to support employees on their professional journeys.

Family Friendly

Point will top off California PFL earnings to full salary for up to six weeks, as well as two weeks of fully paid leave to be available after exhaustion of CA PFL. An employee can take reasonable vacation time in addition to the California PFL leave.

Bright office with amenities

We have an open floor plan for easy collaboration and plenty of free drinks and snacks to keep you nourished throughout the day. Additionally, Point provides catered lunch every Monday and Wednesday.

Staying fit

Point provides a monthly stipend to cover a 45 credit ClassPass membership - see you at Barry's Bootcamp!

COMPENSATION

Annual Salary Range: $120,000 - $150,000

Equity Range: 0.02% - 0.03%

About Harbor Freight Tools

In 1977, when Harbor Freight Tools was started as a small family-owned business, we made a commitment to provide working people with great quality tools at the lowest prices. From hand tools and generators, to air and power tools, from shop equipment to automotive tools, Harbor Freight offers more than 5,000 tools and accessories at quality levels that match or exceed competing brands, but at prices that are up to 80% less.

Delivering Value to the Hardworking Since 1977

title: Hospital Epidemiology Program Manager
job_description:
Summary
Position Overview

Implements epidemiological reduction strategies for patients and staff through assessment and risk identification; researching current literature and practice; development, implementation, monitoring and reporting prevention strategies; routine and focused surveillance; policy and procedure development; training and education program development and collaboration with staff in departments across the AHS; collaborates in clinical analytics, data management and reporting stratgies for internal and external public health and regulatory reporting measures.

Duties & Essential Job Functions

NOTE: Following are the duties performed by employees in this classification. However, employees may perform other related duties at an equivalent level. Not all duties listed are necessarily performed by each individual in the classification.

Communicates specifications for data needs to analytics staff; prepares and presents reports of findings supported by data and graphics at various committees as required.

Manages projects and collaborates with clinical and Infection Prevention staff to fill identified gaps in infection prevention and control efforts.

Performs statistical analysis of infection data, generates graphic displays and creates reports for internal use and external agencies; benchmarks and compares infection rates.

Performs complex data collection and analysis and contributes to reports and epidemiological investigations; proposes new or updated infection control protocols and policies.

Performs surveillance activities including communicable disease exposure follow up and outbreak management; investigates and reports communicable diseases and other reportable events to appropriate agencies.

Identifies patients with community-acquired, healthcare-associated, or surgical-site infections, as well as patients and employees with exposures to infectious and/or drug-resistant organisms; performs all appropriate reporting, documentation, notifications, and follow up in accordance with relevant policies and regulations.

Leads committees and project-focused groups; tracks and communicates progress of infection-reduction initiatives to key stakeholders; develops data requirements for new initiatives and communicates specifications for complex analyses to advanced analytics team.

Manages and maintains data and records for the purposes of determining negative trends, problem identification/resolution and reporting responsibilities; reports regularly to appropriate hospital committee’s data regarding various outcomes within the Infection Control Program.

Manages and coordinates reporting and/or follow-up regarding communicable diseases to the Alameda County California Emerging Infection Program, State Health Department, CDC, and the National Healthcare Safety Network (NHSN).

Performs other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications:

Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge, skills and abilities as well as possession of any required licenses or certifications is qualifying.

Required Education: Master’s degree in Nursing, Public Health, or Epidemiology (if less than two years experience)

Required Experience: Two years of relevant healthcare, epidemiology/biostatistics, analytics, or infection prevention, or equivalent combination of experience and training (Preferred if in possession of Master’s degree).

Preferred Experience: Two years of experience epidemiology/infection control experience in a large acute care setting.

Required Licenses/Certifications: Completion of epidemiology or infection control course (i.e.: APIC EPI Intensive or EPI 101) within one year of hire; certification in Infection Prevention within two years of hire.

title: Senior Product Manager
job_description:
Who we areAlbert is a new type of financial service that uses powerful technology to automate your finances, with a team of human experts to guide you. Albert saves and invests automatically for you, helps you avoid overdrafts, finds savings you’re missing, identifies bills you’re overpaying, and much more. Text Albert a financial question, and we’ll not only offer guidance; we’ll help you make it happen.We’re an LA-based startup with a proven business model, backed by top-tier institutional investors, with over 3 million users who have trusted Albert to help them achieve their financial goals.
