Albert’s product managers sit at the intersection of software development, design and business strategy.On an average day, our product managers might pitch a concept to senior leadership, create a launch plan with marketing, work with designers to prototype a new feature, analyze customer data with geniuses and meet with engineering to implement changes. Our PMs also work directly with customers, unearthing pain points and understanding their pressing needs.Things you're good at


Ownership: own and execute financial products that create value for Albert's customers.Organization: work across multiple layers of our organization, including design, engineering, financial services and senior management.Prioritization: prioritize initiatives to demonstrate alignment with our business strategy and our value propositions. Communicate priorities and drive consensus on the path forward.Strategy: understand Albert's strategic needs and deliver innovative products to align with these needs.Communication: keep lines of communication open and seek out feedback on a regular basis.Teamwork: at Albert, the underpinning of our culture is caring. We care about our customers’ financial wellness, we care about the health of our business, and we treat each other with kindness and respect. 


Responsibilities


Own and execute a product line that creates value for a financial consumer.Prioritize potential initiatives through demonstrating their alignment with our business strategy and the value to our current or future customers.Communicate that prioritization to other stakeholders in the company and drive consensus on the path forward.Work closely with engineering, design, and business team members on business cases, product requirements, development, launch and adoption.Understand Albert's strategic position and deliver innovative products that align with this strategy. Work directly with customers to unearth pain points and understand their most pressing needs.Communicate to the rest of the company the “how” and “why” of each feature.


Requirements


Undergraduate degree and 6+ years of product management experience.Experience working in Mobile and Web environments (iOS and Android).An expert organizer with a proven ability to prioritize.Strong technical background, preferably with deep understanding of engineering development languages and platforms.A self-starting attitude with the ability to drive projects forward while maintaining a keen sense of collaboration.Adapts easily to a fluid work process, capable of pivoting based on evolving business strategies.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills while working with fellow product managers, designers, engineers, marketers and Genius teams.Passion for aiding the underserved financial customer.Entrepreneurial mindset: build strong data-driven arguments, prioritize with business strategy in mind and evangelize projects to build consensus in the organization.


Benefits


Competitive salary and meaningful equityHealth, vision and dental insurance Free lunch

title: Manager, Product- Business Intelligence
job_description:
In just 18 years, OEC has grown globally to more than 1,000 employees with a double-digit revenue increase nearly every year. We provide a lively culture, employee rewards and recognition, and the opportunity to develop and implement innovative technology solutions.

Position Summary:

Has overall profit and loss responsibility and strategic responsibility for assigned product line. Builds and manages a product roadmap that addresses market needs and opportunities that support OEC’s goals and strategies. Manages senior and mid-level product professionals and coaches team for continual success. Establishes market requirements and defines product requirements; provides product marketing leadership and direction to the product team.



Job Duties:

1. Analyzes market data and works with third parties and customers including national accounts to identify needs and define new product opportunities. Maintains detailed knowledge of market conditions, competing products, and customers. Defines the product roadmap, success criteria, and sets expectations with all relevant stakeholders.

2. Builds product line strategy and execution plan to deliver on financial and customer commitments collaborating cross-functionally at all levels of the organization. This includes product development and marketing and sales programs to drive sales and customer satisfaction.

3. Manages product team, driving business processes for various product lines; motivates and coaches team members for continual success; resolves high-level obstacles, as necessary, for team members; provides formal and informal feedback.

4. Designs product packaging, pricing, and name to distinguish product line(s) from other OEC products in line with the product’s value proposition.

5. Seeks out opportunities and develops and delivers presentations at speaking engagements to drive customer awareness of product capabilities and new customer initiatives.

6. Independently develops and manages relationships with OEMs, third parties, and other external industry professionals. Is seen as a trusted advisor and subject matter expert of assigned product.

7. Has a solid understanding of competitive landscape, OEC solutions and strategy, and customer needs; develops product line strategy based on those dynamics.

Education:

An undergraduate degree from an accredited college or university with a focus in Marketing or related discipline. In the absence of a degree, directly-related job experience where a number of years and proven knowledge may offset the degree requirement.

Experience:

At least 8 years of progressively responsible experience in a product development environment; experience managing large scale projects and implementations, with at least 2 years of previous supervisory experience including conducting performance reviews and coaching employees to success. Requires the ability to manage at both a daily operational level with the staff as well as at a strategic level with OEC management. Exceptional leadership skills, establishing credibility within teams as a knowledgeable, effective leader. Maintains detailed knowledge of market conditions, competing products, and customers. Strategic thinker with a track record of success evaluating and implementing new technology products. Demonstrated proactive ability to lead cross-functional teams to successful project completion; ability to resolve complex problems along the way. Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to manage client relationships.

OEConnection is subject to certain governmental recordkeeping and reporting requirements for the administration of civil rights laws and regulations. In order to comply with these laws, we invite applicants and employees to voluntarily self-identify their gender, race and ethnicity. Submission of this information is strictly voluntary and refusal to provide it will not subject you to any adverse treatment. The information obtained will be kept confidential and may only be used in accordance with the provision of applicable laws, executive orders, and regulations, including those that require the information to be summarized and reported to the federal government for civil rights enforcement. When reported, data will not identify any specific individual. This information will be maintained separately from your application for employment. If you do not wish to self-identify at this time, you may do so in the future by submitting this form. Failure to provide the following information will not subject you to any adverse action or treatment. OEConnection is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, age, marital status, national origin, sexual orientation, citizenship status, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status. We prohibit discrimination in decisions concerning recruitment, hiring, compensation, benefits, training, termination, promotions, or any other condition of employment or career development.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Location: San Francisco, CA


Coinbase has built the world's leading compliant cryptocurrency platform serving over 30 million accounts in more than 100 countries. With multiple successful products, and our vocal advocacy for blockchain technology, we have played a major part in mainstream awareness and adoption of cryptocurrency. We are proud to offer an entire suite of products that are helping build the cryptoeconomy, and increase economic freedom around the world.

There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we assess whether a candidate demonstrates our values: Clear Communication, Positive Energy, Efficient Execution, and Continuous Learning. Second, we look for signals that a candidate will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, disrupt ourselves, and expect sustained high performance because we play as a championship team. Finally, we seek people with the desire and capacity to build and share expertise in the frontier technologies of crypto and blockchain, in whatever way is most relevant to their role.

Read more about our values and culture here.

Coinbase Product Managers play a critical role in building the next generation of crypto products. You will work closely with engineering, design and cross-functional teams to build products and new experiences. You'll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of cryptocurrency and help us achieve our mission of creating an open financial system for the world

What you'll be doing:



Own product development from conception to launch

Collaborate cross-functionally with engineering, design and cross-functional teams to develop and steer product roadmap

Define and analyze metrics to guide product development 

Align teams on a shared vision and steer execution on that vision.


What we look for in you:



5+ years of product management experience 

Exceptional interpersonal communication, relationship management and organizational skills

Deep analytical, prioritization and problem solving skills

Previous experience working in software product management

Demonstrated passion for cryptocurrency, financial markets, and the Coinbase mission

An entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to succeed in a fast-paced environment


Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and to review all of our job postings to minimize biased language. Coinbase does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other basis protected by applicable local, state or federal law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in a manner consistent with San Francisco's Fair Chance Ordinance and similar local laws.

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants

Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. Our full notice outlining how your data will be processed as part of the application procedure for application locations is available here: Ireland/EU, United Kingdom, and California. By submitting your application, you are agreeing to our use and processing of your data as required.

title: Capability Development Program Manager
job_description:
Come join the true partner of global healthcare companies who builds transformational solutions by challenging the boundaries of commercialization strategies to improve the lives of patients.Program Manager

Capability Development

Exciting opportunity exists for a Project/Program Manager role within Amplity US Medical Solutions!

Purpose of Role

Amplity Health is seeking to add a Capability Development (CD) Program Manager to our talented team of professionals. In this role, the CD Program Manager will work to deliver “right first-time” projects to a multitude of clients across the pharmaceutical industry while remaining flexible in ways of working.

In this role they will drive cross functional collaboration between various stakeholders on a local and global scale both internally and externally. The CD Program Manager will have oversite and decision-making power to ensure each project they are aligned to is budgeted and resourced appropriately.

They will manage the content curation and material production for each specific project and be accountable for the overall project execution and delivery. Strong vendor management experience is required to liaise with our external network of skilled associates. From a logistical standpoint, the CD Program Manager will be the main point of contact for the client and will be responsible for ensuring internal resources are delivering assigned outputs accurately and on time.

Essential Duties/Responsibilities

Manages the project scoping, planning, management, delivery and follow-up for aligned client projects; liaises closely with clients at the start of all projects to ensure project requirements are clear and achievable, adapts project plans according to client needs, coordinates activities in line with approved Statement of WorkEnsures adequate project resourcing; actively engages project stakeholders at appropriate timesAttends project scope meetings and creates, monitors, and reconciles detailed budgets in-line with project scope. Liaises pro-actively with Account Management and Finance team as required.Leads thorough and efficient briefing and debriefing meetingsParticipates in team meetings and contributes to project management excellence with the Director of Program Management and Senior PMsContributes to the formation and preparation stages of all program aspects in advance of on-site deliveryCoordinate multiple vendor relationships, simultaneously, to ensure timely execution of program delivery; to include clear, concise and proactive communicationsMaintain and grow relationships with clients

Education and Experience

Bachelor’s degree or combination of education and experience2-5 years of work experience in Program Management, Learning and Development, or a related job discipline2-5 years of experience with the project management of programsMeeting management / planning experience preferredHealthcare experience preferred

Essential Skills and Knowledge

Proven planning and organizational skillsImpeccable attention to detailProficient use of Microsoft OfficeExcellent customer focusAbility to multitask and pro-actively plan time accordinglyGood financial acumenStrong written and verbal communication skillsAbility to work as a team collaboratively and cross-functionallyAble to think creatively and innovatively to ensure the best outcomes for external and internal stakeholdersStrives for continuous improvement to PM processes and project deliveryAbility to travel Internationally 1-2 times annually, and domestically approximately 20%

Performance Competencies

These are core traits we look for in all candidates and potential employees. They are assessed throughout the interview process:

ExcellencePassionIntegrityInnovationCollaborationPlanning and organizationDrive for results and InitiativeCommunication skillsCustomer focusTechnical expertise/knowledge – sales cycleProblem solving and Decision makingBuilding Relationships

ABOUT US

Amplity provides a comprehensive array of multichannel message delivery solutions to the life sciences industry. From in field to inside and from promotional to clinical, Amplity centers-of-excellence include field sales and service, live video detailing, inside credentialed sales specialists, inside sales and service, clinical health educators, and medical science liaisons. A wide range of vital support solutions-each of which serves all of the company's message delivery channels-includes recruiting, training, performance management, operations, data/analytics, and compliance. Amplity Health provides the human touch to precision multichannel messaging delivered at the right time and through the right channels to achieve maximum impact.

Partnership. Amplified.

OUR CULTURE

When you join Amplity Health, you have the opportunity to work with and learn from leaders in the health care industry. Our commitment to a team-oriented culture and value-based leadership model provides an environment where our employees can work to their full potential. Opportunities with Amplity offer competitive compensation and dependent on the opportunity could include a comprehensive benefits package and 401K benefits. Join the Amplity team to grow with the nation's leader in healthcare.

One of our goals is to continuously drive innovation through our people by creating an open, respectful, inclusive and trustworthy work environment. We encourage and support equal employment opportunities for all associates and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, marital status, medical condition as defined by applicable state law, genetic information, disability, military service and veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws and ordinances. Employment decisions are evaluated on the basis of an individual's skills, knowledge, abilities, job performance and other qualifications. We do not condone or tolerate an atmosphere of intimidation or harassment.

To learn more about us, visit our website at amplity.com or our social media pages.

OUR DIVERSITY POLICY

We encourage and support equal employment opportunities for all associates and applicants for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation or veteran status. Employment decisions are evaluated on the basis of an individual's skills, knowledge, abilities, job performance and other qualifications. In addition, Amplity Health maintains policies and procedures designed to comply with applicable federal, state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which Amplity Health has facilities.

title: Project Manager - Interior Design
job_description:
Our Boston office is seeking a creative, innovative Project Manager. We’re looking for candidates with a strong talent to lead the development and coordination of projects. Our Project Manager position will include work on a broad range of projects. It will also require someone who can work collaboratively with a team in projects from concept to completion, with true passion, creativity, and acute attention-to-detail. This role will provide tremendous opportunities and involvement throughout the design and implementation processes.

Key Responsibilities:

Generate work plans, fee proposals and project schedules in response to RFP’s and other opportunities

Develop and execute contracts between NELSON and its outside consultants and clients for services

Monitor project schedules and budgets as determined by the client

Oversee and participate in the design and project delivery process

Ensure that design reviews occur at the designated stages of projects

Enhance the work and careers of NELSON teammates through continuous training, support and mentoring

Determine project staffing assignments by identifying the skill sets required to execute specific tasks.

Establish both quantitative and qualitative goals and objectives for each project.

Effectively manage team members to maintain positive interaction, while ensuring the highest product quality, meeting client expectations within the approved fee budget, project budget and project schedule

Responsible for leading and coordinating efforts of work done by design team

Responsible for communication with external stakeholders

Participate in local management meetings to review all projects status and provide recommendations for corrective actions when appropriate.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Architecture or Interior Design.

Minimum of 8-10 years’ experience working in the field of Interior Design or Architecture and at least 3+ years of project management experience.

AutoCAD skills required. Revit skills highly desired.

INDHP

title: Director of Product Management for Indicator of Compromise / Endpoint Detection
job_description:
Summary

Qualys is looking for an experienced Product Leader who is technical, collaborative, and truly excited about building great products to lead Qualys Malware protection product offerings. In this role, you will define product strategies, evolve current products and identify new Endpoint Security / EDR and next-Gen market opportunities. This is a very visible and hands-on PM leadership role where you will conduct research, interact with end-users and customers to define and bring new Endpoint Security solutions to market. You will work very closely with product engineering leadership and be a key member interfacing with product leadership and executive staff. The successful candidate will have the ability to interface and influence cross-functional teams throughout the company.

Role and Responsibilities

Be the ‘Product Owner’ that the engineering teams look up toProduct Roadmap – Define and Develop a product roadmap that represents key deliverables, customer asks and market directionManage and prioritize the Endpoint Security strategyEnsure products are aligned to company’s Cyber Security product strategyEngage with executive stakeholders to identify needs and map it to overall product roadmap.Provide technical and program oversight within the Endpoint Security product portfolioWork closely with Endpoint Security product leadership to ensure day to day activities have the appropriate priority and have strong alignment to roadmap.Manage dependencies within and outside of the Endpoint Security productProvide timely updates to executive team

Desired Skills, Experience and Qualifications:

Comfortable with conflicts, capable of influencing cross-functional teams without formal authorityPassionate problem solverStrong desire for learning new thingsExcellent analytical, written and verbal communication skills – capable of explaining complex requirements in simple wordsExperience working with large enterprises, understanding their needs and capabilities in deploying new softwarePrior experience of software development and good understanding of software engineering methodologies is a big plusExperience with SaaS model / cloud-based security systems is a plusGood domain knowledge of malware detection and protection technologies is requiredAny experience of working for or managing an Anti-Malware / AV product in the past will be highly beneficialBachelor's / Master’s degree in a technical field; MBA – an advantage

Knowledge of IOC / IOA / EDR / Next-gen AV or machine-learning based malware detection is required.


Good understanding of competitive product landscape and featuresAbility to distinguish between hype and reality is essentialPrior experience of working with globally distributed teams is highly desirable.Innovation focused – ability to understand disruptive solution where no precedence exists!

title: Director of Product Management
job_description:
The Director of Product Management is a vital member of the Engineering team who owns the product roadmap across all products, while transforming Dynamic Signal’s product management team into a world-class organization who, through superior data analysis, innovation and execution.

Dynamic Signal’s new Director will be a key contributor in the development and growth of Dynamic Signal’s current and future product plan – owning and crafting a superior customer experience. In partnership with leaders across Engineering, Product Design and Product Marketing, the Director of Product Management will identify and develop strategic plans around evolving customer needs and trends, new market opportunities, and will drive product and market strategy as a core cultural value and competency within the company.

Key Responsibilities:

Reporting to the CTO, the Director of Product Management will own the operation of the Product Management team.Collaborate across Product Management, Engineering, and Product Design to develop overall product strategy and define the vision, roadmap, and goals for our products.Provide fact-based data analysis to ensure that new product offerings meet customer demands; provide superior quality at scale and distinguish Dynamic Signal from existing and future competitive offerings.Partner with engineering to establish rapid product development and deployment processes with a small team that can accelerate, build, design, test and launch releases with constant updates.Oversee feature prioritization for the development teams and keep programs running on time within an agile development environment.Work closely with a cross functional product team to lead the definition and execution of Dynamic Signal’s product strategy from insight to go-to-market execution.

Qualifications and Experience:

Seasoned Product Director/Manager who has delivered successful SaaS product(s), at scale, while owning vision, strategy, data and execution of that product line.7+ years Product Management with 3+ years delivering SaaS productsPrior start-up experience or an entrepreneurial mentality validated by success within unstructured environments, a rapid integration mindset, and a clear affinity for the customer.An excellent team builder. Demonstrated ability to define, refine, and implement development processes, resource planning, metrics, and documentation.Excellent customer management, project management skills and ability to work across functions to drive business goals.Experience working on a small, talented team to execute sharply.

Education:

A strong academic background with a Bachelor’s degree from a top university is a plus, but we care more about track record and skill than pedigree.

title: Product Manager, Quality Automation
job_description:
Who we are:

DoubleVerify is the leader in digital performance solutions, improving the impression quality and audience impact of digital advertising. Built on best practices, DoubleVerify solutions create value for media buyers and sellers by bringing transparency and accountability to the market, ensuring ad viewability, brand safety, fraud protection, accurate impression delivery and audience quality across campaigns to drive performance. Since 2008, DoubleVerify has helped hundreds of Fortune 500 companies gain the most value out of their media spend by delivering best in class solutions across the digital ecosystem that help build a better industry. Learn more at doubleverify.com.

Position Overview:

With the fragmentation of digital ad spending into an ever increasing number of media formats and environments, it is critical for DV's ad exposure and engagement measurement products to execute accurately and efficiently wherever our advertiser and publisher clients run our services. As the Product Manager for Quality Automation, you will be responsible for the last line of defense before a new measurement technology is rolled out to run on millions of apps and sites each day. This role is a vital part of the processes in place to ensure that issues are identified and resolved before they may potentially impact billions of ad impressions and hundreds of millions in media investment. The ideal candidate will possess a strong knowledge in test automation and quality with the necessary skills to translate them into a product ownership capability.

This role is part of the growing Exposure and Engagement (E&E) measurement product team that measures billions of ads each day and drives insights to our clients through hundreds of metrics. We are a cross functional team that enables DoubleVerify's services across all devices/ ad formats, collects ad exposure and engagement signals, and produces metrics,reports, and insights for DV clients and partners.

What You'll Do:

Lead the development of a modern fully functional automation test framework to support all aspects of quality, including the execution of automated test plans
Work collaboratively with PMs and engineers, including teams in different locations, to build the roadmap for automation; compile product requirements that are best suited for automated testing.
Manage the scope of the measurement quality team to translate the product requirements into test cases and suites
Validate the outcome of the tests by comparing the browser/app measurement results and database assertions against the expected results
Isolate, replicate, and report any anomalies per an automated defined process and escalate them in an actionable format for development teams to investigate and resolve
Design and create monitors and alerts to identify scenarios where we may lose data or be unable to measure impressions that were not identified in the test environment
Manage DV's partner certification process for mobile in-app and CTV inventory that ensures the accuracy of measurement signals

Who You Are:

3-5 years professional experience in automated testing and quality initiatives
Prior experience managing products that are exposed as SDKs/APIs and experience in web/mobile and CTV app testing
Proven track record of improving product test coverage and managing large suites of automated tests
Strong data analysis skills and attention to details; a successful candidate is expected to have a data driven approach where product requirements are derived through insights from large datasets
Possess outstanding critical thinking skills for future-thinking and planning
B.A. /B.S. or equivalent/higher level of education in Computer Science or a related technical field is strongly preferred
Your coworkers describe you as "hands-on" and having a positive "can-do" attitude

What We Consider as Advantages:

Past experience in AdTech/MarTech or related areas with a strong understanding of the online advertising industry, platforms, and relevant metrics
Prior experience in a CI/CD environment where the automated testing solution ensures quality
Product management experience related to a test automation solution
Experience directly or managing teams that use tools such as Selenium, BrowserStack etc as well as Postman or similar API tool

title: Financial Empowerment Program Manager
job_description:
SUMMARY
The Financial Empowerment Program Manager is responsible for the success of the Financial Empowerment Network (FEN), an initiative that seeks to improve the financial well-being of Latinos through partnerships with UnidosUS Affiliates that promote access to financial coaching services. The Program Manager will be responsible for the oversight of project activities and staff in cooperation with and under the direction of the Director of Financial Empowerment. The Program Manager is also responsible for the ongoing growth of UnidosUS’s portfolio of financial empowerment program initiatives.
 
Additionally, the Financial Empowerment Program Manager will be a part of a management team of the Housing and Financial Empowerment component of UnidosUS, working with other managers and the component’s senior leadership to support the strategic growth and efficient operation of the department. The Program Manager, like others in the management team, will held accountable to goals in the areas of growth, quality improvement, and overall project compliance. Further, the Program Manager will be expected to engage external partners and contribute to the management of department-wide systems and contribute to the successful financial management of the department.
 
Responsibilities primarily relate to leading the FEN, ensuring that production and quality goals are met, in ways that support the ongoing pursuit of a scalable model. These goals are:

70,000 people receive financial education.
11,500 people engage in activities that will propel them forward.
1,500 people speak with the UnidosUS Counseling Connection.
900 people will engage in ongoing financial coaching services.

 
Success in this role requires a can-do attitude, a fundamental respect for the work of our Affiliates and a desire to support them in strengthening the services they offer, and a strong interest in collaborating with teammates in areas across the rest of the UnidosUS organization. Candidates must have excellent project management skills, personnel management skills, and the ability to work across teams to ensure that all parties fulfill their required duties to optimize project implementation, effectiveness, and results.
 
RESPONSIBILITIES

Ensure the achievement of all key program performance measures, in a timely way and on budget.
Contribute to the refinement of FEN models of capacity-building and technical assistance, sharing best practices and insight from FEN implementation with other aspects of component’s work for improvements in impact, relevancy, and alignment of our pieces of work.
Ensure trainings and capacity-building activities of the FEN are formalized for scalable implementation and adaptation across the network.
Make certain that needs of partners in the FEN are met as the projects evolve and grow, providing technical assistance and training directly to Affiliates involved with projects as needed.
Develop and use project management tools to organize team activity and support effective decision-making.
Support Director with project evaluation, communication, and fundraising activities related to FEN.
Oversee the development and deployment of quality control mechanisms to ensure quality of services provided by participating Affiliates.
Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation, plans, and reports.
Verify and analyze the accuracy of all data and information used or generated by project; resolve any discrepancies or problems.
Oversee and ensure the timely processing and delivery of Affiliate payments.
Monitor recordkeeping and file maintenance requirements for the program or project.
Serve as the point of contact and communicate project status adequately to key stakeholders.
Oversee the coordination of Network convenings and trainings.
Manage day-to-day activities of FEN staff including, but not limited to, scheduling job assignments; development and training; performance evaluation; recommendation for salary increases, disciplinary and other personnel actions in accordance with relevant policies and procedures.
Develop workplans for each FEN staff member based on project’s goals and objectives.
Coach staff to provide effective technical assistance and capacity building supports to FEN Affiliates.
Assess staff’s workload and capacity to ensure adequate Affiliate support.
Coordinate travel assignments for staff based on Affiliate supports needs.
Represent UnidosUS at various events such as conferences and meetings.
Participate in component’s management meetings, contributing to the achievement of the goals of peer leaders and department leadership in collaborative and creative ways.
Collaborate with other UnidosUS departments to identify and implement new opportunities for integration of financial empowerment.
Incubate and develop new financial empowerment projects, in collaboration with department leadership.

 
QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree required, master’s degree preferred.
Five to seven years of experience required in the field of financial empowerment, housing services, asset building services, or a related field; three to five years of program management and supervisory experience preferred.
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written.
Ability to create systems, establish protocols, and recommend efficiencies for higher productivity.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and goals, prioritize among assignments, and problem solve.
Ability to work with minimal supervision, maintain attention to deadlines, and function effectively under pressure and communicate clearly and effectively about workload/priorities.
Familiarity with the U.S. Hispanic community, Hispanic nonprofit organizations, and the Hispanic market and consumer a plus.
Commitment to excellence and high standards.
Ability to work independently and as a member of various teams and committees.
Acute attention to detail.
Be willing to travel on a variable schedule up to 30% of work schedule.
Bilingual (Spanish-English) skills a plus.

 
Please note: Only those applicants who submit a cover letter and a résumé will be considered for this opportunity. Please include “Financial Empowerment, Program Manager” in the subject line.
 
SEND COVER LETTER AND RÉSUMÉ TO: 
UnidosUS
Raul Yzaguirre Building
Attn: Katherine Rios
1126 16th Street NW, Suite 600
Washington, DC 20036-4845 hrmail@unidosus.org
No phone calls please!
 
EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, national origin, marital status, religion, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, personal appearance, family responsibilities, political affiliation, or enrollment in a college, university, technical school, or adult education.

title: Case Manager/Life Coach III
job_description:
Your Opportunity

Are you interested in being part of positive changes in child welfare services?

Founded in 1975 with locations across California, Aspiranet is a trusted neighbor, partner and care provider that exists to help families thrive. With personalized care, Aspiranet offers a unique blend of services including foster family support, residential care, adoption services, services for foster youth transitioning to adulthood, mental health services, intensive home-based care, and community-based family resources. We celebrate our values of respect, integrity, courage and hope through our work, and most importantly, our people.

Aspiranet staff gain inspiration from human connection and understand that success is the product of teamwork. We seek champions for our mission and those committed to excellence.

Your Future Team

Our Modesto office is seeking a Life Coach III to provide case management and supportive housing services for young adults participating in licensed housing programs. Aspiranets Transition Age Youth programs offer assistance that is client-centered, trauma-informed, and reflective of best practice standards in the field. When you join our multidisciplinary team, you become part of a passionate group determined to impact lives and empower youth.

Your Impact

Aspiranets Transitional Aged Youth (TAY) services close a critical gap for youth who are preparing for their transition to exit the foster care system towards independent living. Serving youth ranging in age from 14-25, our multi-faceted approach ensures youth receive the guidance to support housing, employment, education, wellness, and other needs they may have for a successful transition.

Your Skills and Duties

Work collaboratively to engage the Youth and other support team members in the identification of strengths and needs which support the development and implementation of a service plan.Provide weekly case contact and support to assess program compliance, regulatory standards, and progress.Conduct assessment and screenings to ensure that identified needs and safety issues are attended to via appropriate and timely referrals, follow-up, and safety planning.

Education & Work Experience

Bachelors of Arts or Science degree in a related field, 2 years of experience working with children and /or transition age youth and knowledge of the foster care system.

Licenses & Certifications

Meets all state required conditions of employment as set forth by funder and regulatory body; i.e. Fingerprint and Child Abuse Index Clearance, TB/Health Physical, valid CDL and clean driving record.

Aspiranet engages in value-based decision making to create the best possible outcomes for our stakeholders, including our employees. We offer an excellent work environment and competitive benefits. If our values are inspiring to you and you thrive in a collaborative, team-based environment then ASPIRAnet may be the right choice for you. You may be one step closer to making a difference in a child, family, and communitys life.

Compensation: Competitive DOE

Benefits: Aspiranet is a collaborative environment where everyone has a voice in creating the best possible outcomes for our clients and our staff. We offer an exceptional work environment and a competitive benefits package for full-time employees. Our benefits package is robust, aimed at keeping you healthy and well, financially secure, providing a work-life balance, and protecting you from the unexpected.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
To continue our solid growth, we are seeking a talented and highly motivated Product Manager to join our expanding organization. Product Management at Quanterix interfaces directly with customers and industry thought leaders to understand the existing and future technology needs of the marketplace and adapt our product portfolio to match those needs. The Product Manager will provide strategic vision and execution of tactical programs for new and existing products in the Simoa reagents and immunoassay kit portfolio. The ideal candidate will be able to operate independently, exercising good judgment within generally defined practices and policies, and will combine a passion for science with an understanding of marketing and customer needs to thrive in a fast-paced business environment.

Key Responsibilities:

Achieving financial targets for the Simoa assay portfolio
Lead customer experience vision, strategy, and portfolio development road map
Provide thought leadership and work collaboratively with internal and external partners, including Market Communication, Sales and Service & Support
Communicate compelling product concepts, requirements, as well as risks and constraints to senior management and stakeholders
Collaborate closely with cross functional business teams to execute the product road map and achieve successful commercialization
Product life-cycle management including product development, launch, maintenance, and discontinuation
Monitor the competitive landscape, identify opportunities and threats to our business
Monitor, understand and identify key customer needs and define opportunities for growth

Skill and Knowledge Requirements:

Experience with immunoassay development or management of ELISA or multiplex biomarker assay product lines
Self-motivated and results-oriented analytical thinker, with a track record of driving to results
Able to build relationships, influence others, and work effectively with colleagues across multiple functions and geographic locations
Good organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously
High attention to detail, accuracy, and consistency
Excellent communication skills – written, verbal, and presentation skills

Minimum Experience and Education:

Bachelor's degree in an applicable life science discipline required.
Specific knowledge and hands-on experience with immunoassay and nucleic acid detection techniques, products, technology, competitors, and customers preferred.
2+ years of related experience in immunoassay development or product management.
Product development experience preferred.
Marketing experience preferred.

Travel Requirements:

Ability to travel up to 20%, both domestically and internationally

Quanterix is a company that's digitizing biomarker analysis with the goal of advancing the science of precision health. The company's digital health solution, Simoa, has the potential to change the way in which healthcare is provided today by giving researchers the ability to closely examine the continuum from health to disease. Quanterix' technology is designed to enable much earlier disease detection, better prognoses and enhanced treatment methods to improve the quality of life and longevity of the population for generations to come. The technology is currently being used for research applications in several therapeutic areas, including oncology, neurology, cardiology, inflammation and infectious disease. The company was established in 2007 and is located in Billerica, Massachusetts. For additional Information, please visit https://www.quanterix.com.

Quanterix is an Equal Opportunity Employer that offers a competitive and comprehensive employee benefits package, including health, dental, life insurance, a flexible spending plan, paid vacation, stock options and a 401(k) investment plan.

title: Capture Manager
job_description:
JOB OVERVIEW:

Valiant is seeking a Capture Manager that will be responsible for capturing new business. Will assist in identifying, qualifying, and positioning Valiant as the contractor of choice for opportunities which align with our core capabilities and targeted growth to Federal government agencies. Duties will involve full life cycle capture management including: capturing new business, establishing relationships with customer agencies and key decision makers, qualifying opportunities, maintaining customer intelligence, developing capture strategies, creating capture plans for proposal submissions Interaction with customers, contractors, subcontractors and other Valiant elements.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

Drives opportunity from capture decision to contract award, manage bid strategies and oversees the development of the technical, management, cost strategies and the associated proposal volumes.
Reviews, analyses, discovers and captures new business and growth opportunities.
Prepares and presents Valiant capability statements and other new business information presentations.
Identifies the need for or benefits of teaming partners and the associated oversight of required agreements.
Determines the most likely requirements to successfully win an opportunity to include development and articulation of the solutions required, win strategies, themes and discriminators; clearly communicate these to both corporate executives and the proposal team.
Responsible for the development, implementation and management of the capture plan and associated strategy into the proposal end-product and corporate offering.
Develops strategies and responses to Request for Information (RFI) and Expressions of Interest (EOI).
Prepares oral presentations to present to customers.
Visits the Contracting Officer and Contracting Officer's Representative to discuss existing work, capture new work and receive customer performance evaluations.
Assists in proposal preparations including but not limited to site visits, bases of estimates, key personnel solicitations and selection, technical and pricing input and reviews.
Performs other duties as assigned.

CORE VALUES:

INTEGRITY - Honesty, Trust and Respect in every situation.

EXCELLENCE - Performance, Effectiveness, Quality, and Safety in everything we do.

INNOVATION - Embracing new ideas and best practice in every service that we provide.

Valiant Integrated Services is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

NOTICE: Valiant Integrated Services NEVER asks job applicants to issue any payment or service fees to Valiant or its recruiters as part of our application process. Before providing any personal information to outside parties, verify that the job you are applying for appears on our Careers site.

title: Director of Product Management, Global Messaging
job_description: We’ve got a pretty good thing going on here at OpenMarket. We’re leaders of a mobile industry that's transforming the way customer obsessed businesses communicate with their customers. Join our team: we're friendly, caring, weirdly tenacious, and fun. The world’s biggest brands seek us out because we love finding ways to help them make their customers’ lives easier. It’s this obsession with customer experience that helps us develop software, technology and processes that competitors all over the world desire.We’re seeking enthusiastic, collaborative and resourceful people from a range of backgrounds who know how to get things done. Success comes from our culture, diversity and dynamic global team so we value people who are authentic, take ownership, and deliver together. Does this sound like you? As a key member of the OpenMarket Product Management team, you will act as a visionary for how OpenMarket should build out its global messaging capabilities and differentiate its offer from the competition. You are the driving force behind growing OpenMarket’s messaging capabilities globally, crafting a vision for the product, understanding competitors, defining market and customer requirements, capabilities and service performance, pricing strategy and tools, sales support, and go-to-market plan.OpenMarket delivers mobile engagement solutions around the world– and you will have a strategic role in delivering the global messaging connectivity that serves these organizations and differentiates OpenMarket from the rest. Develop a comprehensive product plan to support the product vision by incorporating customer requirements, defining the competitive arena, and establishing the objectives, strategies, and actions required to achieve business goals.Build a pricing strategy, processes and supporting tools to efficiently support departments and improve revenues and ensure revenue assurance.Prioritize and own the scope of each product release to deliver key capabilities on time and on budget, while balancing the needs of various departments. Coordinate the service launch across all organizations and drive the development of product documentation and education of all internal and external partners.Develop relationships with strategic customers and technology partners to continually understand and develop market requirements and competitive risks and opportunities.Work cross collaboratively to develop a Global Country Resource, to include country-specific regulatory guidelines and standard methodologies.Own the customer experience for the global messaging product – from pre-sales, to onboarding to ongoing support.Maintain Global SMS product contracts and partner with legal on updates, SLAs and other related items.  10+ years’ experience as a Product Manager delivering software, SaaS, mobile services and/or high-tech products.5+ years’ experience leading diverse, global teams.Knowledge of global and supplier carriers and experience with mobile messaging, preferably at a global SMS aggregator or mobile operator.Knowledge of multi and cross channel enablement of SaaS platform solution technical requirements.Experience leading, informing and directing engineering leaders and partners on cloud, messaging and API architecture and strategies.Background in expanding service reach and connectivity to new countries or regions.Experience in carrier class networking messaging protocols, systems and requirements.Experience with emerging mobile messaging services and business models.Experience with platform infrastructure requirements including cloud-based enablement and microservices.BA/BS, Masters preferred You love being a part of a small, dynamic, and agile team that encourages you to learn and grow.You desire to work with some of the world’s top brands.You love finding solutions to interesting problems and figuring out how things work.You welcome having autonomy with complex tasks.You are passionate about using your experience and expertise to inspire the team.This position is open in Seattle, WA. Some travel is required for this position to visit with partners, customers, attend industry events, etc.  OpenMarket embraces diversity and is an equal opportunity (EEO) employer. We are unable to sponsor new U.S. work visas at this time. Employment in this position may be contingent upon successful completion of a criminal and/or credit background investigation.

title: Product Manager
job_description: You will develop short and long-term strategic roadmaps in collaboration with our customers, engineering, marketing, customer success, and leadership teams to balance “innovation”, “integration”, and debt.  · You’ll keep all key stakeholders informed on the short and long-term impacts to the roadmap. · You’ll manage the product backlog by continuously grooming, defining, and prioritizing user stories. You’ll turn high-level ideas into technical specifications.· You’ll collaborate with engineering teams to accurately estimate level of effort for new components and features. You’ll help us scale our development efforts by increasing our ability to manage multiple efforts at once.· You’ll assemble, manage, and coordinate project teams effectively influencing others into action balanced with a supportive attitude. · You’ll have to love diving into the details to support product decisions while keeping the big picture in mind. For example, you’ll work directly with clients and the customer success team to clarify customer feedback and conduct User Experience, A/B, and beta tests to inform your decisions. You’ll review and develop awareness of competitive products as another source of insight. · You’ll prioritize feature development based on insights from usage data, feedback from customers, sales, marketing, and leadership  · You’ll communicate with our customers and employees to provide transparency into our product strategy, development status, and processes. We partner with our customers in our planning process, and they see us as an extension of their team. At the same time, you need to know when and how to prioritize those needs. · You’ll regularly partner with marketing and customer success teams to turn user data and feedback into user-adoption opportunities· You’ll Collaborate with Marketing to inform customers and prospects of new features with the goal of rapid adoption What you'll need to get startedExperience leading a B2B SaaS software product management function.Highly prefer exposure to enterprise-level customers.Ability to travel up to 10%Why work with us?It’s an exciting time at SAI. We’re in growth mode. We recently added 10 new accounts and have expanded within several major customer accounts. We expect to expand by 40-50% in 2020. We have introduced a unique new product that will help revolutionize how companies conduct business. This will enable us to reach all new markets and engage in valuable, high-level business partnerships. Your success will position you well for future leadership opportunities as we scale. We work with some outstanding clients. Do you know who helps SunTrust, Anheuser Busch and Mohawk streamline their internal operations? We do. We're trusted by business decision makers for our technical expertise, management skills, industry insights and partnerships. Our Culture: Your voice will be heard. We’re big enough to do great work, yet small enough that you can have a real impact. Opinions and ideas are encouraged and valued. As Product Manager you’ll have a unique opportunity to put your fingerprints on how we define the product going forward. You’ll work with great people. SAI is known for hiring humble, hungry and smart team members who balance hard work with fun. We strive to make our work environment pleasant and productive, without interoffice politics. You will be working with an experienced team of software and consulting industry professionals. The Product manager reports to our VP of Software Products, and will engage with all our teams, including leadership at SAI and our customers. You’ll work with great leaders: They reward hard work and performance with trust and empowerment, and it’s not a slow process.Our VPs come from brand-name organizations. Our CEO was a former partner with PriceWaterhouseCoopers (PWC). He surrounds himself with top executives as you can see from our advisory board.  You’ll grow professionally. We want our team members to continue to develop in their professions and stay on top of industry trends. You’ll have the opportunity to share your expertise and raise your professional profile through our blog, webinars, conferences and team collaboration events.As Product Manager you’ll have an opportunity to make a significant impact on how we scale the product team. Location, location, location. Conveniently located off I-83 across from Hunt Valley Towne Centre. Competitive salary and benefits. We offer competitive salaries, 100% employer-paid health insurance premiums for staff, health savings accounts, 401(k) match, and competitive PTO.

title: Software Solutions Product Manager
job_description:
Position Summary

This leadership position provides a focal point for bringing new technology products to market by driving the specification, development, marketing, sales, usage, and adoption of new PartsSource products and services. The three primary objectives for this role are voice-of-customer product definitions and beta management to execute the Product Roadmap, product marketing support on capabilities and value, and integration partner development.

As Product Manager, you will increase the revenue of existing products and develop new products for the company. You will build products from existing ideas, and help to develop new ideas based on your industry experience and your contact with customers and prospects. You must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. You should enjoy spending time in the market to understand problems and have the ability to find innovative solutions for the broader market.

You must be able to communicate with all areas of the company. You will work with application development to define product release requirements. You will work with marketing communications to define the go-to-market strategy, helping them understand the product positioning, key benefits, and target customer. You will also serve as the internal and external evangelist for your product offering, working with the sales channel and key customers.

A product managers key role is strategic, not tactical. Cross-functional departments will support your strategic efforts. This position reports to the Director of Product Management.

Job Duties

Manages the entire product line life cycle from strategic planning to tactical implementation activities to customer usage and adoption.

Analyzes product, customer, and market data to identify and define: new product opportunities, extensions and enhancements to existing products, and applications of technology to new markets.

Drives a solution set across functional teams (primarily Software Engineering, Marketing Communications, and Business Development).
Analyzes, builds, and extends potential partner relationships, including integrations, for the product set.

Maintains an in-depth understanding of all PartsSource products, their features, benefits, and application within the customer environment.
Maintains detailed knowledge of market conditions and competing products.

Creates detailed product requirements providing a complete and comprehensive definition of the features and functions of the product suitable for implementation by the software engineering team.

Acts as primary point of contact to support all product development efforts and ensure efficiency in communications and implementation.
Performs customer interviews, market surveys, focus groups, and other market research activities as needed to measure market responsiveness to product features and benefits, including beta customer management.

Develops product launch plans and coordinates all organizational areas through the successful development, launch, and lifecycle management of product initiatives.

Coordinates the operation of marketing programs to drive product sales, usage, adoption, and user satisfaction.

Works closely with the PartsSource sales organization to train, plan, and implement coordinated sales and marketing campaigns to drive customer acquisition and retention.

Performs demonstrations of products and makes presentations to customer groups about product features, benefits, and value propositions.
Develops and maintains customer and user contacts in the marketplace to ensure a ready supply of customer references and testimonials.
Other Miscellaneous duties as assigned.

Position Requirements

BA/BS in business, marketing, or technical field required. MBA preferred.

Minimum of 5 years product related experience, preferably within a software environment.

Healthcare industry experience a plus.

Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal presentation skills.

Demonstrated results-orientation and strong project management abilities.

Experience working in/leading cross-functional teams.

Willingness to travel (approximately 25%).

Strong problem solving and analytical skills.

Ability to communicate ideas and problem solutions.

Self-driven and motivated to delight customers and business partners.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Do you want to work hard alongside smart and talented product managers, engineers, and designers every day? Do you excel when you are smack in the middle of a challenging project, thrive when things get complex, and yawn when everything is going according to plan? 
 If yes, then join our Product organization and help us build technical solutions to School’s device content challenges. 
At Lightspeed Systems we are on a mission to create a safe digital space for students to learn and thrive in. We do this by giving IT teams and educators the tools to ensure that devices are used for their intended purpose, to educate. 
The Product Manager is responsible for driving product initiatives from inception through execution. You will use your deep product experience to work with stakeholders to define product strategy, manage the collection and documentation of requirements, monitor product development, oversee customer hand-off and acceptance testing, and support post launch monitoring. 
You must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. You must enjoy spending time understanding the industry to empathize with the customers and their problems, and find innovative solutions for the broader market. 
ABOUT YOU – KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES 

Has a growth mindset and knows what a growth mindset is. 
Be flexible and adaptable at all times as you go in and out of full autonomy and then into deep collaboration. 
Relish the opportunity to be an integral part of a team, but also like to roll your sleeves up and do the daily work of building something great. 
Enjoy an agile workflow that helps balance long-term vison with immediate goals. 
Ability to think holistically, in a design thinking fashion, with a sharp eye for detail and consistency. 
Thoroughly believes that the devil is in the details and is confident they can get those details right. 
Is technologically savvy and can understand sophisticated concepts with ease. 
Is obsessed with empathizing with and understanding the customer. 
Can manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously, from concepts to deliverables. 
Comfortable with feedback and adapts quickly to changing information. 
Experience working in a deadline-driven atmosphere. 
Is able to and has a proven track record of delivering quality products and features under all circumstances, whether you have 5 months, or 5 days to accomplish the goal. 
A compelling and unique point of view. 

ABOUT THE ROLE

Deeply understand the customer 
Be an evangelist for your product 
Leverage your entrepreneurial personality and be ready to experiment and learn 
Work with all internal stakeholders (marketing, sales, support, leadership, development) to ensure clear alignment and buy-in 
Maintain a relevant and well prioritized backlog, supported by user storyboards, acceptance criteria and other artifacts needed by development teams. 
Experience with User Story Mapping and Design Thinking 
Document baselines and monitor KPIs to determine success of product against stated goals. 
Articulate communicator both verbally and in writing. 
Outstanding organizational and analytical skills. 
Managing the entire product line life cycle from strategic planning to tactical activities 
Driving a solution set across engineering teams via Product Owner role within Agile Scrum framework. 
Be a subject matter expert in web filtering 

 Need to have 

5+ years experience in one of the following: Product Management, Education Industry Sales Engineering, Development 
BA/BS 

 Nice to have 

Computer Networking background 
Education Industry background 
B2B Product experience 
Technical product experience 

We require all qualified applicants, as part of the application process, to complete a set of assessments. We invite you to jump start your application for this role by completing a brief assessment (it will only take 7-10 minutes): https://bit.ly/3690mfq 
ABOUT US
Education is undergoing a technology revolution with new devices and tools being added to the classroom every day and IT departments are responsible for keeping all this technology managed, safe and working. That is where we come in! Lightspeed Systems, ed-tech provider and leader in K-12 device filtering for 20 years, partners with schools to make learning safe, managed and mobile. Learn more at www.lightspeedsystems.com.We love our employees, and we show it. A sneak peek into our BENEFITS & PERKS include:


Health -- Medical, dental and vision insurance with healthy company contribution toward premiums.
Wellness -- Lightspeed kicks cash into your HSA if you participate our HDHP. Employees are provided an adjustable desk and onsite gyms at some offices. Healthy Holiday and PTO policy.
Retirement -- 401(k) matching up to 6%
Perks -- Fully stocked kitchen with snacks and beverages. Some lunches provided as well! Some offices pet friendly.

title: Division Product Manager
job_description:
OverviewThe sales team identifies many customer needs. The DPM is tasked with synthesizing this information from many sources to identifying the greatest customer needs that can most profitably be addressed by JBT. The DPM achieves improvement in customer satisfaction, market share, product line revenue, and margin in his or her region and product line while maintaining a global perspective of the JBT portfolio.

The DPM communicates with all areas of the company, and works with an engineering counterpart to define product release requirements. The DPM works with the marketing communications team to define the product launch plan and go-to-market strategy, helping them understand the product positioning, key benefits and target customer. The DPM serves as the internal and external champion for a product offering working closely with the sales channel and key customers. Gather information on market trends & drivers, competitor’s activities, customer requirements and equipment buying behavior. Work with suppliers and/or partners to develop new or existing product line solutions as specific markets require.

ResponsibilitiesRELATIONSHIP RESPONSIBILITIES:

Number of direct / indirect reports : Depending on Product Line, this position may have direct reports
Key external contacts: Customers, Supplier Partnerships, Industry Analysts, Industry Associations.
Key internal contacts:
Sales Managers, Account Managers, Sales Support Team , Marketing Team, Project Management, Engineering, R&D, Purchasing, Manufacturing, Accounting/Finance team, General Management, Corporate staff (Division manager, Business development & Finance functions)


SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITIES / ACCOUNTABILITY:

Market analysis, research, reporting, and decision making:


Gather voice of the customer information via in-person interviews, analytical surveys, or other means.
Provide competitive updates and monitor lost orders.
Provide clear recommendations to continue, halt, or abandon a project or a product line based upon most current information.
Continuously monitor customer performance and market needs. Communicate main themes and implications to JBT stakeholders.

Sales Team Support


Work with applications engineering and project management to develop and maintain "Product Line Sales tools" including "Total Cost of Ownership" and/or "Life-Cycle" calculators; and work with Sales Team to implement tools into the Sales Process.

Support the Sales Team by developing product line sales presentations, literature and data to help in the Sales Process. Update and improve these sales tools as necessary

Product Line Direction and Performance


Develop & maintain Product Line Roadmap structure in conjunction with applications engineering, account managers, production engineering, R&D, and service.
Manage the entire product line life cycle from strategic planning to tactical activities
Develop product line competitive and marketing strategies
Assess new product development and product care opportunities through justification tools
Plan, budget and drive the Product Development projects through necessary departments (engineering, R&D, marketing, etc.). Assess success of projects after completion and modify as needed
Work closely with R&D to collaborate and streamline development efforts

Business Development


Analyze financially different strategies for key accounts, product lines, etc.
Recommend target acquisitions/partnerships as they relate to product line development
Conduct market segment studies to help identify sales opportunities
Identify new market segments to enter and determine attractiveness of those segments, market size and create a business case
Push sales to help generate greater opportunities for the product line.

Task Force Participation


Participate as an active team member in key business initiatives

Increase Expertise and Insight


Expand overall working knowledge of technical aspects and features of the company’s equipment offerings.

Qualifications

5+ years of direct industry experience in application engineering, design engineering, marketing, or department management role. A history of direct customer contact is required. Food industry experience is preferred.
BS degree in Marketing, Engineering or related field required;
Knowledgeable in technology.
This position requires travel to customer sites in North America and may include International travel.
Strong analytical, interpersonal, and communication skills (verbal, written and listening). A strong knowledge of Excel, Word and PowerPoint is crucial. Good judgment. Demonstrated work ethic. Team player. High sense of urgency and standards of excellence.

title: Product Support Specialist
job_description:
General DescriptionDo you have a passion for floorcovering and helping others? Can you troubleshoot and solve complex resilient-flooring related issues? Do you like sharing your knowledge with other industry professionals? Are you interested in the idea of working for an industry-leading company that truly values your professional experience? Do you have the ability to demonstrate your knowledge through verbal, written, and hands-on instruction? Does the opportunity to assist with the development of revolutionary new products sound interesting? If so, HMTX invites you to consider a position as our Product Support Specialist! We are looking for a top tier industry professional who is excited to join our growing company. Roles & Responsibilities

Conduct testing individually or within a team environment, assess new products under development, facilitate claims resolution, and tend to day-to-day technical projects as directed by the Product Support Manager.
Conduct installation training across all product platforms and divisions; including dryback LVT, interlocking vinyl, WPC, and SPC.
Field telephone calls providing technical assistance to internal and external customers throughout North America.
Inspect claims on large commercial projects to determine the root cause and submit findings via written reports to the Product Support Manager.
Assist Customer Service with the reviewing of claims to determine the root cause and resolution.
Work collaboratively with Distributor and Commercial Sales Managers providing technical sales support.
Draft/develop/enhance technical documentation including installation guides and training curriculum.
Work in collaboration with coworkers to maintain a clean, organized and safe environment within the Quality Evaluation Workspace.
Attend construction meetings and conduct high profile job-starts to ensure proper start-up processes and procedures.

Position Requirements

A minimum of 10 years of master-level resilient flooring installation experience and/or a bachelor’s degree or equivalent
INSTALL Certification (or comparable) preferred.
Fluency with ASTM F1700 industry standards.
Able to work in a dynamic environment.
Exceptional verbal and written communication and reporting skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.
Ability to analyze processes and information, identify problems and trends, and develop effective solutions and strategies.
Capable of traveling unassisted with the occasional weekend, night, and extended stays.
Adaptable and willing to accommodate sudden changes in schedule.
Commitment to providing exceptional service to customers and support to staff members.
Bend, lift, stoop, squat, reach, kneel, lift, and manipulate flooring materials.
Able to adhere to and follow all company and departmental policies and procedures.

To be considered for this position the candidate is required to demonstrate installation, computer and writing skills.

title: Business Development Manager- System Drives
job_description:
ABB is seeking a Business Developer System Drives for its Wauwatosa, Wisconsin location. This role is responsible to support the US System Drives management in the definition and implementation of respective strategy – in line with global Product Group System Drive and business strategies. Ensure comprehensive understanding of US market and competitive environment. Support US management in identification and realization of business opportunities in line with global strategies. In addition, the BDM is responsible for the implementation of product marketing strategies for System Drives focusing on HP Drives and Wind Drives to meet business objectives and in line with global product strategy. The BDM will lead the implementation of marketing plans and support the Sales organizations in driving sales and achieving the required growth. Accountable for the long-term profitable growth and marketing of the ABB System Drives offering to targeted market segments, by supporting the global Product Portfolio team in regards of developing and managing product portfolio management.Your responsibilitiesYour backgroundMore about usBring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution – creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Let’s write the future, together.
