title: Group Manager, Marketing Technology Strategy and Architecture
job_description:
Panasonic – Group Manager, Marketing Technology Strategy and Architecture

Every moment of every day, people all over the world turn to Panasonic to make their lives simpler, more enjoyable, more productive and more secure. Since our founding almost a century ago, we’ve been committed to improving peoples’ lives and making the world a better place–one customer, one business, one innovative leap at a time. Come join our journey. 

Click here to learn more about how Panasonic is creating a better life, a better world.



Watch this video to see how our employees are shaping the technologies that move us.



What You’ll Get to Do:

The Group Manager, Marketing Technology Strategy & Architecture leads Panasonic’s largest and most challenging digital and marketing technology project engagements. This position reports to the Director of the Digital Demand Center in Panasonic Corp. North America’s corporate marketing group, and partners with Panasonic business units to develop the digital marketing technology program strategy to manage user experience throughout the customer decision journey and ensure integration of relevant digital touch points such as websites, social channels, paid search, etc. This position develops and owns enterprise architecture for marketing, drives martech adoption and process solutions to meet the growing and changing demands of the enterprise.

Own design, architecture, and implementation of solutions and platforms related to Marketing Technology (martech stack) including Mobile Applications, Marketing API & Integration Backend Services, Atomic Design Frameworks and Cross-Platform Frontend Experiences.As a trusted advisor, work with application owners, data domain owners, marketers, and business leaders to optimize current stack investments and drive future business requirements to ensure strategic business goals are met.Ensure that ROI on investments is achieved.Drive martech strategy including roadmap and execution in collaboration with stakeholders and partner/vendors, utilizing best practices e.g. 70/20/10 rule.Act as the chief product owner for the Panasonic martech stack including the Customer Engagement Platform, Partner Management System, API Platform and Customer Data Platform.Represent discipline of marketing technology (strategy, architecture, implementation/operations) in C-suite engagements.Lead cross-functional teams on martech engagements including pilots and manage to budgets and deadlines.Manage, mentor, attract and retain team of marketing technologists.



What You’ll Bring:

Education & Experience:

10-12 years leadership experience driving and implementing successful digital marketing transformation at the enterprise level.Demonstrated leadership through product mindset, agile software development managing scrum practices, and building for business outcomes.Experience leading architects and engineering teams to design, deliver and maintain a continuously evolving technology architecture / eco-system combining both internal and external technology landscapes and organizations.Expertise in managing complex martech stacks, and designing and building applications for scalability and repeatability (e.g., DMP, DSP, DAM, CRM, CDP, PMS, MDM, MAP).Demonstrate executive level presentation and anticipatory skills, and able to work effectively in a cross-functional and matrixed organization.Experience with one or more of the following preferred: digital marketing (e.g., web content management, rich internet applications, web and social analytics, online ad targeting, content personalization), technology/software/SaaS concepts, custom software development processes and methodologies (including managing agile projects and sprints), technology project management and governance.Familiarity with current privacy and compliance requirements related to consumer/personal data (e.g., CCPA, CSTL, GDPR).Experience working at a digital agency or a global enterprise supporting cross-portfolio, cross-functional, and distributed teams.S., M.B.A. and/or background in high tech, engineering or comparable area.

What We Offer:

Competitive compensation packageComprehensive benefits401KPet InsurancePaid Parental Care LeaveEmployee Referral ProgramEducational AssistanceFlexible Work ProgramVolunteer time OffCasual Dress CodeTotal Well Being Program

Panasonic is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by law or company policy. All qualified individuals are required to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation. Pre-employment drug testing is required for safety sensitive positions or as may otherwise be required by contract or law. Due to the high volume of responses, we will only be able to respond to candidates of interest. All candidates must have valid authorization to work in the U.S. Thank you for your interest in Panasonic Corporation of North America.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Who are we?Ribbon is a first of its kind real estate technology company transforming the real estate transaction by delivering certainty, transparency and joy to the home buying process. Consumers and realtors deserve a better experience, and we have designed an open platform that welcomes everyone in the ecosystem to participate.

As members of the Ribbon team, we live out our mission every day through our core values:


Be an invited guest to dinner - Everything we do is in the service of the customer.
Be a (home) owner - If we see a problem, we address it head on without assuming someone else will do it.
Break new ground - We challenge conventional wisdom to create clever solutions and break down the walls.
Foster greatness - We grow and inspire the team around us to constantly make Ribbon better.
Engage with intellectual humility - We become our best selves through rigorous debate and adjusting opinions based on new information.

How you'll help make homeownership achievable:



Lead the team to focus on the most impactful projects that empower the entire company to help homebuyers, sellers, agents, lenders, and the entire housing ecosystem.
Work closely with the engineers on the team to help us execute on the most impactful initiatives
Work closely with functions across the company whom we serve as customers (operations, finance and risk, growth, engineering).
Set broad vision, influence engineering and strategy, and establish practices to address customer needs

What we're looking for:



Product judgment - You make the right calls in product decisions based on deep user empathy, data, and your product instincts.
Leadership - You can inspire the team, resolve conflicts, and create alignment. People want to follow you to build great products.
Business acumen - Ribbon is a complex business. You will need to understand the whole business so you can drive the best product decisions.
Data chops - You should be a natural at diving into the metrics through our data tools, as well as choose the right metrics to set the team up for success.
Relentlessly resourceful - You find a way to get the most challenging things done through determination and creativity.

You have:



BA/BS degree or equivalent practical, working experience (4+ years preferred)
4+ years as a Product Manager or product owner role at a strong technology company
Build world-class products, ideally a real-world marketplace or a product with a strong operations component
Technical knowledge of how software works and what's difficult and what's possible
Founder experience is a huge plus
Software engineering experience is a plus

What we offer:



Health, dental, and vision insurance
Flexible, unlimited vacation
Regular team lunches
Discounted fitness benefits
401(k)
Commuter benefits
FSA + HSA
Learning + development stipend
Meaningful equity in the company

Read more about our engineering culture here!

Even if you don't meet all the requirements, we encourage you to apply! If you'd be excited to show up for work each day, we'd be excited to have you on our team.

Here at Ribbon we're not scared of differences. It's how we break new ground. As we scale and we help families from every walk of life, the team we build must be reflective of the diversity that we serve. Together, we've built and will continue to grow, a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone has a seat at the table and the space to be their most authentic self. Ribbon is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we support, celebrate, and cherish all the things that make our teammates who they are.

title: Mortgage Production Manager
job_description:
The Mortgage Production Manager is a visible, hands-on position, reporting directly to the Chief Lending Officer. The Production Manager is responsible for creation and maintenance current product offerings in addition to reviewing residential mortgage applications and scenarios for approval. The position also requires extensive knowledge of current mortgage products, industry regulations, and mortgage lending guidelines including FNMA. A wide degree of creativity is expected.

Management

title: Market Manager – Nationwide
job_description:
OverviewNOTE: Danville, IL is 2.5 hours from Chicago, 1.5 from Indianapolis, 0.5 from Champaign/Urbana.

Headquartered in Danville, Ill., Watchfire has manufactured electric signs since 1932 and LED signs, using meticulously sourced components from around the world, since 1998. Our products include indoor and outdoor LED displays, fixed digit and video scoreboards, gas price signs and digital billboards. Every aspect of our products and service is focused on giving our customers the greatest advertising tools available for developing their business and increasing sales. Our partnerships with respected, knowledgeable sign company professionals are the foundation of our collective success.

Watchfire LED signs are known for their legendary quality and reliability. We test our outdoor displays to withstand whatever nature throws at them, all to guarantee our customers years of worry-free performance. The excellence in every Watchfire sign begins with our outstanding engineering team designing a quality product. In production, we choose quality over expedience or expense. We use the best performing components available from a global market and invest the time and expense needed to evaluate and verify every aspect of our products’ design, function and serviceability. Our reputation depends on our displays looking and performing great not just on day one, but for years to come.

We developed our proprietary Ignite software to create and manage messages from design to scheduling. Whether the sign is large or small, color or monochrome, the suite of Ignite software helps create head-turning messages through easy-to-use interfaces. Watchfire has over 60,000 LED signs in operation at convenience stores, gas stations, retail outlets, banks, schools, places of worship and other locations worldwide. We also have more digital billboard customers in the U.S. than any other brand.

Job Description:

The Market Manager will prospect and qualify new digital sign opportunities in a strategic market through face-to-face meetings and on-site demonstrations. The Market Manager will also quickly follow up on prospects generated by Watchfire marketing efforts in their market. This position will report to the Business Development Manager, but also receive guidance, direction, and mentoring from the overlapping Territory Manager.

The Market Manager will spend most of their time out in their market meeting with end user prospects, but the position will not require significant overnight travel outside of occasional trips to Watchfire’s home office, annual sales meetings, and industry events. Watchfire will provide a company vehicle for travel within their designated markets. It is important for the Market Manager to reside within, or in close proximity, to their strategic market.

*Watchfire is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs.Responsibilities

Proactively seek out new sales targets in their strategic market
Prospect new customers through phone calls, personal visits, and onsite demonstrations
Qualify and handoff prospects who are ready for next steps in the sales process to the local Territory Manager
Document and track sales activities consistently in Salesforce

Required Education/Qualifications

2-5 years of related career experience
Associate’s degree along with relevant career experience will be considered
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Sales or related field preferred
Sales force or similar CRM experience highly valued
Confidence, persistence, and drive for success
Creative problem solving and flexibility to change is highly valued
Experience with B2B sales prospecting
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Professionalism, tact, attention to detail, self-organization, and consistent work ethic
Valid driver’s license and ability to drive daily
Comfort with face-to-face sales
Legal authorization to work in the US required. We will not consider candidates who need sponsorship, now or in the future, to be legally employed in the US. No H1B, OPT, CPT or other “temporary work authorization” candidates will be considered.

title: Technical Manager Embedded Software Engineering
job_description:
We are AAM. We have the POWER to move the world.

At AAM, we're looking for associates who push boundaries and drive solutions for the future. Innovators. Thinkers. Dreamers. Doers. No matter the role or function, every associate is a piece of what makes AAM great. Were growing and building #TeamAAM to be the best. Join us!

Job Posting TitleTechnical Manager Embedded Software EngineeringJob Description SummaryAmerican Axle & Manufacturing, Inc. has openings for Technical Manager Embedded Software Engineering at its Advanced Technology Development Center (ATDC), located in Detroit, Michigan.Job Description

Define the technical criteria for Software Architecture, Detailed Design, Unit Construction and Testing in accordance with company software roadmap.Embedded software development using Assembly/MISRA C/Simulink/Stateflow/ Embedded Coder and AUTOSAR for 16 or 32-bit microcontroller for automotive driveline systems including locking differential, transfer case, and torque transfer differential.Analysis, design and implementation of software requirements including diagnostics specification such as UDS/KWP/GMLAN standards using GenY, CANdela studio and ISOLAR A and B.Develop embedded software build environment using Cosmic or Hightec compiler.Troubleshooting of software algorithms and low-level drivers using Zap, CANape, CANoe, Vehicle Spy, In-circuit emulator and Oscilloscope

Required Skills and Education

Bachelors Degree in Electronic or Electrical Engineering, or foreign equivalent education, and 5 years of post-baccalaureate progressive experience working in the embedded software development field. 5 years of experience is required in each of the following:

Developing embedded software using MISRA C, Assembly programming language, Simulink, Stateflow and Embedded Coder for 16 or 32-bit microcontroller.Embedded software development including requirements analysis, design, implementation, and testing of automotive driveline systems including locking differential, transfer case, and torque transfer differential.Developing vehicle diagnostics software per UDS/KWP/GMLAN using GenY and CANdela studio with Cosmic/Hightec compiler.Debugging of embedded software using tools including Zap, CANape, CANoe, Vehicle Spy, In-circuit emulator and Oscilloscope.

Experience may be obtained concurrently.

About American Axle & Manufacturing

For over 20 years, customers around the world have entrusted AAM to design, engineer, validate and manufacture driveline and metal forming technologies for automotive, commercial and industrial markets. Today, we are a premier global Tier 1 automotive supplier with broad capabilities across multiple product lines to deliver efficient, powerful and innovative solutions for our customers. Weve earned the trust of our suppliers and our customers through our steadfast commitments to quality, operational excellence and technology leadership.

AAM delivers power. We deliver power literally through vehicle components, systems and innovation, but we also deliver power in ways unseen. We power our associates, their families, and the communities in which we operate. Our global team of over 21,000 associates has a clear vision of where AAM is going and how we are going to get there. After all, they are the reason we are a leader in the automotive industry. We are powering the future. We are AAM. Move with us, and join #TeamAAM.AAM will not discriminate against any Associate or applicant for employment because of age, race, color, gender, religion, weight, height, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic history or information, gender identity or expression, disability, protected veteran status, national origin, or other characteristic protected by law. title: eCommerce Customer Service and Quality Manager
job_description:
Leading online retailer & direct-to-consumer brand looking for customer service manager with extensive Zen Desk and eCommerce experience to lead a small team of customer care advocates. Founded in 2005, Kraken is the #1 online brand of Speciosa tea and related products, has over 200,000 customers, is the industry leader in product quality and safety. We are seeking a quality detail oriented and special someone to oversee our growing customer base.  What you ll be doing:

Oversee our customer service team of Zen Desk, LiveChat, and Phone Support Agents
Manage, refine, and implement all customer service processes
Set reasonable customer satisfaction goals and work with the team to meet them on a consistent basis
Interact with customers on a daily basis, responding to their questions and guiding them as needed.
On-board any potential new agents and train them based on your expertise and skill set
Create and implement an effective customer loyalty program

Skill requirements:

5+ years of customer service experience with 3+ years experience as a CS Manager
2-year college degree/certificate required.
Expert understanding of quality and customer service as it pertains to eCommerce
Intermediate/Expert understanding of Zen Desk.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; you will communicate, talk with and write to customers plus manage an existing Zen Desk agent as well as two phone agents.
Patience.
Previous experience evaluating quality and refining CS processes

Knowledge of CRM systems, Magento, Zen Cart, Shipstation
In depth knowledge and experience in using ZenDesk
Experience in B2C retail ecommerce environments is highly preferred.
Previous call center or phone support is desirable
Some knowledge of botanical products is a plus.

Our Culture

We are seeking experienced, smart, open-minded people who love technology and who aim to be a part of something bigger. We are operating in a high-risk and cutting edge environment and we are seeking like-minded folks who are interested in the thrill of the hunt and whose native skills derive from the deep internal passion of their work.

About Us  Our office is located in inner Northeast Portland, Oregon. We work flexible hours and schedules and operate as a team. Our space is bright, creative, and with open team work areas. We're surrounded by public transportation and convenient car & bike parking. We prefer our folks in-house with light remote work available as or when needed. We truly believe in a balanced work/life ethic. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We sell herbal, tea, food, and supplement products online and are the largest retailer of Speciosa tea in the world. We offer competitive medical and dental benefits and up to three weeks of paid time off. We are also open to relocation assistance, if some is required.  Please include your resume, cover letter, and date of availability. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Sr. Product Manager/Associate Director, Medical Marketing
job_description:
Working at Horizon is more than a job – it’s personal. For us, success is measured by the numbers that matter most – the number of lives we touch, the number we change and those we work tirelessly to help save. We’re a team of agile, out-of-the-box thinkers who are inspired to do more because we know we’re a part of something bigger. title: Senior Product Manager
job_description:
Role Description: Imagine being responsible for driving a product from paper concept to 'in the customer's hand' reality. Imagine enabling a growing start-up company and product team to drive business transformation at companies like GE, Salesforce, ADP, Dell and others with impact to a customer's top line. And imagine doing all that without the big company bureaucracy that slows down experimentation and progress of a product team.

As a Senior Manager of Product Management at 6sense, you'll be an instrumental player to help us grow the emerging market of predictive intelligence for sales and marketing. We have a superior technology position and growing customer base, and you will be a key contributor to help us accelerate growth through identifying and delivering upon unique product value propositions. You will drive some of our core products designed to meet the customer and market need while maintaining the overall company strategy.

This position reports to the VP of Product, and we're looking for someone that has a strong technical and analytical background, exceptional at executing a product roadmap, can get into the mind of our target customer, and can iterate with customers, customer success, user experience, and the executive team to build compelling customer value. You need to be an integrative thinker with high attention-to-detail, a strong communicator, a great problem-solver, and a hard worker.

The Company:

The 6sense Account Based Orchestration Platform helps revenue teams identify and close more opportunities by putting the power of AI, big data and machine learning behind every member of the B2B revenue team, empowering them to uncover anonymous buying behavior, prioritize fragmented data to focus on accounts in market, and engage resistant buying teams with personalized, multi-channel, multi-touch campaigns. 6sense helps revenue teams know everything they need to know about their buyers so they can easily do anything they need to do to generate more opportunities, increase deal size, get into opportunities sooner, compete and win more often.

Job Responsibilities

Be a customer advocate and organizational glue, championing customer needs via customer discovery sessions and understanding industry trends that will drive our product vision
Gather requirements from users, customers, sales, support and internal stakeholders
Develop use cases and product requirements to communicate these needs to engineering and user experience
Work with the product management team to coordinate and drive roadmap, positioning, requirements, and track feature delivery
Work with sales and customer success teams to drive process and product improvements
Support product marketing to create customer driven messaging and content

Minimum Required Skills

Demonstrated ability to build, own, communicate, and drive the roadmap of at least one product through cross-functional collaboration and research
Demonstrated ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects for different stakeholders
Demonstrated ability to communicate complex feature requirements, capture clear user stories, and design appropriate product feature metrics
Demonstrated ability to understand technical challenges with software-as-a-service offerings, and work hands-on with engineering and user experience teams to find solutions
Demonstrated ability to provide product demonstrations
Superior verbal communication and presentation skills in translating product concepts and issues into implications and actions
Experience in a fast-paced Agile and Web Development environment
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to connect with customers and partners
Native-level English written and spoken skill is required

Minimum Required Qualifications

Background or product management experience in marketing tech, sales tech, or ad tech space
Academic background in computer science or related engineering discipline that will enable you to easily communicate with the engineering team; MBA preferred
4+ years of product management experience working with enterprise customers; ideally managing at least one product through an entire development cycle from concept to launch

title: Quality Manager (Multi-Site Food/Chemical Mfg)
job_description:
Quality Manager (Multi-Site Food/Chemical Mfg)


Location



MN - Roseville


Job Code

2020-130.2


# of Openings

1



Apply Now
ABOUT HAWKINSHawkins, Inc. is a formulator, manufacturer, blender, distributor, and sales agent for thousands of industrial chemicals, reagent grade laboratory chemicals, and other specialty ingredients sold to municipalities and a wide variety of industries. Founded in 1938 and headquartered in Roseville, Minnesota with 41 facilities in 19 states, Hawkins creates value for its customers through superb customer service and support, quality products and personalized applications.

Learn more about us at www.hawkinsinc.com/careers.ABOUT THE JOBHawkins is looking for a Quality Manager (Food/Chemical Manufacturing) to be based at our corporate headquarters in Roseville, MN. This position manages the Quality team overseeing several facility locations in Minnesota, covering multiple business divisions (pharmaceutical-grade, food-grade, and industrial-grade chemical products), and meeting all regulatory and customer requirements for the sites. The Quality Manager will provide leadership, guidance, and employee development support for his/her team, and will support the Quality Director as needed.

Responsibilities

Team Management:

Provide management of the Quality department across multiple facilities and business units (pharmaceutical excipients, food, and industrial chemicals).
Represent and champion the Quality team and function.

QMS Development and Implementation:

Respond to customer requests and questionnaires in a timely manner.
Manage the timely disposition of quality materials and documentation
Responsible for coordinating and facilitating resolution of product quality concerns and issues.
Manage CAPA and complaints, ensuring timely reporting, adequate root cause investigations and compliance to schedule on resulting action items.
Perform risk assessments and manage HACCP, Food safety plans, and all pre-requisite programs at the sites.
Manage annual qualification testing of manufactured products, where needed.
Drive QMS compliance at all supervised facilities and ensure that organizational systems, documentation, training and design controls are appropriate for organization and are enforced.

Regulatory Management:

Oversee compliance to all pertinent regulations (FDA, ISO, GFSI, SQF, IPEC) and drive continuous improvement to support certification requirements.
Function as a lead for internal and external audits and address any non-conformities that may result.
Manage external compendia review, USP and FCC monographs, and required testing for incoming raw materials and finished product.

ABOUT YOU

B.S. in Chemistry or science-related field required; Masters degree preferred.
5 to 10 years of work experience in Quality operations, preferably within the food or pharmaceutical industry.
Minimum of 3 years of direct supervisory experience with a passion for developing people.
Experience with regulatory bodies and working knowledge of FDA, GMP, SQF, ISO 9001-2015 and IPEC requirements.
Familiar with USP and FCC monograph requirements.
Strong knowledge of analytical test methodology and ability to analyze/interpret test results.
Experience in CAPA, Risk Assessment, HACCP and Change Management processes.
Must be able to work collaboratively in a cross-functional environment, and ensure timely completion of projects.
Must demonstrate active listening, problem-solving and relationships skills.
Must be proficient with Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel.
Must have the ability to work at a high level of accuracy and timeliness.

WORK FOR THE BESTHawkins offers a competitive compensation and benefit package and is an award-winning employer and organization! Learn more about us at www.hawkinsinc.com.

All resumes/applications must be submitted online.

Hawkins, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, gender, disability or protected veteran status.

Hawkins, Inc. is a Drug Free Workplace Employer

title: Product Manager, Mechanical Condition & Safety (Smart & Connected)
job_description:
Sensata Technologies is looking for an entrepreneurial product manager to develop the product strategy and drive the product roadmap from concept development to market leadership for smart and connected technologies that serve mechanical condition and safety applications on commercial trucks and trailers (e.g. wheel ends, tires, brakes, etc.).

Commercial fleets are seeking to deploy smart and connected devices across trucks and trailers in order to generate actionable insight from sensors to reduce breakdown costs, reduce time for pre/post-trip inspections, and improve vehicle safety as well as fuel efficiency. As the Product Manager you will be responsible for understanding and translating the business needs of commercial fleets related to mechanical condition and safety into a compelling technology solution comprised of a vehicle area network platform and a portfolio of wireless sensors.

This is a unique opportunity at Sensata to play a highly visible role to develop and execute on a product strategy that is both compelling and achievable as a result of combining a deep understanding of customer and partner needs with our smart and connected technology capabilities. The Product Manager will work closely with market development, engineering, and operations teams along with all types of customers and partners across the commercial fleet ecosystem, including truck and trailer OEMs, tiers and telematics providers.

This role reports to the Senior Product Manager for Smart & Connected and the selected candidate will join a highly motivated and growing team within a new ventures organization at Sensata charged with incubating and commercializing new technologies.-

Responsibilities include:

Understand market outlook and ecosystem evolution for mechanical condition and safety applications across smart and connected trucks and trailers for different customer segments and go-to-market channels in each global region.Build deep customer empathy in partnership with the market development team for typical use cases experienced by each stakeholder (e.g. driver, production technician, fleet back office, etc.)Synthesize product requirements and develop a differentiated product strategy for an integrated solution consisting of high value wireless sensors and an interoperable vehicle area network platform connecting trucks and trailers.Define the multi-generation product roadmap, determining which devices and features should be prioritized across each customer segment and go-to-market channel.Facilitate product/solution development in collaboration with engineering.Lead product positioning and value proposition development for each customer segment and go-to-market channel; use data to illustrate conclusions that address commercial fleet business needs.Develop monetization strategies and pricing models for solution offerings, including creating innovative new revenue/business models.

Experience/Qualifications:

The ideal candidate will possess the following characteristics:

4+ years post-MBA or 6+ years work experience performing relevant product management or related job function.B.S. degree in engineering, or related quantitative field. MBA preferred.Ideal candidate will have experience with commercial fleets, telematics and/or commercial vehicle solutions. Demonstrated ability to lead and drive complex product definition and development with multiple internal and external stakeholders.Outstanding organizational skills, especially the ability to manage multiple concurrent priorities being executed by multiple teams.Strong interpersonal and leadership skills with the ability to work in a cross-functional environment and deliver results despite the ambiguity and complexity typically associated with emerging markets.Structured thinking with analytical skills.Desire to make a significant impact in a high growth environment.Energetic, collaborative, self-motivated and autonomous.Willingness to travel as required across North America and EuropeStrong MS PowerPoint and Excel skills

-

-SmarterTogether

Collaborating at Sensata means working with some of the world’s most talented people in an enriching environment that is constantly pushing towards the next best thing.
Employees work across functions, countries and cultures gaining new perspectives through mutual respect and open communication.
As OneSensata, we are working together to make things work together

If you are an individual who requires a reasonable accommodation in connection with the hiring process and/or to perform the essential functions of the position for which you applied, please make a request to the recruiter or contact benefits@sensata.com.

NOTE: If you are a current Sensata employee (or one of our Affiliates), please back out of this application and log into Workday via the Company Intranet to apply directly. Type FIND JOBS in the Workday search bar.

title: Director of Product Management (Pay)
job_description:
At Fivestars, our mission is to help businesses and communities thrive by turning every transaction into a relationship. Over 50 million people use Fivestars to get rewarded at more than 14,000 local businesses with one rewards program. Local businesses use Fivestars to bring more customers into their stores with an all-in-one marketing and payments program. Fivestars drives over $3 billion in local commerce across its network per year. Fivestars has raised $105 million from HarbourVest, Menlo Ventures, Lightspeed, DCM, Y-Combinator, and others. Together, let's love local. Visit www.fivestars.com for more information.

Who you are:

We are looking for a Director of Product Management who is excited to lead the vision and execution of our payments product at FiveStars. The ideal candidate will bring depth of functional (product management) and subject matter (SMB, payments) knowledge as well as a proven track record of shipping fantastic products. Upon coming on board, you'll be joining and fostering a culture of making, testing and learning. You will be part of a highly collaborative, iterative, learning environment that is excited by creating new and innovative solutions to business owners problems.

What you'll be doing:

Lead the product vision, strategy, roadmapping, prioritization, development and execution of two or more product teams at FiveStars
Translate company goals into a clear team strategy
Own company-level OKRs for those teams.
Be a player and a coach: you'll have projects or products that you may own and directly drive, while also mentoring and managing other product teams
Work cross functionally with engineering, design, analytics, marketing and other product teams to create great customer experiences.
Use qualitative and customer research and data analysis to communicate product vision to senior management and various stakeholders.
Occasionally eat a piece of pizza or two or six

Desired Skills and Experience:

8+ years of building and shipping products that customers love
Management experience
Strong technical architectural understanding of SMB and payment products.
Proven ability to lead teams and work cross-functionally in a highly collaborative environment
Knowledge of agile development methodologies and tools
Passion about the SMB space and the problems we are solving
Continual desire to understand merchant and consumer behaviors
Natural talent for moderating competing ideas and finding creative solutions

Fivestars provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Fivestars complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

title: Senior Product Manager-mobile apps experience
job_description:
Audible is seeking a Senior Product Manager to define and build key product experiences that will elevate the customer experience for millions of Audible customers leading to deep engagement and long term retention of our passionate listeners. As a member of the the product team, you will ensure that these experiences are well thought out and connect the entire customers journey across our website, apps and device experiences on a global scale.

You will focus relentlessly on customer needs, working with user experience designers to craft product features that will surprise and delight our customers. You will provide enough clarity in the product definition that our software engineers can build the product/features and our marketers can determine the product positioning.

You will be the voice of the customer as you work with data, design, technical, and business leaders to set strategy and define the product.

ABOUT YOU

You live and breathe consumer experiences across website (desktop and mobile) and possess a good understanding of iOS and Android apps. You understand seamless customer experiences from one platform to another and how they together form a whole continuous end to end customer experience. You understand the cost benefit analysis of the features you build. You have an insatiable appetite for understanding your customers and are relentless in finding solutions that meet their needs across a variety of surfaces. You sweat the details and tie them back to the big picture.

Youre an accountable, hands on problem-solver with a positive attitude, letting nothing stand in the way. You know how to clarify the path forward and prioritize work. You know how to influence others.

Youre a natural collaborator equally comfortable talking tech with developers, user experience with designers, copy and positioning with product marketers, numbers with finance and marketing, and strategy with executive leadership.

The successful candidate will be an ambitious self-starter with a passion for building best-in-class customer experiences. You will have proven analytical capabilities, strong persuasive writing skills, broad business experience, tenacity to develop ideas independently, and thrive in a fast-paced start-up

environment.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

· Work with leadership and key business and engineering stakeholders to set strategy, define the product, and make appropriate high-judgement trade-offs between features and speed-to-launch.

· Drive product development from conceptualization through launch creating actionable plans, workstreams and tactics, and execute on those in support of new product launches.

· Establish and continuously update the roadmap for Audibles customer experience on our website/mobile surfaces.

· Collaborate with technology teams, UX, marketing and business development partners to determine what features to move forward and in what priority order.

· Ensure business and technical stakeholder needs are aligned by driving mindful discussions that lead to crisp decisions.

· Write market, functional and system requirements documents and ensure clear communication and coordination of requirements to business and development teams.

· Proactively identify and mitigate risks before they become roadblocks.

· Partner with UX and User Research to define good outcomes for qualitative testing, ensuring we are building the right experience for a diverse range of cultures.

· Regularly review metrics and proactively seek out new and improved data/mechanisms for visibility, ensuring your program stays aligned with organization objectives.

title: Shift Manager / Shift Lead / Aquarium Adventure
job_description:
Retail Sales Expert with a passion for the aquatic life? This is for you!!!
We have 1,000 Species of fish in 450 aquariums and 20,000 gallons of water - this truly is an Aquarium Adventure!
We are looking for dedicated, reliable aquatic lovers, with an outgoing personality to join our team. We have some tremendous career opportunities for the right individuals who are looking for a change of pace and share our passion for the aquatic life. We are in need of individuals who can hit the ground running, and who can eventually take on a senior role.
What does it take?
We are proud of our Fish Specialists; they love what they do. It is this aspect, as well as product quality selection, and a real love of aquatics and reptiles that gives Aquarium Adventure it’s reputation.
A major focus of our Fish Specialists is to educate people . This information assists customers in making informed choices that improves the quality of the their lives and the lives of their pets.
We provide all necessary training.
Do you have what it takes?

AT LEAST 30 hours a week, with a flexible schedule. (This is a retail position, so weekends and evenings are required. Flexibility is KEY. A limited availability will not work for us.)
Previous retail sales is required. (This position is very sales driven. We need individuals who have the confidence and experience to fully engage with our customers, and properly relay information. You must be comfortable meeting biweekly sales goals.)

Our seniors are the managers' second hand. We need an individual who can assist the manager in any needed task (customers, operations, opening/closing, etc.)
Does this sound like you? We Want You!!!! Apply now to become a part of our team. Please only serious acquisitions only.
**A true passion for the aquatic life is a MUST.**
Please do not apply if ALL of the above does not pertain to you. Only qualified individuals will be considered.
Apply Today!: https://my.peoplematter.at/petlandaqa/HIRE

title: Product Manager, Digital Channel Engagement
job_description:
As a Product Manager, you will bring your leadership, business acumen, and technical skills to the Genesys Cloud team. You will play a critical role in the definition, development and delivery of Genesys Cloud solutions. In this role, you will usher features through all phases of product development with primary responsibilities on feature requirements definition, project planning, managing schedules, facilitating conflict resolution, identifying and communicating risk, building and managing a product roadmap and coordinating tasks involving dependencies within cross-functional teams. You will add value by ensuring that the features delivered meet quality standards, solve stated business problems and are completed in a timely manner within scope project deliverables.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate and define components of Genesys Cloud solutions, from both functional and business perspective, with a key focus on the following areas:

Artificial Intelligence (AI) Powered Digital Interactions Customer Journey with Digital Interactions Omni-Channel Interactions Seamless Channel switching Conversation threading Email Interactions Build and manage a product roadmap Work with customers, vendors and product management team to define product features Define and execute on requirements with supporting organizations, including product management, sales, development, support, IT operations, finance and legal Provide visibility to feature status and escalates issues to senior management Plan and track release milestones for feature releases Work closely with Product, Development, and Quality Assurance management to ensure successful feature delivery Identify needs, create, and deliver sales enablement training material Create and deliver clear and concise customer facing documentation outlining delivered solutions Remove obstacles blocking or slowing down the teams Manage multiple projects at one time Develop and improve processes, communicate plans and achievements, and facilitate project meetings 

Minimum Requirements:

BA/BS required Experience in Cloud solutions, with strong background in product management and cloud operations 4+ years of experience working in a Product Manager capacity working on enterprise software life cycle development Experience working with Email Channels Strong bonus if you bring validated experience using or product managing a modern helpdesk or customer care cloud platform Fluency reading and understanding API and developer documentation Experience delivering Customer Experience or Customer Engagement solutions Ability to prioritize issues effectively and meet tight deadlines when required Ability to lead a high performing, cross-functional team Ability to manage the work and quality of other cross-functional team members Ability to resolve conflict within a project team Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong Project management skills Ability to actively listen and learn Ability to multi-task, prioritize and be detail oriented Ability to work in a team environment Ability to take initiative and be proactive Ability to work independently and be resourceful Ability to manage multiple projects and coordinate with other Product Managers Critical thinker with excellent communication skills, written and verbal 


About Genesys

Every year, Genesys® delivers more than 70 billion remarkable customer experiences for organizations in over 100 countries. Through the power of the cloud and AI, our technology connects every customer moment across marketing, sales and service on any channel, while also improving employee experiences. title: Software Product Owner
job_description: Product Owner Would you like the best of both worlds--cutting edge technology and meaningful work? Our team uses Docker, Kubernetes, Nodejs, Python, Vuejs and other cutting edge technologies to solve some of DoD's most pressing issues. We are at the forefront of development and design activities for the C2BMC Planner. You will be collaborating directly with war-fighters and other stakeholders to determine the future of missile defense planning. These activities include acting as the product owner of full-stack development of prototypes, assessment of missile defense planners and full-stack development of production components used in missile defense planning. The ideal candidate will be an enthusiastic product owner with exceptional attention to detail. QualificationsBachelors degree in a technical field and 8 plus years of relevant experience.Knowledge of BMDS Elements is a plusBachelors/Masters/Doctorate in a technical field, preferably engineering, physics, computer science, or mathMust be able to obtain a security clearance and be a US citizen.Must have experience in some or all of the following:Agile frameworkScrumJiraConfluenceWhat do you get when you bring together the brightest minds and place them into an exciting, fast-paced environment that fosters intellectual growth and rewards based on impact, not tenure? You get one of the best privately held small business headquartered in Huntsville, Alabama, that provides advanced technology and expert consulting services to industries throughout the world. AEgis specializes in modeling & simulation (M&S) and micro/nanoscale technology development. Our core competencies include simulation software and training simulators; geospatial databases; 3D models; war fighter exercise support; systems engineering and analysis; verification, validation, and accreditation (VV&A); test and evaluation support; Hardware-in-the-Loop (HWIL) and Man-in-the-Loop (MIL) simulation.

title: Project Manager
job_description:
Who We Are

At Christian Care Ministry we believe that Christians can, and should, share in one another's burdens. Through the use of Medi-Share®, a Christian Healthcare Ministry, we cultivate that belief.

The Team

Everyone at Christian Care Ministry agrees to our Statement of Faith which outlines our core beliefs. Although we aren't perfect people, we are serving our perfect God to the best of our ability.

We work hard to serve our members, but know we can only do that if we invest in our employees professionally, financially, physically, and spiritually. Through times of prayer, weekly Chapel services, plenty of professional development, an onsite gym, 401(k) and, great benefits, we purposefully invest in our employees so that our employees can invest in others.

The Role

The Project Manager is responsible for overseeing, coordinating, managing, and driving to success all of the projects within Christian Care Ministry. These projects will include IT projects as well as business-related projects. Within each project, all business areas will be included in the project plan and accounted for in estimation. This position will coordinate project phases from inception, planning, requirements, development, test, and delivery. This position will work very closely with the product development team to ensure that the initial requirements are met with implementation while documenting any changes needed. They will also perform extensive requirements analysis with teams such as the UX/UI team and those with Design Thinking to ensure that the correct solution is being evaluated. Project managers may be required to manage multiple projects simultaneously while coordinating between various business users, functional leads, vendors, and project stakeholders. This is an on-site position.

The Fellowship of the Believers

Based on the principles of James 5:13-16, every staff member will be expected to participate and/or lead prayer with internal and external customers when appropriate. Because this will take place during the workday, these opportunities are included in the calculation of hours worked.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Manage multiple complex projects simultaneously; prioritize based on business need and resources.
Apply a disciplined approach to develop requirements, project plans, budgets, schedules, and risk profiles for projects.
Work closely with the product manager to ensure that implementation is in line with initial projections.
Apply and contribute to Agile and/or iterative development methodologies to projects.
Lead and execute projects through the project lifecycle ensuring the completion of all deliverables and milestones assigned projects.
Communicate milestones, progress, issues, and status regularly to stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Manage and track team velocity and resource allocation.
Develop user stories and document the definition of done for all projects.
Provide direction to project teams, understanding when to delegate tasks as needed.
Manage interaction with customers paying attention to their values while gaining their trust
Provides deliverables to the business within expected periods. These include but are not limited to the communication plan, training plan, and go-no-go criteria.
Provide risk assessment and track potential issues with mitigation as needed
Collaborate with both project teams and stakeholders utilizing the project plan described under the EPMO templates.
Document test plans and use cases for projects as required.
Document risks and mitigation plans.
Manage teams both onsite and remote without issue.
Manage vendor relationships on projects including budgets and expenses
Prepare proposals and review estimates.
Manage project budget and report status to leaders as needed.
Perform other duties and responsibilities, as assigned.

Essential Skills & Abilities

Project management experience utilizing Agile methodology.
Ability to understand the alignment of the project management lifecycle and the SDLC.
Experience managing different types of projects including IT projects.
Knowledge in budget tracking and reconciliation, planning, requirements management, and test procedure creation and validation.
Exceptional understanding of customer satisfaction.
Knowledge in project management software (such as Jira, workfront, MS Project.)
Ability to learn new technologies, experiment and exploit them to their optimal potential.
Accepts new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm.
Strong communication skills.
Self-driven and well organized even under tough circumstances.
Proven ability to influence while providing direction, delegating, and removing obstacles to get work done without direct authority.
Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
Strong collaboration and influencing skills.
Ability to deliver results in an environment which requires a high degree of coordination and alignment.
Established ability to influence, gain support, resolve conflict, and work in a matrixed organization.
Ability to quickly learn CCM's business practices and functional areas.
Keen attention to detail with the ability to organize and synthesize a broad set of information.

Other Skills & Abilities

Experience in a healthcare payer related field is a plus
Experience in working in a product management driven environment is a plus

Core Competencies/Demonstrable Behaviors

Collaborates - Builds partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.
Communication Effectively - Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.
Balances Stakeholders - Anticipating and balancing the needs of multiple stakeholders.
Plans and Aligns - Planning and prioritizing work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals.
Instills trust - Gaining the confidence and trust of others through honesty, integrity, and authenticity.

Education & Experience

Bachelor's degree in IT or Business related field required.
Minimum 8 years' experience in a project manager role performing the duties specified above regularly (proven experience within a project management capacity will also be considered) required.
PMP or PMI-ACP required.
8-years' experience with SDLC required.
Experience in a healthcare payer related field preferred.
Experience in working in a product management-driven environment preferred.
Experience in a healthcare payer related field preferred.
Experience in working in a product management driven environment preferred.

title: Product Line Manager

All our systems and instruments are designed to improve safety of products, accelerate time-to-market and support industries in successfully enhancing quality of life. We’ve been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 50 years now. Today, worldwide more than 6,000 employees are working on this permanent challenge, at over 70 locations on all continents.Responsibilities: NI within Bruker is a business unit supporting nanomechanical and nanotribological test equipment. The position will be responsible for supporting product marketing activities for in-situ nanomechanical microscopy products (MP) for various microscopes (TEM, SEM, FIB-SEM, XRM, SPM, optical, Raman, etc.) and product line extensions in this category. price book administration, SAP product configuration, demo unit budgeting and delivery, and custom/customized product resource allocation planning Creates and manages Marketing Requirement R&DDevelops business case (KPI)Owns marketing input into PLC process and is responsible for overseeing product launch and product penetration strategies Communicates account strategies and customer updates to the teamsSets product pricing guidelines for existing product lines and for new product lineSupports Sales in answering technical questions regarding product configurations (especially with materialsBroad knowledge of material characterization techniques and applications including those involving numerous categories of microscopyHands-on experience/expertise in SEM or skillsAbility to work well with limited supervision and across other functionsAbility to work under tight deadlines, particularly at end of each quarterStrong interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to work with a global sales forceExceptional and professional written and verbal communication skills and demonstrated product launch experienceAbility to interface with challenging clients, engaging in a constructive mannerExperience in problem solving, coordinating cross-functional solutions and responding to non-standard customer requestsPro-active, results driven. Strong leadership skills that can drive the organization from a marketing perspective EDUCATIONAL/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS: Typically requires a minimum of 8 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree in Materials Science & Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics or Chemistry; or 5 years and a Master’s degree in Materials Science & Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics or ChemistryStrong understanding of existing NI products, techniques, applications, competition and market landscapeExperience in technical problem solving, coordinating cross-functional solutions and responding to non-standard customer requestsDemonstrated ability to effectively interface with researchers and engineers in industry, academia, and government labsExperience collaborating with microscope OEMs (especially electron microscope OEMs) a plusMBA preferredTravel up to 30% of time (domestic and international) Bruker Corporation offers a comprehensive and competitive benefits package including medical, dental, 401(k), paid vacation, holidays, and tuition assistance (as applicable). title: Product Marketing Manager, Enterprise IT
job_description:
The Product Marketing Manager will be joining a close-knit marketing team, as well as collaborating with sales and product leadership for the Enterprise IT product suite. The Product Marketing Manager is an instrumental component of our team as we establish and grow our newest business line, serving the Enterprise IT sector. The Product Marketing Manager will be responsible for and own messaging and positioning for this suite of products, as expressed through client-facing materials, lead generation efforts including search and outbound email, and content ideation for our website, blog and white papers.

The compensation package includes a competitive salary and incentive structure, generous benefits, and valuable business experiences, challenges, and excitement of contributing to the success of a fast-growing technology company.

Ideal candidates are those who are excited by constant contribution to improve/grow our existing product line and demonstrate to our clients’ the value of our offerings.

This position reports to the VP, Marketing.

Responsibilities:

Develop high quality sales enablement materials including pitch decks, case studies, sales sheets, white papers, and more
Collaborate with the Marketing Operations Manager to execute on-time, on-brand and on-message campaigns for prospects and current customers
Develop ideas for content for our blog and to pitch to press, and work with our PR agency to keep a full content pipeline
Work with the sales team to identify appropriate industry events and prepare any required collateral or presentation materials
Develop and evolve product positioning and messaging, including packaging concepts
Work alongside sales and marketing operations to create successful inbound & outbound campaigns to find and nurture leads
Build and maintain a library of product documentation, including specs and user guides
Ongoing market and competitive analysis

Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree required
4-8 years of experience in a B2B sales environment
Experience in Enterprise Technology is a plus, but not required
Ability to work across product, marketing, and sales teams
A self-starter, with a strong sense of curiosity and a belief in the transformative power of data
Fearlessness in the pursuit of process improvement, implementation, and change
Flexibility and willingness to adapt to the changing demands of a fast-paced, startup environment
Solutions oriented approach and multi-dimensional problem solving
Highly self-motivated and results oriented, proven track record of exceeding goals
Commitment to success and willingness to put forth the effort to achieve it
Strong written and verbal English communication skills

title: Convenience Store Manager
job_description:

This position calls for people who are adept at both assistant and leading. title: Product Manager
job_description: We are currently seeking an experienced, dynamic and collaborative professional to serve as a Product Manager within our Schools and Libraries Division. Reporting to the Director of Product Management and Reporting & Analytics you will: Serve as the champion for software products we deliver to internal and external stakeholders. Act as the interface between the business and IT technical teams working to solve business challenges through technology. You will be involved in all phases of the process including requirements gathering, option analysis, prioritization and software implementation.  This is an outstanding career opportunity for an individual interested in a genuine professional challenge in support of a public-spirited mission.Working in a creative and fast-paced environment, the Product Manager will define user stories, use cases and product requirements based on customer input and feedback, and assessment of existing workflow; considering internal and external business needs as well as regulatory impacts. Among others, your responsibilities will include the following:Define product requirements, identify product gaps, and engage with internal and external stakeholders to understand business needsSupport the collection of business requirements by working with the business SMEs and the IT development teamFacilitate user acceptance testing results, includes coordination with internal and external stakeholdersBrief Leadership on progress, risks, and recommendations.Support the preparation of issue papers and reports for the Board of Directors and the FCC.Assist in the development and interpretation of IT policies, procedures and strategies governing the planning and delivery of IT services.Work closely with USAC’s IT security team to manage and mitigate/remediate issues and risk.Act as the liaison between management and outside vendors regarding major IT projects.Other duties as assigned.About You The successful candidate will excel at operating in a diverse and fluid environment, and will be crucial for the success of the Schools and Libraries Division.Bachelor Degree and/or relevant technical training with no preferred certificationThree (3) to Four (4) years of directly related experience.Experience in product management, including direct relevant experience in a product manager or product owner role working with an Agile development team.Experience with change management and business process re-engineeringAbility to work independently, but also collaborate and work across other departments as needed.Experience in reviewing and creating effective technical documents and project plans.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Knowledge of project management and information technology specialty areas (e.g., application systems design, database management, computer equipment, software, and systems).The following skills are desired:Project Management Professional (PMP)Through its administration of the $10 billion Universal Service Fund (USF) programs on behalf of the FCC, USAC works to promote the availability of quality services at just, reasonable and affordable rates and to increase access to advanced telecommunications services throughout the nation. Specifically, the USF programs provide funding for the expansion of telecommunications and broadband access to rural communities and health care facilities, schools and libraries across the country, and low income households. Through program administration, auditing, and outreach, USAC works with contributors, service providers, and program beneficiaries to achieve the program goals articulated by the FCC for each of these programs.  The FCC has reformed the USF to support further investment in and access to evolving broadband infrastructure, making the programs a primary vehicle to support this critical national priority. USAC, as the administrator of the USF, plays a critical role in supporting the ambitious vision to ensure that all citizens in the United States have access to high-speed broadband. The organization has approximately 500 employees with an operating budget of more than $200 million. USAC works in close partnership with the FCC and other federal and state partners to support the achievement of the USF program goals.  USAC administers the USF programs—High Cost, Lifeline, Rural Health Care, and Schools and Libraries. USAC strives to provide efficient, responsible stewardship of the programs, a key national asset in making important telecommunications and Internet services available to consumers, health care providers, schools, and libraries throughout the United States. The program divisions are supported by additional USAC personnel in Finance, General Counsel, Information Systems, Internal Audit, the Enterprise Program Management Office and Human Resources. Consistent with FCC rules, USAC does not make policy for or interpret unclear provisions of statutes or the FCC’s rules.  Universal service is paid for by contributions from telecommunications carriers, including wireline and wireless companies, and interconnected Voice over Internet Protocol providers, including cable companies that provide voice service, based on an assessment of their interstate and international end- user revenues. These contributions are most typically passed through to consumers through a universal service fee line item on their telephone bills.  Additional information on USF programs can be found at: http://www.usac.org/about/about/who-we-are/default.aspx USAC offers a comprehensive benefits package, ongoing professional development opportunities, including vacation and sick leave. USAC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Only principals will be accepted. No agencies please. To apply, please submit a cover letter and resume, click the “Apply For This Job Online” button. USAC employees are passionate about our mission. Our work contributes to the success of all Americans. We’ve worked together to build a culture that is collaborative, ambitious, outcome-oriented, and feedback-focused.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Product Manager-Full Stack:

Alignment Healthcare is a data and technology driven healthcare company focused partnering with health systems, health plans, and provider groups to provide care delivery that is preventive, convenient, coordinated, and that results in improved clinical outcomes for seniors.

We are experiencing rapid growth (backed by top private equity firms), and we are looking for experienced product managers who are passionate about building products that customers love, who can drive the vision of products, while also having the “full-stack” product skillset needed for you to roll up your sleeves and work with designers on wireframes and prototypes, analyze user behavior, lead business partners and user panels through requirements sessions, and serve as product owner with engineering teams to bring your vision to reality and in the hands of users.

What You Will Do:

Work with cross-functional teams to design, build and roll-out products that deliver on the company’s vision and strategy.Coordinate product strategy, vision, and user needs, and efficiently translate those into detailed requirements and high-value prototypesCollaborate with designers, engineers, data scientists, and user researchers to analyze patterns and trends and identify new opportunities for growthGain and maintain a deep understanding of health customer experience; capture product feedback via onsite customer visits, identify and fill product gaps and generate new ideas that grow market share, improve customer experience and drive growthScope and disciplined prioritization of features and functionality, balancing stakeholder objectives, resources and capacity, and overall data and analytics product visionWork closely with engineering teams to deliver efficiently and rapid time to marketFacilitate and drive cross-functional collaboration on product launches, innovation cycles, and product experimentsAct as a product evangelist to build awareness and understandingCollaborate with Product Marketing teams to publish external communications and develop product evangelization content, blog posts, etcServe as subject matter expert and mentor to team members, providing training and guidance regarding product development best practices, processes, and tools

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Curiosity and passion for creating great solutions that help people have a simpler, easier, and more personalized health experienceStrong problem solving skills and willingness to roll up your sleeves to get the job doneAbility to conceive and execute product visions using a rapid prototyping model, both in software and hardwareExperience performing product-oriented quantitative analysis, including statistical analysis; proven track record of managing all aspects of successful product throughout the product development life cyclePassion for assisting developers and end users; positive team attitude and a willingness to get hands-on to resolve problems from both a content and tooling perspective.Ability to deliver against tight deadlines and handle multiple, competing demands. Experience in the health, consumer, or service web and mobile apps domainsExperience in data-driven decision making and demonstrated use of data to inform and guide product and feature roadmapProven ability to develop product and marketing strategies and develop internal and external communicationsExperience working with product marketing and sales teams to develop product launch, pricing, commercialization, etcExperience with software development and product development tools, such as Jira, Azure DevOps, Aha!, ProdPad, etcExcellent written and oral communication abilities.5+ years of product management, marketing, and or strategy experience in the consumer technology or health industries.Familiarity with wireframe and design platforms (eg InVision) and working with UI/UX design teams

Preferred Qualifications:

Familiarity with data, data science, and analytics teams and solutionsExperience within the health domain, including population health and clinical messagingDemonstrated expertise performing product-oriented quantitative analysis, include product and user behavior data such as customer feedback and surveys, search metrics, and usage reportsRobust experience with process improvement methodologies eg Lean or Six SigmaExperience with health standards (eg X12, HL7, and NCPDP), procedures, and policies

Position Location:

Orange, California


Alignment Healthcare, LLC is proud to practice Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action. We are looking for diversity in qualified candidates for employment: Minority/Female/Disable/Protected Veteran.

If you require any reasonable accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) in completing the online application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please contact careers@ahcusa.com.

title: Formulation Manager
job_description:
The Formulation Manager is responsible for medical device solutions and pharmaceutical solution preparation in a cGMP environment. The Formulation Manager supervises formulation associates, providing leadership and review of formulation processes, environmental processes and cleaning. Additional duties include maintaining system control, including scheduling maintenance of the area, and also assists in sourcing for process improvement. The Formulation Manager works with R&D and Validation to provide continuous improvement within a validated system, and to scale up batches from R&D/Engineering. The Formulation Manager reports directly to the Healthcare Business Unit Director or Plant Manager.

Responsibilities

Formulation: Develops new formulas, assists in the transfer of formulas, and generates stability protocols and data to support expiration dating on products.
Product Realization/Planning: Reviews production schedule and coordinates with management, assigning personnel to meet schedule demands. Maintains formulation inventory system for accountability of ingredients.
Lab Tech, and Clean/Sanitization of Manufacturing: Performs wet chemistry testing such as pH, TOC and Conductivity, and performs various activities in support of these job roles, develops methods, and works with lab team to ensure compliance to procedures. Assumes accountability for work performed. Reviews and approves data for compliance. Generates reports in support of the Quality System, as required. Provides chemical related safety support to the safety officer and handles waste stream related to chemical waste.
Facility Maintenance: Performs this job role in support of formulation area equipment and assumes accountability for the work performed. Actively review reports and documents for compliance to requirements.
Validation: Supports validation activities in formulation.
Purchasing: Uses the purchasing system to procure supplies for the formulation area.
DCR System: Actively uses the DCR System to generate or revise document, as needed.
CIMP System: Provides support for continuous improvement and Kaizen events and projects.
NCR System: Supports the nonconformance system through reporting of Nonconformances and supporting Quality in investigation activities. Provides reports and communication based on investigation findings
Other duties as assigned   

Qualifications

BS/MS in science major or extensive equivalent experience, 5+ years formulation experience and 2+ years chemistry experience in a pharmaceutical, medical device facility, or research facility/university. Education and experience in chemical interactions, specific to understanding formulation requirements. Experience in ISO standard execution, cGMP and Quality Systems
Required reading, writing and speaking fluently in English and preparing reports.
Must be familiar with wet-chemistry, HPLC Instrumentation, method development, calibration and lab equipment maintenance
Skills in a variety of analytical instrumentation preferred.

title: Website Product Manager
job_description:
About us:

As the leading authority in comprehensive real estate data, ATTOM Data Solutions provides customers a one-stop destination to make better-informed real estate and economical decisions. Recognized nationwide as a trusted industry partner, ATTOM delivers various data products that ensure the accuracy, support, and flexibility required to get the information businesses and individuals need to achieve maximum results.

About the role:

ATTOM Data Solutions, a premier property data and analytics company, is looking to hire a Website Product Manager who has a balanced business, technical and analytical skill set. To ensure success, a candidate must display an excellent understanding of Content Management Systems (CMS), Search Engine Optimization (SEO), and modern website technologies. Top candidates will have proven experience and a foundation for driving website traffic, increasing website conversions, generating leads, and improving overall user experience.

What you will do:

Develops and executes plans to grow website traffic metrics, generate quality leads and improve user experience.Gathers and prioritizes requirements based on multiple inputs, including business owners, stakeholders, competitive analysis, marketing analysis, and available data. Agile project manage multiple website projects at various stages while achieving project deadlines using Jira Boards, gathering and writing business requirements, working with UI/UX designers, developers (front-/back-end), copy writers, and other team members.Works closely with other team members and consultants to fix SEO issues, enact SEO tactics and develop long-term SEO strategies.Use of Google Analytics and other digital tools to monitor and analyze website traffic, user engagement metrics and key performance indicators; assist in plans to improve.Work on implementing digital campaigns like paid search and developing campaign-specific landing pages.Responsible for the website roadmap projects.Responsible for regular monthly and quarterly reporting of key metrics and performance updates for internal review and presentation.Collaborate with full Marketing team to support other major campaigns, product launches or other cross-functional milestones.Ensure full compliance on the website with all laws and regulations.

What you need to succeed:

5+ years of work experience on an enterprise website as a Website Manager, Digital Marketer, Web Product Manager, and/or Web Developer.Expert knowledge of Wordpress, Google Analytics, Google Webmaster Tools, Adobe suite, Content Management Systems, Marketing Software like Pardot/Hubspot/Marketo, Web Technologies and W3C Web standards.Excellent time management skills with the ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment.Ability to accurately scope projects and hit deadlines on time.Strong communication skills and ability to present to senior management team.Strong attention to detail with an analytical mind and outstanding problem-solving skills.

What we offer:

Annual salary range 105K-115KUnlimited PTOFlexible work scheduleFree healthy snacks and coffee on-siteMedical, dental, and vision insuranceLife and disability insuranceEmployer-paid benefitsTraditional 401(k) and Roth retirement plans with company matchPet insuranceCar wash services on-siteOn-site gymEmployee Referral Bonus

ATTOM Data Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer/W/M/Dis. Relocation assistance is not offered for this position.
