title: Product Manager
job_description:
As a Tech Product Manager, you will translate user requirements into design and work alongside multiple teams including Marketing, Growth, Operations, and Product.

Responsibilities include:

Working with product leadership to manage and drive strategic priorities.

Translating the identified business needs into requirements easily understandable by cross-functional teams

Understanding the user experience aspect and building features to meet both user & business needs.

Working closely with UX/UI designers, engineering teams, QAs, and analytics teams to bring ideas from conceptualization to implementation.

Analysing data and usage patterns and maintaining an optimised experience pre and post product launch

Staying on top of design guidelines and technologies that affect the business as well as evaluate the performance of products and features and develop recommendations for improvement.

The Profile

Must have at least 3 years product development/management experience, ideally within an E-Commerce industry.

Must have expertise in using web analytics and A/B testing to identify improvement opportunities

Should have strong analytics skills

Must have prior experience in design, development, launch, and measurement of successful consumer web and mobile products.

Must have good interpersonal and communication skills and are adept at working with multiple stakeholders to drive desired outcomes.

Should have a go-getter attitude.

Can exercise discretion and can maintain strict levels of confidentiality.

Should be a strong mentor and coach who can build high performing teams.y

Should pay strong attention to detail and deliver work that is of a high standard

title: Senior Program/Project Manager with Experience working with Dealers & Vendors
job_description:
Candidate Responsibilities
Manage delivery of the Platform features and capabilities, provide support to the multiple development/scrum teams, interface with technical staff and management, business resources. Provide leadership and mentor less experienced Digital Project Managers. Manage delivery of group of related projects that delivers a common program goal in line with Digital Strategy.
Typical Day
The program manager is accountable for ensuring successful completion of projects, on-time, within budget, and error-free. The principal responsibility of the Program Manager is to manage the planning and execution of various project deliverables. The incumbent will be responsible for managing the project charter, communications, metrics, reporting, and the overall program plan (highlighting dependencies between various projects under the same program) and budget. The Program Manager will: - Use knowledge of cloud based Platforms and digital processes and business acumen to guide cross-functional teams in the execution of projects. - Manage multiple projects concurrently. - Demonstrate advanced knowledge of client's products and services; its internal systems, processes, and procedures; and its relevant external influences (competitors, laws and regulations, market conditions, etc.) to meet or exceed customer expectations. - Serve as the principal communicator with clients and internal stakeholders regarding project status. - Identify and manage risks and issues - Define program scope with program success indicators to reap benefits of the program within a defined timeframe. - Use Agile or Waterfall program management methodology as relevant to the program execution. Follow latest industry execution practices and processes (e.g, DevOps, Continuous Integration – Continuous Delivery) for highest velocity and innovation. - Prioritize program requirements working with Product Owner or other stakeholders. - Write communication plan and stakeholder management plan for the program. Develop stakeholder register, analyze positive and negative stakeholders, and manage the expectation of stakeholders across the program. - Provide regularly update to Business stakeholders and consumers of program deliverables. - Create and manage dependencies across all active projects. Collaborate across the program to leverage diverse thoughts and ideas. - Log and review program risks with stakeholders and take timely action to mitigate or eliminate risks. - Evaluate team members of the program organization and look to add required resources or train resources to improve IT skills for the benefit of the digital program. - Mentor project managers for success delivery of the program. - Create rough order of magnitude of program budget, track actuals, and do quarterly forecast of spend throughout the life of the program. - Radiate program status using a visual tool. Document all program related artifacts including lessons learned, on an easily accessible and shared environment. - Be an advocate of the digital program and market it for a successful adoption.
Education Requirements:
4 year degree required - Information systems, computer science or related field. 
Skills15+ years of Program management experienceUnderstanding of SW development/experience managing SW development projectsExperience with vendor managementExperience managing dealer projectsBig data management 
Soft Skills
Advanced human relations skills are needed for a cooperative working relationship with others inside and outside the department. Ability to drive issues to resolution.

title: Senior Product Manager - SISW - MG
job_description:
Company: SISW - MG

Job Description:
Mentor Graphics, a Siemens Business is an equal opportunity global technology leader in Electronic Design Automation software. Our software tools enable companies around the world to develop new and highly innovative electronic products faster and more cost-effectively. Our customers use our tools to push the boundaries of technology and physics in order todeliver better products in the increasingly complex world of chip, board and system design.
Product Manager, Transistor-level EM/IR Position
Overview:Mentor Graphics seeks a highly motivated technologist with the capability and desire to make a meaningful contribution to the development and deployment of a transistor-level EM/IR tool. This latest addition to our excellent team will define, support and market transistor-level power analysis and reliability signoff.

• Set priorities based on business and technical goals
• Build tight customer relationships based on long-term customer success.

• Lead customer and internal partner expectations

• BS degree (or equivalent) in Electrical Engineering, Physics or related field is required. MS degree is highly preferred.
• Should have 4 or more years of meaningful experience in the semiconductor IC design or EDA industry
• Previous experience with product development is a requirement
• Strong knowledge and experience in analog design, transistor-level IR/EM analysis, transistor-level simulation, parasitic extraction, and cell characterization.
• Must have detailed understanding in EDA software development and the product release cycle
• Must demonstrate script-programming skills with languages such as TCL, Perl, Python, shell, etc.
• Must be familiar with Unix/Linux operating systems
• Must demonstrate excellent analytical and problem solving capabilities, and strong interpersonal skills
• Experience of leading or directing new product feature development, from concept/prototype to production release is preferred.
• Ability to run multiple projects simultaneously with multi-functional, distributed teams
• Ability to write comprehensive marketing or product requirement specifications in English.
• Validated collaboration skills
• Willingness to travel

years? If so, Sandy Spring Bank may be

assessments and business impact analyses; developing appropriate business
disruption risk mitigation strategies and controls; and creating, implementing,

responsibilities that may be reasonable and under the direction of the

projects.5. Experience
working as a liaison with regulatory bodies, government agencies, and other
compliance-oriented entities — internal and external is a plus.6. Experience
in creating and defining new operational models and procedures, and explaining
complex problems or situations7. The ability
to work the time needed to succeed under potentially stressful conditions, such
as business-related crises in the event of a disruption or disaster.8. Strong
organizational skills to track multiple priorities along with excellent
writing, grammar, and proof reading skills will be utilized. 9. Advanced
computer skill level with word processing, spreadsheets, and database
applications (Outlook, SharePoint, Excel and WORD).10. Work
requires diverse internal and external contacts in furnishing and obtaining
information.11. Position includes exposure to
information of a highly confidential nature requiring confidentiality, tact and
discretion.Sandy Spring Bank is an Equal Opportunity

title: Sr. Product Manager
job_description:
We are looking for a Sr. Product Manager to join the team at our North American Headquarters in Carlsbad, CA. This person will primarily be responsible for the entire product life cycle of our pool automation systems and accessories. Do you have experience with connected products and thrive in a fast -paced, collaborative environment? If so, we’d love to talk with you.

WHY WORK FOR FLUIDRA?

We are a leader in the global pool industry. Our portfolio includes some of the most trusted brands; we offer our customers an expansive array of products across both the residential and commercial pool and wellness markets; and we have strong geographical footprint with operations in over 45 countries. With our merger with Zodiac, we now have over 5,500 employees and the combined resources to accelerate innovation in critical areas like energy-efficiency, robotics and the Internet of Things.

We are guided by clear values and come to work every day with a simple and direct mission in mind: To create the perfect pool and wellness experience. By staying focused on this mission, we will create value for all our stakeholders–customers, pool owners, investors and employees.

We own a portfolio of some of the industry’s most recognized and trusted brands, including Jandy®, AstralPool®, Polaris®, Cepex®, Zodiac®, CTX Professional® and Gre®.

WHAT YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE

To succeed in this role, you should bring a strong technical aptitude and experience managing a technical product line including all aspects of product management. You will support both sustaining and new product development (NPD) programs as well as various business level functions and product strategies. The primary portfolios you will be responsible for are swimming pool automation systems and accessories. These automation systems include IoT connected products and serve as the main hub of connectivity for the complete swimming pool equipment pad.

In this high-profile role, you will be responsible for cradle to grave product management from conducting in-field research and defining product specifications, through launch forecasting.

To do this effectively, you possess technical marketing expertise and/or application engineering experience to act as the subject matter expert and liaise with the engineering team to work together to develop your designs. As the Sr. Product Manager, you are the core team leader central to all marketing communications and training initiatives related to your product portfolio.

You must thrive in a fast-paced, highly collaborative, team environment. As a leader, you recognize the importance of delivering quality, innovative, products to market which directly target our customers wants and needs and have the ability to influence the organization to prioritize those programs which will enhance our brands and drive short and long-term business success. As a team member, you lead by example, own the research process, and strive to become a highly detailed business, application, and product expert. Additionally, you will:

Build a strong understanding of our channels, customers, and their applications in order to empathize with their goals and challenges and advocate for improving their experiences through direct interaction and data collection.Assess competitive products, technologies, and processes, as well as adjacent markets and technologies.Define product specs and portfolio roadmaps in collaboration with the broader product management, engineering, and executive teams. Evangelize the specs and roadmap vision based on documented user research and feedback.Actively participate in regular demand planning / supply chain meetings.Develop, coordinate, and execute launch plans along with key stakeholders to maximize sales and market share.Provide marketing support to all operational and commercial initiatives relevant to your portfolios.

WHAT WE SEEK

7+ year’s product management, product marketing or application engineering experience.Strong technical acumen and ability to understand how our products are chosen, prescribed, sold, and installed.Experience with automation systems and IoT connected products preferred.Self-directed and driven, with an ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously with minimal direct supervision.Highly organized with excellent verbal and written communication skills.Strong platform (presentation) skills: equally comfortable with delivering technical specs to engineers, as well as strategy presentations to executives.Able to be flexible as needs change, moving seamlessly between the strategic and the tactical, while maintaining focus on our prescriber’s and end-user’s needs.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

PREFERRED

The following non-required experiences would be highly advantageous:

Familiarity with the pool / spa industryFamiliarity with pool / spa equipmentExperience with automation systemsExperience with IoT connected products, user interfaces, mobile apps and 3rd party integrations

EDUCATION

Bachelor’s Degree required, marketing or engineering disciplines preferred.

WHAT WE OFFER

An exciting opportunity to dive in and begin your career with a company that offers a competitive total rewards package that includes:

Alternate work week schedule (EVERY OTHER FRIDAY OFF!)

Full range of health benefits including medical, dental & vision, short & long-term disability

401(K) matching (100% of first 3% contributed, 50% of the next 2%)

Health and wellness programs / gym reimbursement

Educational assistance up to $7,000 per year

On-site self-service café / free gourmet coffee stations

Company sponsored FUN events!

On-site gym, ping-pong, foosball, outdoor bocce ball court, BBQ & firepit

Generous product discounts

In the pursuit of product excellence, Fluidra takes its corporate values to heart. We implement these guiding principles in everything we do: passion for success, honesty & trust, customer collaboration, team work, learn and adapt, excellence and Innovation.

For a deeper dive in to our corporate culture, click here.

title: Shift Manager QSR
job_description:

Arrange to have shifts covered

Track daily costs and revenues

Balance the cash register at the end of the shift

Coordinate with suppliers as they deliver food product orders

Ensure client satisfaction and gracefully handle any complaints

Open or close the restaurant

Inform the next Shift Manager about pending tasks

Report maintenance and training needs

Work authorization:

United States (Required)

Work Location:

One location

Benefits:

Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planFlexible schedule

title: Program Manager, UnidosUS Counseling Connection
job_description: BACKGROUNDUnidosUS, previously known as NCLR (National Council of La Raza), is the nation’s largest Hispanic civil rights and advocacy organization. Through its unique combination of expert research, advocacy, programs, and an Affiliate Network of nearly 300 community-based organizations across the United States and Puerto Rico, UnidosUS simultaneously challenges the social, economic, and political barriers that affect Latinos at the national and local levels. For more than 50 years, UnidosUS has united communities and different groups seeking common ground through collaboration, and that share a desire to make our community stronger. For more information on UnidosUS, visit www.unidosus.org or follow us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter.SUMMARYUnidosUS is seeking a Program Manager for the UnidosUS Counseling Connection Initiative. The UnidosUS Counseling Connection Program Manager is a full-time staff member of UnidosUS’s Housing and Financial Empowerment (HFE) component, responsible for oversight and supervision of the UnidosUS Counseling Connection team and adherence to all program and legal standards and in-house policies. The manager will support the VP and/or Director with oversight and management of day to day operations, program/partner relationships, and enforcement of regulations in all aspects and levels of business as well as provide guidance on compliance matters more broadly to the HFE team. The Program Manager reports to the Vice President of Housing and Community Development and the Director, Financial Empowerment, working with limited supervision to assist them in performing multiple duties related to the operational responsibilities and compliance requirements of the UnidosUS Counseling Connection.Additionally, the UnidosUS Counseling Connection Program Manager will be a part of a management team of the Housing and Financial Empowerment component of UnidosUS, working with other managers and the component’s senior leadership to support the strategic growth and efficient operation of the department. The Manager, like others in the management team, will be held accountable to goals in the areas of growth, quality improvement, and overall project compliance. Additionally, the manager will be expected to engage external partners and contribute to the management of department-wide systems and contribute to the successful financial management of the department.RESPONSIBILITIES• Supervise a team of housing counselors and intake and outreach staff.• Organizing programs and activities in accordance with the mission and goals of the component and organization.• Assist with the development of new programs to support the strategic direction of the component.• Creating and managing short term and long-term goals of the program to meet component and partner goals and expectations.• Assist VP in managing program budget including tracking of funding and expenses generated by program and/or grants achieved.• Developing an evaluation method to assess program strengths and identify areas for improvement.• Working closely with VP and component directors to help manage partner relationships and requests for information.• Ensuring goals are met in areas including customer satisfaction, quality, and team member performance.• Implementing and managing changes and interventions to ensure project goals are achieved.• Meeting with stakeholders to make communication easy and transparent regarding project issues and decisions on services.• Producing accurate and timely reporting of program status throughout its life cycle.• Working closely with other program managers to provide support to the component and encouraging cross program collaboration opportunities in the HFE component and UnidosUS more broadly.• Meet or exceed all compliance audit and reporting deadlines.• Conduct periodic internal reviews or audits to ensure that compliance procedures are followed.• Conduct or direct the internal investigation of compliance issues.• Assess product, compliance, or operational risks, and develop risk management strategies.• Identify compliance issues that require follow-up or investigation.• Disseminate written policies and procedures related to compliance activities.• File appropriate compliance reports with requesting entities.• Coordinate with our third-party vendor to ensure our systems are following vendor requirements.• Maintain documentation of compliance activities, such as complaints received or investigation outcomes.• Consult with component Director and VP to address difficult legal compliance issues.• Discuss emerging compliance issues with management or employees.• Collaborate with Director and VP to ensure the implementation of consistent disciplinary action strategies in cases of compliance standard violations.• Provide employee training on compliance related topics, policies, or procedures.• Aid internal or external auditors in compliance reviews.• Prepare management reports regarding compliance operations and progress.• Monitor compliance systems to ensure their effectiveness.• Report violations of compliance or regulatory standards to leadership.• Keep informed regarding pending industry changes, trends, and best practices and assess the potential impact of these changes on organizational processes.• Verify that all compliance and risk management policies and procedures have been documented, implemented, and communicated.• Direct the development or implementation of compliance-related policies and procedures throughout the component.• Participate in component’s management meetings, contributing to the achievement of the goals of peer leaders and department leadership in collaborative and creative ways.• Collaborate with other UnidosUS departments to identify and implement new opportunities for integration of financial empowerment.QUALIFICATIONS• Bachelor’s degree preferred.• Three to five years of professional experience working in operations and compliance required.• Three to five years of managerial and supervisory experience required.• Additional experience as a supervisor and/or in compliance can substitute for education.• A business acumen partnered with a dedication to legality and ethics.• Methodical and diligent with outstanding planning abilities.• An analytical mind able to see the complexities of procedures and regulations.• Excellent communication skills.• Good communication and staff development skills.• Excellent sense of technology and able to implement ideas for greater efficiencies.• High level of competence with spreadsheet, database, and word processing software and knowledge of computers essential.• Strong sense of self-motivation and personal initiative; ability to work with minimal supervision and meet deadlines.• Ability to work effectively as a member of a team and across components with all UnidosUS staff.• Good judgment; ability to know when to act independently and when to consult for advice on decision-making.• Exhibit unquestionable integrity. Be honest and forthright about any issues.• Excellent organizational skills in a complex environment; personal initiative to address organizational issues without direct guidance.• Strong work ethic and personal qualities of integrity, credibility, and commitment to UnidosUS’s mission and values (excellence, accountability, and respeto). Willing to work whatever hours are required to meet all deadlines.• Effective written and oral communication skills.• Ability to handle multiple priorities and meet deadlines.Please note: Only those applicants who submit a cover letter and a résumé will be considered for this opportunity. Please include, “Program Manager, UnidosUS Counseling Connection” in the subject line.SEND COVER LETTER AND RÉSUMÉ TO:UnidosUSRaul Yzaguirre BuildingAttn: Katherine Rios1126 16th Street NW, Suite 600Washington, DC 20036hrmail@unidosus.orgNo phone calls please!EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, national origin, marital status, religion, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, personal appearance, family responsibilities, political affiliation, or enrollment in a college, university, technical school, or adult education.

title: Manager QC Flow Cytometry
job_description:
At Cognate BioServices, our continued success depends on attracting and developing talented people that share our passion for delivering quality products that help people live better lives. Essential to our mission, we are committed to making a difference and we value our colleagues for their different perspectives and individual contributions. 

We are a leading Contract Development Manufacturing Organization specialized in cell and cell-mediated gene therapy product. We pride ourselves in the level of quality and experience our Cognate team brings to the table. Are you ready to make a difference in the lives of others?

We are searching for the perfect candidate to lead our growing Quality Control Flow Cytometry Team. This individual will be a project leader, responsible for oversight of junior and mid-level staff, and interact regularly with senior staff.
 
POSITION SUMMARY:
 The successful candidate will serve as a subject matter expert and leader of our flow team focused on leading diverse team, and organizing and leading the staffing (two, possibly three shifts), and routine in-process and release testing to meet client requirements and deadlines. The position requires a strong background and understanding of immunology (current cell-based therapies) and wide technical expertise in flow cytometry-based cell characterization methods. It is preferred that the candidate have experience leading direct reports (>5 analysts). A strong desire to not only learn, but teach less experienced staff is an additional defining characteristic for this position. 
• 3-5 years of experience in analyzing multi-color flow cytometry is required (2 years of Academic experience can be added with additional years in a GMP environment) 
• Strong experience with various industry-standard flow cytometry software packages (particularly BD FACSDiva and FACSSuite)
• Competency in understanding flow analysis, compensation, and gating strategies for analysis of mixed cell populations.
• A strong understanding of cGMP/GLP regulations as well as excellent documentation skills in order to complete paperwork dealing in all aspects of Quality Control
• Understanding/familiarity with relevant FDA, EMA, ICH, USP and EP guidelines and regulations associated with the quality control of biologic/cell therapies.
• Basic understanding of emerging T cell / CAR T biotechnology
• Excellent writing skills. Experience in drafting of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), protocols, reports, etc.
• Ability to problem solve and troubleshoot as necessary

QUALIFICATIONS:
• BS or higher degree with 3+ years of cGMP experience in a Quality Control biotechnology/pharmaceutical environment. Immunology or related degree preferred.
• Experience working with cell and/or gene therapy products for clinical trials
• Preferable experience leading people (>5 people)
• Preferable experience performing flow in a controlled environment (>2 years)
• Ability to process large amounts of paperwork in a timely and efficient manner
• Ability to work in a team-oriented, multidisciplinary, and multicultural environment
• Previous management experience required
• Willingness to train and involve less experienced staff on new techniques as part of technology transfer or assay development

title: Manager/Sr Manager, External Manufacturing-Antibody Drug Conjugates
job_description:
Are you looking for a role with impact?

Magenta Therapeutics is seeking an individual to provide management and technical oversight of external manufacturing projects. The ideal candidate will support the manufacturing of antibody drug conjugates (ADCs), which may include management of antibody and linker payload intermediates, and ADC drug substance and drug product manufacturing.

The candidate will be an integral member of internal development and CMC teams working closely with the conjugation, analytical, regulatory and quality functions. The candidate will manage and provide oversight of various contract manufacturing organizations (CMOs). By establishing strong relationships with both internal and external partners the candidate will identify and implement process improvements and carefully monitor and manage integration of activities across multiple partners.

You are perfect for this opportunity if you are engaged by:

Managing CMC projects for ADC programs
Coordinating activities and managing relationships with CMOs
Ensuring timely delivery of drug for nonclinical and clinical studies
Fostering strong technical and business relationships with external manufacturing partners and proactively identifying and resolving issues
Overseeing manufacturing campaigns as person in plant, as needed
Enabling technology transfer working as a liaison between internal and external technical teams
Leading and coordinating review of master batch records, change control process, technical manufacturing deviation investigations, and review of executed batch records
Partnering with business development team to negotiate clinical and commercial supply agreements with CMOs

We would be thrilled if you brought the following with you:

Demonstrated track record of success within manufacturing or process development
In depth knowledge of ADC or bioconjugate manufacturing strongly preferred
Small molecule CMC knowledge a plus
Significant experience managing CMOs, preferably in the GMP production of antibody drug conjugates
Proven ability to collaborate effectively with internal and external teams
Knowledge of cGMP/ICH/FDA regulations and guidance and experience reviewing CMC sections of regulatory documents (module 3)
Bachelor's degree in Chemistry, Engineering, Biochemistry, Biology or related field with 5- 10 years' experience in the biopharmaceutical industry in a CMC capacity
Ability to travel within the US and internationally up to 15-20%

Successful leaders and contributors within Magenta are:

Driven. You will be focused on the achievement of Magenta's mission and major corporate goals.
Results-focused. Demonstrated record of exceeding stretch goals, and willing to bring creative problem-solving skills to challenges along the way
Intuitive. You will enjoy learning and being involved in the content of our whole business, thriving on a very fast-paced and growing business
Collaborative. You will have demonstrated the ability to achieve objectives across complex projects and organizational structures
Process-oriented, yet flexible. You will appreciate and be able to create and drive process, while also recognizing when flexibility is needed.
Transparent and Articulate. You will have the ability to communicate clearly and concisely with all stakeholders
Independent. You will be able to self-organize and operate effectively without significant day-to-day oversight, while staying tightly connected to key leaders and teams across the company
A role model for the company's cultural pillars; Courage Commitment & Excellence

title: Infection Prevention Program Manager
job_description:
ROLE SUMMARY

The Infection Prevention Program Manager ensures activities are directed toward preventing and decreasing healthcare associated infections through conducting ongoing risk assessments, planning and implementing improvement activities, and supporting an effective infection prevention infrastructure across Virginia Mason Memorial Hospital and ambulatory settings. Organizes and facilitates expert workgroups and teams to accomplish organization-wide improvement efforts and will take a lead role in developing and implementing new processes, technologies, and resources toward achievement of the infection prevention program goals.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

In conjunction with the Director and key stakeholders, develops, implements, and evaluates infection prevention program goals and activities to reduce and control the risk of health care associated infections.
Coordinates the development of policies, procedures, standard processes, risk assessment, and the Annual Infection Prevention Program Plan.
Co-facilitates the Infection Prevention and Control Committee with the Chair to ensure surveillance activities and improvement plans are analyzed, implemented, and reported to leadership.
Conducts research (e.g. literature reviews) as applicable to identify best practices and establish program objectives.
Keeps abreast of current recommendations, guidelines, and regulatory requirements which may impact the Infection Prevention Program.
Collaborates with leadership to ensure compliance with regulatory and accrediting agency requirements, timely and accurate reporting to the Department of Public Health and other external agencies.
Serves as a knowledgeable resource for patients, families, visitors, and staff in both inpatient and outpatient settings regarding infection control standard processes and policies. Provides guidance and mentorship to infection preventionists.
In conjunction with the Director, evaluates the cost-effectiveness of advances in current technology, products, software, or changes in practice.
Provides education through verbal, written, and hands-on experience to staff, providers, and management; may conduct presentations at workshops/in-services or public speaking engagements.

QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS

Education:  Bachelor of Science (BS) degree required. RN or BSN preferred.

Experience: At least five years clinical experience as an RN or Medical Technologist (MT). Minimum of two years’ experience as an Infection Preventionist highly preferred.

Licenses/Certificates/Registration: Washington State (DOH) Registered Nurse licensure preferred. Current certification in infection control (CIC) preferred.

About Us:

Virginia Mason Memorial (VMM), part of the Virginia Mason Health System, is made up of a 226-bed hospital as well as 20+ primary care and specialty care locations. We are a nonprofit community hospital that has served Central Washington's Yakima Valley for 70 years. We are seeking employees with a passion for patients and customer service!

We offer a comprehensive benefit plan including medical, dental, and vision coverage; plus we have a generous 401K plan (with an employer contribution!), competitive compensation, an employee wellness clinic and continuing education and training. At VMM, we know the best care is provided by employees who are well-supported.

Why do we do what we do? As the region's leading health care provider and Yakima's largest employer, we believe that by inspiring people to thrive, we can transform lives. Our vision is to "create healthy communities one person at a time." With such an important goal, we work together to demonstrate our values of Respect, Accountability, Teamwork, Stewardship, and Innovation for everyone who walks through our doors, patients and coworkers alike. We would love to hear from you!

“Virginia Mason Memorial provides reasonable accommodations to assist qualified individuals in order to perform the essential duties/requirements their job requires. The description is intended to provide only basic guidelines for meeting job requirements and serves as merely a summary rather than a complete listing of duties. Responsibilities, knowledge, skills, abilities, and working conditions may change as needs evolve. This job description does not constitute a contract as employment is at will.”

title: Commercial Product Analyst
job_description:
Hastings Mutual is currently looking for a Commercial Product Analyst. The individual in this role will analyze and recommend rates, rules, forms, and guidelines for both new and existing products, focusing on our commercial line of business. In addition, they will also ensure all existing products are in compliance with all applicable state statutes, court decisions, and other regulatory requirements.

Position Location Details

This role will report to the Director, Product Development and work from our corporate offices located in Hastings, Michigan. Hours of work will generally be within our standard hours of Monday - Friday, 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM.

Position Duties& Responsibilities

Continuously monitors and evaluates Hastings Mutual's competition in regards to commercial product offerings.Independently researches, develops and recommends formal commercial product proposals consisting of rating variable analysis, coverage comparisons, and rate indications.Accurately implements product revisions including coordination with other HMIC business units as needed.Properly prepares all applicable state and other regulatory agency filings.Serves as a resource and point of contact for other business units related to programming, statistical reporting, claim, and underwriting guidelines for the commercial product line.

Candidate Requirements and Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree, with a preference for Business, Mathematics, Statistics, or Insurance Management related fields desired. Advanced degrees preferred. Exposure to commercial rating coverage and forms may offset education requirements.A minimum of three-to-five years of Property& Casualty insurance carrier/industry experience with a background in Underwriting, Claim, Product Development or Marketing.Chartered Property Casualty Underwriter (CPCU) certification, or other industry/actuarial related exams or certifications a plus.Demonstrated strong mathematical and statistical aptitude.Demonstrated excellent verbal, written and presentation communication ability is required.Intermediate to strong Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint experience.Effective time management, organization and ability to work both independently and in a team setting is required.

About Hastings Mutual Insurance Company

From our humble roots in 1885 providing coverage for windstorm damage, Hastings Mutual has evolved into a leading regional property and casualty insurance carrier, offering innovative products for businesses, farm owners, and individuals. We work with customers in six Midwestern states (Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Michigan, Ohio, and Wisconsin). Hastings Mutual is known for its financial strength, high ethical standards, and a culture of service and responsiveness.

The core of our ongoing success is our employees. Whether at the corporate offices in Hastings, Michigan, information technology office in Alpharetta, Georgia to our remote team members throughout the Midwest, Hastings Mutual is made up of talented professionals across multiple divisions and functional areas. Our commitment to our employees and work culture has been confirmed with our inclusion in the“Best and Brightest Companies to Work for in West Michigan” each year since 2011.

Hastings Mutual offers a friendly, family-like environment that values transparency and approachability. We recognize the hard work of our employees with many benefits, including fully paid certification training, a cafeteria and fitness center at our corporate offices, ongoing professional development opportunities, and financial stability backed by our“A” rating from A.M. Best. We also have a long-term commitment to the communities in which we live and work, either through partnerships with local charitable organizations or through our own Hastings Mutual Charitable Foundation.

At Hastings Mutual, we’re always looking for professionals of all experience and education levels to help us continue our more than 130-year history of successful, stable growth.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Full timeWe are looking for a product manager who is passionate about building a premium experience for our B2B product to join our team of agile-minded product people, engineers and designers.

Bloomberg is the trusted tax research solution that empowers practitioners to make better more informed decisions every day. Our Product Managers drive research, innovation and product development to continuously provide value to our users and increase revenue.Primary Responsibilities:

Manages product roadmap and communicates objectives to stakeholders. Shepherds product initiatives from ideation through development and launch. Collaborates with both internal and external stakeholders to effectively bring new products and enhancements to market.Develops user stories, writes acceptance criteria and leads user acceptance testingWorks with designers to define the user experienceAttend cross-functional meetings and agile ceremoniesSupports user research initiatives and becomes an expert in our clients’ needs.Leads bug triagePerforms other duties as assignedHelp to promote an agile product mindset within the company

title: Night Stock Manager
job_description:
Night Stock Manager
Full-Time
Wauwatosa, WI
Availability: 3rd shift: Work shifts ranging between 9pm and 7am including weekends and holidays.
Summary: The Night Stock Department Manager directs and coordinates activities involved with the production, sale and or distribution of Metcalfes Market grocery products. Ensures hiring, training and supervision of the staff. Facilitates sales goals, inventory rotation, scheduling, safety and sanitation and any division of responsibility assigned by the store manager. The Night Stock Department Manager is required to assist customers and maintain complaint resolution with an energetic demeanor. This position requires adhering to all procedural guidelines and established practices set by Metcalfes Market.
Essential Duties:


Supports the departments staff efforts and work through timely response to questions, caring and appreciative attitude and demonstrated effectiveness in dealing with employee issues.
Determines variety and quantity of products to be ordered, according to orders and/or sales projections.
Conducts inventories and cycle counts as required.
Develops and achieves the departmental budget.
Directs personnel and activities; including timekeeping.
Negotiates the purchase and delivery of departmental supplies.
Follows safe food handling and local health department standards.
Provides insight and input in department personnel decisions such as hire, discipline, reward and termination.
Performs effective coaching to all associates.
Maintains a safe work environment for employees, vendors and customers.
Monitors and address customer issues or questions.
Sustains a high level of product knowledge and work toward continuous quality improvement.
Stays current with changing technology, including software programs.
Upholds, supports, and promotes all company policies and procedures.
Other duties as assigned.

Supervisory Responsibilities: The Night Stock Manager has supervisory responsibility for the Night Stock Department including approximately ten (10) direct reports.
Qualifications: 

High School diploma/equivalent required, Associates degree (A.A.) or technical school training preferred.
One or more years of previous grocery experience.
At least one or more years of previous management experience.
Must have strong people management skills.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
What you'll do...

H&R Block is looking for a talented Product Manager to join the BlockWorks team. This person will be responsible for delivering an outstanding experience for tax professionals using our BlockWorks software tax products.

As a Product Manager on the BlockWorks team, you will conduct retail tax product management activities including the initiation, planning, execution, and support of tax preparation products involving multiple people, process, and technology components.


Understand the business needs of the customer.
Develop plans and roadmaps for the professional tax preparation product.
Actively look for ways to improve product delivery.
Execute any assigned product tasks including writing and prioritizing user stories/product features.
Plan, verify, and document product results.
Coordinate across various business and technology stakeholders to understand implications of product features and decisions.
Attend meetings, in person and over electronic media, to provide administrative assistance and advice.
Schedule and coordinate product research and promotion events.
Other duties as assigned.

About H&R Block...

We're here to live our purposeto provide help and inspire confidence in our clients and communities everywhere. We take our work personally, because we know what it represents: Families and homes. Livelihoods and lives.

We've been true to that purpose since brothers Henry and Richard Bloch founded our company in 1955. Since then, we've grown to approximately 12,000 tax offices throughout the United States and around the world. When you join our team, you'll add to the momentum of a forward-thinking companyone that defined an industry and is now leading its transformation.

It would be even better if you also had...

Three or more years working as an H&R Block tax professional on multiple individual state returns and business/entity tax returns.
Highly certified tax professional, especially Enrolled Agent or CPA.
One or more years software product management experience.
One or more years technology delivery/software development experience.
Experience operating in an Agile methodology as a Product Owner or team member.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Management Information Systems, Computer Science or related area, or the equivalent through a combination of education and work experience.
Introduction to compliance (regulatory, SOX, etc.) and governance issues.

What you'll bring to the team...

Experience working in a tax or financial services office serving clients.
Passionate interest in improving the tax preparation experience for the tax professional and the client.
Familiarity with technology delivery/software development lifecycles.
Demonstrated decision-making, analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Track record of establishing priorities and meeting deadlines.
Effective written and oral presentation skills.
Ability to work effectively as part of a team.
Experience with Microsoft Office software and product planning tools

title: Product Manager, Platform Services
job_description:
Get your career started at eHealtheHealthInsurance has many exciting career opportunities in a number of locations, across various functions. Come join us today!

It’s complex looking for healthcare. But it’s the perfect challenge for any product leader who wants to contribute to people’s lives and meet real needs. We are helping a range of people – including the poor and the elderly, many of them digitally savvy -- understand their best healthcare options among a dizzying array of choices. As our Product Manager, Platform Services, you will find that the customers who are using our products are not abstract at all. They are probably your friends and family.

Location:

This role can sit in our Santa Clara, CA, Gold River, CA or Indianapolis, IN office.

Product Management at eHealth

The Product Manager, Platform Services, does more than “gather requirements from stakeholders.” You will develop platform services and capabilities that define our customer experience. We are looking for product leaders who are both tactical AND strategic. We work with engineers, data science teams, analysts, marketers, and business teams to solve some of the most complex, emotionally fraught problems consumers will ever face in their lives. So, we take the insights we’ve gained about our customers, how they shop for healthcare, and their needs, and shape product strategy and invent new products. You will see both sides of the product – knowing that at the heart of our consumer experience are our data and shared services. If you want to be in the middle of one of the most important conversations in America, then work here. If you have a passion for the platform services side of eCommerce, this is an interesting place to hone your craft. We aren’t trying to convince people to want some cool new app – we try to help them feel more comfortable with something they absolutely must buy. We are always asking ourselves where we might be losing, confusing, or distressing our customers, and what we can do to fix that. It’s a fun and absorbing challenge. Our company has revolutionized the distribution of health insurance in this country, and we’ve only just begun. You could be one of us if you …

Have a passion for the shared services at the heart of a great customer ecommerce experienceHave exceptional communication and leadership skillsHave experience gathering, analyzing, and maintaining applicable data to inform and drive your decision makingHave a proven track record for delivering successful projects to market on-time and on-budgetHave a proven track record for effectively managing a team of high-achieversWant to make a difference in a marketplace that is the focus of the nation’s attention

The Team

The Product team has decades of experience, with teammates from a range of leading companies such as Amazon, Apple, Bank of America, Disney, IAC and more. We provide a highly customer-centric, team-oriented environment in our offices located in Austin, Indianapolis, Sacramento, San Francisco and Santa Clara, California, and a culture that:

demands empathy for our customersis excited by the business mission of the companyruns on collaboration with other disciplines and business partnershipsrequires you to come up with ideas on your ownhas strong and opinionated leadership pushing the department to evolvesupports PMs in having long and passionate careersrecognizes the need to have a balanced life that includes family, friends, health and wellnessdemands authenticity and trustworthiness and respectseeks to humanize technology in a challenging product category

What You Will Do

Drive product strategy and execution for key shared services – including Providers and Drugs – that help match customers with the best plan for them across eHealth business lines and partner experiences.Drive key services roadmap, working with business stakeholders, product, engineering, and data colleagues to align product development with customer success and business goalsPrioritize deliverables, guiding efforts between technical and non-technical teams to design and deliver compelling platform capabilitiesDeliver actionable requirements, stories, and acceptance criteria, and lead the follow-up conversations with engineering, security, compliance through deliveryCollaborate with engineering and project management on best implementations and release schedulesSupport a talented team to build, maintain, and evolve core capabilities, maximizing features common to multiple stakeholders to improve customer success online and on the phone.Define and measure key metrics, using data to drive decision-makingDevelop near-term and long-term roadmaps, gathering requirements from stakeholders, driving feature prioritizationManage expectations across functional teams (customers, marketing, business, engineering, ops, legal, security)Advocate for a platform approach and a supportive and transparent product culture open to feedbackUndertake related business tasks as required

 Qualifications

BS / MS degree in Computer Science / Engineering or related discipline, or equivalent experience3+ years of platform product experience, including experience with ecommerce technology productsAgile experience as a product manager in Scrum / Kanban frameworks.Experience with leading drug compendia publishers and EHR vendorsPBM experience highly preferredHands-on coding experience in platform services development (web services, APIs, Data Processing ETL, Database modeling in SQL and non-SQL databases, CRM / Back Office systems, etc.) preferredTechnical acumen and experience designing, developing, and enhancing APIs and API-driven solutions on a micro-services architectureProficiency in various product management tools, including Atlassian, MS Office, etc.Experience aligning business requirements with product execution involving significant technical and business complexitiesHigh sense of ownership, initiative, momentum, and urgencyAbility to work collaboratively and lead teams by influenceAbility to juggle multiple projects simultaneously and work across a large organization, including teams in the US and China, to ship cross functional projectsAbility to negotiate and resolve conflicts with a sense of finesse and diplomacyExcellent communication skills, both oral and written, to communicate product vision, roadmap, backlog priorities and trade-offs, adapting for technical and non-technical audiences, and engaging all level of eHealth employees, management and executivesPrior experience in health insurance a plus

eHealth is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. It is our policy to provide equal opportunity to all employees and applicants and to prohibit any discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information, disability, protected veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state or local laws. The foundation of these policies is our commitment to treat everyone fairly and equally and to have a bias-free work environment.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
OverviewKlein Tools has a 160-year history of serving the hand tool needs of professional tradesmen with products that represent a standard of excellence, innovation, technology and quality in our industry. We are looking for candidates who want a career working with The Premier Brand of Hand Tools.

We are currently looking for a Product Manager to be located in our Lincolnshire, IL office.ResponsibilitiesThe Product Manager is responsible for developing and executing product strategy plans, including 3 year life-cycle plans that fit the company's selling tactics, distribution channels, strategy, and financial goals on the large volume, strategically important product categories. This position ensures timely execution of marketing plans and effectively communicates critical information. This position will supply market and product data, analysis, and recommendations as needed. This position is responsible for understanding competitive product lines and can compare and contrast product features and benefits with a compelling selling story. This position is also responsible for understanding, initiating, and utilizing all tactical business drivers to obtain financial objectives.

Specific Responsibilities will include:

​1. Develop short- and long-term product plans designed to deliver growth and profit performance that aligns with the overall goals or the organization.

2. Prepare annual plans for each major product line. Responsible for achieving plans for each major productline.

3. Provide strategic, specific, and targeted recommendations for growth as the recognized expert in the competitive environment, existing internal capabilities, and potential new capabilities. Seek out, evaluate, and prioritize opportunities for product improvements, product line additions, new markets,improved merchandising, promotions, and other growth prospects.

4. Responsible for maintaining a product line portfolio strategy that includes a 3 year product life-cycle plan that will include new product launches, product modifications, promotions, and end of life discontinuations.

5. Provide direction and ensure timely execution of marketing plans including product launches, product modifications, and promotions to drive sales of products.

6. Display leadership qualities when working with cross-functional teams and internal departments. Drives effective communication and collaboration within the organization. Foster good working relationships among team members and other functional contacts. Mentor less experienced Product Management personnel.

7. Market & end user expert through interaction with sales people, distributors, and end users through a variety of venues. Collect and maintain market information. Conduct market research as necessary. Spend 10% of time in the field and documents this time and how and where it is spent learning about customer needs.

8. Serve as the product expert on performance, functionality, pricing, packaging, merchandising, and value propositions to internal and external customers. Provide product-related assistance to other areas of the company as needed.

9. Provide monthly narrative on major product line performance to plan focusing on product lines that are significantly above or below plan along with corrective actions. Provide recommendations for delivering growth.

10. Perform all other duties as assigned.QualificationsQualified candidates will possess a Bachelors Degree in Business or related technical field and five (5) years relevant experience in consumer goods product management or a minimum of three (3) years product management combined with five (5) years of other relevant business experience. MBA or other relevant advanced degree preferred.

Must possess knowledge managing budgets, forecasts, and business plans to achieve financial objectives.

Must possess knowledge in identifying plus justifying a growth opportunity, then launching new product lines and working with a stage-gate development process.

Demonstrate strong communications skills, verbal and written. Demonstrate proficiency with Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Word).

Ability to understand basic financial calculations, simple market research techniques, basic implementation of marketing activities (PR, Advertising, Promotions, POP, Packaging), developing strategic plans (pricing strategy, brand positioning, competitive analysis) with limited assistance, exposure to various manufacturing/sourcing supply chains, and a basic project management proficiency.

Ability to be an effective team player that takes initiative and ownership, while influencing cross-functional team.

Klein Tools provides a competitive compensation and benefits package, including:


401(k) Company Match
Profit Sharing
Paid Vacation/Holidays
Shared Cost Medical & Dental
Flex Spending
Education Reimbursement Program
Employee Discount Program
Onsite Employee Fitness Center

If you have the commitment to succeed and the desire to join an organization recognized as the industry leader, please submit your cover letter and resume.

No phone calls please.

EOE/M/F/D/V

title: Sr. Category Manager, Floral & Garden
job_description:
The Sr. Category Manager conducts category reviews to assess performance of across customer segments, stores and items. This role translates consumer segment data & insights into specific category assortment, merchandising, advertising/promotions and pricing strategies.

Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:

· Conduct category reviews to assess performance of across customer segments, stores and items

· Translate consumer segment data & insights into specific category assortment, merchandising, advertising/promotions and pricing strategies

· Details out category plans and drives execution

· Coordinates across support teams and synthesizes inputs

· Designs, executes category initiatives

· Liaise between Merchandising and Consumer Analytics & Insight

Analytics & Insight team

· Support vendor negotiation for category initiatives (e.g., "category month" for specific categories)

· Develop a portfolio of customer-centric product offerings for assigned categories that promotes the unique banner identity and ensures that the banner is relevant in every market and drives customers to the stores

· Responsible for all aspects of product life cycle management to include understanding market demands, technology trends, and the competitive environment for assigned categories

· Through analytics, store visits, and other research elements, determines future product needs for assigned categories

· Determine product offerings and promotional plans for assigned categories to achieve operating results

· Work with the Merchandising and Marketing teams to ensure assigned categories are effectively merchandised for optimized customer experience and sales (“total store experience”) – to include teaching/training opportunities during store visits

· Develop and assist with the successful execution of the merchandise planning and allocation plan, to fulfill growth and revenue goals

· Support the banner’s strategic product roadmap for assigned area, to include product launch and product marketing in order to meet customer needs

· Serve as the primary interface with suppliers in day-to-day interactions, and effectively manages these relationships to support banner sales and profit goals

· Work collaboratively with Sourcing to define the cost of goods and provide promotional planning requirements in support of banner and cross-banner collaborative supplier negotiations

· Perform other duties as assigned

LOCATION: MODESTO, CA.

#glassdoor

The Save Mart Companies is one of the largest food and drug retailers in California and Nevada. It is home to a number of well-known brands in food retailing. You might have seen our banners that include Save Mart, Lucky, Lucky California and Food Maxx. We also have 4 distribution centers and SMART Refrigerated Transport, a trucking firm that transports dry groceries, frozen foods, ice and novelties to all of The Save Mart Companies stores. We are a locally and family owned business, headquartered in the heart of one of the greatest agricultural areas of our nation - the San Joaquin Valley.

The Modesto community is vibrant with great traditions, educational opportunities and multi-cultural lifestyles. Aside from mild weather year-round, Modesto allows for easy access to many major tourist attractions in California. To the west lies the San Francisco Bay Area (90-miles) and the Santa Cruz Beach (115-miles). To the east is the famed Gold Country “Mother Lode” (50-miles) and a little farther you can find the majestic Sierra Nevada mountain range, Lake Tahoe (180-miles) and Yosemite National Park (110-miles).

Some of our competitive benefits include: exceptionally generous benefits package (Health, Dental, Vision, Life, 401K), flexible schedule options, Employee Connection (earn fun and valuable prizes!), Life Long Learning – Educational opportunities, Employee Association (discounted and free tuition options, contests, and support services).

Grow your CAREER and join us to share your Guest focus, passion about food and family, and pride in the Central Valley and our wonderful community!

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Description

"Join an award winning and globally recognized leader in the electronics industry."

Client is a rapidly growing producer of ultra-pure chemical products, serving the semiconductor, silicon and flat-panel screen industries worldwide. We deliver world class products to the leaders of the industries we serve.

Position Summary: Under the direction of the Program Manager, the Product Manager will work independently and with Program Managers, Account Managers, and other Product Managers to accomplish the goals of the Organization. The Product Manager supports the Program Manager with various aspects of product management. The Product Manager will demonstrate professional appearance, behavior and attitude at all times while performing his/her job duties. Position is currently located in Moses Lake, WA. The right candidate may earn the opportunity to work from our Portland, OR location.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities (Essential Job Functions):

Tactical product management to internal and external customers.

Serve as primary POC (point of contact) for management of each product line

Establish, organize and facilitate customer meetings as needed for regular support of each product line

Run projects related to product lines, including both customer escalations and internally driven task force activities

Manage product development deliverables and schedule

Use cost models to characterize product cost structure

Collaborate with Facilities, Engineering, and manufacturing groups to understand the manufacturing process, cost and capital expenditure requirements

Collaborate with Supply Chain Management, QA, Lab, and other affected departments to ensure product quality throughout product life cycle

Other duties as assigned

Job Specific Competencies:

Accountability-Accepting responsibility that results in anticipation/prevention of problem areas from actions, and problem solving inside and outside the department/organization

Result Orientation-Accepting responsibility that results in anticipation/prevention of problem areas from actions, and problem solving inside and outside the department/organization

Continuous Learning-Actively and continuously gaining insight of strengths and weaknesses in order to identify the relevant areas that need further development (with regard to skills and knowledge) and acting upon it

Data Gathering and Analysis-Collecting, consolidating, and using relevant information; recognizing important information; tracing possible causes of problems, and searching for practical data/solutions

Empathy-Having the ability to put things in context and think broadly. Involves consideration and understanding of future business needs within a changing (external) environment (social, political, economic and related industries, and technology), how process, methods, and resource requirements might be affected by future trends and developments, and developing long-term goals and strategies extending over a significant time span (i.e. 3-5 years)

Financial Awareness-Actively seeking opportunities to optimize financial costs and investments when making decisions that have a financial implication

Teamwork-Working as a productive member of a cohesive group toward a common goal and contributing to team development and effective team dynamics

People Development-Having the ability to assess skill strengths and weaknesses of individuals and teams in order to determine what actions are appropriate to build and/or improve the needed skills

General Job Requirements / Competencies:

Client's Core Values-A strong culture is fundamental to the success of Client and this is driven by our core company values. Client expects employees to demonstrate and promote the values ofSafety, Integrity, Accountability, Collaboration, Innovation and Sustainability

Safety Conscious-Actively supporting and promoting Client safety culture

Uphold all Client policies and "Client Code of Conduct."

Strict compliance with Environmental and Safety regulations

Compliance and individual accountability with the Client Quality System and ISO Registration is required. It is the employee's commitment to ensure that the Company's actual practices and procedures are exercised as directed

Required Knowledge, Skills and Ability:

5+ years of experience working in a manufacturing environment

5+ years of experience in customer management

BA in Business Economics or BS in Chemistry or Engineering with 5+ years relevant business experience will be considered

Project management skils

Strong analytical/computer skills (Excel and PowerPoint)

Demonstrated ability to:

o Follow written and verbal instructions in English

o Manage multiple priorities and projects simultaneously in order to meet established deadlines

o Work effectively independently and as part of a dynamic/collaborative team

o Perform tasks with attention to detail and accuracy

o Maintain regular and punctual attendance

Working Conditions: Duties are generally performed indoors in an office and high purity manufacturing environment. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate. When working in the presence of safety hazards, the employee is expected to follow company safety rules and use proper personal protective equipment such as: hardhat, safety glasses and full leather shoes, etc. Client is an alcohol and drug free work place.

Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, stand, walk, talk and listen. The employee is frequently required to handle and use objects, controls or keyboards; reach with hands and arms; kneel, crouch and occasionally climb. The employee frequently works with computer systems that require coordination and attention to detail.

The employee may occasionally lift and move up to 25 pounds without assistance and with assistance of greater weight. Specific vision abilities required are; color perception, close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

Located in central Washington, an outdoor recreational oasis, we offer a competitive compensation and complete benefits package. Client is an equal employment opportunity employer and is a drug & alcohol-free workplace. If you are prepared to work in an exciting and rewarding environment, we look forward to considering your experience and qualifications.

Candidates who do not meet the minimum requirements for the position will not be considered.

Qualifications

Skills

MicroSoft Office: Advanced

Education

Bachelors or better in Business Economics.

Experience

Required

5 years: BS in Chemistry or Engineering with Business experience will be considered

5 years: Manufacturing environment experience

Licenses & Certifications

title: Product Owner - Digital Asset Management
job_description:
DAM (Digital Asset Manager) Product Manager

IT Product Managers own digital products from conception, through launch and retirement. IT Product Managers bridge the technical and business worlds as digital products are designed that enable our key business objectives through collaboration with business strategy,data science and product delivery teams. The IT Product Manager develops the vision for the digital product, the digital product strategy and the roadmap to execute upon the strategy for IT products/systems related to Bayer Crop Science Product Portfolio Management. Requires a degree or 3-5 years experience in field or related area.

Responsibilities:

This individual will be expected to develop a comprehensive understanding of how our business use digital assets to communicate and market, and uncover unmet and emerging asset management needs of those businesses in partnership with CoEs, ITBPs and other stakeholders.
Based on market trends and internal business needs, develop a vision for industry-leading digital asset management platform and partner with CoEs, ITBP and other stakeholders to co-create the product roadmap
Define the product strategy and roadmap to support the objectives of business segments, markets, and brands.
Lead the process, governance, and service for internal customers who are onboarding to and using the DAM platform, partnering closely to ensure successful adoption and integration of services into their business processes; Provide product governance through typical, and as needed special, ceremonies and artifacts
Contribute and help develop a network of DAM champions/advocates throughout the company to evangelize best practices, so they can serve as first-line support within their Line of Business and provide input on the direction and roadmap of the DAM platform.
Partner with stakeholders on the standards, methodologies, and governance for organizing folder structure, assets, metadata, and content taxonomy and tagging.
Ensure that organizational principles and metadata schema are effectively maintained in the DAM by providing oversight and input to content structure, uploading, and tagging of assets, approval workflows, and asset life cycle management
Based on the Roadmap, Manage and prioritize the product backlog to maximize value delivery, speed, and quality iteratively.
Define requirements in the necessary formats and details to allow development, testing, demonstration, acceptance, deployment, support, usage, and adoption.
Define requirements in the necessary formats and details to allow integration with any 3rd party systems or data sources or other Internal tools.
Approve and accept development and deployment of features, Publish release notes
Identify solutions and manage vendors, as necessary, to achieve objectives.
Provide authoritative, inspired, and well-informed DAM subject matter expertise.

Must Haves:

3+ years of Prior Product Management Experience, overseeing implementation of 3rd party software for Digital Marketing
2+ years of experience with DAM, Library Science, Content Management and data collection systems
2+ years of experience with Content Taxonomy
Knowledge of marketing content development processes and familiarity with marketing technology
Ability to Solicit, Analyze and define requirements for large-scale projects (integrations with other systems, migrations to AEM, translation, Analytics, Marketing Automation, Asset Management etc. and ability to work with teams in breaking down high-level features into tactical user-stories and track them across multiple organizations.
Experience working across-teams to gain alignment and dependency Coordination across Adobe Experience Management suite of tools and Internal data systems.
Demonstrated ability to lead through influence working in a cross functional team, building relationships with engineering teams and business stakeholders
The ability to explain complex concepts in a way that enables the team & stakeholders to understand what they are doing and why
Strong initiative for anticipating and meeting business demands, an ability to thrive in a fast-paced and uncertain environment, and a focus on generating results

This position will work closely with Product Strategy Development to outline a vision to product enhancement and round out the documentation with functional specifications.

title: Product Analytics Senior Manager
job_description:
Connect with work that matters. Be a part of transforming the healthcare industry!

We are looking for a Product Analytics Senior Manager to lead a team of analysts working to enable data driven decisions and improvements in the athenahealth product suite. The role combines technical expertise in data analysis and metric definition, with the management acumen required to lead and scale a large team of talented analysts, supporting a broad, complex product. You will also be responsible for the overall approach and processes your team implements in supporting your product and R&D stakeholders. But enough about us; let’s talk about you.

You are passionate about problem-solving, and always take a customer-centric approach. You know how to energize cross-functional teams around a problem and use data to identify and prioritize solutions. You have experience creating meaningful analysis with large, complex datasets and using the tools of your trade: query languages, ETL tools, data modeling, and data visualization. You have strong attention to detail and passion for building effective teams and processes. You are at your best when tackling new problems and supporting innovation.

The Team: We are a diverse group of athenistas who believe that being smart about how we use data can lead to better products and more value for our clients. We don't just pull data and create analyses; we create compelling stories driven by the context of our customers and the vision of athenahealth. We believe we are strongest when we support each other, and that learning is always part of the job.

Job Responsibilities

Drives partnerships with the Product Management leaders to determine the measures of success and guide good usage of outcome driven metricsOversees professional development of the team by identifying development opportunities, providing coaching and/or training, and supporting growthGuides the measurement of success for the designated product and each of its components, including metrics that cover product performance, adoption and utilization, and outcomes.Synthesizes insights from across the team to create compelling presentations and visualizations to demonstrate product proof points to internal and external stakeholdersOwns and maintains team processes to maximize appropriate and efficient application of analytics resources

Typical Qualifications

10+ years overall professional experience, inclusive of 5+ years of data analytics or data science.Experience leading teams with multiple members.Strong understanding of database technologies and ability to use and analyze a variety of tools, techniques, and processes to gather and report data. Extensive SQL experience preferred.Ability to synthesize complex, high quantity and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve business problems. Excellent verbal and written communication skills; strong track record of influencing across a range of audiences, both internal and external audiences, and across a range of cohorts.Bachelor’s Degree required; Degree (Bachelor’s or Masters) in quantitative disciples like Computer Science, Data Engineering, Data Science, Statistics, or Mathematics preferred.

About athenahealth

Our Vision: To create a thriving ecosystem that delivers accessible, high-quality, and sustainable healthcare for all. Our Location: This role is based in Watertown, MA, just a few miles outside of Boston. Watertown is our Global Headquarters and our campus, the Arsenal on the Charles, is home to restaurants, a local gym, and large outdoor space. This office also has a cafeteria, coffee café, and food trucks that rotate every day.Our Culture: If you’re curious, passionate and want to connect with work that matters, you’ve come to the right place. At athenahealth, our employees (or “athenistas”) are committed to making healthcare in the United States smarter. At the heart of athenahealth's culture is unconditional positive regard for one another, our customers, their patients and our community. We take time to celebrate diversity and our accomplishments, and we strive to be powerfully relevant and refreshingly candid in everything we do.Our Perks:  Along with health & financial benefits, our athenistas are offered a variety of perks that promote employee wellbeing such as commuter support and collaborative workspaces.

athenahealth is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity—that’s why we recruit and hire applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, disability, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression, or any other factor prohibited by law. We’re happy to provide a reasonable accommodation, for those with a disability, to complete any part of the application process. If you are unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, please contact us at

taoperations@athenahealth.com for assistance.

https://www.athenahealth.com/careers/equal-opportunity
