title: Product Manager
job_description:
About the Role

As Product Manager, you will support Brivos engineering teams in the day-to-day operations of product development as well as chart the strategic direction for Brivos current and future product offerings. If you are passionate about building and launching new products and looking for a new challenge, join us.

In this role, you will also be responsible to:

Work cross-functionally with all areas of our business including, but not limited to, channel partners, sales, customer support, operations and finance. Develop a detailed understanding of Brivos business environment and translate our strategic priorities into a product vision, roadmap and specifications.Utilize your strong Voice of Customer skills to develop product requirements and new product proposals based on market needs.Collaborate with internal teams to iterate on product concepts and deliver capabilities that will enable us to accelerate our growth.Coordinate with internal and external engineering teams using agile methodologies to deliver on our vision, including product roadmap development, sprint planning, user story development, and backlog refinement.

About You

Experienced building customer-facing products (at least 3 years) and have a Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Information Systems or related field. Able to lead time-sensitive, high availability products with minimum guidance and high attention to detail.Able to collaborate at a variety of levels on product vision, strategy and roadmap.Experienced using Google Analytics or similar data analytics platformsAble to use data to establish priorities and drive actions.Action-oriented, self motivated, and a team player.Comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.A track record of success in developing new products and featuresExcellent communication skills - both written and verbal - to develop training and marketing materials for products and services coming to market.The ability to clearly define, quantify, and track results to implement continuous improvements, and enhance the customer experience.Familiarity working with UX prototyping tools, such as InVision or Sketch, to visually articulate ideas to developers and stakeholders.Some level of experience in the commercial security industry or other related industries preferred (e.g., access control, property management, video).

About Us

Brivo is the original innovator of cloud-based physical security solutions for commercial buildings. Our mission is to make the world a safer place by providing a subscription-based service for securing buildings using reliable, convenient, scalable, cyber-hardened technology. Every day this mission becomes more important as our world becomes more complex and more divided, and the nature of threats evolves faster than most observers can follow. Join a team thats passionate for the business, its values, and building simply better security.

Some of Our Perks

Discretionary time off, professional development opportunities, 401(K) match, paid parental leave, fitness center reimbursement, commuter stipend, health insurance, company-sponsored outings, unlimited [free] snacks, and lots of breakfasts & lunches.

Brivo is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

title: Product Manager, Integrations
job_description:
The Product Manager is responsible for guiding the team through development and current issues regarding our software, hardware, and integrations with our products. You will work close with Engineers, our Product Management team and our Customers to ensure that the best quality product is developed in the industry.
Key Responsibilities 

Collaborate with design and engineering to scope, build and launch new features of new and existing platforms, hardware and integrations.
Build consensus amongst stakeholders by defining a shared vision and establishing a roadmap of prioritized initiatives, backed by quantitative research.
Act as a product owner responsible for prioritization of the team’s backlog, leveraging your experience to prioritize based not only on a technical path, but also on business value and strategic direction.
Advocate for the Product Line assigned.
Ensure that our product capabilities meet our customers’ requirements
Ensure programs are scalable and secure for integration into customer cloud enterprises.
Execute and oversee standard software development activities including design, development, implementation, test, documentation, and support using agile software engineering principles.
Provide leadership by example.
Communicate the product roadmap to Sales, Marketing & Support teams
Develop product requirements and user stories for new product features and enhancements
Complete weekly status reports

Position Requirements 

5 to 7 years’ experience working in a similar role or capacity
Preferred education is a four-year bachelor’s degree in the field of Animal Science, Engineering, or equivalent education and experience
Able to balance quantitative and qualitative analysis
Detail-oriented with a high bar for quality when writing user stories, reviewing designs, brainstorming technical approach, and testing a feature before it is released.
Able to keep up with a fast-paced, global company, focusing on execution.
Have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Continuously looking to maximize impact.
You must possess a great work ethic and a positive outlook on your career
Experience with a dairy related company are a big plus
Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.
Willingness to learn new tasks and expand skill set into additional areas.

title: Cooler Manager

Manage receipt and storage of all incoming shipments • Manages the daily and monthly inventories. • Ensure accuracy and on time shipment of product against orders • Safeguards company assets • Meet Standards for Employee Safety, Food Safety and Quality in cooler area • Ensure direct report development including their empowerment, training and accountability • Manages development and use of necessary corrective performance measures • Comply with SQF policies/procedures, JVM Sales Corp.'s policies/procedures and maintain GMP's within areas assigned • Support achievement of department KPI's • Adhere to all Guida's Food Safety and Qualitypolicies and procedures, reporting any nonconformity • Adhere to all Guida's Safety policies and procedures, reporting any nonconformity • Adhere to all Guida's GMP policies and procedures, reporting any nonconformity • Other duties as assigned Requirements 5 + years experience in high volume warehousing, Self Disciplined Good Communication skills

title: Account/Project Manager
job_description:
Our Mission:
B2B marketing is dated and ineffective. Marketers are overstretched, trying to catch up to quickly-evolving modern methods. Most of the help available offers productized solutions focused on justifying a retainer rather than driving business success.
We guide each client toward digital marketing success through modern websites, tools, and initiatives that address their unique needs, with great communication and powerful processes.
Our customers grow in their businesses and their careers — by better supporting sales and increasing their own knowledge and experience.
By connecting thoughtful modern marketing with innovative companies, we help propel the world forward.Learn more about our mission and team culture at https://www.windmillstrategy.com/careers/
 About the Opportunity: This role is of a client-facing project manager, who serves as the primary point of contact for your group of existing client accounts. You’ll balance keeping projects on time and on budget, nurturing and growing client relationships, and protecting Windmill’s interests with sane project schedules and healthy project profitability. About You: You are smart, realistic, logical, results- and process-oriented. You live to address client needs and to plan and execute strategies that guide the success of both our clients and Windmill Design.You will keep projects successful and on track throughout their lifecycle by managing budgets and timelines and prioritizing assignments. You thrive on keeping clients happy and well-informed, and turning them into raving fans of our team and process.You are a natural problem solver and communicator, with the ability to negotiate between the needs of the client, Windmill, and our internal team to create win-win solutions. You have deep knowledge of web and digital marketing processes, think quickly on your feet, and are a pro at delegation. You balance big picture goals and important details to ensure successful project outcomes.Most importantly, you want to join a team of great people who are passionate about growing our company, and helping our clients succeed. Responsibilities:  

Comprehend the essential dynamics, strategies and drivers of the client’s business.Be warm, likable, and a good listener.
Share your knowledge of web design/development, graphic design, and branding solutions. Show how they solve a client’s business and marketing needs. Our customers trust you as their expert guide.
Collaborate with the team to create project estimates, proposals and planning documents, then execute against high-level strategies and goals set forth at the kickoff.
As the main point of contact for projects large and small, you promptly return client emails and calls, communicate proactively and apply their feedback toward the collective best outcome for the project.
Collaboratively schedule and balance the workload of a small team of designers, developers, strategists and outside vendors/contractors.
Hold the team accountable to deadlines, and drive results and efficiency.
Assist in continuous evolution of internal processes and strengthening existing client relationships.
Follow up with clients on a regular basis to ensure customer satisfaction, review needs, and develop plans for future projects.
Facilitate client meetings (in collaboration with other team-members) and ensure that feedback is complete and received in a timely manner.
Objectively make recommendations and present decision alternatives, negotiate effectively and influence project stakeholders to create win-win solutions.
Identify and resolve risks in meeting schedule and budget constraints and hold yourself accountable for project momentum, quality, client satisfaction, and company profitability. Maintain and communicate realistic timeline and budget expectations.
Create and manage client-facing project schedules and internal task assignments and priorities.
Review billing and invoices for accuracy and profitability.

We’re a small team of expert practitioners who are multidisciplinary and often wear many hats. Other activities you might assist with, depending on your background, include:

Proofread and QA copy, web and design deliverables to ensure requirements and quality standards are being met.
Train clients in using their CMS installations (typically WordPress) and create client-facing website documentation.
Guide and facilitate content creation by writers and/or clients.
Use Google Analytics, Heatmap reports and other analysis tools.
Make small CMS edits to existing client websites.
Other related responsibilities may be assigned as needed to help the company operate efficiently.

Specific skills:

Experience in and knowledge of the creative and technical requirements of web design, web development, digital marketing, SEO, analytics, print/graphic design and branding
Great verbal and written communication skills
Prioritizes accuracy, logic, problem-solving and action.
2+ years at a digital agency in account, project or traffic management and a proven track record
Proactive communication habits: adept at asking the right questions to create clarity and answering client questions before they have to ask
Strong organizational and problem-solving skills
Conversant and familiar with WordPress and Shopify, able to pick up other software tools easily.
A positive attitude; effective listening skills; empathy, assertiveness and an ongoing interest in learning
Leadership qualities: honesty, integrity and ability to stay calm under pressure
Mac user with Microsoft Office, Google Apps experience (Adobe Creative Suite experience a plus, but not required)
Ready to become a power user of Liquidplanner
Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree

Account Project manager key accountabilities:

Collaborative company resource planning
Objective pricing and estimates for projects and tasks
Coordination of inside and outside resources
Establish, manage and monitor project schedules, scope, and budget
Deadline compliance
Budget compliance
Notes and assets
Risk mitigation
Project process/procedure
Primary client contact
Grow existing client relationships

Culture & Benefits:
We’re a small team of friendly, engaged A-players who care about each other. Our work environment is high on responsibility, low on politics. We value work-life balance, and have a no-jerks policy. Compensation packages include healthcare, disability insurance, paid vacation/holidays (including your birthday off), 401k matching, a professional development/education budget, bonus potential, and flex schedules. We also have office snacks, Dogwood Coffee, regular team lunches and happy hours, ample free parking in a cool Northeast Minneapolis neighborhood, and a close proximity to Bauhaus Brew Labs, Dogwood and Spyhouse Coffee. If the key characteristics and info above sounds like you, we’d love to have you join us on our mission — you’ll like it here. Learn more about our culture at https://www.windmillstrategy.com/careers/
To apply:    Please email a cover letter, résumé, salary requirements, and links to three live website projects that you’ve worked on (with a description of your role in the project).

title: Sales/Project Manager
job_description:
The Company:

Monarch roofing is the leading provider of roofing solutions to all Commercial and Residential Owner. We take pride in installing the best roofing system that offer the best protection available and is specific to the coastal warm and humid area. Our roofing system used are proven to lower long-term cost and increase the curb appeal. We specialize in all roofing aspect including Metal, Tile, Shingles and Low Slope Roofs.

Monarch Roofing is Certified with all products used including (not limited) to: GAF Master Elite, GAF Master Commercial, Duro-Last Installer, GACO.

The Project Manager/Salesman reports to the General Manager. This position is responsible for developing new business and managing that business through the entire roof installation process. This position requires excellent customer service, exceptional leadership, multi-tasking and problem-solving skills.

The Project Manager/Salesman Duties:

Understands or learns all roofing systems
Excellent customer service
Maximize each sales opportunity with the existing and prospective customers while developing and maintaining key client relationship
Develops a strong product knowledge as well as customer knowledge
Participates in company and industry events and conferences
Works on special projects and contributes to team effort
Has excellent communication and collaboration skills to work with other team members
Conducts himself in a professional matter acting as the customer relationship Management
Works closely with marketing team & general manager to provide smart ideas maximizing market sales opportunities

Qualities, Characteristics, Aptitude:

The Project Manager/Salesman is a Team player orientation. Ability to interface with all levels within the organization and external parties
High degree of confidentiality required
Passion to turn prospects into customers
Able to multi task
Motivated by others success
Self-starter: Strong leadership skills and looking to grow with the company wanting to better himself for constant improvement
Exceptional skills and understand that customer satisfaction is our #1 priority
Detailed monthly report providing accurate information
Strong work ethics
Polite & positive attitude


Compensation

$45,000 to $75,000 Annually


Employment Type

Full-Time

title: Product Manager, Technical - Supply Chain Planning
job_description:
This Product Manager, Technical role will play a key part in defining and executing the technology strategy for T-Mobile's Network Supply Chain domain. The role will focus on T-Mobile's supply chain planning capabilities, owning the technology product strategy, roadmap, and backlog prioritization and execution.

Product Manager, Technical is a visionary, strategist, analyst, customer evangelist, respected leader of business and technology execution, and professional relationship builder all rolled into a single dynamic package. Every product at T-Mobile is envisioned and created to achieve a specific business purpose or set of business results. The Product Manager, Technical is ultimately accountable, responsible, and has ownership of T-Mobile's internal and external products, platforms, services, experiences envisioned and created to achieve the specific business purpose or business results. At a high level this means identifying the intersection of customer problems/unmet needs (an opportunity), technical feasibility, business objectives, securing funding, and leading a cross-functional business and technical team, as well as key stakeholders to deliver against the opportunity.

Product Manager, Technical is the ultimate "jack-of-all-trades" leveraging deep customer empathy, strategic thinking, commercial, analytical, technical capability and knowledge, and leadership prowess to successfully deliver delightful and differentiated products that drive growth and positively impact customers lives.

No day is the same for the Product Manager, Technical. Day to day activities or responsibilities include: conducting market research; writing features or user stories; determining specifications; defining long-term strategy of the product; creating the product road map; driving technical delivery end to end; defining scope for releases/product increments; partnering with development, project/program management, marketing, and other key stakeholders to define release schedule; and support/drive go-to-market activities as needed.

Responsibilities

Vision, Strategy, and Analysis

Owns product category end to end for technology products or features with moderate level of complexity and scope. This includes creating, managing, maintaining and communicating product vision and roadmap.

Partners with business and internal/external stakeholders to understand current customer/user experiences, identifies areas of opportunity.

Conducts analysis of quantitative and qualitative data to identify product innovation opportunities or root cause of issues, and assess opportunity size and impact. May work with data scientists to answer complex questions or identify meaningful insights from data.

Works with external third parties to assess partnerships and licensing opportunities.

Product Execution/Delivery

Translates product/platform strategy by writing detailed features and user stories consumable for Dev teams for moderately complex products. This work may include creation of prototypes.

Owns and manages product backlog and priorities with our business and technology partners. Backlog at this level typically serves 1 - 4 Agile / Scrum / Sprint teams.

Scopes and prioritizes activities based on business and customer impact.

Collaborates with Architecture and Dev teams to ensure technical debt and long term technical investment is factored into roadmap.

Ensures existing production defects are factored into regular backlog prioritization for resolution based on priority.

Collaborates with stakeholders and Dev / Execution teams to create and communicate anticipated release schedule.

Generates and maintains dashboards and reports that track product health and success metrics.

Conduct Product Quarterly Business Reviews (QBR's) and Steering meetings.

Runs beta and pilot programs with early-stage products and samples.

Collaborates with advertising and public relations to promote product.

Supports sales, marketing, and other stakeholder teams with the necessary product knowledge and additional documentation.

Assists with the overall execution relating to all aspects of the software development process, from defining the strategy and architecture through deployment and support.

Communicates technical challenges to stakeholders and makes educated trade-off decisions based on those challenges.

Accountable for product quality and performance in production environment. Accountable for product team response in event of critical or high impacting defect, including communications to stakeholders at all levels.

Manages development of adoption tools and training materials.

Identify execution, operational, organizational issues that impede product success. Drive improvement plan to change or resolve issues (within sphere of influence).

Relationship & People, Professional Development

Collaborates and develops positive working relationships with many technical and non-technical teams, including sales, commercial accounting, marketing, legal, go-to-market, and finance. Works with outside partners and other third parties.

Develops adoption tools and training material.

Qualifications

4 to 7 years of relevant Technology Product Management, Technology Product Owner, Business Analyst, and System Analyst experience in an agile software product development environment.

Experience with supply chain planning software, with preference for experience with o9 Solutions software

Experience with technology-enabled supply chain operations, from planning thorugh fulfillment and asset lifecycle tracking

Experience in performing systems analysis in the support and operation of enterprise supply chain systems.

Experience with JIRA or related tools

Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in written form

Ability to conduct analysis and leverage logic to develop conclusions and recommendations

Excel, PowerPoint, Word, etc.

Familiarity with DevOps concepts, tools, and execution

Company Profile

As America's Un-carrier, T-Mobile USA, Inc. (NASDAQ: "TMUS") is redefining the way consumers and businesses buy wireless services through leading product and service innovation. The company's advanced nationwide 4G and 4G LTE network delivers outstanding wireless experiences for customers who are unwilling to compromise on quality and value. Based in Bellevue, Washington, T-Mobile USA. Inc. provides services through its subsidiaries and operates its flagship brands, T-Mobile and Metro by T-Mobile. For more information, please visit http://www.t-mobile.com

Applicant Privacy Policy

We are committed to maintaining your trust by respecting and protecting your privacy. For more information about how T-Mobile processes the personal data of job applicants, please visit Applicant Privacy Policy.

EOE Statement

We Take Equal Opportunity Seriously - By Choice. T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with our Company values and will not be tolerated. Furthermore, such discrimination or harassment may violate federal, state, or local law.

title: Sr. Product Manager
job_description: The Product Management Manager is an accomplished achiever in designing and building products and services. The focus is on the development and accomplishment of goals and strategic plans to relentlessly advance credit union through products and pricing. Obsessed with product and price optimization in order to better serve members, increase revenue, manage risk, and grow the credit union. Charts and enforces adherence to strategic product roadmaps to further the credit union’s mission and strategies. Acts as the voice of product user inside the credit union and is consumed with the member experience and competitive positioning. Leads ALM committee discussions on lending performance and the competitive landscape to help determine strategic direction and risk tolerances of the credit union. Must possess excellent public relation skills and a full and thorough understanding of AFCU lending operations, policies, and procedures, products and services, granting credit, as well as legal and regulatory requirements related to consumer lending. Directs and mentors a dynamic team of professionals on a wide spectrum of products in order to better navigate the multi-faceted product development process and product management lifecycle while optimizing Product Management resources. Leads cross-functional teams in product innovation, pricing, and process improvement.1. Product Management and Development• Establishes product goals for utilization, penetration, profitability, market share, etc. • Creates and drives competitive product strategies• Manages the product lifecycle from strategic planning to tactical activities• Evaluates product performance against strategic objectives and makes adjustments as needed• Increases profitability, penetration and utilization of existing products• Investigate opportunities and evaluate proposals• Infuses original and differentiating insights resulting in products that lead the market• Takes strong and immediate data-backed action on underperforming areas within the product offerings• Identifies, analyzes, and evaluates loan risks and compensating factors to establish lending criteria and limits.• Aides in the creation of company policy relative to product usage/experience• Owns and controls the overall product experience• Develops, evaluates and implements strategic product plans, based on member needs, organizational objectives and market characteristics2. Product Research and Analysis• Employs product research and analysis for the creation and implementation of strategic plans• Sets, tracks, and adjust product goals based on performance and economic conditions• Leverages performance metrics in setting policy• Creates, tests and validates predictive models• Discovers, acts upon and notifies Senior Management of “stories” told by the data• Maintains a keen understanding of competitive products and offerings• Performs ongoing, in-depth analyses of products reporting to evaluate performance against corporate strategy• Initiates primary and secondary research studies to determine market needs, competitor strength and positioning, member satisfaction and product requirements• Uncovers key insights to develop product strategies to enhance the value of the member relationship, while maximizing the value that the member receives• Identifies issues and recommend changes in strategies and tactics3. Employee Development• Develops, coaches, supports and manages an effective product management and development team• Holds direct reports accountable for individual and team performance• Provides leadership to personnel through effective objective setting, delegation, and communication• Ensures that personnel are well-trained, effective, and optimally used. • Ensures that staffing levels are appropriate. Interviews, hires, and assigns personnel• Directs, schedules, and coordinates department functions• Conducts performance appraisals. Formulates and implements corrective actions as needed.  4. Interaction with Others• Communicates with and makes recommendations to top-level management on a daily basis.• Consistently advises senior management on product and service strategies.• Functions as a member of the Asset Liability Management, Enterprise Risk Management, Capital Planning, and Product Excellence committees attending, contributing and carrying out decisions made within those committees• Leads ALM Committee discussions on lending performance and competitive environment.• Creates and leads cross-functional teams to accomplish objectives and resolve problems.• Works closely with the marketing and operational teams to deliver on product goals.• Maintains a broad knowledge of virtually all aspects of the company along with a veryfocused knowledge of all products and services and members. 5. Responsible for related duties as required or assigned• Stays abreast of computer applications, models, and research in the Product and Service field.• Works to develop more efficient methods for tracking key indicators. • Conducts regular product assessments.• Completes special projects as assigned.Training/Education/Certification: • Four-year Business, Economics, Finance, or related college degree.• MBA degree desirable. Required Knowledge: • Complete knowledge of all Credit Union products, services, policies, and procedures.• Expert in complex pricing models.• Understands interest rate risk and credit risk.• Business, financial and management knowledge.• Proficient in product innovation and development.• Understanding of market pressures that drive product performance.• Product and industry knowledge.• Understanding of market research techniques and models.• Extensive knowledge of statistics and related computer applications and financial and market indicators.• Competent in database theory database utilization.• Proficient in Structured Query Language (SQL) and Oracle RDBMS. Experience Required: • Ten plus years in product management or related field, preferably at a financial institution.• Five plus years supervisory responsibility. Skills/Abilities:• Outstanding abstract, analytical, and creative thinking abilities.• Ability to discuss and debate strategic issues with top management.• Entrepreneurial attitude.• Strategic Planning.• Proven ability to lead and influence cross-functional teams.• Negotiation expertise.• Keen decision-making skills.• Excellent reasoning, interpersonal and organizational skills.• Strong project management skills.• Outstanding leadership abilities.• Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills.• Able to meet deadlines.• Strong problem solving abilities.• Ability to apply logical or scientific thinking to define problems. • Skilled in the collection of data and using that data to establish facts.• Gifted in interpreting information to draw relevant, actionable conclusions. • Able to interpret a variety of technical instructions and can deal with multiple variables.• Expert in taking quantitate data and turning that into creative solutions to capture opportunity.• Ability to use advanced mathematical and statistical calculations.

title: Senior Marketing Manager (North America)
job_description:
Cherwell Software (@Cherwell) is a global leader in enterprise service management, empowering organizations through the use of intuitive technology for better, faster, and more affordable innovation. Our solutions and our people build lasting relationships. We are a growing company with offices in the US, Europe, and Australia.

We are looking for a Senior Marketing Manager (North America) to join our team in Colorado (Denver or Colorado Springs, CO).Who Will Love This Job

Someone who is a "doer": You take initiative and enjoy taking on a challenge!
An organizer: Are highly organized and pride yourself on bringing order to chaos—you like systems that work well, and you are willing to help define them​
A​ ​phenomenal​ ​presenter​: ​ ​You​ ​are​ ​effective​ ​in​ ​a​ ​variety​ ​of​ ​formal​ ​presentation​ ​settings: one-on-one, ​ ​small​ ​and​ ​large​ ​groups. ​ ​You​ ​command attention​ ​and​ ​can​ ​manage​ ​group​ ​processes​ ​during​ ​the​ ​presentation.
A good writer: You enjoy writing on technical and business topics. You dig in and do the research to understand trends and how our solutions solve real business challenges and then writing about your findings in blogs, papers, and web pages.
Someone who is widely trusted: You are seen as a direct, truthful individual and can present the feedback in an appropriate and helpful manner.

What You'll DoWe are looking for a highly collaborative Sr. Manager of Marketing to create and execute multi-channel campaigns to increase Cherwell's brand awareness and lead acquisition across the North American regions. Must be passionate about lead acquisition and manage campaigns using thoughtful data decisions, a high amount of attention to detail, fierce organization, and collaborative throughout multiple levels of the organization. You must have a proven track record of creating multi-channel strategies to increase lead acquisition and enhance funnel velocity.

The Sr. Manager of Marketing will be responsible for creating and executing offline, online, and ABM strategies across many channels such as PPC, email, events, webinars and digital. This will include the planning and execution of regional campaigns along with measuring campaign effectiveness and adapting plans to meet lead acquisition goals. You are responsible for achieving the regional marketing budget against goals. This is a critical role that requires someone who loves "doing it all".

Job Responsibilities:


Plan out multi-channel marketing plans with objectives supporting - growth, executive contact creation, pipeline engagement and revenue attribution.
Lead the creation of an industry-leading, account-based marketing programs across multiple regions in North America.
Create and implement plans that include an integrated approach of both online and offline tactics, such as events, digital, email, direct mail with goals, metrics and a timeline for execution.
Nurture contacts within the prioritized named accounts and engage that audience consistently with innovative, unexpected and intentional messaging to drive opportunities within an account.
Execute demand generation campaigns and activities, across multiple channels, that lead to inquiries, leads, opportunities and closed won revenue.
Collaborate with sales and marketing on developing the appropriate metrics to demonstrate the long term success of marketing Programs, including visibility into campaign results, lead generation, opportunity creation, service adoption, pipeline contribution, and ROI of our efforts within the account.
Interface with sales leadership to determine sales enablement needs across many regions within North America
Build and manage a rich enterprise B2B content stream that attracts a qualified audience to our owned properties (including blog posts, videos, whitepapers, ebooks, reports, webinars, infographics, etc.)
Evaluate, select, and manage vendors that contribute to local demand creation programs, including agencies, direct mail providers, and fulfillment services
Establish closed loop reporting with sales and marketing to understand how our inbound marketing activity drives funnel engagement and ultimately turn into closed won opportunities.
Develop marketing mix strategies, across multiple channels and continually refine our activities to convert customers.
Have the potential future opportunity to grow a team of marketers into a lean and efficient demand generation / ABM engine

If you have the following experience, we'd love to hear from you!

Minimum Qualifications:

5+ years driving world-class, measurable, account-based marketing results in the B2B enterprise space (SaaS experience preferred).
3+ years' experience managing inbound marketing programs.

Even Better If You Have:

BA/BS in Marketing or, Business-related field.
Proficiency in marketing automation in order to generate traffic, convert visitors into leads, and then nurture them (using dynamic workflows) into converted customers.
Knowledge of IT Service Management, IT Operations Management (preferred)
Strong Digital Marketing skills and experience, including direct experience with marketing automation technology (Marketo preferred), customer relationship management technology (Salesforce preferred)
Strong experience with Channel Partners, co-marketing, lead sharing, fulfillment, etc.
Relevant direct or indirect experience with SEO, PPC, and Syndicated Content.
Strong Field event skills and experience.
Strong webinar skills and experience.
Project management skills
Agency management
Budget management skills

Why Cherwell?

When experienced people are inspired to come together to change the Service Management industry, the industry takes notice.
We hire humble, but hungry teammates with a passion to give their heart into all that we do for our customers, partners, and community members!
You will work with a team of great people with diverse talents and learn something new every day.
We offer competitive compensation and benefits - including health, 401K with employer matching program, and a generous PTO plan that includes 8 hours for community service

Cherwell Software embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. If you require accessibility assistance applying for open positions, please send an email with your request to Recruiting@Cherwell.com.

If you are a recruiter or placement agency, please do not submit resumes to any person or email address at Cherwell Software prior to having a signed agreement from Cherwell Talent Acquisition. Cherwell is not liable for and will not pay placement fees for candidates submitted by any agency other than its prior-approved recruitment partners. Furthermore, any resumes sent to us without a written signed agreement in place will be considered your company's gift to Cherwell and may be forwarded to our recruiters for their attention. Thank you

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Compuware empowers the world’s largest companies to excel in the digital economy by fully leveraging their high-value mainframe intellectual property. We do this by delivering highly innovative mainframe application development and performance optimization solutions that uniquely enable IT to drive business value. Learn more at www.compuware.com.

The company's ongoing success depends on our employees--a diverse team of people with a set of key, common attributes. We seek positive, assertive team players who have a strong desire to succeed in a team- and customer-oriented environment.

As Product Manager, you will be focused on defining the long-term product roadmap for multiple products within the Compuware family. This extends from increasing the profitability of existing products to developing new products for the company. You will build products from existing ideas, and help to develop new ideas based on your industry experience and your contact with customers and prospects. You must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. You must enjoy spending time in the market to understand their problems, and find innovative solutions for the broader market.

You must be able to communicate with all areas of the company, including executive management, marketing, sales and engineering. You will work to define the go-to-market strategy, the product positioning, key benefits, and target customer. You will also serve as an evangelist for your product offering, working with the sales channel and key customers.

Job Responsibilities:

Managing the entire product line life cycle from strategic planning to tactical activitiesSpecifying market requirements for current and future products by conducting market research supported by on-going visits to customers and non-customers.Driving a solution set across engineering teams via Product Owner role within Agile Scrum framework.Developing and implementing a company-wide go-to-market plan, working with all departments to execute.Analyzing potential partner relationships for the product.


Qualifications:

5+ years of software marketing/product management experience.Knowledgeable in technologyComputer Science or Engineering degree or work experiences a strong plus.


Strong understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC)This position requires travel to customer and non-customer sites in North America and Europe (25%).

Desired:

Solid understanding of the role mainframes play in today's enterprise customer facing applicationsCertified Scrum Product OwnerWell versed in the principles and practices of Marty Cagan’s Inspired: How to Create Products Customers Love.

We offer competitive salary, company-sponsored premium Medical & Dental Plans, company-paid Holidays, Vacation, Personal, Sick Days and a company matching 401(k) Plan. We are an EOE -Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans and VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
What We Need

A smart Product Manager who is analytical, can decompose a customer experience workflow and make recommendations for how to make it better. We also want an Product Manager who shows business acumen and can use logic along with data to make recommendations on how to improve.

Your Area of Focus

Support and work closely with a team of fellow Product Managers on one of Kareos core products to help define and design features that delight our customersPerform customer research studies and analysis, including customer surveys and interviews, conducting competitive analysis, reviewing industry research reports, determining needs of different target segments and presenting findings and recommendations to the Sr. Product ManagerPartner closely with other Kareo functions who are responsible for the customers' experience within sales, onboarding, support, and trainingAnalyze and prepare product usage reports on key Kareo product features, providing insight on what can be improved as input to the product roadmapAnalyze the customer experience and documenting use cases for key product roadmap featuresResearch product positioning and providing recommendations to Product MarketingCollect feedback by studying customer support incidents, administering user tests, and visiting customers to study product interaction in their natural environmentHave fun, because we don't take ourselves too seriously

Your Characteristics

Be Passionately Driven: We take pride in our work, inspire others to excel, and are dedicated to solving tough problems in healthcare. We hold ourselves to the highest standards. And we work with urgency because what we do matters.Dedicated to Customer Success: Helping our customers succeed directs every action we take. Were committed to helping their practices run smoother so their patients can thrive. We are solution-oriented and aligned with their needs.Together Were Better:Great teams are collaborative, selfless, hardworking, and dedicated. We are willing to do what it takes to get the job done so we can accomplish more together.Constant Growth: We strive to have a growth mindset in all we do. We reject the status quo. We take a unique approach and make every effort to bring clarity to a needlessly complex industry. We are creative problem solvers that believe in making things better.

Kareo is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

title: Product Owner
job_description:
Picture yourself contributing to eVestment’s innovative product offerings by working closely with internal and external stakeholders to evaluate needs, discover and develop requirements and execute change through the continuous software development lifecycle.

What it is:
 Conducting analysis, gathering requirements, and documenting user stories for building and deploying eVestment products and services. Maintaining the product backlog of new business features as well as maintenance and support items. Working closely with the Product Manager to translate roadmaps into user stories that are part of a well-groomed backlog. Understanding all aspects of the Agile project lifecycle and Scrum framework. Understanding the business processes, story mapping, documenting detailed business requirements, developing functional designs, conducting gap analysis, etc. that bring the client and project team to a common understanding of the product and how it will satisfy the business need. Building strong relationships among the business and IT teams, assisting the Product Manager in managing customer expectations and translating needs into business solutions. Operating in an agile team environment and ensuring success of the project by taking ownership of deliverables and performing agile project management, testing, support, training, or other tasks. Planning, organizing and facilitating User Acceptance Testing. Serving as a product expert and providing triage and resolution of production defects. Utilizing effective meeting management skills to initiate, develop agenda, conduct, and communicate decisions so that all appropriate parties are aligned and kept up-to-date. Maintaining open and constant communication amongst the team, management, and customers regarding project status and sprint outcomes. Promoting a collaborative working relationship with the team and customers. Coordinating the migration of projects into production.
What it isn’t:

It is not linear, nor is it task focused. If you are most effective in a highly structured setting with well-defined, prescribed steps in sequential order, you are likely to feel frustrated with the highly agile and continuously changing priorities. It isn’t about developing product vision in a silo and pushing your personal vision to reality; if you don’t love the discovery process or place a high priority on learning to love what the stakeholders need, you’ll want to pass on us and find a better fit for your skills.

Requirements
3+ years of experience and successful track record as a Product Owner. Experience in software development, business analysis, and system lifecycle development is a plus. Ideal candidates will have experience in the institutional investment field. Strong analytical & business skills to extract implicit, unstated, and unrecognized requirements. Keen understanding of backlog management practices and experience using various backlog management tools. Cross-functional experience across multiple disciplines including business systems analysis, customer experience management, usability, and scrum project methods. Superior verbal and written communications skills. Strong attention to detail including precise and effective customer communications and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously. Logical understanding of how the system functionality interacts or changes with existing system modules, interfaces, etc. Ability to "think out of the box" and develop creative solutions. Must demonstrate proactive client service skills. Ability to translate complex concepts between business and technical groups. Ability to manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment, with limited supervision. Very detailed-oriented and highly organized. Energetic, shows passion and is invested in the project as well as our business as a whole. Basic understanding of web application and SaaS concepts and associative architectures to be conversant with the development team.
Benefits

eVestment is a leading fintech firm headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia with offices around the world. Our primary goal is to transform the institutional investment industry though data, insights and innovative technologies. Consistently ranked as a top workplace, our environment is fun, smart and energetic. We hire self-motivated people and provide them with exceptional opportunities for development through on-the-job learning and benefits like tuition reimbursement. From robust health coverage to matching 401k and even pet insurance, we understand the critical work-life balance needed for success doesn’t stop inside our walls. Oh, did we mention additional perks like catered lunches every week and regular team-building activities?

If you are interested in joining the team, please submit your resume. We look forward to speaking soon.

title: Plant Safety Manager in Hermiston, OR at Shearer’s Foods
job_description:
Job DescriptionYou already love us – now join the team and be a part of something special!

Shearer’s is a privately held manufacturer of quality salty snack foods, cookies and crackers. Our focus includes both private label and co-manufacturer products, across our network of 12 state-of-the-art non-union plants. As a matter of fact, Shearers is the number one producer of kettle cooked chips in the world!

As the leader in North America, we private label and co-manufacture salty snacks and we are the second largest producer of cookies and crackers. We utilize our manufacturing expertise to serve as a strategic supplier to our partners, who are nationally recognized retail and restaurant brands. So, while you may not be familiar with our name, you likely eat the products we make on a regular basis. We have exceptional competence in supply chain, product development, manufacturing and business development, we continue to realize significant growth in each segment of our business. Headquartered in Massillon, Ohio, we have over 5,000 associates, and we are growing. You can visit our website at www.Shearers.com for more information, select “Manufacturing Careers” to apply online.

 Plant Safety Manager

At Shearer’s, we provide the safest environment possible for our employees by providing proper PPE (Personal Protective Equipment), frequent and thorough sanitation practices, social distancing, daily temperature checks, as well as virtual interviewing options. Safety is our absolute priority.

Your seat at the table!

This role is a part of the senior team at the plant and is accountable for leading a comprehensive safety and wellness process using a proactive approach. Creating a Safety Culture, where our associates’ safety and well-being is always the #1 priority is the primary responsibility for this Safety Leader. This highly energized, on-the-floor leader will engage with associates daily, help lead safety messaging and stretching exercises during shift meetings and work cross-functionally to ensure safety training and compliance is very effective. Creation and implementation of a Safety Strategy for the plant will be required. Sharing key learnings, issues, opportunities and best practices as an active contributor to the Safety Community across the plant network and building relationships with peers and cross-functional partners will be critical to success.

Reporting Structure: This role reports both in to the Plant Site Director and the Director of Safety.

Core Responsibilities:

Lead a caring safety culture that is focused on people Lead processes necessary to ensure a safe working environment – every shift, every day Lead the facility to meet or exceed established corporate safety goals aligned with business needs Lead processes necessary to be compliant with applicable federal, state and local safety requirements and remain current on changing requirements; handle any applicable audits or OSHA visits Lead programs, training and messaging to recognize, reward and promote safe behaviors throughout the facility – catch our associates doing things right. Drive strong accountability with leaders to be role models of safe behaviors. Lead programs to correct unsafe acts and unsafe conditions with the workplace Work collaboratively with the Site Director, HR and Worker’s Compensation/Leave Experts (both in the plant and at the support center) on all decisions related to injuries, leaves, reasonable accommodations/return to work, discipline and leave case management. Strong sense of urgency around communication and proactive approach to issues and concerns. Stay apprised on trends and best practices – both across the network and within the marketplace and the Safety Community Ensure relevant data, compliance records & training, postings, procedures and reporting is complete, accurate and in compliance. Extract insights from our data to identify trends/issues/opportunities and create a plan to address those insights (may be ergonomic, PM issues, training gaps, etc.) Build high performing teams, develop and retain top talent Financial Controls and Budgeting: Responsible for providing leadership and guidance to maintain a safety budget with an emphasis on practical business and financial responsibility

Coaching and Leading others Caring positive approach, influencing and motivating others Whole systems thinking Managing projects and processes

What you bring to the table

Bachelor’s degree in Safety, Operations, Engineering, Business or similar Experience influencing and training large manufacturing teams and management to promote and lead by example a safe work environment and to always remain in compliance with all legal and company safety regulations. Minimum three years related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience Ability to lead others – servant leadership style is the best fit for our culture Knowledge of OSHA, Logout Tagout, Machine Guarding and other State/Federal requirements Ability and willingness to work flexible schedule Experience in working with regulatory agencies Priority setting – able to effectively direct the activities of others including establishing expectations, removing barriers, and managing performance Comfort around leadership – able to influence others without formal authority including comfort with senior leadership Managing peer relationships – able to work collaboratively with others and accomplish objectives Influencing others – able to work effectively through others where there is no reporting relationship Strategic agility – able to think through complex issues and develop solutions that deliver integrated and long-lasting results. Action oriented – high level of energy and able to help others see the goals for safety, health, and environment Approachability– able to present well and establish credibility Drive for results – action oriented and able to produce results utilizing matrixed relationships throughout the organization

We Offer a Feast of Benefits

Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Flexible Spending Account, Retirement Savings Plan with Match, Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability, Tuition Assistance, Adoption Assistance, Scholarships, Leadership Training, Group Critical Accident Insurance, Group Critical Illness Insurance, Employee Assistance Plan and numerous opportunities to volunteer in the communities in which we operate.

You will be considered for employment in our inclusive workplace

Because at Shearer’s, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

This is your invitation to apply now!

Note: Shearer’s does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to any recruiting alias or employee. Shearer’s is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Product Marketing Manager
job_description:
Every day, people around the world use our manufacturing software to build the things that make our lives safer, easier, and more interesting. Although our team is diverse, they’ve got a few things in common – namely, a global perspective and a passion for simplifying how things are made. If that sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.
THE JOB:
You’re a product evangelist. You may not develop the product, but you will learn know how it works and how to sing its praises. What does that look like?

You have an affinity to our products and markets, and you know that developing a comprehensive understanding of our customers’ world is critical to success. You will be bridging the gap between engineering and marketing.
You will become obsessed about promoting the wonderful things we do in a way that resonates with our diverse audience.

As a Product Marketing Manager, you will contribute towards guiding product development and work extensively on helping marketing communications to drive customer satisfaction, revenue growth, and market expansion. You will play an active role in the growth of our company. Reporting to the company’s Direct or Product Marketing, this is a hands-on position that is focused on enabling our sales teams to do their job.
THE SKILLS:

Sales enablement: Contribute towards the creation of marketing content in collaboration with corporate marketing, like sales presentations, solution briefs, product demos, webinars, white papers, case studies, etc.
Product evangelism: Promote the product within the company, the distribution channel, and to the market and end users. The Product Marketing Manager will have the ability to present and demonstrate complex technical concepts.
Market intelligence: Analyze industries, applications, features, competition, and trends. Assess new potential market opportunities and continuously validate existing ones with customer focus groups.
Lead generation: Focus on implementing campaign/programs that consistently generate new, high quality leads for the sales team.
Competitive landscape: Run competitive analysis and share competitive intelligence with the field.
Coordinated collaboration: Effectively communicate with all stakeholders including engineering, marketing and sales staff.
Product strategy: Help define the product roadmap (objectives) in collaboration with software engineering. 

THE TRAVEL:
We have teams and customers across three continents, so you’ll have the opportunity to travel the world up to 25% of the time.
THE NON-NEGOTIABLES:

BS/MS Mechanical Engineering or Manufacturing Engineering
Collaborative and leadership skills
Creative and analytical thinking
Organizational skills
Ability to manage multiple activities and details at one time
5+ years’ work experience in the manufacturing/mechanical engineering field
3+ years’ work experience with CAM (Computer-Aided Manufacturing) software or other manufacturing/engineering simulation software
2+ years of product marketing/product management experience is a plus

We know we’re asking for a lot, but we want to see you succeed. Our product marketing managers work directly with many of our best and brightest – can you keep up?
Our robust benefits include a competitive salary, flexible hours, 401(k) matching, and gym reimbursements. But that’s not all. You’ll also enjoy more intangible benefits, such as autonomy at work (we trust you to do your best, however that looks for you), ongoing skills development across industries, and ample opportunities for experimentation.

title: Project / Program Manager
job_description:
Project / Program Manager


Location



Carlsbad, CA


Internal Req ID

3820


Division



Hospitality & Specialty Communications



Apply Now
PMI: Project / Program Manager

Are you our next PMI-certified Project / Program Manager? If so, you will be leading various aspects of Product Development for new and improving various products within HME’s Hospitality and Specialty Communications division, HSC. As the Project / Program Manager, you will lead technically driven initiatives for a team of software engineers.

Can you lead highly technical projects in a dynamic and fast-paced environment? This includes leading Agile software development initiatives for cross-functional software development teams. If this sounds like you, we look forward to connecting with you!

HSC, HME’s Hospitality & Specialty Communications company, was the first to introduce the wireless drive-thru headset system to the quick-service restaurant industry. We lead the industry in QSR communication and timer system installations worldwide, with more drive-thru communication equipment than all other manufacturers combined.

Our focus on being at the forefront of technology carries over to our commitment to our customers as well as our employees. Our state-of-the-art manufacturing operation is one of only four facilities in the world to receive a 2019 AME Excellence Award presented by the Association for Manufacturing Excellence (AME).

Come write the next chapter in the HME story.

What you will accomplish in this position:

· Plan and execute development projects, from the concept phase to production release

· Lead Scrum ceremonies (Stand-ups, Grooming, Demos, etc.)

· Establish standard tools, templates, metrics, and dashboards to monitor projects with other project managers

· Produce project plans for each approved product development effort

· Establish, maintain and communicate program milestones and timelines

· Monitor program critical path and contingency planning

· Assist management with resource planning

· Utilize scrum methodology and ceremonies in managing projects

· Complete projects within time, cost and performance constraints

· Ensure development teams meet interim and final deliverables

· Prepare and present project status to senior management

· Coordinate efforts of Core Team members

· Provide an open environment that promotes teamwork and removes organizational barriers

What you need to succeed in this position:

· 5+ years in a related field

· BA or BS required (Engineering), MA or MBA preferred

· PMP Certification required

High energy to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment while juggling multiple projects

HME is committed to building an environment where highly talented, challenge-hungry people thrive. We promise, you will learn and grow, and you will see how your contributions matter to our products, our customers, and our employees.


About HME

Five companies. One family name. The HME family of companies is the leading provider of clear, reliable communication solutions for a variety of niche markets; from world-famous restaurant chains to major television networks and global live events to military, aerospace, and government applications - HME products are preferred in 100+ countries.

title: Product Manager, Developer Platform - 20-0254
job_description: We are Relativity. A market-leading, global tech company that equips legal professionals with a powerful platform to organize data, discover the truth, and act on it.  The US Department of Justice, 198 of top 200 US law firms, and more than 70 Fortune 100 companies are among the customers who trust Relativity during litigation, internal investigations, and compliance projects.  Our SaaS product, RelativityOne, has become the fastest-growing product in the company's history and we have consistently been named a great workplace. As we grow, we continue to seek individuals that will bring their whole, authentic self to our team.  Join us in the transformation of the legal industry and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of the practice of law and beyond. We don’t believe in ‘ideal’ candidates, so if you see a job that sparks your interest, go for it. Wherever you’re from, however you identify, and whatever experience you have, you can belong at Relativity. At Relativity we make software to help users organize data, discover the truth, and act on it. Our e-discovery platform is used by more than 13,000 organizations around the world to manage large volumes of data and quickly identify key issues during litigation, internal investigations, and compliance projects. The Product Management team is looking for a Product Manager with background in product lifecycle and agile practices, as well as, strong communication and collaboration skills. You will be responsible for participating and leading both discovery and development to achieve a specific product goal. A successful candidate must be energized by building deep customer empathy, collaborating with design and development, optimizing team processes, and utilizing data to monitor project success.  Focused on Relativity's Developer Platform, you will be responsible for helping create creative solutions to deliver intuitive tools and technology for our passionate community of developers to build innovative applications that solve everyday problems. You will build strong customer relationships to validate our solutions are solving the right problems. You will help lead a team of skilled designers and engineers focused creating exceptional user experiences and actualizing the project goals. Responsibilities:Deeply understands the product. Speaks to our technical implementation in a way that internal stakeholders and clients can understand.Ability to speak to the variety of workflows and end user needs we see across segments and personas and coaches others on how to do the same.Owns product roadmap and backlog for their product(s).Works directly with Product Leads to help build a strategy and goals for their product(s).Develops and shares plans and results clearly to immediate teams.Ensure what we build solves the customer or business problem and delivers a product that is stable in production and satisfies scalability, reliability, performance and business goals. Organize and engage in usability testing to define detailed Interaction flows. Meet with users and stakeholders to obtain deep understanding of detailed needs and constraints.Anticipates the need to bring cross-functional teams together to solve problems. Provides recommendations rooted in customer empathy. Responsible for user and competitive research for their product(s) Self-directed analysis and data interpretation.Tracks and reports on product metrics. Develops external and internal facing go-to-market content Ability to break down large projects into iterative releases Translate validated designs and analysis into story cards with acceptance criteria.Ability to prioritize work based on impact.Test new features to ensure quality for release Manage defect prioritization Understands technical requirements for completion of new initiatives and ensures development team is set up for success.Operates as an indirect leader, facilitating communication across internal stakeholders and effectively communicate ‘why’ and gain buy in. Also responsible for driving conflict resolution amongst product development stakeholders.Provides direct feedback to peers and is skilled at understanding multiple points of view.Preferred Qualifications:Generates excitement and curiosity when working with highly complex systems.Is a team player with proven ability to deliver features from inception to delivery.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Detail-oriented, enthusiastic self-starter with ability to work both independently and in a team environment. Strong project manager able to handle multiple projects simultaneously.Strong facilitation and analysis skills. Strong business acumen.Minimum Qualifications:5+ years of experience in product management at a technology company.Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, or Design or comparable work experience. Solid understanding of software development lifecycle and agile methodologies.Knowledge and experience doing discovery & usability testing to gather customer feedback.#LI-EH1At Relativity, we live our core values and we thrive on solving complex problems. We’re dedicated to continually improving our product and providing relentless customer service, and we’re always looking for people to join us on the journey.  Relativity is a team of smart, passionate people always looking to grow, contribute, and make our product and customer service the best it can be. Our team members come from diverse backgrounds with different skills and life experiences—and we love and celebrate those differences. We believe that employees are happiest when they’re empowered to be their full, authentic selves, regardless how you identify.  So, please come as you are. We can’t wait to meet you.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

title: Senior Product Manager, Talent Lifecycle
job_description:
Upwork ($UPWK) is the leading tech solution for companies looking to hire the best talent, maintain flexibility, and get more done. We're passionate about our mission to create economic opportunities so people have better lives. Every year, more than $2 billion of work is done through Upwork by skilled professionals who want the freedom of working anytime, anywhere. Top companies connecting with extraordinary talent around the globe? Upwork is how.

The Application Platform Management team is charged with delivering enterprise grade tools & platform services that enable marketplace experiences for accounts of all sizes.

We do this through a combination of automated processes and by delivering tools that enable agent investigations. We are looking for a user-focused product expert to design and help build the back office systems that our agents, and others across Upwork, rely on. These systems facilitate exceptional customer experiences and provide the basis for further automation and business scale. You'll partner closely with Engineering, Operations teams, Analytics and other cross-functional partners to build a foundation for operational excellence and superb customer experience.

Your Responsibilities:

Develop nuanced insights into what is needed for agents to serve and protect Upwork customers
Define a bold vision and strategy for building the back office systems our agents use
Align key stakeholders in Product and Engineering around an ambitious systems roadmap
Execute and deliver quality systems that take our customer experience and protections up a level
Ensure our agents have the tools to label data so our Engineers can build and refine our models

What it takes to catch our eye:

At least 2 years of experience in product management,engineering, or technology consulting
Prior experience designing and/or building internal tools for operations teams in any industry
Success in running complex and multi-faceted programs from conception to completion
An obsession for generating great results with scarce resources
Willingness to roll up your sleeves to ensure deadlines are met and solutions are executed

How to really knock our socks off:

Experience in designing, implementing and testing technology-enabled operations processes
Proven track record of identifying and developing solutions to improve customer experiences
Excellent communication skills, with the proven ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders across a variety of functional areas.
Ability to thrive in fast-paced environments where you manage priorities across multiple simultaneous projects


Come change how the world works.

At Upwork, you'll shape talent solutions for how the world works today. Whether you're working from our offices in San Francisco, Santa Clara, and Chicago or are part of our globally distributed team, we're working together to create exciting remote work opportunities for a global community of professionals. Our vibrant culture is built on a common mission and shared values. As we create economic opportunities so that people have better lives, our employees build amazing teams, put our community first and have a bias towards action. We encourage team Upwork to bring their whole selves to work through learning and development opportunities, mentorship, and employee resource groups. All that and amazing benefits too? We've got you covered (especially with our company favorite, Work Online Wednesdays). Check out our Life at Upwork page to learn more about the employee experience.

Upwork is proudly committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse and inclusive workforce. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we never discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
 #LI-JS1

title: Compliance and Information Security Manager
job_description:
Who You Are
As our Compliance and Information Security Manager, you will be a key member of the Global Compliance and Information Security team who is responsible for C Space's global compliance, privacy, and information security. You will collaborate closely with Senior Management, Sales, Technology, Product teams and other internal and external stakeholders.

What You'll Do

Be an advocate for all company compliance and security related issues, including the planning and development of the compliance, privacy and information security strategy and plans and their effectiveness, in support of the company's mission and strategic plan
Work with key business and IT leaders to develop policies, standards, guidelines, and procedures to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability (CIA) of the company's systems and data
Provide leadership and direction during incident response, investigations, and reporting
Maintain and implement risk management programs and strategies and conduct internal risk assessments to validate compliance and manage risk assessment of current and new technologies and processes and implement strategies to mitigate prioritized risks
Manage external compliance, privacy, and security, assessments and audits and coordinate with the appropriate entities or authorities
Review contracts and assist in relevant compliance, privacy, and security negotiation during contracting phase
Build and maintain relationship with client contacts including drug safety and quality departments
Manage and help nurture a growing team

Desired Skills and Experience

Minimum of 3+ experience in a risk management, information security, privacy, and/or compliance role
Experience in developing, reviewing, and implementing relevant policies and procedures and programs that meet compliance, privacy, and security requirements
CISA Certification
Knowledge and understanding of relevant regulations and standards such as GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA, SOX, MA 201 CMR 17, ISO/IEC 27001/2 and NIST, and sound knowledge of information security management systems (ISMS)
Knowledge of information security processes such as Change Management, SDLC, DRP, BCP, and IRP and experience in managing compliance, privacy incidents and participating in Security Incident Response Team (SIRT) activation in the course of a rapidly evolving incident is a plus
Excellent analytical skills and demonstrated experience in communicating effectively in written and spoken form to broad internal and external entities
Keen ability to manage multiple projects under strict timelines, with exceptional attention to detail
Self-starter and able to work both independently and in a team setting
Maintain a positive attitude, strong work ethic and a focus on creative problem-solving
Superior management skills
Proficient in MS Office, with emphasis on Outlook, Word and Excel required

There's no such thing as a typical C Spacer. What C Spacers thrive on is a growth mindset. We're a growing, always-changing business, often reinventing ourselves to keep pace with the fast-changing world of our clients. So we're looking for people who are excited about change and who challenge the status quo. We need people who share our passion for the role customers can play in solving business problems - people who want to disrupt the way things traditionally have been done.

We're focused on building a learning culture where it's safe to experiment, take risks and do things differently. That means we need people who aren't afraid to speak up and share an alternative perspective yet are humble and self-aware enough to admit they don't know everything. Collaborators, self-starters, creative problem-solvers.

We're always challenging ourselves to be better, more human, more impactful. 20 years since launch, we still think of our business as a 'work in progress' where we're focused on getting better every day. If you share that philosophy when you think about your own personal development, we might be a good match.

About C Space

Our clients call us their customer agency.

Our mission is to make business more human. We create rapid insight and business change, putting customers at the heart of companies and solving problems from the customer's perspective. We keep our clients relevant by building real, ongoing relationships with customers that in turn help them deliver superior experiences, launch successful products and build loyalty. Our customized approaches are tailored to specific business needs and include online insight communities, immersive storytelling, data and analytics, activation events, innovation projects and business consulting. We do this for many of the world's best-known brands – like Bose, Walmart, Jaguar Land Rover, Mars, Samsung, IKEA and more – to create "Customer Inspired Growth".

We are passionate about our people and proud of our culture. We co-created a set of values to ensure that we are delivering fantastic work, continuing to learn and developing and building a high-performance culture which creates opportunities for those who work here:


I've got this: taking responsibility, doing what we say we will
Only accept awesome: delivering high quality work that we are proud of and has impact
Show the love: celebrating successes and ensuring everyone has a voice
Do what scares you: challenging ourselves, taking risks and learning more
Tell it like it is: being honest and freeing ourselves from "office politics" and "hidden agendas"
Open up and listen: listening first and fully before we respond or react
Find what fascinates: being passionate about the world and our clients' worlds
We before me: putting the team first
Leave your mark: everyone has an opportunity drive change in our business and for our clients

Interested? We look forward to receiving applications from people with diverse backgrounds – talented, creative people with their own voice, ideas and perspectives.

To learn more, visit www.cspace.com or follow us on Twitter @CSpaceGlobal and Instagram @c_spaceglobal. C Space is a part of DDB, a division of Omnicom Group Inc.

Headquartered in Boston, C Space also has offices in New York, San Francisco and London.

C Space is proud to be an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment at C Space without regard to race; creed; color; religion; national origin; sex; age; disability; sexual orientation; gender identity or expression; genetic predisposition or carrier status; veteran, marital, or citizenship status; or any other status protected by law.
