title: Senior Product Manager – Public Cloud
job_description:
At Acxiom, a successful Senior Product Manager for Public Cloud develops and delivers the product strategy for our public cloud platform standards. You will work with people in IT, Security, and Engineering to design automation and features for our environments.

You will collect business requirements, plan budgets, and align against strategic initiatives. You will drive operational improvements across cloud implementations.

You will communicate roadmaps and status to the team. You will guide and mentor others on how to deliver products and services.What you will do:

Develop and contribute to product strategyWork with partners and consumers to design and validate product featuresCommunicate product roadmap and statusLead Agile ceremonies and set priorities for engineering teamsUnderstand and help evolve product design, architecture, technology, and featuresPossess a sound understanding of Acxiom functional objectivesEnsure that all capabilities delivered align with original business goalsCollaborate with other product managers, engineers and architectsClosely partner with information security to ensure security compliance

What you will need:

6+ years product management experience2+ years engineering experience2+ years AWS experience2+ years Agile experienceProduction Service OwnershipCurrent AWS Solutions Architect Associate certificationBachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar field

What will set you apart:

Current AWS Solutions Architect Professional, Developer, Security certificationsAWS Security Hub, GuardDuty, Inspector, Config experienceStrong agile perspective and experience around story creation, estimation, prioritization, grooming, testing, and acceptingExperience working with large teams / running large product platforms across teamsDelivering Log, Streaming, and Event PlatformsExperience crafting and delivering IaaS, PaaS, or SaaS productsExperience building products within Automation and DevOps culturesExperience with additional Cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure)Multi-cloud, Systems, and Networking integration projectsExperience with distributed systems (Hadoop, Kafka, Elasticsearch)Foundational understanding of ITIL and associated processesExperience designing, developing, testing complex software solutions to support distributed, scalable and highly available applications

We believe in building an awesome workplace where associates feel engaged and want to come to work every single day. It’s important to Acxiom that we invest in our culture and promote a healthy work-life balance, even when our associates are at work.

As a part of our team, you will join a fast-moving, dynamic, “get stuff done” culture we empower our people to do their jobs. You will always be guided to do what’s right, legally and morally for our customers. At Acxiom, we believe in exceptionalism- we intend to be the absolute best in everything we do.

title: Marketing Project Manager
job_description:
Overview:

UNIFY Financial Credit Union is one of the nations largest 100 credit unions with a reputation for being financially sound and growth-oriented. Were expanding rapidly to meet the needs of a growing member base. At UNIFY, our team members work together to strive toward a common goal, providing superior service to our members. In doing so, we promote a culture where your ideas matter, your growth matters, and you matter. We encourage all team members to challenge and encourage themselves and their teammates to work smarter and to be more successful

Summary:

Leads, manages and executes marketing projects and integrated campaigns from conception through completion: leads the strategy, development and implementation of marketing campaigns and promotional efforts to drive membership engagement and growth to meet established marketing objectives for the Credit Union. Oversees and handles projects independently, working with various vendors, agencies and internal teams within budget.

Responsibilities:

Maintain full project ownership while managing the successful execution of marketing projects as assigned, including but not limited to, involving senior staff and engaging appropriate areas/individuals, addressing the impact on all areas throughout the process, ensuring the final outcome(s) meet the needs of the organization/department and the objectives of the project, while keeping Management well informed and knowledgeable throughout the process.
Leads and creates effective marketing plans and project briefs to outline the objective goals, specifications, timeline and budget for each project.
Uses internal and external resources to gather information before executing projects. Drives projects engaging appropriate stakeholders while considering operational processes and risk management.
Communicates project details, through written and oral communication, to all stakeholders and to the organization, in order to ensure that the various areas are prepared, and that there is the opportunity to provide input.
Guides in-house creative team and manages outside vendors closely to ensure that the work and distribution of promotional materials are on schedule, compliant with the Credit Union standards, and within budget. Collaborates with Team members to find new streamlined solutions for greater efficiency.
Utilizes measurement systems for marketing programs to monitor and evaluate the programs effectiveness toward reaching the goals of the promotions, as well as, the Credit Union goals and objectives. If goals are not being met, provides additional recommendations to increase success.
Ensures that all work meets established Brand Style Guide standards for appearance, quality and content, with 100% accuracy.
Ensures that appropriate and accurate corporate disclosures and standards are included in every promotional piece, in keeping with compliance requirements.
Ensure delegation that all advertising and promotional pieces are sent to the in-house Proofing Team and other appropriate managers or departments, for approval prior to sign-off.
Maintains full compliance with UNIFY Financial Credit Union policies, procedures, and service standards; and with the Bank Secrecy Act.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

Bachelors degree with emphasis in Marketing, Public Relations, Communications or Advertising.
Minimum of 5 years relevant experience.
Preferably 2-3 years experience with a financial institution.
A solid understanding of project management, marketing principles and activities, strategic positioning, and product development.
Excellent planning, communication and problem-solving skills.
Must be a team player and willing to foster collaboration within the Marketing department and across the organization.
Exceptional interpersonal, written communications and verbal skills and the ability to interface with all levels of team members across the organization.
Must be very detail oriented, able to work in a fast-paced environment and handle the varied details of multiple projects, on time and within budget.
Proficiency in Word, Excel and PowerPoint.

See the UNIFY Difference!

At UNIFY, we believe that each team member is a valued contributor. Through a teamwork approach, we strive to provide a positive and rewarding workplace that helps our team succeed. UNIFY provides a work environment which promotes learning, growth, and the opportunity for team members to challenge themselves.

Competitive Compensation and Excellent Benefits Package* Includes:

Medical (PPO/HMO), Prescription, Dental (PPO/DMO), Vision, Life, and Short- and Long-Term Disability Insurance

Dependent and Medical Care - Flexible Spending Accounts

Vacation, Sick, Personal and Holiday Pay

401(K) Plan with employer match

Education reimbursement for approved programs

UNIFY banking privileges for you and your family



All programs subject to review and change

UNIFY is proud to be a drug-free, equal-opportunity employer including disability/vets. For more information on UNIFY, visit us at www.unifyfcu.com

title: FSQA Compliance Manager - Corporate
job_description:
Company DescriptionFoster Farms has been a family-owned and operated company for four generations. Since our founding days back in 1939, we have always been committed to providing consumers with the highest-quality, best-tasting poultry products available. The hope is that our commitment to excellence, honesty, quality, service, and our people will shine through in everything we do.

We are always looking for talented individuals to join the Foster Farms team. We offer the experience of a large organization, but operate like a family business. More than half of our job openings are filled by internal promotion, and we encourage employees to gain a variety of experiences across different functional groups.Job DescriptionPurpose of Position:

The Corporate FSQA Manager is a key leadership position that spans responsibility for overseeing Supplier and Co-Packer food safety and quality, auditing internal and external food manufacturing sites to measure compliance with FF policies and programs, identifying the key risk attributes for each manufacturing site and working with local operations and QC managers on initiatives for reducing risk, as well as overseeing implementation and maintenance of all FSQA data systems (e.g. – SAP/Q.M., LIMS, SSS). This individual is responsible for providing FSQA data systems leadership, support, and training to the manufacturing facilities and executive team by identifying key opportunities and reporting systems to improve food safety, product quality and regulatory compliance. This includes managing customer and consumer complaints, leading IT systems implementation, and managing the use of current technologies throughout the facilities. The manager is responsible for the analysis and reporting of key FSQA metrics to other departments and the executive team. This individual is also responsible for the development, implementation and maintenance of corporate FSQA programs (e.g. procedures, training material). This individual will have a vital role in the development and successful implementation of an internal FSQA compliance program, and the supplier risk reduction program that includes the approval and on-going management of the Company’s supply chain and co-manufacturers/co-packers.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Manage the FSQA supplier and co-packer program that outlines the approval criteria for suppliers, materials, risk assessment matrix, on-going management of supplier performance, and supplier/co-packer audit requirements to reduce risk.

Provide technical food safety and quality support during the innovation/development of products. Direct involvement with internal and external resources during product launching at co-packer facilities.

Develop an internal FSQA compliance program that includes implementation and verification of standardized corporate programs all processing facilities, routine gap analysis audits and BRC internal audits.

Maintain corporate programs relevant, up to date and easily accessible by the processing plants. Function as the gatekeeper for third party audit and customer audit certifications. Verify compliance of programs/procedures against third party audit standards, including GFSI audit scheme, and customer requirements.

Responsible for the overall management of consumer and customer complaint system. Ability to analyze complaint data using statistical tools to identify emerging trends. Drive continuous process improvements for the consumer contact center and customer complaint handling process. Effective communication of key data to a diverse audience such as processing facilities, Marketing, Sales, R&D and the Executive team.

Serve as the business lead and liaison for the development, enhancement, implementation and development of all IT related FSQA projects. Responsible for the implementation and consistent utilization of FSQA IT systems all processing facilities.

Key contributor during Crisis Management.

Special projects or assignments are specified by ManagerQualificationsRequirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Food Science, Food Safety, Meat Science or related field with at least 5 years of experience. Preferred MBA or MS in Food Science, Food Safety, Meat Science or related field.

Understanding of Process capability and the application of Process control/Quality control within those processes. Six Sigma Green or Black belt certification is preferred.

Management and facilitation of cross-functional teams.

Strong aptitude for data analysis and information reporting.

Ability to communicate to all members of the organization and the ability to create standardized methods and approaches for project management processes. Advise executive teams on progress, problem-solving, solution development, identification and measurement of performance targets, plan development and data analysis

Prior department management experience is preferred.

Problem solving skills and team management skills.

Ability to independently manage projects and ensure follow-up and completion.

Possess good interpersonal skills and good oral and written communication skills.

Technical knowledge of food quality/safety procedures and programs, regulatory requirements, microbial hazards, HACCP program development, microbiological laboratory procedures, sanitation procedures and plant operations.

Working knowledge of GFSI certification standards

Functions at an autonomous level with minimal supervision.

Travel approximately 30% of the timeAdditional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Foster Farms is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minorities, Females, Veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

Foster Farms participates in E-Verify during the hire process at all locations for all new employees.

title: Product Manager, US HCP Marketing Hematology
job_description:
Apellis is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company focused on the development of novel therapeutic compounds to treat disease through the inhibition of the complement system, which is an integral component of the immune system, at the level of C3, the central protein in the complement cascade.

We believe that our lead product candidate, APL-2, has the potential to be a first-in-class treatment targeting C3 that may address the limitations of existing treatment options or provide a treatment option where there currently is none. APL-2 has already shown activity that we believe is clinically meaningful in clinical trials for two distinct medical conditions—geographic atrophy in age-related macular degeneration (GA) and paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH). We plan to conduct additional clinical trials in GA, PNH, autoimmune hemolytic anemia (AIHA) and complement-dependent nephropathies.

Position: Product Manager, US HCP Marketing – Hematology

Reports to: Director, US Brand Lead - PNH

Location: Waltham, MA

Position Summary:

Apellis is seeking a passionate and talented marketer for the role of Product Manager, US HCP Marketing - Hematology. It is an outstanding opportunity to make a significant impact for HCPs and the company, executing the US HCP marketing initiatives for the first commercial launch for Apellis.

The US HCP Marketing Product Manager will be responsible for executing the HCP strategy in the US, pulling through the Global campaign and regionalizing the creative and messaging for HCPs. This role requires cross functional leadership across multiple internal functional areas to develop and execute the operational plan and tactics. This role will report to the Director, US Brand Lead - PNH.

Key Responsibilities Include:

Development of personal and non-personal tactics, including but not limited to sales force resources, peer to peer programming content, HCP congress activities, digital resources (e.g. websites, email campaigns), and media executionExecuting the vision and plan for HCP marketing in the US for both market shaping and the launch of APL-2 in PNH. Manage agencies in the execution of that planDeveloping field execution strategy for HCP-facing initiatives in partnership with sales training and sales leadershipDeveloping a multi-channel/digital strategy and measurement planSupporting POA strategy and executionEfficiently and thoughtfully administering the HCP marketing budgetWorking closely with regualtory, legal, and compliance to build policies and procedures related to HCP marketing, including speaker bureaus and advisory boards

Education, Registration & Certification:

Bachelor's degree requiredMBA or other advanced degree is a plus

Experience:

3+ years of biotech/pharma experience, predominantly in marketing roles of increasing scope and responsibilityExperience in US launches and rare diseases is preferredExperience in sales or customer-facing roles is a plus

Skills, Knowledge & Abilities:

Passion for understanding and championing the needs of people treating rare diseases, translating them into market-moving insightsExperience translating global brand strategy into affiliate HCP marketing execution, with depth in both personal and multi-channel marketingAbility to navigate and be successful in a fast-paced, results-driven environment, managing through ambiguityCommitment to collaboration and engagement, with a history of success leading in a matrix environment and with agency partnersAn entrepreneurial spirit coupled with the drive to embrace innovation and develop creative but well-reasoned solutions to business challengesMotivation to be a part of envisioning and building the infrastructure, systems, and tactics to ensure launch successDemonstrated integrity on the job, including an understanding of relevant rules and regulationsStrong communication skills with the ability to influence across functions and varying levels of the organization Willing to travel domestically up to 30% of the time and attend events outside of business hours (e.g., occasional weekends and evenings)

Benefits And Perks

Apellis offers a great benefit package which includes: health insurance with full premium coverage, 401K with company match, paid time off (PTO), long- term disability insurance, life insurance and more! Visit http://apellis.com/careerbenefits.html to learn more.

EEO Statement

Apellis is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state and local fair employment practices laws. Apellis strictly prohibits and does not tolerate discrimination against employees, applicants or any other covered persons because of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, sex (including pregnancy), gender (including gender nonconformity and status as a transgender or transsexual individual), age, physical or mental disability, citizenship, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, genetic information, marital status, AIDS/HIV status, smoker/nonsmoker, and occupational pneumocononiosis or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state or local law.

title: Senior Business Analyst
job_description:
FCCI is proud to be recognized as a top-notch employer by Business Insurance magazine, Florida Trend magazine and others. We encourage you to consider FCCI Insurance Group as your next employer of choice. FCCI is a highly collaborative environment that values its customer and our employees. We are committed to growing our teammates skills and careers. If you share our commitment to excellent service and continuous improvement, we want to hear from you.

The Senior Business Analyst will be responsible for creating/documenting, tracing, maintaining, prioritizing, and accessing changes to the requirements. This role utilizes significant Business Analysis experience across the full project lifecycle (planning, requirements, design, development, testing and deployment) to ensure requirements are understood and validated by stakeholders and adhere to the review and approval procedures defined by FCCI IT SDLC process. In addition, the Senior Business Analyst will work closely with key decision makers, systems owners and end users in support of core processes and critical business objectives. This position will be based out of our Sarasota, Florida corporate office in the Lakewood Ranch area.

In exchange for your talents, FCCI offers competitive salaries and an excellent benefits package, including profit sharing and bonus potential, along with an on-site café' and fitness center.

 * Minimum of four years in the capacity of a Business Analyst with at least two years having led medium to large complex projects * Minimum of two years working in the commercial insurance industry with solid working knowledge of commercial insurance terminology and general policy workflows preferred* Experience implementing COTS applications* Experience on various types of projects (e.g., legacy migration/system replacement, system enhancements, reporting projects)* Experience with UAT and testing* Understanding of relational databases* Experience with SQL, enough to run queries and profile data* Experience with requirements modelling \u0026 management tools (e.g., UML, Visio, Lucidchart, ALM)* Ability to effective communicate (verbal and written) to various stakeholders, at all levels of the organization* Excellent documentation / technical writing skills * Adhere to IT Process and Standards, as well as BA guidelines and best practices.  * Solid working knowledge of the IIBA’s BABOK industry best practices * Advanced ability to elicit information from business partners and other interfacing application groups to understand current processing as well as new / enhanced requirements for future processing * Experience in current state and future state business process modeling is preferred * Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills * Strong analytical capabilities as well as strong problem solving skills * Strong working knowledge of Information Technology concepts, strategies and methodologies * Solid understanding of information systems, business operations, and processes to analyze business requirements * Must be a self-starter with ability to work across multiple teams; work independently or as part of a group with strong conflict resolution and problem solving skills * Experience using various requirements elicitation methods (brainstorming, interviews, workshop facilitation, etc) Experience in analyzing, validating, and managing requirements to ensure requirements meet business needs and are consumable by various stakeholders in Business and IT * Experience in defining various Requirements Types (i.e., Business, System, Integration, Data, Reporting), using various techniques (Business Process \u0026 Capability Models, Business Rules, Use Cases, Sequence Diagram, Wireframes) * Proficient in data modeling, data dictionary, data mapping (source to target; transformation rules) * Experience working in complex integration and data centric environment

title: Technical Product Manager, SDK
job_description:
Alteryx, Inc. is looking for a Technical Product Manager to help drive the execution efforts for our extensibility initiatives. The SDK teams are focused on creating a cohesive and easy-to-use suite of SDKs that will help developers extend and expand upon the Alteryx platform. This role, as part of the Product Management organization, will focus on translating the business value of product initiatives into functional features and will work day-to-day with the SDK development teams to deliver business value, as well as guiding others on how development initiatives fit into the holistic product vision.

Responsibilities:

Work with development teams to organize and manage large scope projects from initial design concept phase through life cycle of products.Understand and help to communicate the business value of product initiatives; collaborate with Product Managers to kick off initiatives with development teams and facilitate the process to break those initiatives into feature and user story-level requirements.Collaborate with development team leaders to drive the planning process.Ensure development efforts will meet the business requirements and timelines of the project, with a focus on quality and timely delivery of scheduled features; decision-maker for user-facing functionality.Participate in development team ceremonies including stand ups, story refinements and team retrospectives, to align the team towards a successful delivery cycle.Responsible for feature and user story acceptance on one or more development teams, where features or stories have customer-facing value.Primary point of contact for inward-facing stakeholders (i.e. development, QA, UX, technical writing and all supporting teams) regarding the value of development initiatives and relationship to product vision.Collaborates with Product Managers to understand SDK developer goals and help prioritize initiatives supporting those goalsIdentify, manage and communicate initiative and feature risks and dependencies across multiple teamsCollaborate with Product Managers to review and respond to feedback via the Alteryx Beta ProgramCollaborate with QA and Customer Support teams to prioritize resolution of customer issues related to SDK functionalityApproves QA test plans for customer-facing requirementsMonitors and manages successful delivery of features defined in the product roadmap with respective teams throughout the development life cycle; works to identify risks and remove impediments; discovers opportunities for improvement and keeps senior management and others informed

Requirements:

3+ years of experience as a Technical Product/Program ManagementFamiliarity with building products in the enterprise software industryDetail oriented with critical thinking skills - ability to break down initiative-level requirements into feature and story attribute level detailsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsProject management skills; problem solving skills; strategic thinking and business acumen with ability to build strong working relationships across organizational teams in a fast paced and changing environmentEffective documentation skills with ability to articulate technical informationExcellent teamwork skills, ability to manage, interpret and influence cross functional teamsPreferred: Experience with SDKs and APIsExperience with C++ or Python a plus

Perks:

100% company-paid medical, dental, and vision for associatesHealth plans that cover your family and petsCompany matched 401(k)Associate stock purchase planPaid time off: 3 weeks’ vacation, 5 sick days, 9 holidays, 3 floating holidays, and 20 hours volunteer time100% paid parental leaveTuition reimbursementWellness programs with up to $300 fitness reimbursement annuallyCollaborative offices stocked with healthy snacks and drinksOffice events, catered lunches, and happy hours

title: Technical Product Manager - 5G Networks
job_description: Pivotal Commware develops 5G communications platforms, systems and applications based on Holographic Beam Forming® , a patented breakthrough in electromagnetic physics. HBF allows Pivotal to create software-defined antennas that can harness, shape and direct radio waves with order-of magnitude advantages over legacy beamforming systems in cost, size, weight and power consumption (C-SWaP). HBF enables mobile network operators to maximize capacity, coverage and throughput on demand and is recognized as an essential element in the 5G ecosystem. 5G leadership is pivotal to the US economy, and 5G is Pivotal™.Pivotal Commware is seeking a Technical Product Manager to define and drive product and platform strategy for product line development, product promotion and product life cycle. This role will be responsible for introducing and developing new product line(s) while working closely with a small group of scientists, engineers and business leaders in a start-up environment.  We are looking for someone with previous experience introducing wireless network centric products into the market. In addition, the candidate should be skilled in project planning, budget and schedule management, written and verbal communication. The successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to think creatively and to operate within a flexible, rapid development program dedicated to expanding Pivotal’s market and mindshare.  Responsibilities: • Introduce and manage RF product line in multiple business markets including product and platform strategy and definition, product line extension, NPI, market analysis, customer engagement, forecasting, sales enablement, product promotion and product life cycle• Manage full product release from product concept to market release including technical requirement definition, project trade-off decisions, function and feature definition, value-based pricing strategy and marketing release processes• Drive definition and internal and external communication of product line strategy as well as product exploration R&D in target business markets• Enable sales, providing both technical and relationship management to facilitate customer success through customer visits • Conduct mutually beneficial customer technical engagement programs, creating greater market insights for future product development decisions • Head cross-functional team communication and development of new strategic plans for targeted corporate initiatives• Create and deliver sales enablement collateral including in-person product training, product demonstrations, instructional videos, customer facing presentations and technical learning material Required Qualifications: • Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or related technical field• 10+ years of experience with wireless / RF products as a Technical Product Manager, Product Marketing Manager, RF Engineer, Electrical Engineer or related title• 5+ years of experience as a Systems Engineer or related technical role• Solid understanding of product lifecycle management stages and processes with the ability to craft, hone and manage how the company handles the product management function• Ability to understand and relay technical information to customers, engineering teams and marketing colleagues• Excellent interpersonal and verbal and written communications skills to interact with customers and internal teams• Strong leadership skills to be able to influence others and drive consensus of conflicting priorities• Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment• Proficient in presenting to various business audiences as needed Desired Qualifications: • Master’s degree and/or MBA• 15 years of experience with wireless/RF products as a Technical Product Manager, Product Marketing Manager, RF Engineer, Electrical Engineer or related title• Hands on bench experience in RF and antenna design, applications or manufacturing• Experience working with major wireless mobile network operators

title: Controlled Substance Surveillance Program Manager (PharmD), Material Resources - FT/Days (8hr)
job_description:
At

MemorialCare Health System, we believe in providing extraordinary healthcare to

our communities and an exceptional working environment for our employees.

Memorial Care stands for excellence in Healthcare. Across our family of

medical centers, we support each one of our bright, talented employees in

reaching the highest levels of professional development, contribution,

collaboration and accountability. Whatever your role and whatever

expertise you bring, we are dedicated to helping you achieve your full

potential in an environment of respect, innovation and teamwork.



Position Summary

The

Controlled Substance Surveillance Program Manager is responsible for the

oversight of controlled substance monitoring plan across all MemorialCare sites

where controlled substances are procured, stored, dispensed, used and disposed

of, facilitating implementation of consistent pharmacy controls, compliant

facility standards, uniform processes and enhanced monitoring capabilities

across all campuses. Working with key campus stakeholders, this position will

develop and conduct routine surveillance, investigation, and program

development plan and activities. Such duties include conducting daily/monthly

audits, reviews and investigations related to diversion and required audits to

ensure compliance with policies and procedures.

The

Manager must take a leadership role in planning, organizing, directing, and

monitoring the use and control of controlled drug substances within the system

and overseeing all areas of regulatory compliance in conjunction and

coordination with the appropriate Pharmacist-in-Charge at each of the licensed

locations where these substances are used.

This

position requires expertise in all policies and procedures dealing with the

handling of controlled substances, State and Federal laws and regulations

covering these agents, and a strong understanding of all systems used to order,

document use, document waste and inventory of these agents. Knowledge and

understanding of IA systems used in identifying potential diversion as well as

data analysis is critical.

The

position also requires the ability to lead and execute special projects and

assist with other duties as directed to meet departmental needs.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities

of the Job

Develop,

enhance and maintain a formal diversion detection program for all MemorialCare

where controlled substances are procured, stored, dispensed, and wasted.Create

a system-wide and where appropriate a Diversion Response Team, and a Diversion

Oversight Committee.Develop

and implement sustained and consistent approach to diversion prevention,

detection, and response, by ensuring that expectations for controlled substance

handling and diversion prevention, detection, and response are defined in policy.Conduct

diversion risk rounds regularly to identify and reduce noncompliance and

diversion risk in high-risk areas (e.g. anesthesia, travelers, temporary agency

employees with access to these substances).Develop

a diversion education program for all staff including non-clinical, clinical,

administration and medical staff.Define

and enhance its proactive diversion surveillance program to include auditing

parameters for controlled substance handling by nursing, pharmacy, and

anesthesia. Standardize assessment tools, monitoring solutions, development of

risk metrics/dashboards and other tools to support early and proactive

detection of risk and avoidance of repeat compliance failures.Working

with key stakeholders at each campus, establish an effective program for

tracking noncompliance in controlled substance handling and implementing

progressive discipline for staff at each facility, as appropriate.Increase

transparency about drug diversion across each campus.Serves

as a subject matter expert with respect to medication diversion prevention

polices and requirements as it pertains to state and federal regulations.Ensures

that policies and procedures are developed, implemented, and updated according

to organizational, state, and federal requirements and guidelines.Works

closely with local Pharmacist-in-Charge who hold respective DEA and State

licenses to ensure that policies and procedures meet all legal and regulatory

requirements.Collaborates

with information technology (IT) and decision support resources in assisting

sites, departments, service lines and individuals in the identification of

information or data needs to support 340B activities.Acts

as a facilitator and a change agent to establish and maintain an effective drug

diversion education program for all key stakeholders. Provides leadership and

actively participates in multidisciplinary education activities relating to

drug diversion, impairment, and controlled substance and diversion resource for

all staff, system wide.Provides

ongoing training, education, and communications required to key stakeholders

(pharmacy, nursing, medical staff, and leadership) on the handling of

controlled substances.Regularly

communicates with stakeholders on critical issues or suspected diversion.Ensures

that the controlled substances process is continuously compliant with Federal

and State regulations.Keeps

abreast of trends and issues pertaining to illicit controlled drug diversion.Maintains

current knowledge of relevant DEA, FDA, CDPH, Board of Pharmacy, the Joint

Commission, and EPA regulations related to controlled substance management and

diversion activities.Serves

as the point person and coordinator for all audits and inspections both routine

and for suspected diversion. Assists during investigations of suspected

diversion events by collecting relevant data and reports, and by collaborating

with nursing and pharmacy leadership.Collect

and track institution and system wide diversion related data, including but not

limited to, medication handling and security issues, concerns about healthcare

provide behavior/performance, patient complaints related to pain relief, and

patient safety event data that may be related to diversion or impairment.

Monitor data for evolving trends that may be suggestive of diversion.Ensures

that system and campuses, maintain a current state of “audit readiness.”Provides

oversight for all audits performed by any independent external auditors.Participates

and provides support as needed at local sites for any scheduled or unscheduled

survey (e.g. JC, CDPH, DEA).Routinely

monitors monthly controlled substance use via appropriate software available to

track and identify potential misuse of these agents.Develops

and sustains a strong process to identify and report Discrepancies, works with

pharmacy leadership and respective administration to undertake proper action by

covered licensed entity.Ensures

that reporting meets organizational, state, and federal

requirements/guidelines.Maintains

records related to job function and contributes to reports.Works

closely with key senior management at all covered entities and MC Compliance

Department to ensure that all are aware of any issues with diversion.Prepares

annual report to Compliance Department, Risk Management and each Pharmacist in

Charge who has a DEA license detailing all suspected illicit activities, action

taken, and formalizes any future audits.Present

institutional drug diversion reports to the relevant stakeholders at the local

and system level.

Minimum Requirements

Qualifications/Work Experience:

5

years of hospital pharmacy experience preferredKnowledgeable

and experienced in pharmacy operations, technology, pharmacy accreditation and

regulatory compliance and medication related federal and state regulatory

standardsHas

experience in investigation, interviewing witnesses, and investigative report

processRequires

strong leadership, interpersonal and superior communication skills, both verbal

and written

Education/Licensure/Certification:

PharmD

and licensed as a Registered Pharmacist eligible to practice pharmacy in the

state of California

title: Product Manager, Student Sponsorship
job_description:
Guild is increasing economic mobility for working adults by partnering with the largest employers in the country to offer education as a benefit to their employees via our marketplace of nonprofit universities and education institutions. Guild's proprietary technology platform facilitates the administration of this innovative benefit and our team of coaches helps each employee navigate the path back to school, providing individualized support from day one through program completion. Guild's product teams leverage technology to help connect and scale our education marketplace, enabling thousands of students to go to school affordably.

Guild just became the latest female-led company to hit a $1billion valuation and the only B-corp with those qualifications. Our latest $157 million financing round was led by Ken Chenault, General Catalyst Partners chairman and former CEO of AMEX, and joined by Emerson Collective, LeadEdge Capital, and Iconiq.

The Product Manager, Student Sponsorship is a newly created role, reporting to Jamie Masterson (Director of Product, Payments and Platform), focused on scaling our sponsorship product and offering from MVP functionality to a core and strategic part of our payments marketplace.

In this role you will:

Own the product strategy, roadmap, and delivery against the roadmap for all sponsorship related product investments.
Use data, user research and market knowledge to craft a vision for your product area and identify areas of opportunity, building a business case for new product investments.
Lead cross-functional projects related to enhancing and optimizing the sponsorship experience, work with operations, marketing, academic partners and other product managers to create a cohesive end-to-end experience.
Work directly with engineering, design, and senior leadership to deliver effective product(s) to market.
Act as the Product Owner for Guild's sponsorship product and development team, including authoring, grooming and prioritizing user stories.

In this role you will collaborate closely with: Alex Pepin (Product Manager, Payments), Annie He (Director of Product Operations), Sveta Dawant (Technical Operations & Strategic Initiatives Director), and Mae Podesta (SVP, Marketplace Operations and Payment Strategy).

You are a strong fit for this role if you have:

3+ years experience in a product management role, working cross-functionally with operations teams and taking products to market.
Proven ability to manage complex business problems across internal and external stakeholders.
A track record of working collaboratively and effectively with engineering and non-technical partner teams to lead delivery of product solutions.
Experience with working with Looker/Tableau (ability to write SQL preferred).
Attention to detail; you're willing to dig deep into the details to get things right
Experience with payments, workflow tools, or B2B2C businesses is a plus.

Guild Education is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Workday Product Owner
job_description:
The Product Owner (PO) we're looking to hire resides within the HR Domain and is a member of the extended Product Management team and crucial member of the Agile Team. PO owns the Team / Sprint backlog representing the single source of truth the Product & Technology team and is the single point of contact to the Dev team and Customer team for user story details associated to Workday continuous delivery workstream(s). PO is responsible for defining and refining user stories and prioritizing the Agile Team backlog to streamline the execution of Workday SaaS Platform while maintaining conceptual and technical integrity of features for the team.

This role needs to be able to navigate within the platform and provide high level technical guidance while working within the Delivery workstream. They are the bridge between the business stakeholders (non-technical) with the technical delivery teams (engineers, configuration leads) that will transform what the business is expecting from a behavior to what the development team and testing resources should be creating and testing

The PO also is aware of modern software development, integration and delivery practices using DevOps and Agile methodologies. In this capacity, the PO remains highly available to the Dev teams during each iteration (sprint) in order to answer real-time questions and provide clarity to user stories. PO also drives user story refinement activities ensuring Team backlog contains 2 iterations worth of 'ready' work for Dev team. These two functions are critical to enabling Dev teams to improve and maintain high velocity/productivity in iteration (sprint) execution.

PO also has a significant role in quality control and is the only team member empowered to accept stories as done, ensuring the acceptance criteria has been met. This role has significant relationships and responsibilities outside their specific Agile team, including working with Product Management, who is responsible for the Product (Program) Backlog, to prepare for the Program Increment (PI) Planning meeting (Big Room Planning).

Responsibilities

Project Management


Coordinates and functional scope analysis and detailed solution design of the processes/systems within domain. Partners across domain IT teams for alignment and impact analysis. Proactively reviews domain for risk and mitigations before they become critical. Continually keeps stakeholders, management and project managers informed of team activities and work-plan status.Leads issue resolution efforts to help eliminate or reduce scheduling or budget impacts. Collaborate with business and IT partner teams to refine and define business capability and technology roadmaps, provides education on potential process and system solution options, and drives business/IT investigation of emerging strategic capabilities.Facilitates sessions to solicit and document requirements (e.g. creation of user stories).


Business and Technical Execution


Develops understanding of customer experience, especially at a tactical and transaction level.Builds and maintains Agile (Scrum / Sprint) team backlog, with input from the customer, Product Managers, System Architect/Engineering and other stakeholders (team backlog consists mostly of user stories, it also includes defects and enablers.)Collaborates with Agile team and stakeholders to write user stories and requirements that include acceptance criteria and acceptance tests, typically for 1 or 2 (max) Agile / Scrum teams.Reviews and prioritizes Agile Team backlog for Iteration (Sprint) Planning, including coordination of dependencies with other Product Owners.Primary resource (and source of truth / single point of contact) to Technical (Dev) team and Customer team for user story details. Highly available to technical team during iteration (sprint) in order to answer real-time questions and provide clarity to user stories.Manages and maintains the efficient flow of just-in-time story elaboration activities (user story refinement) throughout team execution, typically maintaining 2 iterations(sprints) worth user stories available and ready in team backlog.Works across Agile teams to define and implement improvement stories that will increase velocity and quality of the program.Accountable and responsible for user story quality and performance in production environment.Supports and helps Technical Product Managers create and manage product vision and technical roadmap, primarily related to working scope.

Qualifications

3+ years Development/Configuration Workday experience
4-7 years experience in a Product Management, Product Owner, Business Analyst, or Software Engineer role.2-4 years experience delivering software with Agile Scrum methodologies and other commonly used tools.

Company Profile

As America's Un-carrier, T-Mobile USA, Inc. (NASDAQ: "TMUS") is redefining the way consumers and businesses buy wireless services through leading product and service innovation. The company's advanced nationwide 4G and 4G LTE network delivers outstanding wireless experiences for customers who are unwilling to compromise on quality and value. Based in Bellevue, Washington, T-Mobile USA. Inc. provides services through its subsidiaries and operates its flagship brands, T-Mobile and Metro by T-Mobile. For more information, please visit http://www.t-mobile.com

Applicant Privacy Policy

We are committed to maintaining your trust by respecting and protecting your privacy. For more information about how T-Mobile processes the personal data of job applicants, please visit Applicant Privacy Policy.

EOE Statement

We Take Equal Opportunity Seriously - By Choice. T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with our Company values and will not be tolerated. Furthermore, such discrimination or harassment may violate federal, state, or local law.

title: Project Manager SDLC
job_description:
Syndicus NACON provides service-oriented staffing and recruiting services to small businesses, large corporations, nonprofits and government agencies. We pride ourselves on personal service, local market knowledge and commitment to providing great job opportunities. We specialize in contract, contract-to-hire and direct placement positions.

Are you an SDLC Project Manager? We have a great opportunity for a PM in Columbia, MD. This is a direct hire role with full benefits and salary depending on experience. The position is also eligible for the company’s commission plan.

Project Manager Position Description

Location: Columbia, Maryland

Position summary: Works with clients and employees to plan, manage, execute, and close software implementation projects. Identifies sales opportunities based on matching client needs to current offerings and routing opportunities to account managers.

Compensation: Base salary commensurate with experience. This role is eligible for the company’s commission plan.

Key Responsibilities

• Prepares project budgets for review and approval by management

• Responsible for meeting all contractual deliverables and milestones according to the approved project plan

• Responsible for project accountability

• Assembles and manages project teams and assigns individual responsibilities

• Serves as the liaison to the development and sales teams

• Supervises implementation specialists

• Validates business requirements with clients then measures and documents success in achieving the goals

• Identifies upsell opportunities and routes opportunities to account managers/sales people

• Determines and acquires resources needed to ensure that deliverable deadlines and payment milestones are met within the approved project budget

• Evaluates and mitigates project risks

• Develops and manages project plan and budget

• Monitors and reports project progress against objectives, internally, and with clients; escalates issues, risks to SA management when necessary

• Understands and documents product issues

• Oversees contractual software enhancements or defects

• Coordinates, oversees, and provides product rollout and onsite support

• Manages and maintains client relationships, serving as point of contact for all client issues and responding to client requests

• Maintains consistent, ongoing contact with clients regarding project status, and conducts weekly project status meetings with agency project managers

• At close of project, conducts project performance review, transfers project to the Customer Service team, and archives project in SharePoint

• Must also be able to fill in for an implementation specialist when necessary, and perform the associated tasks

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

• Basic knowledge and understanding of computer / database concepts

• Proficient in the fundamentals of project management

• Knowledge of MS Project

• Familiarity with SQL, web-based applications, and client-server applications

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills

• Ability to problem-solve tenaciously

• Ability to communicate effectively during difficult customer issues

• Ability to troubleshoot effectively

• Ability to work well with others

• Excellent customer service skills

• Ability to work on multiple projects concurrently

• Ability to manage multiple priorities

• Ability to collaborate with others to cooperatively develop consensus based solutions

• Enjoys having a variety of assignments and projects

title: QUALITY PRODUCT MANAGER
job_description:
Who We Are

ImmunoGen is developing the next generation of antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs) to improve outcomes for cancer patients. By generating targeted therapies with enhanced anti-tumor activity and favorable tolerability profiles, we aim to disrupt the progression of cancer and offer our patients more good days. We call this our commitment to “target a better now.”

Learn more about who we are, what we do, and how we do it at www.immunogen.com.

The Opportunity

As a representative of the Quality Assurance department, ensure end-to-end product quality for assigned products. Provide quality oversight to ensure manufacturing and testing performed by ImmunoGen contractors (CMO/CTL) are conducted in compliance with all applicable filings, regulations and cGMPs. This encompasses all aspects associated with manufacturing and testing of designated product(s) components (antibody, payload and linker), drug substance and drug product. Serve as the primary Quality representative and product quality expert for designated product(s).


Acquire and maintain end-to-end product knowledge enabling a contextual understanding of designated product(s) from clinical development through commercialization.
Partner with relevant internal and external teams to highlight potential quality issues during process transfer, GMP manufacturing and testing and identify/execute strategies to effectively manage them.
Collaborate with key CMC stakeholders on development of the overall control strategy (e.g., in-process, release, stability testing and respective acceptance criteria).
Draft and obtain approval of the intermediate, drug substance and drug product specifications. Contribute to the Specification and Stability Review Boards.
When establishing a new CMO or CTL, serve as a member of the assessment team to determine if the prospective supplier has the necessary and sufficient quality system capabilities to ensure product quality. Attend vendor audits as needed.
Monitor compliance to respective Quality Agreements and escalate issues.
Review and approve process validation protocols and reports, as well as master batch records and associated GMP documents used by ImmunoGen’s contractors.
Perform batch review and disposition of antibody, payload, linker, drug substance and drug product batches manufactured and tested by ImmunoGen’s CMOs and CTLs
Review and approve relevant risk assessments, change controls, deviations, investigations and associated CAPAs.
Lead complaint investigations and recalls, as necessary.
In partnership with the Technical Operations, review trended product data (as prescribed by the designatedproduct(s) monitoring plans) and assess impact of process changes and effectiveness of CAPAs and change controls on product quality.
Coordinate development of Annual Product Reviews and FDA metrics for designated product(s) and ensure completeness including lifecycle management commitments.
Author/review assigned sections of regulatory filings.

Who You Are

BS/MS in relevant scientific or engineering discipline.

Minimum of 8 years of relevant experience in the pharmaceutical industry, including time spent in a Quality role in a GMP environment.


Working knowledge of batch release processes and associated accountabilities (assessment of batch data, deviations, investigations, change controls, complaints, etc.).
Working knowledge of process validation
Preferable to have experience in both small molecules and biologics, as well as involvement in process development of ADCs.

Preferable to have experience working with third party manufacturers and testing laboratories.
Additional professional requirements and behavioral competencies:



Knowledge of cGMP and regulatory requirements for ADC manufacturing and testing.
Demonstrated effectiveness in partnership relationships in the areas of communication, influence and negotiation.
Demonstrated effectiveness in problem solving, decision making and managing a diverse set of activities across multiple stakeholders.
Ability to travel, as required, to support external manufacturing.



Personal Characteristics:

Results Oriented: Establishes clear goals and expectations and effectively allocates resources. Consistently delivers. Has flexible and creative problem solving skills.
Strategic Thinker: Is able to see the big picture and understand the challenging and sometimes conflicting needs within an organization. Thinks logically, develops and evaluates options, and identifies pros and cons. Constantly strives for ways to add value and improve how work is done.
Team Leader: Able to manage, lead, and nurture talent. Encourages team to present and debate their best ideas and holds the team accountable for results.
Communications: Strong, clear communicator who recognizes that new ideas and approaches require a great deal of communication. Able to communicate across functions and bring people together around a common goal.
Self-directed: Able to work effectively with limited direction in a complex, fast-paced environment.
Positive Energy: Brings energy into the room and is a strong collaborator.
Innovation: Drives and supports new ways of thinking and embraces change.
Patient Focus: Work with urgency and go the extra mile. The patient is waiting.

ImmunoGen, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer & prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, disability, marital and veteran status.

ImmunoGen, Inc. does not accept non-solicited resumes or candidate submittals from search/recruiting agencies not already on ImmunoGen, Inc.’s approved agency list. Unsolicited resumes or candidate information submitted to ImmunoGen, Inc. by search/recruiting agencies not already on ImmunoGen, Inc. approved agency list shall become the property of ImmunoGen, Inc. and if the candidate is subsequently hired by ImmunoGen, Inc., ImmunoGen, Inc. shall not owe any fee to the submitting agency.

title: Product Manager, Digital & Social Channel Engagement
job_description:
Looking for an experienced Product Manager with building social messaging solutions! This isn't a marketing type of role. You must have experience with social channels as a product manager - building features for product social channel. If this is you, apply today!

As a Product Manager, you will bring your leadership, business acumen, and technical skills to the Genesys Cloud team. You will play a critical role in the definition, development and delivery of Genesys Cloud solutions. In this role, you will usher features through all phases of product development with primary responsibilities on feature requirements definition, project planning, managing schedules, facilitating conflict resolution, identifying and communicating risk, building and managing a product roadmap and coordinating tasks involving dependencies within cross-functional teams. You will add value by ensuring that the features delivered meet quality standards, solve stated business problems and are completed in a timely manner within scope project deliverables.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate and define components of Genesys Cloud solutions, from both functional and business perspective, with a key focus in Social Media Channels:

Artificial Intelligence (AI) Powered Digital Interactions Customer Journey with Digital Interactions Omni-Channel Interactions Chatbot and human agent orchestration Seamless Channel switching Conversation threading Social Media Channels – public and private channel support Build and manage a product roadmap Work with customers, vendors and product management team to define product features Define and execute on requirements with supporting organizations, including product management, sales, development, support, IT operations, finance and legal Provide visibility to feature status and escalates issues to senior management Plan and track release milestones for feature releases Work closely with Product, Development, and Quality Assurance management to ensure successful feature delivery Identify needs, create, and deliver sales enablement training material Create and deliver clear and concise customer facing documentation outlining delivered solutions Remove obstacles blocking or slowing down the teams Manage multiple projects at one time Develop and improve processes, communicate plans and achievements, and facilitate project meetings

Minimum Requirements:

BA/BS requiredExperience in Cloud solutions, with strong background in product management and cloud operations 4+ years of experience working in a Product Manager capacity working on enterprise software life cycle development Experience working with Social Media Channels and Social Media vendors Strong bonus if you bring validated experience using or product managing a Social Media monitoring, Social Media engagement or Social customer care cloud platform Fluency reading and understanding API and developer documentation Experience delivering Customer Experience or Customer Engagement solutions Ability to prioritize issues effectively and meet tight deadlines when required Ability to lead a high performing, cross-functional team Ability to manage the work and quality of other cross-functional team members Ability to resolve conflict within a project team Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong Project management skills Ability to actively listen and learn Ability to multi-task, prioritize and be detail oriented Ability to work in a team environment Ability to take initiative and be proactive Ability to work independently and be resourceful Ability to manage multiple projects and coordinate with other Product Managers Critical thinker with excellent communication skills, written and verbal 

About Genesys

Every year, Genesys® delivers more than 70 billion remarkable customer experiences for organizations in over 100 countries. Through the power of the cloud and AI, our technology connects every customer moment across marketing, sales and service on any channel, while also improving employee experiences. Genesys pioneered Experience as a Service℠ so organizations of any size can provide true personalization at scale, interact with empathy, and foster customer trust and loyalty. This is enabled by Genesys Cloud™, an all-in-one solution and the world’s leading public cloud contact center platform, designed for rapid innovation, scalability and flexibility. Visit www.genesys.com.

Genesys is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics. #LI-TL1

title: Product Manager
job_description:
At PEMCO it’s all about people, starting with our customers. We’re a mutual insurance company owned by our Northwest policyholders and protecting their dreams since 1949. We believe in listening to our customers and showing that we understand them in ways that others don’t. It’s what makes us “a little different.”

Come join our dynamic Product team as we execute product initiatives using technology to make a difference! You’ll have the opportunity to manage and develop product strategies that offer high customer value and optimize profitable growth.

At PEMCO you will enjoy the benefits of a smaller company – sharing ideas, learning and seeing the impact of your work – while competing with the big guys and enjoying positive work-life balance.

What You'll Be Doing

Responsible for profit/loss and growth and forecasting and budgeting for assigned product line(s) Develop and maintain product line(s) to meet consumer needs - perform pricing analysis and make pricing selects; responsible for the regulatory filing strategy; ensure assigned products comply with state regulations and statutes; strong understanding of market and key competitors; determine policy and coverage language and strategy; influence underwriting strategy and guidelines Determine and actively manage 2-5-year strategic product plans Influence and educate partners at all levels in key functions regarding product changes Work effectively with internal and external teams and business partners to implement product initiatives and effect product changes Work closely with, mentor, and coach Product Analysts and business partners. Effectively supervise employees, as assigned

What You'll Bring

6+ year(s) of work experience in comparable role, including demonstrated command of Product Management principles required MBA or Master’s Degree or BA/BS degree with commensurate experience preferred. Excellent analytical, quantitative and problem-solving skills with a proven ability to make and execute data-driven decisions required. Thorough working knowledge of query tools (such as SQL, Access, Brio, Business Objects, SAS, or SPSS) preferred. Excellent written and oral communication skills with ability to effectively communicate complex concepts required. Ability to plan, implement, and manage projects of medium/high complexity and/or medium/large scale key initiatives required. Prior leadership experience or demonstrated leadership ability preferred.

We've Got You Covered

Competitive salary 200% match on your 401(k) up to 6% of your pay Generous medical, dental, disability and life insurance plans A friendly, professional work environment The opportunity to work at a place of integrity, where customer service is emphasized

At PEMCO, we celebrate and support our differences. We know employing a team rich in diverse thoughts, experiences, and opinions allows our employees, our products and our community to flourish. PEMCO is honored to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation or Veteran status.
