title: Assistant Manager
job_description:
SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES  At Tropical Smoothie Cafe, we inspire a healthier lifestyle by serving amazing food and smoothies with a bit of tropical fun! Our leaders are key to delivering on this promise which is driven by our four values: Solid Relationships, Playing to Win, Creative Spirit and Living Better. If you are Smart and have Integrity, Drive, and Enthusiasm, you would be a great Tropical Smoothie Café Assistant Manager.  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Interacts with crew members and customers using “Tropitude” (Tropitude is our “mojo” and what makes Tropical Smoothie Café fun and different and means having energy and creating a positive atmosphere).
Provides leadership and verbal direction to crew members.
Ensures quality product is delivered to the customer every time.
Supports and works closely with the general manager through daily shift tasks.
Assists the general manager with stocking & inventory counting.
Delivers ‘Unparalleled Hospitality’ to each customer that visits our cafe.
Knowledgeable and proficient in all positions within the cafe.
Successfully completes the Café Basics Training Program and Certified Trainer Program.
Ensures each position is operating to Tropical Smoothie Cafe’s standards.
Trains and coaches crew members during each shift to ensure brand standards are upheld.
Enjoys working in team environments.
Uses tools to accomplish goals, manage labor and control inventory.
Performs any additional tasks necessary to run the cafe.

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS

A minimum of 3 years in the restaurant industry.


Experience in a leadership role or position.


Stable work history.


Self-motivated and possess a strong desire for professional growth.


Legally able to work within the State and Federal guidelines.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Continuous standing and walking throughout the duration of each shift.


Constant face-to-face interactions with crew members and customers. ·


Bending, lifting and carrying up to 25 pounds to perform duties like stocking, refilling ice or taking out trash.


Safely navigate in a fast-paced cafe environment.


Ability to multi-task and remain positive in sometimes stressful working conditions.

WORKING CONDITIONS

Most shifts are between six to eight hours, but this may vary.
Assistant Managers can expect to have some early mornings, late evenings, weekend and/or holiday hours with additional opening/closing responsibilities.
Lead Crew Members by demonstrating Tropical Smoothie Cafes core values in all interactions with team & customers
Comply with the Tropical Smoothie Cafe uniform and personal hygiene polices for each shift.
Fun, fast-paced, upbeat environment with no fryers!

title: Sr. Product Manager Global Web Platform
job_description:
Avalara, Inc., (www.Avalara.com), is the leading provider of cloud-based software that delivers a broad array of compliance solutions related to sales tax and other transactional taxes.

What is it like to work at Avalara? Come find out! We are committed to the following success traits that embody our culture and how we work together to accomplish great things: Fun. Passion. Adaptability. Urgency. Simplicity. Curiosity. Humility. Ownership. Optimism.

Job Summary:

The Sr. Product Manager for Avalara's Global Web App/Platform will work with Avalara’s product teams to bring our suite of tax compliance products together under a single, compelling UI that delivers meaningful value to organizations of all sizes and end-user needs across the complexity spectrum. Included in the web platform is a suite of tools and services that will ultimately allow for Avalara product teams to accelerate development while delivering a unified, consistent, high quality and secure user experience.

Job Duties

Work with internal and external customers to acquire a deep understanding of their requirements & business needs (e.g. other PMs, operations, business development, sales, marketing & customer success teams)Create and update roadmap for Avalara’s User Interface by 1) identifying new products or features that solve problems and automate otherwise manual processes, and 2) establishing shared vision across company stakeholders by building consensus on priorities leading to product executionResearch and write detailed product requirements including but not limited to user stories for engineering to execute againstDeliver requirements in partnership with Design/UX with an iterative, pragmatic approach to feature deliveryEnsure that product requirements incorporate effective written and more creative, visual techniques (e.g. wireframes and mockups)Develop and articulate defensible point of views based on data from primary and secondary researching including direct customer engagementEnsure committed product delivery timelines are achieved across the organization including but not limited to engineeringDefine and analyze metrics that inform the success of productsDevelop and maintain relationships with key decision makers across the organization

Qualifications

5+ years of experience as a product manager for web & SaaS-based UI/UX7+ years overall experience with some startup experienceExperience with agile development methodologies and toolchain (e.g. Jira)Experience working for leading SaaS companies with a diverse customer base spanning small business owners, SMB, and enterpriseDemonstrated experience partnering with design teams on UI/UXStrong attention to detailAbility to drive results through influenceVery strong English written and oral communication skillsExperience managing a UX platform, including shared components, tools, services and design systemBachelor's Degree in a relevant field

Preferred Qualifications

MBA in a relevant fieldExperience with tax automation products, ERP, eCommerce, and other financial accounting systemsExperience with accounting and transaction tax compliance concepts (i.e., sales tax returns)Experience with analytics platforms like Heap, FullStory, and AdobeWork on data models with hands-on SQL experience to write queries and perform data analysis



About Avalara

Avalara helps businesses of all sizes achieve compliance with transactional taxes, including VAT, sales and use, excise, communications, and other tax types. We deliver comprehensive, automated, cloud-based solutions that are fast, accurate, and easy to use.

Avalara offers hundreds of pre-built connectors into leading accounting, ERP, e-commerce and other business applications. Each year, the company processes billions of tax transactions for customers and users, files hundreds of thousands of tax compliance documents and tax returns and manages millions of exemption certificates and other compliance related documents.

Avalara’s headquarters are in Seattle, WA and it has offices across the U.S. and in Brighton and London, England; Brussels, Belgium; and Pune, India. More information at: www.avalara.comAvalara is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, age, gender, national orientation, disability, sexual orientation, US Veteran status, or any other factor protected by law.

title: Production Manager - Irwindale, CA
job_description:
Responsible for the proactive management of a sterile manufacturing facility in accordance with safety regulations, cGMP, and regulatory compliance. A dynamic hands-on leader with the ability to drive performance by the development of employees through accountability, standards, continuous improvement; leads by example as a technical expert in the sterile production processes and facilities. Intuitive solutionist to the requirements of the business with a good understanding of supply chain, operations and/or any other factors that may result in productions delays, while maintaining quality, compliance and standards of delivery; through efficient and effective, planning, directing and co-ordination of all production and maintenance activities.

Management

Translate company strategy into meaningful plans and actions at the operations level. Manages and evaluate daily, weekly and monthly KPI information to identify bottlenecks and enables and executes actions to problem solve and remove obstacles to ensure smooth flow of production. Participate in the budget planning process. Works with the production budget and strive for cost management and improvements. Ensure proper communication is maintained with internal and external customers. Observe and align operations in all departments to acquire knowledge of methods, procedures and standards as related to departmental duties. Identify production needs and execute actions including, but not limited to, process management, staffing, equipment, and training. Make Continuous Improvement a priority in the day to day life of the production system and management.

Employee Development and Succession Planning

Build and sustain empathy and trust by actively listening, understanding, coaching and supporting employees and team members. Assess existing talent to determine if skills/competencies are appropriate for current roles and future goals. Set performance goals and objectives with direct reports. Ensure SOP, Safety and CGMP training are current and that all employees are compliant. Develop employees through daily learning, training, workshops, mentorship, etc.

Operations

Plan, direct and coordinate all areas of production and related services to produce quality and compliant products, safely at the most economic costs to meet on time customer demand. Identify trends in processing times and identify appropriate actions to address; and improve operating conditions. Provides technical guidance to staff and/or colleagues as well as anticipates and interprets the business needs to identify solutions. Includes approval of technical documentation including investigation, protocols, qualification, validation etc. as required. Interface with external organizations such as the FDA, DEA, Contract Auditors, CalOSHA, EPA, and others to ensure compliance with current regulations. Sets and measures team performance/goals, contribute to production scheduling decisions, and work cross-functionally to close deviation investigations and introduce new product SKUs. Hand-on approach to problem solve production constraints and/or improve production capacity. Oversees all day-to-day activities in the manufacturing departments. Lead and support filling and packaging equipment modifications and upgrades for automated process efficiency, regulatory compliance and replacement of obsolescent equipment, controls and systems. Enhance the management and operation skills within the production department; provide technical advice to departments within the organization regarding compounding, filling and packaging equipment improvement based upon the departmental systems used to facilitate the workload. Manages the following departments: Injectables (sterile) and powder (Non-sterile), and Sterile. Knowledge on cost accounting principles for a manufacturing environment. Develops cost reduction plans and ensure departments operates within budget. Ensure cGMP compliance & attainment of PSQDC (Performance, Safety, Quality, Delivery, Cost) targets

Continuous Improvement

Support CI project teams by providing adequate time for activities to facilitate process improvements. Encourage and mentor CI Leaders to educate and empower a CI mindset throughout the production operations. Participating as a role model in establishing a Continuous Improvement / lean culture with responsibility to translate onto the manufacturing floor.

Requirements

At least 5 years of bio-pharmaceutical experience, with 3 years of leadership experience directly within drug product manufacturing that includes aseptic and sterile filling environments Effective at working in fast-paced environments, specifically in a leadership capacity to facilitate objective decision making Capacity to perform departmental capacity analysis to recommend short and long-term strategies

People

Demonstrated leadership and vision in managing staff groups and major projects or initiatives. A demonstrated commitment to high professional ethical standards and a diverse workplace. Excels at operating in a fast pace environment. Excellent people manager with transformation and change management experience, Open to direction with a collaborative style of work and a commitment to a job well done. Ability to challenge and debate issues of importance to the organization. Highly skilled in leadership, strategic thinking, analytical ability, with effective people; change; and transformation management skills. Self-motivated with a good understanding of the “big picture” and utilizes own initiative Successful Team builder whether leading or being part of a team Sets clear and high expectations and holds self and others accountable for decisions and results achieved Drives a sense of purpose or vision for self, group or team Translates broad strategies into specific objectives and action plans Makes critical choices that support strategy and ultimately the end customers Aligns personal, team and/or department goals and objectives with organization goals and business strategy and takes actions to achieve them Provides direction to others that clarifies their expectations and role Collaborates and engages with multiple functional organizations such as Quality Assurance, Quality Control, Engineering Supply Chain and Finance to develop and maintain processes that meet cGMP and business requirement

title: Manager, Business Analytics
job_description: QSC thrives where innovative technology and compelling audio-visual experiences intersect. For over 50 years, QSC has pioneered the technology and solutions that enable immersive cinema, live performance audio, themed entertainment, digital collaboration and meeting experiences for our customers and partners around the world. A globally recognized innovator in the design, engineering, and manufacture of category leading high-performance loudspeakers, digital mixers, power amplifiers, audio processors, digital cinema solutions, and the Q-SYS™ software-based audio, video and control Ecosystem. By joining the QSC team, you will be in a challenging, collaborative, fun, and innovative environment. We encourage employees to take ownership, to color outside the lines, and to imagine possibilities. Our culture is casual but dynamic, with cross-functional teams collaborating on creating memorable audio-visual experiences that deliver joy to people, wherever they are. At QSC, fun and hard work go hand in hand. Join us and make a difference in the way people experience movies, meetings, presentations, live performances, and much more.  QSC is currently seeking a Manager, Business Analytics to join our team. The Manager will be involved in evolving and leveraging data to affect business outcomes, contributing to high-impact, strategic engagements across the organization (e.g., go-to-market models and strategy, customer experience), and build market research capabilities for the organization. In this newly created role, you will be gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations to a wide set of stakeholders. This is a highly visible professional growth role that will keep you challenged and learning while utilizing the full range of your skills. Data management and presentationWork with a wide variety of internal and external data sources to collect, clean/organize, interpret/present data to deliver insights for the business Analyze multifaceted business problems and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide insight to decision makersCompile key pieces of information related to performance against business objectives, proactively analyze sales data and reports to identify areas of concern and improvementBuild relationships and partnerships with peers and other key stakeholders Conduct analysis using advanced practices and tools associated with data gathering and analysisWork with IT and business teams to identify, map, and organize key data sources to provide business intelligence capabilities for the businessVisualize and communicate business analyses and insights, develop compelling presentations with recommendationsPrioritize work based on evaluating competing demands, timelines, and priorities; and understand and negotiate needs and expectations of multiple stakeholders Strategic programs supportContribute to the planning and implementation of strategic projects and transformation initiative(s) to support long-range business objectivesPerform research plans, business analyses, and discover insights from data to validate hypotheses or challenge status quo collaborating with appropriate team membersGather business requirements in support of projects, reporting and process improvementsCollaborate on projects with process owners, key team members, IT and external partners to build a cohesive infrastructure of systemsSupport projects with process mapping, gap analysis, and process improvement initiativesMarket research and analysisBecome recognized as the central “hub” for analytics on market data and competitive trends/information Identify and monitor competitors and market trends/changes that could affect business strategy and directionDevelop and maintain market sizing models for current markets and new market areas for the companyConduct primary and secondary qualitative and quantitative research with rigor and good business judgementIdentify third party market research available and manage subscriptions and library of market knowledge for the organization Successful candidate typically have:Master’s Degree or MBA in business, marketing, economics, data analytics or similar discipline from a top-tier school or Bachelor’s Degree with 2-3 years of experience with a top tier consulting firm Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools, SQL, Oracle; salesforce.com knowledge and experience is a plusDemonstrated aptitude for analytics with exceptional qualitative and quantitative problem-solving skillsAbility to work collaboratively in a team environment with people at all levels in an organizationAbility to communicate complex ideas effectively – both verbally and in writing – in English and the local office language(s)Strong sense of ownership, and ability/desire to work independentlyEngaging personality who can build trusting relationshipsExcellent business acumen, problem solving, negotiating skills, and analytical thinkingTeam player, personable, empathetic, and diplomatic; Energetic and enthusiastic personalityIT or AV industry or practice area expertise in customer experience, global growth, SaaS business models, product development is a plus

title: Product Manager
job_description:
mTrade offers a Software as a Solution (SaaS) platform for trading residential whole loans. The primary focus of mTrade's technology solutions is to improve the efficiency of trading residential whole loans. Starting with industry best practices, we have built an end-to-end Loan Acquisition System (LAS) that ties buyers, sellers, documents, data, analytics, and vendors together.

title: Director of Product Management
job_description:
Dairy.com is searching for an enthusiastic and talented Director of Product Management. This position will partner with Engineering, Experience Design, Product Team, and business leaders across Dairy.com. Our Product Management team ensures that were building technology to solve important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways. You will translate market and technology insights into compelling value propositions for our customers by looking to the future of our industry.

Our Product organization includes a variety of teams solving interesting problems including:

Logistics our Dispatch, Mobile Manifest, Receiving and Trading exchange modules supports the orderly scheduling, pickup of milk on a dairy farm and delivery of billions of pounds of milk each year across the United States.
Producer Payroll our milk solutions pay more producers than any other system in the US. This application has stringent federal and state regulations and providing technology solutions to the supply chain is challenging and rewarding.
Manufacturing our manufacturing systems are unique because they are built to support the unique requirements of the dairy industry. These solutions require increasing visibility to dairy liquids throughout the plant and report it in actionable manners to plant team members.

Located in our Frisco, Texas office, the role is responsible for defining, designing, and driving the implementation of market-driven capabilities for our products and solutions. Balancing the companys growth objectives, market needs, competitive offerings, and existing customer enhancement requests, the Director of Product Management is responsible for guiding the product strategy in order to drive profitable growth for Dairy.com.
This is a visible out in front leadership role that requires direct collaboration with engineering, marketing, sales, and our customers. The ideal candidate will bring focus and precision to product requirements and design, while balancing the need to move quickly and build demonstrated value with our customers. The successful candidate will be equally comfortable in product planning meetings, working with senior management to identify new market opportunities, working with engineers in a sprint planning meeting, and speaking to large groups of prospects and customers espousing the product strategy & vision.

Responsibilities:


Build an effective product management team thats responsible for multi-faceted product lines from Farm-to-Fork. Ongoing development of product strategy, product road-maps, and product requirements.
Drive the creation and maintenance of the companys product vision and strategy.
Own and drive the creation and maintenance of the companys Product Road-map, including business case development (cost/benefit and ROI analysis)
Work with Sales and Customer Success teams to conduct market research, surveys, and customer/prospect/partner visits to understand customer needs and identify requirements for all customer segments.
Define and track metrics to measure effectiveness and drive improvements and best practices.
Manage the design and specification of new user-facing products and features with a laser focus on customer value
Manage the collection, description, analysis and prioritization of requests for new product functionality from customers, prospects, partners, sales, and market-driven inputs.
Work closely with Product Development, Sales, Professional Services, and Customer Success teams to ensure timely and high quality product releases.
Maintain product, competitor and market knowledge. Analyze and keep abreast of market trends.
Analyze partnership opportunities for products and/or integrated solutions
Act as product evangelist both internally and externally.
Maintain a satisfied and referenceable customer base.

Experience & Education:

BA/BS in a technical or business field
A minimum of 5+ years product management experience
Demonstrated success, as a product management leader, conceiving, building, and shipping commercial enterprise software products & solutions
SaaS product management experience required
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Strong quantitative analysis skills, including market sizing & analysis, business case definition, and competitive analysis.
Ability to coordinate people and activities across multiple functional areas with strong capabilities in communicating and interfacing between Sales, Marketing, Finance, Professional Services, Customer Success, and Product Development
Solid business acumen, management, and marketing communication skills
A passion for listening to customers and delivering world-class user experience
Strong working knowledge of product management tools, Aha! Is a plus
Background in Agile methodology, SAFe is a plus
Background in supply chain management is a plus

title: Digital Marketing Manager
job_description:
Dickinson Fleet Services keeps your fleet moving. Dickinson Fleet Services is the largest independent fleet maintenance company in the country. As a leader in the mobile fleet service industry, we provide preventative maintenance excellence tailored to each customer's unique needs. As our business continues to expand, we are always on the lookout for motivated, energetic individuals to fill the positions now available on our talented team of professionals.
 JOB TITLE: Digital Marketing Manager


We are searching for a highly-creative Digital Marketing Manager to lead our marketing initiatives. In this position, you will be responsible for all aspects of our marketing operations. Your central goal is to help grow our brands influence nationally, while also increasing brand loyalty and awareness.
Your duties will include planning, implementing, and monitoring our digital marketing campaigns across all digital networks. Our ideal candidate is someone with experience in marketing, digital content creation, and social media management. In addition to being an outstanding communicator, you will also demonstrate excellent interpersonal and analytical skills.
Job Responsibilities

Be Responsible for the Companys short term and long-term marketing strategy, efforts and success of digital marketing programs, including search and social media advertising, SEO, website tracking and analytics, email campaigns, blogs and all marketing efforts surrounding product and content launches.
Work with our social media platforms to create visual content for Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Yelp, Google Business and LinkedIn
Compose quality, well written content for blogs, landing pages, press releases, email/text marketing campaigns, etc.
Ability to work with WordPress: manage company website, create landing pages, work with plugins, etc.
Evaluate, regularly analyze and report out on the performance and ROI of every marketing campaign by channel and recommend/implement needed changes, enhancements, additional investment or termination of campaigns, etc.
Evaluate important metrics that affect our website traffic, service quotas, and target audience.
Serve as a point of contact for the company when interacting with outside media and digital marketing agencies
Create frequent and targeted email marketing campaigns (MailChimp and Constant Contact)
Stay current with best practices, strategies, and industry standards for social media, SEO and search engine marketing (SEM).
Oversee the lead handling process, ensure that lead referral sources are being accurately entered in the CRM and make sure staff is appropriately interacting with leads and ensuring a positive customer service experience
Provide project management or project management support for special projects and trade shows.

Required Competencies:


Bachelors degree in Marketing or relevant field.
A minimum of 5 years experience in a digital marketing position developing and implementing digital marketing strategies
2 years of hands-on experience with SEO, Google Analytics and CRM software
In-depth knowledge of various social media platforms, best practices, and website analytics.
Working knowledge of Adobe Suite, Microsoft PowerPoint, WordPress, Email marketing applications, Constant Contact, Canvas, etc.
Highly creative with excellent analytical abilities.
Transportation and Maintenance industry experience preferred
Digital photography and videography, with associated editing experience preferred
Sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on a companys success
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.
Familiarity with web design
Up-to-date on the latest trends and technologies in digital marketing.
Sense of urgency daily and action oriented; not fearful of acting with a minimum of planning

Why Dickinson?
Excellent benefits: An excellent medical, dental and vision plan with a zero premium monthly contribution option, a 401(k) plan with company match, wellness program, short and long term disability insurance and more.
Strong values: We're family owned, we value our people and we've created a culture based on strong values.
Grow your skills: We'll set you up for success with great training, as you come on board and on an ongoing basis.
Accelerate your career: History shows that strong performers can move up to a Lead or Manager role, or follow other paths within our company.
The stability of an industry leader: Our passion for quality work and excellent customer service have helped us dominate our market. Our customers include some of the nation's largest fleet operators.

title: Program Manager (Healthcare)
job_description:
Why CareATC: We are a leading innovator in the health technology sector providing on-site and shared-site medical clinics. By leveraging groundbreaking technology, CareATC offers customized population health management solutions for employers that reduce healthcare costs by promoting health, preventing disease and providing a shorter path to care. CareATC manages more than 150 clients in 36 states and cares for more than 255,000 patients. CareATC is based in Tulsa, Oklahoma.

Care to be Different: CareATC is the first provider of on-site clinics to achieve 100% network accreditation from Accreditation Association of Ambulatory Health Care, Inc., earn the Evidence-Based Design Accreditation from the EDAC Advisory Council and be Net Promoter Certified. In our unique model, CareATC contracts directly with the employer and does not engage in traditional fee-for-service healthcare. Instead, we have created an environment that allows medical providers and their clinical staff to focus on wellness while eliminating the burden of managing the financial aspects of the clinic. Billing and reimbursement hassles don't exist at CareATC. Our providers work closely with their patients to initiate preventative measures and encourage good health.

Why Program Manager at CareATC: Are you a strategic leader? Do you have excellent client relationship? Have you managed multiple clinics/locations? If you said yes, keep reading.


Do you want to work with a full-time employer based opportunity that is located onsite at one of our established well-staffed clinics in North Palm Beach, FL?
Would you enjoy working at a clinic that is located on a beautiful campus with amenities such as state of the art workout facility and a fabulous food court?

The Program Manager is responsible for executing the business development strategy and strengthen client development & retention by demonstrating effective communication, presenting statistical reporting and aligning the clients vision with ours to ensure success. The Program Manager has concurrent responsibilities of: client account liaison, developing and maintaining client relationships and clinical management, managing the day-to-day coordination and efficient operation of our healthcare program(s) ensuring the delivery of quality service.

What you will be responsible for:

Manages overall delivery of CareATC services by developing relationships and providing support and guidance to existing and potential customers to ensure continued partnership.
Leads cross functional multi-partner team to shape the overall success of the initiative by managing implementation activities for new clients.
Demonstrates regard for the right of all patients and personnel and provides respectful and considerate care focused on improving the business aspects of health care operations and the quality of the health care provided.
Demonstrates management skills to orient, schedule and coordinate staff.
Effectively collaborates with administrative staff and physicians to optimize efficiency of a variety of related services ranging from inpatient care to outpatient follow-up care.
Participates in staff human resource planning and decisions, including hiring, training, supervision, and evaluating personnel and their work.
Develops budgets including recommendations for equipment outlays.
Identifies and resolves operational problems using defined processes, expertise and judgment.
Investigate first-level customer service issues as identified within area of expertise and communicate resolution to the client.
Maintains ongoing client contact via calls and meetings (weekly/monthly/quarterly) to discuss utilization, PHAs, marketing, reporting, operational and financial needs, wellness programs, new program development.
Annual Activities- Health plan performance reviews, Aggregate PHA results, formulary review, strategic planning, health/benefit fairs, employee meetings.
Coordinates in-services with client, health insurance providers and wellness center staff to support ongoing improvements and new initiatives.
Monitors, understands and communicates utilization and service quality, patient satisfaction surveys, and complaints.

You may be a fit if:

3-5 years of leadership experience strongly preferred
BS, BSN or other clinical degree strongly preferred
Current CPR or BLS certification
3 plus years of clinical experience with business/management responsibilities
Ability to travel and work at multiple locations upon the business need

title: Supplier Development Engineering Manager
job_description:
Supplier Development Engineering ManagerMarch 7, 2020 | Waukesha, WI

This position is located in Waukesha, WI

Husco is committed to building an environment for employees to be able:


To have the flexibility of their own work and put a personal ‘stamp’ on their output
Continuously expand and development their professional skills and knowledge
Create a product for our customers that serves a greater purpose to communities around the world

POSITION SUMMARYHusco Automotive provides individuals the opportunity to pursue a career within a fast-paced, industry leading and entrepreneurial organization.

PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES


Manage the Global Supplier Development Team. This role directly manages the US based supplier development team. Allocate supplier / commodity responsibilities to the team to maintain workload as well as to provide a challenging, learning atmosphere. Ensure the engineers have project assignments, in addition to standard component PPAP’s, that provide personal career growth promote interaction with other departments. The Supplier Development Manager of our China team also reports to this position. As our international sourcing efforts expand, the responsibilities of this role will expand to own the Global team.
Process Owner for Supplier Component PPAPs. Manage the existing PPAP process and work towards common execution among all Supplier Development Engineers. Lead and mentor the team through this process. Maintain active projects for the improvement of these processes and development of new or improved tools based on best practices. Represent the process for all customer and certification audits. Ensure that all Automotive requirements are met by the PPAP process.
Lead the Development of Critical Processes and Process Controls at the Supply Base. Husco has a long history of projects requiring innovation both internally and at our supply base. Spearhead these efforts with the supply base to ensure that they plan and execute projects in a manner that meets the ever-growing quality demands. As our purchased components require new processes to achieve the required designs, this position must work with the supply base to ensure that appropriate process controls are instituted to match.
Execute company initiatives that drive quality enhancements throughout the supply base. Identify projects that drive improvements in the delivered component quality metrics. Drive best practices throughout the supply base. An example would be a recent initiative that implemented automated inspection for all high-volume components not just the critical components. This also involves analyzing our quality data to identify suppliers or commodities with recurring non-conformance and working to put corrections in place.
Thorough understanding of Automotive Quality Systems and Requirements. Heavy use of Data Analysis tools. Husco works to meet and exceed the standards of the automotive industry. As our manufacturing model is to assemble and test, our quality records are fully dependent on the delivered quality of our sub-components. In order to maintain our history of single digit ppm, we must require the same from our supply base. In order to achieve this, we are extremely data driven. Use of data analysis and Six-Sigma tools is built into everything that we do.
Manage the selection, onboarding and training of new suppliers. Husco is continuously adding new suppliers based on various needs. Reasons may be due to diversification, geographical diversification or the addition of a new type of component or process. Supplier Development is a critical component of our process for identifying, approving and onboarding these suppliers. The Manager of Supplier Development will oversee this critical process.
Supervise and Develop Employees. Demonstrate core cultural competencies to subordinates. Provide challenging and stretching tasks and assignments. Attract, retain, and develop the best people from inside or outside the company. Assemble talented teams. Broadly share both responsibility and accountability with subordinates. Create an environment that allows employees the opportunity to finish their own work and trust people to perform the duties assigned. Improve performance and abilities of subordinates through training, counseling, disciplining and responding to employee ideas and concerns. Be aware and supportive of each subordinate’s career goals. Bring out the best in people and is an effective people builder. Coach and lead team in taking calculated risks.
Strong Team Player and Contributor. Able to work well with colleagues and produce results within a fast-paced and high-pressure atmosphere. Combine strong attention to detail with an orientation towards results/execution.



MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS


Bachelor’s Degree in technical discipline required.
A minimum of ten (10) years of experience in in supply chain management in a manufacturing environment and supporting achievements.
Advanced degree in Business (MBA) or MS in Manufacturing/Engineering preferred.
Demonstrated process and part cost reduction through innovative best practice approaches.
High level of analytical skill combined with excellent computer skills.
Effective trouble shooting, problem solving and organizational skills.
Able to handle frequent interruptions, meet tight deadlines, and handle conflict in an effective manner.
Ability to interact with people at all levels of responsibility.
International and domestic travel up to 25%.
(Authorized to work in the United States.)



PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS


In a standard workday, this person will be required to sit 80 %, stand 10%, and walk 10%.
Will lift from 1 to 35 pounds. Lifting may include miscellaneous materials if required.
Fine manipulation is needed for PC work and use of other office equipment.
Visual requirements include ability to read and follow directions. This person may come in contact with office hazards. Temperature and humidity are normal for this position and there are no unusual atmospheric conditions. Will be required to wear personal protective equipment in posted areas of the plant, including safety glasses, ear plugs, and safety shoes.
Total awareness of the plant environment as it pertains to the safety of other employees, operation of equipment, handling of equipment/materials, and visitors required.



(HUSCO IS PROUD TO BE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.)

title: Practice Manager Product Manager - Azure Platform Services
job_description:
Offering Leader Apps Infrastructure MU-Azure - Northeast Region

Market Units are what we want to be known for in the market; they are the areas on which our clients most frequently seek our guidance during their digital transformation. Within our Market Units, we have core Offerings, which are the solutions we deliver to our clients. By specializing in and formalizing these select Offerings, we can deepen our relationships with our clients across their entire business, expanding into new areas, helping us to grow our market share and the clients positive business outcomes.

About the Role:

As a Director, Region Offering Lead, you will lead the overall strategy, performance and growth Microsoft Azure Services Offering in the largest Market Unit globally, right here in the Northeast Region. Youll team closely with both the Regional and the Area Market Unit Leads to implement a strategy for offering identification and investments in Azure cloud. In this key role, youll focus on driving the offering every day; serving as the "face" of the offering internally and externally, support offering sales through delivery, including capability and capacity, and regional relationships with offering alliance partners, Microsoft and Accenture.

In this role, you will manage full-spectrum, cross-offering solutions delivery for our clients. You will partner with Talent Community Lead and Regional Capability Lead on resourcing and skill needs to maintain effective business operations and project outcomes, engaging the Global Delivery Network (GDN) as needed.

Daily Activities:

Collaborate with and educate account and sales team to drive offerings to target clients, including all stages of the deal pursuit, review and approval. If you're looking for an impactful, client-facing role, it doesn't get better than this!
Support, nurture and drive quality delivery and client delivery outcomes for offerings and solutions in your Region in conjunction with managing your budget for Area/Region metrics.
Positioning offering and cross-offerings with local partners, primarily Accenture and Microsoft, you develop strong beneficial relationships and ensure Azure is considered as part of proposed solutions with clients.
Partner with the global Center of Excellence (CoE) on offering and asset development, where you can make your mark!
Support direct selling teams, from crafting solutions through proposal and closing deals, with regional business travel as needed.

About You:

Your successful leadership track record of developing and growing long term, high value client relationships makes you a stand out with C-sat and happy clients. Your honed communication, influencing and negotiating capabilities have helped you establish and grow solutions with key clients. You enjoy advising leadership teams in the development, production and promotion of solution offerings to grow a technology services line of business.

About Your Background:

You possess a Bachelor's degree in Business or technology-related field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. We always love advanced technical degrees (IT, Engineering, etc.) or an MBA.
You have around 7 -10 years of relevant technology experience (think solution sales, offering creation, delivery and business management) and 5+ years of demonstrated people and/or business leadership experience with measureable results in a consultancy or professional services firm.


Avanade® Is An Equal Opportunity Employer. Avanade prohibits discrimination and harassment against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, colour, age, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, marital status or any other protected status.

title: Senior Product Manager
job_description:
By applying to this position, your application is automatically considered for the range of PM leadership roles we have at Wayfair. If we think you might be a fit, a recruiter will reach out to learn more about your background and discuss relevant positions in more detail.

Who We Are:

Wayfair believes everyone should live in a home they love. Through technology and innovation, we make it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 14 million items across home furnishings, décor, home improvement, housewares and more. Partnering with Engineering, Experience Design, Analytics and business leaders across Wayfair, our Product teams ensure that were building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways.

Our Product organization includes a variety of teams solving interesting problems:


Storefront, our consumer-facing Product team, is tackling a wide array of fascinating, incredibly difficult problems - like helping a massive, rapidly growing global customer base efficiently find the perfect products from our catalog of >10M items (with the majority of traffic on mobile), building 2-sided marketplaces to connect consumers with interior designers and contractors, and leveraging A/R and Computer Vision to help customers visualize products in their space.
Ad Tech & Customer Intelligence (ATCI) builds products that let Wayfair communicate with new and existing customers effectively across advertising, email, and onsite touchpoints. This team is at the intersection of product, marketing, data science, and technology which allows us to be a leader in the Ad Technology space.
Our Supply Chain product team ensures the right products are in stock, in the right places, at the right time, with the right cost profile to enable valuable delivery experiences for our customers, and differentiated value for our suppliers and carriers. We power availability, speed, and cost reduction across the value chain, from forecast to home delivery and post-delivery services.
Our Operations Product teams (Catalog, Sales, Service, and Enterprise) drive the development of the world-class software products that power Wayfairs transformation of retail for home. These teams create new and innovative services for customers and build the backbone of Wayfairs pricing, merchandising, and enterprise operations. Whether on desktop, mobile web, app, or any of our proprietary internal platforms, we leverage data, user-centric design, machine learning, and Agile to achieve operational excellence, fueling company growth.

Across all product teams we have a modern tech stack including sophisticated capabilities around AI, data science, multivariate testing and personalization. Were a highly collaborative, supportive team that values learning, psychological safety and intentional career development.

What Youll Do:

Establish vision, strategy and product roadmap for a cross functional group of development teams across all platforms. You will own your roadmap, measure performance, keep your pulse on the customer, anticipate bottlenecks, make tradeoffs, and take acceptable risks to maximize the benefit for our customer and business
Build and lead a cross-functional team of engineers, designers, analysts, data scientists, and other internal partners to envision, build, and deliver experiences that impact tens of millions of consumers
Lead your teams to deliver business impact by launching and iteratively optimizing products that improve our user experience in ways that lead to scalable, measurable gains in metrics that you will largely define

What Youll Need:

7+ years of product management experience in an agile development environment, ideally with exposure to a relevant product area (eCommerce or B2C; SaaS platforms; API experience)
3+ years experience successfully leading and growing teams that are highly effective both in terms of business impact and team culture
Excellent analytical skills with demonstrated experience with hypothesis-driven learning and turning data into actionable insights
Superior communication skills with demonstrated ability to navigate a complex organization and generate buy-in for ideas and plans
Entrepreneurial mindset, with a bias for action and ability to deal with ambiguity and rapidly changing environments
Bachelors degree or equivalent practical experience

Wayfair is one of the worlds largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, were reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If youre looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then youll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. Were a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair and world for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. Thats why were proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.Apply Now

title: Automotive Application Engineer / Technical Account Manager
job_description:
Shape the way innovative automotive technology companies develop their products through the use of MATLAB and Simulink.

Leverage your industry experience and technical expertise in autonomous systems, control system design, modeling and simulation, or embedded software development to understand customer workflows, challenges, and key business initiatives. With that knowledge, you will paint a vision of how MathWorks products can accelerate the pace of their development and innovation. You will also establish yourself as a trusted advisor to strategic MathWorks customers and provide technical leadership by providing guidance on best practices, direction on workflow improvements, and connections to other MathWorks support teams.

Travel can be expected between 30-40%, generally throughout North America. This position is based in Santa Clara, CA.


Collaborate with sales account managers, other technical specialists, and marketing stakeholders at MathWorks in creating and executing an overall account development plan.
Engage with prospective customers (from engineers to executives) to understand their business-critical projects and their unique workflows
Build and maintain long term relationships with customer decision makers and end users
Serve as the initial point of contact for all business-critical customer projects
Prepare and deliver presentations and product demonstrations that highlight how MathWorks tools address customer needs
Scope technical projects and coordinate with other technical specialists to address customer needs in specialized application areas
Advocate internally on behalf of the customer to ensure their needs are understood for future product direction

Professional work experience with automotive development processes
Working knowledge of Model-Based Design as a methodology is a plus
Highly motivated towards working directly with customers, showing strong business acumen

Candidates must be willing to travel 25% to 50% of the time
Experience with MATLAB
Experience with Simulink
A bachelor's degree and 7 years of professional work experience (or a master's degree and 5 years of professional work experience, or a PhD degree) is required.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Product Manager

 Product ManagerJob Location AZ - Scottsdale, AZDescription Parchment's Product team guides the technology innovation that helps to turn credentials into opportunities for tens of millions of learners, enabling sustainable growth, serving our users and our business. Bringing the interests of Parchment's network of institutions to our internal teams, we work to make our services better every day; Join us and help to amplify the work of educators around the globe as learners seek greater education and employment.

As a Product Manager at Parchment you’ll be responsible for a portfolio of services that the market see as must-have for creating, processing, and delivering academic and professional credentials. Here are some of the most important things you'll do:

Be a domain expert who can balance a thirty thousand foot view, with a view from the ground on the state of credentialing at secondary and postsecondary educational institutions, among the related data standards organizations, and in the technology community that supports education.

Back your hard-earned intuition with business cases that show the financial benefit of your hypotheses.

Build a product roadmap that guides the evolution of form and function of credentials, supporting the organizations that issue credentials, the learners who have earned those credentials, and the verifiers who need to evaluate them.

Assist in the design, planning, testing, implementation, training and support of new products and feature enhancements.

Draw insights and inspiration from our users research, trends in the market, and colleagues throughout Parchment to imagine, then implement, the future of our services.

Help development teams efficiently and continuously deliver value to our markets.

Understand and distill the challenges our users and Support teams face to prioritize ad hoc work on to resolve emergent issues.

Get the best out of others by operating as an effective teammate in a distributed organization.

Exert your influence by representing Parchment through documentation, pitches, and presentations.

Find your place on a happy, results-driven team of accomplished, talented, and hard-working product and engineering leaders.

To be a good fit on our team, it’s important that you are:

A natural leader. Your track record shows a nature of independent thought and skill at bringing people together, formally or informally, to accomplish something you believe.

A communicator and listener. You have years of experience collaborating effectively with prospects and customers, sales and support staff, engineers and partners. You evangelize a vision that builds our business, but can only be realized through the work of others, and you regularly iterate that vision through observation and experimentation.

A proven operator. You’ve been instrumental in building great software and you know the craft of Product Management.

A ruthless simplifier. In what you say and what you make happen, efficiency and effectiveness come first.Qualifications 

3+ years of software product management experience.
Proven track record of managing all aspects of a multi-million annual revenue product throughout its lifecycle.
Solid technical background and hands-on experience with agile software development, SaaS strategies and solutions.
BS or MS in Information or Computer Science, or equivalent work experience.
> 10% business travel required.
Position can be based in Parchment offices in Scottsdale, AZ, Sacramento, CA, or Deerfield, IL.

title: Product Owner/Product Manager - Cyber Security Platforms
job_description:
LookingGlass Cyber Solutions Product Management Team is seeking an experienced, resourceful Product Owner to join our growing company. In this position, you will be responsible for defining product capabilities and managing the roadmap to ensure continuity in current product offerings, and to identify potential product extensions and future New Product Development within your part of the Lookingglass portfolio.

You should have a solid grasp on Agile methodologies, and experience with business- and requirements-analysis, product/market fit, and customer/prospect interactions that are needed in order to deliver a high-quality product that solves customer problems.

In this role, you will help move an early-stage enterprise software product with a rapidly-growing pipeline of enterprise customers into a major contributor to the business. You will develop and implement product strategies to respond to changing and/or competitive conditions, which may include pricing strategies and overall product positioning in concert with our Product Marketing team.

Key Responsibilities include:

Identifies business opportunities through field partnership, market analysis, understanding of customer pain points and a holistic view of the company’s entire product portfolioDevelops product vision, roadmap and requirements (MRD/PRDs) for differentiated product and solution offerings by working with customers, sales, and engineeringClearly expresses customer needs in the form of user stories and product requirements, clearly logged and documentedPrioritizes and sequences backlog items to best achieve goals and missions and manages tradeoffs in allocating engineering and other resourcesRefines backlog based on product changes, dev progress and stakeholder feedbackEnsures that the Product Backlog is visible, transparent, and clear to all, and shows what the development team will work on nextEnsures the development team understands the requirements for items in the Product Backlog to the level of detail needed for successful, as-intended implementation, and communicates with the engineers why each item is aligned with product strategy and customer needsIs the sole person responsible and accountable for managing the Product backlogCollaborates in development of the Sprint/Iteration Backlog, and setting of the Sprint GoalsDecides whether to release an increment of functionalityWorks closely with and ensures regular communication with Product Marketing and other stakeholders such CTO Office, Sales and Sales Engineering and Support to ensure smooth customer on-boarding and delivery.Identifies and helps define use cases, competitive positioning, product marketing programs, contracts and materials required to make our sales team successful in selling the product

Qualifying Requirements:

Minimum of 2 years experience within an Agile software development, customer support, or sales engineering organization. Excellent time-management, communication and organizational skills to manage the intersection of teams, stakeholders and needs inherent in the Product Management/Development processExperience in business analysis, solutions development, and requirements gathering and refinement within an agile software development organizationAn ability to thrive in an uncertain environment and adapt to change. This is a role that you will help define and grow over timeSolid experience with JIRA and other Atlassian tools or similar (Rally, VersionOne etc.)Proven experience defining and creating processes that streamline the people-centered value chain in software developmentExperience working on a Scrum team participating in Agile activities e.g. daily standups, backlog grooming, sprint planning, sprint demos/retrospectivesSolid understanding of software engineering practices for the full SDLC including coding standards, code reviews, source control, build processes, testing, and operations

title: Director of Product, Data
job_description:
GSN Games, a subsidiary of Sony Pictures Entertainment, is looking for a Lead Product Manager, Data Services to join our team in San Francisco!

The GSN Data team teams provides end to end data solutions to GSN Game studios. This includes the machine learning algorithms that power mission critical aspects of our games portfolio, Data Engineering/Infrastructure services such as data pipelines, AB test platforms, targeting tools, etc. as well as best-in-class Analytics team and User Research teams. Combined, they work together with a group of highly talented individuals and key decision makers to make GSN Games a fun and rich experience for players.

What You’ll Do
You will be a thought leader on the roadmap and planning process these teams take on to execute in their individual technical domains. Recent projects the team has worked on: Machine Learning algorithms including LTV/churn/payer prediction, segmentation; Data Infrastructure initiatives including vendor analysis (AWS, GCP, Vertica), onboarding our next generation reporting tools including Tableau, internally built AB Test, targeting platforms, etc. This is an exceptional opportunity to apply your organizational skills to shape the future of GSN Games’ roadmap.

You Will:
Collaborate with GSN game studio leads to ensure the Data team’s roadmap aligns to our their strategic objectives
Drive adoption and evangelize data products across the organization 
Work very closely with the Data Engineering team on key Big Data Initiatives to ensure our platform is, and remains, cutting edge. This includes working with new offerings on AWS, GCP/BigQuery, Vertica and Spark technologies.
Work closely with our Analytics, ML and Player insights team to ensure their products are supported and aligned closely with the rest of the team
Partner with game studios to solve business-critical questions. Sometimes these questions are brought to us, and sometimes we bring these questions to the game teams.
Manage and mentor our Data Technical Project Manager, who will be responsible for our execution of our technical roadmap. 
Help develop best practices with data and analytic techniques across the game studios.
Keep up with industry trends and developments.
About You:
5+ years’ experience in related product management, preferably with machine learning platforms, data architectures, and analytics. Candidate should have strategic insights, be able to create vision and develop strategy.
Experience leading and managing large projects that span various groups.
Experience working and communicating with a variety of global stakeholders (engineering, UA, product, e-staff)
Direct experience working with data engineering teams on highly technical products / platforms.
Experience with JIRA, Confluence, and other product management tools
Experience building data science roadmaps for marketing or advertising centric products
Deep knowledge of data science and product development lifecycles, and associated processes to transform ideas into successful features
Excellent communication skills.
BS in a quantitative field such as math, economics, or computer science (MS/MBA preferred)
Experience in gaming a strong plus.

job_description:

title: Product Manager
job_description:
POSITION: PRODUCT MANAGER

Summary:

The Product Manager will be part of the Product Management Team and will focus on Commercial and Small Business Cash Management Products. This person’s responsibilities includes managing their products to ensure they meet customer’s needs, developing a product road map, defining product strategy and implementing new features and capabilities.

Key Result Areas:

Act as subject matter expert on assigned cash management products
Define a product roadmap and strategy for assigned cash management products by leveraging market analysis, competitive knowledge, and customer research
Focus on product enhancements and launch new products as needed to meet the product road map
Partner across the organization to understand product/service demand for your product and related requirements
Evaluate new and existing product opportunities and brings forward proposals for products to optimize and expand the banks offering
Manage product roll outs from start to finish
Regularly review and re-evaluate competitive landscape comparing features, pricing, design and overall competitiveness
Create and maintain product material such as procedures, user guides, customer communications and marketing materials
Developed and conduct product training as needed
Provide product expertise to the customer service, implementation, and cash management teams as needed
Drive adoption of owned cash management products across the commercial and small business portfolio
Prepare product data tracking and present to management on a monthly basis
Partner with Risk, compliance and other areas to ensure products adhere to all relevant regulatory requirements
Build critical partnerships with key business lines (Cash Management, Retail Operations, Small Business Development Officers, Risk, IT)
Perform additional duties as required

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree required, MBA preferred
Five plus years of industry experience
Drive self-starter with the ability to multitask, prioritize and meet deadlines
Strong analysis skills and ability to interpret data against business objectives
Excel, Word, and PowerPoint proficiency are a must
Ability to work independently in fast paced environment
Strong business communication skills, to include both written and oral
The ability to solve problems quickly and make decisions in an independent manner seeking assistance from Management as needed

The above description covers the most significant responsibilities but does not exclude other occasional responsibilities and accountabilities, the inclusion of which would be in conformity with the major purpose of this job.

Location:

Waltham, Massachusetts

About Cambridge Savings Bank:

Cambridge Savings Bank is a full-service financial institution with approximately $4 billion in assets that is committed to improving the quality of life in the communities it serves. One of the oldest and largest community banks in Massachusetts, Cambridge Savings Bank offers a full line of individual and business banking services and has branches located in Arlington, Bedford, Belmont, Burlington, Cambridge, Charlestown, Concord, Lexington, Newton, and Watertown.

Cambridge Savings Bank is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
ABOUT US
True Digital Surgery is a World Leader in Computer-Guided Microsurgery. We combine 3D visualization and guidance software applications focused on improving accuracy, efficiency and outcomes for surgeons and patients. Our medical imaging and guidance system employs advanced real-time 3D graphic capabilities and proprietary software that is sold to surgeons and hospitals all over the world.
SUMMARY
The Product Manager must ensure that TDS products support the company’s overall strategy, revenue & customer satisfaction goals. Responsible for the product planning and execution throughout the Product Lifecycle, the product manager will gather and prioritize product & customer requirements; define the product vision; and work closely with engineering, sales, marketing & support to facilitate successful product development.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Define product strategies and roadmaps
Deliver robust MRDs and PRDs with prioritized features and corresponding justification
Work with internal teams to develop and market core products and line extensions
Run beta and pilot programs with early-stage products and samples
Provide expert guidance with respect to relevant technologies and the competition

REQUIRED COMPETENCIES
To perform the job successfully, an individual will demonstrate the following competencies:

Minimum of five years of experience as a Product Manager
Demonstrated success in defining and launching relevant and successful products
3+ years of experience in the neurosurgical market (Cranial, ENT, Spine)
Technical background, with experience in video technology, computers, software development optics and/or robotics a plus. Agile development experience a plus.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Bachelor’s degree (MBA preferred)
Excellent teamwork skills
Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority
Must be able to travel 25% of the time

QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Language: Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of an organization.
Mathematics: Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry.
Reasoning: Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds and frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include color, distance and close vision.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently exposed to work near moving mechanical parts. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
Benefits:
We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by our competitive compensation and an extensive benefits package including paid time off, medical, dental and vision benefits and future growth opportunities within the company. Plus, we work to maintain the best possible environment
To Apply:
To respond to this opportunity, please apply through this ad.
For more information about us, please visit www.truedigitalsurgery.com
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
