title: Project Manager / Scrum Master
job_description:
About us

Teaching Strategies is a high growth, private-equity backed, market leading business in early childhood education. The Company provides the most innovative and effective curriculum, assessment, professional development, and family connection resources to programs serving children from birth through 3rd grade. With ground-breaking print and SaaS solutions and a strong belief that the most powerful way to impact child outcomes is to improve teacher effectiveness, Teaching Strategies has been supporting the critical work of early childhood educators for over 30 years.

Located in downtown Bethesda, MD, our company's headquarters are within steps from Bethesda Row and the Bethesda Metro stop. Candidates who fit with our values, vision, and mission will find a work environment that fosters creativity, innovation and career growth. We are building a team of results-oriented individuals who will thrive in a collaborative, work-hard/play-hard culture. We pride ourselves on the impact we have on the early childhood field through supporting teachers who are doing the most important work there is, teaching children to become creative, confident thinkers.

What's In It for You

Teaching Strategies offers our employees a robust suite of benefits and other perks which include:

Medical, dental, and vision coverage for spouses, domestic partners, and childrenPre-tax medical and dependent care flexible spending accounts (FSA)Health savings accounts with employer contributions401(k) plan with employer matchCompany sponsored life, short and long term disability insuranceVoluntary life and critical illness insuranceCommuter benefitsGenerous paid time off (which includes Winter Break)Free on-site gymPaid parental leave programsProfessional development and growth opportunitiesEmployee referral bonusesCasual dress environmentCompany sponsored eventsCompetitive compensation package
Position overview:

If you are a talented technology leader who can thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, project-driven environment then you have an opportunity to join the technology group at Teaching Strategies in Bethesda, MD. Working with a team of other technology leaders, product managers, software and QA engineers you will design, develop, and implement our industry leading SaaS products used by early childhood educators. The company is looking for a highly motivated individual that will work closely with other technology team leaders and will support the implementation of the company products roadmap. As a leader of the technology team, the individual will interface with directly with key business partners and help drive our product innovation.

You are a creative thinker, you love to understand the ins and outs of your organization, and you strive to find winning resolutions. You have a high level of integrity and sense of urgency to "make things happen" and will work collaboratively across project teams to achieve project goals.

The Role

This individual will create and manage the project plan and track project progress including dependencies, constraints, and assumptions. They will manage the risk index, identify resource gaps and delays as needed to ensure the project stays on track. Following Teaching Strategy scrum guidelines, they will lead daily Scrum and weekly Scrum of Scrum meetings to compile project status updates, updating project plans and removing obstacles and roadblocks for project team members. Lastly, the ideal candidate will be able to encourage velocity, quality, and efficiency while adhering to coding, quality assurance, and project execution best practices.

The individual will be responsible for:

Tracking project performance to ensure successful implementation of short and long term goalsDevelop and maintain detailed project plans and schedulesMaintain the risk index and identify sources to mitigate risksMonitor project progress and keep stakeholders informed throughout the project lifecycle

Responsibilities:

Organize, lead and monitor technology projectsResponsible for managing resources utilization, project scope, deadlines, and budgetEstablish, track and report on project KPIsFacilitate regular project status meetings with stakeholders and teams Prepare Executive and Board level status reportsParticipates in the resource capacity planning sessionsLead daily scrum meetings and other agile processes as neededEscalate potential project issues in a timely manner and develop a risk management plan with stakeholdersManage project vendors

Minimum Requirements:



5+ years of demonstrated knowledge and experience with managing software (product) development projects through their entire life cycle (including launch and implementation) using automated management tools2+ years of experience in an Agile environment, preferably as a Scrum MasterAbility to organize and lead multiple projects simultaneouslyExperience managing both onsite and geographically distributed project teamsUnderstanding of complex technical operations environments Strong advisory and presentation skillsAdvanced time management and analytical skills

Flexible and willing to accept a change in priorities as necessary Strong attention to detailThorough understanding of project/program management techniques and methodsWorking knowledge of change management principlesExcellent communication skillsExcellent problem-solving ability

Desired Skills:

Project Management Professional (PMP), Agile / Scrum (ACP) or other similar industry-recognized certificationsHands-on experience with Atlassian Tools (JIRA, Confluence) or comparable Agile suiteExperience with industry standard project management toolsExperience as a business analyst writing requirements documentation, epics, and user stories

Education:

BS in Computer Science, Business, Information Management or relevant industry experience is required

Teaching Strategies, LLC is committed to creating a diverse workplace and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer of Minorities, all Genders, Protected Veterans and Individual with Disabilities.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Summary of Job

The Product Manger works at a mid-level to translate business requirements into functional requirement specification documents and functional designs for electronic health record (EHR) and practice management software (PMS) applications.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

• Conduct meetings and discussions to achieve consensus on product features and functionality.

• Research the existing product and customer requests to determine the desired functionality for a new product line.

• Create wireframes of proposed UI for the assigned modules.

• Write functional specifications based on the research and meetings done for each module assigned.

• Conduct review sessions of functional specifications to obtain approval from all necessary parties.

• Support the approved functional specifications through the Design, Development and QA processes.

• Communicates with high-level personnel; Sales, Senior Management, Support, Development, QA, and external customers, including Providers, Billing Staff, CEOs, CFOs, etc.

• Organize and prioritize many high priority items, determine strategic goals.

• Works directly with customers, research and write specifications based on their requests.

Qualifications

• Experience defining functional software requirements is preferable, but not required

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills

• Good analytical thinking skills

• Good planning, organizing, decision-making and problem-solving skills

• Good judgment skills

• Ability to take initiative

• Solid history of establishing and meeting work schedules with limited time frames and under tight deadlines

• Ability to adhere to standards and procedures

• Ability to organize material, analyze a wide variety of facts and develop appropriate recommendations

• Strong grasp of technology and how it plays a role in business processes

• Knowledge of Microsoft Office Systems including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

• Ability to understand workflow within the PM system and EMR system

• Ability to establish attainable goals, objectives, and work plans

• Ability to multitask and adjust priorities in a busy and changing work environment

• Excellent communication and customer service skills

• Experience with prior EMRs

• Experience with Agile methodology

• Self-motivated and able to work without close supervision

Education and/or Experience

Minimum of 2 years of work experience in a medical practice environment is preferable, but not required or experience working in the software development life cycle.

Language Skills

Employees are required to speak, read and write English

Physical Demands / Work Environment

All employees must be able to lift 50lbs

title: Technical Program Manager
job_description:
Job Title: Technical Program Manager
Location: Washington, DC
Main Purpose of the job: Oversight and execution of WECommunity Platform and USAID Project
Job Type: Full-Time
Organization Information: WEConnect International, a corporate-led global non-profit, helps women-owned businesses access and succeed in global value chains. WEConnect International has since 2009 provided business education, certification, and business connections to companies based outside the United Sates that are at least 51 percent owned, managed and controlled by one or more women. WEConnect International corporate members represent over $1 trillion in annual purchasing power and are true pioneers in inclusive sourcing and global supplier development. www.WEConnectInternational.org
Job Overview: The Program Manager is primarily responsible for leading, managing, and successfully overseeing all aspects of a USAID funded technology project with SAP Ariba designed to connect buyers with women-owned businesses based in developing countries. The position may also require management of additional projects. Applies seasoned project management expertise to coordinate between the WEConnect International team and corporate stakeholders to design, monitor, control and provide transparent reporting on the status and implementation of mission-critical technology solutions.
The scope of responsibilities includes, but is not limited to, vendor management, data analysis and reporting; requirements traceability matrix; delivering project milestones on time; assessment and mitigation of fiscal, legal, political, regulatory and other risks; and coordination of project activities throughout the project lifecycle.
Core Values and Culture: As we continue to grow our impact, WEConnect International will attract and hold accountable members, partners, staff and stakeholders based on these core values, which help to define our culture, brand and operational strategies.

Embrace Diversity and Inclusion to Unleash Potential
Demonstrate Passion for Women's Economic Empowerment
Make a Positive Difference in the World
Deliver Stakeholder Value
Exemplify Integrity in Everything We Do
Pursue Teamwork with a Shared Vision and Purpose
Embrace Openness, Trust and Candid Communication

 
Job Responsibilities: To help ensure the efficient and effective management, growth, and impact of WEConnect International in accordance with its mission and regulation, the position is required to:

Manage projects with top-down oversight throughout entire execution to ensure success of scope, budget, and timeline while adhering to USAID and US Government Program regulations
Liaison with the implementation vendors to ensure alignment with requirements. Manage the work of the sub-contractors to ensure quality delivery
Develop and lead the strategy implementation to increase connections between buyers and sellers and user adoption of the new platform
Ensure quality review and implementation of business requirements and coordinate various stakeholders during all project phases, from initial development through implementation
Monitor project progress continuously and develop detailed bi-weekly status reports on measurable items, such as milestones and deliverables
Develop data migration plan, testing plan and rollout strategy for the new platform
Communicate proactively with all relevant staff to provide encouragement, identify problems, create solutions, and implement efficiency improvements
Oversee acquisition of resources and materials in accordance with US Government regulations, including negotiating price and payment agreements with vendors
Lead multidisciplinary and global project team across the project
Manage technology releases; understanding dependencies between different releases and liaising with other project partner representatives to facilitate good communication, innovation and problem solving
Manage expectations for the delivery of the project and escalating issues on deadlines as early as possible to senior management to enable appropriate corrective action to be taken
Oversee the maintenance of the new platform and manage the platform, post implementation

 
Qualifications
Education

Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Project Management, Business Administration, Computer Science or a related discipline
Project management professional certification, preferred

Experience and Skills

8+ years of experience managing all phases of large complex IT projects including design, budgets, risk assessment, and mitigation, preferably using Agile methodologies
Understanding of Federal contracting regulations
Understanding of data Monitoring and Evaluation techniques
Ability to organize and lead cross-functional project teams to produce deliverables on-time and within budget
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing, including status reports, project summaries, scoping documents, lessons learned, and other project-related documentation
Ability to understand agendas of other functions, groups, and business units within WEConnect International and to integrate that understanding into the decision-making process of the team
SAP Ariba implementation experience, preferred
Experience working within Department of State, USAID, or other US Federal agencies with focus on developing countries, preferred
The successful candidate must not be subject to past employment restrictions

title: Restaurant Assistant Manager
job_description: Assistant Managers will learn to do all aspects of running a restaurant from ordering product to interviewing employees and running profitable shifts. Candidates should be quick learners with a long term goal of becoming a general manager. title: Senior Product Manager (Mobile Game Developer)
job_description:
Senior Product Manager (Mobile Game Developer)

If you’re an experienced Product Manager looking for a place to work that will treat you with respect and will challenge you intellectually, then this may be a fit.

You will lead a small product team (3 other PMs and various Producers), so you’ll work closely with your peers. Our hope is that you’ll teach as well as learn.

The Job:
You will analyze data, develop insights, make decisions, and define actions to take. Your scope will be across all our current games, but focused on what you think will drive the most impact. So basically... product management.

What We are Looking For:
-- Brilliance - the ability to synthesize large amounts of information from multiple disciplines quickly and make decisions that have life or death impact on the health of the company
-- Empathy - understanding what drives the emotions of players
-- Attention to Detail - oftentimes, the tiniest factors have the biggest impact.
-- 2+ years of Mobile Games Experience
-- 1+ years managing Product team

Who We Are:
Super Lucky is a large, independent developer of mobile games. We make social casino (slots) games and casual (word & puzzle) games. We’re profitable and growing quickly. We've been around for 9 years. We produce some of the most fun and highly-rated apps on Apple’s Appstore & Google Play!

We work as a team. Everyone helps everyone. Everyone is a teacher. Everyone is a student. Overall, our goal is to make our team better at what we do.

PERKS:
This position is full-time with some schedule flexibility. We offer hyper-competitive compensation, full benefits, and PTO. We encourage personal growth and provide everyone an opportunity to grow in whichever direction they are most interested! Check out our rating on Glassdoor.

Recruiters of any sort are NOT welcome to contact us about filling our open positions.

To Apply:
Please visit our Senior Product Manager job posting on our website: www.superlucky.com/jobs

title: Program Manager
job_description:
Responsible for the quality of child care services and the performance of the staff within the group home. The role of the Program Manager is critical to the growth and development of the program’s potential. By utilizing his/her personality, knowledge, skills and leadership ability, the Program Managers assures that a high quality of child care standards is maintained. The Program Manager is also responsible for reinforcing the implementation of the Department’s philosophy and program.
Bachelor's degree in Social Work or related field and a minimum of over 3 years experience in casework supervision or supervision of personnel required OR Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 4 years related experience. 
Must have a valid driver’s license and driving record in accordance with agency standards. 
Must be able to type a minimum of 30 words per minute. Proficient in Microsoft Office with special attention to Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint.

title: Insurance Product Manager
job_description:
At Kin, we’re looking for self-motivated thinkers ready to make a change for our customers. We value tackling challenges and breaking down walls – but being chill about it.
Kin Insurance is an insur-tech startup that sells affordable, user-friendly homeowners insurance. Unlike many startups that gather users and figure out how to be profitable later, we are selling a product that homeowners need and depend on now. We’re innovating in an industry largely untouched by tech, so we are always thinking big. 
We believe autonomy is key to job satisfaction, which is why we say the person closest to the problem should solve it. It’s also why we offer unlimited vacation time: we trust in our team to manage their own projects and time. If you want the chance to develop your skills, work with some of the best minds in the industry, and see what you’re really capable of, come learn and grow with us.
So, what’s the role?
Kin is revolutionizing the home insurance industry. We think homeowners deserve better, so we’re making the process of quoting and purchasing insurance easier. 
In order to continue to offer innovative products and services, we need to expand our team of Insurance Product experts. We’re looking for innovative thinkers who agree with us, insurance can be exciting! This individual will bring their industry expertise and lend a hand to multiple areas of the business including managing to profitable growth for our lines of business and assigned states. You’ll be responsible for all aspects of management including pricing, policy and forms, underwriting, agency management, regulatory, planning, project management, and implementation. 
We’ll look to you to develop integrated state-specific strategies including actuarial, claims, distribution and other functional areas as well as to align and measure goals set against our financial plans. A day in the life could include


P&L responsibility for line of business and/or statesRepresenting Kin as a company expert and authority on line of business and/or states including detailed understanding of market underwriting, pricing, competitors, agencies, business mix, regulationsCreate line of business / state strategies including all operational goals and measures including; customer experience and satisfaction, policyholder retention, quotes, sales, conversion, new business growth, underwriting quality, price segmentation, agency management, and claims trendsAlign operational goals and measures across functions for financial planning and evaluation Project management including planning, business requirements quality, timeliness, and qualityFile and gain approval of changes requiring regulatory approval Communicate and plan state strategies with managers across all functional areas and leadership teamLead line of business and state teams 


I’ve got the skills...but do I have the necessary ones?


BS degree ideally with a focus in mathematics, finance, accounting, engineering, or other quantitative disciplineProven success leading lines of business or state teams Ability to create lines of business and state strategies supported by operational plans and measuresHighly motivated to improve the insurance industry Strong attention to detail and qualityPassion for customer service and doing things the right way5+ years of relevant work experience


Oh, and don’t worry, we’ve got you covered. 
Being in the insurance industry we recognize the importance of comprehensive benefits for you and your family. That’s why we provide a variety of options and coverage levels to customize a plan that’s right for you. 
MedicalDentalVisionCommuter Benefit PlansFlexible PTOFlex Spending Accounts401kDisability InsuranceLife Insurance Onsite gym membershipCompany provided lunch several times a monthRotating option of snacks, dailySodas, unlimited flavored waters, coffee
These are just some of the benefits and perks we provide!

job_description:
At Kin, we’re looking for self-motivated thinkers ready to make a change for our customers. We value tackling challenges and breaking down walls – but being chill about it.
Kin Insurance is an insurtech startup that sells affordable, user-friendly homeowners insurance. title: Sr. Product Manager, Salesforce CXI
job_description:
At Bluebeam, we empower people to advance the way the world is built. We create smart software solutions that make construction sites more efficient, connected and safe and improve the lives of design and construction professionals everywhere.

In order to make the impact on our world that we desire to, we know that our people are what matters most. To fully embody our purpose requires building and developing an extraordinary team of people who are committed to the success of each of our customers and to their fellow employees.

*This role is a full-time, onsite position. Due to the Corona Virus, all new employees will be required to start work remotely until we are able to return to the office. More information will be provided in the interview process.*

We hire people who:

Have integrity
See challenges as opportunities
Are committed to continual improvement
Demonstrate trust and are willing to be vulnerable about mistakes and weaknesses
Engage in positive, productive conflict and unfiltered debate of ideas
Can fully commit to corporate decisions, even if they disagree with some of them
Hold peers accountable in order to ensure we achieve our company goals on behalf of our customers
Are laser-focused upon achievement of Bluebeam's companywide results

In summary, Bluebeam employees are a team of people committed to winning together as we work to create real value for our customers. And we are committed to winning the right way – both ethically and as a team.

What we're looking for:

Bluebeam is looking for a Sr. Product Manager to develop the systems that help us connect customers around the world with our solutions. You will play an important role in building the applications that support our customer-facing products, provide an amazing experience for our customers, and enable efficiency for your fellow Bluebeamers. But you won't go it alone. You'll work closely with Sales, Sales Ops, Marketing, Finance, other Product teams, and Technical Support teams to ensure a smooth integration of business-critical systems including Salesforce.com, NetSuite, and additional applications. You'll have the chance to make an immediate impact while paving the way for future initiatives that support Bluebeam's growth around the globe. Are you in?

What you'll do:

Be the product owner for Bluebeam Salesforce.com CPQ, Billing, Netsuite, as well as other Sales Cloud, and integration capabilities
Leverage Salesforce.com capabilities to support our Sales, Marketing, and Finance departments by streamlining and adding value to our sales productivity, lead management, license management capabilities, web store functionality, operation processes, and finance applications
Optimize experience for both Bluebeam internal and external customers by coordinating with cross-functional teams, introducing innovative ideas, triage departmental requests, organize product roadmap, as well as designing and implementing efficient solutions across platforms and devices
Convert business requirements into functional requirements and system design across Salesforce.com and integration with other systems
Work closely with internal customers, software engineers, delivery managers, and consultants to execute on product initiatives leveraging Agile methodology
Work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to collect business requirements, research and identify end user needs, and convert business requirements into functional requirements and high-level system design
Drive product implementation and provide input to product roadmap

What we'd like to see in you:

Proficiency in Salesforce.com platform, especially for CPQ, Billing, and other Salescloud related capabilities.
Working knowledge of Netsuite or other enterprise financial applications and integrations
Minimum 3 years of CPQ or other quoting tool experience
Minimum 5 years of product management experience building enterprise solutions on the Salesforce.com platform
Working knowledge of CRM, ERP, and in-house application integrations
A demonstrated record of product management with a results-oriented approach supporting internal users and external customers
Ability to communicate using wireframes, user stories, whiteboarding, or other similar methods
Experience in iterative software delivery methodologies – Agile, SCRUM, etc.
Ability to communicate complex idea to a wide range of audience
Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills with attention to details
Technical and analytical aptitude or background, data driven decision focus a big plus
Exceptional written/verbal communication and presentation skills
Knowledge of and experience with Enterprise B2B business models a plus
Experience with APIs and 3rd party integrations a plus
…And there is no escaping the basics: flexible, likeable, well-presented, and able to work well with cross functional teams and/or with ambiguity
A Bachelor's degree; Master's degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, or Information Systems a plus

Tell us about yourself.

Share your resume and a cover letter that explains why you believe you'd be a fit for Bluebeam and this position.

Impeccable writing skills are essential to all we do, and we weigh cover letters heavily. We love a cover letter that shows us your personality, but don't stress if you're not a comedian. Just be yourself. We're mostly interested in learning who you are, what you love to do, and why you'd love to do it here with us. And if you send us the generic one you send everyone else, we'll be bummed.

About Bluebeam

The construction industry is adopting new technology at a feverish pace. Tablets and cell phones are replacing paper blueprints, drones are surveying jobsites in 3D, and cloud collaboration is changing the way teams work together. Bluebeam plays a crucial role in this transformation. The key to our success is a customer-focused approach to product development: we work with the industry to create solutions for the industry. Today, over 1.6 million people throughout the world use Bluebeam. In the US, we're a critical partner for the majority of top AEC firms, and rapidly expanding our presence globally, with offices in Sweden, Germany and the UK.

Come design and build your future with us.

Bluebeam is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or veteran status.

title: Store Manager
company_name: LAABH, Inc and its Affiliates DBA as Dunkin/Baskin Robbins
job_description:
You are applying for work with a franchisee of Dunkin' Donuts /Baskin-Robbins, not Dunkin' Brands, Inc. or any of its affiliates. Any application or information you submit will be provided solely to the franchisee. If hired, the franchisee will be your only employer. Franchisees are independent business owners who are solely responsible for their own employees and set their own wage and benefit programs that can vary among franchisees 2017.
Leadership is responsible for coaching Crew Members throughout their shift to execute Dunkin' Donuts operational standards and deliver a great guest experience. They set goals, provide job assignments, and motivate others, celebrating successes and providing timely feedback to correct deficiencies. They also have responsibilities in specific departments such as scheduling and inventory controls.If you enjoy working in a fast-paced, fun-paced environment that is challenging and allows you to apply your personality and skills in a variety of ways, becoming a Leader for a Dunkin' Donuts franchisee is a great career choice. Our team is committed to making our guests' day by serving them with a great product, a smile, and heck, maybe even a joke or two. Everyone on our team, from our franchisee to our manager to our crew members, works together and takes pride in doing a good job. If you are ready to roll up your sleeves and work with a winning team, then join our dynamic, award-winning franchise!Responsibilities Include:

Flexible availability and willingness to work changing hours based on the needs of the restaurant.
Talk employees into, through, and out of position on each shift, communicating responsibilities, providing feedback, and recognizing achievements in a respectful manner.
Deploy team members appropriately to meet guests' needs and service standards throughout shift.
Support training of Crew Members.
Communicate goals and hold team members accountable for performance during shift.
Hold guests as highest priority and role model exceptional guest service.
Drive sense of urgency through Crew Members to satisfy guests' needs and resolve problems.
Reinforce the use of systems, tools, and procedures throughout shift, while taking appropriate steps to correct deficiencies.
Monitor team performance to ensure quality, service, and cleanliness standards are met.
Ensure restaurant standards and marketing initiatives are properly executed.
Follow all and implement systems and processes to control labor costs, food costs, and cash throughout shift.
Monitor and ensure Crew Members comply with all policies and procedures related to cleanliness, food safety, and restaurant safety and security.
Report equipment issues, provide Crew Member performance feedback and discuss other restaurant opportunities with other Store Leadership.
Comply with all restaurant, Brand, and franchisee policies.

Qualifications:

Must be able to fluently speak/read English
Math and writing skills
Supervisory Experience Necessary (In a restaurant field)
Guest Focus - anticipate and understand guests' needs and exceed their expectations
Passion for Results - set compelling targets and deliver on commitments
Problem Solving and Decision Making - make good decisions based on analysis, experience, and judgment
Building Effective Teams - get the right people in the right places, enabling them to make decisions and celebrate success as a team
The desire for Career Development

Benefits Include:

Competitive Pay with appropriate experience and availability.
Employee Meal Discount
Medical Insurance with Company contribution (full-time employees)
Career Development and Training Programs
Paid Vacation Time
Opportunities for advancement within the company

title: General Manager
job_description:
General Manager
We are looking for a highly motivated General Manager to join our team.
POSITION SUMMARY: The General Manager has overall responsibility is to ensure the gym achieves its revenue and expense control goals to thereby hit profitability goals. This will be achieved by effectively managing all facets of operations to include membership, service and product sales and promotions; facility, personnel and customer experience management and ensuring that the gym is running efficiently and in compliance with Company policies and procedures.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:


Well-developed understanding and use of management skills such as recruitment, selection, training and development, coaching, goal setting, performance management, delegation and organization


Strong motivational, communication, team building and training skills


High level of professionalism, honesty, integrity and work ethic


Organized and ability to prioritize and delegate


Superior sense of customer service


Working knowledge of basic computer software including MS Word, Excel, and Outlook


Willingness to work flexible hours.


EXPERIENCE:


Minimum of two years of proven success in health club industry


Experience selling health club memberships and managing the sales department


High school diploma or General Education Diploma (GED)


Bachelor’s degree in related industry preferred


Compensation: Competitive salary, bonus, commission and benefits.

title: Senior Lead Product Development Manager
job_description:
About CenturyLink

CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is the second largest U.S. communications provider to global enterprise customers. With customers in more than 60 countries and an intense focus on the customer experience, CenturyLink strives to be the worlds best networking company by solving customers increased demand for reliable and secure connections. The company also serves as its customers trusted partner, helping them manage increased network and IT complexity and providing managed network and cyber security solutions that help protect their business.
The Role
This role will report to Director Product Management. This high impact individual contributor role is responsible for growing CTL’s revenue stream and increasing profitability as measured by FCF and EBITDA. This position will partner closely with Consumer Sales and will need to interface with VP and director-level leaders in the technology and operations organizations. This role will also need to collaborate closely with other members of the product organization to achieve results. This individual will identify and drive financial improvements to revenue through improved ARPU value, sales penetration, capital efficiencies through technology advances and operational efficiencies through process improvements and automation. This role will also be responsible for owning all aspects of the end to end customer journey for our Fiber customers and will identify & lead efforts to address areas of greatest opportunity to improve the customer experience. This position requires strong relationship building skills and financial acumen, excellent abilities to collaborate and influence cross-functionally, a high bias for action and sense of urgency and a passion for delivering a differentiated customer experience. Performance of this role will be tied to Consumer Fiber revenue, CX and EBITDA results.The Main Responsibilities


Meet or exceed committed business outcomes, including financial performance, customer experience and employee experience goals and objectivesLead team(s) to the on-scope, on-time and on-budget launch of new product introductions, product features/platform enhancements, and product lifecycle improvement effortsPartner across/vertically throughout the Company to ensure relevant evolution of Core Solutions


Partner Organizations: Works consistently with Product Management, Business Process Implementation, Software Delivery Organizations, Innovation, Architecture, Engineering, Finance, Business Unit, Operations, Sales, Sales Overlay and other organizations as part of the planning, design, development, and launch of new products and servicesDevelopment Process: Identification of appropriate development process based on needs (Rapid Development to Staged Development)Resource Management: Identification and solicitation for commitment of required core and extended resourcesKnowledge & Leadership: Product Development is the COO of responsible solutions area, with intimate knowledge of business drivers, market dynamics, product requirements, solutions interoperability, supporting systems/processes/people jointly accountable for the success of business outcomes across enterprise (non-consumer) business unitsConflict Resolution/Celebration of Success: Identification and resolution of barriers to success for both milestone attainment and achievement of desired business outcomes
Maximizes the digital presence across the customer lifecycle (Learn, Buy, Get, Pay, Support)Ensures the effective transition of strategic programs from ideation to development to lifecycle management, delivering on the identified minimum viable experience (customer and employee) standards.
What We Look For in a Candidate
Bachelor's degree or equivalent education and relevant experience

10+ years related experience

8+ years w/Master's degree or equivalent and relevant work experience preferred.

Obsessed with creating an outstanding customer experienceSuccessfully directs cross functional teams to achieve targeted outcomesDemonstrates experience with agile development and lean practicesExcellent written and verbal communications skills with strong copywriting and design skillsTakes the initiative to develop new strategies and outside-the-box ideasWorks independently and within a teamExhibits a growth mindset, an ability to take risks, question norms, unlearn old habits & to not take one’s self too seriously

Alternate Location: US-Colorado-Broomfield

Requisition #: 225011

This job may require successful completion of an online assessment. A brief description of the assessments can be viewed on our website at http://find.centurylink.jobs/testguides/

EEO Statement

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all persons regardless of race, color, ancestry, citizenship, national origin, religion, veteran status, disability, genetic characteristic or information, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, family status, pregnancy, or other legally protected status (collectively, protected statuses). We do not tolerate unlawful discrimination in any employment decisions, including recruiting, hiring, compensation, promotion, benefits, discipline, termination, job assignments or training.

Disclaimer

The above job definition information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Job duties and responsibilities are subject to change based on changing business needs and conditions.

title: Quality Assurance Manager
job_description:
The Quality Assurance Manager works closely with the Director of Engineering to set the tone and direction for all quality assurance efforts. They work with Quality Assurance Engineers to develop test scenarios and cases from the requirements provided by analysts and engineering leadership. They will assist with running the day-to-day operations of all Quality Assurance Engineers. They will work closely with the engineering team to ensure that defects are identified and resolved. They will be responsible for ensuring automation is elevated from an afterthought to a key part of the quality assurance process.

Responsibilities

Provide leadership to the quality assurance engineering team including assigning work and thinking through the right approach to testing complex functionality while mimicking real work scenarios and workflows used by the business.Analyze, design, plan, develop, and implement the testing strategies, plans, cases, and scenarios needed to validate business rules and requirements while determining the appropriate testing techniques for user interfaces and non-UI elements in multiple environments.Continually mentor all quality assurance engineers with a focus on core competencies, personal growth, and career progression.Design automated testing solutions as part of the quality assurance process that are consistent with the architecture and philosophy articulated by the Director of Engineering while suggesting improvements and/or enhancements.Collaborate with Application Engineers to identify, isolate, document, and resolve issues and defects found during development and by users.Create and maintain the test data needed to execute tests for multiple concurrent software projects.Provide an accurate progress status during the daily standup meeting.Work with the team during regular sprint planning sessions to develop detailed technical tasks from business requirements while providing time estimates, identifying dependencies, and setting deadlines.Provide rough estimates of the User Story complexity for future functionality by asking probing questions of analysts, product owners, and engineers during backlog grooming sessions.Prepare and deliver business value-oriented demonstrations to the quality assurance engineering team or end-users.Participate in frequent retrospective and postmortem discussions while providing critical analysis with a focus on process improvement and conflict resolution.Act autonomously in their decision making while following philosophies and guidelines established by the team.Partner with engineering and technology leadership and other team members to develop roadmaps when appropriate.Participate in on-boarding all new employees with a focus on cross-functional competencies.

Direct Reports

Quality Assurance Engineers.

Qualifications

You must have a strong understanding of the following:

Developing test cases and scenarios from business requirements and wireframes.Developing and implementing testing for data, logic and presentation tiers - we use tools like CucumberJs for end-to-end testing and Postman for API testing.Identifying unaccounted exception paths including positive, negative and edge test cases.Experience testing headless applications such as batch processes.Experience database testing.Documenting and maintaining functional test cases and other test artifacts - including test data - we use TestRail.Defect tracking software - we use JIRA Capture.

Preferred Qualifications

NoSQL Databases - we use MongoDB.

Education/Experience

Five to seven years' experience.Preferred four (4) year Bachelor's degree.

Working Conditions

This position may require occasional night or weekend work to support product launches.This position will work with a geographically dispersed, remote team.

Physical Requirements

NoneJob Posted by ApplicantPro

title: Product Owner (AEM - Adobe Experience Manager)
job_description:
AEM (Adobe Experience Manager) Product Manager

IT Product Managers own digital products from conception, through launch and retirement. IT Product Managers bridge the technical and business worlds as digital products are designed that enable our key business objectives through collaboration with business strategy,data science and product delivery teams. The IT Product Manager develops the vision for the digital product, the digital product strategy and the roadmap to execute upon the strategy for IT products/systems related to Bayer Crop Science Product Portfolio Management. Requires a degree or 3-5 years experience in field or related area.

Responsibilities:

Understand the business strategy needs, the end user needs, market and competitive conditions and distill this into a digital product vision to design and deliver a differentiated offering.
Own all digital product roadmap decisions and priority of items on the digital product backlog leveraging a deep understanding of the business and IT dependencies; Roadmaps are co-created in partnership with CoE, ITBPs, other Product Managers and any additional stakeholders.
Responsible for the content and quality of the digital product releases, collaborating with IT Product Specialists to establish a launch plan to ensure usage and adoption
Assess & define capability as well as data requirements/gaps and partner with IT and business to elicit robust feedback around needs and support to drive the work forward.
Manage stakeholder expectations by effectively communicating the digital product vision, strategy and roadmap to IT business partners and key business stakeholders within IT and other functions such as Sales, Marketing, legal and any additional groups as relevant
Ensure appropriate documentation is created to launch and support the digital product in partnership with Product Specialists.
Monitor user feedback and metrics to drive better user experience and business value
Engage in continuous discovery activities to evolve the digital product strategy to meet changing business needs or to leverage new technologies that will enhance the digital product and deliver better business outcomes
Partner closely with software engineers, data engineers, designers and other members of the digital product team to direct the development of the digital product
Participate & drive issue resolution meetings with Brands & agencies as needed in partnership with Product Specialist(s) and dev teams.
Partner with website(s) migration teams, other Product Managers, Product Specialists & dev teams on any post go-live support

Must Haves:

Prior Product Management Experience, overseeing implementation of 3rd party software for Digital Marketing
3+ years' experience working with Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) content management system (for Sites) and digital Asset Mgt system (Assets), including experience with implementation/migration to AEM.
Ability to solicit, analyze and define requirements for large-scale projects (integrations with other systems, migrations to AEM, translation, Analytics, Marketing Automation, Asset Management etc.) and ability to work with dev teams in breaking down high-level features into tactical user-stories and track them across multiple organizations.
Cross-team alignment and dependency coordination across Adobe Experience Management suite of tools and Internal data systems.
Demonstrated ability to lead through influence working in a cross functional team, building relationships with engineering teams and business stakeholders
The ability to explain complex concepts in a way that enables the team & stakeholders to understand what they are doing and why
Strong initiative for anticipating and meeting business demands, an ability to thrive in a fast-paced and uncertain environment, and a focus on generating results

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Product Manager

Jacksonville, FL Office

Join our hardworking, collaborative team where your contributions will be celebrated and valued.

Why Stillwater? We’re a national insurance provider that offers a full suite of insurance products and services. We strive to be the most respected insurance provider in the United States and that respect starts with our employees.

We’re looking for a leader who will bring Property and Casualty Product Development experience, supporting a team and meeting deadlines.

Primary Duties:

Responsible for obtaining, evaluating, and communicating information that supports revenue growth and profitability. Recommends strategies for improving results and market position. Analyzes information using data manipulation and statistical analysis. Creates and modifies company databases. Utilize state indications and other analysis of loss experience, retention, and expense data. Performs field research pertaining to competitor, insurance department, and market surveys. Prepares exhibits for state filing and responds to requests from regulators for additional data. Provides detailed requirements for system implementation projects. Ensures compliance with state statutes. Measures and monitors performance of states.

Qualifications:

Fifth Year Collegeor university program certificate, and two to four years of related experience and/or training, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Proficient on database software, internet software, spreadsheet software and word processing software. Strong organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills. Ability to manage priorities and workflow. Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work within constantly changing priorities with enthusiasm. Demonstrated ability to plan and organize projects. Proven ability to handle multiple projects and meet deadlines. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Stillwater offers:

·Business casual work environment – wear your jeans to work.

·Office location near Butler Blvd and I-95 – convenient to shopping and dining.

·Medical, dental, vision and life insurance benefits to keep you and your family protected.

·401(k) Plan to help you plan for your retirement, with employer match.

·Gym/Fitness Center reimbursement to support your commitment to staying healthy.

·Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) program to help you maintain your work/life balance. Accruals begin from the date of hire.

Apply today to start your journey of being celebrated and valued with Stillwater Insurance Group.

Offer is contingent upon a favorable response from both a pre-employment background investigation and a drug screen.

Stillwater Insurance Group is an equal opportunity employer and a drug free workplace.

title: Produce Manager
job_description:
The Produce Department Manager ensures that our customers’ needs are met and exceeded through effective day-to-day management of the operations and merchandising functions for the assigned department. This position oversees department product and conditions to include, preparation and display areas, back room, equipment, schematics, and inventory.

The Produce Department Manager provides leadership and direction to Department associates to promote a culture reflective of The Save Mart Companies mission statement and winning behaviors. The Manager trains and develops employees to enable their success and ability to advance in their careers. This position manages department performance and productivity to optimize department performance.

Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:

• Provides customers with a remarkable shopping experience by demonstrating, training, and holding store associates accountable for excellent customer service

• Achieves department financials (sales, profit and loss, projections, metrics, and analysis) by identifying, defining, and implementing best department practices and optimization strategies utilizing innovative solutions

• Directly leads department staff with focus on accountability and achieving high level of business performance for department

• Develops department staff (annual appraisal discussion, supervision reports, annual goals/performance review, quarterly progress review, employee surveys, etc.)

• Implements department’s visual merchandising and plan providing innovative solutions, emphasizing “fresh Effectively utilizes resources to improve productivity, flexibility and efficiencies of labor, and quality of shopping experience

• Oversees schematic implementation, stocking standards, item to tag integrity, back room organization

• Manages product rotation, spoils, shrink, and markdowns

• Ensures department’s overall cleanliness/conditions

• Manages sign and price integrity

• Manages department to ensure produce products are prepared according to company guidelines

• Trains department staff on department procedures, hands-on safety and food safety

• Orders product (utilizes order/inventory system, pre-orders, promotion/seasonal planning)

• Analyzes and manages to product performance to maximize sales and profitability

• Manages the accuracy of department inventory

• Ensures produce/floral products are prepared for display according to company policy

• Contributes to overall store conditions (to include store safety, food safety, sanitation, hazardous waste, protection of company assets, etc.) ensuring a safe working and shopping experience

• Performs other duties as assigned

Glassdoor

About Us:

The Save Mart Companies is one of the largest food and drug retailers in California and Nevada. It is home to a number of well-known brands in food retailing. You might have seen our banners that include Save Mart, Lucky, Lucky California and Food Maxx. We also have 4 distribution centers and SMART Refrigerated Transport, a trucking firm that transports dry groceries, frozen foods, ice and novelties to all of The Save Mart Companies stores. We are a locally and family owned business, headquartered in the heart of one of the greatest agricultural areas of our nation - the San Joaquin Valley.

Some of our competitive benefits include: exceptionally generous benefits package (Health, Dental, Vision, Life, 401K), flexible schedule options, Employee Connection (earn fun and valuable prizes!), Life Long Learning – Educational opportunities, Employee Association (discounted and free tuition options, contests, and support services).

title: Analytics Product Manager
job_description:
CCC is looking for a creative mind, with strong analytical skills, to drive the next generation of business intelligence applications at Copyright Clearance Center. The Product Management team will drive the development of analytic services and support the Publisher product suite. As the Product Manager, you will be working on all aspects of the product development cycle, including strategic vision, research, requirements gathering, design, documentation, marketing, roadmap development, customer support, and operations.

Role Responsibilities:

•Develop data and analytics offerings that meet the needs of our customers.

•Maintain product roadmaps, managing internal and external communications regarding roadmap plans and milestones, and managing product lifecycle from conception to planning, development, and product launches.

•Collaborate with the engineering team to help determine the best approaches, implementation methods, and prioritizations.

•Gather requirements, design user workflows and specify high-level behavior for new features, while working closely with business analysts, tech leads, developers, and QA to communicate and clarify user stories as needed.

•Define, track, report on, and improve key product metrics, including sales/renewal, performance, and data integrity.

•Work with other product managers and departments, including marketing, sales, and professional services, to gather internal requirements, and coordinate projects.

•Excel at facilitating meetings, communicating with users and stakeholders, and adapting your communication style to your audience.

•Comfortable traveling to meet users and stakeholders and can represent both the team and CCC during travel (20%).

Experience/Skills :

•2-4 years in technical product management within a Scrum or other Agile development environment is required.

•2-4 years experience in building roadmaps and delivering to market successful analytics services.

•Experience with Machine Learning and/or OLAP a plus.

•Experience in building and delivering to market successful analytics products.

•Keen focus on user experience, usability, and design.

•Strong interpersonal and communication skills with demonstrated ability to collaborate cross-functionally, including, working directly with customers.

•Detail-oriented, analytical thinker, with ability to apply structure to complex problems

•Background in B2B knowledge management products and technologies supporting R&D enterprises preferred.

•Bachelor’s degree required - BS in Information Technology or related field.

Type of Degree: Industry Related

Name of Licenses/Certifications: Safe Agile preferred

Experience: Direct Experience:6-10 years

Management Experience:2-4 years

title: Restaurant General Manager
job_description:
JOB SUMMARY:

This position has management responsibility for the day-to-day operation of a Restaurant facility that serves proprietary and/or brand food products and beverages. The Restaurant Manager is in charge of the facility and is responsible for the business units sales, profitability, expense control, inventory, customer service, safety and conditions. Emphasis is placed on customer service, supervision of staff, and operating within the scope of Company and/or brand policies and standards and applicable laws. This position reports directly to the District Manager.

JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Customer Satisfaction:  Promotes a positive work environment and maintains excellent employee, customer and community relations.Facility Condition:  Inspects Restaurant supplies, equipment and dining and work areas to ensure proper standards of cleanliness, safety, maintenance and operation.Merchandising:  Implements Restaurant programs in accordance with Company and/or brand and regulatory standards.Competition:  Monitors changes in local market. Reports concerns and makes recommendations to District Manager to enhance or maintain sales.Sales Controls:  Follows and enforces Company sales control policies and procedures by ensuring employees are trained to scan or ring in all transactions at the time of purchase at the correct price, to use the correct keys/codes, to place all payments collected in the register and to make the correct change.Financial Controls:  Monitors records and analyses operating reports (budget, sales, margin, cash, labor, product usage and variance, inventory, etc.); identifies opportunities for improvement and implements plans to increase sales and profitability.Staffing Controls:  Directly supervises the activities of 2 or more full-time employees which may include Assistant Manager(s), Shift Supervisor(s) and Restaurant Associate(s); may supervise maintenance personnel or retail store employees assigned to the Restaurant unit.External/Internal Controls:  Follows and enforces all government requirements, health and safety codes, food brand inspection standards, and the Company policies, procedures and standards that apply to the conduct of business. Seeks guidance from District Manager about legal questions or obligations.Security Controls:  Maintains a safe environment for employees and customers and protects Company assets including information, cash, product, equipment and property.Administrative Controls:  Completes all periodic operating reports and transmits/forwards to Support Center and brand partners when required.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Knowledge of basic business and customer service principles including planning and organizing, resource management and leadership skills.Ability to listen, understand and explain information and ideas in a clear and understandable manner.Ability to recruit, select, train, motivate and lead a team of employees to maintain a profitable, efficient, customer-focused operation.Physical Demands: Work requires frequent standing and walking; occasional to frequent bending, stooping or crouching; frequent lifting/carrying of up to 10 pounds and occasional lifting/carrying of up to 50 pounds; and occasional climbing and descending ladders.Working Conditions: Work requires 50 hours per week and can include hours on all shifts, week-ends and holidays. Tasks are generally performed indoors in a temperature-controlled setting but can include exposure to extreme temperatures (both hot and cold), vapors/fumes/food odors, high humidity, noise and household chemicals for short periods routinely and longer periods occasionally. Work may include exposure to high temperature grease, grill/steam units, knives, slicers and slippery floors.Certificates & Licenses: Valid state motor vehicle operators license.

BENEFITS:

Medical, Dental, Vision, Term Life and AD&D plansVacation401(k) (FT &1+ years of service)Tuition ReimbursementDiscount Meal planHoliday pay

StockShort Term Disability

Job Type: Full-time

Experience:

management: 2 years (Preferred)

License:

ServSafe Manager (Preferred)

Work authorization:

United States (Required)

Benefits:

Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceFlexible scheduleTuition reimbursement

Schedule:

Other

title: E-Commerce Account Manager
job_description:
Job Description
E-Commerce Account Manager
Full-time –
On-Site Minimum of 3 year’s practical experience ………..
Dreaming of a new job where your contributions are appreciated? Follow your dreams to Boyd Specialty Sleep.
Boyd is a local St. Louis area company (40 yrs.) that has been recognized by Inc. Magazine as a US Top 500 growth company 5 separate times. We foster a collaborative culture and creative environment that puts our people and ideas above all else. We value our professionals, providing comprehensive benefits, exciting challenges and competitive salary plus bonus opportunities.
In addition to our Brick and Mortar customer base, Boyd Specialty Sleep has prioritized its E-Commerce channel as a critical growth engine for our company. We design and produce specialty sleep products for companies such as Amazon.com, SamsClub.com, Walmart.com, HomeDepot.com, Target.com, Wayfair.com, Overstock.com and many others.
As a result of significant growth plus new opportunities on the horizon, we are seeking an experienced E-Commerce Account Manager to drive growth of existing and new E-Commerce accounts.
The ideal candidate is highly motivated, a self-starter and team player.
Primary Responsibilities Include:
Reporting directly to the ECommerce Manager this position will be responsible for maintaining our product catalog on account sites, developing strategies to drive growth and seeking new accounts to onboard.
Set-up:

Establish an operational framework to organize and track deliverables required for all assigned E-Commerce accounts.
Work with the in-house Creative Department to develop product content intended to drive sales.
Ensure all product specs are correctly entered onto set-up templates, according to respective E-Commerce account group specifications, and submitted to appropriate E-Commerce account in a timeframe that allows the products to ‘go live’ at the time of inventory availability.
Follow-up and follow-through will be a critical component of this position.

Maintenance:

Monitor inventory availability on sites to ensure in-stock products are live, and pricing is correct.
Monitor and address Q & A and review content on E-Commerce sites.
Develop and facilitate methods for seeking positive customer review placement on E-Commerce products.
Participate in periodic conference calls with key account contacts to track progress and uncover opportunities.

Growth:

Participate in strategy discussions and share knowledge of systems and processes.
Plan promotions and holiday-driven sales (Black Friday, Labor Day, etc.).
Work with key customer contacts and internal leadership to develop strategies to increase assortment on all accounts, and drive sales through promos.
Establish methods to increase page rank and visibility of products on E-Commerce sites to promote top-tier listings.


Analyze sales data and develop reporting on KPIs to create actionable plans to drive growth.
Monitor product/pricing strategies and promotions to drive incremental sales volume.

The successful candidate will possess the following traits:

Great organization skills
Excellent communication
Positive attitude
Multi-tasking ability
Self-starter with ability to make and establish critical due dates to ensure ‘go live’ dates are met.
Keen attention to detail
Original creative thinker
Analytical and strategic
Able to present ideas and information in a manner that is easily understood and actionable
Comfortable interacting with both internal and external customers
Takes pride in a job well done.
Strong proficiency in Excel. Can work efficiently.
Working proficiency with Word and Powerpoint. Experience with Google Docs, and online file sharing a plus.
Minimum 3 years’ experience in an Account Management role with sales
Job Type: Corporate Headquarter Office location

Compensation: Boyd is a dynamic, creative entrepreneurial environment. We pay well and bonus based upon the sales increases of our E-Commerce business. Salary based on experience and aptitude. Base salary range: $40k – 70k.
Job Type: Full-time

title: Senior Product Manager, AI
job_description:
At Movable Ink we're building a platform that combines data and content at scale, allowing teams to quickly build complex ecosystems of visual creative that can be delivered in any channel. With artificial intelligence woven into Movable Ink's creative toolset, marketing and creative teams can be augmented in ways that aren't possible today. When it comes to creating products we believe that enterprise experiences deserve the craft, care, and delight that have become standard on the consumer side, and we're looking for people who feel the same.

Fast-forward one year. Here's what you'll have accomplished at Movable Ink:

Working closely with a team of talented engineers, data scientists, designers, and researchers your leadership style brought out the best in everyone and facilitated innovations we hadn't dreamed of. Your incessant drive to learn what was happening in the market, across industries, and in research literature expanded our understanding of what was even possible.
You deftly navigated the balance of trust, control, and autonomy to find the sweet spot that helped our users feel comfortable and capable working with AI. You supported research and design to fully explore and vet models of trust was that resulted in users integrating the product into their production workflows.
Your keen ability to identify and collaborate with stakeholders across the organization resulted in company-wide excitement for the work the AI team was doing. Because you were attuned to what was happening in the market, with competitors, and insights generated through research you were able to deftly identify new opportunities, rally the team, and prioritize accordingly.
Our sales and customer experience teams have your back because of your work with product marketing in defining go-to-market strategies, creating demos, supporting sales enablement, and supporting collateral for our customers. Your clear organization and communication around releases created a network of support that quickly pushed new features into the hands of our customers.
Our training, documentation, and technical support team love working with you because you were intentional about bringing them into the process and making sure they had the right context and information to create best-in-class training videos and support documentation.
On several occasions people in the office couldn't find you. Not because you were playing hookie, but because you deeply value getting out of the building and talking to customers. On many of these forays you took research, design, and/or engineering with you because you know how meaningful it is to be close to our customers. You didn't stop there though - when you got back to the office you made sure to debrief with the team and document your learnings, adding to our growing database of stories and insights.

In the past you have:

Shipped. This is not your first rodeo.
Worked in collaborative, cross-functional team environments with engineering, design, data science and research.
Have previous experience leading and building AI products.

It would be amazing if:

You've worked in the Marketing Tech space before
You have experience in B2B SaaS environments

title: Shift Leader/Manager
company_name: LAABH, Inc and its Affiliates DBA as Dunkin/Baskin Robbins
job_description:
You are applying for work with a franchisee of Dunkin' Donuts /Baskin-Robbins, not Dunkin' Brands, Inc. or any of its affiliates. Any application or information you submit will be provided solely to the franchisee. If hired, the franchisee will be your only employer. Franchisees are independent business owners who are solely responsible for their own employees and set their own wage and benefit programs that can vary among franchisees 2017.
If you enjoy working in a fast-paced, fun-paced environment that is challenging and allows you to apply your personality and skills in a variety of ways, becoming a Leader for a Dunkin' Donuts franchisee is a great career choice. Our team is committed to making our guests' day by serving them with a great product, a smile, and heck, maybe even a joke or two. Everyone on our team, from our franchisee to our manager to our crew members, works together and takes pride in doing a good job. If you are ready to roll up your sleeves and work with a winning team, then join our dynamic, award-winning franchise!

12575 Uline Drive, Pleasant Prairie, WI 53158

title: Senior Product Manager
job_description:
Interlace Senior Product Manager

Do you enjoy taking a hands-on approach to guiding ideas through the product development lifecycle? Do you have a passion and drive for bringing world-class software solutions and products to the healthcare market? Then Interlace Health is looking for you!

The Interlace Product Manager is an effective leader and influencer who is:

Strategic. Understands industry trends and their impact on our corporate initiatives, matches the product vision to the companys vision, and ensures alignment from across the organization.Creative. Is a deep and creative thinker with good product instincts. Comes up with innovative concepts, validates them with real users, and is always working to create the next great app.Agile. Believes in putting new solutions into the hands of users as fast as possible and understands how to value meaningful customer knowledge and feedback.Inquisitive. Possesses an analytical mind and is constantly seeking to expand their knowledge.

The mission of Interlace Health, a Top 30 vendor to the healthcare provider market, is to build software products to empower the business of healthcare and we need your help.

Key Responsibilities:

You will coordinate the overall flow of input from the idea stage through the product development cycle. Your key responsibilities will include but not be limited to:

Prioritizing and validating potential enhancements, new functionality, and wholly new products and solutions by identifying resources needed and verifying market backed monetization. Translating ideas into product requirements for Development and developing a long-term product roadmap. Working with Development to determine if we should build internally, buy, or partner to meet certain product specifications.Managing the creation of a structured beta customer program.In conjunction with Solution Marketing, keeping abreast of competing products and identifying market trends.Assisting Solution Marketing in gathering product feedback and maintaining the list of possible new features, enhancements, and products to be vetted.Collaborating internally to build use cases and present product concepts to internal stakeholders and external customers at a senior level.Assisting in communicating and training on the product positioning, key benefits, and target customers back to sales, marketing, and services.

Requirements:

Minimum 5 years experience in product management; prior experience with SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle)Intimate knowledge of the healthcare provider industry and clinical and/or clinical informatics processes is highly desirablePractical problem solving and strong critical thinking skills with excellent judgment and initiativeSelf-starter who excels in forming positive relationships with all areas of the companyOutstanding written and oral communication skills, including experience presenting to executive leadership, participating in sales, and handling sensitive customer needsEnergetic and passionate about products and able to work under pressureThis position requires up to 40% travelBachelor degree required, advanced degree highly desirableLeadership/management experience beneficial

Location:  Nashville/Brentwood/Franklin TN area preferable

Note: The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed, but are not to be seen as a complete list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required and personnel so classified. Also, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the employer.
