title: RFID Program Manager
job_description:
PURPOSE: The RFID Program Manager will provide leadership and guidance on key strategic projects and initiatives within the Materials organization. This role will support projects that improve overall material flow, reduce dependency on labor, and optimize inventory investment across the company's North American Manufacturing Platform. The position will work across the user community to define, qualify, and prioritize projects utilizing RFID technology. The RFID Program Manager will lead and achieve operational excellence through the advancement of customer experience, leveraging an approach that considers all interdependent, interrelated processes that occur within our business systems.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Provide leadership and coaching to a team of analytical and technical resources
Research, evaluate, and define deployment strategies for both the advancement of existing technologies as well as the targeting of new technologies to advance the organization
Work with user groups to develop financial justification / AFE's for new requirements. Ensure compliance with all FP&P requirements. Take a leadership role for these needs on corporate driven RFID initiatives.
Maintain a prioritized, structured project portfolio associated with technology, innovation, and disruptive thinking. Inclusive but not limited to applications such as RFID technology
Constantly evaluate current systems and processes leading to the identification and implementation of design alternatives facilitating an advocacy for a continuous improvement culture
Support operational excellence through employing a toolkit that incorporates the use of six sigma and lean methodologies
Manage supplier relationships related to RFID installation, inclusive of materials, software and hardware
Actively support cross-functional clients by synthesizing key business needs into a prioritized, structured queue of projects and activities. Continuously engage with all constituents to support timely implementations
Identify and implement metrics to monitor the performance and timeliness of technological and system/ process changes

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:

This role is responsible for the direct supervision of the RFID Specialists.

QUALIFICATIONS:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and ability required

Education, Experience and Skills



Undergraduate degree in Project Management, Supply Chain, Operations or related field; MBA is a plus
Minimum of 5 years of leadership experience in the areas of Project Management, Operations, Supply Chain and/or Engineering with a record of consistent success within a dynamic process oriented business
Minimum of 5 years of demonstrated success maintaining a prioritized, structured project portfolio associated with technology, innovation, and disruptive thinking. RFID technology application a plus
System/ process improvement experience through the use of Six Sigma and lean manufacturing tools
Ability to be flexible and creative in the face of unforeseen project and system/ process challenges
Change management champion; possesses a big picture vision with a keen focus on details
Commitment to being a servant leader, coach and mentor
Dedicated to improving team performance through aligning to a common goal, motivating for success, and removing barriers
Undeniable passion for business and self-improvement; evident in communication and approach

Language Skills:

Ability to read, and interpret common business documents including technical reports, charts, graphs and diagrams. Ability to listen and communicate effectively with customers/clients in an effort to respond to common inquires or complaints from customers/clients, members of the business community and public.

Mathematical Skills:

Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to interpret graphs and diagrams.

Reasoning Ability:

Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit. Must be able to lift up to 20 pounds over head.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

Significant travel, greater than 50% both in and out of town, may be required (based on business need). Travel is typically by company car and or commercial air carrier. Occasional evening and weekend work is required.

AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

The American Woodmark Corporation does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, religion, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, or gender; and it will comply with all applicable federal, state, and local discrimination laws. No person shall be denied employment solely because of any disability which is unrelated to the ability to engage in the essential functions involved in the position for which application has been made either with or without reasonable accommodations.

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Senior Manager Product Security
job_description:
A product security manager:

will work closely with all our internal development teams to ensure we build in security from day one.
Have a solid development background and have progressed to be a security authority.
Able to keep up to date on all new security challenges and work with cross functional teams to develop protection mechanism is key.
identify common software security anti-patterns and design appropriate solutions.
help the Product Teams at Splunk "shift left" within the SDLC.
play multiple roles, including product manager, senior engineer reviewing code from junior engineers on the team and project manager, handling delivery timelines.

will be an excellent fit if:

Have 3-5 years hands-on experience writing tools that can integrate with the CI pipeline and user facing tools with good user experience.
Have delivered high signal, low noise security tools which accurately identify security issues early in the SDLC.
Have experience with security testing at scale by building and implementing static and dynamic analysis tools, open source scanning tools and integrating security into a CI/CD workflow.
Have hands-on experience with tools and technologies used throughout secure SDLC (e.g., Burp Suite, Fortify/Checkmarx /Veracode, WhiteSource/Blackduck).
Have performed as a technical lead for a group of 3-5 engineers

Required Skills:

Expertise in software development using Python, JavaScript or Golang.
Expertise in application development frameworks, build systems and ability to integrate tools into the CI infrastructure.
Proficiency in reading, writing, and auditing compiled languages like C++, and interpreted languages like Python or Javascript.
Experience with continuous integration tools such as Gitlab CI, Jenkins and build tools like CMake.
Familiarity with SAST, DAST and OSS scanning tools.
Authoritative understanding of common software and web application security vulnerabilities.
Knowledge of crypto primitives, authentication protocols and authorization standards (Eg: SSL/TLS, SAML, OAuth, JWT tokens).
Effective written and oral communication with multiple levels of leadership involving both business and technical sides of the business.

Desired Skills:

Hands-on experience in:

Open source tools, particularly security tools.
Developing and rolling out security tools that have been received well by developers.
Performing peer code reviews and quality reviews regularly.
Software security testing, methodologies and frameworks.

title: Product Manager - Messaging
job_description:
Because you belong at Twilio.

The Who, What, Why and Where

Twilio is growing rapidly and seeking a Product Manager to build products for the next 10 years of growth in messaging. This product leader will work closely with partners and internal stakeholders to identify, launch and scale innovative messaging capabilities that fuel our customers' products. Reporting to the Head of Product for Twilio Messaging, this position is critical in maintaining Twilio's leadership position in the messaging market.

Who?
Twilio is looking for a product leader who lives the Twilio Magic and has a demonstrated track record of driving new launches and scaling features that drive measurable business impact. They also have:


4+ years experience in product management in a fast-paced company. You have hustle and know how to knock down barriers to get to your objective.
You are curious, collaborative, humble and have empathy as a key trait.
You have solved complex problems and have the aptitude to navigate uncharted waters.
You have the ability to distill information from many - often competing - sources into clearly scoped problems and focused, high impact solutions.
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills. You're equally at home on stage presenting to an audience of developers as you are writing product requirements. Your best days are the ones where you do both in the same day.
Experience managing products at various stages of maturity, from greenfield to at-scale
Technically savvy and experience with the cloud, APIs, communications, enterprise software, devices, and mobility is a plus.
Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline (Computer Science, Engineering, Technology or Math).

What?

As a Product Manager, you will live the Twilio Magic values:


WRITE IT DOWN: Distill information from many - often competing - sources into clearly scoped problems and focused, high impact solutions.
DRAW THE OWL: Work with customers, partners and internal stakeholders to bring innovative ideas to life that unlock new messaging capabilities
BE AN OWNER & BE BOLD: Envision a world better than today for our customers and clear the path through ambiguity to get there.
EMPOWER OTHERS: Collaborate extensively with engineering, design and other functional teams within Twilio and have significant exposure to our executive leadership.
NO SHENANIGANS: Ruthlessly prioritize to bring only the highest impact ideas to life based on measurable outcomes that help our customers.

Why?

Brands globally are incorporating more and more text messages into their workflows, informing users of appointments, deliveries, and connecting brands to their customers. Usage is set to continue growing exponentially and Twilio's Programmable Messaging business unit is at the forefront of this revolution.

Our business unit builds not just the messaging products of today, but also of tomorrow. From Twilio's API for WhatsApp to future initiatives like Rich Communication Services (RCS), and Apple Business Chat, Twilio's Programmable Messaging APIs ensure that brands around the world are able to connect to their customers on the channels that make the most sense.

Twilio is a company that is empowering the world's developers with modern communication in order to build better applications. Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development, and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion, and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio. With 6 million developers on the platform, you will have the opportunity to have an impact on a massive scale. Your job will be to turn developers into heros!

Where?

This position will be located in our office at 375 Beale Street in San Francisco. You will enjoy our office perks: catered meals, snacks, game room, ergonomic desks, massages, Wednesday dinners, bi-weekly All Hands and more. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; seeks well-rounded talent to ensure a full perspective on our customers' experience, understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves.

About us:

Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing the world's communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world's most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer's toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry — from emerging leaders to the world's largest organizations — to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Product Manager - Risk Platform
job_description:
Because you belong at Twilio

The Who, What, Why, and Where

At Twilio, our mission is to power the future of communications. We believe that communication should be at the heart of every product and customer experience. Unfortunately, communications can also be misused by bad actors who attempt to game the system for nefarious purposes. We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to own and lead our Risk Platform. Our customers range from individual developers to large enterprises that are well known brand names and they collectively interact with millions of consumers globally. The PM, Risk Platform will define the vision and strategy for our risk platform with the goal of preventing fraud and abuse and helping Twilio ensure trusted communications with our customers and consumers globally. The ideal candidate for this role should be passionate about protecting consumers and developing creative solutions to combat fraud and mitigate risk.

Success in this role requires building and maintaining strong relationships across operations, support, data science, security, and other product teams. We are seeking an Owner with strong product vision, intellectual curiosity, data-driven prioritization, leadership, and execution skills.

Who?

We are excited about the candidates with the following traits:


5+ years of Product Management experience, leading products from development to launch.
You are knowledgeable about different data science techniques and how they are applied.
You are experienced and comfortable working at the technical level, understanding APIs and data.
You are experienced working on a self-organizing agile software team.
You have an analytical mindset and understand data systems.
You are detail-oriented with great organizational skills and comfort with ambiguity.
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
You have a Bachelors/Masters degree or equivalent experience.
Experience managing products/ services in the compliance, fraud, abuse or user protection space preferred but not required.

What?

Own and shape the product roadmap for our risk platform, building the products, tools and analytical systems we use for detecting and remediating fraud and unwanted communications, across all channels in our network.
Collaborate with other product teams and operations teams to improve effectiveness to scale with Twilio's fast growing platform.
Strategize and iteratively develop new solutions with data science and engineering to combat changing fraud patterns and new vectors.
Write and present detailed product deliverables on key initiatives to executives and stakeholders.
Get involved with industry meet-ups and associations to stay on top of new trends and best practices.
Get your hands dirty to remove barriers and obstacles hindering your engineering team's ability to ship.

Why?

As Twilio grows, our platform for global communications becomes a larger target for fraud, abuse and unwanted communications. This role owns our investments and plans for managing and mitigating these ever-changing risks across the business while enabling Twilio and our customers to have a frictionless trajectory for growth. You will work closely with other product teams on visible projects with impact across the company. Your success is highly measurable, affecting Twilio's bottom line and our reputation in the larger communications ecosystem.

Where?

This position is a remote position (work from home) with at least 25-35% travel expected, most often to our offices in San Francisco and Denver as well as to visit global teams and industry meetings and events globally. When visiting our offices, you will enjoy our office perks: catered meals, snacks, game room, ergonomic desks, massages, Wednesday dinners, bi-weekly All Hands and more. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; seeks well-rounded talent to ensure a full perspective on our customers' experience, understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves.

About us:

Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing the world's communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world's most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer's toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry — from emerging leaders to the world's largest organizations — to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Build a product clients love. Solve complex problems. Drive product roadmap.

If you are customer-obsessed, a strong communicator and a structured thinker, we'd love to talk.

The role you'll play:

At CB Insights, we build products that help clients make sense of the future and drive their businesses forward, using data.

We are looking to add an experienced Product Manager to join our mission. This is a great opportunity to join a tight-knit, fast-growing and highly visible Product team.

You will drive the product roadmap, uncover product needs via research and client conversations, translate product ideas and goals into projects, and bring products to market.

Your work will be seen by hundreds of Fortune 1000 customers, the top VCs in the world and 580,000+ newsletter subscribers.

Your main tasks:

Drive roadmap for products you own from idea to implementation. This includes market research driven by client usage data, competitor research, client conversations and other sources to determine needs, prioritize ideas in a disciplined and deliberate way and ultimately work with product marketing and sales/customer success to ensure successful rollout
Has a good eye for UX & UI to translate product ideas into wireframes (or draft designs if you have the design chops) and clear requirements documents
Drive product planning with Designers, Project Managers, and Engineering Team Leads
Integrate insights from customers conversations, stakeholder feedback, and competitive research to identify product opportunities and differentiators
Communicate strategy, value to clients, and roadmap for your product areas to the larger CB Insights team
Define success metrics for your products; monitor and refine your product areas based on client engagement for your product area
Partner with Product Marketing to contribute to go-to-market plans and collateral (e.g. FAQS)

What you bring to the table:

Bachelor's degree
4+ years of experience in product management for a software development company and / or a role related to CB Insights customer profile (e.g. strategy, innovation, venture capital)
Experience turning large datasets into simple and beautiful product offerings a big plus
Proven, consistent track record of building great products with software development teams.
Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment
Proficiency in product planning, wireframing and/or prototyping tools (e.g. Sketch, Invision)
You have high standards for your work and what a product should enable clients to achieve
A structured thinker who can influence a diverse array of audiences. Clarity of thought is important in both written and verbal communication. Should be comfortable talking with a diverse array of audiences ranging from Fortune 500 customers to engineers to sales professionals.
Experience working in an Agile development environment, and project management tools (e.g. JIRA)
You must be a great listener who is comfortable talking to clients to understand their needs and distill insights from these conversations into themes that drive product strategy
You are a data geek and enjoy experimentation; proficiency in SQL is a plus

What's CB Insights All About:

The CB Insights platform is the smartest way to explore and exploit emerging technologies. We help the world's leading companies accelerate their digital strategy and transformation with data, not opinion. Our Emerging Technology Insights Platform fuses machine and human intelligence to help you discover and manage your response to emerging technology startups and markets.

The Perks:

Amazing culture: Happy, Helpful, Humble, Hungry. Learn more here
A newsletter that 600k people follow: Sign up here.
Be Healthy: Health with HSA and FSA options, dental, and vision insurance along with unlimited/take what you need sick day policy
Plan for the future: 401k with up to 4% match
Continued Learning: $1,000 yearly continuing education stipend
Rest and Relax: Competitive vacation and holiday plans
Refuel: Daily lunch stipend, unlimited snacks/coffee

We know that diversity makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking. We are dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply if your experience is close to what we are looking for.

Equal Opportunity Employer: CB Insights is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.If you know someone who'd be perfect for the role,

submit here and you'll be eligible for $5,000!

title: Sr. Program Manager (PM)
job_description:
ABOUT US  True Digital Surgeryis a World Leader in Computer-Guided Microsurgery. We combine 3D visualization and guidance software applications focused on improving accuracy, efficiency and outcomes for surgeons and patients. Our medical imaging and guidance system employs advanced real-time 3D graphic capabilities and proprietary software that is sold to surgeons and hospitals all over the world.  SUMMARY  The Program Manager (PM) leads multidisciplinary teams for assigned programs/projects utilizing program management techniques in a highly regulated medical device environment. This position is primarily focused on the timely execution of New Product Development in accordance with the Quality Management System (QMS), partner contracts and product specifications. In addition to New Product Development, the PM will also lead continual product or business process improvement initiatives.  The selected individual will need to be a technical leader with the ability to make direct technical progress assessments within Systems, Electronics, Mechanical, Optical, Software, Manufacturing and Test Engineering disciplines. The PM will have the responsibility of representing the organization in a highly professional manner and will need to prepare and present partner facing communications, documents and presentations. These communications will be with external stakeholders such as partners, critical and/or strategic suppliers and contract manufacturers (CMs) as well as internal stakeholders such as Engineering, QA, Regulatory Affairs, Operations, Purchasing, Customer Service and the True Digital Surgery Senior Management team.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Responsible for development and execution of project plan with clear milestones and deliverables to ensure timely completion of projects within established timeline and budget
Ensure project compliance with Contracts, Specifications and Quality Management System (QMS) for medical devices
Applies and demonstrates technical management and organizational skills that results in a collaborative culture using clear, credible, objective and proactive communications and stakeholder management

Lead regular team meetings in an efficient manner with cross functional team members including engineering, operations, purchasing, quality, regulatory, customer service, partners, critical suppliers and contract manufacturers
Track and document the project progress, monitors the risks, effectiveness, and performance of the project and project team and proactively facilitates the development of contingency plans and recommended corrective actions as required
Publish project documentation
Action item tracking and task prioritization
Appropriately manage / escalate project issues or risk
Prepare and conduct monthly program reviews with senior management
Prepare and conduct quarterly program reviews with partners (as required)


Participate in the development and improvement of policies and procedures and tools that affect efficient program management and product development
All other duties as assigned by the VP, Operations and Program Management
Occasional travel may be required

REQUIRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE

10+ Years experience with MS Degree in Engineering (preferably EE in high tech sector)
15+ Years experience with BS Degree in Engineering (preferably EE in high tech sector)
7+ years of program or project or technical leadership experience with demonstrated past performance of successfully transitioning a product through the following development gates: proof of concept, development, verification, test, manufacturing build, commercial launch and service
2+ years of experience with Quality Management Systems (QMS) for medical device manufacturers
Advanced skill set with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), MS Project, Visio, Confluence, JIRA

SPECIALIZED JOB KNOWLEDGE  To excel in this position, an individual would benefit from the following competencies.

Complete understanding and application of Program Management principles, concepts and industry best practices in a highly regulated medical device field
Proficient systems engineering approach to technical problem-solving skills
Full knowledge of medical device industry standards and design control: 21CFR820, ISO 13485 QMS, IEC60601 Safety, Essential Performance and EMI/EMC
Basic familiarity and operation of surgical microscopes
Familiarity with robotics

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include color, distance and close vision.  WORK ENVIRONMENT  The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently exposed to work near moving mechanical parts. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.  Benefits:  We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by our competitive compensation and an extensive benefits package including paid time off, medical, dental and vision benefits and future growth opportunities within the company. Plus, we work to maintain the best possible environment  To Apply:  To respond to this opportunity, please apply through this ad.  For more information about us, please visit www.truedigitalsurgery.com  We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. title: Manager, Web Engineering
job_description:
Who we are:
Jamf, the standard for Apple in the enterprise, extends the legendary Apple experience people love to businesses, schools, and government organizations. After watching hundreds of users struggle to deploy, update, and secure Apple computers, iPads, and iPhones in business and in the classroom, we knew there had to be a better way to handle such pesky IT functions. Removing the barriers of technology and empowering doctors to treat patients, teachers to teach, and businesses to thrive.

Today, more than 34,000 customers from more than 150 countries rely on Jamf to help them succeed with Apple. We don’t say we are the best, but we strive to be the best. We are a group of curious, self-starters with a passion for making people’s lives easier, paving the way for a better Apple experience in government organizations, hospitals, businesses, and schools. 


What you’ll do at Jamf:
At Jamf, we empower people to be their best selves and do their best work. The Manager, Web Engineering is responsible for the day-to-day management of a web development team and their deliverables. The Manager works closely with key stakeholders to meet strategic business objectives. The Web Engineering Manager will ensure their team is aware of and understands the what, the how, and the why of current priorities. The Manager is an expert at their craft and will guide their team towards also becoming experts.

Responsibilities

Maintains current knowledge in present areas of responsibility (i.e., self-education, attends ongoing educational programs).
Leads the software development efforts of the team and utilizes expertise on techniques, tools, languages, and practices to guide and mentor.
Guides and mentor teams in solving the problems of building performant and production-ready web applications through modular, reusable code.
Monitors and manages results through planning, attention to detail, and decision-making.
Identifies and proactively manages and mitigates project obstacles and risks. 
Reviews and revises project work plans as needed to meet changing needs and requirements. 
Reviews and analyzes existing workflows and practices for effectiveness and efficiency.
Researches and understands the best technical solutions for team’s code base.
Ensures the overall code quality of the code base, through consistent direction and team alignment.
Mentors Software Engineers and Developers on the appropriate technical solutions for features, coding techniques, and tools.
Ensures consistent and effective application of Lean principles and Agile development practices.
Performs key people management responsibilities including hiring, onboarding, developing, and supervising team along with conducting performance appraisals and coaching for performance and career growth.
Ensures the teams they interact with understand Jamf values, mission, goals and engineering priorities and can make the connection between the work they are doing and the greater organization.

 

4 year / Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field (preferred), or a combination of relevant experience and education
Preferred Certifications/Licensures: (Certified Scrum Masters training (CSM training), Certified Scrum Developer training (CSD training), Certified Scrum Product Owner training (CSPO training))
5-7 years professional experience in Enterprise Software development roles demonstrating progressive knowledge and growth in responsibilities (Required)
2-4 years in management or supervisory role (Required)
2+ years professional experience in web development languages, frameworks, techniques, and tools (including but not limited to JavaScript, CSS, MySQL, PHP, Responsive Web Design, AWS. (Required)
General Experience with web technologies and infrastructure (Required)

 
How we help you reach your best potential:

We are progressive, but laid back. You are free to be you and work how you work best. Here, you manage your own day and your own work style.
Be your own self-starter. We support each other no doubt, but we thrive taking initiative and are empowered to roll up our sleeves, dig in, and push forward.
Everyone has a voice, and everyone can make a difference, our more than 90% employee retention rate agrees!
Opportunity to make a real and meaningful impact for more than 34,000 global customers with the best Apple Device Management solution in the world
We put people over profits – which is why our customers keep coming back to us at a 96% customer retention rate
We embrace all perspectives. Our employee led I&D groups encourage employees to make real, actionable differences here at Jamf.
20 of the Top 25 Fortune 500 companies rely on Jamf to do their best work.
We are relentless, but we are selfless. You can create and be creative, dig in, break it down, and troubleshoot to help others make sense of technology.
Opportunity to make a real and meaningful impact for people by constantly building and improving the best Apple enterprise solution in the world. 

 
You are the right kind of Jamf if:
You go above and beyond for others, genuine and willing to help, always. You support the team around you, you don’t point fingers or pass blame. You take responsibility for your actions, are open, and respect others. You value different perspectives, in how you work and how you learn. You are naturally inquisitive, like to create and be creative. You are a problem solver, curious and resourceful, self-driven and constantly improving. You roll up your sleeves and dig in. You are excited by not knowing what may lie ahead. You are willing to take risks, try new things, even fail just to do it better next time. You’re not a jerk. You put people first. You are a good person, someone who just wants to do the right thing.
 
Why Jamf? 
Our mission is simple; we help organizations succeed with Apple. At Jamf, we put people first. We focus on the human before we focus on the technology. We are just good people that have it in their gut to do what’s right – for our customers, our employees, and our communities.
 
Get social with us: Instagram, LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter & YouTube

title: Program Manager
job_description:
Nexius Solutions, Inc. is hiring a Program Manager in Itasca, IL market.Who We're Looking For:A Program Manager who is a motivated and customer-centric leader with strong Project and Program Management skills to join our growing team.What You'll Do:

Utilize your expertise in wireless to develop strategies in order to effectively build, manage, deploy and operate a large-scale metropolitan market and/or regionOversee all development activities for a defined market, including overseeing our internal network deployment team, as well as general contractorsManage multi-million dollar budgets for market and forecast capital spending for assigned projects while managing progress against defined objectivesBuild, manage and motivate all members of your teamDevelop and track project objectives, resource loading, and timelinesDevelop continuous improvement initiatives and oversee process improvement teamsEngage, foster and manage strong GC and leasing relationshipsCommunicate project status reports to the executive leadership team including risk assessments and mitigation plansOccasional travel, including travel by air

The Qualities You Possess:

title: Regional Equipment and Services Manager
job_description:
At the core of every successful company, you’ll find a great team. Our team is truly a family and the heart and soul of the company. With a Purpose to“make tomorrow a little bit better than today” for each other, our customers, and our communities, we work together to create an environment where you can love what you do and be your best every day as you write yourself into the Lube-Tech story. And that’s one of the reasons we are the proud recipient of the 2019 Top Workplace award, issued by the Minneapolis Star Tribune!

We promise to:

Provide a safe environment:We care about each other, and it’s a top priority to ensure we all go home to our families without an incident.

Celebrate what makes us unique:We look for greatness in everyone, listen to every voice, and find ways to bring out the best in each other.

Empower each other:We trust each other and create a place where everyone matters and can make a difference.

Since 1925, Lube-Tech and its founding companies have demonstrated a people-first, customer-focused approach. Lube-Tech is a family-owned company who provides advanced energy, fluid technology, lubricants and services to OEMs and customers within the automotive, fleet and manufacturing industries. Lube-Tech also operates Reliable Plus, a vehicle wash company who provides product and service solutions to customers within the c-store, grocery, fleet and automotive industries.

JOB SUMMARY:

The Regional Equipment& Services Operations Manager will execute the operational strategies for the Equipment& Industrial Services operating unit within Wisconsin. This position will ensure operational capacity, capabilities, and costs are aligned to support growth strategies and optimize our installation and service execution across the Wisconsin Region. Responsibilities include oversight of operations including service, installation, and industrial services.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES:

Ensure operational compliance with all areas of environmental, health, safety and security (SSHE). Demonstrate leadership and teamwork required to continuously eliminate unsafe conditions and behaviors.Become a key member of the Equipment& Services management team providing business, operational and people leadership.Provide effective leadership to operations including service, installation, procurement, and warehousing teams. Ensure operations capabilities are competitive, differentiated, and keep pace with emerging opportunities. Provide coaching, mentoring, and effective performance management to technicians working in various capacities throughout the region.Engage with customers to ensure we are meeting their performance expectation; actively participate on key customer calls to ensure we understand and meet their expectations.Effectively partner with other functions (i.e. Sales, Safety, Quality, Finance etc.) to achieve overall Division goals; establish and maintains effective relationships with others and gains their trust and respect.Ensure technicians are maintaining a safe working environment on the job and within Lube-Tech facilities.Work side by side with technicians in order to demonstrate the correct and safe process for various tasks.Ensure all jobs follow the correct process from work order creations to final billing.
Prioritize and schedule all jobs throughout the region with a general understanding of the scope of work and time commitment necessary to complete in order to increase technician utilization rate.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Education:

Technical Degree or equivalent experience in Operations, Logistics, Industrial Service, Equipment Service or related field

Experience and/or Training:

Strong leader with extensive knowledge of operations, supply chain management, service and installation processes.Proven track record of building a top performing team through effective leadership. Ability to effectively interact with staff at every level of an organization. Utilizes a variety of techniques to influence others.Ability to read, interpret, and explain financial statements and related operating reports.Demonstrates sound judgment and decision making considering relative costs& benefits of potential actions; critical thinking logic& reasoning to identify solutions, conclusions or approaches to problemsKnowledge of Lean concepts and tools. Ability to be a thoughtful leader and inspire employee engagement.Excellent presentation, organization, analytical, interpersonal and oral and written communication skills.Strong Microsoft Office skills including Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.


PHYSICAL AND MENTAL DEMANDS:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms. The mental and physical requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an individual to successfully perform the essential functions of this position.

WORKING ENVIRONMENT:

This job operates in a professional office environment as well as in the field at various customer sites. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines. The employee is occasionally exposed to fumes or hazardous material when in our warehouse facilities. The job will also operate at customer sites while installation or service work is being executed. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an individual encounters while performing the essential functions of this position.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

We are always working to ensure our teammates know just how valued they are. In addition to a competitive salary, comprehensive health and wellness benefits beginning day one, Lube-Tech offers employees a variety of perks, including:

Philanthropy– Giving back to our communities is woven into the fabric of who we are. Throughout the year, there are many opportunities for employees, and their families, to get involved and give back. The Employee Giving Program allows you to donate to a 501c3 nonprofit of your choice and the Bame Foundation will match your contribution, dollar for dollar!

Total Wellness– Your health and well-being are important to us which is why you’ll have benefit coverage on your first day of employment. Lube-Tech offers employees complimentary use of our onsite fitness facilities where available. In addition to physical wellbeing, Lube-Tech offers a variety of mental health, financial, and other resources to every employee.

Paid Time Off– All employees begin earning paid time off (PTO) upon hire, with the ability to earn 3 weeks of PTO in the first year of employment!

Paid time off when it matters most– We offer paid time off for bereavement& parental leave so you can be with your family when it matters most. We observe eight paid holidays and provide two floating holidays per year.

Profit Sharing– A significant factor in employee engagement is believing you make a difference and have an impact on the success of the company. Lube-Tech has a history of sharing success with teammates through its quarterly Profit Sharing program.

Lube-Tech is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants including women, minorities, veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
As a Product Manager at CircleCI, you will define and ship successful, meaningful products that help thousands of developers deliver better applications to their users faster.About Product Management at CircleCIThe Product Management team is responsible for the product strategy, roadmap, and execution. Because developers are our customers (and we're a huge user of our own service), Product Management and Engineering work together closely to understand the needs of our users, and jointly define the product vision. We work in cross-functional teams, use data and user-research to drive our decision making, believe in delivering features quickly and continuously improving them, and love to talk to our users. We prioritize work that delivers the most impact, and is measurable and achievable.What you'll do:

Set the product strategy, prioritize features, build consensus and coordinate product schedules with a team of engineers and designers to ship top quality experiences to users
Build and maintain a roadmap to delight our users while growing the business
Build use cases and user stories and communicate them effectively
Integrate usability studies, user research, market analysis and community feedback into product requirements to ensure the product satisfies user needs as well as wants
Inform product decisions with quantitative data on user behavior and experimentation (a/b testing)
Define methods and metrics for measuring success and failure while ensuring the team is clear on their objectives, and constantly track performance
Coordinate with other product managers, designers, and engineers to ensure a cohesive overall user experience.

What we're looking for:

5+ years of product management experience, ideally in SaaS or related space
Demonstrated ability to prioritize amongst competing opportunities, balancing customer needs with business priorities and the ability to articulate the rationale behind those decisions
Strong use of analytics, user research and business cases to drive decisions and improve products
Exceptional written and oral communication skills
Exceptional organizational and analytical skills
Solid understanding of how software is built, tested and released to customers
Experience working for an engineering-driven company a plus
Startup experience a plus
Understanding of Continuous Delivery concepts a plus

How to apply If you're interested in joining the team at CircleCI, please send a resumé and cover letter describing what inspires you and why you think you are a good fit for the team. If you contribute to an open source project, write a blog, or have a presence on the web (GitHub, Twitter, Stack, etc.) we would love to hear about it.

We know there's no such thing as a "perfect" candidate - we're all a work in progress and are growing new skills and capabilities all the time. CircleCI welcomes those who are enthusiastic about learning and evolving, so however you identify and whatever your background, if this looks like a role where you could do work that excites you, we hope you'll apply.About CircleCI CircleCI is the world's largest shared continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) platform, and the central hub where code moves from idea to delivery. As one of the most-used DevOps tools that processes more than 1 million builds a day, CircleCI has unique access to data on how engineering teams work, and how their code runs. Companies like Spotify, Coinbase, Stitch Fix, and BuzzFeed use us to improve engineering team productivity, release better products, and get to market faster.

Founded in 2011 and headquartered in downtown San Francisco with a global, remote workforce, CircleCI is venture-backed by IVP, Sapphire Ventures, Owl Rock, NextEquity Partners, Scale Venture Partners, Threshold Ventures, Baseline Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Industry Ventures, Heavybit, and Harrison Metal Capital. Learn more at https://circleci.com.

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

title: Senior Business Analyst - Government/Military experience and active TS/SCI required
job_description:
Type of Requisition:RegularClearance Level Must Currently Possess:Top Secret/SCIClearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain:Top Secret/SCISuitability:Yankee WhitePublic Trust/Other Required:

Job Family:Business Process AnalysisJob Description:

The focus of this position is to work closely with the Joint Staff and Units within our customer's business divisions to gain in-depth understanding of their business strategy, processes, services, roadmap and the context in which they operate, with the goal of understanding, documenting and mapping the technical, process, and management capabilities needed to address the challenges facing them in meeting the needs of its customers.

The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for reviewing assigned business processes from end-to-end to identify and address operational, financial and technological risks. The Senior Business Analysts identifies opportunities to improve efficiency. Responsibilities of the Senior Business Analyst include from leading small to mid-size projects to assisting project managers on larger more complex projects related to operational business functions that affect the mission.

Roles and Responsibilities

Demonstrate up-to-date expertise in Information Systems and apply this to the development, execution and improvement of action plans by providing advice and guidance to others in the application of information, information systems and best practicesSupport and align efforts across technical and managerial layers to meet the needs of our customersManage customer relationships and expectations by developing a communication plans and processes that are designed to keep management, stakeholders and customers advised as to the status of projects, and ongoing project results.


Identify ways to increase adoption of new systems and capabilities by customers and methods by which customer satisfaction can be improvedDemonstrated fluency in business processes and process differentiationAnalyze and synthesize business requirements, including recognizing patterns and conceptualizing processes with the objective of identify duplicate needs that may be addressed through one solution, thereby improving services, speeding service delivery and reducing costsAssist the government identifying and documenting needs and expectations of multiple stakeholders, and in the negotiation of solutions and their service levelsAssets the government to gather business requirements needed for system modifications, enhancement and implementations
Maintain currency with customer needs and strategies; utilizing formal and informal written communication methods (for example, emails, newsletters, PowerPoint presentations, executive updates, task lists, updates) to communicate digitally, visually and through presentations, updates and findings; and facilitating project meetings and presentations to all types of diverse audiences (for example, senior management, Customers, technical staff)Lead or participate in project meetings designed to assist assigned Project Managers develop, complete and update project documentation; managing project scope; adjusting schedules when necessary; determining daily priorities; ensuring efficient and on-time delivery of project tasks and milestones; following proper escalation paths; and managing customer and supplier relationships.Assist Project Managers in the creation and maintenance of project schedules by developing project plans and specifications, estimating time and resources, monitoring milestone completion, tracking all phases of the project lifecycle, providing timely reporting of issues that impact project progress, coordinating actions and resolving conflicts.


As necessary, design, develop and maintain Project Schedules in support of special mission requirementDesign, develop and maintain a Microsoft Project based integrated resource loaded Integrated Master Schedule (IMS), using input from assigned Project Managers and others.Provide informal training to Project Managers in the use of Microsoft Project to aid in IMS maintenance
Provide leadership to Project Managers, project teams and peers by collaborating with others; articulating ideas and viewpoints to senior leadership, peers and others; identifying and initiating projects; managing resources; and driving the resolution of issues.Identify, create and facilitate process design changes by conducting business and systems process analysis and design at a complex level; focusing on quality improvement and data management; ensuring measurable and repeatable processes; ensuring data is reliable and valid; developing process improvements or re-engineering and recommending elimination; integrating new systems and processes with existing ones; and partnering with internal and external customers to ensure systems provided meet the long-term business strategiesProvide and support the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders and customers; identifying business needs; determining and carrying out necessary processes and practices; monitoring progress and results; recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities; and adapting to competing demands, organizational changes and new responsibilitiesEstablish a Continual Service Improvement (CSI) process that continually monitors projects and other management activities, identifies service improvement opportunities (proactive and reactive) and tracks improvements from conception to implementation – measuring their success/impact.Provide business level analysis – and as required, produce required Business Cases, Concepts of Operations (CONOPS), Total Cost of Ownership documents, Risk Reward Analysis, Strength/Weaknesses/Opportunities/Threat (SWOT) analysis, Balanced Scorecard tools and other tools and documentation that will aid the leadership prioritize projects and align resources to meet the needs of our customers.Provide project level analysis – producing, and assisting Project Managers in the production of required project analysis documentation (business and technical requirements), business scope matrix/document, project charters, use cases, total cost of ownership, project sequence diagrams, future state proposals, and User Acceptance Test Plans (UAT).


Assist the Government, Project Managers, and Technical Teams establish Critical Success Factors, Key Performance Indicators and other success measurements that governs existing and emerging systems and capabilities.
Assist the Government in establishing criteria for and track the progress of our customer in achieving its mission, the Commanders Vision, Goals and quarterly objectives, and report on that progress to the Commander and leadership team.

Core skills:

Knowledge of general business principles, military and government organizations, and systems engineering concepts.Strong oral, written and interpersonal communication skills in English and at the Graduate level.Technically proficient with Microsoft Office products (Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, Access, Publisher).Advanced to Expert level of knowledge with Microsoft Project, with experience in developing integrate master schedules from multiple project schedules.Working knowledge of Python programming language

Educational Requirements

Required - Bachelor of Engineering / Science Degree in Project Management, Business Management, Business Analysis, Computer Information Systems, Information TechnologyPreferred - Master of Business Administration or Master of Technology ManagementPreferred – Education in two or more programming languages (e.g. Python, JAVA, C++, .NET)

Experience Requirements

Minimum if 10 years’ experience working as a business analyst within an Information Technology enterprise supporting 8,000+ users, with a Bachelor’s Degree Minimum if 5 years’ experience working as a business analyst within an Information Technology enterprise supporting 8,000+ users Masters of Business Administration or Masters of Technology ManagementExperience should include no less than three years working within the Department of Defense.

Desired Behaviors

Self-starter with the ability to multi-task.Strong leadership skills with excellent listening skills. Must have the ability to see multiple conflicting views and assist in the formation of consensus. Must be able to lead and to be led by others.Strong formal and informal communications skills including the ability to mentor and train – must take satisfaction in the accomplishments of menteesMust be able to work well within teams either as a member or leader

#GDITpriority

Scheduled Weekly Hours:40Travel Required:Less than 10%Telecommuting Options:Telecommuting Not AllowedWork Location:USA DC WashingtonAdditional Work Locations:We are GDIT. The people supporting some of the most complex government, defense, and intelligence projects across the country. We deliver. Bringing the expertise needed to understand and advance critical missions. We transform. Shifting the ways clients invest in, integrate, and innovate technology solutions. We ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. We are there. On the ground, beside our clients, in the lab, and everywhere in between. Offering the technology transformations, strategy, and mission services needed to get the job done.

title: Channel Account Manager (Georgia and Florida)
job_description:
Consider growing your career as a Channel Account Manager with Mitsubishi Electric Automation, an industry leader in factory automation products and solutions. Be rewarded for your successes with unlimited earning potential and having line of sight to the direct impact you'll make as sales increase. Join our team of smart, dedicated professionals, who are the best in their fields and also enjoy work life balance while being successful.

The Channel Account Manager is responsible for working closely with Channel Partners to achieve aggressive sales growth within the Sales Region. The Channel Account Managers objective is to bring close alignment between MEAU and our channel partners. The Channel Account Manager will focus on the implementation of channel initiatives as well as develop distribution action plans in support of MEAU’s Strategic Objectives. Collaboration with Senior Sales Management, Regional Sales, Strategic Marketing, Product Marketing and Technical Support Group is essential to achieve required sales growth with MEAU’s channel partners.

The Channel Account Manager is based out of the Atlanta, GA area. 20% travel within the Southeast Region: Georgia and Florida.

Position Duties and Responsibilities


Work in cooperation with Regional Sales Managers in development of aggressive distribution sales plans
Develop and implement the Distributor Sales Plan (DSP) with channel partners/distributors
Target a minimum baseline sales growth of 15%-20% year over year through distribution (organic growth outside of strategic/project sales)
Focus distributors on expansion of sales at existing key accounts
Focus distributors to capture new target opportunities
Help distributors increase top line sales and return on investment by promoting value with MEAU Products and Solutions
Administer, manage and continually improve the Diamond Distributor Elite Program.
Plan and lead joint sales calls with partners, per the Distributor Sales Plan (DSP), to expand customer base and maintain Key customer relationships
Conduct Distributor Scorecard and Distributor Sales Plan (DSP) quarterly reviews as directed by management
Conduct partner sales training as required in assigned territory
Represent Mitsubishi in a professional, ethical, and socially responsible manner with channel partners and customers
Document activities in CRM and complete monthly reports as required by management
Complete monthly and annual business forecasts to show projected sales vs. quota
Attain quarterly and yearly sales goals as established by management
Perform other job functions as assigned


Travel Requirements

20% travel within the Southeast Region: Georgia and Florida. 

BS in an engineering discipline: i.e.; electrical, mechanical or equivalent experience.
10+ years’ experience in sales and channel management.
10+ year’s sales experience in the automation industry (Servo/Motion, PLC/HMI, VFD)
Strong sales management skills
Excellent people and relationship building skills
Solid track record of consistent sales and profitability growth
Strong work ethic (leads by example)
Excellent listening and questioning skills
Solid organizational and time management skills
Proven ability with problem analysis and strategic problem solving
Excellent communication skills (oral and written)
Ability to multi task
Solid planning ability
Computer proficiency – (CRM, Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Map Point, and Outlook)

Beneficial Skills

Consultative Selling Skills (Wilson CSP methodology)

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Product Manager


Location



Boston


Business Function

IT



Apply Now
About the Firm:Cambridge Associates was founded in the early 1970s to assist nonprofit institutions with the investment of their endowment assets. Today, we provide investment management, financial planning and proprietary capital markets research to over 990 clients including nonprofit institutions, private clients (families) and pension plans. The firm advises on assets in all asset categories, including equities, bonds, non-US investments, real estate, venture capital, hedge funds, leveraged buyout funds, oil and gas partnerships, and many other types of investments. We monitor the performance of nearly all major institutional investment managers and provide an advanced monitoring service for our clients to evaluate alternative assets managers such as venture capital and private equity.About the Team:The Portfolio Workbench team sits at the center of Cambridge Associates’ business, building the mission-critical application that drives our investment process. We are a small closely knit team, but we have a big and far-reaching impact. The decisions we make, the technologies we use, and the things we build are shaping the future of our firm. We’re building a portfolio management system from scratch that will provide sophisticated analytics to facilitate data-driven investment decisions across thousands of assets. We design robust solutions that unify our firm’s varied needs. We have the opportunity to try new things that have never been attempted before. We release frequently and have the flexibility to act upon changing business conditions. Our application is set to transform how our firm does business.About You:You’re an experienced product manager with the financial acumen necessary to manage a transformational portfolio management system. You can speak frankly with stakeholders to discuss tradeoffs, challenges, and opportunities. You are constantly on the lookout for ways to improve investment outcomes, whether it be in analytics, decision support, or operational efficiencies. You have the technical skills necessary to understand system and application designs and to review correctness of code. You’re not afraid to challenge long-held assumptions. You clearly articulate your ideas to developers, analysts, and other team members. You can find the data you need by querying across databases and other data sources to form fact-driven analysis and arguments. When data is not available, you find other ways to objectively evaluate options.

Cambridge Associates is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion are essential elements of our culture. We are committed to fostering an environment where individual perspectives, backgrounds, and life experiences make the firm a great place to work, and result in a more satisfying client experience.

title: Director of Product Management
job_description:
Posting Title

Director of Product Management

05/13/2020

Job Description

The role of Director of Product Management will work collaboratively with corporate HQ teams to help oversee and manage defined product categories and execute retail and marketing business plans. This individual will become a subject matter expert in HFT’s product development process, providing guidance on next steps, deliverables and follow-up action items, ensuring issues are resolved and communicated. Additionally, this role will be responsible for coordinating project development and communicating projects status as it relates to deadlines. It will be critical that he or she work successfully across multiple departments to ensure all stakeholders are actively engaged in the completion of the project. This position will partner with various departments from Marketing, Operations, Inventory, Global Sourcing, Quality, E-commerce, IT and Finance/analytics to ensure input during strategic development and will be directly responsible for department implementation and execution.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Partner with corporate HQ’s team of category managers and help execute overall product strategy including: pricing, product assortment, marketing and promotional strategy and in-store merchandising strategy Help develop product and marketing plans and processes that drive efficiency, profitabilityResponsible for providing business analysis, measurement and reporting using internal data as well as independent external industry sources through research and industry best practices to define product strategy.Participate in and contribute to strategic planning sessions.Responsible for coordinating project development and communicating projects status as it relates to deadlines. Collaborate with global sourcing and global quality teams to drive quality and sourcing initiativesInventory collaboration and management for sales planning and item transition forecastingAbility to multitask and direct multiple projects simultaneouslyCollaboration with brand development and packaging team to drive process improvement and outputCollaboration with the operations team in order to execute programsProvides positive and constructive feedback to employees by coaching, mentoring, counseling or corrective guidance and action, as appropriate.Provides strategic and tactical leadership in category management that insure financial goals, improved efficiencies and that ensure customer satisfaction.Ensures implementation of the business plan for Harbor Freight Tools that establishes a rapport, promotes partnership and fulfills the organizations needs and expectations.Additional duties as assigned by management Build, drive, and protect a rewarding and engaging culture where an appreciation for tradition is balanced with a passion for continuous improvement. Drive our values that reward, promote, and encourage high performance while ensuring we always do the right thing for our people. Encourage a high level of trust and transparency across all levels and functions. Promote diversity in the workplace and ensure recruiting and development strategies attract and grow a diverse pool of candidates and associates.

Scope

Supervises Staff – Yes - ExemptFinancial Scope – YesDecision Making – Decisions affect work of district/area/function and may extend to an entire operating division

Auto req ID

69591BR

State

CA

City

Calabasas

Requirements

Education and/or Experience:

Bachelors’ Degree preferably with a Business major or related field

5+ years of merchandising or product marketing experience required Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office SuiteFinancial analysis experience requiredRefined critical thinking skills Excellent time management and planning skills, organized with the ability to multitask, exceptional follow up skills and able to meet deadlinesAbility to make decisions quickly, based upon a combination of analysis, experience, wisdom and judgmentFlexible personality with the ability to deal with ambiguity and to think outside the box and provide a continuous flow of new ideas and process improvements.Results-oriented. Ability to execute and carry out strategic and operational plans. Able to capitalize on new brand building opportunities, strategies and objectives.Skilled at attracting, retaining and motivating the team. Strong interpersonal skills. Able to maintain and develop top-level, internal and external relationships.Effective communication skills.Informs and directs appropriately on both verbal and written fronts. Dedicated to the success of the company and willing to commit to necessary hours Personable, collaborative team leader who will thrive in a fast-paced, growing environment with constantly changing priorities.

Competencies:

Leadership - Models the Company’s values and influences others to achieve individual or team objectives.Communication - Clearly conveys information through a variety of media to individuals or groups in a manner that is understandable, easy to retain and timely.Initiative - Approaches work objectives with a sense of urgency and a dedication to exceeding performance expectations.Problem-solving/Decision-making - Accurately identifies problems, issues and opportunities, collects data to draw conclusions and chooses a course of action based on facts.Planning & Organization - Establishes courses of action for self and others to ensure that work objectives are met.Policy Compliance - Manages in accordance with Company policies and procedures and promotes compliance in others.

Physical Requirements

General office environment requiring ability to:

• stand, walk, sit for extended periods of time

• speak and listen to others in person and over the phone

• use keyboard and read from computer screen and reports

• lift up to 15 lbs.

About Harbor Freight Tools

In 1977, when Harbor Freight Tools was started as a small family-owned business, we made a commitment to provide working people with great quality tools at the lowest prices. And for over 40 years, Harbor Freight Tools has done just that. From hand tools and generators, to air and power tools, from shop equipment to automotive tools, Harbor Freight offers more than 5,000 tools and accessories at quality levels that match or exceed competing brands, but at prices that are up to 80% less. We're not your typical retailer. We're a team of high-achievers, who have a passion for excellence and continuous improvement and obsess about getting things done. We're also equally committed to doing the right thing and giving back to our community. And for us, collaboration is the golden rule. We're a 40 year-old, $4 billion company with over 30 million loyal customers and growing. If you are looking for a not so ordinary and highly rewarding career opportunity, we would love to talk with you. Delivering Value to the Hardworking Since 1977
