title: Product Manager
job_description: A key component to drchrono’s EMR is our Billing Software, an intuitive set of applications and tools that allows making the billing operations easier for our Customers and in-house Billers and Coders. As the PM of the Billing team, you will own the end to end experience, all the way from the product experience to our market positioning. You will be responsible for developing and executing on the vision, strategy, and roadmap that enables providers to get to the highest quality for all appropriate needs, while reducing the operational complexities of our product workflow. In your job, you are well equipped to write business requirements into functional requirement specification documents and functional designs for electronic health record (EHR) and practice management software (PMS) applications. As a leader, you are highly-accountable with strong interpersonal skills in working with Engineers, RCM Operation leaders, Vendors and Customers. You function effectively in a busy environment with little or no supervision and are comfortable making independent decisions.In this role you will...Research the existing product and customer requests to determine the desired functionality. Understand and analyze user needs using both quantitative and qualitative tactics.Lead the full product cycle: ideation, research, design, development, launch, and iteration.Create wireframes of proposed UI for the assigned modules. Write functional specifications based on the research and meetings done for each module assigned. Conduct review sessions of functional specifications to obtain approval from all necessary parties. Support the approved functional specifications through the Design, Development and QA processes. Communicate with high-level personnel; Sales, Account Managers, Customer Support, Engineering, QA, Senior Management and external customers, including Providers, Billing Staff, CEOs, CFOs, etc. Organize and prioritize many high priority items, determine strategic goals. Work directly with customers, research and write specifications based on their requests. Serve as the resident expert within Product management and “go to” person for all coding, billing and collections processes.You have...Bachelor’s degree in Science, healthcare administration, business or related field (preferred).Minimum of 2 years of work experience in a medical practice/medical insurance/healthcare billing and collections experience with a deep understanding of medical billing rules and regulations.A certification as a certified coder (plus).Thorough understanding of medical billing, collections and payment posting, revenue cycle, third party payers, Medicare.An understanding of CPT, ICD-9 and ICD-10 codes and procedural modifiers, claim forms, HIPAA, billing and insurance regulations, medical terminology, insurance benefits and appeal processes.Experience in any of the EMR software and Microsoft Office, including Outlook, Word and Excel.Experience with Agile methodology.The ability to communicate effectively in writing, over the telephone, and in person.The ability to multitask and adjust priorities in a busy and changing work environment.Strong leadership, team development and business skills.In the first 30 days, you'll...Understand internal processes and collaborate with product, design, and engineering teams, using agile principles to deliver products that drive meaningful health outcomesSpend time with our engineers, RCM operations, AMs, customers and users to understand their pain points and help inform our product strategyBecome an expert on our existing product, understanding our target customers and key market differentiatorsIn the first 60 days, you'll...Manage the product lifecycle from ideation to launch, working closely with design and engineering to deliver quality product releasesStart actively leading the ongoing projects and setting strategic direction to our Product EngineersIn the first 90 days, you'll...Own the vision for future product lines, working closely with product and engineering leadership to align product roadmaps with our overall product strategyCollaborate with our Sales, AMs and Customer success teams to ensure successful go-to-market strategies that drive product utilizationAnalyze and synthesize various sources of customer data including product utilization data, support tickets, etc. to help us evaluate the success of product releases

title: Product Manager, Programmatic
job_description:
Job Description

Product Manager, Programmatic Product

New York

Company Overview

Founded in 2008, DoubleVerify (DV) is the leading independent provider of marketing measurement software, data and analytics that authenticates the quality and effectiveness of digital media for the world's largest brands and media platforms. DV provides media transparency and accountability to deliver the highest level of impression quality for maximum advertising performance by bringing transparency and accountability to the market and ensuring ad viewability, brand safety, fraud protection, accurate impression delivery and audience quality across campaigns to drive performance. DV has helped hundreds of Fortune 500 companies across every major vertical, including financial services, telecom, automotive, retail, CPG, travel, luxury and pharmaceuticals gain the most value out of their media spend by delivering best-in-class solutions across the digital ecosystem. Let's build a better industry.

Position OverviewThe Product Manager, Programmatic has ownership of and accountability for developing new functionality and services for DoubleVerify's Programmatic offering. This is a high impact buy-side offering generating millions of dollars in revenue, and is leveraged by programmatic traders to deliver targeted ads in a brand safe, fraud free, contextually relevant and viewable environment.

In this role the product manager will own the definition and launch of a new programmatic analytics product that will deliver actionable insights to meet the growing needs of hundreds of DV Advertiser and Agency customers. As a data rockstar, this product manager will be part of a cross-functional team, will drive the business and technical product management aspects and report to the Senior Director of Programmatic Products. The ideal candidate will innovate on solutions, formulate product strategy, assess competitive landscape, collect requirements, work closely with the Engineering team, evangelize product capabilities internally and externally, and collaborate with integration partners.

Success in this role requires proactive execution, ingenuity, attention to detail, the ability to lead by example, exercise indirect influence, perform insightful data analysis, collaborate in a cross functional environment and articulate complex concepts to multiple stakeholders at all levels of the organization.

What you'll do

Work closely with the engineering team to execute in a fast paced development environment.
Break down product vision into epics and user stories for development.
Liaise with multiple teams within the product and development organization to drive development of DV-wide features
Engage with sales and client services to gather customer feedback, identify functional needs and synthesize actionable product requirements
Lead user-acceptance testing efforts with development team for accurate, high-quality, and timely product delivery.
Collaborate with business development, integrations team and external partners to deliver features to end customers
Partner with marketing to create product collateral for internal and external customers.
Analyze data to glean relevant insights that help drive feature prioritization and solutioning.
Do market research, monitor industry trends and undertake competitive analyses.

Who you are

2-6 years of product management experience in the internet technology or online media industry.
B.A. /B.S. or equivalent/higher level of education. B.S. in Computer Science or a related technical field is strongly preferred.
Written detailed and thoughtful PRDs and driven execution in a fast paced environment.
Superb data analysis skills and ability to deliver insight and action from information.
Technical experience with databases, SQL, system integrations, APIs.
Passion and desire to play a key role in driving a new business to success in the advertising technology space.

What we prefer

Past experience in Martech/Adtech with an understanding of programmatic buying via OpenRTB and familiarity with key players (DSPs, Exchanges, SSPs, Networks).
Strong process management, business process re-engineering, and analytical skills.
Proven ability to balance the need of the customer while maintaining corporate objectives.

title: Principal Product Manager, Security
job_description:
We’re looking for a Principal Product Manager with a passion for cybersecurity. We’re a team of veteran product managers and UX designers who care about building the right things to solve the right problems.

If you can understand a customer’s problem even before they do, if you thrive on distilling clarity from complexity, if you enjoy working with dev teams that make you rethink what’s possible multiple times a quarter, we want you. If you want to have an impact from day 1, if you’re excited by the agility of a fast-growing venture-backed company at the forefront of cybersecurity, if you want product management to be fun again, you want us.Duties & Responsibilities

Build rapport and relationships with customers, prospects, and teams within ExtraHop to understand use-cases, evangelize product vision, discuss the roadmap, and gather product feedback
Drive R&D’s shared understanding of customer needs, domain problems, and market conditions
Define and document product vision
Prioritize product roadmap, maximizing business and customer value in changing market conditions and balancing investment in established product functionality against the introduction of new use cases
Partner closely with engineering to bring product improvements to market

Minimum Qualifications

1 year experience in a product leadership or principal product management role

Preferred Qualifications

3 years experience in cybersecurity on the vendor or practitioner side
Conversational knowledge of computer networking and common enterprise applications You’ll want to know what SMBv1 is used for and why nobody should see it in their network

ABOUT EXTRAHOPExtraHop is an enterprise cyber analytics and performance monitoring company helping the world’s leading organizations understand and secure their entire environment from the core to edge to the cloud. Our breakthrough approach to analytics and machine learning helps our customers investigate threats, ensure the delivery of critical applications, and secure their investment in the cloud, resulting in 95% faster threat detection and reducing unplanned downtime by 86% while providing the best possible customer experience.

ExtraHop is recognized by leading organizations for both its innovation in the market and its commitment to building a world-class team. We’ve been named to Wealthfront’s Career-Launching Companies list for the last four years, and JMP Securities put ExtraHop on its 2019 Elite 80 List as one of the most strategically positioned private companies in the cybersecurity industry. Credit Suisse recognized ExtraHop as a member of its inaugural Disruptive Technology Recognition Program, and SC Media named ExtraHop a 2019 Industry Innovator for enterprise network traffic analysis.

With well over $150 million in bookings in 2019 and 40% year-over-year growth for the last two consecutive years, the opportunity with ExtraHop has never been greater. Are you ready to rise above the noise?

ExtraHop is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, military status, or national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable local law

title: Manager, Program Management - Lexington, MA, US
job_description:
Company Overview

Translate Bio is a leading mRNA therapeutics company developing a new class of potentially transformative medicines to treat diseases caused by protein or gene dysfunction. Our MRT platform is designed to deliver mRNA carrying instructions to produce proteins for therapeutic benefit and may potentially be applicable to a broad range of diseases caused by insufficient protein production or where production of proteins can modify disease.





Job Summary

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced individual to join our team as a Manager, Program Management. The successful candidate will report to the Senior Director of Program Management and will be an integral part of the Program Management and Technical Operations teams. This position offers opportunities to work with multiple external CROs, CTOs, and CMOs.





Job Responsibilities


Facilitate communication among team members and coordinate activities to drive project execution in alignment with defined schedule. Collaborate with multi-disciplinary team members to develop integrated project plans and lead regular meetings to track activities, monitor progress, drive decision making, resolve issues, and identify risks and mitigation plans. Align with internal team members to ensure completion of deliverables supporting manufacturing campaigns. Ensure integration of activities into overarching project plan. Manage projects outsourced to multiple CROs / CTOs / CMOs. Assist with preparation of RFPs and drive contract development, review and approval. Plan activities/deliverables and establish timelines, monitor progress, resolve issues, and identify risks and mitigation plans. Proactively manage raw material supply chain for drug substance and drug product production. Coordinate with multiple vendors to order required raw materials and monitor outstanding deliveries. Develop long term supply chain forecast aligned with CMC production forecasts to ensure maintenance of reagent supply and identify / mitigate pinch points. Develop project/program and manage spending against established budget.





Required Skills & Qualifications


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in life sciences, biotechnology or engineering with expertise in program or project management.5+ years (Bachelor’s) / 3+ years (Master’s) experience in a similar position, 5-7 total years’ experience in the biotechnology / pharmaceutical industry.Demonstrated ability to facilitate project team meetings, enhance cross-functional communication, support decision making, influence outcomes, and ensure alignment among internal and external stakeholders.Excellent organizational skills with great attention to detail coupled with strong interpersonal skills, self-awareness and ability to manage team dynamics.Ability to effectively represent the Company to external partners, CROs, CTOs and CMOs.Excellent knowledge with all aspects of MS Office including Visio and MS Project.Excellent communication skills and ability to provide clear, candid, and transparent descriptions of CMC/technical tasks, issues, schedule challenges, and proposed solutions.Able to achieve goals in a timely manner, despite obstacles, by prioritizing tasks and building in contingency planning.


Translate Bio is committed to equal employment opportunity. All applicants must have authorization to work in the U.S.

title: ​Education Project Manager
job_description:
You are known for your keen insight into how people learn. Your intellectual curiosity assists in your ability to critically evaluate, recognize risk and identify solutions to improve upon current processes. Your solutions driven attitude paired with your dedication to accomplishing goals is unmatched.You confidently lead with credibility, proactively communicate and never lose sight of your exceptional commitment to the project. You are flexible, creative and earnest.

If this sounds like you, read on!

Manages projects to support product development, operations, and strategic initiatives. This position requires a full understanding of content development operations and extensive people, communication, organizational, planning, and project management skills. Assists in development of Project Management processes, tools, templates, policies, and procedures. Develops detailed project scope, timelines/work plans, schedules, project estimates, resource plans, and status reports. Leads project meetings and is responsible for adherence to quality standards and review of project deliverables. Communicates with project champions, subject matter experts, and other resources as needed to ensure successful project management and implementation. Work with leadership and cross-functional project teams to steer projects through lifecycle, including initiating, planning, executing, controlling/monitoring, and closing.

Conduct effective, proactive communications with internal and external stakeholders, utilizing status updates, agendas, action items, issue logs, etc., as appropriate. Communicate status of plan, obstacles, etc., ensuring transparency of progress and risk.

Manage projects accordingly as circumstances change, holding team members accountable for delivery, and escalating issues to leadership as appropriate.

Partner with product owner and project sponsor to understand business strategy and requirements. Work with committees project manager to secure subject matter expertise for projects.

Provide operational input and counsel to Manager, Education Curriculum and Planning and Senior Manager of Online Learning as necessary to guide strategic initiatives.

Partner with project managers across organization to develop project management standards, processes, tools, templates, and policies.

TRAVEL:

Up to 10 days per year.

QUALIFICATIONS

REQUIRED:

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Management or related field. PMP (Project Management Professional) certification. 4 years progressively responsible experience working in content development operations with a minimum of 4 years project management experience. Experience working with medical or scientific professionals in creation of Academic products or programs including writing, editing, proof reading and fact-checking content. Demonstrated experience managing stakeholders in a weak matrix organization Strong organizational, team-building, time management, and written and verbal communication skills. Experience with Microsoft Suite, including Project and Visio, and web-based project management and collaborative applications.

DESIRED:

Experience developing eLearning coursework. Familiarity with instructional and learning/curriculum design. Previous professional, medical/association background. Previous people management experience. Previous nonprofit experience. Solutions-driven attitude Embodies AAOS values: Teamwork, Empowerment, Accountability, and Growth Mindset.

If this describes YOU, please apply by sharing the following:

-Clearly communicate why you are the ideal candidate for this role, providing specific examples and experiences as proof points.

-Attach your resume, cover letter and any additional materials that support your application.

We have over 200 locations across the US and continue to grow every month. Ahern's mid-size boutique insurance brokerage specializes in the insurance needs of law firms. We provide comprehensive insurance products that include coverage for Professional Liability, General Liability, Property, Workers' Compensation, High Net Worth Personal Lines, Employment Practices Liability and Employee Benefits.

We offer an environment that provides our staff with the culture of a small family oriented business while providing large company benefits. As our agency continues to grow and stay ahead of the curve in the service and products that we offer, we are looking for additional team members who want the excitement of a continuously developing company that has the stability of a long established one.

title: Technology Product Manager
job_description:
We are looking for a Technology Product Manager to join our Supply Chain and Digital Retail team. TheTPM will partner with internal/external stakeholders and Leadership to understand the business and technology landscape of the company and creatively define solutions in support of new product offerings, alleviating customer experience pain points and improving the architecture. The TPM will own the product end-to-end, create and manage product vision, strategy and roadmap, and lead cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality products. The TPM will be adept in balancing technical knowledge and business acumen, possess great leadership, management, communication and people skills.

Responsibilities

Project Management• Acts as the primary point of contact for the intake process to DevOps technology teams.

Product Management

• Owns the product end to end as well as roadmap at the technology/functional level.

• Partners with business and internal/external stakeholders to understand current customer experiences; identifies areas of opportunity, create and manage product vision and roadmap.

• Manages product backlog and priorities with our business and technology partners.

• Leads product backlog grooming sessions partnering with key resources.

Views the "big picture" of challenges impacting the customer experience, including the technical, functional, process, and policy considerations, and creatively define solutions to those challenges.

Informs and evangelizes a strong customer focus and customer experience that aligns decision making with IT investment choices and prioritization.

Works with the business to identify and articulate initiative scope, benefits and ROI.

Collaborates with stakeholders to plan and manage product releases.

Relationship and People Management

Effectively and efficiently communicate with technical and non-technical audiences

Qualifications

4-7 years of relevant Product Management, Product Owner, Business Analyst, and System Analyst experience in an agile software product development environment.

Company Profile

As America's Un-carrier, T-Mobile USA, Inc. (NASDAQ: "TMUS") is redefining the way consumers and businesses buy wireless services through leading product and service innovation. The company's advanced nationwide 4G and 4G LTE network delivers outstanding wireless experiences for customers who are unwilling to compromise on quality and value. Based in Bellevue, Washington, T-Mobile USA. Inc. provides services through its subsidiaries and operates its flagship brands, T-Mobile and Metro by T-Mobile. For more information, please visit http://www.t-mobile.com

Applicant Privacy Policy

We are committed to maintaining your trust by respecting and protecting your privacy. For more information about how T-Mobile processes the personal data of job applicants, please visit Applicant Privacy Policy.

EOE Statement

We Take Equal Opportunity Seriously - By Choice. T-Mobile USA, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship will be made without regard to age, race, ethnicity, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental disability, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with our Company values and will not be tolerated. Furthermore, such discrimination or harassment may violate federal, state, or local law.

title: Accounting Manager
job_description:
Lone Mountain is a family-owned business with culture centered around core values. We allow customers to achieve the dream of owning their own truck through no balloon payments, buyouts, or minimum credit scores. Our company continues to see double digit increases in sales and our future is bright! As we continue to grow, we need individuals who align with family principles. Drive your career forward at Lone Mountain!
Position Overview: This individual will have the opportunity to build a team of 3-5 Specialists while standardizing workflow for 6,000-7,000 invoices monthly.
The Accounting Manager will be an agent of change as we build consistent and efficient systems. High-volume invoices will require this individual to put the people in the right places to efficiently process information and document SOPs. This mid-level manager will be given autonomy to operate independently and utilize outside experiences to implement creative solutions. A strong Accounting Team is in place to support this person as they take on the challenges of this role.
Take advantage of a unique opportunity and apply below! Our family-owned company offers a casual work environment and a family-friendly benefits package. Please review the qualifications and apply if interested!
Job Responsibilities:

Coordinates the entire Accounts Payable process of invoice submission to processing payments for a large transportation company.
Manages a team of 3-5 AP Specialists to enhance their performance, development, and work product.
Develops, implements, and maintains accounts payable systems, procedures, and policies, to ensure adherence to company guidelines.
Manages vendor relations and accounts.
Reviews workflows, expense distributions, and aging reports for any outstanding invoices.
Reviews vendor ledgers for payments and duplicate invoices.
Provides accounting assistance to managers and operations staff; responds to financial questions/concerns.

Job Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in business administration, accounting, finance, or related field preferred; equivalent combination of education and experience considered
5-7 of accounting experience with full-cycle A/P processing
1-3 years of supervisory/leadership experience
Experience working with generally accepted accounting principles and accounting software
Paperless AP workflow and systems experience a huge plus
Must be well versed on 1099 filing requirements; electronic 1099 filing experience
Solid interpersonal and communication skills for interacting with vendors, department managers, and upper management
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Good planning and organizational skills to balance and prioritize work

title: RMRA Project Manager - Health Alliance Plan
job_description:
GENERAL SUMMARY:
Identifies Revenue Management and Risk Adjustment (RMRA) department program needs and requirements. Responsible for leading the design, development, testing and roll out of new RMRA programs and existing program improvements. PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 
Plan and organize the program: In partnership with the RMRA Manager(s), leads development of prospective, retrospective and coding/auditing risk adjustment programs. In addition, leads development of data management and revenue management programs. 

Define and negotiate Project Scope and Deliverables Identify costs and benefits of the project Obtain approval for projects, justifying the return on investment. Plan and staff projects. Plan and schedule user training related to the project’s implementation. Document and communicate process models, project scope, deliverables and commitments. Manage and operationalize the program:

Produce project status reports, work plans, time lines, budget reports, risk management, issue lists, and project metrics. Monitor progress, change control, issue resolution. Manage scope change, issue resolution, and negotiate change in deliverables. Ensure appropriate documentation for user manuals, training materials. Provide feedback to line manager on team member performance. Manage post implementation support. Provide post implementation project review.

Additional duties:


Assist with overall IT Strategic Planning Assist in determining annual planning according to resource and budget allocation. Evaluation of existing programs to improve operations to gain premium increase/quality improvement, efficiencies and enhanced clinical coding and documentation. Research, collect and analyze claims, clinical, HCC, encounter & RAPS data and best practices in managed care in order to assist in making operational decisions. Provide extensive communication to all levels of management and staff to encourage participation and support related to a project. Assure the communication is timely and well-articulated. Communicate with internal and external customers to gather supporting information and/or educate regarding policy and procedural changes. Prepare and present projects and provide status reports to immediate and next level management. Participation on assigned committees, teams and projects Provide department-wide education, training and create training documents and manuals. Conduct department audits to ensure regulatory compliance and perform quality reviews and assessments Support the department management to prepare in-depth reporting, pre-planning and taking a pro-active approach to project management. Work independently or in teams as required. Perform all other responsibilities as assigned. 



EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: 

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Project Management or Computer Science with training in personal computing, networking, mainframe and client server applications. Three (3) years of project management experience in running large projects of a complex nature. One (1) year of information systems experience in computer related areas mainframe, network, internet, intranet and client server application development, including new product implementation. Two (2) years of experience at all levels of system development projects with emphasis in leading large, multi-disciplinary teams evaluating and implementing technologies. Two (2) years of managed care/insurance related business preferred. One (1) year of experience in supervisory/management position preferred. One (1) year of experience in development of process and project methodologies preferred. Additional experience in Project Management, Risk Management, Customer Service, Project/Resource Planning, Metrics Reporting, Systems Design, Application Development and Client Server Implementation preferred. 
CERTIFICATIONS/LICENSURES REQUIRED:

Current Project Management Institute Certification or must obtain within three (3) years of hire date

title: General Application - Product Management
job_description:
Thank you for your interest in Propeller. In light of the novel coronavirus, we've decided to temporarily pause filling our open positions and focus on addressing the near-term needs of our patients, customers, and team. We appreciate your patience through this unprecedented time, and encourage you to share your interest in Propeller by applying below to stay in the loop on our upcoming open positions. When we're in a better position to anticipate our talent and team building needs, we'll contact you if we decide that we have a potential fit for you in the future.

The Propeller Team

About Propeller

Asthma and COPD are two of the most frustrating challenges in healthcare. In the last 50 years, we've made huge leaps in developing new medicines and understanding the complexity of these diseases. Yet despite this progress, patients today aren't doing as well as they could be. Medicines aren't used correctly or consistently, and doctors don't have the tools they need to deliver personalized treatment.

Propeller Health is changing that. We are the leading digital health company in respiratory care. Our technology helps patients and their doctors understand their disease, informs better treatment decisions and improves the quality of life of people living with asthma or COPD.

Our mission is to make life better for every person and community affected by chronic respiratory disease.

Why This Job Is Important

Many patients have forgotten what it's like to not have trouble breathing. We've created a unique technology that combines hardware and software to digitally guide the course of therapy for patients and physicians managing respiratory diseases. Our small team enjoys working together to create and apply technology to challenging problems that have enormous social costs.

We empower people with asthma and COPD to lead their lives without limits; you'll create software that conquers respiratory disease, and learn something new every day as you pioneer new digital health solutions.

Consider Joining Us If You Are
Eager to work at a fast-paced startup company on a 5 to 7 person, self-governed, cross-functional team
Passionate about eliminating waste, and getting stuff done
Not afraid to experiment and fail. Failure is an opportunity to learn, and is embraced as a core tenet of Propeller.
Naturally curious, and believe in lifelong personal growth
Keenly interested in public health and finding solutions to complex healthcare problems
Deeply empathetic towards people who live with chronic illness and those who help care for them
Excited to contribute to our thriving culture by adding your unique background, experience, and perspective to our team
A believer that technology can help solve hard problems and change the world
Aware that technology, by itself, does not delight customers; the sweet spot is when we combine technology with practical solutions, surprises, utility, and social interaction

Product Management

The Product team is responsible for defining and implementing the vision and plan for all the products Propeller produces. We decide which features will be developed and more importantly which will not, set priorities and define requirements so Engineering and QA know what they need to build, test and deploy. We listen to what customers tell our Customer Experience team and many people to help us set priorities on bugs to fix and features to implement and do our best to help Propeller produce good products. We help with user research, for qualitative and quantitative insights into what people want. The product design team provides guidance for visual and user experience for all Propeller products.
Our Product Management team includes; Patient Experience Product Manager, Provider Experience Product Manager, Product Development User Researcher, and Product Designers.

What's In It For You

Work with a smart, creative and diverse team of professionals. Solving respiratory disease requires a wide array of disciplines to work together. For example, we have epidemiologists, physicians/clinicians on staff combined with engineers, statisticians and data scientists to build the best respiratory solution possible.
Connecting as a team is important to us. We create plenty of opportunities to get together, such as regular summer cookouts for lunch, after work events like board game and hobby night, and our annual company-wide camping trip! You can opt in where it makes sense for you.
We care about balancing work with the rest of life. We encourage and support our team members to disconnect when they're not at work.
A great office location in downtown Madison, steps from fun restaurants and shops!

Propeller Health is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive team with a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, each helping us understand our patients better, and strengthen our team. We firmly believe that hiring and supporting a diverse team allows us to do the best work of our lives, and make the disease experience different. To do this, we strive to maximize access to every opportunity, cultivate a diverse set of candidates, and if hired, providing them with support, mentorship, and growth opportunities. We don't discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, ability status, or any other differences. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. All are welcome here.

title: Senior Product Manager
job_description: ABOUT HOPPERAt Hopper, we’re on a mission to make booking travel faster, easier, and more transparent. We are leveraging the power that comes from combining massive amounts of data and machine learning to build the world’s fastest-growing travel app -- one that enables our customers to save money and travel more. With over $235M CAD in funding from leading investors in both Canada and the US, Hopper is primed to continue its path toward becoming the go-to way to book travel as the world continues its shift to mobile.Recognized as the fastest-growing travel app by Forbes and one of the world’s most innovative companies by Fast Company two years in a row, Hopper has been downloaded over 40 million times and has helped travelers plan over 100 million trips and counting. The app has received high praise in the form of mobile accolades such as the Webby Award for Best Travel App of 2019, the Google Play Award for Standout Startup of 2016 and Apple’s App Store Best of 2015. Take off with us!THE ROLEProduct Managers at Hopper are “smart creatives” that will take the Hopper app from a disruptive, startup product to being the global leader in mobile travel. As a Product Manager, you will work at the intersection of development, data science, and user experience, as well as have a competitive understanding of the travel landscape to facilitate the creation of successful new features. On any given day - whether you’re weighing the tradeoffs of offering new features, scoping and specifying solutions, or shepherding features through development - your contribution will be critical to Hopper’s current and future success. Hopper’s Air product has been one of the biggest disruptors in the travel space since its launch in early 2015, helping travelers plan over 100 million trips and save nearly $2.5 billion along the way by leveraging big data technologies to help users understand the best time and destinations to fly, and more importantly, the best time to book airfare. We are looking for Product Managers to own the product roadmap to scale the Air product to be the preeminent destination for travelers when purchasing flights. This means exciting opportunities to own the booking funnel, sell ancillary products, and alleviate anxiety for millions of travelers. If you’re looking to dive deep into the challenges of scaling an established product to the market leader, look no further. THE PRODUCTUntil recently, billions of dollars of flights and hotels had been purchased through Hopper by customers paying in full for their trip at time of booking. Over the last several years, installment payments have changed the way consumers spend money online, and in travel particularly, with over 30% of online shoppers stating they would not have made a purchase had the option to finance it not existed. This problem is particularly pronounced in travel, given the need to spend hundreds or thousands of dollars upfront often several months prior to their trip.While the largest travel companies in the world now plug in to third party widgets to offer customers the ability to finance their trips, Hopper is leveraging its data science DNA to build an internal banking and lending function to offer this natively, the first travel company in the world to do so. Installments payments launched on Hopper in April 2020, is scaling quickly, and requires a senior product person to own it end-to-end.IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL:Manage a product roadmap for a set of features from inception through implementation; collect requirements, establish key performance metrics, craft the user experience, and drive executionCollaborate closely with data science to dive deep into our data to understand our usersWork with business leaders to help shape and drive business cases for product features Ideate and wireframe new features that will be in the hands of millions of users across the globeIdentify the essential qualities of each feature: what's important, what's not, how can we limit cost and risk?Understand and explain complex technical issues, discern impact, and communicate them to maximize clarity and drive resolutionUse good judgment to make appropriate trade-offs when scoping and specifying solutions, ensuring that anything we build adds value to the business and continues to delight our usersA PERFECT CANDIDATE HAS:Thrived in a consumer product role and delivered delightful features at scaleAn innovative and detail-oriented approach to problem-solvingThe instinct to get on a whiteboard and explain their thinking, and even faster to document that thinking into expected use cases and user behaviors, driving UX for new features from start to finishExceptional ability to grasp, manage, and articulate complex systemsExperience connecting innovative solutions to real-world, user problems with actual business needs of a rapidly scaling organizationTechnical depth that allows you to communicate with, understand, and earn the respect of world-class engineers and data scientistsA track record of being proactive and persuading colleagues by constructing a compelling narrative both in-person and in-writingPast success analyzing data, drawing accurate conclusions, and adjusting strategy accordinglyNo ego. Strong focus on doing what is right for the customer and the companyExperience with mobile product development strongly preferredExperience with GDS, CRS, airline, hotel and/or other travel systems a plusBENEFITS• Well-funded and proven startup with large ambitions, competitive salary and stock options• Dynamic and entrepreneurial team where pushing limits is everyday business• 100% employer paid medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance plans• Access to a 401k (US) or Retirement Savings Plan (Canada)• Easy commute with a paid-for public transportation or parking pass• Fully stocked kitchen with: coffee/tea, beer, bagels and snacks (both healthy and not-healthy)• Team lunches, offsite activities and much more!

title: Product Development Manager
job_description:
If you are motivated to succeed and can see yourself in this role, please complete our application. We will follow up with you on the next steps in the interview process.

Our associates are a strategic advantage for us who are making a difference at Littelfuse. Join our team and make a difference every day!Manager of Product Development-FusesReporting to the Senior Manager of Engineering, TheMgr Product Development - Fuses will be responsible for executing the Fuse Development Roadmap. He/she should be an expert in fuse design and familiar with the processes and automation used for fuse manufacturing and should be a strong team leader with an ability to communicate vision, goals and achievements. The individual should be creative, innovative and straight forward in his/her approaches and serves as coach or mentor to his/her team, leading by example and modeling appropriate behavior. Littelfuse EBU operates in multiple engineering and manufacturing locations in Asia, US and in Europe. Littelfuse is market leader in circuit protection and sensors and innovator for passive circuit protection and offers technically superior and environmentally friendly solutions for the entire electronics industry including Automotive, Industrial, Consumer and Appliance Industry. Electronic Business Unit (EBU) is almost a half a billion USD business.

TheMgr Product Development - Fuses will be responsible for executing the Fuse Development Roadmap. The Fuse Product Development team supports a revenue of $140M. The individual reports to the VP Engineering. The position is located in Chicago. He/she has a total of 2 direct and 14 indirect reports located in Suzhou and Lipa. The EBU fuse development team shall work closely with the Fuse Technology team.About the Job:

Lead the multi-location and multicultural Product Development team for Fuses located in Chicago, Suzhou and Lipa. Master of Science Degree or PhD in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics or similar experience10+ years of experience in the development of electronic, electromechanical components, sensors or similar components. Specific experience in Fuse development and component level design is required and knowledge in active circuit protection would be of advantage. Horizontal technical development skills with material mass production processing, product processing, product design, and application also are needed in the position. Proven record of successfully leading a distributed and multicultural New Product Development teams. Familiar with state of the art engineering tools and processes serving multiple industries. Knowledge of the Industries served (Electronics, Industrial, Automotive, Appliances etc.). Good in execution of projects. Innovative thinker driving for new and innovative products and processes. Able to collaborate well with different disciplines in the company (PM, Marketing, MDE, Operations, Quality). Able to communicate and negotiate with customers. Familiar with related manufacturing processes and quality procedures. Able to lead and empower the Fuse development team in order to defend our market leadership position. Able to handle complex problems, able to work under pressure, attract the right talents with the right skills.

We Offer:

The possibility to work in this exciting and challenging industry.
To develop you professionally and to expand your knowledge through cross-functional collaboration and training experiences.

Our associates are a strategic advantage for us who are making a difference at Littelfuse. Join our team and make a difference every day!

title: Product Manager - AI/ML Group
job_description:
Today, nearly every business in the world has to do bookkeeping and accounting in order to file taxes, understand financial health, and most importantly, make strategic business decisions. The process is universally manual, tedious, and error prone. At the same time, the process follows well-defined rules, abides by industry standardization, and has become increasingly data-rich. It’s a product-focused machine learning team’s dream.

Sage Artificial Intelligence Labs “SAIL” is a nimble team within Sage Intacct building the future of cloud accounting by leveraging artificial intelligence. The SAIL team builds capabilities to help businesses make better decisions through data-powered insights.

We are looking for an outstanding Product Manager to define and deliver the next generation of AI-powered financial management products. As a part of our cross-functional team, including data scientists and engineers, you will drive key product decisions, manage customer priorities, lead customer conversations, and launch new features. You will gain deep expertise in our products, and use your expertise to deliver customer value. Through your work, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of AI-powered financial management products at a leading financial management software company.

Responsibilities:

Own feature / product development from conception to launch Deeply understand the problems and needs of our customers Be an expert on our product, market, and competitors Define features with specs, mockups, and flows Work hand-in-hand with engineers, designers, product experts, and other internal teams to turn ideas into products in production Define and analyze metrics to understand feature adoption and guide development of existing and new features Conceptualize how AI / ML can be applied to drive customer value and work with the cross-functional team to bring those ideas to life

Requirements:

3+ years of product management experienceKnowledge of AI / ML and first-hand experience working with AI / ML-powered technology productsAn entrepreneurial / self-starter mindset who first and foremost knows how to get work done in a dynamic environmentTrack record of successfully launching and managing productsDeep analytical, prioritization, and problem-solving skillsObsesses over getting the product details right but knows how to ship on timeAble to influence and inspire a cross-functional team to reach ambitious goalsClear and compelling in written and spoken communication; comfortable with public speakingExperience with Agile software development, sprint grooming and planning

You may be fit for this role if you:

Thrive in a highly technical, engineering focused company Believe that a good plan, violently executed now, is better than a perfect plan next week Believe that the best ideas win and that they can come from anyone regardless of position Are able to put ego aside and do whatever it takes to get the job done Are comfortable giving and receiving open and honest feedback with the goal of improving how you and your teamwork Enjoy working in high performing teams, which value learning, shared responsibility and moving fast

What's it like to work here:

You will have an opportunity to work in an environment where engineering is central to what we do. The products we build are breaking new ground, and we have a focus on providing the best environment to allow you to do what you do best - solve problems, collaborate with your team and push first class software. Our distributed team is spread across multiple continents, we promote an open diverse environment, encourage contributions to open-source software and invest heavily in our staff. Our team is talented, capable and inclusive. We know that great things can only be done with great teams and look forward to continuing this direction.

title: Product Manager-Student Information Systems
job_description:
Edupoint Educational Systems, a "Top Companies to Work For" recipient is currently seeking a Product Manager- Student Information Systems to join our growing team of professionals. As a Product Manager, you will oversee the entire portfolio of SIS development projects and provides leadership and supervision over the development and Quality Assurance. develop best-in-class education solutions used by millions daily while working with an energetic and innovative team.  In this role, you will be responsible for allocating resources, establishing and managing development priorities, ensuring on-time completion of assigned tasks, proactively manage the quality of work products and provide overall leadership to the development staff within the Department of Software Services. SIS product development requirements for which the Product Manager has responsibility generally fall into these categories:

Contractually Obligated Customizations: these are usually for-fee requirements that may be part of product implementation contracts or specific customer requests made through the Customer Resource Center (CRC).
Product Improvements: these generally are corrections to product defects and minor product enhancements that are approved for implementation by the Change Control Board (CCB).
SIS Product Quality – ensures best QA practices are being implanted for a thoroughly tested product.

 If you’re looking to make a difference, please apply! We offer a Comprehensive Package to include generous Paid Time Off, excellent medical coverage, dental, vision, life insurance, and 401K with immediate vesting opportunities. Job Summary:


The Product Manager allocates resources, establishes and manages development priorities, ensures on-time completion of assigned tasks, proactively manages the quality of work products, and provides overall leadership to the development staff within the Department of Software Services. SIS product development requirements for which the Product Manager has responsibility generally fall into these categories:

Contractually Obligated Customizations: these are usually for-fee requirements that may be part of product implementation contracts or specific customer requests made through the Customer Resource Center (CRC).
Product Improvements: these generally are corrections to product defects and minor product enhancements that are approved for implementation by the Change Control Board (CCB).
SIS Product Quality – ensures best QA practices are being implanted for a thoroughly tested product.



Job Duties:
Edupoint’s Synergy® Student Information System is a market-leading K-12 education software application used by schools and school districts throughout the nation. While it is a stable and mature product, widespread use, and the company’s growing customer base results in continuous demand for customizations, product improvements, and other changes.
Requests for software development services generally originate through implementation project managers for districts in implementation and the Company’s Customer Resource Center (CRC) for fully implemented customers. At a minimum, the Product Manager executes the following duties, both in response to those requests and as part of ongoing quality assurance within the development group:

Provide leadership, supervision, coaching, and staff development to the software development staff.
Provide leadership, supervision, coaching, and staff development to the quality assurance staff.
Carry out directives from the VP, Software Services, and the Company’s Executive Leadership Team.
Work closely with Project Management, the CRC, and the CCB to coordinate work requests.
Work closely with Account Management to understand client priorities
Provide account managers with the status of tickets and/or projects
Participate in partner district discussion to review ticket/project status, troubleshoot issues or provide technical support
Continuously manage allocation of development resources to work requests.
Work with Project Management to track progress through for customization projects.
Protect allocation of resources to backlog and product improvements to ensure continual progress.
Coordinate software updates and integration requirements with the Synergy Special Education and Grade Book development teams.
Assign and enforce work deadlines for all development staff.
Work with the VP, Software Services and the VP, Support Services and staff to plan sprints and releases.
Assist the VP, Software Services in developing and implementing an effective Agile-based SDLC methodology.
Develop, implement, and report metrics for reporting status, quality, and productivity of individuals and the staff as a whole to senior management.
Coordinate with the VP, Product Development regarding Synergy Technology framework issues and assistance.
Participate in customer and internal department and company meetings as required.
Work with the VP, Software Services to develop budget projections and monitor actuals against projections.
Conduct one on ones with direct reports
Maintain reports that show metrics and status of efforts of development and quality assurance teams.
Identify improvements to tools to increase the productivity of development and quality assurance
Ensure unit testing, code reviews and peer reviews are being conducted in accordance with Edupoint development practices
Ensure the creation of functional test scripts for use in regression testing and automation.
Perform other duties as assigned by the VP, Software Services.

Job Requirements-Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Ability to work both independently and collaboratively
Ability to proactively and effectively lead a group of 20-30 software developers and analysts
Strong customer-first orientation
Strong project and time management and problem-solving skills
Strong organizational and analytical abilities
Well-refined ability to multi-task and manage details
Ability to communicate effectively in writing and verbally
Ability to effectively manage a large, fast-moving portfolio of projects and work requests
Working knowledge of current software development methods and best practices.
Professional job experience with current software technology and tools, such as web-based solutions, SQL, XML, .Net, etc.
5+ years of development experience with C# and ASP.NET applications
Competence in the use of the Microsoft® Office® suite of products, specifically Word®, Excel®, PowerPoint®

The following additional knowledge, skills, and abilities are preferred:

Familiarity with K-12 Education software products
Knowledge and skills in Agile and Scrum Software Development practices
Experience and skills with Microsoft® Visual Studio® and associated source-code control tools


Working familiarity with Microsoft® Project® and Visio®

Education and/or Experience:

Minimum of a bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in computer science, information systems, engineering, or related discipline; master’s degree is a plus
Minimum of 5 years management/leadership experience in a software development or technology organization


Record of successful delivery of software and/or technology projects and solutions

Typical Physical Demands and Work Environment: 
Work may require sitting for long periods of time; also stooping, bending, and stretching for files and supplies, occasionally lifting files, objects, or paper weighing up to 30 pounds. Requires manual dexterity sufficient to operate a keyboard, telephone, copier, and other office equipment as necessary. Hearing must be in the normal range for telephone and video conferencing contacts. Visual acuity is necessary to work extended hours on computer screens. Ability to work in a typical office environment with moderate noise and which can be fast-paced and project intensive. Travel and some extended overnight trips in the performance of duties may be required.

Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance

Short and Long Term Disability

title: Senior Product Manager
job_description:
About MasterControl:

MasterControl Inc. is a leading provider of cloud-based quality and compliance software for life sciences and other regulated industries. Our mission is the same as that of our customers to bring life-changing products to more people sooner. The MasterControl Platform helps organizations digitize, automate and connect quality and compliance processes across the regulated product development life cycle. Over 1,000 companies worldwide rely on MasterControl solutions to achieve new levels of operational excellence across product development, clinical trials, regulatory affairs, quality management, supply chain, manufacturing and postmarket surveillance. For more information, visitwww.mastercontrol.com.

SUMMARY

The Senior Product Manager position requires a rare combination of product management experience for a manufacturing, operations, or production department.

The Senior Product Manager works closely with other Product and Architecture team members on the overall PLx platform that helps life science companies make their products available to more people sooner. The Manufacturing Product Manager works side by side with another Manufacturing Product Manager on the growing MasterControl Manufacturing product line.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Represent our customers' manufacturing-related personas and their problems & challenges to work with the MasterControl Labs organizationCooperatively work with the Manufacturing Product Manager on strategic epics & features as defined by SAFe (scaled agile framework)Participate in ongoing collaboration with internal partners to evolve and execute our productPartner with the business to identify opportunities, shape and improve the Mx product lineSupport the launch strategy process (marketing, sales strategy, demo highlights, etc.) Identify and track milestones (spec completion, beta testing, etc.)Routinely and regularly interact with customers (feedback on specs, early demonstrations, beta, etc.)Assist marketing (draft messaging for collateral, create initial presentations, attend events as a speaker and subject matter expert)Assist sales (demonstrate the vision, participate on sales calls, etc.)

IDEAL CANDIDATE

The ideal candidate will have 5-10 years of experience working as a Product Manager for a software company that develops enterprise software for manufacturing, production, and/or operations.

Pluses include one or more of the following:

Experience with a life sciences company Even better would be exposure to pharma, medical device, biologic, and biotechExposure to multiple companies and their respective manufacturing processes

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience. An MBA or other advanced degree is a plus.Very strong communication skills, both written and verbalBe located or relocate to MasterControl headquarters in Salt Lake City, Utah.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORKING CONDITIONS:

Some travel is required, typically to interact with customers, present at user group meetings, participate in sales meetings, etc.Must be able to work well with peopleAbility to operate a computer and work at a desk for extended periods of timeAbility to communicate effectively in writing, in person, over the telephone and in e-mail

Why Work Here?

#WhyWorkAnywhereElse

#ExceptionalTeamCulture

MasterControl is a place where Exceptional Teams come together to do their best work. Hiring Exceptional Teams, including the best talent in our industry, is a core value of ours. MasterControl employees are surrounded by intelligent, motivated individuals every day. We like to call it #TheBestTeamOnThePlanet.

We value every employee and their contribution to what makes MasterControl successful. We give right back to the employee through a generous benefits package, great flexibility, and continuous opportunities for advancement.

Not only do we hire Exceptional Teams, but we work hard to keep them here by developing and challenging their skillsets, encouraging professional development and growth, and offering a culture that can't be found elsewhere. Which is why we say - #WhyWorkAnywhereElse?

To put it simply, working at MasterControl is fun, challenging, and rewarding. From our Fitness Clubs to our awards programs, from our company parties to our competitive benefits, you can't really go wrong. MasterControl could be your next (and last) career move!

We are growing quickly and always looking for talented individuals to add to #TheBestTeamOnThePlanet!

Here are some of the benefits MasterControl employees enjoy:

Generous PTO package of three weeks, increasing after just three years of employmentCompetitive compensation with annual merit increase reviews100% medical premium coverage (yes, you read that right!)Dental/Vision Plans401k PlanEmployer Paid Life Insurance Policy ($50K)Great FlexibilityWellness Programs (every employee gets a Fitbit!)

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.Job Posted by ApplicantPro

title: Equipment Manager
job_description:
EquipmentShare is Hiring an Equipment ManagerEquipmentShare is searching for an experienced Equipment Manager for our Corporate office to help effectively and intelligently scale our rental fleet across our 35+ markets in the U.S. to better serve our customers and their equipment needs.About EquipmentShareEquipmentShare is dedicated to creating a connected jobsite for the modern contractor. We deliver technology-driven, user-friendly solutions that provide direct value for construction industry professionals—all optimized for maximum uptime, reduced risk exposure and increased productivity. Our product offerings range from an improved rental experience to fleet tracking and asset management software to hardware security solutions to predictive service and maintenance applications.

We are also the fastest-growing, independently owned construction equipment rental company in the country. We currently serve 35 markets across the U.S. and are on track to launch 10 additional locations by year's end. Our branch locations are equipped with a broad range of construction equipment ranging from 150' telescopic booms to 120,000lb track excavators.

Our rapid growth goes beyond and is attributed to so much more than simply meeting a demand for equipment rentals in booming new markets. The U.S. alone has over 4,500 publicly held and independently owned rental companies so there are plenty of options available to source equipment.

Our growth and success in the rental space is also not just a means-to-an-end and we're not just another rental company popping up with the age-old strategy of showing up first and for the most market share possible. Unlike so many other players in the industry, our mission begins with our rental product and is the first of many sectors within the industry that we're solving problems for and redesigning to better serve the customer. Our goal is to fundamentally change the industry through a permanent national and, ultimately, global footprint. Our expansion and customer retention is a validation of strong contractor demand for the proprietary technology solutions we've built into our rental fleet from the ground up. Through our full service branches we deploy new equipment with cutting-edge technology like cloud-based access control, predictive service, and integrated management tools that deliver immediate, measurable value to our customers.Your Opportunity to Grow With UsOur existing team is a close-knit group of professionals with a genuine interest in providing exceptional service to others, both internally and externally. We find enormous satisfaction from a job well done and we're seeking a motivated and experienced full-time Equipment Manager who loves a challenge and the opportunity to grow with a fast-paced company. Unlike many competitors that have layers of tenured management, the opportunity for rapid advancement and increased responsibility as our fleet continues to grow is unparalleled in the industry.

Primary Responsibilities

Maintain frequent communication with branch and sales management to determine upcoming rental fleet needs and provide information on incoming equipment
Creatively provide solutions for time sensitive opportunities through transfers, expedited delivery of new fleet, or negotiation of Re-rent options
Work with manufacturers to track shipping and receiving of new equipment
Negotiate pricing, volume, and new equipment specifications directly with manufacturers on new fleet orders and trade in packages

About You Our mission to change an entire industry is not easily achieved so we only hire people who are inspired by the goal and up for the challenge. In turn, our employees have every opportunity to grow with us, achieving personal and professional success while enjoying the satisfaction that comes from making a tangible difference in an industry resistant to change and ripe for disruption.Skills & Qualifications

Extensive working knowledge of one or more classes of construction equipment: Aerial, Material Handling, Ground Engaging, Small or Towable Tools, Industrial equipment, Pump and Power.
Intermediate experience with spreadsheets (EXCEL/Google), pivot tables and asset reports.
Ability to work with a tight deadline to creatively problem solve and provide solutions.
Organizational, time management and multitasking skills

Why We're a Better Place to Work

Competitive salary
Health insurance and medical coverage benefits
401(k)
Generous paid time off
Stocked breakroom and full kitchen
Free weekly team workout at a local gym
Volunteering and local charity initiatives that help you nurture and grow the communities you call home through EquipmentCare
Opportunities for continued education, mentorship and professional development with conferences, seminars and more.

Since our founding in 2015, we've had explosive growth—and we're not stopping anytime soon. Ready to invest in our mission, invest in yourself and discover a better place to work? Then we'd love to meet you. Apply today.

EquipmentShare is an EOE M/F/D/V

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Globalization Partners' mission is to eliminate the barriers to global business and make it easy for companies to hire in more than 170 countries within days. Our renowned culture has been named one of the Top 150 Company Cultures in America, and our goal is to add the best talent to our award-winning team!

About the position:

As a Product Manager at Globalization Partners, you will be performing across the end-to-end spectrum of product management discipline for your product line in this role, you will bridge the technical and business worlds as you design products that our customers love. You must enjoy spending time in the market to understand real customer problems and needs, find innovative solutions that are scalable and repeatable for the broader market adoption. You must enjoy communicating with all functional areas within the company, such as Engineering, Operations, Finance, Marketing, Legal, UX, Customer Success, Support, as well as with other product managers in the practice. You will serve as both internal and external evangelist for your product line.

What you'll do:

Manage the end-to-end life cycle of the product line from strategic planning to tactical execution.
Build successful partnerships with engineering groups, eloquently authoring user stories around the expected deliverables, deconstructing business requirements and translating into user stories for Engineering teams
Take ownership of roadmap predictability, be a strong change manager, and drive operational excellence
Identify market opportunities, synthesize trends in the PEO ecosystem, measure product performance, growth, and couple these with insights from customers and partners
Be a master in cross-functional collaboration by developing deep relationships with key cross-functional partners across the company and Establish a shared product understanding

What we're looking for:

3-5 years of demonstrated success in product management
S. degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience; M.S. or MBA is a plus.
Inspiring communicator who can demonstrate a wide peripheral knowledge and can speak to all functional groups that come together in orchestrating the product life cycle.
Experience with agile software development methodologies, frameworks, and tools
Excellent Problem solving and business analysis experience
Experience learning and shifting priorities, while maintaining organization and control of the expected product outcomes

Perks:

Sabbatical
World class benefits, including health, vision and dental
401k matching
Competitive compensation
Paid-time-off (PTO)
Generous, equal-gender family leave
Frequent team events- including happy hours and lunches
We'll keep you fed with snacks, treats, and beverages

title: Aggregate Manager
job_description:
Position summary:

Under the direction of the Area Manager, the Aggregate Manager will manage the day-to-day operations associated with quarry management and aggregate production. Main duties will include production oversight, budgeting, operational and process improvements, and employee leadership with a strong emphasis on ethics, safety and environmental compliance. This position works closely with other manufacturing departments, along with finance, environmental, safety, technical services and human resources.

Role and Responsibilities

Safety

Provide leadership and be a safety role model by promoting and enforcing safe work habitsEnforce MSHA laws and regulations and promote safety within the organization

Crushing/Washing Production

Ensure materials meet specifications and shipping/load out time frames

Work with foreman in the day-to-day operations of aggregate production Prepare aggregate site budgets and oversee production Monitor production costs regularly Identify ways to increase production efficiency and lower costsSchedule, approve, and monitor all routine, preventative, and emergency equipment repair projects and costsMaintain, assist, and develop layouts and plans of crushing and wash plants, detailing plant layouts, material flows, screen sizes, products and TPH for quarry sites and productsAnalyze equipment usage and needs, research and makes recommendations on new equipment Work with asphalt plant managers to coordinate production needs and schedule

Site Operations

Work with land resource department to develop short and long term site operations plans detailing the most advisable and economical direction to mine a particular siteDirect & support site foreman on planning and implementation of the operations plansCoordinate completion of necessary site work Ensure professional appearance and aesthetics of site(s) Supervise and coordinate with blasting supervisor for all drilling and blasting needs for all managed sitesReview and approve invoices, assign costs to proper sites or jobsManage subcontractors when performing work on site(s)Prepare monthly production inventory booking in accordance with budget and monthly inventory reconciliation to ensure accuracy

Quality Control

Work with site foreman and quality control personnel in scheduling materials testing and maintaining product specifications Assist in perpetual review, improvement and implementation of CQI procedures and processes

Other

Coordinate all GPS services needed with the Survey DepartmentEnsure product availability and specification along with continuous communication with manufacturing management about aggregate related issues and developmentsUnderstand local zoning ordinancesMaintain good communication and positive relationship with government officials

Qualifications and Education Requirements

Three (3) or more years of experience in crushing and washing production and quarry management in the aggregate and or mining industryKnowledge of all aspects of day-to-day operations for aggregate production Must be safety oriented including detailed knowledge of the Mine Safety & Health Administration safety regulations, compliance and inspection process requiredExperience with all aspects of quarry management Strong oral and written communication skillsIntermediate computer skills with Microsoft Office applications Ability to travel locally and regionallyAbility to handle multiple tasks simultaneouslyMust be a team player

Preferred Skills

Bachelor's degree in engineering, mining or related field preferredHCSS Heavy Job and Heavy Bid preferred

Benefits

The Walbec Group offers a great benefit package including PTO, health, dental, vision, life, disability, 401(k), profit sharing, flex spending, employee assistance and career development.

We are an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and it is our practice to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants. In addition, it is the policy of our Company to comply with applicable federal, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in each locality in which our Company has employees.
