title: Mgr., Product Development
job_description:
Job Description

Company DescriptionSince time began, the earth’s been a generous contributor to people’s well-being. We haven’t been around quite that long, but The Nature’s Bounty Co. has been enriching lives of consumers around the world for more than 70 years. And before we even got started, the world was developing our motivation: Nature’s bountiful effects on people’s health.

Through our years, we’ve been a leader in health and wellness with our innovative products and solutions. We put science and the highest quality standards at the heart of our business—that’s why The Nature’s Bounty Co. brands are some of the most trusted in the world. We’re a leading global manufacturer, marketer, distributor and retailer of vitamins, nutritional supplements, sports & active nutrition, and ethical beauty products.

We’re also a great place to work, with excellent benefits, competitive compensation and a progressive, healthy company culture. If you’ve ever spent your workdays watching the clock, you know how important a positive work environment is for a person’s well-being. The Nature’s Bounty Co. is committed to supporting wellness in all its forms. And when it comes to wellness, nature is a pretty good place to start.Job DescriptionThe Manager of Product Development will manage technical projects including design, development, and technology transfer of new formulas, products, and line extensions and providing technical support to existing products as needed in the Natural & Organic (N&O) category. This position leads and supports new product development in N&O through sage-gates and all pre- and post-evaluations, develops new or improved products/ processes leading to Product Launch, and identifies, assesses and exploits enabling technology and delivery form platforms to support growth of current and future N&O Brands and Platforms with an emphasis on proprietary and differentiated solutions.

Additional responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Being a recognized technical leadership/subject matter expert in an important area(s) of innovation within the N&O and/or Over-The-Counter (OTC) space.Act as the technical expert and lead projects from inception to commercialization.Interface with co-manufactures or vendors to co-develop new products.Develop budgets and schedule project plans for new product launches. Serve as key member of Research & Development (R&D) franchise teams, working with marketing, supply chain and other partners within the organization.Independently plan, manage and complete technical programs necessary to design, develop and optimize new and improved formulations, products, delivery systems for products that meet customer needs and are robust and reproducible.Creatively links formulation and/or product science and technology opportunities to the needs of the business through development and transfer of new products from Idea to Commercialization, transfer technologies from bench/pilot to manufacturing scale and successfully implementing proprietary and differentiated technical solutions.Manages complex business relationships with ingredient/bioactive, form or process technology partner companies, contract developers and manufacturers, consultants, vendors, cross-functional departments, and outside university experts to ensure customer needs and projects are executed in an efficient and effective manner.Manages the identification, assessment and development of enabling technology/delivery form platforms to enable meaningfully unique delivery of current and future ingredients/bio-actives to grow Brands and Platforms short and long term pipeline value.Collect, analyze, interpret and draw conclusions and make recommendations from data to enable technical execution of projects. Modify methodology to improve the quality, accuracy and usefulness of data.Provide technical recommendations to R&D, Project and Brand teams through clear and concise oral and written communications.Manages technical staff as needed at internal and external research, development and manufacturing sites. Develops, documents and transfers critical ingredient, product, process and analytical parameters/specifications to Supply Chain/QA to ensure consumer focused and robust design of new products, processes and characterizing methods. Ensure proper documentation for all technical and project work is completed.Develops and reviews intellectual property strategy and conducts patent searches, literature reviews and is current with cross industry technology insights. Understands application and benefits/costs to our product portfolio. Ensure competitive advantage through implementation of proprietary and differentiated technical solutions.Plan, develop and coordinate and direct large, important R&D projects or a number of small projects with many complex features.May technically supervise, coordinate and review the work of a small staff of on-site or remote scientists and technicians.Provides input on budget allocation and project prioritization.Coordinates and influences Brand Marketing, Insights & Analytics, Supply Chain, R&D and QA as key member and activity owner on Project, Brand and Platform teams.



Job Requirements

7+ years of industrial experience in the OTC or dietary supplement industry and with continually increasing scope of responsibilitiesBS, MS, PhD in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Chemical Engineering, Pharmaceutical Science or equivalentTraining or certifications in Project Management, Design of Experiments or equivalent is preferred2+ years of experience in a supervisory role managing others at a functional or project levelBreadth of technical knowledge and experience in application in OTC/ nutritionals/dietary supplement formulation, product, process and platform development and delivery systemsStrong business acumen linking science to commercial opportunitiesExperience in technical projects and project/program/platform leadership in an R&D environmentDemonstrated proficiency in New Product Development (NPD)/Stage-Gate process from Idea through CommercializationExcellent oral and written communication skills with proven ability to manage up and work well in a collaborative team environmentExperience in budget management, project prioritization and resource allocationKnowledge and application of design thinking, design of experiments and relevant statistical tools in product developmentStrong technical activity management in a stage-gate system is requiredProven ability to deliver programs on time and within budget Product lifecycle management (PLM) system knowledge is required

The Nature's Bounty Co. is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

The Nature's Bounty Co. offers a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package, which includes health and dental plans, voluntary short-term and long-term disability, life insurance, flexible spending accounts, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, generous associate discounts and more!

title: Biotechnology Manufacturing Manager
job_description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW Nittobo America Inc. was established in 1986. Our primary emphasis is the manufacturing and supply of antisera and calibrators in bulk quantities as raw material to immunodiagnostic assay manufacturers. We are ISO Certified (9001:2015).
COMPANY PHILOSOPHY The people in the Nittobo Group, with regard to all corporate activities and business development, contribute to the succession of our precious global environment for the next generations, with sustainable development and by providing eco-friendly products and services.
COMPANY MISSION STATEMENT To manufacture diagnostic products that create consistent value for our customers and contribute to a healthy and comfortable lifestyle; we will do this by managing our business with integrity, the highest ethical standards, and in a socially responsible manner.
Position Summary
Plans, coordinates and directs the manufacture and distribution of quality bulk antisera and calibrators in a safe, cost efficient and timely manner. Manages inventory control, warehousing and distribution functions. Performs the following duties personally or through subordinates. All duties are performed in a manner that is consistent with the goals and policies of the company, as well as in compliance with ISO standards, where applicable.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Plans and manages production strategy to ensure inventory meets material budget goals within constraints of financial inventory objectives.
Reconciles Product Inventories monthly for review and approval by President for inclusion in Accounting reports.
Responsible for product and process improvement within the scope of manufacturing and test of antisera and calibrators.
Responsible for maintenance of functional chromatography May coordinate with MIS personnel for assistance with computer portion of equipment.
Directs and coordinates with R&D for implementation of new product and process improvements. Assists in development of ligands necessary to ensure consistent quality of existing core products.
Prepares departmental reports for budgets, capital expenditures, and cost analysis as required for annual planning and review activities.
Develops improvements in standard processing to increase efficiency and reduce costs.
Responsible for calibration of all lab equipment.
Coordinates and facilitates integration of distribution activity with sales functions to ensure product delivery in timely manner.
Functions as database(s) advisor for company.
Oversees shipping and receiving and also logistics.
Responsible for validation of new products and new gels.
Oversees DI Water system to ensure quality and value to all operations.

POSITIONS REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's degree (B.S.) in chemistry or life science from four-year college or university; and eight to ten years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Requires a demonstrated ability to lead people and get results through others. Provides leadership for problem resolution to facilitate fast improvements and improved working relationships. Offers leadership in developing, improving, and implementing corporate policies and procedures in conjunction with the President.
Requires the ability to read, analyze, and interpret scientific and technical journals, professional journals, technical procedures and government regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information to top management or customers.
Nittobo America Inc. offers competitive wages and an exceptionally strong benefits package. At Nittobo America Inc. we promote a work environment which makes the most of people's individuality. We respect the individual potential of each of our employees. Facilitated by teamwork, we aim to become a more powerful corporate entity, based on freedom of expression and the robust exchange of ideas.

title: Product Manager – Connected Products Software & Services
job_description:
Western

Digital
The next big thing in data is you!
At Western Digital we’re developing the next-generation of smart storage products and services -- making all your digital stuff accessible, engaging and safe from anywhere and any device. As a member of our talented team, you will define, develop and launch products that touch the lives of hundreds of millions of people. In our division of Western Digital, we hire the best, operate with the freedom and innovation of a start-up, and are backed by the resources, scale and market leadership of a Fortune 500 company.

We’re looking for an experienced and entrepreneurial consumer software Product Manager to help innovate and execute key product initiatives across the company. You will influence the product vision and build-out completely new capabilities into our products. You’ll analyze data, understand user behavior, identify trends, craft product strategies, define products, lead cross-functional programs, measure results and drive product implementation and rollout. This position is based in our Milpitas, CA office.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Define short-to-medium term strategy for evolving our smart storage products and services based on customer personas and use-cases along with identifying new areas for growthCollaborate with engineering and design teams to ship impactful features (e.g. cloud acceleration, advanced search, auto-content creation, aggregation and security), including preparing the necessary technical specs, coordinating development activity and tracking progress of in-process itemsWork closely with marketing and customer service to deeply understand, analyze and synthesize user needs into product priorities, roadmap plans and detailed specificationsProcess, review and interpret qualitative and quantitative data on competition, customers, usage / metrics to uncover new product insights and drive engagementBuild cross functional relationships and manage complex, cross-functional projects across multiple teams 

REQUIRED:

BS in computer science or an equivalent degree requiredMBA or equivalent degree is a plus but not mandatory3 - 5+ years’ experience as a software Product ManagerExperience launching software products with multiple releasesConsumer application (mobile, desktop and web) experience critical; photos/video applications are a plusDeep understanding and empathy for users / user experienceExperience working on platform SDK and with 3rd party developers a plusAbility to analyze and use data to inform decisions; strategic, product-minded thinkerProven ability to lead teams and work cross-functionally in a highly collaborative environment; experience with Scrum and Agile development methods is importantAbility to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance; comfortable dealing with ambiguityA passion for building great end-user experiences that deliver value without complexity


ABOUT

The

title: Business Development Manager - Process Automation
job_description:
Do you have a strong understanding of Engineering and Industrial Controls? Do you have experience selling multiple services (not products)? Then combine that experience and help us deliver results as a Business Development Manager for MAVERICK Technologies! You can make a positive impact for a growing organization!

MAVERICK Technologies is currently recruiting for a Business Development Manager to work in our North region, preferably in Minneapolis/St. Paul or Wisconsin. The BDM offers excellent potential for bonuses on top of a base salary. Experience with Solutions based sales or selling services (not products) is crucial. We are also flexible on the location.

A successful Engineering Business Development Manager will focus on delivering solutions, not products. Qualified candidates must have demonstrated ability to thrive in a collaborative environment where operations and sales work together to plan and execute successful projects and exceed customer expectations. Must be willing to travel as needed.. The ideal candidate will be technically savvy and have an understanding of engineering and industrial controls. Must be capable of engaging C-level stakeholders and building relationships!

Must Have's:


Process Controls and Automation experience.

Extensive experience selling programs or services, NOT product sales.

A Solid understanding of process controls and/or automation solutions.

Exceptional listening and interpersonal communication skills.

A Collaborative spirit and flexible approach to sales. 

Qualifications/Criteria:

Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering or other technical field strongly preferred.
Typically five years or more experience in process control and/or automation solutions is a highly preferred.
The ideal candidate will be proposing and closing sales to achieve assigned nominal annual territory revenue.

Technical Responsibilities:

Responsible for delivering sales revenue from our portfolio of offerings to clients and prospects in the assigned region. Average sales revenue responsibility of $4MM annually.
Must be capable of regional and national travel to support Target Account sales.
Possesses excellent interpersonal skills including strong self motivation, focus and passion for the sales process and service to customers.
Must be passionate toward building strong customer relationships and have a proven ability to prosecute and close new business.
Achieves and exceeds revenue quota targets by winning new contracts and orders through prospecting and developing new customer relationships.
Identifies and qualifies legitimate sales opportunities, providing a consultative and value-added approach to develop relationships. Negotiates contractual terms and conditions, and works with the proposal and technical teams to ensure smooth hand-offs and builds a sales pipeline of qualified sales opportunities.
Maintains an ongoing relationship with prospective clients continuously assessing and communicating how MAVERICK can meet their needs.
Develops and executes sales presentations to potential clients. Must be an accomplished user of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook).
Develops and implements sales plans and activities. Learns about MAVERICK’s technologies, keeping up to date with the portfolio offerings and market trends.
The position will require supporting our business development initiatives, requiring the Sales/ Business Development Manager to initiate and organize meetings and phone calls with prospects, prepare letters and email and will require experienced prospecting and solutions closure skills.

Critical Competencies:

Demonstrates a proactive commitment to safety by taking the time to understand risks and completing all required safety training.
Complies with safety requirements by following all safety procedures and by reporting/documenting safety incidences and near misses.
Demonstrates personal accountability to learning and development of oneself as well as assisting with development of new employees and peers.
Willingly accepts coaching and mentoring from more experienced resources and provides the same when working with entry level resources.
Promotes teamwork by participating as a team player while also demonstrating effective communication skills with the team, management and the customer.
Proactively works to build good relationships with peers, leaders and customers while also demonstrating the ability to meet customer expectations.
Seeks out new responsibilities and stretch opportunities while demonstrating creativity in identifying better means of accomplishing a job.
Displays ambition for learning new processes, platforms or other new offerings at MAVERICK.
Displays leadership abilities including honesty, integrity and professionalism across all aspects of the business.
Demonstrates a willing, can-do attitude by actively participating in teams.
Exhibits proficiency and personal accountability for project performance and meeting customer needs.

Awards and Recognition:

Check out some of our Awards below, and then visit our website at www.mavtechglobal.com to learn more about MAVERICK Technologies. We look forward to your application and always welcome referrals!


International Society of Automation’s Premier Strategic Partner for Systems Integration

Proud to be in Control Engineering’s System Integrator Hall of Fame

Paul Galeski named an ISA Fellow.
2008 Frost & Sullivan North American System Integrator Company of the Year
Microsoft® Gold Certified Partner for Microsoft Business Solutions
Diamond Level Service Partner for Yokogawa Corporation of America
One of the Inc. 500/5000 Fastest Growing Companies — named six times.
Paul Galeski named Ernst & Young Emerging Entrepreneur of the Year (2002)
Wonderware ArchestrA® Certified System Integrator (SI).

EEO Statement

MAVERICK Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer-Disability/Veterans.

title: E-Commerce Catalog Excel and Alteryx Data Manager
job_description:
Company in Malibu needs a manager for our 1.5 Million products we distribute via E-commerce websites. Youe daily roll will be to manage and modify product data that we offer for sale. Candidate must have a great attitude, be highly organized and proficient in Excel and Alteryx and most importantly be a reliable, hard worker. This person must like data management and excel spreadsheets to enjoy this position. If you hate Excel you will hate this job. If you are good with excel and Alteryx l you will thrive with this job.
On a daily basis this candidate will be assisting our Government Contracts Manager by formatting and pricing products in excel and ensuring the product offering abides by government procurement guidelines. title: Project Manager- Ting Internet
job_description:
Tucows has been working on the Internet since the days when people unironically called it the Information Superhighway.

Today, we’re the second-largest domain wholesaler in the world with tens of millions of domains under management (OpenSRS / Enom). We’re doing all kinds of interesting things, including running an MVNO cell phone service (Ting Mobile) and building true fiber to the premises networks in towns and cities across the US (Ting Internet). We offer individual and small business domains and integration with various popular platforms (Hover/Ascio).

We’re a team of over 600 people serving tens of millions of customers around the world. Our growth has been incredible, smart and measured (NASDAQ: TCX, TSX: TC). Our success is built on a solid technical and financial foundation.Ting InternetIn December 2015, technology blog Gizmodo listed Ting (a small Internet company operating out of an old warehouse in Liberty Village) as one of “The 6 Best Things That Happened to the Internet This Year” in the United States. What the what?

Ting is a division of Tucows, a global Internet services company. Ting shook up the mobile industry in 2012, offering fair pricing, usable interfaces and shockingly non-phone-company-like customer support. Today we have over 250,000 devices and 150 dedicated employees in multiple locations. We were also the highest rated US cellphone service by Consumer Reports in both 2014 and 2016.

Now we are investing millions in fiber networks and collaborating with small towns to change what Americans expect from their Internet service and their providers. (Oh, related point, Americans hate their cable companies even more than their cellphone providers.) We have already launched Gigabit speed Internet service in Charlottesville, Virginia, Westminster, Maryland and Holly Springs, North Carolina. People there are loving the speed and the customer support, and they are telling their friends.About the opportunity:As we move into additional markets (and as our existing ones grow), we are looking for a Project Manager in our Networks group. The Networks team is responsible to find new markets, setting them up, and focusing heavily on running them. We need someone who excels in a fast paced environment with lots of diverse, contending priorities and can handle a dash of ambiguity to boot.What you’ll be doing:

Leading construction projects in multiple locations: We have construction projects underway in multiple cities. You’ll responsible for ensuring those projects are on time and on budget. This will involve working closely with other members of our Networks team, operations, our vendor management team, support, marketing, product management and external suppliers to make sure everything is moving according to plan, and helping us tackle issues when it isn’t. You will be in the eye of the storm.Assisting various construction related elements as needed: From permits to inventory, there are many areas inside each build that need tracking and process help. We need your skills to help us establish processes and systems as necessary to be successful.Working cross-functionally inside the organization to complete complex enterprise projects: It takes a lot of work from multiple teams to deliver outstanding enterprise services. You’ll assist in everything from developing project plans, evaluating and communicating project risk, establishing schedules, leading procurement, controlling and monitoring projects and much more! You’ll be a key representative of the Networks department, acting as a business SME in helping to resolve a wide variety of day-to-day tasks and issues as they arise. You’ll need to establish various meaningful relationships, ensure the departments with which you work can turn to you for the right information and decisions.

If you think of yourself as an excellent project manager with a desire to do more than handle one-off projects, this job is for you!A bit about you:

Maintaining strong Customer & Vendor relations critical to the role, communication & service excellence are fundamental.Superb presentation skills, including the ability to converse at both business and technical levelsAbility to occasionally travel will be required.(once in 4-6 weeks)Ability to work remotely

Qualifications required:



Bachelor's Degree in Business equivalent experience.A minimum of five years of project management experience in construction, utilities or telecom.Strong program management skills: you will be expected to coordinate and schedule multiple long-term projects at the same time.Experience leading cross-functional teams and vendors in projects, including resource planning, scheduling, progress tracking and reporting.Ability to raise issues and advance them to senior management if necessary.Enjoys working in a “start-up” environment within a larger organization; you will be jumping into a new, upstart business. If you’re used to and only progress in a structured, precise environment, this role isn’t for you.Strong data, metrics and analysis skills.Experience in telecom/Fiber to the Premises is definitely a plus.

We believe diversity drives innovation. Our committed to unbias across race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status. We celebrate multiple approaches, and diverse points of view that drive us forward every day.

title: Program Manager
job_description:
Castlight is on a mission to make it as easy as humanly possible to navigate healthcare and live happier, healthier, more productive lives. Our comprehensive health navigation platform guides users to their best available healthcare resources, resulting in lower healthcare costs, higher engagement, and improved outcomes. Through our unique combination of hundreds of health data integrations and machine learning that leverages its data to personalize the user experience, Castlight simplifies healthcare for 20 million users.

We're looking for a solid Program Manager to join our Program Management team. The Program Management team works on a range of high-impact strategic initiatives across the organization, including leading large scale programs/products, managing long-term external partnerships, and co-developing efforts with national health plans. Our Program Management team is constantly thinking about how we solve multi-dimensional problems to serve our teams, customers and users in meaningful ways. The ideal candidate for this role will have critical thinking skills paired with empathy, organization, and a deep drive to make a difference. They should also have a proven track record of effective communication, have client-facing experience and excel at project management, including managing multiple complex projects simultaneously.

While we are currently searching for a Program Manager, Senior Program Managers are encouraged to apply.

Responsibilities

Partner with key stakeholders to develop a strategic program roadmap, including highlighting milestones, risks, issues and dependenciesWork closely with key functional leads across the organization (Product, Engineering, Product Marketing, Operations, etc.) to ensure on-time delivery of roadmap and project plan commitmentsProvide up-to-date visibility into current projects, project health, priorities, accomplishments and risk areasCross-pollinate and facilitate conversations across several stakeholder groups to drive a cohesive programServe as the day-to-day liaison between external health plan partners and internal cross functional teams, fostering ongoing relationship with various business and technical stakeholdersFacilitate product release planning and release executionSupport executive-level communication in steering committee meetings, leadership on-sites, etc.Contribute to enhancing the Program Management team and Castlight culture!

Qualifications

Must have 2+ years of experience in program management, management consulting, and/or in a client-facing roleStrong PowerPoint and Excel skills with a passion for delivering insights and driving resultsProven ability of partnering with multiple stakeholder groups to develop, manage and lead project plansA ‘big picture’ approach in helping establish and manage program, while maintaining attention to detail with borderline obsessive organizational skillsGreat communication skills, written and verbal, with a diverse group of stakeholders ranging from Senior Castlight Executives to external partnersAbility to work with cross-functional teams both internally and externally to manage and implement complex development projects & partnershipComfortable with ambiguity and malleable workflowsResilience and equanimity in dealing with change, challenges and adversityProactive in seeking opportunities to improve team, personal skills and experience

Desired

Prior work experience in the healthcare industry, ideally with deep understanding of the health plan, health benefits or health IT landscapeVendor/Client management and negotiation skills preferred

Core Competencies

Effective communicationLeadership dispositionDetail orientedDriving results and on-time executionBusiness acumen and judgmentStrategic decision-makingCultivating partnerships and client relationships

Our Values

One team. On a mission. Making things happen.

Diversity and Inclusion

The Castlight culture values and celebrates different backgrounds, perspectives, and points of view. We believe our diversity helps drive creativity and innovation. We strive to make everyone feel included, valued, and engaged; enable them to do their best work; and build their careers here at Castlight. That is why diversity and inclusion are more than just words to us. Rather, they are a commitment to a culture where employees feel respected and empowered to share their ideas and deliver the best results. Learn more about our continuing commitment to diversity and inclusion.

title: Salesforce/Financialforce Product Owner
job_description:
Responsibilities

Driving the innovative use of Salesforce/FinancialForce as a productivity tool and business platform.Performing day-to-day administrative tasks, such as customizing and implementing profiles, roles, security settings, rules, dashboards, reports, etc.Interfacing with end users to understand feature requirements and/or address support issues; working collaboratively with Finance, Product Management, Salesforce admins and Salesforce developers on more complex requests and issues.Maintaining and enhancing visual layouts, clicklinks, integrations, workflow rules and business logic to enhance business processes and improve user experience.Creating documentation, maintaining standardization and proactively seeking ways to continuously improve processes& procedures.Developing, launching and managing in-depth dashboards and reports for all team functions at both management and individual levels.Remaining current on FinancialForce/salesforce best practices and technologies and advising on these practices for salesforce-based solutions.Resolving issues with FinancialForce and related applications.Working with salesforce support to troubleshoot issues and maintain smooth operation and performance of the platform.Communicating system changes to management team in advance, manage new releases and system changes and efficiently rolling out new features without interruption to the user.Maintaining System, Security and Integrity - design, create and maintain multiple user setup, roles, profiles and hierarchies; grant/remove and maintain user licenses; maintain security including sharing rules and security levels; map hierarchies and reassign records in response to personnel changes.Monitoring application storage usage and archiving data as needed.Serving as a subject matter expert (SME) for Salesforce/FinancialForce and Force.com applications.Developing and delivering training sessions for existing or new users/groups on an ongoing basis; creating and updating training materials.


Qualifications

3+ years' Salesforce.com administration experience overall; exposure to FinancialForce is preferred.English and Mandarin Bilingual (Preferred)Knowledge of core financial areas (e.g. AP, AR, GL, FA), with the ability to transform business objectives and functional requirements into technical solutions.Proven experience documenting and analyzing processes, procedures, and/or policies. +Capable of managing the migration of change sets from development and testing sandboxes into the production instanceAdvanced Microsoft Excel skills along with excellent Word, Visio and PowerPoint skills.Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate effectively with individuals at different levels and cultural backgrounds within the organizationBachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting or related field is preferred.

title: Senior Product Manager (Data Platforms)
job_description:
The Data Capture team within the Data Engineering organization is a crucial part of Audibles mission to unleash the power of the spoken word. We build systems to understand our customers experience and continuously improve it, capturing and synthesizing information to enable insight. We partner with business intelligence, marketing, data science, product management and senior leadership to understand their strategies and enable them with rich data in accessible systems.

Our growing team is looking for a manager whos passionate about creating high-quality, hygienic data across our growing product family. If your ideal job involves representing the voice of the customer, quantifying user experience, building relationships with business & technical teams, and joining a fast-growing and highly visible team at Audible, this position may be for you.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

· Design and drive our strategy for data capture across our products, experiences and content catalog

· Connect technology, product and analytics by being the expert on data instrumentation

· Understand the use cases of business & technical teams that consume this data, advising upcoming launches to ensure measurability and data coverage

· Articulate and own capture requirements for all technical teams to adhere to, designing a customer-centric, scalable and enforceable schema

· Envision opportunities for continuous improvement in data capture, prioritize them and lead them into reality by collaborating with a variety of domain leaders

· Contribute to the data infrastructure strategy at Audible by building a long-term data capture roadmap

· Advise data technology leadership on emerging data capture technologies, including and beyond Amazon Big Data Technology

· Educate and evangelize best practice in data capture to tech and product teams

title: Senior Product Manager
job_description:
Senior Product Manager

San Francisco, CA

A Little Bit About StyleSeat:

As a Senior Product Manager at StyleSeat, you will have a rare opportunity to join a startup empowering small business owners across the country to be more successful doing what they love. Our mission is to help people look and feel their best. We are on the path to achieving this mission by being the go-to marketplace for consumers to discover, book, and pay for beauty and grooming services (hair stylists, colorists, nail artists, estheticians, barbers, etc). We are also the premier solution for all independent professionals in the industry to run and grow their business. We have powered over 120 million appointments booked and $10B in revenue for small businesses and are on the path to much more.

In Your New Role:

As a Senior Product Manager at StyleSeat, you will own the product and the customer's experience from beginning to end. This includes collaborating on strategic direction, ideation, prioritization, partnering with engineers to build and launch, all while learning from customers and analyzing data to keep StyleSeat on the cutting edge of technology for the beauty industry.

What you'll be responsible for:

Deeply understand your customers and identify top needs to solve for through research and analysis
Take full ownership of the product and drive solutions from inception to impact
Rally a team of cross-functional partners to identify and deliver high value products
Drive continuous value to the community and the business through iterative product development
Define and analyze metrics to inform decisions and measure success
Conduct user research to identify and validate product initiatives
Inspire through well defined vision, strategy and insights
Keep our community first while moving fast with optimal results

Requirements:

5+ years of product management experience with mobile apps and web products

2+ years of which, would ideally be in building marketplace or consumer products

Experienced in Lean, user-centric and insight driven product development
Thrive in fast-paced and dynamic environment
Owner mindset

title: Product Manager
job_description: Bridg is redefining how offline retailers understand and act on consumer behavior. Are you ready to work on a break-through identity matching platform that connects brands to their customers based on our proprietary bureau of over 235 Million individual consumers? Our marketing tech platform enables brands to market to previously unidentifiable consumers via digital media.Bridg is seeking a senior level, experienced Product Manager. As Product Manager of our Campaign product at Bridg you are responsible for defining, prioritizing, planning, and driving execution for the key outbound marketing capabilities of our SaaS product. You will use your understanding of client needs, marketing technologies, business acumen and engineering wherewithal to drive results for and with your team, bringing cutting-edge big data products to market. You will work extensively with our customer-facing team and cross functionally with Client Partnerships, Engineering and Sales in order to successfully prioritize features and develop the products that our customers want and need.At Bridg our CDP ingests and processes billions of transactions from our retail and restaurant clients. Leveraging proprietary methods and algorithms that you will help define, Bridg matches those transactions against our own Bridg Bureau to produce a longitudinal database of consumer behavior. Data science and big data are what we do everyday and our product powers the data science and predictive marketing capabilities of our clients. We are a Big Data company, and we are looking for your specific experience building great data products that leverage leading edge technologies. For your reference, our tech stack includes Java, Cassandra, MongoDB, Kafka, Flink, Docker, Elastic Search, AWS, and a variety of Microservices.Primary ResponsibilitiesCreate, lead, and manage product strategies, roadmaps, project plans and product specifications for the Bridg campaign platformCollaborate with marketing and engineering on product development during the discovery phase to assess value, usability and feasibility of product features“Own” the product’s user experience and feature set and act as the product evangelist to build awareness within the organizationBuild product prototypes and mock-ups - Prioritize and create detailed product specifications to be used in written specifications, business rules, flows and use cases, as well as user-experience (UX) generated deliverables such as prototypes, wireframes and design and copy documentsDrive consistent, quality deliverables with your Agile development team as a product owner by leading feature identification and prioritizing requirementsIdentify market needs, competitive positions and customer trends on an ongoing basis; providing subject matter expertise for customers, clients, tools, and technologies in our nicheRequirementsExperience in and passion for designing and building great user experiences on SaaS Web Application Products4+ years of experience as a professional product manager working for a SaaS companyStrong understanding of all aspects of the product development lifecycle, including product strategy development, requirements definition, UE design, engineering, QA and launchExcellent leadership, project management, communication and organizational skillsBachelors or Masters in Computer Science or equivalentWhat we offerA fantastic opportunity to be part of a growing start-up. A chance to work with a passionate, driven and fun team.An incredible work environment - fun, casual and fast-pacedMonthly team activities and outingsLoft-style office with plenty of break-out spaceFully stocked company snack area complete with every drink and snack your heart desiresGreat benefits - Health, Dental, Vision, and VacationWe’re a rapidly-growing start-up in the heart of Sawtelle Japantown, just blocks away from the 405 and the 10. Our loft-style office houses a passionate, hard-working team of ramen-slurpers, beach-combers, and LA-daydreamers. At our core, we’re a tech company, yes, but our people make the magic happen.Hungry for more? Snag a freshly-ground espresso and a ripe kiwi from our fully stocked snack-area; mosey over to one of our many rotating food trucks – we like the Jamaican truck, personally; or stroll up Sawtelle for a sit-down feast (yes, there’s something for everyone’s belly out here). We work hard, so we can play hard: personal and professional growth opportunities are punctuated with monthly team activities, like bowling alleys, dive bars, and catered lunches. And, yes, there just might be a rooftop holiday party. Not to mention robust health, dental, vision, and vacation benefits.About Bridg:Bridg is a marketing software company that provides a CRM solution, email and SMS marketing, insights and analytics, mobile app and loyalty program development for restaurants and retailers. Powered by transaction data, Bridg builds unique 360º customer profiles to understand individualized behavior patterns, providing clients with deep data science used to create wide-reaching, effective personalized marketing campaigns that drive traffic and sales in a measurable way.Our headquarters is located in West LA / Santa Monica, and we offer competitive salaries, great benefits, and a high-energy environment with lots of room for personal and professional growth.

title: Senior Product Manager - Growth
job_description:
About Doctor On Demand

Doctor On Demand's mission is to improve the world's health through compassionate care and innovation. We believe that health is personal, and means so much more than treating illness. We're proud of the care we've provided over the years and the relationships we've developed with our patients, as evidenced by the 5-star reviews we continually receive. People use our service to gain access to some of the best physicians and licensed therapists in the country, all whenever and wherever is most convenient. It's as simple as opening the Doctor On Demand app on a smartphone or computer.

Through live video visits, our hand-picked, US-trained doctors take patient history, perform an exam, and recommend a treatment plan. Prescriptions, if needed, go directly to the pharmacy of choice. While insurance isn't required, tens of millions of Americans enjoy covered medical and mental health visits through employer and health plan partnerships. To learn more about the hundreds of medical issues we treat, visit us at doctorondemand.com.

About the Team

Doctor On Demand's product team is growing, and we're looking for a senior product manager with a passion for disrupting our current healthcare system. We're solving big problems through the intersection of design and technology -- problems that give you autonomy to build meaningful solutions across the product.

Your responsibilities:


You'll work with employers and health plans to ensure our product is enabling the right patient experience and healthcare's innovation.
You'll work closely with engineers on creating the right product design in a range of projects from patient UX experience improvements to highly technical integrations.
You'll support the go-to-market team, educate our enterprise customers about our offerings and solutioning future iterations of our platform. Finding a balance between quality, customization, and scalability will be an important skill to showcase.
Develop and maintain a roadmap balancing feature requests, service expansion, and feedback.
Create integration guides for third party developers.
Evaluate competitors to look at emerging trends, technical options, and best practices .
Create user stories and requirements for both internal and external engineers.
Work with analytics on integrating data, measurements, and reporting into the platform.
Inspire and empower our internal teams to build capabilities with our platform with external developers in mind.

Skillset:


6+ years of experience leading a product life cycle and working with engineering. Healthcare experience is preferred.
Experience designing new product solutions while leveraging the existing platform.
Ability to represent the company in external client calls. Previous experience with health plans and/or employers is preferred.
Experience writing and contributing to technical integration guides for partners
Proven track record of translating business problems into testable hypotheses
Experience working with multiple stakeholders to create a comprehensive and achievable strategy to tackle a given problem.
Experience delivering products and showing the impact of the work you have done.
Currently authorized to work in the United States as no sponsorship is available for this position.

title: Senior Manager, User Experience (UX) Design
job_description:
British American Tobacco
Job Number: 25543

Reynolds American Incorporated is positively transforming the tobacco industry. We’re a family of companies that strives for success in everything we do. The future inspires us because our people are igniting the breakthroughs that are redefining the ways adult tobacco consumers enjoy tobacco in the 21st century.

When other companies talk about growth, they only talk about size. At Reynolds American, we focus on the growth of our people. We take pride in each other’s growth and well-being throughout our careers. We invest in your career and total well-being because we know our companies succeed when our people thrive.

ABOUT OUR ORGANIZATION:

Reynolds American Inc. is an indirect, wholly owned subsidiary of British American Tobacco p.l.c., and the U.S. parent company of R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Company; Santa Fe Natural Tobacco Company, Inc.; American Snuff Company, LLC; Niconovum USA, Inc.; Niconovum AB; R. J. Reynolds Vapor Company; Lorillard Licensing Company, LLC; and Reynolds Brands, Inc.. This position is with R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Company (2004).

Here, you’ll have the opportunity to work on iconic brands and revolutionary products by collaborating with visionary, principled and passionate people every day.

Position Summary:

We are looking for a passionate UX Senior Manager who can help transform consumer insights into best in class digital experiences that deeply connect with our consumers. The position is a key role within our in-house Creative Studio.

As Senior Manager, you’ll focus on hands-on human-centered digital experiences that are intuitive and seamless, combining your eye for design with outstanding UX/UI skills to translate user needs into engaging user interfaces across multiple brands and channels. You will help our consumers discover compelling new content on our brand sites, and convert on Ecommerce. You will also help bring our multiple brand sites to life as consumers engage with our portfolio on web and mobile.

Responsibilities

Produce design visualizations that help stakeholders across disciplines understand what the best experience looks like: storyboards, user-flows, wireframes, mockups, prototypes, etc.
Lead UX efforts on key projects and initiatives across our portfolio of brands, raising the bar through quantitative and qualitative metrics.
Responsible for the development of UX strategy, and innovative user experiences across a range of digital channels and digital platform.
Provide deliverables including wireframes, mockups, user-flow prototypes, proof of concept documents, wire frames, site architecture, user flows, use cases, and user scenarios.
Deliver complete production-ready UX and visual design framework (through partnerships with art directors, copywriters, and dev teams).
Rapidly drive iterations of existing UX to optimize consumer engagement and ecommerce conversion
Develop and maintain detailed user-interface specifications—working closely with developers to see your design through to deployment.
Communicate complex, interactive design concepts clearly and persuasively
Ensure shared learning and adoption of creative best practices across team for improved effectiveness and efficiency

Bachelors Degree in Design, Computer Science, human factors or equivalent work experience
Min 5 years Experience Design/Ecommerce Design/Digital Design with recent UX/UI experience developing user flows, experience design, site architecture, templates and components and detailed design.

Experience working with HTML, JavaScript and CSS frameworks
Excellent understanding of website and mobile UI standards and usability
Knowledge of UI ADA standards
Experience creating responsive templates and componentry

Demonstrated ability to gather input from a variety of stakeholders including product owners, brand, and analysts
Passion for innovation and pushing/challenging the thinking of our team
Ability to manage and balance multiple strategic priorities and projects

Portfolio of UX-focused work samples for web and mobile applications.
Bonus consideration for skills such as visual design, research, strategy
Bonus consideration for designing within Magento and AEM

Competitive Annual Salary
Targeted Annual Bonus

title: Flatbed and Over-Dimensional Product Manager
job_description:
R+L Global Logistics is seeking a high performing Flatbed and Over-Dimensional Product Manager. The ideal candidate will have operational expertise in Flatbed and Oversized shipments and the vision to use that knowledge creatively to identify and target customers to expand the service offering.

Flatbed and Over-Dimensional Product Manager Summary of Key Responsibilities

Responsibilities and essential job functions include, but are not limited to the following:

Develop strategy and market the company's services to generate new business relationships, increase revenue growth, and present solutions to meet customer's needsCreate an organizational business development plan strategy that successfully allows the organization to meet its monthly, quarterly, and yearly goals and initiativesDevelop and drive a team specialized in sharing flatbed and over-dimensional knowledge to our customers base to increase shipments, gross margins and expand the overall profit ability of the service offeringProcure preferential and competitive pricing from partners and carriers to drive volume and business development growthManagement of existing business accounts and continuously building customer rapportDeliver clear expectations to leadership as to the direction your team will performAssist in setting high standards of performance for all team members

Flatbed and Over-Dimensional Product Manager Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Qualifications

High School Diploma or GED requiredBachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, Supply Chain Management, Logistics Transportation, or adequate level of work experience preferredCandidate must possess operational expertise and knowledge in flatbed/over-dimensional equipmentCandidate must be able to effectively price and communicate solutions to customers and team-members3+ years experience in a supervisory or management role leading high performance teams5+ years experience in flatbed and oversized services3-5 years full truckload third party logistics experience in both sales and operationsPrefer experience in all modes: dry van, expedited, flatbed, oversized loads, refrigerated, intermodal shipmentsPrefer experience in transportation systems such as McLeod and/or CargoWise but not required

Company Benefits - Company Vacation Properties, PTO, Sick Time, Paid Holidays, 401k, Medical, Dental, Vision, Life & Disability Insurance, Pet Insurance and Group Home & Auto Insurance

R+L Global Logistics is a world-class provider of high quality domestic and international logistics and supply chain services, with a reputation for offering the highest quality freight solutions and services to our customers. With 14 offices across the country, we have locations in Atlanta, Chicago, Cincinnati, Denver, Fort Myers, Indianapolis, Kansas City, Laredo, Los Angeles, Nashville, Newark, Ocala, Orlando and San Antonio allowing our logistics team to optimize the supply chain process for our customers.

title: Senior Manager, Product Management
job_description:
JOB SUMMARY

Responsible for defining, executing, and launching a first-class video experience on Roku. This role will be responsible for helping define, breakdown, execute, and report on work alongside the development team. The ability to work in a Kanban fashion with the ability to be nimble and adjust to the needs of the larger organization are crucial for this role. There is a need to understand data analytics and execute analyses to make data driven decisions. You will be partnering with the Development Director to create a culture of speed and accountability within our development organization. An understanding of how web applications are built and high-level system architecture capabilities are a plus to bring a product focus to technical conversations.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Actively and consistently support all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience

Deep understanding of industry best practices in product development process specific to the Cable or telecommunications space and translate appropriate steps for unique organization and market position

Collaborative information gathering to translate high level process goals into specific sub-processes with appropriate documentation

Develop communication plan for stakeholders and process participants

Proactively identify analysis to support the effort and conduct with deep analytics when appropriate while maintaining an eye toward the bigger picture

Support the development and communication of Product Strategies dependent on new services/features to drive financial results. Work with engineering, product management peers, marketing stakeholders and key market areas on implementing strategy.

Lead content and product launches and enhancements of products in the two Charter Operating Units to include working with Corporate Engineering, Corporate and Field Marketing and Field Engineering

Own all aspects of the Products backlog including, preparation of work, prioritization of features, prioritization of bugs, etc.

Ensure proper delivery of features to the customers through various methods of releasing content to customers (eg. Experimentation, direct customer launch, phased launch, etc)

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Skills/Abilities and Knowledge

Aptitude and eagerness to learn from a new environment and make an impact quickly

Ability to manage and foster change

Ability to lead large, cross-functional teams in order to achieve business goals and results

Ability to listen to multiple points of view and synthesize against goals for recommendations

Ability to plan, prioritize and organize effectively and independently

Ability to handle multiple projects and tasks

Ability to manage a team

Ability to make decisions and solve problems while working under pressure

Ability to show judgment and initiative and to accomplish job duties

Ability to analyze and interpret data and synthesize recommendations

Ability to communicate with all levels of management and company personnel

Ability to understand testing techniques and manage testing requirements

Ability to plan ahead and prepare for events days, weeks, and months in the future

Ability to communicate orally and in writing in a clear and straightforward manner

Ability to use personal computer and software applications (i.e. word processing, spreadsheet, etc.)

Proficiency with Word, Excel, PowerPoint

Excellent organizational and office management skills

Excellent cognitive and communication skills

Excellent analytical skills

Strong business sense and sense of urgency to achieve business results

Education

BS in Engineering or other technical degree related to telecommunications, field or operational / process optimization related field required

MBA preferred, but not required

Related Work Experience

5-7 years of Product Development Process

5-7 years of related industry experience (Cable, Telecommunications, Software/Online Services)

Product Management and/or Product Development Experience Required, preferably in Cable, Telecommunications, Software or Web Services

WORKING CONDITIONS

Office environment

Limited Travel

title: Senior Product Operations Manager
job_description:
Movable Ink is a software company that provides marketers with technology and expert services to create unique customer experiences. Founded in 2010, Movable Ink pioneered contextual experiences in email and has powered over 1.5 trillion content impressions worldwide. More than 700 of the world's most innovative brands rely on Movable Ink to create unique, relevant, and compelling visual experiences across email and web at the moment of engagement.

Our product team is growing to meet the needs of a quickly expanding product offering and new ventures across new channels. The Senior Product Operations Manager is responsible for keeping our team on task, cohesive, and feeling positioned for success; providing the autonomy to impact immediate change on our workflows, communications, frameworks to name a few. The Senior Product Operations Manager will often be the face of the team providing engaging and critical updates for the organization so more teams have access and visibility into our roadmap.

This role will report to the Vice President of Product & Design. Together the VP and Senior Product Operations Manager will guide the product team through changes and lead by example to ensure a quickly scaling product.

Fast forward one year. Here's what you will have accomplished:

Built out a process and framework for working with user-facing teams to collect, quantify, and communicate product-related challenges to be considered by Engineering, Product, and Design in future development (feedback loops). Elevated the understanding around how our product is being used and translated insights into product solutions. Surfaced use-cases and edge-cases to help inform product decisions
Assessed, analyzed, and relaunched our discipline around the processes for alphas, betas, launches, and releases. Worked with product marketing, training, and enablement to make sure go-to-market teams are ready with information and processes required to support new products. Set-up, managed, and optimized non-technical processes to help the Engineering, Product, and Design teams meet goals more efficiently
Identified and actively built connections with relevant subject matter experts across the company to surface insights, to get them excited about what your team is building, and to pave the way for smoother future rollouts. Served as a central point of contact for inbound requests from other teams, responding (or appropriately routing them) to cut down interruptions to our engineering, product, and design teams
Designed a communications strategy to help the rest of the organization understand the direction of our product, foster transparency in our roadmap, and clarity around our strategy. Collaborated with product marketing to ensure product releases are well communicated ahead of time and all information is available

Basic Qualifications:

4+ years experience in a product operations role or similar capacity
Exceptional project and program management abilities, able to lead without formal authority
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Metrics minded: experience with multiple data sources and combining quantitative and qualitative data into product and organizational insights
Experience managing product tech stacks: what tools, and in what combination, will superpower our teams?

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with stakeholder mapping and management, ability to work across the organization and partner with departments such as CX, business development, and product marketing
Talent for building empathy for user problems
Collaborative, creative, investigative - the ability to understand what currently exists and how to make it better

title: Product Manager
job_description:
We provide technology that community financial institutions use to manage risk and drive growth. Our solutions automate key processes – from anti-money laundering to fraud detection to CECL readiness to lending workflows – empowering our customers by addressing their Enterprise Risk Management needs.

This is an exciting opportunity for someone who is not only a master of their craft, but also shares our commitment to driving a strong company culture by putting their heart and soul into their work every day.

Abrigo is looking for a product manager who embraces ownership and entrepreneurship while working seamlessly on a team of other product managers and product development individuals. Primary responsibilities include serving as the product expert in addressing both internal and external issues and questions, improving the functionality of the product using customer feedback, and the testing and maintenance of the product(s) owned.

We are looking for energetic candidates with strong intellect, a passion for finance, the ability to learn quickly and execute with excellence, and superior customer service skills. The ideal candidate will be scrappy, have a bias for action, and have a deep commitment to growth and learning. As a role within a high-growth company, the range of initiatives is dynamic and will provide exposure into multiple areas of the company. This position will be based out of our office in Raleigh, NC.

Abrigo is looking for a Product Manager who is:

An Entrepreneur – self-driven, individually accountable, managing the business of your productA Scientist – data-driven, objective, questioningA Creative – aware of, but not limited by boundariesA Team Leader – leads and follows, highly collaborative, cross functional leaderA Results Driver – breaks down blockers, focused on outcomes, creates valueA Visionary – Predicts based on insights gleaned from data. Drives the direction of your product based on a deep understanding of usersA Persuader – able to move the minds of and align groups and individuals toward clear goals

What You'll Do:

Develop subject-matter expertise in our credit and portfolio risk management solutionsCoordinate and run user research sessions (focus groups, usability studies, and other sessions) to gain actionable feedback for maintaining and enhancing the technologyMaintain and enhance the product(s) based on user feedbackManage the development, testing, and implementation of product enhancementsProvide excellent customer service through technical support, product improvements, and client follow-upProvide superior quality assurance through the testing and maintenance of the product(s)Work closely with the client services team, product consultants, the marketing team, and other members of the product development teamOther product development team responsibilities, as needed



What You'll Need:

Ideal candidate will have 2+ years of experience in banking, finance, or a technical product manager roleAbility to communicate effectively in and across teams; must possess strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsTrack record of results-oriented achievements and successful strategy executionAbility to troubleshoot and resolve issues quicklyAdapt to an entrepreneurial environment and culture quicklyA proven leader and self-starterBachelor’s degree with a strong academic record



What You’ll Get:

Market competitive total rewards packageTo be part of the Heart & SOULof a winning company with an inspiring missionThe opportunity to Make Big Things Happen and have a real impact on customers and the companyCompetitive salary along with full health benefits with an HSA optionUnlimited PTO and bank holidays401(k) plan and company match

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identify, age, genetic trait, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Sr. Product Manager
job_description:
About Us:

Are you looking for a new challenge and rewarding career? At Arena Solutions, we help high tech manufacturers and medical device companies create products that change the world. Our cloud-based product lifecycle management (PLM) and quality management (QMS) software is used by leading product innovators like Nutanix, Bio-Rad, Sonos, Teleflex, and Citrix. Join our team and you will thrive in an award-winning workplace that fosters a work-life balance. At Arena we focus on helping people identify their strengths to better their career every day, to grow and learn both personally and professionally.

Why Join Arena?

1,300+ customers love us in the high-tech manufacturing and medical device markets#1 Leader voted by customers among PLM software platforms8 years as Top Company to Work For96% approval rating of our CEO, Craig Livingston

Check us out on G2.com, TrustRadius, GlassDoor, and arenasolutions.com/about/awards/

Role:

Arena is looking for a passionate and talented Senior Product Manager to join our Product Team and change the way manufacturers design and build their products.

Our enterprise-focused cloud application helps our customers through their product realization processes. Arena Solutions enables companies to design, produce, and improve innovative products

quickly. With Arena product development platform, teams share product information, exchange

ideas, and accelerate changes throughout the product lifecycle. As a key member of the product design team, you will play a vital role in

shaping the future of how products are designed and made.

As a Senior Product Manager at Arena, you will be the customer’s advocate, challenged with imagining and developing new products and features to help make them successful.

Responsibilities

Conduct customer interviews, listen, and understand the customerWrite detailed product stories, use cases, and requirementsWork with user interaction team on mock-up development and user interactionBe the product owner in the development processWork with engineering throughout product development to prioritize requirements/needs, define features and functionality, achieve product quality standards, and deliver product.Review and respond to inbound product management activities such as customer enhancement requests, bugs or other product-related customer issuesDevelop internal product messaging, presentation materials, and be a key contributor in the go-to market effortsPrioritize and manage competing priorities in feature definition and backlogHandle multiple projects and manage time efficiently

Required Skills

5+ years of working experience in product management, or a related capacityDemonstrate good Project Management and Time Management SkillsExperience writing Product Specifications, User Stories, Product Requirement DocumentsAbility to work closely with engineering, product design, and product marketingExperience with SaaS/Cloud applications and methodologiesPLM/ERP/Supply Chain domain Experience preferredDiscrete Manufacturing Industry experience in engineering and/or manufacturing environments is a plus

title: Sr. Category Manager, Dry Grocery (Close Out Buyer)
job_description:
The Sr. Category Manager – FoodMaxx conducts category reviews to assess performance of across customer segments, stores and items. This role translates consumer segment data & insights into specific category assortment, merchandising, advertising/promotions and pricing strategies.

Essential Duties and Key Accountabilities:

· Conduct category reviews to assess performance of across customer segments, stores and items

· Translate consumer segment data & insights into specific category assortment, merchandising, advertising/promotions and pricing strategies

· Details out category plans and drives execution

· Coordinates across support teams and synthesizes inputs

· Designs, executes category initiatives

· Liaise between Merchandising and Consumer Analytics & Insight

Analytics & Insight team

· Support vendor negotiation for category initiatives (e.g., "category month" for specific categories)

· Develop a portfolio of customer-centric product offerings for assigned categories that promotes the unique banner identity and ensures that the banner is relevant in every market and drives customers to the stores

· Responsible for all aspects of product life cycle management to include understanding market demands, technology trends, and the competitive environment for assigned categories

· Through analytics, store visits, and other research elements, determines future product needs for assigned categories

· Determine product offerings and promotional plans for assigned categories to achieve operating results

· Work with the Merchandising and Marketing teams to ensure assigned categories are effectively merchandised for optimized customer experience and sales (“total store experience”) – to include teaching/training opportunities during store visits

· Develop and assist with the successful execution of the merchandise planning and allocation plan, to fulfill growth and revenue goals

· Support the banner’s strategic product roadmap for assigned area, to include product launch and product marketing in order to meet customer needs

· Serve as the primary interface with suppliers in day-to-day interactions, and effectively manages these relationships to support banner sales and profit goals

· Work collaboratively with Sourcing to define the cost of goods and provide promotional planning requirements in support of banner and cross-banner collaborative supplier negotiations

· Follow all safety policies and procedures

· Other duties as assigned

LOCATION: MODESTO, CA.

glassdoor

The Save Mart Companies is one of the largest food and drug retailers in California and Nevada. It is home to a number of well-known brands in food retailing. You might have seen our banners that include Save Mart, Lucky, Lucky California and Food Maxx. We also have 4 distribution centers and SMART Refrigerated Transport, a trucking firm that transports dry groceries, frozen foods, ice and novelties to all of The Save Mart Companies stores. We are a locally and family owned business, headquartered in the heart of one of the greatest agricultural areas of our nation - the San Joaquin Valley.

The Modesto community is vibrant with great traditions, educational opportunities and multi-cultural lifestyles. Aside from mild weather year-round, Modesto allows for easy access to many major tourist attractions in California. To the west lies the San Francisco Bay Area (90-miles) and the Santa Cruz Beach (115-miles). To the east is the famed Gold Country “Mother Lode” (50-miles) and a little farther you can find the majestic Sierra Nevada mountain range, Lake Tahoe (180-miles) and Yosemite National Park (110-miles).

Some of our competitive benefits include: exceptionally generous benefits package (Health, Dental, Vision, Life, 401K), flexible schedule options, Employee Connection (earn fun and valuable prizes!), Life Long Learning – Educational opportunities, Employee Association (discounted and free tuition options, contests, and support services).

Grow your CAREER and join us to share your Guest focus, passion about food and family, and pride in the Central Valley and our wonderful community!
