title: Product Marketing Manager, Live Chat
job_description: Product Marketing Manager, Live ChatJob Description Join our growing team!A career with A Place for Mom is an opportunity for you to join a rapidly expanding company committed to making a difference for seniors and their families. A Place for Mom is an online platform connecting families searching for senior care services with a team of experienced advisors providing insight-driven and personalized solutions. Our mission, as the leader in senior care advisory, is to be a trusted destination for families and our community customers. We are a quickly growing organization with over 500 advisors connecting more than 300,000 families every year to one of our community customers.  THE POSITION The Product Marketing Manager will develop and execute a strategy to think differently about how we approach our customer journeys and how we best serve our families – starting with scaling our Live Chat program. Specifically, you will be responsible for defining how we scale our Live Chat program from proof of concept to an enterprise-solution by using data-driven analysis, leading A|B testing, and leading cross-functional teams. Additionally, you will be responsible for the platform integration(s) and technology enablers that will allow us to efficiently scale from proof of concept to full enterprise operation. Who you are:You are a passionate, outcome-oriented, problem solver. And, you have a strong will to win and you don't mind rolling up your sleeves to do what it takes. You have a proven history of building from proof of concept to scaled programs that drove meaningful business impact – by using data, technology, and deep customer insights.What you will do:Establish vision, strategy, and roadmap for our live chat program by defining how we place live chat on our owned & operated websites, on our paid search campaigns, and how we script both the chat bot and live agent engagements with our customersBuild and lead cross-functional teams across Marketing, Sales, Operations (e.g., workforce management, scripting, QA), Data & Analytics, Product, Engineering, and UX/UI to deliver experiences that impact hundreds of thousands customers each yearLead roadmap for product integrations (e.g., chat platform with our CRM, chat platform with our websites) to ensure we have the right technology enablers in place to allow this program to operate efficiently, at scaleDefine and manage metric-based business outcomes, reporting & analytics, that drive both financial performance as well as customer experience outcomesIncorporate APFM Values into each family, customer, and co-worker interactionRequired Skills and Competencies:4+ years of experience with product marketing and/or growth operationsAbility to operate autonomously in a fast-paced environmentDemonstrated ability to develop a strategy roadmap and problem solve to continuously deliver against stated goalsAbility to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences, navigate competing priorities and manage a large set of internal stakeholdersOutcome-oriented – thrives at translating concepts and ideas into actionable resultsStrong analytics skills (Excel, SQL) and problem solving skillsStrong written and oral communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively at all levels of an organizationDemonstrates understanding of consumer mindset and applying insights to daily workBachelor Degree from a top university (MBA preferred) Our Values  Living by our values and working to achieve excellence on behalf of our customers is integral to success at A Place for Mom. Employees who thrive at A Place for Mom live our values every day and are an important part of our hiring practices:Focus on ExcellenceAct with Integrity & Assume Positive IntentDrive Outcomes Every Day with Passion and A Sense of MissionMake the Lives of our Families and Customers Better, Easier and More SuccessfulRealize the Full Potential in Each Team Member. Work as a Single Supportive Team A Place for Mom employees over 850 people nationwide with plans to continue to expand into the future. We currently have offices located in Seattle, New York, and Naples and will soon be opening our office in Kansas City. We offer competitive compensation and benefit packages along with Paid time off, paid holidays and 401K with a match. We are committed to our employee’s career development growth and promotion within the organization. If you are a results-oriented, passionate and collaborative team player looking for a company with a bright future we would love to talk to you. COMPANY LEADERS Company Leaders with whom you will work to drive outcomesTatyana Zlotsky – Chief Marketing Officer & Head of OperationsTatyana is a visionary and entrepreneurial digital marketing executive, brand builder, and industry thought leader with experience in driving transformational change and redefining user experiences for Fortune 100 companies and start-ups. She has a reputation for championing the art and science of marketing - from strategic branding and creative development to data and technology - translating high brand value into tangible revenue generating activities. Alexandra Clegg – Senior Director, Product & Business StrategyAlexandra leads our Channel of Choice, Business Development & affiliate partnership businesses. She joined A Place for Mom from Bain & Company, where she led teams providing strategic and operational advisory services to clients across Healthcare, Education, Agriculture, Industrial/Defense, and Private Equity industries. She received her MBA from the Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth and undergraduate degree from Colby College. In her free time, she enjoys hiking and exploring nature in the Pacific Northwest. About A Place for MomA Place for Mom provides a valuable resource for families seeking senior care solutions for their parents. Since A Place for Mom was established in 2000, we have helped over a million families find senior care and housing options and have become the largest senior living referral service in the U.S and Canada.Our service is completely free for families; our local Advisors are senior care experts in the markets they operate and know the care, properties, costs and reputation of communities available; in addition most Advisors are deeply experienced and have helped thousands of families find the right solution for their mom or dad. They will provide invaluable guidance to the family saving them time and providing confidence they are making the right decision in coordination and on behalf of their parent or loved one (all at no cost). A Place for Mom is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring and valuing a diverse work team. This policy of Equal Employment Opportunity applies to all applicants and employees, and to all aspects of employment, including recruitment, hiring, training, compensation, promotions, and treatment on the job, benefits, termination, and all other terms and conditions of employment.

title: Lawn Fertilization Dept Manager, Must Have Lawn Fertilization Experience
job_description:
Owen Tree & Lawn Care is looking for a team oriented, Experienced Lawn Fertilization Manager to lead, manage, and grow our expanding lawn care department. Our lawn care department performs lawn fertilization , weed control , lawn aerification , and perimeter pest control services . MDARD certifications in categories 3A & 3B is a plus.

The Lawn Care Department Manager will work with senior management, and the Lawn Care Department Foreman. Job duties would include:

* Overseeing scheduling & route organization

* Order and inventory lawn care products.

* Monitor, train and ensure Lawn Care Applicators operate efficiently and productively on a daily

basis.

* Maintain quality control.

* Assist lawn scheduler with scheduling of lawn care services.

* Address any complaints or concerns received from clients regarding their lawn care services and

offer / provide remedies while on site when possible.

* Coordinate with other departments or office staff to insure optimal use of equipment and

personnel.

This is a year round position. Work would consist of assisting in winter marketing to increase route density and number of customers. Knowledge of telephone marketing is a plus (would be to our customer base only). This position may also include sales.

Our main office is located in Attica (which is near Lapeer & Imlay City) and we also have a satellite office in Oakland County, located in Pontiac.

We offer competitive salary, efficiency bonus, paid vacation, a company sponsored personal retirement fund with up to 3% match, health care, and opportunities to advance your green industry experience and knowledge.

Our company goal is to deliver exceptional customer service and satisfaction. If you have a good work ethic and a desire to perform quality workmanship with the latest cutting edge equipment, come and be a part of our growing team.

title: Product Owner
job_description:
Donnelley Financial Solutions (DFIN) is a leader in risk and compliance solutions, providing insightful technology, industry expertise and data insights to clients across the globe. We’re here to help you make smarter decisions with insightful technology, industry expertise and data insights at every stage of your business and investment lifecycles. As markets fluctuate, regulations evolve and technology advances, we’re there. And through it all, we deliver confidence with the right solutions in moments that matter.
Short Description
Donnelley Financial Solutions (NYSE: DFIN) provides software and services that enable clients to communicate with confidence in a complex regulatory environment. With 3,500 employees in 61 locations across 18 countries, we provide thousands of clients globally with innovative tools for content creation, management and distribution, as well as data analytics and multi-lingual translations services. Leveraging advanced technology, deep-domain expertise and 24/7 support, we deliver cost-effective solutions to meet the evolving needs of our clients.

We are looking for an enthusiastic Product Owner for our Global Capital Markets product team. The role will be responsible for contributing to the profitable, rapid, and sustainable growth of the business. The Product Owner will work closely with other product owners, engineers and product designers and be responsible for driving day-to-day deliverables.Responsibilities
• Convert market requirements into actionable and high-value user stories, minimal marketable features, and acceptance criteria based on market need

• Act as an evangelist for the features you manage including testing of expected behavior

• Conceptualize new ideas, research and evaluate them objectively from a financial and market perspective.

• Collaborate with engineering to prioritize enhancements, new features and defect handling

• Operates as a product owner within an Agile team for SaaS solutions serving the B2B markets

• Prioritization and management of Product Backlog items

• Collaborate across the organization to ensure projects ae delivered on time and with agreed upon scope.

• Monitor performance of features and continually iterates for a better client experience

• Oversees feature release in an Agile environment working with engineering to deliver on commitments

• Serves as product expert, understands user workflow; and works with engineering to deliver on commitments; conduct product demonstrations to clients and internal audiences

• Creation of product strategy documents and implementation plans related to product initiatives

• Communicate with clients and internal stakeholders regarding business needs, application features and updates

• Oversee multiple project timelines and efforts

• Demonstrated experience in successfully launching SaaS solutions to a B2B marketQualifications
• 3+ years as a product owner, product manager, or equivalent; B2B and SaaS experience preferred

• Strong attention to detail and respect for timelines & deadlines

• Excellent written, verbal, web, and face-to-face communication skills

• Strong organizational skills, including ability to manage and prioritize multiple competing initiatives

• Demonstrated ability to collaborate with and influence others, resolve conflict, and act as Product Owner

• Engage effectively and persuasively at all levels of the organization

• Strong understanding of Agile development methodologies, ceremonies and software

• Effective in a dynamic, matrix organization with an aggressive multi-project schedule

• Ability to work in a fast-pace environment

• Positive nature, enthusiasm, motivation and a desire for continuous improvement

• BA/BS or a combination of transferable skills and experience
It is the policy of Donnelley Financial Solutions to select, place and manage all its employees without discrimination based on race, color, national origin, gender, age, religion, actual or perceived disability, veteran's status, actual or perceived sexual orientation, genetic information or any other protected status.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access jobs.dfinsolutions.com as a result of your disability. You can request a reasonable accommodation by sending an email to AccommodationRequest@dfinsolutions.com. #TalentknowsTalent

title: Sr. Manager Metallurgy
job_description:
We are AAM. We have the POWER to move the world.

At AAM, we're looking for associates who push boundaries and drive solutions for the future. Innovators. Thinkers. Dreamers. Doers. No matter the role or function, every associate is a piece of what makes AAM great. Were growing and building #TeamAAM to be the best. Join us!

Job Posting TitleSr. Manager MetallurgyJob Description SummarySR. Manager Metallurgy is responsible for the integrity of products being shipped to our customer as it pertains to the material properties of the components that make up that product. SR. Manager Metallurgy is responsible for business process and product compliance, efficiency and waste elimination and customer satisfaction as it relates to product quality.Job Description

Strategy and Development

Collect, compile, and analyze relevant quality statistical data to obtain information regarding quality performanceSupervise technicians, inspectors, and other company staff to ensure they perform their duties in line with established quality proceduresMonitor product development processes to identify deviations from quality policiesConduct tests to verify the quality of raw materials and finished productsReview existing process and product specification to identify the need for improvement or upgrade

General and Task Management

Material Quality control Receiving, change, deviation trialsMetallurgy process ownership including special processesChemical ManagementThermal Treatment of materials to included atmosphere and non-atmosphere heat treatment.Induction heating and heat treatDevelopment and control of process parameters.Process control, product inspection, maintenance direction, furnace safety check coordination, tooling (fixtures and inductors).Liaising with and supervising engineering and technical staffEnsure that plant is compliant both procedurally and document with to AIAG CQI-9 requirementsFurnace temperatures, gas flows, atmosphere 3-gas analysis, carbon shim stock analysis and part metallurgical analysis are being performed daily with appropriate signoff. Developing new test/repair processesGear shot peen control of directed shot peen, shot blast, grit sand other media surface blastingEquipment trouble shootingWelding, TIG, Laser, Friction, MIAB and resistance welding product inspection responsible.Process parameters and chemicals used for paint and anti-corrosion, coating and surface modifiers are controlled by metallurgy.Liaising with clients to determine and interpret design requirementsNon-destructive testing systems will be developed, controlled, training, product analysis, qualifications PM and spare parts controlled by metallurgy.Washers and sediment testing are developed controlled, training, product analysis, qualifications PM and spare parts controlled by metallurgy.Providing technical advice about the suitability of metals for different purposesMaking recommendations and advising about product feasibilitySupport quality, purchasing and product engineeringUsing specialist computer applicationsCarrying out laboratory based analysis of samplesUsing both destructive and non-destructive techniques to test compositionInvestigating production problems.Lead, direct, and support all aspects of laboratory test workDevelop and manage metallurgical operations and work practices that maximize operational efficienciesImprove plant operating performance; reduce waste and delays; promote cost reductions; and achieve a high level of operating efficiency;Evaluate current and potential processing methods;Monitor and analyze key metallurgical performance indicators of process operations and recommend corrective actions to the operations team;Manage metallurgical and chemical engineering activities working with the operations team and external consultants.Create and distribute monthly metallurgical and engineering reports; Work within cross-functional teams and coach, mentor supervise and lead direct reports; Maintain a safe and efficient work environmentPeople Management


Ensure the delivery of the People Strategy within area of accountability Manage, coach and develop a high performing manufacturing team that meets agreed objectives (PIPs) and which delivers best practice results, added value and continuous improvementsSet department objectives/KPIs and review and assess ongoing performance of direct reportsReport on achievement of targets (labor, overhead and PIPs) and identify any actions requiredManage and lead the team, ensuring adequate staffing levels, managing holiday allowances, recruitment, training, development, appraisal, attendance, disciplinary issues and daily supervision to maximize efficient productivityMotivate and coach the team to operational successProvide technical expertise to the teamMonitor the completion of tasks and ensure good performance and record on appropriate systemsConsistently promote high standards through personal example and roll out through the team so that each member of the team understands the standards and behaviors expected of themCommunicate KPIs from the strategic annual plan so that each employee is awareDevelop, implement and manage key performance indicators (KPIs) for each area of responsibility

Required Skills and Education

Bachelor's degree in metallurgical or chemical engineering;Minimum ten years of metallurgical experience; mineral processing, leaching, solvent extraction and rare earth experience preferred or essential;Minimum ten years of engineering process design and feasibility studies;Minimum ten years of project management and financial budgeting;Strong computer skills (i.e. MS Office including Excel, Word and PowerPoint).

About American Axle & Manufacturing

For over 20 years, customers around the world have entrusted AAM to design, engineer, validate and manufacture driveline and metal forming technologies for automotive, commercial and industrial markets. Today, we are a premier global Tier 1 automotive supplier with broad capabilities across multiple product lines to deliver efficient, powerful and innovative solutions for our customers. Weve earned the trust of our suppliers and our customers through our steadfast commitments to quality, operational excellence and technology leadership.

AAM delivers power. We deliver power literally through vehicle components, systems and innovation, but we also deliver power in ways unseen. We power our associates, their families, and the communities in which we operate. Our global team of over 21,000 associates has a clear vision of where AAM is going and how we are going to get there. After all, they are the reason we are a leader in the automotive industry. We are powering the future. We are AAM. Move with us, and join #TeamAAM.AAM will not discriminate against any Associate or applicant for employment because of age, race, color, gender, religion, weight, height, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic history or information, gender identity or expression, disability, protected veteran status, national origin, or other characteristic protected by law. title: Product Manager
job_description:
eSalon is open and thriving. We are looking for a local E-commerce Product Manager to play a key role in defining and refining the customer experience for our websites and internal tools. In this role, you’ll take complex business requirements and transform them into intuitive digital experiences. You’ll use your skills to influence how products/features get implemented and, most importantly, be an advocate for user needs. This role would start out WFH during Covid 19 and then move into our El Segundo, CA headquarters (at least part-time) once it is safe to do so.

What You'll Be Doing:

Participate in all aspects of building products and features, from ideation through launch and optimization. This role is inherently cross-functional. You’ll work closely with product, design, engineering, marketing, etc. to bring products to market, develop and grow business opportunities, and enhance our customer experience. Ownership of day-to-day PM tasks: such as writing requirements, overseeing requirements implementation in design and development, managing stakeholder input, participating in roadmap prioritization. Partner with designers to ensure requirements are effectively captured in both UI design and interaction design. Partner with developers during implementation and participate in QA to ensure product designs and functionality are implemented to specifications. Leverage data and analytics to track current site performance as well as make recommendations during each phase of the product lifecycle. Participate in conceptualizing, designing and running A/B tests with the goal of optimizing conversion funnels and top line KPIs. Research industry trends, customer feedback, and current performance data to conceptualize and pitch new opportunities that support the product vision. Other duties as required.

Requirements

3+ years of E-commerce product management experience. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent professional experience. Skilled in product management processes and best practices. Knowledge of A/B testing principles and methods. Strong analytical thinking and strategic planning skills. Ability to simplify complex ideas so they can be effectively communicated cross-functionally. Ability to juggle multiple projects and independently prioritize your work. Intuitive understanding of and empathy for various user types: their motivations, goals, and pain points. Self-starter, highly organized, strong attention to detail, excellent verbal and written communication skills. Experience with Jira/Confluence, Mixpanel, Invision, and G-suite is a plus. Experience with website localization processes is a plus. Interest in customization technology, hair color and the beauty industry is a plus. Must be authorized to work in the US for any employer.

Benefits

Highly competitive compensation Medical, dental, vision and life insurance plans 401K Plan 15 days of Paid Time Off + 11 company holidays Paid Parental Leave Monthly catered lunches Stocked kitchen Employee Assistance Program

Rideshare program Casual work environment Corporate Discount Program Complimentary salon services Authentic work / life balance Beer Cart Fridays

title: Product Marketing Manager
job_description: BAL’s Product Marketing Manager is:• An Entrepreneur – self-driven, individually accountable, managing the overall marketing strategy for the product, both with existing and prospective clients.• A Creative – aware of, but not limited by boundaries.• A Leader – leads by example, highly collaborative, cross functional leader.• A Results Driver – breaks down barriers, focused on delivery, creates value.• A Visionary – Predicts based on insights gleaned from data. Drives the direction of product marketing based on a deep understanding of the market, users, and the product.• A Persuader – able to move the minds of and align groups and individuals toward clear goals.• Responsible for developing positioning, messaging, and competitive differentiation for BAL’s digital product portfolio, with both internal and external audiences.• Drive product marketing, creating a variety of marketing assets, including product demos, product overview documents, customer presentation decks, feature guides, and educational materials.• Lead market opportunity assessments and process for the BAL digital product portfolio to inform strategic long-term and short-term bets.• Lead the market analysis for the BAL digital product portfolio to clearly communicate strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats.• Lead internal stakeholders and executives through product marketing decisions, and advise on overall product positioning and messaging in the portfolio.• Coordinate cross-functionally and communicate via webinars, events, and marketing campaigns to both internal (immigration provider) and external (client and end-user) audiences.• title: Program Manager
job_description:
Rock House, a leader in residential, foster, and in-home support and care for persons with disabilities is seeking professional to manage the planning, direction, coordination, and supervision of healthcare delivery services.

This position will manage, review, and analyze program operations, personnel, finances, and departmental and facility functioning. Will include policy and procedure administration; maintaining license and certification requirements; liaison coordination with other medical, business and community groups.

Applicants should have at least a bachelor’s degree in a field of health care management, human services, or other related degree.

3-5 years management experience in healthcare delivery systems preferred. Excellent leadership, problem-solving, team development, communication, organization, and multi-tasking skills are a must.

Candidates who do not meet minimum qualifications will not be considered. We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits.

title: Scientific Product Manager - Tempus Insights
job_description:
Passionate about precision medicine and advancing the healthcare industry?

Recent advancements in underlying technology have finally made it possible for AI to impact clinical care in a meaningful way. Tempus' proprietary platform connects an entire ecosystem of real-world evidence to deliver real-time, actionable insights to physicians, providing critical information about the right treatments for the right patients, at the right time.

Passionate about building great software and algorithms that impact clinical care?

Tempus Insights is our business to develop, validate and launch new predictive tests, in oncology and new disease areas, by leveraging our clinical + molecular + imaging data to provide novel insights to clinicians and patients.

We are seeking a highly motivated and capable scientific product manager with strong entrepreneurial skills to help us develop, launch and scale new predictive algorithms in oncology.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Fully own the development and launch of a new product at Tempus. We're launching a new clinical test that will have a dramatic impact on cancer patients. You are going to be the General Manager for this test, to take it from an idea/planning stage to full implementation with direct clinical impact.
Understand the scientific and medical basis for new predictive tests that Tempus is developing. Become the expert.
Collaborate with clinicians, scientific teams, R&D teams and others to understand key risks, determine the right clinical market for the product, and ultimately launch a new test.

Required Experience:

Advanced degree in Bioinformatics, Cancer Biology, Molecular Biology, Bioengineering, Biochemistry or a related field (PhD preferred)
Multiple years of industry experience, blending scientific/medical knowledge with real operational execution
Entrepreneurial skills. You've taken an idea and turned it into something real and something great.

Ideal candidates will possess:

Self-driven and works well in interdisciplinary teams
Experience with communicating insights and presenting concepts to a diverse audience

#LI-LH1

title: Product Manager
job_description:
The Product Manager guides the team that is charged with delivering product line contribution for one or more innovative solutions that transform the healthcare system.This includes increasing sales and user adoption of existing products and helping develop new solutions based on industry experience and your contact with customers and prospects.A successful Product Manager must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that a reality.

The Product Manager will work with all areas of the company along with a development counterpart to define product release requirements and plans.They will work with marketing to define the go-to-market strategy, helping them understand the product positioning, key benefits, and target customer.They will work with the sales team to create a repeatable sales process.They will also serve as the internal and external evangelist for their products.The Product Manager reports to Group Product Manager in the CAQH Solutions organization; the position is full time, exempt.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

§Product Champion– Act as the product lead/owner for new and existing products; work with cross-functional teams to enhance existing products.

§Execute the entire product lifecycle and tactical activities.

§Prioritize enhancement requests and develop and maintain a product roadmap that casts a vision both internally and externally of where the product is going.

§Develop a deep understanding of target customer needs and represent the needs of the customer when defining, designing, building, and launching product.

§Evangelize customer needs and assigned product concepts internally and externally to obtain buy-in and drive industry adoption.

§Coordinate cross-functionally across matrix resources to execute product design reviews, changes, and implementations.

§Utilize product management tools (Aha!/JIRA) and development practices (SAFE Agile) to support CAQH Solution development initiatives.

§Drive the development and retirement of assigned existing products.

§Measure and report the actual results of the product strategy to its plan.

§Go-to-Market– Support the marketing team in the development and implementation of a company-wide go-to-market plan, working with all departments to execute.

§Sales Enablement – Support sales teams by assisting with the development of a repeatable sales process, including sales materials and tools, conducting sales training, identifying new markets, and advising on short and long-term sales strategies existing/new products.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

§Ability to conduct market research, develop business cases, and design conceptual solutions.

§Ability to document business, market or product requirements and create functional design specifications.

§Ability to evaluate product ideas and requests from numerous sources and articulate a rationale for those that are worth pursuing.

§Ability to make and defend decisions related to economic trade-offs and prioritization.

§Ability to create written, graphic and summary documents and presentations for internal and external use in communicating product goals and objectives.

§Ability to communicate clearly and concisely with business and technical stakeholders using their terminology.

§Ability to work collaboratively and effectively across matrix organizations in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.

EXPERIENCE:

§3-5 years in product development / product management (preferably with a technology focus).

§2+ years managing healthcare technology products.

§People management/supervisory experience preferred.

EDUCATION:

§Bachelor’s degree required.

§Master’s degree preferred.

§Degrees in healthcare administration, public health, or technology disciplines preferred.

WHO WE ARE

Named one of Modern Healthcare’s Best Places to Work in 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2019, CAQH, a non-profit alliance, is the leader in creating shared initiatives to streamline the business of healthcare. Through collaboration and innovation, CAQH accelerates the transformation of business processes, delivering value to providers, patients and health plans.

§COB Smart® quickly and accurately directs coordination of benefits processes.

§EnrollHub® reduces costly paper checks with enrollment for electronic payments and electronic remittance advice.

§CAQH ProView® eases the burden of provider data collection, maintenance and distribution.

§DirectAssure® increases the accuracy of health plan provider directories.

§VeriFideTM streamlines credentialing by consolidating and standardizing primary source verification.

§SanctionsTrack® delivers comprehensive, multi-state information on healthcare provider licensure disciplinary actions.

§CAQH CORE® maximizes business efficiency and savings by developing and implementing national operating rules.

§CAQH Index® benchmarks progress and helps optimize operations by tracking industry adoption of electronic administrative transactions.

WHAT YOU GET

CAQH recognizes that its most important asset is its growing team of smart, creative, collaborative, forward-thinking and passionate professionals – and that a comprehensive employee benefits package is an important factor for them in choosing where to work. CAQH offers competitive compensation along with an extensive benefits package for all full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, tuition assistance and a 401k. Our location in downtown Washington, DC is metro-accessible, has an onsite fitness center and is centrally located to allow our team to take advantage of professional networking opportunities, cultural offerings and a thriving social scene.

title: General Manager
job_description:
THIS GENERAL MANAGER POSITION IS LOCATED IN ALTUS, OK!

We are a family-owned, growth oriented company committed to providing outstanding service to our customers and being the employer of choice. We strive to promote quality and integrity in every aspect of our business. Founded in 1969, the company is now owned by David and Linda Hutchinson and has grown to consist of 17 convenience stores and truck stops and 2 restaurants. We also provide bobtail and transport fuel deliveries.

We are looking for ambitious, customer-service oriented General Managers to help us serve the Altus, OK area at our two new Hutch's locations.

General Managers will primarily do the following:

Educate & Develop

General Managers will educate, develop, and recruit all store team membersHolds one on one coaching sessions with all staff members at least every other month, more often as neededUnderstands labor costs; Schedules staff in line with customer count and budgeted wage %Accurately prioritize job responsibilities so that highest level of customer service is provided.Able to direct the work of other employees and lead by example.

Customer Service

Ensure that each Guest receives outstanding Guest Service by providing a Guest friendly environment which includes greeting and acknowledging every Guest, maintaining outstanding standards and solid product knowledge, and providing prompt service.Has some idea of local customer needs and special eventsKeeps current on competitors offerings

Operations and Inventory Management

Knows metrics for the site including, performance of products, fuel pricing, and sales volumeCompletes store paperwork, enters invoices, controls expenses

Works to ensure all employees on their shift operate within company guidelines to achieve sales and profitResponsible for the inventory process: How it works, how it affects the store, how to order, how to handle problems and can investigate discrepanciesFollows correct vendor check-in procedure and ensures authorized employees do so as well

Food Service Operations

General Managers oversee food service operations with the Food Service ManagerEnsure appropriate deli inventory levels at all times by ordering product in a thorough, efficient, and timely manner; Ensure build-tos of warmers and coolers are followed and adjusted as neededMaintain health and sanitation standards for self and employees. Knows food safety.Continually work to increase deli sales

Merchandising & Maintenance

Maintains all merchandising standards, display presentations, signage standards, and monitors inventory levels.

This General Manager position has full benefits, including

general manager: 1 year (Preferred)

Store Discounts

One location

title: Senior Product Manager - Systems
job_description:
Position Summary

The Senior Product Manager– Systems is responsible for driving the vision and execution of Neptune’s R900 Systems portfolio, advocating for the product internally. Responsible for defining product features - with a focus on Voice of the Customer, the Senior Product Manager works collaboratively with Engineering, Operations, Sales, and other Product Managers to meet quality standards, project deadlines and business objectives for the product line, while bringing the product to life. Working together with Marketing Communications, he or she will ensure that sales enablement reflects understanding of the user’s business problems and enables the channel throughout the Buyer Experience.

Objectives

Product Requirements– Tracking overall market and competitive dynamics, acts as intermediary between the market and engineering, representing the business requirements and defining product features that will lead the product team to make informed business decisions. Understand what user needs (the problem) and work across departments to bring the products to life, communicating the Voice of the Customer. Manage the long-term road map, involving sales, marketing, implementation, clients, prospects, partners, and other groups.

Product Marketing– Analyzes market trends and defines product positioning; articulates customer value propositions and key differentiators. Implements marketing plans for the products. Develops standardized sales tools, proposals, demo scripts, etc. Implements product launches and target marketing campaigns. Creates marketing collateral including case studies, data sheets, white papers and FAQ’s.

Sales Enablement - Provides product positioning training and materials for the channel and for customer service. Collaborates cross functionally with Sales and Customer Experience teams on market development, selling, and field solutions. Delivers product presentations to customers and channel partners. Serves as subject matter expert for proposals.

Requirements

Education: Bachelor of Science degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering, Computer Science or Applied Science.

Experience: 7+ years of related experience. Industry experience is a plus

Skills: Requires moderate skill set and proficiency in discipline. Pragmatic Marketing Certification is a plus. Conducts work assignments of increasing complexity, under moderate supervision with some latitude for independent judgement

Knowledge of sales, marketing, and product development processes. Leadership, sales support, project management, and training skills. Analytical mind and strong quantitative and problem solving skills. Positive attitude and high energy, creativity and strong learning ability. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (both verbal and written).

Location: Tallassee, AL or Duluth, GA

Travel Required:25% - 30%

title: Franchise Rep / Area Manager
job_description:
Pickleman's is looking for experienced multi-unit managers to join our Franchise team or the local Team to help us expand the brand in Nebraska and Iowa. $50,000 - $65,000 Annually Paid Vacation401KHealth BenefitsTravel Reimbursement 
We are looking for Franchise Reps and Operators with experience. Purpose and Mission
The AR is the direct line of contact between the franchisee, the store, and Pickleman’s Franchising. The purpose of the AR is to assist the franchisee and its employees in executing Pickleman’s systems and to give immediate feedback, positive and negative, through the “see it, say it” attitude. An AR should work through the management or ownership to the staff. The goal is employee development through constant feedback, physical demonstration, follow up, and reinforcement of Pickleman’s systems. Pickleman’s AR’s should have a complete understanding of health code while demonstrating and coaching those standards to the staff at all times. Through thorough inspections of all corners, floors, nooks, and crannies of our restaurants, an AR provides valuable feedback to our restaurants that guarantees a safe and clean experience for our customers. An AR should be working through an action plan at all times striving to achieve the results listed in the action plan. An AR should have a firm knowledge of the Pickleman’s Policies and Procedures and model them at all times. These Policies and Procedures also obligate you to follow the standards and to comply with any other policies and procedures established by the Company
Progression
An AR answers directly to the Area Director of Operations (AD).
Territory and Travel
AR should live within one hour of the assigned Market but may be required to regularly travel outside of their specified territory. Due to the necessary traveling nature of the position, valid driver’s license and insurance information are required at the time of hire, throughout employment, and may be validated from time to time.
Mental and Physical Requirements
Communicate and converse with location staff, ownership, and customers in a positive and friendly manner that is understandable and clear communication to transmit and receive information.
Express oneself in a manner that reflects positively on themselves and the Pickleman’s brand.
Apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral or diagrammatic form; to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in or from standardized situations.
Add, subtract, multiply and divide all units of measure; to perform the four operations with like or common decimal fractions; to compute ratio, rate, and percent; to operate Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Word.
Distinguish between properly executed or incorrect Pickleman’s recipes product builds through taste or identify through visual confirmation.
Must be able to move, transport, position, put, install, or remove restaurant equipment or necessary product weighing up to 50 pounds inside the restaurants or at events as needed. Most work is required to be performed from a standing position but may involve walking or sitting for brief periods of time.
Occasionally ascends/descends a ladder to service or inspect restaurant equipment and cleanliness.
Position self to maintain and inspect the equipment, including under equipment.
Reaching, climbing, stooping, kneeling, crouching, handling, feeling, lifting, carrying, standing, walking, pushing, and pulling is required frequently in the preparation and production of products.
Exposure occasionally to extreme heat is present with temperatures sufficiently high to cause marked bodily discomfort. Wet and/or humid conditions are present where the worker comes into contact with water and other liquids.
Safe and legal operation of a motor vehicle.
Technology Usage Requirements (ability to use)-Smartphone and Telephone-Tablet or Ipad like device-Location POS software-Portable or Desktop computer-Microsoft Office, Excel, and PowerPoint-Email-Knowledge of social media platforms-Pickleman’s company used platforms such as Online Ordering, Enterprise Reporting software, Online Food and Beverage ordering Platforms
Uniform
The daily uniform should give the appearance of leadership to restaurant staff and customers alike but should blend in with location staff. We require clean Pickleman’s collared shirt tucked into clean, well-kept blue jeans, khaki shorts, or khaki pants and finished with a belt. Because of the requirement to be on their feet for the majority of their working hours, athletic style shoes are the shoes of choice. AR should be ready to make food if necessary so should also have a hat on. Facial hair should be kept neatly trimmed or clean-shaven.
Training
To be done at the training store to be determined. Typical shifts from 8am to 6 pm, 9am to 7pm, and 5pm to 3am. Training will last 6 weeks and be conducted at a location to be determined. After completion of training, an AR will work for a minimum of 6 months and up to one year as the General Manager at a designated location before AR is assigned a market and stores. During this time, an AR in training can expect a monthly evaluation to track progress and determine if AR is ready and qualified to become a full AR. After completion of the store management phase of training, an AR can expect to shadow an active AR for 1 month in their assigned market.
Education
ServSafe national food safety certification.

title: Product Launch Manager
job_description:
Here @Strata…We are committed to our mission to help heal healthcare. Our unique culture is driven by a social, hardworking environment full of talented people solving problems together. We embrace learning, cross-team collaboration, and continuous career growth. Lifting each other to lift our clients, our product, our company. If being part of a fun, fast-moving, innovative team is what you seek? Keep reading.We look for someone who:

Is Service-Centric: Someone who desires to make an impact in and outside of our office. We look for service minded people to support our customers, each other and our community.Has a Growth Mindset: Driven to own your individual learning and development (We’ll help you - we have a team dedicated to training you and providing extra educational resources).Rocks Impact: Thinks two steps ahead to ensure the work we do will solve problems and make a difference.Will be a StrataPro: Accountable. Prepared. Positive. Core to who we are and how we treat one another.

What you’ll do in this role:The role will be responsible for ensuring cross functional alignment, communication, and timeline management related to introduction of new product features in Strata’s software, StrataJazz@ to existing and new customers.

Strata’s Product Launch Manager will work with peers in Client Services, Marketing, Product Management, Business Development, Support, and Strata’s leadership teams to drive business readiness for product launches. Responsibilities include understanding the product road map, communicating feature introduction to internal and external stakeholders, and monitoring and tracking feature adoption and successes. Other aspects of this role include:

Developing, maintaining, and communicating feature introduction plans.Tracking the deliverables, milestones, risks and issues across several cross-functional teams.Anticipating bottlenecks, explore contingencies and provide escalation management throughout feature introduction process.Collaborating with marketing on content/materials and identify case studies to highlight the impact the feature has on driving value for customers.Collaborate with Product Management and Client Services to drive customers through beta testing and Early Adopter (beta) phases.Work with Product Management and Training teams to develop content needed to educate, train and launch Strata’s product features and functionality.Create content and educate Strata’s internal teams on new features and the value they provide.Develop and track metrics related to product adoption to quantify success and identify areas for improvement.

Your accomplishments include:



Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent5-8 years relevant experience in Product Management, Product Marketing and/or Project ManagementStrong communication, presentation and writing skills with emphasis on technologyUnderstanding and experience with Agile product development practicesExperience within healthcare technology and/or financial software systems, a plusStrong technical knowledge around product development/management and ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiencesAbility to build strong cross-functional relationships and at an executive levelDemonstrated strength in analytical thinkingSelf-Starter with strong accountability and project management for tasksExperience with Salesforce or other equivalent CRM systems preferred

title: Property Manager - 21 Oaks
job_description:
Job Description - 21 Oaks
The Property Manager is the leader of their community. In this role, you will build and mentor your team to provide a best in class experience for residents and staff. The key components to this position are overseeing all day to day operations, driving occupancy and NOI, maintaining the community to Campus Advantage’s expectations, and ensuring resident satisfaction.
The Property Manager's responsibilities include creating and executing the business plan, maintaining and enhancing the value of the community and providing a positive living and learning experience for residents of the community. This is accomplished through building and directing a stellar team, demonstrating the ability to prioritize, delegate and appropriately time manage as well as remaining focused on delivering a high level of customer service. This position reports to the Regional Manager.
Responsibilities

Demonstrate a positive, can-do attitude with a relentless drive to get the job done despite any obstacles.


Must possess the ability to work independently and efficiently while maintaining accuracy. Able to collaborate with members of a team and relate well to others.


Build and coach a great team, and communicate with important stakeholders like residents, guarantors, clients, and teammates at the home office. Responsible to conduct annual employee evaluations and administer property level onboarding.


Ensure the team at your property is well trained and supported in executing the functions of their job, understand the policies and procedures and are knowledgeable in the goals of the property.


Develop and manage the annual budget, management plan, and marketing plan. Must analyze and produce monthly financials including variances from budget as well as cash management strategies.


Demonstrate product and market knowledge as well as ensure leasing staff is well trained. Effectively execute property’s marketing plan while maximizing revenue and occupancy. Oversee residence life programming ensuring it meets the needs of the community and results in resident satisfaction.


Manage rent collections and reconciliation as well as ensure accounts payable is processed timely.


Responsible to oversee the asset and ensure it is maintained to Campus Advantage’s standards. Ensuring quarterly health and safety walks are conducted and that the preventative maintenance plan is followed. Responsible for successful execution of property’s annual turn as well as working in conjunction with corporate team and client on execution of any planned capital projects.


Plan and execute the property’s annual turnover process.


Ensure property operations are in conjunction with Campus Advantage’s Policies and Procedures.


Meet required deadlines and ensure team meets required deadlines.

Qualifications

4+ years of experience working in residential rental communities. Student housing is strongly preferred.
Bachelor’s Degree 
PC Literacy (Microsoft Office)
Realpage experience Preferred
Strong Written and Verbal Communication Skills. Must display ability to problem solve and communicate ideas clearly and concisely. (Writing samples will be requested)

About Us
Campus Advantage is a real estate investment management firm fostering financially prosperous higher education student housing communities through its management, development, acquisition, and consulting services. Since its founding in 2003, Campus Advantage has been creating successful communities that provide rewarding living, learning, and career experiences, and as a result has become one of the fastest growing private student housing companies in the nation. The company’s asset acquisition and management strategies combined with its dedication to residence life and student development has made Campus Advantage the 6th largest student housing owner and the 7th largest manager in the United States.
We’re looking for people who share our values.

Integrity We live by the Golden Rule, trying always to do the right thing!
Intelligence We believe that learning is a lifelong endeavor and we strive to stay ahead through innovations.
Passion  We desire to do our best, and we never give up!
Mojo We attract and charm others through our success and outlook on life. We take our work and our communities, but not ourselves, seriously.

title: Service Manager
job_description:
This individual will provide leadership in motivating, managing, and evaluating Service Technicians. The Service Manager will efficiently coordinate, schedule, and manage Service Technician’s time, while maintaining the work order process. This role will also communicate with the customer in regards to quotes, job status, and scheduling. This management role will coordinate activities with other departments to best serve the needs of the customer and employees.

Specific Duties Include:

Demonstrate leadership in day-to-day management of the Service Technicians under their direction.
Assign and schedule jobs and work areas to Service Technicians according to their skills and knowledge.
Coach, mentor, and communicate job expectations to service department team members.
Lead and take ownership of management responsibility relating to hiring, performance management and overall people management with assigned Service Technicians.
Effectively utilize the service scheduling and Ewalk tools to properly manage the flow of the work order process to completion. (customer, internal and warranty)
Follow and understand all of our manufacturer partner’s guidelines, processes and expectations.
Review and approve the daily timecards for employees.
Proactively seek customer feedback, anticipate problems and respond promptly.
Respond and follow up with employee issues and/or concerns.
Review and process all repair work orders for accuracy and completeness concerning parts, materials, labor, and approve the release of equipment for delivery to the customer.
Assist and support all aspects of the service department in support of the responsibilities of the Service Operations Manager.
Responsible for facilitating proper annual employee reviews, 1:1 meetings and quarterly Career Path Level (CPL) meetings.
Maintain technical and product knowledge on all equipment sold within the dealership’s area of responsibility.
Maintain and demonstrate the knowledge of the RDO Equipment Co. Service operations and procedures model.
Effectively utilize company provided tools, i.e. Work Order Scheduler, Ewalk, Precise, DTAC, Service Advisor, Service Advisor Remote etc.
Handle warranty claims, including computation of charges, partner with the Central Warranty Department on the submission and follow-up of all warranty claims.
Ensure that appropriate communications take place throughout the location/s by facilitating/participating in monthly open-book meetings, conducting regular team meetings, encouraging an open-door policy, and proactively seeking feedback from team members.
Foster an engaged work environment within the location/s, encouraging accountability, open communication, teamwork, and a commitment to serving the customer.
Lead and manage all business and/or department activities related to ensuring the customer experience is positive and that all team members are committed to creating solutions and long term relationships with customers.
Ensure that the company/location reputation and image in the community is consistent with RDO Equipment Co. Core Values, and that business relationships with all stakeholders are not compromised.
Manage the evaluation, allocation, and management of physical and financial resources and administer the hiring, development/training, management, evaluation, and effective assignment of people resources.
Responsible for ensuring that sound and safe business practices and processes are implemented and are continuously improved to effectively and efficiently achieve ethical business objectives.
Follow all safety rules and regulations while performing work assignments and adhere to all policies and procedures as specified in company manuals and as directed in the employee handbook.
Proactively seek and participate in available company-sponsored training, in an effort to develop and advance knowledge base and skill set.
Maintain a positive and professional working relationship with peers, management, and support resources, with a constant commitment to teamwork and exemplary customer service.
Perform all other duties as assigned by management in a professional and efficient manner.

Job Requirements:

Previous supervisory/management experience preferred
Excellent customer service skills
Excellent computer skills
Technical knowledge
Excellent time management, problem solving and organizational skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills
High school and/or technical school education preferred
Candidates must have valid work authorization and be able to work in the U.S. without company sponsorship


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Program Manager
job_description:
TekSynap, a Fast 50 technology company in the Washington DC area that offers technology solutions to federal, state and local government agencies. We offer our full-time employees a competitive benefits package to include health, dental, vision, 401K, life insurance, short-term and long-term disability plans, vacation time and holidays.

Visit us at www.TekSynap.com.

Apply now to explore jobs with us!

We are seeking a Program Manager to join our Army DENIX team at the Pentagon.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Provides support to the Deputy Assistant Secretary of the Army for Environment, Safety and Occupational Healthy (DASA ESOH) Technology Directorate and the Defense Environmental Information Technology Management (EITM) Program.
Provide assistance to the Army Secretariat in the development of policies and strategies to address environment, safety and occupational health technology issues that may have significant future impacts on the Army and the DOD ESOH Community of Interest (COI).
Assist the Army Secretariat in setting priorities for environmental, health and safety programs.
Identify areas for environment, safety and occupational health research, development and other activities.
Provide program management support to all functional areas under the purview of the EITM Program Management Office (PMO) including development of policies, briefings, and white papers.
Provide a wide variety of technical support to the EITM program in satisfying requirements established by the Department of Defense to include:

Creation of products from the information generated by the EITM product line
Use of current advances in design and development methodologies to reduce the ongoing support costs associated with EITM program areas
Evaluation of the features and functionality of EITM products to ensure products effectively address requirements of the customer base being served
Continuous improvement of the program using technology insertion to sustain leading edge architecture
Expansion of EITM product line capabilities to include environmental executive support systems, knowledge management, web-based environmental applications and training
Providing scientific and technical expertise to collect data, perform analyses, make recommendations and develop innovative methods to provide financial; tracking/reporting; contract administration; cost management; systems design and architecture; web page development; knowledge management design, and product design
Support EITM in facilitating the delivery of improved ESOH information and knowledge management products to DOD and the Component services


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Must have a Bachelor of Arts or a Bachelor of Science degree from an accredited university.
Requires a minimum of ten (10) years of experience managing contracts, funds and resources similar in complexity to this program.
A minimum of five (5) years of experience directly supporting Federal government programs and briefing senior government leadership.
A minimum five (5) years managing Information Technology (IT) contracts.
A minimum of five (5) years of experience in program management.
PMP Preferred
Minimum secret clearance required
Army experience is preferred.

WORK LOCATION AND HOURS

The Pentagon, typically 7:00am 3:30pm (includes 30-minute lunch) and must be flexible when required.

COMPETENCIES 

Establish Focus
Change Management
Develop Others
Oral Communication
Written Communication
Interpersonal Awareness
Build Relationships
Analytical Thinking
Conceptual Thinking
Strategic Thinking
Technical Expertise
Initiative
Foster Innovation
Results Oriented
Teamwork
Customer Service

title: Manufacturing Engineering Manager
job_description:
SUMMARY:

A manufacturing engineer is responsible for creating, documenting, developing, and implementing processes used to manufacture, outside process, assemble, and inspect the company's products.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:

Manufacturing engineers must have a four year engineering degree or equivalent, preferably in a field related to the company’s production processing needs. Significant prior experience may be substituted for educational requirements.

QUALIFICATIONS:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Ability to correctly read and interpret engineering drawings. Must have capability to change and correct drawings

Must have working knowledge machining processes including tooling and machine programming.

Must have working knowledge of manufacturing system software.

Must have direct machining experience on several types of cutting machines.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:

N/A

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Reviews customer drawings for manufacturability and makes recommendations to management for improvements and/or corrections.

Creates travelers/routers to define the manufacturing process.

Estimates standard times per traveler operation for processing the company’s products.

Revises standard times as necessary to conform to actual processing times.

Establishes engineering procedures to control processing

Works with production to create efficiencies in the production process, such as fixturing, machining time improvements, tooling, etc.

Monitors and reports on manufacturing process for product quality and process control.

Contributes to continuous process improvement through the design, development testing, and implementation of new production methods, measurement systems, and workforce applications.

Prepares the work process mapping portion of the Process Qualification Program (PQP) and Process of Record (POR) for all Critical Parts.

REASONING ABILITY:

Ability to understand the interaction of the various manufacturing and auxiliary processes and potential impacts of the processes. Ability to coordinate the processes.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

The physical demands described herein are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to sit; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 40 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

The work environment characteristics described herein are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions, moving mechanical parts, fumes or airborne particles, risk of electrical shock, and vibration.

Work is performed in an office environment. While in the shop, employee may occasionally be exposed to heat, cold, dust, fumes, loud noises and air born particles. Employee may need to work extended hours based on the needs of the business.

NOTE: The intent of this job description is to provide a representative summary of the major duties and responsibilities to be performed. It should be noted that employees may be requested to perform job-related tasks in addition to those presented in the description. The company reserves the right to revise or modify the responsibilities of this position at any time.

title: Product Manager, Marketing Automation (SFMC)
job_description:
The Opportunity

The Product Manager, Marketing Automation will lead and own Salesforce Marketing Cloud and other marketing automation platforms and initiatives for Rodan + Fields. This role will partner closely with the Lifecycle/Loyalty Marketing team to deliver digital solutions to drive business objectives and revenue growth.

Responsibilities

Product management ownership of Salesforce Marketing Cloud platformProduct management ownership of eCommerce transactional emailsAssist in the vision and strategy for the R+F marketing automation platformsDefine a product roadmap, gain alignment with business/leadership teams and lead executionDefine technical requirements and partner with engineering to drive the completion of deliverablesProvide platform performance analysis and identify opportunity areasWrite high quality user stories, using an agile approachManage internal, client and partner stakeholdersDirect on-time, quality delivery of work

Qualifications:

3-5+ years of marketing automation product management experienceHands-on Salesforce Marketing Cloud experienceExperience defining, owning, and managing a product roadmapExperience leading large full-lifecycle cloud-based marketing implementationsExperience leading large on- and off-shore engineers and consulting staffStrong analytical, prioritization, communication and negotiating skillsA drive for results, with a track record of process improvementFlexibility to quickly adapt in a rapidly changing environment, meeting aggressive schedulesExceptional attention to detailProficient use of Confluence and JIRAA BA/BS degree

The Company

Rodan + Fields was founded in 2000 by Stanford-trained Dermatologists Dr. Katie Rodan and Dr. Kathy Fields with a passion for giving people the best skin of their lives — and the confidence that comes with it. Today, Rodan + Fields is the #1 Skincare Brand in North America[1] in 2018 and the #1 Skincare Brand in the US in 2016, 2017 and 2018[2]! The company has grown its innovative line of products and expanded into Canada and Australia. Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, R+F now employs approximately 700 people, has more than 300,000 enrolled Independent Consultants and over two million Preferred Customers.

At Rodan + Fields, you will be challenged to make an impact, inspired to do more, and rewarded for your contributions. We are transforming skincare, and we welcome your big ideas to fuel our ambitious growth plans! If you are looking for a life-changing career opportunity, we've got your prescription. You’ll become part of a positive, passionate movement that celebrates greatness and encourages employees to be catalysts for change. We provide a creative, vibrant workplace outfitted with all of the technology, tools and training you'll need to learn, grow and thrive! We create life-changing impact in our communities through our non-profit, Prescription for Change®, the heart of Rodan + Fields. By funding empowerment programs for students, we teach them how to use their skills to make life-changing differences in their lives and the lives of others. Join us and share your talents as we develop innovative solutions for your skin and empower entrepreneurs. In addition to working arm-in-arm with industry leaders, employees at Rodan + Fields enjoy rich benefits plans and perks.

[1] Source Euromonitor International Limited; Beauty and Personal Care 2019 Edition, retail value RSP terms; all channels, Skin Care includes Sets and Kits; North America defined as Canada and the United States

[2] Source Euromonitor International Limited; Beauty and Personal Care 2019 Edition, retail value RSP terms; all channels, Skincare includes Sets & Kits.

*At R+F, we do not engage with Google Hangouts or other social media platforms to schedule interviews or communicate with candidates. Please disregard any messages or notifications from Google Hangouts or other social media messenger platforms regarding interviews or job offers.

title: Lead Manager – Infrastructure Security
job_description:
Thank you for your interest in a position with the AXA Equitable Life Insurance Company (Equitable).

The “Lead Manager – Lead Manager” is an individual contributor role. This role is based out of our Syracuse, NY or Charlotte, NC office locations. Although currently all Equitable employees are working virtually.

In this role the individual must have F5 WAF and DDoS product knowledge with large scale implementations spanning multiple business lines. Must be security-focused SME with cloud computing services and be principally responsible for WAF and DDoS. Work with application teams to build, tune, and maintain F5 ASM (WAF) policies. Experience with implementing cloud network solutions is a plus. Individual’s responsibilities will be in the following key areas:

WAF/DDoS:

•	Silverline:

Provide and review F5 Silverline questionnaire’s to/from application teams
Create ticket in Silverline for creation of base WAF policy
Create ticket in Silverline to attach WAF policy to proxy in transparent mode once the proxy has been created
For each transition to next blocking phase (phase 1, 2, and 3)

o	Create ticket requesting assessment of current WAF Violations

o	review actions that will be blocked during transition to the next phase with the application team providing security context, risks, and recommendations

o	take any feedback and create ticket requesting that F5 tune the policy accordingly

o	create ticket transitioning the WAF policy to blocking with approval from application owner

o	confirm with application team that blocking phase did not break functionality

o	work through issues with F5 to tune the policy

5.	Engage Silverline through tickets and phone calls when application issues occur

o	Escalate support requests as needed

•	On-Prem:
Fill information request for policy configuration settings related to RTDs
Review support IDs for issues that appear and provide information about why the request was blocked.
Raise change request and implement changes to fix WAF policy issues reported by application teams
Build and tune WAF policies for new applications that will not sit behind the Silverline WAF service
Minimum Qualifications


2 years of DDoS appliance experience required2 years of Web Application Firewall (WAF) experience required3 years’ experience as a practicing information security professional Ability to communicate network and security issues to peers and managementAbility to manage scheduling and implementation of WAF tuning across multiple application teams in parallelAbility to read and use the results of pen test reports to enhance Web Application Firewall configurationAbility to think through problems and visualize solutions.Dependable and flexible when necessary.Experience designing/implementing secure networks and systems architectures Experience with routing protocols such as BGP, static routing, etc.Must be able to manage multiple security projects and requests simultaneouslyStrong understanding of network infrastructure and network hardware.Troubleshooting, diagnosing and resolving hardware, software, and other network and system problems.

Preferred Qualifications
