title: Business Manager
job_description:
Johnsonville products are available in retail stores in all 50 states. As a member of this sales team, you’ll be the link between Johnsonville and millions of consumers, who enjoy our sausage as part of a quick breakfast or an outdoor tailgate with friends, family and neighbors. Johnsonville relies on experienced and dedicated sales professionals to ensure our customers receive the products they need and want, and that their consumers are satisfied. As a member of our retail sales team, you’ll work closely with Johnsonville’s marketing and category management teams to develop and deliver consumer insights and category reviews that help our customers be successful. You’ll also work with our broker partners to make sure that sales strategies are fully and effectively executed, from headquarters to the retail stores. At Johnsonville, we call this delivering HICS -- Highest Impact On Customer Success.

Johnsonville, LLC

Posting

Business Manager

Chicagoland Area

Position Overview:

Johnsonville is looking for a Business Manager to join our Central Region team. At Johnsonville, we’re so obsessed with sausage that we’ve created five different regions based on where consumers live and their preferences for sausage. In this position you’d be joining our Northern Sausage Belt team that is in our “backyard” of consumers who love Johnsonville sausage. Customer responsibilities would include calling on independent retailers for AWG Kenosha and Troyer with future growth opportunities to handle additional direct customers.

Responsibilities:

Create new and different innovative programs with our retail partners to help drive our customers’ sales and profits through noticeably better products and services
Maintain current distribution, grow base and incremental sales, and gain new distribution on new product launches or current distribution opportunities
Develop and build strong relationships with customers--those in key strategic decision-making positions at headquarter level and within retail store accounts

Education:

Bachelor’s degree preferred

Experience:

Open to all levels of consumer packaged goods sales experience in the retail grocery industry, including entry-level applicants for Spring and Summer college graduates
Experience using syndicated data in selling a plus
Broker Management and/or Broker experience a plus

Skills and Competencies:

Strong understanding of how grocery retailers distributes, merchandises and promote brands
Looking for someone who is a learner and who is not afraid to make mistakes in a rapidly changing environment
“We reserve the right to get smarter. When you make a mistake, admit it and make sure you get a return on that mistake.” – Ralph C. Stayer

About our Company

Since 1945, our family-owned band of sausage-makers has invented better ways to make, eat and prepare crave-able sausage. Today, we are 2,000 Members strong. We sell our famous sausage in all 50 United States and more than 40 countries. We have a culture built on the idea that if we make developing your talents our top priority, great business results will follow naturally. We call it The Johnsonville Way. It has been our secret sauce for decades, and we hope you get to experience it for yourself!

Posting Date: May 6, 2020

Coach: Area Coach

(We don’t have bosses at Johnsonville. We have Coaches. They are there to help you develop your talents.)

Travel: 50-75% (most travel is day trips to IL, WI & IN. Overnight travel may be required)

Preferred Location: Chicagoland, IL

 (Work from home when you’re not traveling)

Member Status: Full Time, Salaried

(At Johnsonville, you are not an employee, you are a Member)

External candidates: Apply on-line only at: http://jobs.johnsonville.com

We value the diversity of our workforce and we embrace the principles of Equal Opportunity Employment. M/F/Vet/Disability

Johnsonville values the service Veterans and their family members have given to our country. We support the hiring of returning service members and military spouses.

title: Technical Product Manager, Partnerships and Alliances
job_description:
Why SecurityScorecard

SecurityScorecard's SaaS based platform enables enterprises to instantly rate and understand the security risk of companies, non-intrusively and from an outside-in perspective. We use an A-F rating scale. Companies with a C, D or F rating are 5 times more likely to be breached or face compliance penalties than companies with an A or B rating. Our platform is used by nearly 1,000 customers for use-cases including self monitoring, vendor risk management, cyber insurance, board reporting, and M&A.

Headquartered in New York City, we are funded by top investors such as Sequoia Capital, Google Ventures, NGP, Moody's, Intel, and others. Our vision is to create a new language for companies and their partners to communicate, understand, and improve each other's security posture.

About the Role:

Do you love being a customer-centric and data-driven Product Manager? Do you seek and drive excellence in yourself and others? As Product Manager for the APIs and Integrations squad, you will work closely with the Senior Product Management and the entire organization at SecurityScorecard to enable integrations that leverage Scorecard data in everyday workflows in alignment with key metrics and KPIs. You will be a key leader in our mission to help the world instantly and non-intrusively measure, collaborate and reduce the risk of any company in the world.

This role will report to our Head of Product and will be critical in enabling us to develop key partnerships with industry leaders of all markets and verticals. To be successful, you should be proactive and able to effectively translate technical specifications to business and performance metrics, while simultaneously wearing hats that may include interfacing with customers, writing and monitoring technical documentation, and any other challenges that may arise on our way to scale.

If you are a technical product manager who is excited by cybersecurity and it's impact on business risk, this role might be for you!

Key Responsibilities:

Work closely with the Partnerships and Alliances team to successfully triage and prioritize client requests according to business value and KPIs
Understand complex technical requirements and translate the customer / business value of adapting to market needs
Prioritize bugs and regressions, and equip Product Marketing and Revenue teams with collateral around how to communicate this to brand customers
Research and empathize with different customer types to translate their feedback into high-value partnerships and features
Competitor and market analysis for emerging development and technology trends a plus

Experience and Skills:

3-6+ years of technical PM or business analyst experience
Understanding of and strong interest in B2B software products and services
Ability to work well with cross-functional teams on areas like infrastructure, search quality, and machine learning in an Agile environment
Collaborative and team-oriented, with an ability to build strong working relationships across levels and departments
Metrics-driven: experience developing product management OKRs/KPIs and hitting business performance metrics
Experience working closely with data, including APIs/Integrations a plus
Experience or exposure to cybersecurity concepts and practices a plus
Experience or exposure to data science and machine learning concepts a plus

SecurityScorecard embraces diversity. We believe that our team is strengthened through hiring and retaining employees with diverse backgrounds, skillsets, ideas, and perspectives. We make hiring decisions based upon merit and do not discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
job_description:
About Us:

SentinelOne was formed by an elite team of cyber security and defense experts from IBM, Intel, Check Point, Cylance, McAfee, and Palo Alto Networks. SentinelOne is shaping the future of endpoint security through its unified, converged platform that automatically prevents, detects, and responds to threats in real-time. Our unique approach is based on deep inspection of all system processes combined with innovative machine learning to quickly isolate malicious behaviors, protecting devices against advanced, targeted threats in real time.What are we looking for?

As a Senior Product Marketing Manager, you will be a key player in the transformation of the endpoint security market. You will articulate a clear, consistent and creative value proposition for our target markets while acting as the linchpin between our sales, product teams and go-to-market message. You will have the opportunity to develop compelling go-to-market initiatives and sales enablement programs while being a part of our product positioning and messaging. You will work closely with the leaders of this organization - across product management, product marketing, sales, demand generation, corporate communications and customer success, to define and execute the strategy.Key Responsibilities:

Be the expert on the key capabilities, differentiators, benefits and use cases for target customer segments.Develop compelling messaging, product literature, website, competitive positioning, customer presentations and event presentations.Develop, gather and disseminate technical information internally and externally.Deliver content, assets and tools including blog posts, whitepapers, presentations, demos, videos, social assets, webinars, ROI tools and other market-facing materials.Identify thought leaders and topics - including research, information gathering, technical investigation, testing and publishing.Work closely across marketing teams to develop demand gen and awareness campaigns.Enable the sales, SE and channel organizations on SentinelOne capabilities and positioning.Understand sales/channel requirements and communicate the value proposition of the products to the sales team and develop the sales tools that support the selling process of the products.Regularly evaluate competitive capabilities and technologies to understand features, pricing, positioning,and packaging.Serve as a thought leader as needed with a variety of audiences including customers, analysts, field and partner teams driving a deeper understanding of the SentinelOne value proposition and our differentiation.Work closely with product management, sales and executives to develop & influence product strategy, GTM strategy.



What skills and knowledge should you bring?

Big passion for cyber-security and for creating high-impact marketing materials and campaigns. Well-versed in persona-based B2B marketing strategies.Knowledgeable about next-generation endpoint protection, cyber-security technologies (traditional antivirus, network security, firewalls, vulnerability assessment, incident response and forensics), endpoint computing platforms (especially macOS), virtualization (VmWare, Citrix), and cloud (AWS, Azure). Deep understanding of the enterprise data center, along with cloud and virtualization technologies. Of all areas listed, endpoint experience is a big plus!Business or Technical postgraduate degree. Strong written, verbal, editing and presentation skills. Highly collaborative with a deep sense of ownership and accountability. Easily builds business partnerships and inspires team member.Team player that can operate without close supervision, including working in remote locations. Conduct detailed reporting of timelines and tasks progress and completion.

Why us?

You will work on real-world problems and make an impact by protecting our customers from cyber threats. You will be joining a cutting-edge project and will be able to influence the architecture, design, and structure of our core platform. You will tackle extraordinary challenges and work with the very BEST in the industry.

Medical, Vision, Dental, 401(k), Commuter, and Dependent FSAUnlimited PTOPaid Company Assigned HolidaysPaid Sick TimeGym membership reimbursementCell phone reimbursementNumerous company-sponsored events including regular happy hours and team building events

title: Program Manager 2 - Internal Candidates Only
job_description:
OverviewTriumph Group designs, engineers, manufactures, repairs and overhauls a broad portfolio of aviation and industrial components, accessories, subassemblies, systems and aircraft structures. We partner with original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and operators of commercial, regional, business and military aircraft worldwide, to provide products and services that solve their hardest problems. So whatever the part, component or complexity of assembly, Triumph is committed to quality, service and meeting the specialized needs of each customer.

Triumph participates at all levels of the aerospace supply chain – from single components, to complex systems, to aerospace structures and their contents. We provide solutions for the entire product life cycle of an aircraft – from raw material to aftermarket service. Our unique ability to integrate a broad range of products and capabilities is our competitive advantage.ResponsibilitiesOversees and coordinates the operational aspects of ongoing programs and serves as liaison between the customer, senior leadership, functional leadership, the support team, and production management. Assesses program issues and develops resolutions to meet productivity, quality, cost, schedule, inventory and customer satisfaction goals and objectives. Responsible for managing and communicating program P&L, EAC adherence, leading cost reduction initiatives, and performing and maintaining risk and opportunity matrix for responsible programs. Develops mechanisms for monitoring program progress and for intervention and problem solving with the cross functional team, production managers, and customers. Develops and implements solutions to a variety of complex problems. Ability to successfully lead and manage cross-functional teams. May refer to established precedents and policies. Work is performed under minimal direction. Plans, schedules and arranges own activities in accomplishing objectives. Exerts influence on overall objectives and long range goals of the organization. Requires experience leading multi-functional teams and completing major projects resulting in financial savings to the organization. Must be available to travel, as needed.QualificationsInternal Candidates Only

Must have a complete understanding and application of principles, financials, concepts, practices and standards. Full knowledge of industry practices. Position requires knowledge and successful application of lean principles in a manufacturing environment.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Pocket Gems seeks to build the greatest games and most compelling interactive entertainment in the world. That's the mission our founders began with in an apartment above a pizza shop back in 2009 and it continues to inspire us today. Since then, we've grown to over 200 people in San Francisco, and with $155 million in backing from Sequoia Capital and Tencent, we're constantly breaking new ground in mobile entertainment.

Our products have been downloaded over 450 million times by players around the world. In recent years, we've launched Episode, a mobile storytelling network and platform, and War Dragons, a visually stunning 3D real-time strategy game. As our community of players continues to grow, we're committed to building diverse and inclusive environments across our teams, and in our games.

As a Product Manager at Pocket Gems, you'll help lead our games throughout the product life-cycle, from initial concept through development to release, and champion a great experience for millions of live players around the world!

What You'll Do:

Be responsible for a significant part of a free-to-play game and develop a strategic roadmap for improving the experience for thousands to millions of players
Demonstrate your passion for the mobile entertainment industry by developing new narrative experiences and/or game mechanics
Combine creativity with business impact in an entrepreneurial environment by working with world-class UX and Game Designers, Engineers and fellow Product Managers to:

Design: Write clear and concise feature specifications that solve player-facing problems and drive business impact within or across our games
Build: Wireframe and project manage new and engaging features as part of an agile product development process
Test: Set and analyze success metrics for product health, and rigorously test and optimize for them over time to deliver exceptional business results

Collaborate with the Art, Marketing, Player Experience and Content teams to create engaging, diverse, inclusive, and valuable content for our player community

What You Bring to the Product Management Team:

Education: Bachelor's degree required, preferably in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Experience: 3 or more years in the technology industry, preferably in a role similar to one of the following
Ability to take initiative and produce results with a passion for the entertainment or mobile games industry
Ability to think creatively about, and apply, the most engaging and profitable game mechanics and themes with an exceptional design mentality
Ability to apply quantitative analyses, and refine hypotheses/models by digging into user data and iteratively improving metrics
Ability to collaborate effectively with a talented team on complex projects balancing multiple stakeholders, resource constraints and deadlines
Ability to write clear and concise specs for new features

Extra Gems for:

Education: MBA or a Master's degree in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)

Pocket Gems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
Product Manager

Velodyne is building industry-leading LiDAR products that are driving the autonomous vehicles revolution. Our Product Management team works closely with customers and internal teams to drive products from concept through launch. As a Product Manager, you'll take ownership for the product, bridge the technical and business elements of the product, establish requirements and priorities, develop business plans, and bring innovative solutions to market.

Job Responsibilities

Product Ownership: Work with various internal stakeholders and customers and translate customer/market needs to MRDs and successfully close RFQs and design wins. Collaborate with internal stakeholders to develop PRDs, prioritize requirements and manage change requests. Develop a good working knowledge of the product and be recognized as a credible product owner by engineering and operations teams.
Competitive Analysis: Assess market trends and competitive threats and identify product requirements that enable sustained competitive advantage.
Business Cases: Own the creation and updates of financial business cases for products - including market models, revenues, operating expenses and COGS.
Product Launch: Serve as single point of contact for product and drive end-to-end product planning and launch of high quality products in collaboration with key stakeholders. Manage product through its lifecycle (till EOL) and drive focus on all elements of product plan-of-record – including requirements, schedule, quality and financials.
Roadmaps: Develop multi-generational, product roadmaps in collaboration with key stakeholders.
Communications: Prepare updates and presentations as needed to drive product understanding as well as adoption among customer base. Serve as a highly effective communicator to drive clarity and effective cross-functional alignment and decision making inside and outside the company, across all levels of the organization, including CXO-level.
Partner Engagement: Develop relationships with strategic partners, as needed, to enable joint solutions and/or strategic collaborations.
Customer Validation: Partner with Sales, Engineering and Operations to validate customer acceptance of launched product and use customer feedback to drive product improvements.

Required Skills and Experience

BS in EE (MS prefered) with 5-8 years Automotive Electromechanical Product Management experience based on IATF16949 Quality requirements
Functional Safety training and experience based on ISO26262
Autosar, ASPICE compliance background
Strong attention to detail, project/product management and organization skills, and ability to manage multiple projects at the same time
Demonstrated experience leading and collaborating with diverse technical and business teams to deliver complex products and solutions; ability to effectively negotiate with and influence key stakeholders in other organizations
Solid experience working with and effectively managing large customers; experience working with partners to jointly co-develop solutions
Excellent communication and presentation skills; ability to work and communicate effectively at all levels of the organization, including with CXOs/GMs and customer executives
Ability to thrive in a startup-like, fast-paced environment as well as setting up light-weight frameworks and processes to manage various elements of the product (requirements, RFQs, financials and more)
Comfortable with ambiguity and ability to take the lead and operate with minimal supervision

Preferred Skills and Experience

Experience with ADAS

title: Resource Planning Software Product Manager
job_description:
Sr Product Mgr

24-Jan-2020

Company Summary

Better software means better projects. Deltek is the leading global provider of enterprise software and information solutions for professional services, management and IT consulting, architecture and engineering, marketing and advertising agencies, government contractors and other project-based businesses. More than 23,000 organizations and millions of users in over 80 countries around the world rely on Deltek for superior levels of project intelligence, management and collaboration to research and identify opportunities, win new business, recruit and develop talent, optimize resources and streamline operations. Our industry-focused expertise powers project success by helping firms achieve performance that maximizes productivity and revenue.

For more information, visit www.deltek.com.

Auto req ID

5644BR

External Job Title

Resource Planning Software Product Manager

Position Responsibilities

We are seeking a bright, collaborative and driven individual to join our growing global Product Management Team, with a particular focus on architecture, engineering and consulting focused ERP product: Vantagepoint/Vision.

Do you have a passion for resource planning and project management and a thirst for software product innovation? You will join a team who combined have many years of experience with both the Vantagepoint/ Vision product and the architecture, engineering and consulting industries. This team is looking to invest in someone who wants to embark on a journey into strategic product management. You’ll get involved in understanding client requirements, work closely with engineering team to translate those requirements into product features and be at the forefront of innovation and learn from the very best in the market, as we aggressively drive our product and technology roadmaps forward to continue to provide a world class solution for organizations within the agency and market.

You must have proven resource planning, project scheduling and project management experience, using Vantagepoint/Vision or a similar ERP system and have a huge thirst for personal and professional growth. Not for the faint hearted, this will be a fast paced and at times, intense role, involving working with internal product experts globally with multiple demands, where you’ll be expected to use your project management experience to bring value to this challenge. Above all, you must love what you do! Below are some of the key responsibilities of this role through the lifecycle of managing requirements from inception to product release:


Create and own product requirements; establishing a business case for overall need and prioritizationPerform detailed requirement specifications for new enhancements; particularly related to the accounting, finance, tax, global compliance and multi-company/multi-currency functionalityConduct competitive analysis in order to understand the key trends in the industries served by the Vantagepoint/Vision productWork with key stakeholders across the organization to define and prioritize requirements for new features and enhancementsAssist in defining and managing incremental release plans related to product area ownership, to achieve overall roadmap visionWork with our Engineering teams to transform requirements into compelling product enhancementsWorking with our Product Marketing teams to enable the Sales and Service teams to maximize the impact of product enhancementsActively participate in product launch to gauge user adoptionAssist our customer care organization with product questions pertaining to the accounting and finance areas of the productSupport our sales and account management teams with prospect development and pursuitsDeliver presentations and training to internal groups and external customers as a part of release readiness, user groups and corporate conferences

Work Location

US Remote

Qualifications

To be successful in this role, we expect you will have at least 5 years’ experience with resource planning/project management systems working at a software vendor or as a practitioner working in an organization using a relevant ERP solution and the ability to demonstrate the following:


Knowledge of architecture, engineering and consulting organizations; market trends, operations and business driversIn-depth knowledge of project management and project scheduling processesExperience working in a project manager roleExperience operating under minimal supervision, with wide latitude for independent judgmentCommercially minded and proven success of building strong working relationships with cross functional teamsExceptional written and oral communication skills, including the ability to communicate clearly with both business and technical stakeholders’ one on one, and in groups of varying sizeAbility to formulate and present a convincing business case and product roadmap to executive managementExperience managing the complete product development lifecycle would be a plusExperience leading user focus groups to elicit requirements and formulate use cases

title: Business Development Manager
job_description:

title: Sr. Product Manager - eCommerce/Webstore
job_description:
At Bluebeam, we empower people to advance the way the world is built. We create smart software solutions that make construction sites more efficient, connected and safe and improve the lives of design and construction professionals everywhere.

In order to make the impact on our world that we desire to, we know that our people are what matters most. To fully embody our purpose requires building and developing an extraordinary team of people who are committed to the success of each of our customers and to their fellow employees.

We believe that teamwork is the ultimate long-term competitive advantage, and we hire those who can remain committed to company-wide results that create value for our customers rather than working for their own desires for power or career advancement. This means that every employee needs to be willing to roll up their sleeves alongside their fellow employees, no matter the task, to ensure the company (not just a department or individual) accomplishes its goals.

*This role is a full-time, onsite position. Due to the Corona Virus, all new employees will be required to start work remotely until we are able to return to the office. More information will be provided in the interview process.*

We hire people who:

Have integrity
See challenges as opportunities
Comfortable working with ambiguity
Are committed to continual improvement
Demonstrate trust and are willing to be vulnerable about mistakes and weaknesses
Engage in positive, productive conflict and unfiltered debate of ideas
Can fully commit to corporate decisions, even if they disagree with some of them
Hold peers accountable in order to ensure we achieve our company goals on behalf of our customers
Are laser-focused upon achievement of Bluebeam's companywide results

What we're looking for:

With a keen focus on our customer, Bluebeam is committed to improving our customer experience to make Bluebeam as easy and delightful to do business with. To this end, and in alignment with where we are heading with our longer-term product vision, we established a new team, "Customer Experience Infrastructure" (CXI), in order to build a highly integrated infrastructure to best support our customers and internal teams. The CXI team focuses on solutioning and developing systems for our front and back office customer-impacting applications. The team collaborates with cross-functional teams to conduct overall customer journey mapping and ensure we design and implement a cohesive end-to-end customer experience.

As an important member of the CXI team, the eCommerce Senior Product Manager will own the design and implementation of our e-commerce solution. You will play an important role in revamping our existing webstore to provide an amazing experience for our customers, improve the operation efficiency of your fellow Bluebeamers, and enable additional revenue stream. You'll have the chance to make an immediate impact while paving the way for future initiatives that support Bluebeam's growth around the globe. Are you in?

What you'll do:

Revamp and expand our existing webstores to boost customer experience, improve operation efficiency, enable additional revenue stream, and optimize system integrity.
Develop and maintain eCommerce roadmap leveraging feedback from both external customers and internal cross-functional teams
Leverage external vendor to drive implementation and ongoing maintenance
Partner with UX/UI group to develop best in class user experience for our customers
Support new business models and enhance existing ones by innovating on our webstore platform
Work closely with internal customers, software engineers, scrum masters, and consultants to execute on product initiatives leveraging Agile methodology
Work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to collect business requirements, research and identify end user needs, and convert business requirements into functional requirements and high-level system design
Formulate and communicate functional requirements and user stories for the technical teams

What we'd like to see in you:

5+ years of product management experiences in managing a B2B or B2C webstore
Track record in leveraging external vendors for webstore implementation, maintenance, and enhancement
Expertise in selecting and implementing new webstore platform
Working knowledge of integrating webstore platform with CRM, ERP, and other internal systems
Ability to communicate complex idea to a wide range of audience using wireframes, user stories, whiteboarding, or other similar methods
Experience in iterative software delivery methodologies – Agile, SCRUM, etc.
Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills with attention to details
Technical and analytical aptitude or background, data driven decision focus a big plus
Exceptional written/verbal communication and presentation skills
Knowledge of Salesforce.com, NetStuite, tax application, payment gateway…etc. a plus
Experience in international webstore a plus
A Bachelor's degree; Master's degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, or Information Systems a plus
…And there is no escaping the basics: flexible, likeable, well-presented, and able to work well with cross functional teams and/or with ambiguity

Tell us about yourself.

Share your resume and a cover letter that explains why you believe you'd be a fit for Bluebeam and this position.

We love a cover letter that shows us your personality, but don't stress if you're not a comedian. Just be yourself. We're mostly interested in learning who you are, what you love to do, and why you'd love to do it here with us. And if you send us the generic one you send everyone else, we'll be bummed.

About Bluebeam

The construction industry is adopting new technology at a feverish pace. Tablets and cell phones are replacing paper blueprints, drones are surveying jobsites in 3D, and cloud collaboration is changing the way teams work together. Bluebeam plays a crucial role in this transformation. The key to our success is a customer-focused approach to product development: we work with the industry to create solutions for the industry. Today, over 1.6 million people throughout the world use Bluebeam. In the US, we're a critical partner for the majority of top AEC firms, and rapidly expanding our presence globally, with offices in Sweden, Germany and the UK.

Come design and build your future with us.

Bluebeam is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or veteran status.

title: API Product Manager
job_description:
API Product Manager

Montréal, QC

We're looking for an experienced Product Manager with an internal desire of optimizing every function of the post development process that can be automized. If you're interested in helping us develop the future of fluid healthcare, this opportunity is for you.

We are building a workforce management system allowing private homecare agencies around the world manage their employees (scheduling, client health records, billing, payroll and reporting) along with exciting complementary products (mobile apps for care workers, remote patient monitoring and family portal).

Every single member of the close-knit team is committed to building the best products possible to change the homecare industry. To achieve this ambitious goal we need to optimize the developer experience to maximize 1st and 3rd party APIs adoption. Ensuring users providing over 2 million care visits a month work efficiently.

The Product Manager is responsible for supporting project teams' APIs and integrations, whilst treating APIs as products with an accompanying product life cycle.

What we are looking for in a Product Manager:

3+ years of experience in a Product role 

Demonstrated success defining and launching product integrations
API product management experience, or product experiences powered by API
Proven ability to collaborate and influence cross-functional teams
Understands how the API Product Manager role sits between two distinct groups of developers: API producers, and API consumers

Your tasks would involve:

Ensure a high-quality and consistent API developer experience
Managing the product planning and execution throughout the Product Lifecycle, including: gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements, defining the product roadmap, working closely with Engineering, Client Success, Sales and Marketing to ensure revenue and customer satisfaction goals are met.
Manage the API Roadmap, Business Priorities and Investment Trade-Offs
Defining API driven SLAs, measure performance and define improvement strategies.
Use Business metrics to communicate API benefits 

Being the point person for Product Management with clients, partners, and within the company
Build and run services that deliver API solutions
Articulate the Business Benefits of the API to the organization
Contributing to the core positioning, pricing strategy and messaging for the product 

Creating and managing ongoing relationships with API consumers 

Planning and performing API integrations
Prepare the Roadmap for API Monetization
Delivering and creating technical material

Bonus if you have:

Product management experience with B2C and B2B software products 

Software development background
Healthcare experience
Work experience in a startup environment
Working experience in Agile methodology
Experience working with relevant platform technologies and developer tools and scripting languages

title: Collaboration and Productivity Solutions Manager
job_description:
ob Title: Collaboration and Productivity Solutions Manager
Area: Information Technology - Infrastructure Service
Reports to: Director - IT Infrastructure
Classification: Exempt

Organization Overview
Rotary unites people from all continents and cultures who take action to deliver real, long-term solutions to pressing issues facing our communities. Each year, Rotary members invest more than $200 million and 16 million volunteer hours to improve lives and create positive change in the world. In exchange for hard work and dedication in support of Rotarys clubs and humanitarian initiatives, our employees receive competitive salaries, flexible schedules, comprehensive benefits, and job enrichment. To learn more, visit http://www.rotary.org.

Rotarys Commitment to Diversity
As a global network that strives to build a world where people unite and take action to create lasting change, Rotary values diversity and celebrates the contributions of people of all backgrounds, regardless of their age, ethnicity, race, color, abilities, religion, socioeconomic status, culture, sex, sexual orientation, and gender identity.
General Overview
Rotary Technologys vision is to build a smart Rotary through the power of technology. RT enables vital services through business solutions, cybersecurity, productivity and collaboration tools, and the user support, powered by a secure, stable and resilient infrastructure.
Rotary Technologys IT Infrastructure team seeks Enterprise Collaboration and Productivity Solutions Manager. This position is responsible for understanding Rotarys customer needs to lead an essential program defined by: strong architecture, user adoption, enterprise content management, business process automation, and user-centric solutions.
The ideal candidate possesses extensive technical experience delivering solutions for the Microsoft ecosystem at scale in a significant enterprise, as well as superior customer service, engagement and delivery skills. This role requires hands-on technical skills in interacting with customers to configure and implement solutions within the Microsoft Office 365 ecosystem, with a focus on SharePoint, Teams and collaborative solutions

You Will Have

Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university with coursework in computer science, information systems, business administration, or closely related field
Seven (7) years of experience managing, maintaining and implementing significant technology programs, computer system infrastructure and design, network operations, security design, and configurations and system/server administration
Five (5) years of supervisory and project personnel management experience, of which at least two (2) years should be supervisory experience over a technical team.
3 or more years of experience architecting and implementing a vision, strategy and roadmap for Microsoft and related productivity, collaboration & endpoint tools.
Preferred experience includes 



Advanced degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, etc.)
Microsoft Cloud (O365, Azure, etc.) Technology Certifications
Certifications in ITIL and an Organizational Change Management Framework (e.g. ADKAR)
Experience working on international projects
Experience working with remote project teams


The ability to communicate effectively and tactfully with all levels of stakeholders, both in verbal and written modes; able to pay close attention to detail.
A high degree of personal integrity and strong work ethic and be proficient in delivering sustained results in dynamic environments.
Ability to proactively manage risk and influence others.
Entrepreneurial drive and work ethic.
Can conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
Excellent interpersonal communications skills, including a positive and professional attitude.
Proven ability to lead business solution projects to successful conclusion with diverse teams to effectively achieve high adoption and user satisfaction of productivity and collaboration solutions

You Are Good At

Ability to clearly and effectively communicate verbally and in writing to a diverse audience.
Excellent organizational skills with high attention to detail.
A positive, team-oriented attitude with confident leadership abilities.
The ability to build and maintain positive professional relationships with project stakeholders.
A commitment to customer satisfaction with quality products or services.
Deep technical knowledge of the Microsoft 365 technology portfolio of services from the user endpoint through the Office 365 cloud services
Ability to translate complex services into an easily understandable set of user-centric capabilities
The experience to lead, measure and mature an enterprise user adoption campaign using organizational change management practices

You Will Be Responsible For
Strategy & Planning

Owns the product vision, strategy, and roadmap for collaboration, conferencing & productivity platforms.
Defines and delivers solutions using Microsoft SharePoint, Office365, Skype/Teams, Windows 10, Intune and the Microsoft 365 ecosystem.
Serves as a subject matter expert and interacts with customers, senior management, product teams, and vendor partners.
Leads modernization, digital transformation, workflow automation, and related process re-engineering efforts by educating the user community on features and capabilities through presentations and demonstrations.

Acquisition & Deployment

Oversees governance and project management activities for the productivity and collaboration product line to ensure user adoption, while simultaneously providing standardization necessary for security, compliance and discoverability.
Creates & communicates compelling end user adoption strategies.
Designing and supporting Unified Communications and Collaboration solutions using Skype, Teams and other solutions for web, video and audio conferencing, including conference room equipment and integration
Leads and develops team members, with a staff of up to 5 team members
Works with product owners, stakeholders, and developers to define and deliver high-value features.

Operational Management

Responsible for the of administration and functional capabilities of Microsoft SharePoint, Exchange, Skype/Teams, Office365, and other parts of the Microsoft ecosystem.

Working with the Endpoint team in managing end user devices using the Microsoft management tools, including PCs and mobile devices
Managing electronic content / document management tools, collaboration tools, productivity tools and business process automation tools.
Liaison with network administrators and software engineers to assist with quality assurance, program logic, and data processing.

 Attributes

Collaboration - Build partnerships and work with others to meet shared objectives.
Communication Be open to receiving ideas from diverse viewpoints and able to communicate messages so that they are universally understood.
Engagement - Foster relationships by hearing, recognizing, and valuing others.
Innovation  Move Rotary beyond traditional ways of thinking.
Adaptability  Respond to changes willingly and recognize when to adjust based on the situation.

Why work for Rotary?

Generous medical, dental, and vision benefits package
Progressive 401k matching contributions
Above market and generous paid time off package
Tuition reimbursement
Professional development opportunities
On-site cafeteria and coffee bar with special pricing for Rotary employees
Flextime-several different work schedules to choose from
Close to CTA, Metra, a variety of stores, and many food options
