title: Implementation Manager
job_description:
Skilljar is seeking a versatile and proven Implementation Manager to join our rapidly growing team at our Seattle office. This person will be working directly with our clients to enable them to successfully implement Skilljar to achieve business goals. As part of a small team, you'll have a unique opportunity to work closely with new customers to project manage the onboarding process and provide tactical and strategic guidance to achieve the quickest time to value.

We're looking for a motivated, self-starter who is comfortable wearing multiple hats and thrives in a dynamic environment. You must be nimble, highly-collaborative, and able to think on your feet. This is a great opportunity to join a rapidly accelerating startup that has dozens of Fortune 1000 and mid-market clients on its roster.Responsibilities

Proactively manage customer relationships from sales handoff to successful implementation. Understand customer use cases and provide expertise on how Skilljar can be leveraged to meet and exceed these goals.
Organize and coordinate customer onboarding and training through virtual web conferences and help documentation.
Act as a project manager by setting implementation expectations, managing project plans in partnership with customer champion(s), and coordinating customer teams to drive success through implementation.
Collect customer product requests and drive agile prioritization through Skilljar's development process. Provide ongoing recommendations and serve as the voice of the customer to internal teams.
Act as a subject matter expert of the Skilljar product to drive product adoption.
Serve as the primary contact for all customer-facing support and service issues during implementation.
Partner with Account Management, Customer Success, and Product Support teams to ensure customers are fully supported through the implementation process and beyond.
Drive KPIs to measure and support overall customer health and success during the implementation phase of the Skilljar customer lifecycle.

Requirements

Ideally looking for 2-5 years experience in an implementation or similar role, preferably in an enterprise SaaS environment.
Experience working with a smaller portfolio of large complex customers through the development and execution of multi-tiered launch strategies, or equivalent program deployments.
Possesses a fundamental understanding of project management methodologies, including scoping, strategic consulting, issue & risk identification, and communication of overall project status.
Strong knowledge of technical concepts to provide guidance with implementation and solutions to include familiarity with Single Sign-On, APIs, and other integrations.
Effective at building, maintaining, and growing relationships with senior leadership at large, established companies.
Able to effectively manage and prioritize workload to include driving implementation projects for several customers at a time while addressing each customer's unique needs.
Communicate effectively via phone, web conference, and in writing, and exceptional interpersonal skills with a broad range of external and internal teams.
Can thrive in a fast-paced, highly ambiguous environment. Startup experience a major plus.
Programming experience using HTML, CSS, and Javascript is a plus.
US work authorization and criminal background check are required.

The Company

Backed by prominent financial institutions, including Mayfield, Shasta Ventures, and Trilogy Equity Partners, Skilljar is building the Customer Education Platform of choice for mid to large-sized enterprises. Trusted by leading global enterprise organizations like Cisco and Verizon, Skilljar's SaaS platform empowers Customer Training and Enablement teams to successfully onboard, engage, and retain customers and increase product adoption throughout the customer journey. We are a team of bright, passionate Skillets with Amazon roots and startup drive. Centrally located just a few blocks from Westlake Center in downtown Seattle, the Skilljar office is a fun, perfectly-caffeinated, and creative place to be (come check out our 3-D laser printer). Apply to join us!

Skilljar is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, veteran status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status or disability (in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act) with respect to employment opportunities.

Skilljar does not accept nor are we responsible for any fees associated with unsolicited resumes, LinkedIn bios, or any other candidate introductions.

title: Director of Product Management, Data and Analytics
job_description: We’ve got a pretty good thing going on here at OpenMarket. We’re leaders of a mobile industry that's transforming the way customer obsessed businesses communicate with their customers. Join our team: we're friendly, caring, weirdly tenacious, and fun. The world’s biggest brands seek us out because we love finding ways to help them make their customers’ lives easier. It’s this obsession with customer experience that helps us develop software, technology and processes that competitors all over the world desire.We’re seeking enthusiastic, collaborative and resourceful people from a range of backgrounds who know how to get things done. Success comes from our culture, diversity and dynamic global team so we value people who are authentic, take ownership, and deliver together. Does this sound like you? Joining the OpenMarket Product Management team, you are responsible for product strategy, roadmap management and customer experience. You will be the driving force behind enabling and growing OpenMarket’s data and analytics capabilities globally; developing a comprehensive product plan supporting the product vision. You will partner with our customers to understand and incorporate customer requirements, define the competitive arena, and establish the objectives, strategies, and actions required to achieve business goals.OpenMarket delivers mobile engagement solutions around the world– and you will have a strategic role in delivering the data enablement and intelligence that serves these organizations and differentiates OpenMarket from the rest. Prioritize and lead the scope of each product release to deliver key on OKR’s on time and on budget, while balancing the needs of various departments. Craft a vision for the product, understanding competitors, defining market and customer requirements, capabilities, positioning, pricing strategy, readiness and go-to-market plan. Develop business models, pricing strategy, processes and supporting tools to efficiently support sales, billing and finance, win deals, maximize customer acquisition, expansion and renewals.Act as the main interface to Engineering for requirements definition and release planning. You will also partner with Product Marketing for effective cross functional launch of products and services.Develop relationships with strategic customers and technology partners to continually understand and develop market requirements and competitive risks and opportunities.Proactively lead and guide outcome focused initiatives to improve scalability, accessibility, data quality, data protection and customer satisfaction. Provide product expertise to customers/prospects in support of marketing, sales and implementation activities as required.Inform and collaborate with InfoSec partners to ensure data compliance, protection and efficacy.10+ years’ experience as a Product Manager delivering SaaS, software, data analytics and/or mobile services products.5+ years’ experience leading diverse, global teams.Experience and knowledge of applied machine learning, AI, predictive analytics, NLP and related microservices.Experience and/or knowledge of data enablement of SaaS platforms, applications and tools.Familiarity with bringing commercial data products to market including leading cross functional business modeling, pricing, readiness and launch efforts.Experience leading, informing and directing engineering leaders and partners on cloud, data and analytic strategies and requirements.BA/BS, Masters preferred You love being a part of a small, dynamic, and agile team that encourages you to learn and grow.You desire to work with some of the world’s top brands.You love finding solutions to interesting problems and figuring out how things work.You welcome having autonomy with complex tasks.You are passionate about using your experience and expertise to inspire the team.This position is open in Seattle, WA. Some travel is required for this position to visit with partners, customers, attend industry events, etc.  OpenMarket embraces diversity and is an equal opportunity (EEO) employer. We are unable to sponsor new U.S. work visas at this time. Employment in this position may be contingent upon successful completion of a criminal and/or credit background investigation.

title: Director Digital Product (Sally)
job_description:
OverviewOur Digital Experience and Marketing Departments at Sally Beauty Holdings (NYSE: SBH) are expanding and we will be significantly investing in our team organization and capabilities over the upcoming year! This investment at SBH can provide long term and diverse career opportunities. We’re a collaborative group of creative, motivated peers that work hard to ensure we’re putting our best ideas and beauty brands in front of our customers and stylist communities. Are you a beauty enthusiast? Do you picture yourself in a fast-paced, energetic environment? Does digital strategy and marketing fuel your creative fire? If so, we’re looking for someone just like you for our Director of Digital Product (Sally) position located at our Headquarters in Denton, TX

Act as voice of the customer to lead the evolution of SBH (Sally Beauty) digital experience via the E-commerce websites, mobile apps, and in-store platforms. Launch new features and functionality. Prioritize and manage product backlogs.Responsibilities

 Lead team and agency partners in writing requirements, epics, and user stories to execute the product roadmap, including fixes and enhancements.
 Effectively communicate system issues or points of customer friction and drive to timely resolution.
 Actively partner with Ecommerce, IT, Marketing, Customer Engagement, Analytics, and agency teams to develop features that drive customer acquisition, engagement, conversion, and satisfaction.
 Drive conversion rate on the site by responding to critical needs and concerns of external and internal customers, including the ecommerce team and customer service.
 Prioritize and manage product backlog and priotities for site releases.
 Ensure team roadmap helps achieve ecommerce business goals.
 Help your team prioritize, negotiate, and remove obstacles to ensure quality product launches.
 Lead team in testing and conducting UAT on all digital features.
 Build out project plans, resource/budget estimates, timelines and resourcing.
 Serve as the subject matter expert across the digital commerce systems.
 Track performance, identify improvement areas, and communicate with service providers to troubleshoot.
 Map out and understand the end-to-end customer journey and the associated KPIs, identifying any client friction points and finding ways to solve them.
 Identify gap areas, set ecommerce excellence targets and ensure that all relevant SLAs are in place.
 Develop business cases as needed for new strategic initiatives.

Qualifications

10 years of relevant experience, including 6 years of modern product management experience preferred
An excellent communicator
A strong problem-solver with excellent leadership, negotiation, and decision making skills
Driven by your eye for detail and great design taste
Well-versed in strategic business concepts

Our culture links actions to results with a Can-Do Attitude that always puts our customers’ and stylists’ needs first. We work together, acting as one and holding ourselves accountable to deliver the best possible results. As innovators in the beauty industry, we emphasize open communication, always seeking new approaches and fostering professional growth. We acknowledge that every team player makes a difference, and it is our shared vision and positive culture that unites us.

We offer a competitive salary, medical, dental, vision and 401(K) along with a free on-site salon, a Sally’s store, on-site gourmet café and discounted dry cleaning.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, or disability.

title: Program Manager
job_description:
Why CareATC: We are a leading innovator in the health technology sector providing on-site and shared-site medical clinics. By leveraging groundbreaking technology, CareATC offers customized population health management solutions for employers that reduce healthcare costs by promoting health, preventing disease and providing a shorter path to care. CareATC manages more than 150 clients in 36 states and cares for more than 255,000 patients. CareATC is based in Tulsa, Oklahoma.

Care to be Different: CareATC is the first provider of on-site clinics to achieve 100% network accreditation from Accreditation Association of Ambulatory Health Care, Inc., earn the Evidence-Based Design Accreditation from the EDAC Advisory Council and be Net Promoter Certified. In our unique model, CareATC contracts directly with the employer and does not engage in traditional fee-for-service healthcare. Instead, we have created an environment that allows medical providers and their clinical staff to focus on wellness while eliminating the burden of managing the financial aspects of the clinic. Billing and reimbursement hassles don't exist at CareATC. Our providers work closely with their patients to initiate preventative measures and encourage good health.

Why Program Manager at CareATC: Are you a strategic leader? Do you have excellent client relationship? Have you managed multiple clinics/locations? If you said yes, keep reading.

The Program Manager is responsible for executing the business development strategy and strengthen client development & retention by demonstrating effective communication, presenting statistical reporting and aligning the clients vision with ours to ensure success. The Program Manager has concurrent responsibilities of: client account liaison, developing and maintaining client relationships and clinical management, managing the day-to-day coordination and efficient operation of our healthcare program(s) ensuring the delivery of quality service.

Oversee the West Region:

Utah, Washington, Oregon and California

What you will be responsible for:

Manages overall delivery of CareATC services by developing relationships and providing support and guidance to existing and potential customers to ensure continued partnership.
Leads cross functional multi-partner team to shape the overall success of the initiative by managing implementation activities for new clients.
Demonstrates regard for the right of all patients and personnel and provides respectful and considerate care focused on improving the business aspects of health care operations and the quality of the health care provided.
Demonstrates management skills to orient, schedule and coordinate staff.
Effectively collaborates with administrative staff and physicians to optimize efficiency of a variety of related services ranging from inpatient care to outpatient follow-up care.
Participates in staff human resource planning and decisions, including hiring, training, supervision, and evaluating personnel and their work.
Develops budgets including recommendations for equipment outlays.
Identifies and resolves operational problems using defined processes, expertise and judgment.
Investigate first-level customer service issues as identified within area of expertise and communicate resolution to the client.
Maintains ongoing client contact via calls and meetings (weekly/monthly/quarterly) to discuss utilization, PHAs, marketing, reporting, operational and financial needs, wellness programs, new program development.
Annual Activities- Health plan performance reviews, Aggregate PHA results, formulary review, strategic planning, health/benefit fairs, employee meetings.
Coordinates in-services with client, health insurance providers and wellness center staff to support ongoing improvements and new initiatives.
Monitors, understands and communicates utilization and service quality, patient satisfaction surveys, and complaints.

You may be a fit if:

Ability to live within the Region
3-5 years of leadership experience strongly preferred
BS, BSN or other clinical degree strongly preferred
Current CPR or BLS certification
3 plus years of clinical experience with business/management responsibilities
Ability to travel and work at multiple locations upon the business need

title: Experienced Manufacturing Manager
Sales Account Manager 4
job_description:
About VERITAS

Veritas solves what no one else can. With an industry-leading product portfolio, we offer proven, modern, and integrated technology that brings together availability, protection, and insights. Our Veritas Enterprise Data Services Platform addresses current and future data issues end-to-end – keeping mission-critical workloads highly available, protecting data everywhere, and providing insights to optimize costs and maintain regulatory readiness.

Veritas supports 500+ data sources, 150+ storage targets, 50+ clouds, and any deployment model imaginable. We serve 99% of the Fortune 100, 90% of the Fortune 500, and are the market leader in Software-defined Storage, Data Protection, and Archiving.

Veritas’ Worldwide Field Operations (WFO) propels company growth by driving all aspects of new business and channel sales and includes global sales operations and global sales enablement for all new business and renewal sales.

The successful candidate should be located within the greater Connecticut market place.

About VERITAS

Veritas' vision is to enable organizations to thrive in this new world of digital business.

Did you know that the International Data Corporation (IDC) predicts that data will double every 2 years, reaching 44 zettabytes by 2020? That's more bytes than gallons of water in the ocean and an exponentially growing problem for businesses. Veritas helps organizations harness the power of their data & turn it into actionable insights.

We believe information is everything! Data is an organization's digital currency; a critical business asset that is growing in value. We are the only company that provides a data management platform to address the core challenge of accessing, managing, and analyzing all of their data, no matter where it is, in real-time - allowing organizations to truly maximize the value of their data.

Veritas is currently looking for motivated individuals who not only do but are also leaders who influence change and make a difference. The team is always looking for passionate, dedicated individuals who are self-motivated in their work and careers.

Veritas' vision is to enable organizations to thrive in this new world of digital business.

Did you know that the International Data Corporation (IDC) predicts that data will double every 2 years, reaching 44 zettabytes by 2020? That's more bytes than gallons of water in the ocean and an exponentially growing problem for businesses. Veritas helps organizations harness the power of their data & turn it into actionable insights.

We believe information is everything! Data is an organization's digital currency; a critical business asset that is growing in value. We are the only company that provides a data management platform to address the core challenge of accessing, managing, and analyzing all their data, no matter where it is, in real-time - allowing organizations to truly maximize the value of their data.

Veritas is currently looking for motivated individuals who not only “do” but are also leaders who influence change and make a difference. The team is always looking for passionate, dedicated individuals who are self-motivated in their work and careers.

Veritas Worldwide Field Operations Organization (WFO)

The WFO team is critical to Veritas’ success. This group engages with the customer from the first contact of discussing how Veritas can support the key business challenges through to implementation of the solution to supporting the technical teams internally. The WFO culture is about winning, being ambitious and putting our customers first. The organization is focused on building solutions that offer that true value to the customers. The Leadership teams lead by example, inspiring and motivate all those in the organization. We have bespoke world-class enablement programs built for Sales, Pre-Sales, Customer Services, Consultants and Technical Support as we firmly believe that our talent is key to our success

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Sell the Veritas offerings and/or services by developing relationships with decision-makers and individuals within a specified geographically defined territory to drive new businessQualify, develop and close sales for Veritas with cooperation with the inside sales teams, the channel team, and partners.Responsible for creating focused territory & close plans to nurture, develop and close opportunities to drive your revenue targetsDevelop key strategies to create a strong virtual team/resources to maximize sales within the assigned territoryUnderstands the client-supplier ecosystem and builds partnerships where appropriate to deliver against objectives.Act as the primary field sales contact for those customers/partners representing VeritasWork closely with your aligned Inside Sales representative to generate meetingsDevelops strong relationships with customer contacts at an executive level to gain insight into the business imperatives and IT drivers enabling the development of a strategy to sell Veritas solutions.Engages effectively with other areas of the business: TSS, Channel, Inside Sales, Sales Specialists, PR, Sales Operations and marketingActively build a strong network of contacts within partner companiesAccountable for meeting assigned Sales QuotaMeets or exceeds discount/profit margin goals.Provide accurate forecasts and reports on activity and sales performance as and when required by management.Ensure full compliance with all internal processes.

EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS:

Proven track record of sales experience in the hi-tech industry (preferably software) developing strategic customer relationships.Extensive successful demonstrable experience in a field sales role.High levels of achievement against quota and experience selling to the executive & CxO level customer, preferably in the high-tech industry.Proven ability to articulate a portfolio selling across products, solutions, and services.Demonstrates strong sales skills and a high level of technical and business acumen in both our industry and industry being sold into.Demonstrates a breadth and depth of knowledge that arrived through exposure to complex business situations.Ability to map Veritas offerings against customer needs and to identify new opportunities within your territory Accounts.Understands the importance of account plans and clearly utilizes them to drive successHas an understanding of operational cadence in their specific areasEnsures operating within compliance from a process, legal and revenue recognitionDemonstrable over achievement in all areas – personal, quota and developmentExposure to the Veritas offerings would be desirable but not necessary; background in positioning infrastructure softwarePresents themselves in a professional manner, being a representative of their organization

At Veritas, we care about the causes close to your heart and enable you to volunteer, donate, and do good. We also value uniqueness and know that a more diverse and inclusive workforce makes a winning team, so come as you are! Interested? Then apply and find out more about #TeamVTAS!

title: Technical Project Manager
job_description:
OverviewWe are seeking a Technical Project Manager in Reston, Virginia to support the management and sustainment of mobile network components and services. We are looking for an individual who is a natural leader of project teams, having an instinctual understanding of the stakeholder’s requirements with an ability to scope and deliver accordingly while motivating the project team to execute.ResponsibilitiesWhat you’ll do…

Develop project plans and schedules, manage teams to timelines & milestones, identify & mitigate risks, resolve interdependencies, remove obstacles for project teams, communicate regular status updates, and serve as the primary interaction point with project stakeholders
Ensure teams align with strategic roadmaps for key capabilities
Simultaneously lead and manage large international projects across multiple countries both remotely and in person
Monitor and manage the all activities and critical path tasks to ensure on-time solution delivery and cross-team, cross organizational coordination and communication
Work closely with multiple internal departments, external vendors and telecom operators to implement sustainable business processes
Work directly with customers on technical integration of mobile services
Work closely with marketing teams to assure proper messaging for our solution offerings
Build and maintain internal and external relationships at all levels – from engineers to executives
Willingness to travel up to 10% of the time

QualificationsYou’d be a great fit if…

Have a bachelor’s degree in IT, Engineering, or other technical related field
Have your PMP certification
Have practical experience with:



Managing complex multimillion-dollar programs and projects
Working in an international telecom environment
Working directly with global mobile network operators


Strong management skills with the ability to coordinate and manage team members in diverse locations:



10+ years overall technical experience
5+ years of Project and Program Management experience
5+ years in international product deployment of telecom services
5+ years experience working with international mobile operators


Have technical knowledge of:



General knowledge and operational understanding of GSM, UMTS, LTE technologies
Basic understanding of mobile network signaling operations is preferred.
Microsoft project
Agile development methodologies


Have the personal skills with:



Multi-cultural business environment; including field deployment, acceptance processes and support services
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with proven expertise in managing international teams
Be a self-starter able to work in a fast pace environment with minimal direction.
Have the ability to work independently on complex problems and collaborate across cross functional teams



It would be even better if you…

Experience using Jira to manage development teams
Enjoy researching solutions to complex problems by analyzing telecommunication markets, standards, and technologies.

About PeratonAt Peraton, we’re at the forefront of delivering the next breakthrough in national security, every day. We’re the partner of choice to help solve some of the world’s most daunting challenges. How? By thinking differently. We’re not mired in the past. We look at all problems with fresh eyes. We look past the obvious to bring the best talent, tech, and ideas together to completely transform how problems are solved. So bring your unique ideas, your entrepreneurial spirit, and your drive to succeed. Get ready to be part of something bigger. title: Program Manager
job_description:
Optimal Solutions & Technologies (OST, Inc.) is focused on excellence. We specialize in providing Management Consulting, Information Technology, and Research Development and Engineering services. OST is one of an elite set of companies worldwide to be externally appraised CMMI Level 5.
The fundamental distinction of the OST team is its business knowledge in both the public and private sectors. We serve the aerospace & transportation, association & nonprofit, defense, education, energy, financial, healthcare, and technology & telecommunications industries. OST is successful because we listen to our clients, we learn from our clients, and we know our clients.
Description of specific Duties in a typical workday for this position:

Responsible for the daily management of a professional team providing Operations and Maintenance (O&M), application development, enhancement, and operations. The PM is responsible for directing resources, managing workload, providing status updates, and providing consultation on effective and efficient performance of responsibilities. The PM also coordinates among multiple internal and external stakeholders to influence and track schedule adherence.
This position requires a self-starter who interfaces with multiple projects on an ongoing basis. The individual in this role relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. This position mentors junior staff members and requires the ability to maintain staffing levels (i.e., staff retention, hiring). As the PM, maintaining good communications and a strong working relationship with the client for identifying and mitigating risks and issues are of the utmost importance.
Ensure timely hiring of qualified personnel in accordance with contract requirements
Ensure timely performance of work in accordance with contract requirements
Establish and disseminate performance standards, and provide necessary training to the client and provide guidance in support of performance standards
Ensure Contract personnel meet performance and professional standards in terms of work habits, quality of work, dress, and behavior
Provide overall quality assurance guidelines to Contract staff
Correct deficiencies in a timely manner
Ensure timely submission of deliverables defined in associated task orders
Provide weekly, monthly, and quarterly reporting to the customer
Drive effective performance and continuous improvement
Define and maintain a culture of accountability
Outstanding leadership and organizational skills
Excellent communication skills
Excellent problem-solving ability
Develop additional services and funding

Position Requirements:


Requires a bachelor's degree in a related area
Project Management Professional (PMP) or PgMP Certification from the Project Management Institute (PMI)
At least five (5) years of experience in managing an O&M, application development, enhancement, operations and program management.
Has technical background in IT programs that contain multiple subsystems
Experience with deliver of products that meet the functional and non-functional requirements
Experience with management, workforce utilization and supervision of employees of various labor categories and skills
All candidates should also possess excellent oral and written English communication skills; strong organization and time management skills; and the ability to problem-solve and apply policies and procedures to resolve complex situations.
Experience working with Microsoft Windows, Outlook, Word, Excel, Project, and PowerPoint is required.

Nice to Have:


Experience with integration management processes and the release and build management processes
Experience presenting material to senior Government officials
Masters degree in a related area
Experience working within a federal government environment

This is a full time position paying a base salary, full benefits, and has possible bonus potential based on merit and performance. To be considered for this position, please apply online with a cover letter and MS Word resume.
OST is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants are considered for positions without regard to race, religion, gender, native origin, age, disability, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

title: Associate Product Manager
job_description:
About the Role

Avidity Science is currently recruiting for an Associate Product Manager. The ideal candidate for this position is a college graduate interested in gaining experience in marketing, product development, business strategies, product management, and customer service. Great opportunities for professional development and career growth. The role of the Associate Product Manager is to assist in the development and maintenance of product lines throughout their lifecycle, along with being involved to support the development of product roadmaps, pricing strategies and marketing plans. This role will also support the on-boarding initiatives for new products, which will include cross-functional coordination and direct customer interactions to ensure smooth transitions through product evaluations to customer adoption of new products.

Key job responsibilities will include:

Assist in the development of short and long-term product strategies to grow product line and market share while supporting the business initiatives complete with market potential and competitive analysis.Assist in the development of detailed, three-year growth projections per product line complete with supporting information.Support Marketing Communications with the development of brand strategy, positioning, and messaging campaigns for assigned product lines.Review all product line sales and marketing materials and provide updates to intercompany functional departments on a regular basis.Evaluate opportunities within product line in other industries/markets.Provide sales support to achieve maximum value for product line and Avidity Science. Assist in the management and prioritization of product enhancements and new product introductions designed to grow the product line.Assist in the management of products throughout their entire lifecycle, assist in the development of roadmaps, and communicate updates quarterly.Assist in the development and evaluation of pricing and margin strategies per product line.Support the Avidity Science brand by managing the product line hierarchy, product classifications, and product naming schemes.Support the on-boarding process for new products to include specific actions as outlined by the Senior Product Manager

Position Requirements/Preferences

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business or related field or equivalent experience and 1 - 3 years’ experience in marketing, market research, and/or product development or a combination of education and experience is preferred.

Benefits

With nearly of 70 years of success, Avidity Science is a worldwide leader that maintains the small, family feel within the culture of the company. Offering a competitive benefit package that includes a profit sharing bonus, Avidity Science is also community-minded with several charity partnerships and offers employee action committees focused on wellness, community involvement, safety, and ideas for improving business.

title: Senior Product Owner
job_description:
Senior Product Owner @ Sitka

Sitka Technology Group is the leading provider of custom software solutions for conservation and natural resource management. We are seeking an experienced product owner / technical product manager to join our team. The successful candidate will get to work on cutting-edge web, mobile, and cloud applications that help manage natural resources.

This is a full-time, senior-level position with responsibility to oversee all aspects of delivering custom software systems. The successful candidate for this position will begin as a team lead and technical product owner, with a roadmap to take on account management accountabilities.

In this customer-facing role, you will be charged with actively managing client relationships and strategically guiding the development process. Core competencies will focus on clearly analyzing and defining objectives, managing technical and budget risk, communicating progress, and creatively solving issues. Working side-by-side with the development team, you will be integral in developing and enhancing Sitka products and services.

Core Requirements

The successful applicant will likely have 6-10 years of relevant job experience and at least two years of experience with agile software development practices. Applicants will be considered based on demonstrated ability to:

Lead a team of developers and analysts through delivery of multiple concurrent agile software projectsCollaborate with internal/external stakeholders and your team on vision, strategy, and road mappingBe passionate about understanding and improving processes by designing and building great software solutions to address client needs and expectationsFacilitate design sessions to design, analyze, and improve existing and new business processes.Focus on software quality and managing deliverable scope, timing, and performance expectationsMentor and advocate for your team of developers and analystsContinuously strive for improved customer satisfaction and stronger client relationshipsEmbrace technical writing, authoring clear, concise, and engaging content such as emails, reports, marketing material, and release notes

Nice-to-Haves

Experience in professional services consulting environmentDirect experience in the environmental services / natural resource management arenaExperience working with financial systemsExperience working with federal, state, or local government organizationsUnderstanding of spatial data, including mapping, GIS, spatial analysisData visualization and analysis experience

Benefits

Competitive compensation based on experience $114K - $124KFlexible hours with PTOFully paid medical, vision and disability coverage for employeeRetirement planProfit sharingPerformance incentive plan once the roll transition into a leadership positionProfessional development opportunitiesPost Shelter at Home Order


Team eventsIn building gym, bike locker and showersStocked kitchen with unlimited espresso and tea



COVID 19 Consideration

Following the recommendations of health professionals and government agencies, all Sitka team members are currently working from home. This position will begin as a fully remote position. When recommendations change and a safe working environment can be maintained, team members (including this position) will return to working from the Portland office. Applicants who are not currently in the Portland area will be considered if demonstrating an earnest intent to relocate when feasible.

In Your Cover Letter

Please include a brief discussion detailing how you would build rapport and trust with a fully remote team. How will you ensure quality communications, mentorship and accountability? Cover letters missing this discussion may not be considered.

If you are ready to meet your next challenge and do something positive for the world you live in, we look forward to hearing from you! All we need is a copy of your resume and a brief cover letter telling us why you would fit into the Sitka culture to get the ball rolling.

Sitka Technology Group is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant for employment because of age, gender, sexual orientation, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, veteran status, or disability.

Job Title: Product Manager - Questa Verification IP - 195380

Job Location: USA - CA - Fremont or USA - OR - Wilsonville or USA - CO - Longmont

Job Category: Product Management
Job Description:

In the role of Verification IP Product Manager, you will be part of a global organization directly responsible for the product management of verification IP products and solutions, reporting to the Product Management Group Manager. Specifically, as a Verification IP Product Manager, you will be responsible for implementing programs and initiatives that align with the business strategy for Mentors IC Verification Solutions organization. The Questa Verification IP product line is experiencing rapidly growing interest, and is poised for even faster business growth.

As a Verification IP Product Manager, you will be responsible for the helping to implement product strategies, including assembling product road maps and detailing development priorities. You will work closely with customers, key industry and academia technologists, Product Engineering, R&D, and key Mentor technologists to implement programs to improve

business in this product line. You will need to be able to align product line strategies into programs, initiatives, and tactics.

Experience in understanding, detailing and prioritizing customer requirements into business, product and promotional plans is a plus.

A successful candidate will have a strong desire and passion for working with customers, account teams, distributors, internal groups and other industry specialists to maximize our business in the semiconductor and systems market segments.

You will need to effectively connect with multiple levels of organizations, from engineers to managers when gathering requirements and promoting our solutions to customers. Driving collaboration is a requirement along with the ability to indirectly influence others within marketing, engineering and sales, across divisions and with 3rd party partners.

An optimal candidate will also have practical exposure to SoC and IP design processes, as well as cutting edge functional verification tools and methodologies, with specific emphasis on the differences between SoC andIP level verification. The candidate will have an appreciation of the challenges and evolving use-models that are unique to verification IP.Key Responsibilities

Develop relationships with appropriate early adopter customers/partners based on business alignment. Implement partnerships to support the business goals of ICVS.Support PR and sustaining outbound marketing strategy collateral with partners.Collect, update, and maintain competitive information.Support collaboration with other complementary product groups.Develop business relationships with strategic customers and account teams. Implement plans to ensure sales engagement and business success.Assemble 1-3 year road maps. Support collateral priorities including new product introduction and business introduction presentations.Implement launch tactics for new products and technologies as needed. Support messaging, positioning, and communicating to the industry for awareness and to the field for sales effectiveness.Support messaging, positioning, and communicating at conferences, and implement requirements and priorities for collateral generation.

Job Qualifications:Key Requirements

The ideal candidate will bring a mixture of business and technical skills to the position of Verification IP Product Manager, plus -Demonstrated ability in design and/or verification IPFunctional experience in product marketing and product managementAbility to implement initiatives, programs, and tactics that align to strategyStrong written and verbal skills with the ability to communicateKnowledge of and exposure to verification tools and methodologiesSelf-starter with the ability to quickly learn and apply new conceptsWilling to travel 25% of the time, including occasional international travel

Preferred

Experience in both field and divisional organizations. Understands both perspectives.Experience in the sales process of sophisticated systems. Understands the elements of selling.Familiarity in product life cycle management, including Crossing the Chasm from early adoption into the mainstream.

Qualified

Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States.

Qualified Applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now

or in the future for employment in the United States.

title: Product Manager
job_description:
The Opportunity

Want to work for a company where you can have a genuine impact, be passionate about what you do, and work with a great team of people? At FastSpring, we work hard while keeping a fun, collaborative, and casual atmosphere. Headquartered in downtown Santa Barbara, our offices are just a few minutes from great restaurants, shops and the beach. If you're highly driven and want to work at an exciting, fast-growing e-commerce software company, consider joining the FastSpring team. We offer a dynamic work environment, competitive compensation, growth opportunities, benefits and more for the right candidate.

The Position

FastSpring is looking for a very strong strategic and analytical leader to help drive product innovation that accelerates the pace of growth for the business. FastSpring has enjoyed tremendous success and is well positioned for the future. This Product Manager role will be responsible for executing the product strategy by discovering and delivering winning solutions that solve unmet needs, delights customers, and drive business growth. This position will work cross-functionality with various teams and executives to identify market growth opportunities, prioritize features, and execute go-to-market strategies. This role will report to the head of product who reports to the CEO. This position is based in Santa Barbara, CA.

Responsibilities

Work with the head of product and leadership team to define the product vision and strategy for the business.Define, evangelize, and execute a product roadmap that expands product capabilities, drives growth, and increases operational efficiency.Identify and prioritize new product opportunities based on internal and external research and deep understanding of customer challenges and market trends.Work closely with a dedicated agile development team to define user stories, research appropriate technical solutions, coordinate delivery, and drive adoption.Gather and synthesize user feedback from various inputs to identify, prioritize, and champion new product opportunities to drive business outcomes.Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to develop business cases for new product development ideas, lead the prioritization of these ideas, and work to gain alignment across the business.Develop a deep understanding of the market and our users by interviewing customers and stakeholders, conducting competitive analysis, and keeping abreast of industry news and trends.Rigorously test and validate new ideas, present fact-based rationale for product prioritization initiatives, and establish and measure success metrics.Collaborate with engineering, design, and other teams to drive innovation for FastSpring that ensures we continue to deliver the leading full-service ecommerce platform for digital products in the world.

Qualifications

5-10 years in ecommerce, payments, and/or software1-3 years of product management experienceProblem solver with exceptional analytical skills. 80/20 thinker that is able to quickly prioritize and be tactical about getting to impact fastAbility to work and create structure out of an undefined environment and make recommendations quicklyExceptional communicator (written, verbal and presentation); able to quickly synthesize and communicate complex information to a wide range of audiences.Experience leading cross-functional teams to deliver measurable impactAbility to excel in a fast-paced environment, juggling multiple high priority tasks at onceAbility to communicate clearly and interact daily with executives on key strategic topicsExperience working directly in or on tools related to ecommerce or sales efficiency (e.g., CPQ tools)Experience with some aspects of payments including payment processors and gateways, acquiring banks, card networks, authorizations, and settlements is preferred

About the Company

FastSpring is the trusted ecommerce partner for companies that sell software around the world. With FastSprings full-service ecommerce solution, you can sell more, compete big, and stay lean. Founded in 2005, FastSpring is a privately owned company headquartered in Santa Barbara with offices in Nebraska and Amsterdam. For more information, please visit https://www.fastspring.com.

FastSpring is an EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY/AFFIRMATIVE ACTION employer. Candidates are considered for employment with FastSpring without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, pregnancy, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military status, veteran status (specifically status as a disabled veteran, special disabled veteran, Vietnam Era veteran, recently separated veteran, armed forces service medal veteran, or other protected veteran) or other classification protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

title: Technical Product Manager
job_description: ABOUT 4C:4C is building the leading self-service intelligence platform for marketers to drive business outcomes across closed ecosystems. Brands, agencies, and media owners around the world trust Scope by 4C™ to surface insights about their most valuable consumers and creatives, and activate them across channels and devices. With over $2 billion in annualized advertising spend running through Scope, 4C bridges linear television, streaming video, digital commerce, and social media. This position will be located in the US. This individual will have responsibility for understanding, documenting client requirements with detailed use cases, product requirements, and functional specs as well as communicating with engineering teams, driving implementation and customer on-boarding, and training client teams. RESPONSIBILITIES:Be part of the 4C product team and serve as the primary liaison between 4C Product-Engineering and Client Product-Engineering-Ad Sales team to bring the cross-screen advanced TV and digital video product to market.Understanding, gathering, documenting, and communicating product requirements effectively to cross-functional teams and facilitate feature, and product roadmap prioritizationPartner with Client Design/UX team to provide input on product design to ensure it meets business and consumer needsDrive customer and internal stakeholder communications as well as training (including Sales, Marketing, Engineering & QA) as the product line interfaceManage and complete tasks associated with the following by working with cross-functional teams:Requirements definition, review, prioritization, and implementation planningGain client, customer and sales validation during planningQA releases as product owner acceptanceFeature/function roadmap: reviews across product line, collaborate with other senior cross-departmental team members to drive implementationPost-launch monitoring of product ROI and customer feedback: Track PBIs and prioritize course corrections for the productOthers, as assigned.EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENT:BS/BA in Engineering or Computer Science. MBA preferred.2-4 years of applied professional experience in Product Management and Project Management1-2 years experience in the linear TV and/ or in the Digital Video advertising space.Strong understanding of Digital Video media buying and selling, programmatic advertising technology solutionsExperience with TV viewership data and BI tools such as Tableau is a plus.Capacity to work in a fast-paced environment. Ease with ambiguity is necessary.Highly developed organizational, planning and analytical capabilities with tactical execution.WE OFFER:We offer a challenging job in a dynamic international environment. At 4C you have the opportunity to make an impact. We are proud of our open and informal culture. We offer a comprehensive benefits package. The salary will be commensurate with experience.

title: Identity and Access Manager
job_description:
Position Purpose/Summary:The Identity and Access Manager’s role is responsible for the day-to-day operations and coaching of the Identity and Access Management team. This is an active, hands-on position, responsible for the planning, design, development, support identity and access management function and all its components. Team responsibilities include: provisioning of user accounts for onboarding employees and requested non-employees; processing of changes to account security requirements as approved by management; assistance to users as required; maintenance of security infrastructure, including software and user directories; processing of user terminations; reporting on provisioning activities; automation of provisioning; multifactor authentication.

*Supervises: Identity and Access Management Analysts

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:All duties and responsibilities align with Visions Federal Credit Union and are subject to reform at-will of the company. Job Duties include, but are not limited to:

Manage and lead the identity and access management team, ensuring prompt, efficient, and accurate resolution of identity and access matters.Involvement in projects as needed as determined by the scope and related to the job function.Provisioning and deprovisioning of user and service account access to all Visions’ systems.Centralization of user access maintenance.Creation and maintenance of processes and documentation required for user provisioning and deprovisioning.Ensures access is provisioned and deprovisioned timely and accurately.Must be adaptable to changes in the work environment, comfortable with multiple competing demands and able to deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events in a calm and logical manner.All employees must embrace and foster an environment that supports our mission and core competencies.Perform other job-related duties as assigned.Manages and monitors systems associated with identity and Access management solutions; provides incident and problem management support.Assesses current environment and makes continuous improvement to align with future state architecture.Develops and maintains IAM artifacts (strategy, decision, solution design, etc.)Develops, participates and documents standard operating procedures, best practices and technical documentation in a shared repositoryProactively works with technology and product managers to identify potential issues and ensures effective remediationDemonstrate advanced understanding of business processes, internal control risk management, IT controls and related standardsIdentify and evaluate complex business and technology risks, internal controls which mitigate risks, and related opportunities for internal control improvementUnderstand complex business and information technology management processesLead the architecture and design of identity solutions for the enterprise in a highly complex environment with a blend of legacy and innovation platformsCreate a sustainable maintenance cycle for existing solutions to ensure solutions are up to date and technical solutions are fully leveraged / utilized. Develop and maintain technology roadmap and refresh cycles. Rationalize overlapping tools on a periodic basis based on updates to product capabilities.Directs the planning, implementation/development, and operations of the overall IAM team, processes, architecture, and tools/technology.Create and execute on a strategic multi-year roadmap for IAM, including governance and oversightAcquire and manage the necessary resources to support all IAM functions, including leadership support, financial resources, and key security personnel, to support Information Security (IS) goals, and reduce overall organizational risk.Advise senior management on IAM-related risks and security posture.Ensure overall IT strategy and architecture plans and standards are translated into IAM service programs, methods and technologies as they align with leading IAM practices.Align IAM security priorities with the organization’s security strategy informed by current understanding of what IAM leaders are doing across the healthcare industry.Overall responsibility for architecture, planning and delivery of enterprise-level IAM program. (Identity, access, privileged access, SSO federation, cloud)Represent IAM services and strategies to key influencers and stakeholders across IT and business teams to ensure maximum effectiveness of the IAM program.Plan and manage IAM budgets and forecasts, as well as reporting dashboards that align with service delivery guidelines.Manage, coach, lead and develop a staff of IAM personnel.Oversee identification of opportunities to enhance performance (productivity and efficiency) of the IAM program (people, process and technology) and reduce costs.Monitor the design and deployment of IAM technologies, solutions and service delivery processes.Monitor overall forecasts and spend with IAM Service Providers.Must be adaptable to changes in the work environment, comfortable with multiple competing demands and able to deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events in a calm and logical manner.All employees must embrace and foster an environment that supports our mission and core competencies.Perform other job-related duties as assigned.

Standard Essential Physical Functions:The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Daily requirements may include (but are not limited to):

Ability to stand/walk as needed, sitting for majority of day.Able to lift/carry up to 20 pounds; may be required to climb, stoop, bend.Manual dexterity for working with papers, files, various office machines, keyboarding, etc. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.Minimal travel may be required for this position.


Essential Knowledge, Skills,& Abilities:Due to the nature of this role in dealing with senior management and employees on an on-going basis, the position requires (and is not limited to):

Excellent interpersonal and communication skillsEfficient time management and organizational skillsFlexibility (able to adapt to changing environment)Positively communicate with diverse employee population while providing excellent customer serviceAdvanced computer and math skills, adherence to confidentiality, detail-orientedProven experience in overseeing the planning, design, development, and implementation of projects or tasks of this size.Extensive knowledge of systems and role based access methodologies to build proper processes around access provisioning and deprovisioning.

Education& Experience: We pride ourselves in our advocacy for education, growth, and opportunity for experience at Visions Federal Credit Union. This position would minimally require a bachelor’s degree in the field of computer science, information science, management information systems, business administration, or engineering, or equivalent education& experience, along with 7 years related work experience. Additional certifications are also preferred although not necessary provided adequate proven documentation of abilities.

Usual Work Environment/Equipment Used: This position operates in a professional office environment, with expectation to use standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines, PCs, Microsoft Office, etc.

title: Senior Technical Product Manager - Security
job_description:
Blink Health is fixing how broken, opaque, and unfair healthcare is. We're a well-funded healthcare technology company on a mission. We're changing healthcare through technology and transparency. With our proprietary technology, everyone now has access to the lowest prices on over 15,000 medications. But there is more work to do.

We are a continuously learning, curious, collaborative team dedicated to inventing new ways of working in an industry that historically has resisted innovation. We're assembling an experienced and talented team to get this done.

We are looking for an experienced Senior Technical Program Manager (TPM) to tackle complex and ambiguous problems that span numerous systems. The TPM role is critical for having technical program management skills to manage business and technical workstreams, leadership/communication skills to work effectively with all levels of the organization, and working technical skills for architecture and software development so they can effectively work with software engineers and managers to design the right solutions and timing. We are looking for a TPM with infosec experience to help manage and drive our security practices across the engineering organization.

This role is for a highly visible and hands-on leader responsible for defining, building, and measuring mechanisms for our security practice. They will be engaged across multiple programs, helping to inform trade-offs between business vs. technical constraints, and clearly communicate security goals, roles, status, and responsibilities. The ideal candidate has experience with information security, from improving processes to managing escalations. Maturity, high level judgment, negotiation skills, ability to influence, analytical talent, and leadership are essential to success. Ability to dive deep and lead by example are necessary for the candidate to thrive in this role.Basic Qualifications:

 Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent industry experience
 5+ years of professional experience in technical leadership roles (TPM, systems architect, etc.) interacting or leading security initiatives.
 3+ years of professional experience in software development roles (SDE, Infrastructure, Security and Operations) related to security initiatives.
 Strong verbal/written communication and presentation skills - ability to clearly communicate high level strategy as well as technical details, and drive appropriate ad hoc communications
Ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical partners
 Past experience working on large cross org programs with extensive technical deep dive skills
 Track record for delivering quality products on time
 General knowledge of software engineering best practices including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

Preferred Qualifications:



 Master's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent industry experience
 8+ years of professional experience in Technical Program Management
 Experience working with a diverse team of engineers, product managers, scientists, and senior leaders
 Experience in non-technical aspects including business analysis (e.g., SQL) and process optimization
 Experience with agile/iterative development and program management methodologies
 Demonstrated passion for understanding ambiguous, complex problems and driving high-quality, innovative, and robust technical solutions
 CISSP or CISM certification. Other relevant security certifications will be considered such as GIAC, GCIH, CEH, CSA+ certifications
Security background in a healthcare space

Why Join Us:At Blink, we put humans first. We want everyone at Blink to be able to do the best work of their lives. We are a relentlessly learning, constantly curious and aggressively collaborative cross-functional team dedicated to inventing new ways to improve the lives of our customers.

title: Assistant Marketing Manager Trainee | PAID TRAINING | BASE PAY!
job_description:
Job DescriptionAs a full time Assistant Marketing Manager Trainee, you can start with our team confidently knowing our career path is fast, challenging, and rewarding. Our Assistant Marketing Manager Trainees fall in love with our firm because of the equal opportunity advancement and our promote-from-within philosophy. The Assistant Marketing Manager Trainees have plenty of opportunities to advance and learn various roles without ever having to change companies or seek opportunity elsewhere.

As a full-time Assistant Marketing Manager Trainee, the initial training involves learning our business from day one. You will be trained and entrusted to serve as both the face of our clients and the behind-the-scenes product knowledge expert. In our structured program, the Assistant Marketing Manager Trainee will master the knowledge and skills needed to advance within our company while training and developing coworkers. Becoming an Assistant Marketing Manager Trainee and having the ability to pass on strong leadership and creativity is what our company is known for and proud of. Our company's goal is to be able to coach someone into the management role without them losing the ability to still be trainable and coachable while our business develops and evolves!

Day-to-day Responsibilities:

Partner with other Assistant Marketing Manager Trainee and conform with their leadership to set training goals to drive resultsDevelop and deliver impactful training for our Inside Business Development and Sales teams via a blended method that supports the unique culture and business environmentDemonstrates professionalism and inspires inside sales teams to have fun and take pride in the company and the customer experienceImproves training effectiveness by developing new approaches and techniques; making support readily available, and integrating support with routine job functionsAfter training is completed, the Market Managers will Prepare new sales representatives for success by conducting an orientation to sales process, developing individual coaching plans, and providing resources and assistance

Preferred Skills and Expertise Include:

Preferred 1-3 years experience in marketing and/or leadership developmentA self-motivated, detail-oriented and positive person who can multitask, work efficiently, and problem solve independently.A willingness to take direction and pay close attention to detailTraits, attitude, skills: unstoppable mindset, coachable, exceptionally driven, resourceful, results-oriented, passionate about helping businesses grow, persuasive, assertive, honest, attention to detail, gregarious, outstanding verbal communicator

*To be considered, please apply today with your resume!*

title: Assistant Branch Manager I
job_description:
Department:Member Relations

Reports To: Branch Manager

Grade: 9Classification:Non-Exempt

Supervises Direct:5Supervises Indirect: 0

Role:

Assists in the direct delivery of services to members and through branch staff. Works with the Branch Manager to increase member loyalty development and achieve Credit Union and branch specific strategic goals. Hires, develops, and supervises assigned staff.

Essential Functions& Responsibilities:

55% Assists the Branch Manager in achieving the Credit Union's Vision, Mission, Guiding Values and Service Promises in assigned branch. Recruits, hires, trains, coaches and manages a highly qualified staff sufficient to meet the needs of the areas assigned. Establishes and maintains objective accountability measurements and evaluates performance on all direct reports. Creates and maintains a coaching culture to consistently strive toward the highest level of achievement and performance for every employee. Provides leadership to ensure Tellers and other assigned staff reach strategic branch and individual goals. Participates in the scheduling of hours. Oversees general operations, daily practices and monitors product delivery quality. Opens or closes branch, conducts meetings, and provides report information as needed.

20% Serves Members as a top priority. Provides information and assistance. Troubleshoots and resolves Member concerns and problems. Backs up Tellers and other branch positions as needed.

10% Stays current on and ensures staff are in compliance with all applicable regulations and Credit Union guidelines. Responsible for compliance issues associated with deposit programs including Regulations B, D, E, Z, CC, and DD.

5% Proactively performs other duties as needed or assigned.

5% Assists in the development, proposals, and acceptance for and implement deposit program strategy and policy; leads activity related to new product development with respect to deposit programs and products.

5% Assists in the establishment of annual operational budget and helps monitor performance to budget throughout the year; establishes annual sales goals (in conjunction with marketing) for deposit products and initiates actions to achieve the goals.

Performance Measurements:

Supports and practices Rogue’s Vision, Mission, Values and Loyalty Culture. Utilizes the Service Promises with both internal and external members. Embraces Rogue’s community involvement program in a positive and proactive manner.
Maintains high quality membership services at assigned location(s). Demonstrates a passion for Member service and coaches staff successfully to build Member Loyalty.
Successfully hires, trains/coaches, and builds a team who can successfully and accurately perform their job functions. Addresses performance problems proactively following Credit Union guidelines.
Meets or exceeds branch performance goals and operational objectives with respect to sales and financial objectives.
Successfully achieves credit union, team, and individual goals as outlined in the yearly Goals and Objectives document.
Maintains acceptable risk& internal control standards. Maintains compliance and guideline knowledge and holds assigned staff accountable to same. Ensures a good audit in assigned areas of responsibility.
Demonstrates good time management, prioritizes effectively, and has the flexibility to change course if needed. Meets deadlines of assigned tasks and communicates effectively when challenges are presented. Can work independently without supervision.
Monitors, reports on, and addresses trends in operations and deposit services. Is resourceful and contributes ideas.
Demonstrates willingness and ability to fill in branch positions as the need arises.
Effectively runs the branch in the manager's absence.

Knowledge and Skills:

Experience: Three years to five years of similar or related experience.

Education:A high school education or GED. Knowledge and in-depth understanding of and ability to interpret regulations affecting deposit programs within the Credit Union, including Regulations B, D, E, Z, CC, and DD.

Interpersonal Skills:A significant level of trust and diplomacy is required, in addition to normal courtesy and tact. Work involves extensive contact with others and/or is usually of a personal or sensitive nature. Work may involve motivating, influencing, or training others. Outside Contacts become important and fostering sound relationships with other entities (companies and/or individuals) becomes necessary and often requires the ability to influence and/or sell ideas or services to others.

Other Skills:Strong supervisory and personnel development skills. Good judgment and ability to hire a strong team capable of building trust and credibility with new and existing members. Excellent communication and training skills. Resourceful with strong conflict and problem resolution skills. Critical thinking skills with the ability to make recommendations. Self starter with excellent time management and organizational skills. Strong computer and software skills. Teller skills for backing up. A valid driver's license is required.

Physical Requirements: Some lifting required (up to 30 pounds), continuous sitting, occasional standing and occasional walking. Finger dexterity while using computer. Occasional talking and hearing in person and on the telephone. Continuous clarity of vision at 20 inches or less and continuous clarity of vision at 20 feet or more.

Work Environment:This job requires flexibility in scheduling tasks and projects. The employee must independently monitor hours and judge the time needed to be spent on applicable duties. Employee must be capable of adjusting to unpredictable schedules proactively. As a direct representative of the Credit Union, the employee must conduct and present themselves courteously and professionally. Exposed to potentially hazardous conditions, i.e., robbery. Travel to all Credit Union regions may be required.

They are intended to be accurate reflections of those principal job elements essential for making fair pay decisions about jobs.

title: Sr. Manager Digital Product
job_description:

We’re a collaborative group of creative, motivated peers that work hard to ensure we’re putting our best ideas and beauty brands in front of our customers and stylist communities. Collaborate with agency partners in writing requirements, epics, and user stories to execute the product road-map, including fixes and enhancements.
