title: Product Marketing Manager, Collaboration
job_description:
InVision is the digital product design platform used to make the world's best customer experiences. We provide design tools and educational resources for teams to navigate every stage of the product design process, from ideation to development. Today, more than 5 million people use InVision to create a repeatable and streamlined design workflow; rapidly design and prototype products before writing code, and collaborate across their entire organization. That includes 100% of the Fortune 100, and organizations like Airbnb, Amazon, HBO, Netflix, Slack, Starbucks and Uber, who are now able to design better products, faster.

We're looking for a Product Marketing Manager to help define and execute the marketing strategy for InVision with a special focus on how design collaborators benefit from InVision. In this role, you'll be responsible for building programs that drive awareness and adoption of InVision from team members such as developers, product managers, marketers, and copywriters.

About the Team:

Product Marketing at InVision is fundamentally about building products that our customers need and bringing them to market in a way that achieves our goals. It's a right-brain + left-brain kind of role, where in a single day you can go from discussing our roadmap with customers, to leading a brainstorm for a new marketing campaign, to building out a strategy for growing specific customer segments. Product marketers bring people, data and ideas together to turn a great product into the market-leading solution.

What you'll do:

Define the messaging, positioning and go-to-market strategy for InVision as we introduce new features for design collaborators—like developers, product managers, and writers
Continuously assess customer needs, the competitive landscape and our value proposition through qualitative and quantitative analysis
Use data and insights to shape our marketing approach, priorities, and overall product direction
Create product materials, value-based narratives, demos and corresponding talk tracks to enable our customer-facing organization
Create stories to inspire customers about the solutions we provide to improve design collaboration across entire organizations
Drive cross-functional alignment throughout the go-to-market process, including holding stakeholders accountable and tracking success metrics

What you'll bring:

3+ years of experience in product marketing at a fast growing tech company–bonus points for experience with products for any of the collaborators mentioned above.
Experience leading cross-functional teams across marketing, product, and sales
Experience executing B2B marketing campaigns to build demand generation and sales pipeline
Excellent verbal and written communication, with a sharp eye for detail
Business savvy with a knack for creative problem solving
Keen ability to turn a complex situation into a simple, clear plan
Enthusiastic, fearless, resourceful, and an all-around team player
A passion for design and how it intersects with larger organizations

About InVision:

InVision offers an incredibly unique work environment. The company employs a diverse team all over the world. Each InVision team member is given the freedom and tools to do their best work from wherever they choose.

The benefits we offer in the United States and Canada include competitive health plans and retirement plans. Some InVision-wide benefits offered to all employees across the globe include a flexible vacation policy, monthly coffee shop stipends, annual allowances for books related to your profession, and home office setup & wellness reimbursements. InVision is an international employer so some benefit offerings will vary from country to country.

InVision is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

title: Product Line Manager
job_description:
AFL provides industry-leading fiber optic products, conductor accessories and fittings, and related services across the globe. Our company was founded in 1984 with a single fiber optic cable and has grown to include every facet of the passive optical network, employing over 5,000 associates worldwide and consistently generating annual sales in excess of a billion-dollars. With our commitment to professional growth and employee development, let AFL“Connect” you to your next career opportunity!

We are seeking aProduct Line Manager to join our team in Duncan, SC, to provide the commercial direction and leadership for AFL’s optical cable and connectivity solutions. This position shares financial responsibility (Revenue and P&L) with the General Manager by developing the annual business plan for their product lines, developing forecasts and margin analyses, creating price lists and pricing strategies, managing the commercial resolution of customer complaints, etc. The Product Manager interacts daily with customers and sales, identifies and justifies new product development projects, manages and negotiates new customer contracts, establishes priorities for manufacturing, and acts as the resident expert on our capabilities and our competitors.

Responsibilities:

Develop and execute annual business plan which includes revenue, margin, and volume by product. This plan will take into account product and market shifts, capacity expansion needs, customer forecasts, competitors, etc.Maximize profits through margin maintenance, customer retention, work out of process (WOP) utilization, complaint resolution, costing analysis, meet competitive bids (MCB’s), etc.Collaborate with the Market Management team on the development of marketing material including website and catalog pages, product releases, brochures, advertisements, articles, etc.Support Sales team via joint sales calls to key accounts and collaboration on new contracts or bidding opportunitiesAssess current products compared to market demand and competitive offerings. Initiate new product development where warranted due to gaps in product line or anticipated market demandProvide guidance to a team of Applications Engineers who are responsible for daily quoting activities as well as educating customers on the proper cable selection and utilizationResponsible for quotes being delivered from the team to Customer Service in a timely and thorough fashion. Establish pricing guidelines for various products. Review/set pricing levels for price lists and individual quotations when appropriate. Daily communication with Market Specialist, Customer Service, and Sales Managers regarding operational status and customer prioritiesAdhere to and promote the environmental, health& safety policies of AFLPerform other duties as requested, directed or assigned

Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering4-7 years of experience in an Applications or Product Management Role.2-3 years of experience in manufacturing preferably in fiber optic cable or accessoriesExcellent oral and written communication skillsAdvanced Computer Skills– Word processing, spreadsheets, database softwareMulti-tasking capabilities. Able to change gears quickly and handle multiple high prioritiesBasic accounting skillsMarketing, sales, and/or business development experience a plus

As Product Marketing Manager, you will:

Construct a strategy on how best to sell products and generate the highest revenues. Oversee how products are advertised, discussed in press releases, and seen by the public. Create a strategy based on knowledge of the product, company, and target market.

Commitment: This is a full-time (40 hours per week), 6-month contract position through HireArt and based in Seattle, WA.Apply Now!

title: Product Line Manager
job_description:
Job Description

Wood Finishes Group, an established manufacturer of paints and coatings and a distributor of related sundry items is in search of a skilled Product Line Manager to join our team at our Shipshewana, IN facility.

Position Summary

Direct and oversee achievement of sales and profitability objectives for the Wood Finishes Group business units. Manage current and new product lines, while finding engaging and functional ways to bring them to market (customer.) Be a key leader for the Wood Finishes Group.

Primary duties and responsibilities include (but are not limited to)

· Obtain product market share by working with sales director to develop product sales strategies.

· Assesses product market data by calling on customers with field sales staff and evaluating sales call results.

· Brings new products to market by analyzing proposed product requirements and product development programs; preparing return-on-investment analyses.

· Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies.

· Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

· Create new marketing strategies to marketing and sales in order to drive growth.

· Drive business by developing customer-right products that corresponds with company financial targets.

· Responsible for generating market trends, consumer insights, growth opportunities and idea generation of product development.

· Responsible for developing consumer and channel communication strategies for new product launch.

· Responsible for producing business statistics among which are price points, product mix sales history and competition for product introduction.

· Analyze all functions and features of existing and new products and evaluate acceptance by customers.

· Design and implement various sales and advertising strategies for existing and new products.

· Coordinate with various departments and ensure optimal level of customer satisfaction.

· Prepare reports and present it to the Wood Finishes Group President on regular basis.

· Monitor product life cycle and design solutions for all problems.

Experience and Education Required

· High School Diploma

· 4-year degree preferred

· Professional training in sales, sales management and related business and or managerial professional seminars.

· Professional training in product management, understanding the customer, requirements analysis, pricing, planning, competitive analysis, sales planning, inventory control, financial planning and strategy.

Critical Skills Required

· Excellent people and leadership skills.

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

· Provide leadership (leading by example with confident decision-making ability)

· Ability to think creatively to define and address personnel, group or business needs and opportunities.

Reasoning Ability

· Analyze sales and product data to develop strategies for growth

· Comprehend technology uses and applications

· Demonstrate outstanding problem solving and critical thinking skills

Salary: $0.00 /hour

Benefits:

Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insuranceRetirement planPaid time off

Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedAggressive -- competitive and growth-orientedTeam-oriented -- cooperative and collaborative

Monday to Friday

title: Sr. Strategy Product Manager - Digital Investor Services
job_description:
Your OpportunityCharles Schwab's Digital Investor Services team is responsible for defining, delivering, and managing the lifecycle of our platforms and services which enable digital interactions with clients at scale. Our digital experience is the way that most clients interact with us on a daily basis, and we’re focused on creating the best experience possible for our users.

In this role, you will help drive the navigation and content strategy, including how we make data driven decisions. You will also build and manage a product roadmap and work alongside the team of product owners who will implement how our clients are discovering tools and content.

The team is responsible for:


Strategy - Envision the future and build the near-term roadmap for the Schwab.com channel
Execution – Own and drive all aspects required to bring new digital capabilities to clients, including the definition, creation, development and implementation of the solutions that help us gauge the health of our channel
Client service – Serve clients with compelling capabilities that improve client outcomes
Partnership – Collaborate with technology, design, marketing and others in delivering value to our clients 

What you’re good at

You will be on a talented team of digital product owners, who will own the implementation and ongoing health of the channel.
You will help formulate the creation of capabilities which enhance Schwab’s channels and experiences.
You will lead the generation of new ideas based on market analytics and interactions with stakeholders, clients and prospects.
You will think “horizontally” to deliver an exceptional experience for our clients across our channel
You will champion Agile methodologies, participating in the product owner roles in daily stand-up meetings, sprint planning sessions, backlog prioritization, user story preparation and demos.
You will execute brilliantly in a deadline-driven environment
You will work cross-functionally with technical, design, business, and compliance counterparts to define product release requirements and investigate production issues as they arise.
You will work to create the awareness and engagement plan for your experiences and provide relevant and concise updates to management teams.
You will serve as a channel subject matter expert and evangelist to stakeholders.

What you have

Strategic thinker with the ability to formulate compelling vision and strategy and translate that to actionable roadmaps and results.
Strong knowledge base and experience developing or managing digital platforms, coupled with knowledge of the underlying technology, both current and emerging.
Experienced in creating transparency in the performance, security and availability of our channel as well as how to optimize the client experience in relation to performance, security and availability
Ability to influence and build strong relationships across multiple levels of the organization
Highly developed communication and presentations skills with a superior ability to effectively communicate and present complex concepts and issues to leadership teams.
Skilled at working cross-functionally with technology, service, marketing and product teams to manage the entire lifecyle of a digital platform.
Prior experience as an Agile Product Owner or leading scrum teams is preferred, with a deep understanding of agile.
Curiosity, a can-do attitude and the ability to learn quickly and thrive in a complex, dynamic environment
Self-starter with outstanding organizational skills and ability to track multiple project deliverables with minimal direction
Confidence presenting and tailoring messaging to a variety of audiences, including senior leadership
Enjoy being a thought leader who naturally challenges the status quo
Good understanding and/or experience with financial services regulations is a plus
Bachelor’s degree required (MBA preferred)
4+ years digital product owner experience

title: Sr Technology Product Manager
job_description:
As the Senior Technology Product Manager, in the T-Mobile Enterprise Data Governance Office, you will develop, drive and maintain data governance products, services, policy and framework for the Enterprise. You will define and manage our data classification and scanning products to ensure that we are able to find and classify data to meet various compliance requirements including privacy and security requirements throughout the data lifecycle including data acquisition, design and delivery, business usage, through to archiving and purging the data. You will collaborate and partner with directly with our Digital Security Organization, Privacy Office, Data Council, Data Stewards and multiple technology, business and compliance teams to find and classify data throughout our T-Mobile technical environments and platforms. You will be responsible for the end- to-end product lifecycle for our data scanning and classification products including design, development, delivery, training, vendor management, system integration, usability, adoption and business value KPIs and measurement.

Responsibilities

Own and define the strategy and product road map for Data Scanning and Classification products, services and policies for each step in the data management life cycle for business data owners and IT data stewards collaboratively with Enterprise Partners.Partner with business, internal/external stakeholders and leadership to understand current customer experiences, identifies areas of opportunity, create and manage large or complex product vision and road map. Lead and manage backlog and priorities with stakeholders and partners including Digital Security Organization, Privacy Office, Data Council, Data Stewards and multiple technology, business and compliance teams including benefits and value delivery planned with target KPIsMonitor compliance with the company's established Data Governance policy, framework, and procedures and review of periodic monitoring results from business Data Stewards to identify risks.Manage Sprint delivery in Agile Dev Ops environment for ongoing delivery of new features and integrations and defect delivery including manage vendor for product defect fixes and enhancements for upcoming feature deliver on 3rd Party product platformSupport User adoption and utilization of your products and services and champion and conduct Data Governance training to users as needed.Support product KPIs for Data Governance reporting framework including but not limited to preparing reports on key data governance KPI's, issues, risk, and concerns to leadership stakeholders.


How You Work


Passion for data, data security and data privacy runs in our DNA and you must have a passion for developing understanding, analyzing, securing and managing dataCollaboratively and cross-functionally. You're known for your ability to influence without authority.Efficiently. You often manage multiple projects while maintaining superior attention to detail.Confidently and proactively. You can quickly adapt to changing priorities and lead in times of ambiguity. You know when to escalate and can provide the counsel needed to agree on a plan.Inclusively and with humility. You encourage diversity of thought and gather feedback judiciously, and you know when to adjust your approach and when to follow your initial vision.Creatively. You quickly tire of the status quo and instead are a standout idea generator.With natural curiosity. You're interested in trends, industry news, cultural influencers and competitive benchmarks. You have a pulse on top-of-mind issues for data security, data privacy, and data management practices.

Qualifications

9+ years of relevant Product Management, Product Owner experience in agile software product development environment.Industry expert on current best practices of Technical Product Management and within the data management and / or cybersecurity. Stays relevant through ongoing trainings, conferences, or education in one or more of the following disciplines: Cybersecurity, Data Privacy Management, Business Intelligence, Data Governance, Data ClassificationExtensive experience building product roadmaps, envisioning and defining programs, writing detailed functional specifications, and delivering projectsStrong background in data management, data relationships, data mining and quantitative vs. qualitative analyticsRequired knowledge and experience in BI/Reporting with Data Warehousing and Big Data.Experience with executive-level communications, tracking project interdependencies, communicating issues & risk, and managing relationships with business team executives at Sr. Manager, Director, VP and SVP level.Ability to work independently and support multiple projects while meeting tight deadlines.Expert communicator who can lead and manage senior level relationships across organizational boundaries and vendor relationshipsWorking knowledge of Agile, Dev Ops and traditional SDLC methodologiesAbility to work independently and support multiple projects while meeting tight deadlinesDesire to learn from your success and failures as well from the experience of others.Natural disposition to work with urgency and limited guidance from your supervisor.Background in applying best practices to development and operational processes.Solid understanding of framework development and piloting for rapid delivery of tools and processes

Desired Qualifications:

Industry knowledge (consumer/retail/telecom)Experience with Metadata Management, Information Management and Master Data Management technologies

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or other related field or equivalent experience.

Company Profile

As America's Un-carrier, T-Mobile USA, Inc. (NASDAQ: "TMUS") is redefining the way consumers and businesses buy wireless services through leading product and service innovation. The company's advanced nationwide 4G and 4G LTE network delivers outstanding wireless experiences for customers who are unwilling to compromise on quality and value. Based in Bellevue, Washington, T-Mobile USA. Inc. provides services through its subsidiaries and operates its flagship brands, T-Mobile and Metro by T-Mobile. For more information, please visit http://www.t-mobile.com

title: Senior Product Manager - Messaging
job_description:
Because you belong at Twilio.

The Who, What, Why and Where

At Twilio, product managers are responsible for every aspect of the product. From concept to API design to go-to-market planning to revenue ownership. You will touch every team within Twilio, and have full responsibility and autonomy to grow your products. You will lead the product requirements required to build and operate real-time, highly-scalable distributed services that must operate at better than five 9s availability, all while the product grows at an exponential growth rate.

Twilio is looking for a Sr Product Manager to join the SMS team of our Programmable Messaging Product. You will understand the needs of our customers in the global SMS market and build products to help our customers scale and deploy worldwide. Working side by side with other product managers and engineering counterparts, you will collaborate to craft and deliver on the vision, strategy, and roadmap for Programmable SMS at Twilio.

Who?

Twilio is looking for a leader who lives the Twilio Magic and has a demonstrated track record of Product Development. They also have:


7+ years in product management in a fast-paced company. You have hustle and know how to knock down barriers to get to your objective.
You are curious, collaborative, humble and have empathy as a key trait.
You are a strategic thinker and thrive operating in broad scope, from conception through continuous operation of 24x7 services.
You have solved complex problems and have the aptitude to navigate uncharted waters.
The ability to solicit customer requirements from many - often competing - sources, prioritize, and work with engineering and design to deliver
Collaborative mindset and ability to work with distributed, cross-functional teams.
Great communication skills. You're equally at home on stage presenting to an audience of developers as you are coming up with product requirements. Your best days are the ones where you do both in the same day.
Previous experience as a developer and the ability to have a comfortable conversation with developers.
Experience managing products at various stages of maturity, from legacy to greenfield
Technically savvy and experience with the cloud, APIs, communications, enterprise software, devices, and mobility is a plus.
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required.

What?

As a Senior Product Manager, you will be doing many things including:


Jointly own the overall roadmap for Programmable SMS products. Every country and network has its own quirks that we design and build for.
Operate a multi-million dollar business delivering text messages globally.
Work directly with the carriers in moving the ecosystem forward and building products for both the carriers and our customers.
Be the leading expert on our messaging customers, understanding what and how they are building, where they get stuck, and what tools or tech will make their jobs easier.
Report on both the business and operational performance of your products and customers on a weekly basis

Why?

Brands globally are incorporating more and more text messages into their workflows, informing users of appointments, deliveries, and connecting brands to their customers. Usage is set to continue growing exponentially and Twilio's Programmable Messaging business unit is at the forefront of this revolution.

Our business unit builds not just the messaging products of today, but also of tomorrow. From Twilio's API for WhatsApp to future initiatives like Rich Communication Services (RCS), and Apple Business Chat, Twilio's Programmable Messaging APIs ensure that brands around the world are able to connect to their customers on the channels that make the most sense.

Twilio is a company that is empowering the world's developers with modern communication in order to build better applications. Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development, and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion, and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio. With 6 million developers on the platform, you will have the opportunity to have an impact on a massive scale. Your job will be to turn developers into heros!

Where?

This position will be located in our office at 375 Beale Street in San Francisco. You will enjoy our office perks: catered meals, snacks, game room, ergonomic desks, massages, Wednesday dinners, bi-weekly All Hands and more. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; seeks well-rounded talent to ensure a full perspective on our customers' experience, understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves.

About us:

Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing the world's communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world's most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer's toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry — from emerging leaders to the world's largest organizations — to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Web Product Manager
job_description:
The CAC:

The Center for Action and Contemplation (CAC) exists to awaken a more loving world through the teaching and practice of the Christian contemplative tradition. Internally, we are creating a modern workplace with the professional skills needed to scale the work of the CAC to reach a larger audience.

The Job Opportunity:

The Center for Action and Contemplation (CAC) has a difficult, if not unusual, challenge, and an amazing opportunity to meet it head on. The challenge: There are many ways people interact with CAC on the web, including a bookstore, an online education portal, daily emails to over 300,000 constituents, registration pages for events, donation pages, 30 years of teaching materials from Richard Rohr, and much more. How do we offer all of this within a user experience that is full-featured yet modern, simple, and accessible while also conveying the CACs essence?

The CAC is blessed with thoughtful and experienced leaders who bring an abundance of expertise to the table. From design to branding to programs to communication to technology and more, each is a passionate advocate for their own area of responsibility.

We are seeking a candidate to join our leaders in the role of Web Product Manager as a strategic synthesizer. Our ideal candidate can sit in the middle, synthesize various perspectives, work with expert outside help, and orchestrate something magical. And from that day forward, continuously seek improvements to the user experience in all its many forms, continually seeking feedback, analyzing what is working, and what could be better. All without sacrificing the elegant, simple user experience that supports our mission.

We are not looking for the mad solo genius who can meet this challenge single handedly. Quite the opposite. We are looking for a clear-thinking collaborator and fair-minded arbiter who understands all of the elements of what it takes to build and maintain a successful, multi-dimensional web presence. Someone who can manage the process and consistently move the ball forward toward an ever-improving future.

The Web Product Manager will communicate daily with stakeholders around the organization to understand their needs, their hopes, and their fears. You will be their advocate, their reality check, the one who figures out what is possible, what it costs, and then makes it happen.

While technical expertise is important, this role will be more focused on leadership and strategy. You must be able to gather and translate user needs into well-defined requirements and user stories to be implemented by internal and external technical resources. The most important skill is the ability to manage technical staff and external developers while understanding the details of their work.

Your relevant product domain will include the creation and iterative development of the main CAC.org website, core teacher websites, other distributed microsites, custom web tools, and web-based elements of other digital products (e.g., the front-end of our online store, donation pages, registration pages, online courses, and more).

Note that the Web Product Manager is not responsible for the development of content, design, or specific engagement strategies, but you should have a strong sense for all of it and know good UI/UX when you see it. Youd collaborate with several teams, most significantly our Creative and Engagement teams, and feel a deep responsibility for understanding and bringing their work into reality.

The Web Product Manager will also work side-by-side with the Managing Director of Digital Products and CRM Product Manager in a highly coordinated, team-oriented and results-focused Digital Product team.

Additional information on the Digital Product Team approach to technology can be found here.

Why You Are the Best Person for this Job...

You are a communicator who loves developing ideas and relationships, and you know enough about design and coding to speak the language. You can manage the heck out of a project, but your skillset goes beyond project management.You are fluent in the principles of design, UX, and user engagement.When someone comes to you with a request, you can do that thing where you dig into it together and end up getting to the bottom of the need behind the request, even if the solution looks far different from where the request started.When it comes to QA you have a certain patience, thoroughness, and investigative tire kicking that prevents sub-par work from getting out into the world.You can get a bit embarrassingly excited about the ways you have optimized your task management systems.You are passionate about delivering the tools and quality necessary to make something truly great.You ignite the interests and proclivities of the team to get top-quality results, while protecting their prioritized workloads.You are relentless when it comes to removing roadblocks to the teams and the organizations success.

Key Responsibilities

The everyday duties of the Web Product Manager include meeting with stakeholders throughout the organization to seek out achievable improvements in user experience, becoming the keeper of dreams for the creative, engagement, and program delivery teams, including the Living School, library, and fundraising.Inspire stakeholders throughout the organization to reimagine the absolute best web experience for the CACs followers, students, and customers, then bring that vision to life, using the best expert strategists, designers, and technicians available.Manage the internal team as well as external consultants to effectively deliver and consistently maintain a world-class web presence that supports CACs mission.Effectively communicate and advocate at all levels of the organization (leadership, staff, constituents, and relevant external consultants) to ensure your teams capacity to deliver an excellent user experience while maintaining excellent working relationships.

Skills and Abilities

Proven ability to unleash the talents of individuals and teams.Consensus-seeking and optimistic that differing perspectives and opinions can make eventual solutions more robust.Highly responsible to commitments, while forthright about uncertainties and obstacles, and willing to seek help when possible.Strong ability to differentiate low priority, low impact rabbit holes from consequential details that must be understood and addressed.Real sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on the organizations success.Driven to inspire; your ultimate orientation is toward empowerment and others success.Willingness to uphold greatness and take initiative.Platform agnostic, with enough various web platform experience to understand costs, benefits, and trade-offs.Experience overseeing the creation of world class websites.Inspired by innovation for continuous improvement.Ability to lead the charge to convey our teachings and message.Effectiveness in bringing all the relevant stakeholders together.Continuous and passionate awareness of CACs front-facing web presence.

Required Qualifications

At least 3-5+ years experience in web product management or equivalent.Understanding of the various components of the web creation and development process, and the areas of expertise involved.A history of participation in successful web projects.Experience with QA testing processes.Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.A history of building trusted relationships with colleagues -- communicating transparently and delivering on projects and commitments.Highly organized and detail oriented.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience managing a high-functioning team.Experience working with a top-tier web design firm and opinions about how to form the most productive working relationships with external experts.Experience with, or detailed understanding of, concepts behind UX and UI.Experience with web testing and optimization.

Work Requirements/ Physical Requirements

The physical requirements of the position include but are not limited to, standing, walking, sitting for long periods of time, use of hands to fingers, reaching with hands and arms, balancing, stooping, and squatting. Use of a computer, keyboard, and monitor on a daily basis. Must be able to speak English and listen, hear sound and words.Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.

Job Specifications and Pay

This job is on-site in our Albuquerque office. Candidates must be located in, or willing to relocate to, Albuquerque, NM. We offer an extremely competitive compensation and benefits package for full-time staff positions. Relocation assistance is available within the United States.

Application Instructions

Please apply for this job directly. You must submit a resume and cover letter to be considered. Because of the high volume of interest, we are not able to process applications or respond to inquiries unless they come through the online application system.

We are an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer

We believe that diversity makes us better. The CAC welcomes and provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to age, race, color, national origin, ancestry, religion, gender and gender identity, sexual orientation, family medical history or genetic information, pregnancy, parental status, military service, veteran status, citizen status, political affiliation, disability status, or any other non-merit based factor.

Powered by JazzHR

title: Program Manager
job_description:
Program Manager


Duty Site



Lakehurst, NJ

Apply Now





Job Code:3350

S3, Inc. is a woman owned small business founded in 1991, headquartered in Huntsville, AL, that provides technical, programmatic, and logistics services to US Department of Defense, other US Government Agencies, and Partner Nation militaries, co-located with Government requirements. S3 has a wholly owned subsidiary, KBFS, that provides aviation pilot training, heavy lift, aircraft maintenance, and related aircraft services to Government and commercial requirements IAW multiple FAA certifications.

S3 Inc. is seeking a Program Manager to support Navy projects in Lakehurst, New Jersey. This position is contingent up on award of contract.

Position Description: The Program Manager is responsible for the performance of the Aircraft Launch and Recovery Equipment (ALRE) Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) task order through management of the business/functional activities and supervision of all contract/functional personnel and subcontractors to execute requirements to standard and within awarded cost. Establishes work breakdown structures, coordinates and monitors schedule and cost elements of the program. Organizes, directs and coordinates planning and all contract support activities. Resolves functional, scheduling and cost issues and serves as the primary point of contract between the Government and various elements of the contract. Prepares management reports and maintains accurate records. Establishes and alters (as necessary) work assignments. Ensures conformance to task specifications and contract provisions. Responsible for negotiation and making binding decisions for the company. Employs expert program acquisition life cycle knowledge, the FAR, and DoD regulations to manage and provide ALRE logistical technical expertise and services that includes, but are not limited to, stakeholder coordination/communications, ILS planning and management; supportability analysis; technical data; design interface and maintenance planning; manpower/personnel/training and supply support for new and in-service ALRE systems and subsystems.

Experience/Skills Required: Fifteen (15) or more years experience with DoD acquisition/in-service support planning related to Aircraft Launch and Recovery Equipment (ALRE). Specific experience includes twelve or more years' experience supporting acquisition/in-service support planning across the life cycle of new and in-service ALRE Systems and Subsystems, and, twelve or more years' of experince with comprehensive knowledge in the acquisition and life cycle support of DoD systems, subsystems, and components/equipment.

Education Required: Bachelor's degree in engineering, business, or other related scientific discipline from an accredited college or university; a Master's degree in engineering, business, or other related scientific discipline from an accredited college or university is preferred.

Security Clearance Required: Top Secret Clearance.

Certifications/Licenses: None.

Other: N/A

Careers Page as a result of your disability, you can request reasonable accommodations by calling (256) 539-1700 Ext 1127 or by sending an email to: recruiter@s3inc.com . title: Senior Product Manager
job_description:
Globalization Partners' mission is to eliminate the barriers to global business and make it easy for companies to hire in more than 170 countries within days. Our renowned culture has been named one of the Top 150 Company Cultures in America, and our goal is to add the best talent to our award-winning team!

About the position:

As a Senior Product Manager at Globalization Partners, you will be performing across the end-to-end spectrum of product management discipline for your product line in this role, you will bridge the technical and business worlds as you design products that our customers love. You must enjoy spending time in the market to understand real customer problems and needs, find innovative solutions that are scalable and repeatable for the broader market adoption. You must enjoy communicating with all functional areas within the company, such as Engineering, Operations, Finance, Marketing, Legal, UX, Customer Success, Support, as well as with other product managers in the practice. You will serve as both internal and external evangelist for your product line.

What you'll do:

 Manage the end-to-end life cycle of the product line from strategic planning to tactical execution
Build successful partnerships with engineering groups, eloquently authoring user stories around the expected deliverables, deconstructing business requirements, and translating into user stories for Engineering teams
Be a master in cross-functional collaboration by developing deep relationships with key cross-functional partners across the company and establish a shared product understanding
Take ownership of road-map predictability, be a strong change manager, and drive operational excellence
Identify market opportunities, synthesize trends in the PEO ecosystem, measure product performance, growth, and couple these with insights from customers and partners

What we're looking for:

5-7 years of demonstrated success in product management A B.S. degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience;
M.S or MBA is a plus Someone who enjoys communicating with all functional areas within the company, such as Engineering, Operations, Finance, Marketing, Legal, User Experience, Customer Success, Support, as well as with other product managers in the practice
Someone capable of managing shifting priorities, while maintaining organization and control of the expected product outcomes
Someone who enjoys spending time in the market to understand real customer problems and needs, finding innovative solutions that are scalable and repeatable for the broader market adoption.
The ability to serve as an internal and external evangelist for your product line
An inspiring communicator who can demonstrate a wide peripheral knowledge and can speak to all functional groups that come together in orchestrating the product life cycle.
Experience with agile software development methodologies, frameworks, and tools
Excellent Problem solving and business analysis experience

Perks:

Sabbatical
World class benefits, including health, vision and dental
401k matching
Competitive compensation
Paid-time-off (PTO)
Generous, equal-gender family leave
Frequent team events- including happy hours and lunches
We'll keep you fed with snacks, treats, and beverages

title: Associate Director/Director - Product Management
job_description:
Dicerna Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (Nasdaq: DRNA) is a biopharmaceutical company focused on discovering, developing and commercializing medicines that are designed to leverage ribonucleic acid interference (RNAi) to selectively silence genes that cause or contribute to disease. Using our proprietary RNAi technology platform called GalXC, Dicerna is committed to developing RNAi-based therapies with the potential to treat both rare and more prevalent diseases. By reducing the level of disease-causing proteins in the hepatocytes of the liver, Dicerna's GalXC has the potential to safely target conditions that are difficult to treat with other modalities. Continually innovating, Dicerna is also exploring new applications of RNAi technology beyond the liver, targeting additional tissues and enabling new therapeutic applications. In addition to our own pipeline of core discovery and clinical candidates, Dicerna has established collaborative relationships with some of the world's leading pharmaceutical companies, including Novo Nordisk A/S, Roche, Eli Lilly and Company, Alexion Pharmaceuticals, Inc. and Boehringer Ingelheim International GmbH. Between Dicerna and our collaborative partners, we currently have more than 20 active discovery, preclinical or clinical programs focused on rare, cardiometabolic, viral-infectious, chronic-liver and complement-mediated diseases, as well as neurodegeneration and pain. At Dicerna, our mission is to interfere to silence genes, to fight disease, to restore heath. For more information, please visit www.dicerna.com.

We are seeking an Associate Director / Director, Product Management.

This individual will play a key role on the Commercial Team. Initial focus will be on engaging stakeholders with disease education including the digital channel as well as leading company presence across small and large conferences. Closer to approval in the future, this individual will also contribute to the development of marketing collateral for stakeholders, as well as design and execution of HCP promotional programs, while collaborating with peers in the commercial team.

Initial Key Responsibilities

Engage stakeholders with disease education assets to showcase unmet need in serious, rare, genetic disease and the need for a better Standard of Care
Be adept at multi-channel implementation of disease education across digital, print and peer to peer formats
Manage company presence at key congresses
Contribute to development of the Strategic Product Plan



Work across marketing, market access and patient services to build comprehensive launch plan.
Participate in the creation of an integrated marketing plan and tactics to encompass the needs of the growing commercial organization


Lead the approval process of the materials through Promotional Review Board (PRB) by executing marketing activities in compliance with medical, regulatory and legal requirements
Manage multiple agency partners to produce deliverables on strategy within timelines and budget
Travel approximately 20%


Qualifications



At least 10 years of US biotech/pharmaceutical commercial experience
Bachelor's degree required, MBA preferred
Launch experience preferred
Understanding of pharmaceutical marketing and regulatory/compliance environment
Ability to work collaboratively with cross functional stakeholders such as Regulatory, Medical, Legal, Market Research, Market Access, Patient Services, Patient Advocacy, Sales
Demonstrated ability to effectively implement assets based on the core brand positioning and messaging
Strong organizational and operational skills, with attention to detail and sound business judgment
Strong critical thinking skills with a solution-oriented mindset
Proven project management skills including objective setting, prioritization, planning, timeline and budget management, and pull-though of clear action plans
Ability to adapt and thrive within a fast-paced and dynamic environment

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
job_description:
Join Hayes as we optimize the business of healthcare for the nation’s premier healthcare organizations. From day one, you will have the opportunity to make a difference for our clients, who represent the nation’s premier healthcare systems within academic and for-profit institutions. As the Senior Product Marketing Manager, you will take on a leadership role to create a best-in-class product marketing function supporting our industry-leading MDaudit Enterprise SaaS platform.

The ideal candidate has extensive experience partnering with the MDaudit technology team to craft go-to-market messaging, develop ROI tools, conduct market research and competitive analysis and use a metrics-driven understanding of customer and user behavior to create and capture market opportunities. The right candidate will have a strong track record in sales enablement best practices and will know how to arm the sales organization with the tools and materials needed to beat competitors and win in the marketplace.Required SkillsYou will become the in-house expert on the MDaudit Enterprise platform with an in-depth understanding of product functionality, market segments, competitors, buyer personas and use cases. Use that knowledge to create external product assets – including white papers, brochures, data sheets, technical briefs, customer presentations, blogs, and videos – that will equip the sales team with differentiated positioning and sales tools that garner C-level buy-in and accelerate the sales cycle. Make product feature recommendations based on your deep understanding of our products and customers. Partner with current customers to build a bank of testimonials and case studies to evangelize our solution in the marketplace. Support sales and customer success teams during customer meetings, tradeshows, and events. Contribute to and uphold our brand marketing efforts as the in-house product marketing expert.

Required Skills

· Experience working in the healthcare industry for a technology provider (EMR/EHR, healthcare analytics or related technology); knowledge of healthcare billing compliance and revenue integrity a strong plus

· Experience managing product & market research programs

· Experience designing and develop customer presentations and ROI tools

· Sharp business judgement and the ability to stay focused in a dynamic, fast-paced environment

· Proven ability to partner with and align key stakeholders: product management, sales and customer experience

· Strong communicator, attentive listener and compelling explainerRequired Experience· BA/BS degree preferred, in Marketing, Business, or related field

· Minimum 7+ years of product marketing experience or equivalent rolesJob Location

Wellesley, US-MA

title: Technical Product Manager
job_description:
DescriptionThe Technical Product Manager will be responsible for managing small-scale, low complexity new product development projects, portions of large new product development projects, post launch new product development activities, and/or sustaining released products. The incumbent will be working with other Product Managers as well as cross-functional core teams for these different efforts. He/She will be responsible for the planning of project activities, prioritization, budget management, task follow up, communications and schedule maintenance. The incumbent is responsible for directly and indirectly driving project execution and development efforts while ensuring that deliverables meet internal and external customer requirements and follow Brook's NPI (New Product Introduction) Product Development Process (PDP), including progress reporting and reviews by senior leadership.

WHAT YOULL DO:

Acts as technical liaison on Cryo product lines providing product and regulatory information to sales, service and customers.Respond directly and independently to end-customer inquiries and recommend escalations if needed to ensure timely resolutions and quality control.Analyze business results including financial, customer, and internal process metrics. Monitor metrics and develop actionable insights to improve the efficiency and performance of the product.Assists with the creation of technical support material for sales, service and customers to drive achievement of annual sales growth.Assess and report on competitive activity in the marketplace.Assist in the development of market research plans and project execution.Support global marketing organization through sharing key strategies and marketing materials to global partners.Provide in-depth and personalized product demonstrations as needed to customers, sales, and service.Hustle and problem solve as we pioneer a rapidly growing, nascent industry.Uncover new opportunities to further improve the Cryo product line, the end-user experience, and work with the product team to quantify, prioritize, and launch improvements.Work with Sr. Product Manager and Operations Management to ensure the maintenance of proper production and inventory levels and proactively communicate areas of concern as appropriateWork with cross-functional key partners including but not limited to Sales, Engineering, Service, Customer Care, Marketing, Finance, Manufacturing, and QualityActively spends time with customers, internal and field visits, to ensure alignment of marketing plans in fulfilling customer and market needs and to ensure strong customer & competitor insightsContribute to new product development initiatives and execution

WHAT WERE LOOKING FOR:

Exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to provide compassionate, empathetic responses and solutions to complex problems.Data analysis experience.The ability to independently provide accurate resolutions to a variety of problems.Highly proficient in verbal communications, including strong written and phone skills.A natural interest in mechanical and technical systems.Ability to translate complex ideas into easily understood descriptions.

EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE

Bachelors degree required (engineering focus is preferred)Minimum 2-4 years of experience, preferably in product management / marketing or sales capacityIndustry experience in life science, healthcare, medical device, or pharma related industry is a plus

title: Product Manager
job_description:
IXL Learning, a leading edtech company with products used by 10 million students worldwide, is seeking experienced Product Managers to lead the design and development of new features for IXL.

At IXL Learning, we are dedicated to creating first-of-their-kind products that leverage cutting-edge technologies to solve seemingly intractable problems in education. Millions of users count on us to make learning as effective as can be, so we're looking for exceptional people who are committed to solving the real-world challenges faced by students and teachers around the world.

At IXL, product management starts with a passion for making a lasting impact on education. Product Managers put our users first in all that we do, taking feature sets from initial brainstorm to final launch and beyond, and working collaboratively across many teams including Engineering, Visual Design, Marketing, and more! Our creative solutions, clean designs, and commitment to quality allow us to deliver effective, compelling products that tackle some of the biggest problems in education today.WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

Own the roadmap for your product area: prioritize, develop, and launch new features
Deeply understand and advocate for the needs of our student, teacher, and parent users
Solve large, complex problems by developing innovative and creative solutions that address user needs and align with broader product strategy
Produce clear, thorough written specification for all feature functionality and user flows
Collaborate with visual designers to create innovative, clean user interfaces
Work with engineers to align technical designs and decisions with product needs
Coordinate and drive execution; manage project schedules and work collaboratively across the development organization (design, engineering, QA) to ensure timely delivery of high quality features
Anticipate, identify, and communicate project status and risks to key stakeholders, including the senior leadership team
Analyze quantitative and qualitative data to inform product decision-making
Work closely with Marketing team on product marketing strategy and execution
Do whatever it takes to develop features and deliver value to our users

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, or a related field
3+ years of product management experience, or a combination of product design and project management roles; strong track record of delivering high quality, efficient, creative solutions to tough problems
Exceptional analytical reasoning, problem-solving, and creative thinking skills
Excellent written and verbal communicator, with an eye to clarity and conciseness
High degree of user empathy for teachers and learners, understanding how they will interact with a product and what will and won't appeal to them
Excellent project management and organizational skills, with proven experience leading multiple complex projects simultaneously
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work across teams to make things happen
Curiosity, open-mindedness, and an unfailingly positive attitude
Interest in K-12 education! Classroom/teaching experience is a plus

title: Product Marketing Manager
job_description:
The Opportunity
The Product Marketing Manager is Responsible for product strategy through execution for assigned scope, including product and business strategy, synthesizing large amounts of data to understand business drivers and enable decision making, new product innovation roadmap & Go-to-Market execution, communications, & ongoing development of product marketing programs to support business goals. Product Marketing Manager will be involved in other programs involving new product innovation and execution, and ongoing business management / development of product marketing programs to support the business. Displays executive presence and business maturity.

Responsibilities:

 Strategy:

Spearhead product marketing innovation strategies and launch calendar for relevant categoriesPresent recommendations to Brand Director and senior leadership to gain buy-in and cross-functional resourcesAbility to influence key stakeholders and align business objectives

 Innovation:

Develop and manage multiple complex innovation projects linked to global brand strategies and platformsManage new product innovation & holistic communication plan from consumer insight through launch through global lensSpearhead diverse, cross-functional projects in partnership with key stakeholders throughout the organization (R&D, Manufacturing, Commercialization Team, Product, Events, Video, Field Development, etc.) to meet key goals and timelines

 Base Brand Management:

Consult forecasting S&OP process (providing key assumptions to support forecast accuracy), manage budget and gross margin targets for relevant global lines / products.Lead 360° product marketing plans for existing brands to drive business momentumContinue to develop sophisticated understanding of social media and digital product marketing and make recommendations to inform 360° global product marketing programsServe as consumer and competitive expert for relevant categories. Keep brand director and senior management abreast of key data and trends.Conduct comprehensive brand reviews and program analyses including recommendations to drive business

Qualifications:

5+ years of experience in brand or product management (at a beauty or consumer goods company preferred) or minimum of 7 yrs related experience Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or related fieldMBA or general management training program highly desiredPrior experience working on global businesses is preferred – APAC a big plusSolid strategic, analytical and critical thinking skills with proven expertise in problem solvingStrong presentation skills and command of an audienceAbility to distill complex problems and recommendations in easily-digestible, cohesive management-friendly presentationsA strong understanding of the product life cycle and promotional processExcellent project management skills and ability to navigate ambiguityA demonstrated passion for beauty and/or consumer products and social commerceCollaborative orientation with the ability to effectively partner and motivate across functions and with outside vendorsExcellent judgment in representing the Company to customers and consultantsA proven track record of contributing positively to team culture, working collaboratively and being accountableOutstanding oral and written communication skillsExceptional organizational skills and a great attention to detailSelf-starter, ability to thrive in a fast paced, start-up environment Ability to influence a highly matrixed organization

The Company

Rodan + Fields was founded in 2000 by Stanford-trained Dermatologists Dr. Katie Rodan and Dr. Kathy Fields with a passion for giving people the best skin of their lives — and the confidence that comes with it. Today, Rodan + Fields is the #1 Skincare Brand in North America[1] in 2018 and the #1 Skincare Brand in the US in 2016, 2017 and 2018[2]! The company has grown its innovative line of products and expanded into Canada and Australia. Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, R+F now employs approximately 700 people, has more than 300,000 enrolled Independent Consultants and over two million Preferred Customers.

At Rodan + Fields, you will be challenged to make an impact, inspired to do more, and rewarded for your contributions. We are transforming skincare, and we welcome your big ideas to fuel our ambitious growth plans! If you are looking for a life-changing career opportunity, we've got your prescription. You’ll become part of a positive, passionate movement that celebrates greatness and encourages employees to be catalysts for change. We provide a creative, vibrant workplace outfitted with all of the technology, tools and training you'll need to learn, grow and thrive! We create life-changing impact in our communities through our non-profit, Prescription for Change®, the heart of Rodan + Fields. By funding empowerment programs for students, we teach them how to use their skills to make life-changing differences in their lives and the lives of others. Join us and share your talents as we develop innovative solutions for your skin and empower entrepreneurs. In addition to working arm-in-arm with industry leaders, employees at Rodan + Fields enjoy rich benefits plans and perks.

[1] Source Euromonitor International Limited; Beauty and Personal Care 2019 Edition, retail value RSP terms; all channels, Skin Care includes Sets and Kits; North America defined as Canada and the United States

[2] Source Euromonitor International Limited; Beauty and Personal Care 2019 Edition, retail value RSP terms; all channels, Skincare includes Sets & Kits.

*At R+F, we do not engage with Google Hangouts or other social media platforms to schedule interviews or communicate with candidates. Please disregard any messages or notifications from Google Hangouts or other social media messenger platforms regarding interviews or job offers.

title: Project Manager, HRIS
job_description:
OverviewTriumph Group designs, engineers, manufactures, repairs and overhauls a broad portfolio of aviation and industrial components, accessories, subassemblies, systems and aircraft structures. We partner with original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and operators of commercial, regional, business and military aircraft worldwide, to provide products and services that solve their hardest problems. So whatever the part, component or complexity of assembly, Triumph is committed to quality, service and meeting the specialized needs of each customer.

Triumph participates at all levels of the aerospace supply chain – from single components, to complex systems, to aerospace structures and their contents. We provide solutions for the entire product life cycle of an aircraft – from raw material to aftermarket service. Our unique ability to integrate a broad range of products and capabilities is our competitive advantage.

The HRIS Project Manager role will manage projects within the HRIS space and will coordinate the activities of project teams to ensure projects are delivered on-time within budget and scope. The HRIS Project manager will also be responsible for managing the overall HRIS portfolio by helping to collect, prioritize and manage all system related initiatives.Responsibilities

Work with the HRIS Director and Project Sponsors in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring feasibility
Deliver project objectives within time, resource, and budget constraints
Align project execution with the strategy, mission, culture, and ethics of Triumph
Address and/or escalate any project related issues or risks
Manage the overall HRIS project portfolio and project pipeline
Determine project specifications, scope, roles, responsibilities, milestones, tasks, and deliverables needed for project execution
Identify, document, and communicate potential risks that could cause delay in project execution
Prepare project plans and schedule project work through gates and milestones as identified by Triumph’s project methodologies
Assemble project teams according to project needs
Following Triumph’s standard project methodologies, manage project schedule to ensure on-time and on-budget delivery
Manage and control changes to the project scope, project schedule, and project costs
Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation including but not limited to requirements, issues tracking, etc.
Document and drive issues through resolution and escalation as necessary
Manage appropriate communications with both the project team and PMO through weekly, biweekly, and/or monthly meetings
Develop procedure requirements and plans such as statements of work and RFP’s when needed for the project
Communicate and escalate any project constraints and risks that arise throughout project execution

#LI-KD1

#GDOORQualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer or Business Management or equivalent degree.
PMP Certification a plus
5+ years of experience in a Project Management role, specifically managing HRIS projects
Good understanding of SAP SuccessFactors modules, data structures and processes
Strong familiarity with project management process and software
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft software, including Word, Power Point, Excel, Project
Ability to interact with all levels in a large environment
Excellent organizational skills with the ability to set/manage priorities, develop a work schedule, monitor progress towards goals, and track details/data/information/activities
Ability to work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Must be able to learn, understand, and apply new technologies
Exceptional problem/conflict resolution skills
Good facilitation and analytical skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Have the willingness to see things through to the end
Ability to influence people at all levels
Be an inspirational project leader who is able to demonstrate enthusiasm and passion
Understand how and when to make a choice and how and when to escalate issues to higher levels
Some travel may be required for the purpose of meeting with clients, stakeholders, or off-site personnel/management

title: Product Manager, Growth & Engagement
job_description:
REF#: 34387

CBS BUSINESS UNIT: CBS Interactive

JOB TYPE: Full-Time Staff

JOB SCHEDULE:

JOB LOCATION: New York, NY

ABOUT US:

CBS Interactive is the premier online content network for information and online operations of CBS Corporation as well as some of the top native digital brands in the entertainment industry. Our brands dive deep into the things people care about across entertainment, technology, news, games, business and sports. With over 1 billion users visiting our properties every quarter, we are a global top 10 web property and one of the largest premium content networks online.

Check us out on [1] The Muse, [2] Instagram and [3] YouTube for an inside look into 'Life At CBSi' through employee testimonials, office photos and company updates.

References

Visible links


https://www.themuse.com/companies/cbsinteractive
https://www.instagram.com/cbsinteractive/?hl=en
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCAvGapyifCtUlmNTagAl_sQ

DESCRIPTION:

Role Details:

CBS News is offering a unique opportunity for an enthusiastic product manager with innovative vision to be a part of the team that is building the premier multi-platform news destination. You will have the chance to help shape the future of digital news with CBSN, the 24/7 streaming news channel, alongside CBSs suite of award-winning journalism featuring 60 Minutes, CBS Evening News, CBS Sunday Morning and more to create exceptional, cutting-edge interactive experiences on CBS News.

You are passionate about UX, analyzing business intelligence data, and conducting user testing. You thrive in a fast moving, collaborative environment and are focused on creating products that delight users and drive KPIs. You also have experience with various Agile methodologies, are well-versed in Jira, love A/B testing with tools like Optimizely, and are data obsessed, with Omniture and similar skills.

Your Day-to-Day:


You will spend your day deeply in touch with data and analytics across all CBS News Digital platforms. You will collaborate with the Business Intelligence team to dig into user experience and consumption data and look for trends and growth opportunities across core KPIs. You will also work with editorial, marketing, sales and design to define and test ideas, then evaluate, iterate and optimize. Additionally, you will:
Work with product and marketing managers to create growth and retention strategies for mobile & emerging platforms products
Interpret usage data and collaborate with business intelligence team to develop reports and presentations analyzing product usage
Act as liaison between wide range of internal clients, including Business Intelligence/Data, Editorial, Marketing and Ad Operations.
Collaborate with SEO team on optimization tactics
Develop and execute app store optimization strategies
Be an in-house subject matter expert by staying up to date on the latest in competitive products and industry trends and regularly presenting internally to various stakeholders on the state of the digital news product landscape
Advocate for CBS product users and create detailed and comprehensive product requirement documents detailing innovative and effective product experiences
Operate both independently and as part of a broader team; juggle multiple tasks and projects simultaneously in a results-oriented environment

QUALIFICATIONS:

What you bring to the team:

You have -


Extremely motivated and detail-oriented individual who is energized by big challenges
Experience working with Optimizely, Chartbeat, Omniture, Confluence, InVision, Sketch or comparable systems
3+ years of experience in digital product management, or product marketing with some understanding of consumer research, product strategy and online promotion
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Expert knowledge in mobile, streaming media players, connected devices and gaming consoles
Comfort drafting detailed Product Requirement Documents (PRDs), user stories and wireframes
Ability to work well under pressure and manage multiple tasks simultaneously
Proficient in Excel, Powerpoint, Visio/Omnigraffle or other tools for wire-framing
Familiar with XML, HTML, and prototyping tools

title: Product Marketing Manager
job_description:
Position Summary

SMC3 is seeking a high performing candidate for the positon of Product Marketing Manager.

SMC3 delivers cloud based SaaS solutions geared to optimize over-the-road freight transportation for manufacturers, retailers, 3PLs and carriers. SMC3 is also an education provider to the supply chain industry hosting conferences, user groups and on-line learning courses.

The Product Marketing Manager will have a deep understanding of SMC3 technology products, customer verticals, and competitive landscape. They will be a product evangelist and own the go to market plan for product launches and market communications throughout product life cycles. They will have the ability to grasp and translate technical capabilities into business benefits and develop product positioning, messaging and content that resonates with customers along each stage of the buying process.

Key Responsibilities

•Develop competitive intelligence framework and research, manage and provide key insights that will guide product requirements/positioning and strategic marketing initiatives.

•Lead and develop product positioning and messaging that resonates with targeted buyers by understanding our brand, customer needs, product roadmap, market trends, and competitive landscape.

•Create, manage and execute the product marketing strategy and integrated marketing campaigns for new and existing products to optimize reach, customer acquisition and retention.

•Lead creation of thought-leading product marketing materials and content across digital and print communications such as customer literature, blogs, e-mails, videos, webinars, presentations, web copy, advertisement and trade show/event material.

•Assess effectiveness of marketing programs on an ongoing basis, and report back to the business on required changes.

•Collaborate closely with SMC3 marketing team members, agile teams, sales team and client success team to achieve goals.

Requirements

•Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Administration or directly related experience required. MBA a plus.

•5+ years of product marketing experience preferably in the SaaS environment or supply chain industry.

•Strong planning and project management skills, with proven ability to oversee complex projects from origin to execution.

•Exceptional collaboration abilities across multi-functional teams.

•Strong sense of ownership, work ethic and self-motivation.

•Experience in these additional marketing areas is a plus: Lead generation, CRM/ marketing automation tools, email marketing, social media and branding.

•Position is located on-site in Peachtree City, Georgia.

Competencies

•Problem Solving

•Interpersonal Skills

•Oral Communications

•Written Communications

•Organization

•Detail oriented

•Accuracy

•Adaptability

•Dependability
